description:
I've eaten here a few times now, and have never been disappointed.  The steaks are amazing, they have a great wine menu, and the service is good!

I'd suggest if you eat upstairs, to make sure the door is closed to avoid the outside air/ SF smell...
author: Daniel R.

description:
I'm disappointed to be writing this updated review since Bobo's has been my favorite restaurant for the past few years. But first let me make it clear that this is not (all) about the food but 90% about the service that we experienced. 

I recommended this restaurant to my best friend and we decided to come here to celebrate her birthday. We ordered mussels and shrimp to start along with Dungeness crab crostini. The mussels and shrimp were fantastic, like I remembered, and it was a seemingly great start to our dinner. I ordered the filet mignon with a half crab for my main course and the filet mignon was cooked perfectly. However, the crab was very roasted which made it super dry. Of course, it was my friend's birthday so we were chatting while enjoying our meal and taking our time. I noticed our waiter would constantly come by to stare at whether we finished our food or not and even asked twice if we were finished (we were not, obviously, there was still uneaten crab legs and some meat on our plates). We began to feel rushed and obligated to finish our food quicker. I then remembered that our waiter literally stood in front of our table asking who was going to have the last pieces of shrimp and mussels so he could take away the appetizers. Awkward... 

After we finished, our plates were taken almost right away and we then ordered the mango panna cotta for dessert, which was delicious. But as we were finishing up, our waiter comes by AGAIN to comment on how there's only a little bit left. At this point I was sure they were just trying to get us to leave. We felt extremely rushed and it definitely made our meal and my friend's birthday dinner not as enjoyable as it should have been, since the food was delicious. My friend said they thought they were rushing us because they were closing soon, but as we left we saw several other tables in the other room still dining. Unfortunately I can no longer say that Bobo's is my favorite restaurant because the service put a damper on my best friend's birthday dinner. Don't expect this to be a 5 star dining experience because they want you in and out of there as soon as possible.
author: Cecille W.

description:
I was horribly underwhelmed by the quality of the food for this Marina Steakhouse, I truly do not understand how they are still in business.  

I must add, the waiter was PHENOMENAL and was not to be blamed at all for our experience as there's nothing he could have done better.  He answered all of our questions with the most helpful suggestions and really helped us pick out a wine to match our dishes.

The steak was just awful, I will include that I am extremely picky with my steak as I am from Texas.  I did not enjoy the quality of meat, especially for the prices at Bobo's. I was expecting much more, I really wanted to like this restaurant though and am disappointed it was not a better experiece.

Definitely go to Harrahs if you want a quiality steak in the beighnorhood.
author: Ellie J.

description:
This is an EXPENSIVE A LA CARTE restaurant. Everything is single item with a cost that runs your bill up quick. Order a $65 steak & two side orders of potatoes and spinach at $9 each and now your dinner is $85, add a glass of wine your bill is now $97 for ONE PERSON. That is how it works here.
Food is good but way way way overpriced. Restaurant is small and tight table space, and staff not very friendly at all from the bored looking hostesses at door to the waiters who act all business in a rushed manner & not very friendly. Again, the food is very good, but not at the price they demand. Just imagine going somewhere for a steak dinner for 2 & all you get for $130 is 2 pieces of steak and that is IT, no salad, no potatoes, no anything else. Oops I forgot, they do give you good garlic french bread at table before dinner but believe me, in the end you pay for it. Our dinner for 2 here was $190.00, wow but they have free valet parking.
No return here, I'd rather go somewhere else and eat 3 times for this price. The last rub was having a fee of $7.40 added to bill for SF good & welfare program even though SF already spends over $271 million a year on homeless mess. Cya BoBo.
author: Larry H.

description:
Disappointing. The kitchen mixed up parts of our order (wrong steak / wrong doneness) and was unwilling to exchange it to the right piece. Alright, I'm more than happy to forgive mistakes but if I'm being charged $$$ prices I'd expect better customer service. Moreover, really EVERYONE who worked here seemed stressed. No smiles and a rather grumpy attitude. We were seated upstairs next to the patio door and that one waiter came by every 10 minutes or so to air out the room, without asking if it's okay to leave the door open. I ended up sitting there with my jacket. I didn't expect SF's winter in July to follow me into the restaurant.

Poor service and poor customer care. Nah.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
My review for the place is well overdue, out of all the steak houses, this steak medium well is the best, perfectly made steak I have ever tasted

My husband and I came here to celebrate my birthday and we ordered the crab, shrimp and mussels and he added a steak ! The ambiance is amazing - I love a dinner place where I have to dress up and be glammed and this is a place for that. We always start at the bar before being seated and I ordered a whiskey sour with jack Daniel's which tasted so good! And the bartender is the best! The staff makes you feel like royalty with their amazing service and wanting to make sure our night was perfect! Definitely in my top 5 dinner places in San Francisco
author: Taniesha L.

description:
Been here a few times, really like the decor of the place, the ambiance, the waiters are very nice, and drinks are great. 

Steak on the other hand is a hit or miss. For a place that mainly serves steak, it shouldn't be that way. 

Their steak always seems to be too crispy from the top and that is something I do not like at all. 

Their iron skillet dishes on the other hand are really good. 

Always great the shrimp and they are amazing. 

Would be great if they can improve on their steak, so it comes out perfect each time.
author: Shanzay H.

description:
Overall, I felt like Bobo's is a bit too expensive for the quality of food that it offers. I've never had a cold steak until I went there. And, no, it wasn't a steak tartar. I ordered a Double Turf n' Surf (a New York Steak with Filet Mignon along with a side order of crab legs) and for some reason, everything felt a bit cold when I ate them. It was almost as if the chef had left them sitting for too long before they got to my table. In any case, I enjoyed my rare filet mignon since it was very tender and tasty. If only it was a bit warmer in the center, I probably would've loved it more. The New York Steak, on the other hand, was quite chewy and full of tough fat parts. I regretted that my side steak wasn't another filet mignon from this experience. As for the crab legs, holy sh*t did I learn my lesson to never order a crustacean when I'm at a steak place. I felt as if my poor crab didn't have enough to eat before it was freshly netted out from the ocean and dumped onto my plate since it was so scrawny and cold. If I ever go back to Bobo's, I will make sure to stick to the filet mignon and forget anything else on the menu. 

Since this place is in the City, the free valet parking is awesome. The ambience there was quite lovely (our group of 4 got seated on one of the higher floors) and worthy of an anniversary celebration. Service is superb and well worth the heavy price tag.
author: Joy H.

description:
Great first time experience. The place is very red and Bobo's refers to the theme of "Jester". It's a fun theme well implemented. 

We shared their famous bone-in filet mignon, a half crab, a twice baked potato and a wedge Caesar salad they nicely split for us. 

The salad was very tasty, above average for sure. The steal was honestly one of the best I've ever had the bone added serious flavor. The half crab was a little overcooked but still quite tasty and they include some steak sauce and bread with butter and olive on it. FInally the twice baked potato was incredibly tasty and we destroyed it.

We shared some Strawerry cheesecake for dessert. Will return.
author: Jordan C.

description: Our group of eight family members went to Bobos last night. This was a first and last time we will go to Bobo's. Service was good, but the food was bland. I ordered the 20oz  bone in rib eye which was $60 and I eat barely half of it. Two people ordered the fish and it came out on a wood plank and again bland. The surf and turf was crab and a bone in fillet. You would think for $80 this would be the bomb, but the crab didn't seem fresh. Save your money and drive  a few more blocks to House of Prime Rib and have a great meal.
author: Mike I.

description: Had a terrible experience there last weekend! We had to keep asking over and over again for our drinks cause we wouldn't get them, our appetizers were good, but the bread was the hardest and driest bread I've ever tried at a restaurant. We kept breathing and being patient longing for our steaks to arrive since they were supposed be awesome (according to the price and word of mouth I've head), what a tremendous deception when our steaks arrived raw when many from our table have ordered medium well and specifically requested them not bloody-red, 3 of us decided we just couldn't eat them that way and sent them to the kitchen to get them a little more cooked (other's in our table just decided to eat it that way but weren't happy about it), it took forever for the steaks to get back to us, and this time they were completely chard (literally black) on the outside but still red in the inside, the photo I'm posting doesn't even do justice to how chard it actually was.... Horrible experience, and it was so hot in there since it's a tiny place with no air circulation, wouldn't recommend this place at all! And it's So not worth the price! There are many great steak houses in the city, but BoBos is definitely not one of them!!
author: Lety L.

description: I had the surf and turf! would say one of the best Steaks I've ever had! It's very tender and very flavorful! The crab was crunchy and delicious as well! The tiramisu was good. I had better tho! Overall, I would definitely come back here for steak! Yummm!!
author: Moreen T.

description:
Bobo's is a solid 4 stars. The stars could be broken up into two categories: food & service. 2 stars for the service which was pretty good. The waiters made sure my water glass was full-- I drink a lot, they filled it every time it was empty so that says a lot. Our waitress was nice and not pushy, gave us time to decide and made sure everything was all good. Only complaint is that they sat us where the extra dishes/utensils were, so every time they had to get extras it was a bit noisy. Onto the food.

Ordered the New York Strip ~18-20oz [$49.95] I enjoyed my steak. It was cooked to my liking (Med) instead of their suggested temp which was Med Rare. The meat was tender and juicy all throughout. Filet Mignon Bone In [$51.95] didn't really taste like a filet... I think they overcooked some parts to where the meat was tough but as we got through the middle it started tasting more like a filet. The "bone-in" part wasn't anything special, just something to attract the customers cause it tasted the same. The sides we chose were the Modern Mac & Cheese [$9.95] and the Mushroom [$9.95] which are both big enough to share. Loooved the portabello mushrooms! It was well prepared in a great tasting sauce. The Modern Mac took a back seat to the mushrooms, but it was still a great side dish. It was creamy and cheesy, but not cheesy enough to overcome the shrooms. 

Bobo's is a good establishment. The steaks were great & the service was good, but honestly, I've had better steak. Nothing really blew me away except maybe the mushrooms. It was a great experience. The quirkiness of the restaurant shows in every room, but I wish it was a little more brighter for patrons to see the decor. Also, it smelled a little funky in the room we sat in (first room to the right upon entering the building). I think maybe cause it's an old joint. Upgrades are always a good thing.
author: Rana R.

description: Came for my anniversary. They made our first time incredible. Best seat in the house. Steak and crab was delicious  can't wait to be back.
author: Diana N.

description:
Stopped here for our last dinner in San Francisco and glad that we did. Only a few blocks from our hotel so it was east to walk to and quickly made a reservations. In a converted house but very nice place.

Food - so very good. The steak (Filet) was one of the best ones I have had. I ordered medium rare and it came out much closer to rare but it was so good that I did not mind The twice baked potato was also very good. Wife had the crab and loved it. Not sure exactly their secret for cooking it but very successful. The Mango Panna cotta is also very good.

Service - In general was very good however he did not seem to be very knowledgeable on wine. Specifically was not sure of the difference between a sweet wine (which my wife likes) and a dry wine.

Price - Expensive. The crab was not much more than other places but the steaks and sides are quite pricey. It was worth it but just a warning.
author: Mike P.

description:
We made a reservation at the last minute for an early dinner. We were definitely early as the restaurant was empty when we arrived. We got a great table on the top floor overlooking the street with the entire floor to ourselves. We started with cocktails, I had the basil cocktail and daughter had the blood orange margarita. Good drinks, but nothing to write home about. We followed up the cocktails with some wine by the glass. For dinner we ordered the crab bisque, Cesar salad, full crab, 9 oz filet, mac & cheese, and chard. Salad was real good, bisque was good and full of crab. Filet was the highlight of the meal (according to my daughter) - she quickly finished it. Chard and Mac & cheese were tasty. Crab was a little dry, but still good. As we ate, our dining room filled with other patrons and the restaurant was completely full when we finished. 

Service was top notch. They were very professional, not pushy, and great with wine recommendations. The water glass never went empty as someone always refilled it.

I'd definitely consider returning here the next time in San Francisco. Looks like a great place for a daddy/daughter dinner as well as a romantic dinner for a couple.
author: JR H.

description:
The ambiance has a lot of personality, corky but interesting. It's a bit small, good for smaller groups or dinner dates.

I ordered a San Francisco mule which was tasty. It has a hint of mint to it. I also ordered a 9oz filet medium which was really nice and flavorful. I'd definitely go again and try the crab. I hear it's a must!
author: Katherine B.

description:
Great steak, shrimp, and drinks. 

We came here late night and ended up being one of two of the last parties to leave. Despite this, the staff continued to be attentive and didn't rush us out. It's interesting coming up to this place because it felt like coming into someone's home rather than stepping into a restaurant. We were seated in the room immediately to the right as you enter. It's a cozy little place but I'm sure it gets bigger as you go in more. 

We started with a couple basil martinis that went down like juice. You could definitely taste the alcohol but the balance was perfect that it didn't stop you from gulping it down like a Capri Sun. They have this really good crispy kettle bread for starters and amazing Dungeness crab crostinis with smoked salmon, avocado, olive oil and burratta. Definitely a must-try. We got the bone-in filet for dinner at medium rare and it came out perfectly, with the twice baked potatoes and creamed spinach family style. Our friends also got the shrimp and mussel iron skillet and they seemed to enjoy that as well. 

All in all, it was a great dining experience with good food and good service. We'd definitely pay Bobo's  a visit the next time we're back up in San Francisco.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: This was our second time here and we liked it even more! This time we ordered the double shrimp and whole crab grill and the bone in filet Mignon...OMG!!! The steak was delicious, melts in your mouth and cooked to perfection. Best steak we've ever had! The crab and shrimp were really good too. Service is always excellent. We will definitely go back.
author: Monica L.

description: Wasn't super impressed by the food. It was ok seafood and steak. I have has better. The service was great, place a little outdated, and food was ok not fabulous for the price we paid. The twice baked potato was really good and also their bread was wonderful. They did give a decent amount of mussels in the combo with mussels, crab, and shrimp. We had maybe 4 shrimp and not much in the crab they gave us. It was just ok.
author: Yael G.

description:
Three star rating for the disappointing steak. BF and I came here for dinner and ordered the crab crostini appetizer and then split the bone in filet and half crab. Appetizer was good and the sides were pretty delicious (we ordered the mushrooms and Swiss chard). Biggest issue was the steak - we asked for medium rare. Steak came out completely raw at first (it was ice cold in the middle!) and then came out burnt on both sides when we sent it back. For a steakhouse that prides themselves on the bone-in filet, it's not a good look when you can't even properly cook a medium rare steak!

Overall ambiance was fun and quirky but a little dated. Martinis were pretty good. Overall though you never want your favorite dish to be the side of mushrooms!
author: Kathryn L.

description: Extremely overpriced for very mediocre food. All of us ordered medium rare and some were medium, some were practically medium well. You can do a lot better in San Francisco for way less money.
author: Jon D.

description:
It's still a damn fine steak if I do say so for myself. :) 

After a successful week of sports betting, my buds and I decided to celebrate with a late Sunday night steak dinner at Bobo's. The plan...stick to the basics here and don't stray to the sides. You'll notice in my last review of this place that I was unimpressed with the sides and still feel that way. 

Anywhoooo, we all ordered the bone-in filet mignon and decided to share the "lots of crab" as an accompaniment. The sheer amount of butter on both of these dishes is enough for a month but, it's so good. The steak was cooked to perfection (med-rare) and the dungeness crab was just covered in garlic. Yum. 

If I could give you one piece of advice, it would be stick to the steak and crab and you'll leave happy!
author: Benjamin F.

description: Reserved a table, took us in right away no waiting! Very nice atmosphere, all red around you with dim candles. The waiter was really rude and had attitude the runner was way more nicer and attentive! The food I ordered seafood, lobster soup, crab and shrimp and dessert! Good choice of wines, just don't make this a date place your mouth will taste like garlic all night. I would go again maybe to try the steaks it was overall a nice atmosphere!!
author: Cindy L.

description: Super friendly staff, great food, a fine attention to detail. Thanks for accommodating my wife on crutches!
author: Sean M.

description: Had a wonderful birthday dinner for my niece! I will say the service was a little slow but they had some bigger parties to attend to so it's completely understandable. The food was delicious and the restaurant has this unique charm you don't get at most steakhouses. Would definitely recommend going there for a date, birthday or just to have a great meal in a cool atmosphere!
author: Rebecca R.

description: It's a pretty cool spot with decent food. Def not a fancy place, the crowd is more casual than a nice steak restaurant as you expect. But overall the food and the service was fine
author: Sandy M.

description:
This place was referred by a good friend, drove over 3.5 hours to San Fran and definitely had to give this place a try for dinner! After calling to make reservation "the same day" they got me in at the time o requested!

The server was great, but the food is what the review is all about, I had the DOUBLE mussel DOUBLE shrimp and DOUBLE crab sizzling plate! It melted in your mouth with flavor that had me craving for it the next day! When I go back to San Fran I am going here for dinner again! 

I have to also mention the crab Mac and cheese was to die for, out of this world of you are a Mac and cheese fan, if you are not, then you WILL be after trying Bobo's Mac and cheese!!!!
author: Cj S.

description:
This is a amazing Spot in the world of corporate big name Steakhouses and over Priced Steakhouses all over Frisco.


Bobos nails it from top to Bottom. First as you arrive if by own Vehicle You are treated to amazing free Valet parking by a exceptional Valet Man Like Zack.

He Treated me graciously and made me assured my car was in good hands. Best Valet man I've had ever. 

I deal with a lot as well constantly dining in LA and Miami.

Zack Is Superb... 

All this Before I enter Bobos, well I'm shocked and pleasantly surprised to say this Steakhouse is Top Notch in every way from Pricing to Food , To Service, To Ambiance 

Every Single Course way above good ... Favorites I suggest Yellowtail Carpaccio 
                Crab Cakes
                 Tomato Salad
                  Bone in Super Filet

I've ate at Many Steakhouses all over the world and Bobos is in my Top 5 all time and hard to argue I've had a Better bone in filet in my life.

Italian Chef Andrea  is Cucina fantastica!!
author: Vinny M.

description:
Nearly had a perfect dining experience here. Planned a small girls' night out and easily made reservations online for a Saturday evening. Even called to confirm my 6:30pm reservation and told them we need a handicap seating area due to my friend being in a leg cast and they were able to accommodate my request for a quiet area so we could catch up as well. 

Drove up all the way from San Jose. Was prepared to look for parking but was pleasantly surprised by the complimentary valet parking right out front! Was quickly seated and the waiter was on point. The ambiance was ok - it was dark like most steakhouses are so it's difficult to get good pictures, but obviously, that's not the priority of us being there. 

There was only three of us and you won't believe how much we ate. We ordered 2 full-sized crabs, double serving of shrimp, 16 oz bone-in filet mignon, 2 orders of crab cakes (4 total), order of lobster crostini, a side of brussel sprouts, a side of mushrooms, 2 desserts and 3 drinks. The waiter thought we were crazy but it was so good, we ate most of it (we purposely skipped lunch and came hungry lol)

By 8:30pm, we were finishing up our dessert when the hostess came up to us and said something along the lines of "I have 4 people here for their 8:30 reservation so we'll need you to wrap up". We were so shocked we didn't even respond before she turned around and walked away. The waiter heard and he apologized and said we could stay but by then, my friend was so turned off, she said she wanted to leave and she will be writing a Yelp review and my other friend and I wanted to stay even longer just to spite the hostess. There's no sign like at Korean hot-pot places that say our reservation is only 2 hours. What if we were still eating and hadn't paid yet? We just felt so disrespected. Instead of passive-aggressively complaining, I went up to the hostess and gave her a piece of my mind. I asked her what her name is (it's Nancy) and I told her what she did and how she treated us was incredibly rude. We literally just spent $400 between 3 people and expect to be treated better. It is not our fault you as a hostess overbooked the restaurant and there's no sign we had to leave at 2 hours exactly. We were having a wonderful night until she came up to our table demanding us to leave. She responded with "do you want to talk to the manager?" I said "No, did I say I wanted to talk to the manager? I just want to talk to you and tell you what you did is not right". She did apologize and we walked out but by then, she just killed it for us. Way to ruin what could have been a 4-5 star experience, Nancy.
author: Lucky N.

description:
We literally stumbled past this place on our walk back to the hotel. Hubby made reservations and we were told they only had bar tables available. For a Saturday night, we weren't stressed! If you blink, you will miss the entrance (I did, hubby had to call me back!) 

it's very squishy. There's not room for more than 2 people in the doorway area. We were seated fairly quickly by the hostess and the waiter brought us waters immediately. The menu is fairly easy. Steaks, seafood, sides. Everything is sold separately. When the waiter came back for our order he "splashed" hubby's water all over the table, his app plate, silverware. He was pretty nonchalant about it and rather than apologize said "at least it's just water". I didn't find that appropriate, but we just nervous giggled and moved past it because the table was literally smaller than my pillow at home. Very small, very cramped in the bar area. I was bumped in to at least 6 times in the duration of our meal. 

I was torn between crab and shrimp, but "settled" for crab  Hubby got the bone-in filet mignon.  We let the waiter know we were sharing and he stated they would split the food for us. Pretty cool. I like when restaurants do that, or bring the extra plat so we can do it ourselves. 

They started us off with sourdough topped with olives and drizzled with olive oil. I didn't eat the topping but hubby enjoyed it! The bread was SO good! Light, fluffy, and the crust was crispy. It was perfect! Food came out soon after and was cooked well. They do goop the garlic butter all over the crab which makes cracking a challenge (especially with the "fancy" stupid cloth napkins). They do not bring a shell bowl, but that's probably because there's literally no room one on the table. Our glasses ended up in the windowsill so we had room for our plates. The steak was great! Cooked well and not too fatty or gristle-y. The crab was good, but I am a Dungeness LOVE-ERRRRR! Once again, we had a ton of people ask if we were done eating while we were still mid-bite (or one while I was chewing). It must be an "SF" thing to not get to sit and enjoy your food because they were so crowded and busy it was obvious they wanted our table. Even the hostess came over to try to clear our food, before we ever even got the bill. Hubby was so annoyed at that that he went and paid the bill directly to the waiter while I stood in the doorway. It wasn't the most welcoming atmosphere, nor were the staff super friendly, but the food was delish. Pricey, but delicious.
author: Tiffanie E.

description:
Although I'm eating much less meat these days than I used to, oh how I love me a good steak. And if I'm going to indulge, I want it to be spectacular.

These thoughts brought me to Bobo's last Friday, in fond remembrance of my last meal here, years prior. Has Bobo's retained its glory?

In the main, yes. However, things are seeming a bit...dated, and the place could use a refresh.

Practically empty when we arrived at 5:30 and we were seated promptly. A stale scent pervaded the downstairs seating area overlooking Lombard. The entire restaurant, while maintaining its quirky charm, could use a deep-clean.

The service was quick, efficient, and, if not warm or engaging, effective. Seemed to be a number of regulars here, and management really warmly welcomed them.

Cocktails are well-crafted and fairly well-balanced.

The shrimp appetizer was extremely tasty and arrived sizzling at our table (ala Fajitas at a Mexican restaurant). Chard was a bit overcooked. Presentation could be improved a tad.

House salad was tasty and fresh, if a bit overpriced for what amounts to gussied-up iceberg lettuce. Presentation was beautiful.

But you're not here for salad are you?

On to the steak...

My goodness, prices have spiked since I was last here. Yet, I cannot pass you up, oh bone-in filet. The steak was cooked to order, medium-rare in this case, and tasted phenomenal, eliciting "wows" and audible moans of pleasure. Presentation, again, could be improved here, and there were bits of this cut that were chewier than I'd prefer in a $52 filet, but all-in-all, this is one great steak. As good as my last time here? No, but it didn't fall short by much.

Total for two - two cocktails, salad, shrimp app, chard, steak: $170 all-in.

Come here for cocktails and steak. Enjoy!

Food: 4
Service: 4
Ambiance: 3.5
Value: 3
author: Ethan R.

description:
TLDR; you can get good steak and delicious seafood in one convenient place called Bobo's.

What makes this place special besides their interesting decor is the fact that you can get a solid surf and turf here that doesn't disappoint. It does come with a price tag but it's not bad if you're looking at other $$$ steakhouses plus I bet their seafood is better ;) 

I recommend reserving to avoid a wait. It easy and you can use opentable so no excuses! The restaurant is hard to miss with its vibrant color and of course the jester logo. They also have complimentary valet or you can chance it with street parking.

The menu is pretty simple. They have a seafood, salad, and steak section plus some other stuff. You are a fool if you don't get one seafood dish. If you're thinking about getting a steak to share and adding a crab to it and maybe the mussel and shrimp platter as an appetizer... Do it but definitely go with the double shrimp, mussel, and full crab platter and a steak. You get more food at a better price! And yes, that is a lot of food for two people but soooo good :) 

Shrimp, mussel, and crab platter: I'm not 100% sure platter is the correct dish name but it was served on a platter that was sizzling so I'm using it. They're all cooked in the same sauce and served as one dish. Garlic, butter, and seafood is a match made by the gods because very few things can beat it. The dish was delicious and that crab was cooked perfectly. The double platter is definitely meant to be shared by 4 people and way too much for 2 people but I wasn't complaining. Though I loved the crab, the shrimp was my favorite. 

Side note: you also get this amazing crisp bread rubbed with garlic and this was low key my favorite dish. 

Bone-in dry aged New York: my new rule in life is to always get dry aged steak. This wasn't as dry aged as I would like it but it was a solid steak. They only cook their steak one way and that's medium rare. I found my steak to be more on the rare side so it was a little chewier than I would like but the flavor was simple and tasty. 

I also got the mushrooms, twice baked potato, and lobster bisque. The twice baked potatoes was good but not worth it for me. I didn't like the lobster bisque because it was really a lobster curry soup with a few pieces of lobster so unless curry is your thing, I would pass. I did however, enjoy the mushrooms immensely. It was intensely juicy and flavorful. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here and would definitely come back for more seafood! The service here was great. The staff was friendly and attentive. Definitely worth trying if you want great seafood with some good steak to go with it!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Mussels and shrimp were fine.  Bread was stale.  Brussel sprouts undercooked (crunchy). Tbone was good. Filet was ok.  Service was not great.  All the decorations were grimy and dusty.  I do not know why this was rated so high.  I would not go back here.  Way too expensive for the quality.  And I can't stress enough what the dirty lamps and crystals did - if you can't keep the dining room clean it's hard to imagine how the kitchen looks.
author: Kris A.

description:
Ok I eat out ALL the time and have been to most of the steakhouse restaurants in the city as well as many of the Michelin Star restaurants and I've never been so underwhelmed by a white table cloth 3$$$ restaurant with 4 yelp stars. 

I had the server help pick out what they are known for... Mac and cheese, brussels, bone in filet mignon, mussels and shrimp, house salad. 

The house salad, the wine and steak were all good, but nothing to write home about. Everything else I would never order again which is sad that they are known for those items.
author: Sara M.

description:
I haven't been here in years before couple nights ago. I got to say, everything was fantastic except the bone in filet. It was definitely not what I remembered it to be. I've had friends that told me the quality of the steak went downhill and I did not believe them, so I went anyways. And sure enough, the bone in filet wasn't as juicy, texture was a bit too mushy, and it wasn't as sweet. The color was a bit grey, instead of a dark red, as if the meat wasn't that fresh.  All in all, I was a bit disappointed. This use to be one of my favorite steak house.

The mussels and crab cakes were still fantastic though.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Ughhhh, I hate writing bad reviews and 3 is being very generous for the food, but Bobo's steaks were super disappointing. It sucks when the seafood is better than the actual steak. The most redeeming quality of Bobo's is the ambiance and service. 

For our table, we ordered the super bone in filet mignon and the ribeye because everyone on yelp was raving about this. First of all, I love my steaks medium rare and this filet mignon was a freaking sampler of every level of doneness. The first few slices were well done followed by a briefly medium rare portion and everything between the middle to the bone was rare. Not to mention, the center was cold and the outsides were way too over done. If I was blind folded I could've sworn these steaks were straight outa Outback Steakhouse. And that's just depressing... I wish it was a better experience because I've heard such great things, but this was one of the worst I've ever had. 

Overall Bobo's is a No no.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
I came here while visiting San Francisco for the weekend. I had reservations booked in advance so I was really looking forward to trying this place.

For dinner we had the following:
1. Mussels and shrimp - we had this as an appetizer. I typically love mussels the way the French do it but these mussels weren't that good.  The shrimp was far better. I've had better mussels at most other French restaurants. They were over cooked and the flavor wasn't there. If I ever go back, I wouldn't get the mussels.  I'd go for the shrimp instead.

2. Baby blue salad - delicious. The proportions were just right. 

3. Filet mignon - this was absolutely delicious. I ordered it medium rare but it came out as a medium. Regardless, it was delicious. 

4. Brussel Sprouts - these were amazing. I was truly surprised how delicious these were. 

5. Dunce cap cones  - these were good. The mousse was delicious. The cones were good. Not as good and buttery as the ici ice cream cones in Rerkeley nor the butter waffle cookies at trader joe's. 

6. Mango panna cotta - good. I wouldn't say it was amazing. 

The place looks small from the outside but it is huge on the inside like a maze with many little rooms. The ambiance is romantic with dim lighting. There's a nice bar area for you to wait to be seated. The service was alright. I think the waiter was really busy that day. Valet was a nice plus. 

TL/DR:  The shrimp was good; the mussel's were a big disappointment. I would come again. Although, I feel like it doesn't match up to other restaurants are in a similar price range.
author: Jon P.

description:
Well after weeks of hearing about it I had the chance to step in and give it a try. Sitting at the bar was the best way to experience this awesome spot. I looked over the menu and thought to myself. Ok if we are gonna go for it lets do it big time. I ordered the 20oz super bone in filet medium rare. I know I know filet don't have a bone in. Well the way BoBo's does... it does!!! I also decided to have the twice baked potato and the lobster Mac and cheese.

20oz Super Bone in filet was amazing. So cooked to perfection that as soon as it hit the counter the other guys at the bar were like wow I have that also. It was super tender and so full of flavor that I couldn't wait to taste the cuts right near the bone. I wasn't disappointed!!! More flavor in a steak then I have had in a long time. No you see it and now you don't!!!

The twice baked potato was super good. Large and in charge. Great serving size.


Service was great besides not refilling my Arnold Palmer

Now the Lobster mac.... 3 bites and didn't finish it. I would not order it again

 The Mac N Cheese and the non refills on the Arnold cost them the 5th star. I really wanted to do the last star but just couldn't. 

If your in San Francisco this is a place you definitely want to have dinner just don't get the lobster Mac n Cheese and make sure they refill you Arnold Palmer.
author: Spencer T.

description:
Great bone-in filet.  Yes that's their signature dish and it's legit and it's worth getting.  I don't normally like bone-in steaks either but I decided to try it and boy was I glad I went with their signature dish. Super tender but also super flavorful.  I actually preferred the bone-in filet to the bone-in ribeye.  I think the filet actually had just as much or more flavor and was way more tender.  It was like flavorful butter.

The tomato salad was also really great; I don't know why they don't mention it but it's tomatoes avocados and super soft and tasty burrata!

The bread is super tasty but comes out full of oil and capers.  If you want plain bread they will bring you out a hot loaf of plain bread also.

Desserts were an absolute disappointment, but I'm not taking off a star because that bone-in filet was SO GOOD.  The wild strawberry italian cheesecake tasted like just cream and it had RASPBERRY on it (I don't like raspberries) and they didn't list it at all.  At least I wasn't allergic.  The mango panna cotta tastes kind of like fake mango flavor

Reservations on OpenTable.

Single bathroom downstairs. More bathrooms upstairs.

Complimentary valet parking sign (we did street parking so don't know how this works)

It's a little dark inside and tables are a little close.

They do have high chairs!

Pretty good service; not the friendliest but very prompt, respectful, and accurate.  I'm not sure I saw more than maybe 1 smile and it wasn't even that busy but hey, it was good service, just not service with a smile.
author: Traci H.

description: Ordered the ribeye and cream of spinach every bite was amazing! I also enjoyed the table bread
author: S K.

description:
Came here for a close friend's birthday dinner. I don't go to steakhouses very often so I don't have much to compare Bobo's to, but... the Bone-in filet mignon is to die for. Nods of approval around the table. 

Seafood is pretty good but on the heavy side. Sides can use a bit of work. Brussels sprouts weren't anything to remember and the mushrooms were sooooo incredibly salty. I could barely finish the one piece I tried. Mod Mac was creamy, but it didn't particularly wow me either. Cauliflower was simple but good. 

The cocktails are strong and yummy! Just how I like em. 

The restaurant is super cramped and tiny and it can get a little stuffy. Servers are great, no complaints there. 

Free valet parking is also a huge plus!
author: Christine W.

description: Such a disappointment...the only things worth positively noting were the Dirty Vodka Martini before dinner and the Portobello Mushroom side dish. We arrived a little early for our 6pm reservation on Father's Day and were pleasantly surprised to find that they had complimentary valet parking. The hostess was very nice and said she was happy we were early, but the person she directed to seat us seemed confused and aloof. There had been cancellations so they were shuffling plans and out of high chairs. Both are understandable. After a minute or so, we were seated upstairs at a table for 5 when there were just 2.5 of us. We were seated against the window and I immediately noticed the layer of dust on the blinds that was next to the table. They decided to separate and turn the tables around since we didn't need such a large table which was fine but we found it odd they didn't do it before seating us. Our server wasn't very friendly or personable. She was just blah and she didn't come around to refill my water or ask if we needed another bottle of sparkling or check on us in general. The rest of the staff was all very pleasant and personable when bringing the food and clearing dishes. As for our food, the Combo Shrimp, Mussels, and Half Crab were good but not great. The Mussels were really fresh and bursted with flavor but the shrimp were boring and the crab didn't impress us by any means. I do think the combo was a decent size and it's a nice starter to share. Both the Filet Mignon and New York Steak were cooked to the right temp of medium rare but something was missing in the seasoning. The Swiss Chard side and the Mac & Cheese were both tasty and we really enjoyed the Portobello Mushroom side. It was probably the best of the dishes we had. The meal was underwhelming and the place seemed run down with the dusty blinds, a scratched up black banister showing white paint, and faded, dirty carpet. For the high price and being known for both Steak and Crab, the quality just did not meet expectations.
author: Jen L.

description:
I wish i could give a better rating for this place but we were all sorely disappointed. For a restaurant with steak in its name and only a few main ingredients, i expect at-least the bare minimum. I ordered the bone in New York steak medium rare which came out super rare! Picture attached. Plus the flavor was lacking big time.

My sis ordered the shrimp, mussels and crab skillet. And i must say, it was the worst rotten, smelly, mussels we've ever tasted that left a terrible taste in our mouths. Unfortunately, quality does not match price ($250 bill!). Maybe we came on a bad day. But given that Saturday's have the most volume, it's a restaurants time to really shine for new guests.

Service was great which is why it's 2 stars instead of 1. Nice atmosphere, but it did get pretty stuffy on the 3rd floor. I'm not sure if there will be a next time.
author: Linda l.

description: First time here for Baby Cakes and I.  We had dinner reservations at 8:30.   We arrived on time had to wait about 15 min for table to be ready.  I ordered the Basa with side of portabello mushrooms. My food was very tasty, Baby cakes ordered the filet mignon with double baked potato.    The filet mignon was very tasty and tender.        Service was efficient.  They offer complimentary valet so you don't have to drive around and look for parking as parking can be difficult in SF.     Only draw back is the seating is "tight".   We sat rt next to another couple (within arms reach)  and there was no privacy at all.
author: Ultima M.

description:
I came here for a team dinner and this is definitely the highlight of my career so far.

For appetizers, we had the yellowtail carpaccio and the crab cake. The yellowtail tasted really fresh and the toppings/seasoning complemented the fish well. The crab cakes were also delicious!

I ordered the bone in filet. This was the first time I have seen a filet mignon with a bone. It was really really really good. It was perfectly cooked to medium rare and the meat was so tender and flavorful. For our sides, we had mashed yam, portobello, Brussels sprouts, and mac and cheese. The yam wasn't super flavorful and I could pass on the portobello. The brussels sprouts were good and my favorite was the mac and cheese. 

We ordered another mac and cheese but it didn't come until long after we finished our meal. We told them towards the end of our meal that we didn't want it and then they still tried to convince us to take it at the end. They also tried to sneak it in the bill. That was a downer on the night. I wanted more :(

For dessert, my coworker and I split the panna cotta and the cheesecake. The cheesecake was good - I liked the raspberry flavoring. The panna cotta was light and refreshing, definitely a nice way to end the meal.

Despite the hiccup, I definitely recommend this place for the food!
author: Becky H.

description:
My husband and I live a few blocks away and have been coming to Bobo's for the past 6 years, usually to celebrate special occasions like birthdays and anniversaries. We always really enjoy the food and the atmosphere. Unfortunately our most recent visit to Bobo's to celebrate my birthday was quite different.

I ordered the filet mignon cooked medium rare, which is what I always order when we come here. When I cut into the steak it was most definitely not medium rare and my husband agreed. I showed our waiter and was told that I was wrong and the steak was indeed medium rare and he then walked away. I was a little shocked by his reaction as I knew the steak was overcooked. My husband then flagged him down again and we reiterated that I was not happy with the steak and it was overcooked. The waiter again told us that it was fine and that it was cooked that way because of the cut of the meat. What?? I felt uncomfortable raising the issue again although I wish I had asked to speak to the manager. The waiter then gave us a complimentary dessert, which to me means that he knew there was something wrong with my meal but for whatever reason would not take it back and bring me another. 

Our anniversary is coming up and we would normally go to Bobo's to celebrate but after this experience I am sad to say that we will most likely not be returning again. Such a shame as we have always enjoyed our visits here until recently.
author: Stacey N.

description: Mice! We had a table upstairs and were the last to leave.. during dessert we see a mouse running around under the tables! I took video but can't upload it to yelp.. food was good but I won't be returning
author: Charlene C.

description:
Our annual Christmas Eve steak dinner. 
The waiter and the bus-person seemed to either be very snobby or pissed at the world. The menu is small and the food is ok. We spent $750. for 6 adults and a child, I wouldn't recommend it as some place to our friends or family.
author: Sean S.

description:
The whole place smells like old gym socks like they haven't washed their carpet in 15 years. 

When the waiter saw that we weren't ordering a whole meal, but only drinks and steak, his attitude did a 180 instantly. 

For a medium steak, it was way undercooked but we ate it anyway since it took so long for it to arrive.
author: John H.

description:
Captain's Log Stardate 2017. After years of research, months of planning, I have stumbled across the Motherload of meats! I have decided to Treat myself!

What I mean by that is...dry aged perfect steak, that is threatened to be cut, savored, and devoured by the likes of Me! 

Before, I get to the story of dinner, let me tell you a little about what I know about this place. With making conversation at the restaurant, I found that the owner/founder/idea man, was responsible for one of my favorite restaurants in Crockett called "The Dead fish", and that this particular gentleman was featured in this crazy commercial shooting a fish, that commercial Sparkled by of my childhood curiosity for finer type of dinning.

https://youtu.be/9jk-UXu9Q20

^Yeah, this video(if it works, it works).

Anyways, this place "Bobo's," was featured on the television show "check please" , which airs on public broadcasting starion. Ever since watching, I have been enthralled with the idea tasting a juicy steak of this quality.

Upon arriving here, you will notice that parking is very difficult to find, but did you know that they have a valet? That's right, take advantage of this while you can.

When you arrive, you enter this a small establishment it is very warm, but dark, and a rustic italian mobster private type of place. A hostess, checks your reservation. Upon this place, A place in which, I believe is not just stumbled upon, but a place like this is " referred" to you. (Ahem, thanks yelp) :)

I'll keep it short and sweet the bread was good a nice sourdough loaf freshly baked. I had the Brussels sprouts, mushrooms, Mac and cheese, the lobster soup, and yeah, One of the best Bone Fillet Minion out there and please, ask the waitress about her drink recommendations, Genius!

Dare, I challenge myself, not to come here again? Hmmmm.
author: Michael R.

description: Hello came here last night expecting to have a nice evening...spent about $145 on the bill $30 on the tip..when I got home I realized the ticket for the valet was still on there and on the back it it says TWO BLACK GUYS.... this place is a joke and this is disgusting...I have the pictures I will post it it allows me to prove it...I am from India and my friend is hespanic...we're not black and if we were I would feel like this is a rasict remark...I'm sure all the tickets don't say two of a certain ethnicity or some other ethnicity...we were definitely profiled here...for spending as much as I did here and it's my third time...ahh if I knew earlier I would of had some words for you folks up there but I won't be coming back
author: Navi B.

description:
What an amazing place!! I came here on recommendation as I heard Bobo's was a classic.  So, when I was in SF, I knew that I had to try this place.  I made sure to make reservations since I was going on a Saturday night.  I took an Uber here so I did not have to worry about parking.  Once I got there, it was packed!!! It was packed in the restaurant, packed at the bar, packed in the waiting area.  I checked in with the hostess and wandered to the outside area.  There is no waiting area, so everyone who was waiting was sort of awkwardly facing each other.  My reservation was for 9, but she still quoted me a 20 minute wait.  I get it, it was crowded on Saturday night.  But, once the 20 minute mark passed, I started getting a little antsy especially since parties that were there after me started getting seated.  I checked in with the host at the 25 minute mark and she told me another 10 minutes, but to make sure to check in with her.  Then, when I did, she quoted me another a few minutes.  SIGH! I think the problem is they allocate a table to each party and the table I was allocated to was not leaving.  However, since the hostess knew I was waiting, I guess she decided to jump the line a little and gave us these amazing seats on the top floor.  It was a private booth.  I loved it so I guess it was worth the wait.  (Especially since I saw that a lot of the 2 seater were very close to each other). 

Once I got seated, I was ready for some good food.  I got some complimentary garlic bread.  DELICIOUS!!! I looked over the menu and decided on the filet and baked potato to share.  Our server was SOO nice and attentive, bringing us water and menu promptly.  Once the food came out, the filet was so delicious and tender.  I loved the way it was cooked.  I also loved the baked potato.  It was cut open, so it was easy to share.  Definitely worth the long wait. 

I will definitely be back to Bobo's next time I am in town.  I liked the unique atmosphere (it has a carnival theme inside).  Dress code is whatever you feel like.  I saw some people dressed up to the nines, some people super causal.  Overall, good vibes and good food.
author: Jane L.

description:
Charming steakhouse built into a motel and filled with tons of local kitsch.  The steak is obviously awesome.  Pretty tasty appetizers, including the iron skillet seafood.  Sides were just ok, but who goes to a steakhouse for sides?

Mussels & Shrimp: They look very impressive with everything sizzling on an iron skillet  Absolutely loved the shrimp which was bursting with flavor; the shell was cooked enough that you just ate it whole for a slight crunch.  The mussels were kind of meh though, felt a little dry from the preparation (compared to when mussels are steamed in a nice broth).

Yellowtail Carpaccio: Way more exciting than sashimi because of all the nice ingredients on top.

Dungeness Crab Crostini: The smoked salmon felt a bit unnecessary (but still tasted good).  I really liked the pairing of crab with cheese & avocado for extra creaminess.

Heirloom Toy Box Tomatoes: Less going on here so you can really focus on the cheese and some pretty little tomatoes.

Bone-In Filet Mignon: This is why you come to Bobo's.  I had it the house default of medium-rare and it was just perfect.  Absolutely loved the high-temperature sear on the outside while the inside maintained a full color gradient from char-to-pink as you moved towards the center.  I asked about steak sauces (e.g. béarnaise, au poivre) but they only offered A1 so I passed.  So much flavor, it was fine without anything on top.

Twice-Baked Potato: This looked cool, but I wasn't too impressed by the taste.  It seemed like it had cubes of zucchini mixed in.  Also, the twice-baked filling wasn't that smooth.

Bermuda Onion Rings: Seemed a bit batter heavy.

Mod Mac w/ Lobster: So anything mac & cheese and anything lobster will be good, that's just a fact.  Despite the winning combination, this dish didn't graduate from the good to great.  The crust on top was just few breadcrumbs; I prefer a nice thick layer of crusted cheese.  The noodles seems a bit small and limp (as opposed to al dente).  The creamy sauce was nice though.

Chocolate Bomb: Chocolate and raspberry, a perfect ending after a nice steak dinner.

Dunce Cap Cones: Cute little snacks.  You get a bite or two of chocolate mousse and homemade cone.
author: Adam B.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend for July 4th dinner, but the experience was not what it used to be. We got the bone-in ribeye, bone-in filet mignon, sizzling shrimp (appetizer), and sautéed mushroom on the side. The steaks were just okay. The appetizer and the mushrooms were great. 

What made everything so bad was when our waiter was boxing our food, he was using his hands. No utensils even though it was there next to him. He also took two bites out of our mushrooms while he was packing it with his hands. I don't think he thought we can see him. We couldn't eat our left over food anymore after seeing that. What's worst was that dinner was expensive.
author: Vincent D.

description: Bobo's was amazing. We came here for a date night and left completely satisfied and more. We ordered lobster soup, the filet, mussels, a baby blue salad and the creamed spinach. The mussels were huge and delicious, the steak was cooked perfectly and everything else was great. I wasn't super big on the soup and we forgot to order crab but will definitely be back to try some other options out! Highly recommended.
author: Brittney G.

description: The steak was good. However, everything comes a la cart so if you don't order sides, the steak is kinda served to you on a large plate, feeling kinda lonely and bleek. The server was nice enough, but I couldn't really tell if he was happy to be there or not, probably not. I'm not sure I'd go again, but I can't hate on the quality of the steak.
author: Sam P.

description: Went on a Friday and the wait was not bad 20 minutes with a reservation.  Sat at the bar while waiting this was a bit tight seating area.  The ribeye was excellent along with the bread.  The service was professional and good.  Didn't care for the crooked pictures as it made me dizzy to look at but will come again for the ribeye and bread.
author: David W.

description:
One of the nicer steakhouses around. This was my second time here. Although the food was a bit pricey we enjoyed the crab cakes, lobster bisque and two kinds of fillet mignon.

The atmosphere on the top floor was lively and bright. Downstairs was a bit too dark and too close to other guests.
The steaks were well seasoned and prepared. 
The bread was the best dish eventhough it was free.
author: Ricky J.

description: The place is small inside and the steak is OK so it doesn't really stand out. I think its supposed to be a circus theme but I don't quite get it. Staff overall was very good though.  Pricey which is expected
author: Tiff W.

description: Went here on a suggestion from yelpand was very impressed with the service and quality of food and drinks. Small little place but very lively. Steak dinner was cooked to perfection.
author: Ty C.

description:
Really disappointed with our experience.  My wife and I chose Bobo's for my 'Surf & Turf' birthday dinner.  While the aesthetic was nice, the dining area where we were sat had a distinct and putrid smell.  The wait staff was pretty rude as well.  When we asked for one steaks to be prepared Medium, this seemed to cause heartache for the waitress.  She offered them prepared 'Medium Rare' and when I asked if there would be a problem preparing them at Medium, she said there wouldn't be.  The steaks were served Medium Rare.   

Additionally,  the gentleman bussing the tables just came in and grabbed plates/glasses from us.  No questions, just took them and left.  

Given the price of this experience, the service we received and the quality of how the food was prepared the only word that I can use to describe Bobo's is 'disappointing'.   (What I would expect at Sizzler)

Eat here at your own peril.  I'm certain there are better steakhouses in town where you can have a superior experience.  Don't waste your time at this one
author: Jared H.

description:
First off this should have 4$ (not 3), a steak costs approx $65 / steak.

This place has gone downhill, it used to be my go-to for steak, but my recent experiences have changed my mind.

On two occasions I had a conversation about having my steak medium rare, each time the steak was raw.  I and everyone at my table sent their steaks back to be cooked, and then had to send them back a second time.  By the time they were cooked the our side was kind of burned hard.

The atmosphere is fun, the staff is fine (nice people) but they strike out on the beef.
author: Patrick H.

description: I came here for my 30th birthday! The decor is very unique. The food and service was fantastic. They made my birthday very special. It was nice to see the owner there too
author: Lana L.

description: Just finished eating a absolutely excellent bone in filet mignon at bobos. It was very intimate inside here very small and romantic. This place is sf history and I finally got to try it. I highly recommend this place to anyone. 5 stars for sure. My waiter was quick and courteous. The double baked potatoes and Brussel sprouts were also to die for. And the bread came out baked with olive oil and garlic dreanched all over it. Everything was awesome.
author: Mark P.

description:
The signature bone in filet was melt in your mouth perfection!  The Brussel sprouts were also amazing.
Our waiter was great.  Very professional and funny.
I will definitely be back.
author: Patti P.

description:
Best steak and seafood in town!

Iv'e been to Bobo's several times and I'm happy to say it is good every time. The bone in filet mignon, the combo mussels, shrimp and crab, and twice baked potato is my go to order. The ambiance feels homey and the staff are always friendly. Their bread that they give you is to die for too.
author: Katie L.

description: Another delightful evening at Bobo's! Here's a shoutout to Reneau who took excellent care of us, and to Andrea who stopped by for a taste of Cellar Scraps #9, an amazing wine! Three filet mignons disappeared in no time and three well-fed gentlemen headed out into the San Francisco evening with huge smiles on their faces. See you soon at Bobo's!
author: Lou S.

description:
I'll preface this review by stating that we came on New Year's Eve, so I think our experience with the food is different than on a regular night. Our group of four had early dinner reservations for 5:45 pm. When we arrived the restaurant only had a handful of other tables and we were seated upstairs. It was pretty hot and stuffy up there, but luckily someone cracked the door open about halfway through our meal. Our waitress was extremely kind and attentive throughout our dinner service. 

In casual conversation our waitress let us know that they had about 300 more seatings after our early dinner seating. They were prepared by having a ton of staff, but perhaps a bit too prepared with having the food already prepared prior to people ordering it. I say this because we received our food fast, like fast food drive-thru fast. We put in our order, received our bread and as we are taking bites of our bread our entrees were being put down in front of us. We received our entrees in about 7 minutes or less. Our waitress even made a comment saying that she's never seen the food come out that quick. This indicated to me that it was all prepared beforehand because there was no way our food was fired when the order was put in. We ordered our steak medium and it came to us medium rare. No biggie, we aren't that picky and ate it the way it came to us, but it was lukewarm. While some people prefer steak to be fully rested to room temperature, I like it when it's served with a bit more heat so the fat melts in my mouth.  We also ordered the half crab and it was so dry we had to drench it in the dipping sauce. This was the biggest disappointment. We ended our meal with a couple of desserts which were satisfying.

I'm sure this place is good on a regular night, but the food we received was prepared too far in advance and got to us at lightning speed, which is not something we want at a nice sit down restaurant. The food was really 2 stars, but I gave it 3 due to the great service.
author: Sara P.

description: Gets steak place towards Marina located at Lombard at Van Ness. This place I would say is 1/3 best steak restaurants in Bay Area as they are now rare(pun unattended)
author: Christos V.

description:
This place was open on new years day and so we thought we'd give it a try.
avoid the salads..they were nothing special and a complete waste of money.
The steak here is really tender- I was very pleased. However, for the price, the steak was a bit small. Also, my mom's steak was a bit burnt (but she did ask for a medium well so maybe that's just how it was supposed to be for that cook) 
The sides were okay. the mushrooms were huge chunks of portobello that seemed to be just coated in butter. nothing too special. the brussel sprouts were pretty good- lots of good bacon flavor. the twice baked potato was okay- not as amazing as everyone made it seem like it was in their reviews- just tasted like a plain baked potato to me. 
My dad ordered the mussel/shrimp/crab mix- crab was extremely small in size with very little meat. mussels were pretty good but I could tell they weren't too fresh. shrimp was fine, just coated in tons of butter. 
Actually everything was extremely buttery and greasy...definitely do not come here if you are trying to avoid all that. I ended up with a bit of a stomach ache after the meal just because it was SO much butter in everything...
The service was fine..nothing extraordinary...no one came by our table asking if we wanted more bread, if everything was okay, if we wanted anything else to drink... 
For a $270 check, food was decent but I would probably not come back.
author: Jinhee K.

description:
Bobo's is such a unique restaurant with Venetian décor and its dim light makes it a perfect date night spot. It is famous for their steak among all things and I was here with my clients so we were able to order a huge selection of food to try. There are some things I absolutely love here and unfortunately, there are things that I think could be better.

What I really like from their appetizers are their Iron skillet roasted mussels, free garlic bread, yellowtail Carpaccio and Filet el Crudo. The mussels are a bit fried so be aware but the sauce is delicious. The yellowtail carpaccio is a bit spicy but very fresh and tender. I like their Filet too but that is overshadowed by the yellowtail. 

For entrée, I opted for their medium rare bone-in Filet Mignon 20 oz and the gentlemen at the table all got the bone-in rib eye. I should have got that as well. My filet came but it honestly wasn't cooked perfectly. The outer layer of the steak seems rather medium and I don't see the reddish part till I am about center close to the bone. The steak is aged but the flavor did not seem to reach the majority of the meat. My guess is that the filet is very thick and therefore, hard to cook it evenly throughout. On the contrary, the rib eye is juicy, fatty and full of flavor. On the sides, we tried lobster mac and cheese, mod mac, Brussel sprouts and cauliflower and lobster mac is definitely the clear winner. 

We ended the night with 3 different types of desserts. My favorite is their raspberry cheese cake. It is somewhat rich yet light and not too sweet. Their chocolate bomb is also amazing as well as their Panna Cotta.  

Overall, it was a great meal with lots of solid dishes. However, if you are a serious steak lover, go for the rib eye and skip the filet mignon. I have had better, tender and juicier pieces.
author: Athena C.

description:
Best steakhouse in the City.

Perfect sear on the steaks, and crab is excellent.


Great atmosphere.

Bartenders are great.  Eat the bar and enjoy.
author: Chester H.

description:
The 1 and 2 star reviews are right on the money sad to say.  We had our holiday party here and I was very disappointing. After some of our staff driving 2+ hours to the restaurant from their locations (we cover the entire Bay Area), the only good thing were the "Sidecars" that the bartender made me. Other than that, everything was not good.

All the food came out in horribly long intervals (we had 28 people, all in the burger restarant of Bobo's, not the Steakhouse side, so it was just us with a fixed menu that was all set up before the evening.   

The appetizers were the mussels and crab in which the mussels were chalk dry and completely overcooked. Not a bit of moisture in them, and mussels are one of my favorites. The crab was ok, but it just missed the mark completely for me. 

Water, Water Water, where is the water. Finally after 30 minutes of asking at least 6 times by several different people we received our water, long after we started eating.

Steaks: I had ordered the bone in NY and was very disappointing. The meat came out not extremely hot.  I had to wait 15 minutes to eat because they brought out 3-4 steaks at a time (seemed like every 5 minutes) and then we had to wait for more to come out until our table received all the main courses. The steak was a bone in NY, 16oz but mine had a lot of hard fat around the edges. I love fat, that's the flavor, but it should be crispy fat that is soft and tender, not grizzle like.  The steak was not very thick, and although med rare, the temperature was way down when it came and nearly cool by the time I could eat it.  Otherwise I would looked like a starving caveman eating steak while my co-workers watched.

Then after we started on the main dish, the side dishes sporadically started coming out for another 10-15 minute strung out service for those.  The final side dish of the three came out a good 20 minutes after I received my steak. Just horrible timing from a crew that seemed completely overwhelmed with a group.  They were very nice, but the service was very poorly coordinated and executed.

The sauteed mushrooms were ok, and the brussel sprouts were good (I did like the brussel sprouts).  The baked potatoes came out and they put a few in front of six of us and we just figured they were to share. After cutting them in 1/3's, suddenly more of them show up. Very disorganized and again horrible timing.

For the hype I heard about this place, the steak was definitely no where near the quality I have had elsewhere, and the service was extremely poor.  I really was surprised how the evening went considering this was all planned out in advance with the restaurant.

2 stars, definitely much better steakhouses than this in SF and the greater bay area.

The song of the review is by The Flock of Seagulls, "I ran", unfortunately it's away.
author: Jay G.

description:
OMG the best meal we had in this SF trip!
The crab  was so flavorful, unlike any other we had before! BF ordered the bone in filet mignon based on recommendation. It was very tender & delicious too! Wish my stomach was bigger!!
author: Elaine C.

description: Came here for my 10 year anniversary and had a reservation for a Sunday night.  It's a cute little unique building but the lighting is a little dark.  We were seated right away.  Me and my date ordered a bone-in prime rib each, mac and cheese, creamed spinach, baked potato, brussel sprouts and the mussels and shrimp platter.  The service was great and I liked the ambiance.  It was quiet and intimate.  The mussels and shrimp came on a sizzling platter and it was amazing!!  It comes w/a caper, lemon butter sauce and super yummy!  The prime rib was soooo huge that I had more than enough to have steak and eggs the next day.  It was cooked perfectly medium rare and good.  The sides were all pretty good but came al carte so it was a little pricey ($9.99/side).  Overall it was a great experience and I definitely want to try the mixed seafood platter w/crab, mussels and shrimp next time.  They also gave us a little plate w/ice cream and candles for our special night.  It was a cute touch.
author: Honey S.

description:
3/19/18: 7:00 reservations for two
"Basil Martini", really great
1/2 order "Mussels", to die for
(Preparation perfect), 9oz. Filet
Very good (ordered Medium Rare),
But was just too rare, but extremely tasty, still enjoyable, mac & cheese  with crab, especially delicious 
We will definitely return 
Love the ambience & bar so cool
author: Judy K.

description:
During our trip to the bay we decided to have dinner here. A small yet enticing restaurant. Filled with lavish curtains. Scary yet intriguing paintings of jesters and dark red walls. This place can be a little frightening. Haha 

Upon arrival we were seated quickly. Since it was our first visit our server explained the menu and gave recommendations. I decided on the bone in fillet. While my wife had the bone in New York. For sides we decided on the sweet potatoes and portobello mushrooms. 

Both steaks were incredible. Very flavorful and moist. Nice char on the outside. Every bite was pure heaven. Maybe I'm being over the top. But I throughly enjoyed it. The sides were fantastic. Sweet potatoes well seasoned. Portobello mushroom sautéed perfectly. Combined with the steak was I unforgettable. 

Service was excellent. All employees were welcoming. Our waiter checked on us regularly. Great place and highly recommend anyone to visit.
author: Paul S.

description: Used to go here all the time. I would of rated this place 5 stars historically.. sadly it ain't what it used to be..  I came here w 3 people and we had a reservation.  They made us wait 45 minutes on top of our set reservation...  when we asked to just use the bar area table instead- the manager set us up for disaster...  we got our app.  Main course never came for 30 plus min. We finally gave up and the sad manager realized how fucked his decisions were..  F minus for this place under the current mgmt.
author: Jared T.

description:
It looks like a welcoming neighborhood restaurant.  We were excited to try it since it is close to our son's apartment. Vodka Gimlet was ordered with "light on the Roses Lime," but it was too sweet.  Too much Roses lime juice.
For dinner we ordered Brussels sprouts, two fish specials, and onion rings.  The service was slow.  When the food arrived, it was drowning in oil.  My son's plate was full of oil after he ate the fish.  The vegetables were full of oil too.  Mushy Brussels sprouts.  We all felt sick after we left.  Sorry.  It was a Monday night and maybe a substitute cook was in that night.  Very disappointing.
author: Leslie G.

description:
Dodged a Bullet

I drive by Bobo's every day to/from work on a touristy part of Lombard street, but recently saw it featured on "Check Please Bay Area" and it sounded really great and a locals' hangout. So we booked a table for last night at 7:00.

After a schedule change, we showed up 45 minutes early figuring it would either be packed and we could have drinks at the bar while we waited, or it would be early enough to snare an empty table.

Got there and the bar area was full, but the two main dining rooms had a single table occupied in each room. The hostess wanted us to sit at a table literally 6 inches from the other couple in a completely empty room of tables. When we asked if we could have a more private seat, the hostess said "not till 7:00."

We tried a few times to point out other options but she refused until our reservation time of 7:00PM, so we walked out. Her response in a snarky tone: "I take it that's a no?" We said "correct." and she just said happily "well, good by."

The hostess then listed us as a no-show on Open Table, so I just came here to correct that and add - we are big tippers, usually order cocktails and an expensive bottle of wine with dinner, enjoy great steaks, and sides, and with a baby sitter in Marin - would not have hogged the earlier table and probably opened up one more cover for them in the process. Hire nicer hosts who can help make an experience wonderful not awkward sitting up against some other table and skip the snooty attitude. There was no reason to treat anyone this way, especially people who arrived eager and happy to sample this restaurant.
author: Alice H.

description:
I can't say enough good about this place!! I have been here a couple of times and the burgers have been absolutely delicious!! The drink specials are well-priced. And the fries are absolutely delicious! Tender, juicy, and beyond satisfying. The bun was light and crisp on the edges--the perfect crunch. 
Absolute perfection. 
I will definitely be returning!
author: Lindy M.

description: I ordered the half crab (1lb), however I should've ordered the full crab because I was left a little hungry after. Also the crab was hard to eat, you really do get messy and have to work for your food. Nonetheless, it was extremely tasty, full of butter and garlic. My date ordered the filet mignon (9 oz.) medium rare and loved every bite of it. It had a tasty and crunchy outside with a perfectly cooked and tender middle. He was very full afterwards. Sort of pricey, but I want to say it was worth it!
author: Kierra W.

description: Food was amazing. Hubs and I split the full crab and bone in filet. We couldn't have chosen better options! Our service was fantastic, Khalid was phenomenal. He was friendly, quick, and knew the timing of service. My husband and I were there to enjoy an evening of conversation and tasty food. That is exactly what we got! We never felt rushed or that things took too long. Our wine pairings were perfect and the steak was cooked to perfection!
author: Kelsy H.

description: My youngest daughter(25) took me here for my 56th birthday! I haven't been here since I was a young person. This is like the House of Prime Rib. Both are old San Francisco mainstays. New restaurants coming and go. BoBo's is here to stay.  Small, quaint, comfortable place. Folks come from all over the world to visit and indulge in the finest crab,mussels and double shrimp! The meat is not shabby either. The service is excellent! Free valet parking in San Francisco..a freaking plus. Its costly but heck it's my birthday dinner.. life is short and so is crab season.
author: Jacy H.

description:
I took my friend out for his Bday and decided to try Bobo's, first off we were seated upstairs next to the door on a windy day... it was ruined the experience as soon as we asked to have it shut someone else would open it. It made our meal cold & I wish I would have sat else where. 

The food would have been better hot & me more comfortable had I not been cold. The service lady was very nice though.

I'm 50/50 on trying it again.
author: mini m.

description:
Great service and a nice piece of meat! Great classic SF spot to get a steak. 

We got the jumbo bone in fillet and twice baked potato. One meal was enough to split.
author: Evan S.

description:
Food:
-Bone In Filet Mignon - The steak was definitely good and tender.  The only thing is that it wasn't the steak that melted in your mouth.
-Double Baked Potato - Pretty tasty and had a few toppings on it.
-Brussels Sprouts - Was decent with some good flavor

Service:  Very attentive waitstaff and friendly.

Ambiance:  The decor is definitely very different.  Pretty interesting as it mimics something you would see in New Orleans.  Also it's pretty big as it's about 3 stories high.

Overall:  Solid Steak with some good toppings.
author: Spencer Q.

description: The food was excellent and so was the service!! The steak melted in your mouth. The crab, mussels and shrimp so good!!! We will be coming back soon.
author: G S.

description:
I got the filet mignon, crab, swiss chard and other items on the table were bone in rib eye, modern mac n cheese, mushrooms, and twice baked potato and everything is delicious. 

Service is excellent!
author: Mary M.

description: Went here with a group of friends for dinner. The staff was really unprofessional. My friends and I ordered drinks and the top of the line menu items. The food came out good, but the service was awful. The waiter was really rude and not attentive at all. Our bill was $300 and we attempted to split it 4 ways. They did not accept my card do to not having a chip, so my friend offered to use her card again. The waiter ended up charging the entire dinner twice on her card. They stated the charges would be voided, and the manager Luca said everything would be taking care of. The charges have not been reimbursed and the mgr is no longer with the company. Needless to say they are a complete rip off and don't value their customers. Will not return and don't recommend this place if you are looking to enjoy a nice meal and paying your hard earned money save yourself the experience and dine elsewhere.
author: Erica P.

description:
Overrated to say the least.  Had better beef at places that didn't even claim dry aged.  I expect something pretty glorious for a fifty dollar NY strip.  Dry aged beef should melt in your mouth, not need to be gnawed on.  At least sear it right if you're going to charge me so much for a substandard piece of beef.  Looked like they had attempted to sear it in a nonstick pan.  How anyone has the nerve to say they specialize in steak and serve something like that is beyond me. 

Beyond the sub par food, the service was insulting.  They sat me and my group upstairs as physically far away from any exit as they could and made several comments during our meal about if we were sure we wanted to order THAT bottle of wine, etc.  Pretty transparent in their motives.
