The fact that I have tattoos and am under sixty doesn't mean you get to presume that my friends or I are dishonest and will run out on the tab.

In summary, next time my friends and I are in SF and decide to drop close to five bills on a special occasion, it sure as hell won't be here.  Go elsewhere if you're looking for steak and to be treated with respect.
author: Ryan C.

description: We had a great birthday celebration dinner here when we were visiting from out of town. However, we left behind an item and when I called the restaurant to confirm, I was told that yes they have it but they won't mail it to me.
author: Melinda K.

description: I always love this place! Great steaks, seafood and drinks. Their sides are delicious and amazing
author: Ricardo R.

description:
Visiting San Francisco with my sons .... yelp has good reviews on this place. .... it's a disappointment. We ordered double mussels and shrimps. The shrimps was dry and over cooked the mussels were spoiled / rotten. It stinks so bad. I had to returned it and they gave us back double over cooked tiny shrimps and still charged $40. 
The steaks are tiny and over priced. My youngest son ordered NY NY bone in 22 oz the same size as 16 oz that my other son ordered for $69 what ????
My filet  mignon 9 oz was alright, nothing special and of course its over priced too. Don't mind paying $310 for the dinner if it was worth it. 
Not to mention the place was old  and unkept   The floor was filthy and the decors were out of this world. The place is horrible. Will never come back and will never recommend to anybody 

, 
Will not recommend this place.
author: flor n.

description:
Cool place. Rude hostess. The food was average, except for the steak, that was worth 4 stars. 

There are better places in the area, but wasn't bad.
author: Rick G.

description:
This was my second time here , and the food honestly has been wonderful. i really can't complain much on that. the twice baked potato is honestly something i highly recommended  BOMB AF ! lol 

H O W E V E R , our service was horrible. i wouldn't even know how to explain it. we got our drinks , order our food , and maybe saw our server once... i mean we considered walking out the service was so horrible. what does that tell yah (all jokes - never ever would i do that)
author: Silvia R.

description: In a word, disappointing.  One would think that if steaks are the signature dish they would get it right the first time.  Filet came out rare when spouse asked for well done and no apologies.  At $52 for a bone in filet and $10 for a potato, expectations were much higher and had heard good things.  On the flip side, charming French ambience, but with an attitude that was not so much.
author: Roy A.

description:
I have been to Bobo's several times and have been more than satisfied with every dining experience. Most recently, we had our wedding reception here and I cannot speak highly enough about Jim and Robert and, of course, the appetizing food. Jim, the manager, was accommodating and helpful in meeting our needs. We met with him to check out the space and to go over the details such as time and parking.

Our guests loved the food and so did we. They have a good red wine selection which went nicely with the meal. Robert was our waiter the first time we dined at Bobo's together and we specifically asked for him to be our server. He was not scheduled to work that day, but he came in because we asked. Thanks a billion to Jim and Robert and the rest of the staff for all of your hard work and hospitality on our special day!

We hope to make it a tradition of returning to Bobo's to celebrate our anniversary and whenever else we can.

Recommend:
- Bone-in Filet Mignon
- Porterhouse
- Dungeness Crab
- Twice Baked Potato
- Brussel Sprouts
- Yellowtail Carpaccio
- Crispy Crab Cakes
- Apples, Walnuts, Sundried Cranberries Salad
- Dunce Cap Cones
author: Christina M.

description:
Heard a lot of good things about this place so we had to try it out. A little bit of a different vibe from other steakhouses that my bf and I have been to but food didn't disappoint us. I'm not exactly sure how to describe the decors and the vibe... it was a bit creepy with the red walls, and weird paintings on the wall. 

Because of our friends recommendation, we made sure to try the mussel and shrimp. There was sadly a mistake so they brought out only the mussels the first time and when I mentioned it to the server asking where our shrimp was, he apologized and brought out shrimp, but it was only like 4 pieces :( my guess is that they gave us full size of mussels and reduced the amount of shrimp. Anyway, mussels were delicious. Imagine a very soft mussels soaked in the buttery garlicky dipping sauce melting in your mouth. Mmmmm~ however, although I'm a huge fan of seafood so I love all kinds but shrimps unfortunately didn't meet up to my expectations. There wasn't anything special to it. And it was very salty. 

Some of the other things we ordered were:
-CRAB CAKES: decent. Skip next time. 
-FILET MIGNON: ordered a medium rare but received medium well--it ended up being a little more chewy and cooked than I wanted it to, but it was still very delicious and juicy.
-BONE-IN FILET MIGNON w/ HALF CRAB: ordered medium well but received medium rare. Juiced, and very tender. Half a crab had lots of meat attached.


Overall, I enjoyed everything. Our waiter was very kind but he unfortunately messed up on a lot of the items we ordered and it was sometimes difficult to grab his attention. 

If I were to ever come back, I think I'll go all for seafood next time.
author: Elaine C.

description: This steakhouse was recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. We came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday! If you don't mind spending a little extra for a delicious aged steak, then I highly recommend coming here! Everything was delicious and juicy and the service was great!
author: Keisha K.

description: This was the Best Steak Ever! I though it was a bunch of Hype..etc. It truly is Exceptional. The Staff is A1. My friends ordered Mac & Cheese. Since I was paying for it thought WHY? I tried some & I said OMG!  I would order it again. Everything was Outstanding! I like my Steak rare but I suggest medium rare.
author: Sparky W.

description: I just walked in without a reservation and was lucky to get a bar seat which are first come first serve, appetizers includes crab cakes and crab crostini, super delicious, in comes the bone in Filet Mignon, finished everything and was praised for it by the sever, he was super nice. This place was packed on a Friday night and I was more than happy with my dinner. An experience which will make me smile everytime O think of it.
author: Udyatbhanu B.

description:
This place was very cool. I like the decor. Great filet mignon and the wedge salad, twice baked potato and the macaroni and cheese were very good.
I must say, the broiled shrimp was not good at all and didn't taste fresh so it left a bad taste in my mouth. Also strange to not have the shrimp pealed when they are so small and it's a messy job!

If they had better seafood, I would probably have wanted to return
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for an early dinner. The restaurant was extremely quiet and the tables seemed like it was all packed tightly together. I actually had a very hard time getting inside my seat because the table was placed way too close to the wall. There was a weird curtain right against our table to separate us from the next table. Nonetheless, I felt as if it was way too packed together. I could literally hear the whole conversation of the table right next to us since it was just a curtain dividing us. 

My boyfriend ordered the surf and turf, which consisted of bone in filet minon and half a crab. I got the bone in filet mignon with a side of mod mac and the twice baked potato. Overall I wasn't too impressed with the filet mignon. I didn't think there was anything special about the flavor or piece of meat at all. The mod mac wasn't great either. I felt like there was something off about it. It wasn't super cheesy and didn't taste like much other than maybe peppers. The only thing I really enjoyed about the meal with the twice baked potato. That was probably the best thing I ate all night. It was cheesy and had a lot of flavor considering the way it was made. For dessert we had the mango panna cotta and that was also good.
author: Annie H.

description:
I don't even know where to begin with this place. First, when walking in, it has a cool harlequin theme with dark red velvet booths and random mannequins as decorations. I knew exactly what I wanted coming in and we didn't waste any time in ordering. We got the bone in filet minon (medium), half crab, mac and cheese, brussel sprouts, and twice baked potato. The filet minon was cooked perfectly. It was super tender, seared on the outside and had light seasoning so it totally highlighted the flavor of the steak. I like the medium pieces and the BF likes it a little more rare which is what you get closer to the bone. This was definitely a winning choice. The crab was really good as well. It was fresh, plump, juicy and whatever dipping sauce it came with was so addicting. Definitely another win. Sadly, all the sides were just okay though. The mac and cheese was just mac and cheese, the brussel sprouts was just brussel sprouts and the potato tasted like a potato with a few things on top. I wasn't super impressed by any of it.

Overall though, it was a great meal and I was super satisfied with what I came for. The service was great as well and they also do free valet parking! I would definitely come back if I ever hit the jackpot as this meal was not cheap.
author: Sophia Y.

description: The steak was OK as in TX Roadhouse can do better and for the price this place is really not worth it.  The crab wasn't good.
author: Craig E.

description: This place smelled like a mixture of athletes foot and Asiago cheese. They sat us in this tiny musty room. So uncomfortable! Had to leave before I threw up. On my way out the door the server gave me and fiancé a dirty look or idk maybe it was just the scent of the place hitting her
author: Ashtar B.

description: Made a reservation for my wife's birthday.  When we arrived, we were seated right away. The waitress (Elsae)was nice when she seated us,  but turned a complete 180 when we told her we wanted to have a few drinks before we ordered food. She had a really bad attitude the whole time we were there. My wife and I even tried to ease the tension with small talk and jokes but she wasn't having it! We emailed the restaurant directly to let them know our experience but they never responded. The food was fair but was overshadowed by the rude/unwelcoming service.
author: Rene O.

description: so so so good! I really like the crab! if I have time I will come again, but I have to leave San Francisco!
author: Jever L.

description: Came here for a date night and will most definitely return. The ambiance is old San Francisco and is absolutely fantastic. The service staff are impeccably trained and don't even get me started on the steaks! You go to BoBos specifically for the filet mignon and you will absolutely not be disappointed. You should also try the crab cakes and the the yams on the side. They were perfection!
author: Gwendolyn B.

description: One of my favorite steak houses. Good service. Valet parking is a plus. I always get the mussels and shrimp to start but I also love the crab cakes and the carpaccio. I love the bone in filet but I've also had the petit filet and I'm happy with either one.
author: Denise A.

description: Came here on a Monday around 5:20 and got seated right away. It's pretty dim inside. We got seated on the three floor and FYI valet is free. We started with the House salad. I thought it could have use a lot more dressing. I could barely taste the vinaigrette. After the waiter had saw we finished our salad he brought out our Brussels sprouts, baked potatoes, Bone in rib eyes, and mussels and shrimp. Love all the dishes except the bone in rib eye. It was good but not the best I've had. I thought it could have been cooked a little bit longer. The mussels was my absolute favorite. I don't know if it was in season but the mussels were huge inside and so juicy!
author: Tram T.

description:
Love just about everything about this place!

Cute bar area - great Pinot Noir from Napa and good bartender: made a good Moscow Mule ... pleasant hostess seated us promptly with our 9:15 pm reservation.  

Waiter seemed good and my food was excellent - it was after 9:30 so I kept it lower carb and just ordered the 9-oz filet Mignon and a side of mashed yams to share with the table.  

The filet was absolutely heavenly - perfectly cooked and buttery. I could have eaten another 9 oz! Yams were delicious!  A perfect pairing.

My Guy liked his mac & cheese with shrimp and Caesar salad and my friends guy liked his 16 oz bone-in filet and salad with salmon (although sort of a weird side bar ... it was a smoked salmon versus a cooked fillet of salmon and I don't think the menu specified [I think it just said add Salmon to your salad] so I thought it was a bit weird she got a salad that was completely covered in thinly sliced smoked salmon - I would've sent it back if it were me but she seemed to power through it). 

The French waiter we had seemed a little too eager to get out of there and he forgot to bring bread, which my guests mentioned, and then there was no butter or olive oil to go with it.  

Considering they were taking dinner reservations through 10:15 PM I didn't think that sitting there at 10:30, still talking, would be a big deal but it really seem like they wanted us out of there ... so much so that they tried to clear our entire table and never brought water refills or ask if we needed anything as soon as they drop the check ...  that's the only reason they didn't get five stars. The service and the vibe - if it's off - will kill a perfect review every time.
author: Darlene C.

description:
I remember this place being a lot better. I mean, the food is good but not amazing. I had the filet and our table also shared the shrimp and mussels. I thought the shrimp seemed smaller and the mussels were meh. It was good with the butter dip. 

Service is fine and they offer complimentary valet parking which is nice since there is barely any street parking. 

This was my third time coming here ever, probably won't come back. I just feel like there's other places with similar menus that are worth going to than Bobo's.
author: Francesca N.

description:
This is by far the best seafood and steak restaurant I have visited. Normally one is better than the other however Bobo's seafood and steak was exquisite. I had the Combo Mussels, Shrimp & Crab sizzling platter and my husband had Bone- In Filet Mignon. In addition, we had a twice baked potato and Brussel sprouts sides. Everything at this establishment is on the large side and can be shared.

When the platter arrived they poured white wine over the seafood and it sizzled with a puff of fragranced aroma that filled the air with garlic, butter and wine. Every morsel was perfectly seasoned and well balanced I didn't even need the drawn butter for dipping. This dish was perfect and amazing.

My husband's steak was so tender and moist it just melted in my mouth. We didn't even need a steak knife to cut it. Best steak I have ever eaten. It was large and worth every penny.

Lastly the sides were so so good. You must try the twice baked potato and Brussel sprouts. I wish we had a Bobo's in San Diego however this will give me an excuse to return to San Francisco.
author: Deborah S.

description: Came in and our server Ian was amazing. He guided us to ordering the bone in fillets, they literally melted in your mouth. We sat in a comfortable booth and showed up at just the right time. It made my birthday experience one to remember. If you want a lovely birthday, ask for Ian as your server!  He knows just what to order to make your experience perfect, everything was as smooth as it gets.  I am going to recommend all my friends birthdays come here. Best Birthday Restaurant in the city. they really take care of your special occasion.  The atmosphere is amazing.  Don't waste your money somewhere else.  Well worth it!
author: Vanessa C.

description: This place is SOOOOO good. Steak was cooked perfectly (Rib Eye ) ordered the crab for two who was AMAZING!!! Ordered long islands ice teas/ wine. Sides were onion rings and double baked potato all super delish. Now the place ia pricey but so worth the $$$.
author: Gloria M.

description: Great steaks, sea food and service. Coming from Chicago, was a little hesitant about ordering steak but it was terrific. The filet was done to perfection and "like butter." We'll be back.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I've been meaning to try this local steakhouse for awhile and finally go the chance the other night.    Yes this place is definitely quirky from the location on busy Lombard to the loud front sign.  The front entrance is a bit awkward with the bar right at the door but the greeter was friendly and led us to a quiet well lit room 2 floors up.   The 'booth' for the 2 of us felt a bit cramped and the hard wood seats (at 90 degrees) was not the most comfortable for a long dinner.   The server was extremely friendly and attentive but she shredded our cork opening the wine and then spilled some of the wine on the white tablecloth while straining out pieces of cork into a decanter and we dined the rest of the evening with large red splotches.
We started with the mussels and they were perfectly done with generous portions and I was a big fan!    The crab bisque soup was pretty good but if a tad salty.   I ordered the bone in filet medium rare and they came shaped round and very thick looking impressive.   However this is where the biggest disappointment happens.   The filet had little flavor and the center was a bit cold (temperature).   It looked like it was cooked medium rare so maybe it was sitting for awhile waiting for us to finish our other courses.   I'm not sure.   Whatever the cause was I did not enjoy the steak.    In retrospect I should have asked the steak to be reheated but then it could have become almost medium.   I recently had a bone in filet at a different steakhouse in the city and it was perfectly done and flavored leaving me craving more.  Unfortunately this was not the case this time.   I wanted to like this place despite the quirks but enjoying the steak is the most important aspect of going to a steakhouse.
author: John P.

description: My went to this place for Mother's Day & We Want want the left over steak and fish and the seafood to take home. He just give us the seafood also the paper bag seem like chew by a mouse or something.i think I won't go back
author: gloria y.

description:
Came in early  at 7:30 with the almost-wifey, reservations at 8. They accommodated us at a table that she didn't like. It took an extra 15 minutes to get the new table. When we sat it took another ten for the waiter to arrive. The time wait mixed with the cheesy atmosphere dropped this place to a 3.5. There were pictures of clowns in foyer!

We put in our order and looked at the steaks at the coupe beside us. Beautiful but small. That's why I went with the super in-bone fillet minion, 20oz ($66).  The lady had the 9 oz and we had the Brussels sprouts and twice baked potatoe with a bottle of merlot.

The food came out and looked amazing. This place isn't well lit (a good thing) which means that pictures don't do this place justice. I doubted that bobo could cook a 20!oz steak to perfection but maybe that's why he's a jester. The joke was on me! As soon as I bit into my steak I knew this was the perfect rush. I've now quit my cocaine/heroine/meth habit; my new addiction is bobos. The double baked potatoe had cheese infused throughout the whole spud. The Brussels sprouts has bacon and Parmesan. The best food combination. This is the best steak house in San Francisco! Trust

At the end our server Teo gave us a free dessert chocolate mouse in a waffle cone. 

The side table entertainment was amazing. There was an old guy here who was wining and dining his Thai fuck boy here. It was like Jack Welch and Lloyd from entourage had a tinder date in the Marina. Better than reality television on vh1. 

%20 tip
author: Johny B.

description:
Your business is only as good as your weakest link...Robert is your weakest link.

The steak, the crab, the sides, and the drinks were great. 

However, this restaurant doesn't get a one star because of the food. It gets a one star because Robert was a smart ass that left a bad taste in our mouth. When asked about portion sizes and whether or not they would be appropriate for our group he stated, "Well, I wouldn't know. I don't know how much you can eat." with a grin on his face. He continued on after we asked him more about it and refused to give us any sort of indication about portion size. He couldn't dare give any sort of advice to first time diners at this restaurant. Just tell us in your best opinion whether or not it will work for us. Make a guess. Take a stab at it. 

We continue with our order and move on to entrees. On the menu, it clearly suggests that the steaks should be cooked medium rare. Robert asks us for the cook of our steaks, "how would you like that cooked, medium rare?" Sounds great to us, we will all have ours that way. However, one of the ladies in our group decides that she doesn't want the steak that rare and would like it medium. We get his attention and she asks for the steak medium. "That's already what I wrote down? 3 medium filet mignons and one medium rare bone-in New York." Nope. That's not what we ordered and we all knew it. Yet again, he absolutely insisted that he wrote it down and heard it correctly, yet again with a smug smart ass tone in his voice. 

By the way, Robert, my New York came out medium to medium well. Hardly any pink on the inside, but I didn't dare mention it to you in fear of you coming up with some "holier-than-thou" response from you about how it's cooked perfectly.

Robert, if it were up to me, you would have been lucky to receive even a penny for gratuity from me but luckily our gracious hosts had decided otherwise. Even the best tasting steak in the world could not have compensated for the smart-alec tone you had in your voice all night. I refuse to give this business any more than one star and if I were able to, I would give them zero. 

Service is key in a city with a hundred restaurants...JUST...LIKE...YOURS.

If you want great crab (and probably great steak), great service and a great view go to the Crab House at Pier 39. I've never been disappointed there and doubt you would be either.
author: Jeong C.

description: This was a great steakhouse. Great service! Great food! Def get the NY bone in strip cooked medium! Savory and cooked perfectly! The mushrooms was a really nice complement to the NY strip! We will definitely come back!
author: Bryan F.

description: Absolutely awful service. We experienced better from the valet than we did our server. We ordered an appetizer of crab cakes, and our steaks came out first- by a runner. Once we let him know that we had ordered an appetizer he stuttered an excuse and went to the kitchen. Shortly later our appetizer came out- which was good by the way- our server brought it. When questioned about the steaks that had come to us, he did not apologize; he said the runner was "new", that the steaks went to a different table, and walked away. Then after- TOO soon after, our steaks came out. How do I know too soon? Because I have been in the service industry for 6 years and know how courses are timed. So not only were THE SAME steaks brought out from previously, but our server lied and gave no apology. Our server was hardly able to be found even though we were sat at a horrible table right In front of the service station/computer. It was almost appalling how he figured out so many ways to ignore us in such a small setting. He had 3 other tables. It was not busy. I was shocked with the blatant lying, the inconsideration, and the cramped, tacky atmosphere. The only saving grace was the food. It was lovely- albeit being lied too about the steak. For the money- do not come here. I have given better service in my time, and have received better service by a Dutch Bro's coffee barista.
author: Rachael V.

description:
After years of singing the praises here I don't think that I'll be back.  Came in on Saturday night for my birthday. Drinks at the bar were fine if a bit boring.

The biggest problem was the food and service.

Steak came out nearly raw (like the fat wasn't rendered and it was cool on the inside) and sliced terribly. For $65 this is inexcusable.  When we told our server that the steak was way undercooked and that the brussel sprouts were completely mushy and luke warm she flipped an attitude and took the food back... the kitchen the hate cooked the steak into leather and gave us another plate of sprouts that were just as terrible.

The GM gave us a half hearted 'sorry about the steak' but there was no saving this disaster.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Years ago, I dined at Boboquivari's for the first time. My filet mignon was juicy, tender, and cut like butter. A few years after that, it was still excellent, but not quite as amazing as I remembered. But is anything ever as wonderful as the first time? It was still a very delicious steak. So good that I chose to eat here the night before I had my wisdom teeth pulled. It is always a good idea to have steak if you're told you may experience reduced ability to eat solid foods. 

I was running late for our reservation, but thank goodness for complimentary valet. That saved us a few minutes. Positioned on a sloping hill, Bobo's looks like a traditional steakhouse from the outside. Inside is pretty funky. Apparently...
Boboquivari: venetian court jester of comedy, embodied in a popular Italian marionette
Hmm... but what does that have to do with steak? I could appreciate the unique theme they've got going on. But, on my way to the restroom, I turned my head and my eyes unexpectedly landed on one of the stern-faced jester paintings and freaked myself out a little. Yet, the masks and the tilted picture frames are intriguing. Plus, the curtained booths were definitely a nice touch.

Bread - delicious, fluffy, pull-apart loaf, lightly toasted, drizzled with olive oil, golden brown on top

Filet Mignon - Like I mentioned, the steak was juicy and delicious. My knife slid through it almost like spreadable butter. It was springy and buoyant as I pressed against it with my fork. The outside was nicely seared to a brown crust, pink on the inside, with meat juices still flowing. 
The price points are pretty reasonable. A petite filet is about $40 for 8 ounces, a little more than the typical 6 ounces. The bone-in options are great for people who are partial to the flavor of meat on the bone.

Combo Mussels, Shrimp & 1/2 Crab ($49.95) -
Since I had their steak before, I wanted to try their sea animals. I believe it comes with clarified butter and lemon garlic sauce. 
My eyes were bigger than my stomach, because this hot skillet was clearly meant to be shared. The crab and mussels were very sweet and tender. The shrimp was tasting a little oily and the shells were soft and translucent. It was great, but probably better to stick to their steaks.

Twice-Baked Potato (~$9) stuffed with zucchini, chives, fontina cheese -
Creamy and cheesy, not chalky like a lot of baked potatoes. Twice-baked is the way to go as the skin on the outside was nice and crisp. It was drizzled with sour cream on top that added a mildly creamy tart flavor. I couldn't really taste the zucchini embedded in the potato, but I appreciate that it's in there.

I'd still come back for another awesome steak, maybe ribeye next time.
author: Joy W.

description: Visiting San Francisco for business and pleasure. A local recommended Bobo's for dinner. So glad we listened. We made a reservation and were seated immediately. Had some cocktails then ordered dinner. Husband got the filet which was awesome. I ordered the mussels and shrimp. It was excellent. Fun place, lots of red. The staff is incredible. Really attentive and happy. Management is very involved to make sure everything is running smoothly.  I got the Brussels sprouts, H got the twice baked potato. We had the strawberry cheesecake dessert which was good, not great. High dollar dinner ($200), the room was very loud which was hard on these old lady ears. But everyone was having such fun so it was infectious. Highly recommend.
author: Jenny S.

description:
I REALLY wanted to love this place. I really did. 

I was so excited to hear that my boyfriend made dinner reservations at Bobo's for my birthday this year. To make sure there weren't any issues, my boyfriend and I called them a few days before our dinner to make sure our reservations were in their system. The lady who answered was kind and helpful and told us our reservations were indeed there for Sunday night. 

However, when we arrived on Sunday, the hostess told us that they didn't have our reservations and asked us to wait so they can see if there were any tables to seat us. Not necessarily sure what happened between that, but we weren't upset and it gave us the opportunity to sit at the bar while we waited. The bar is quite small but had a decent selection of cocktail drinks, wines, and liquor. 

After being seated, my boyfriend asked for a bottle of sparkling water and I ordered a drink at the bar which still didn't arrive by the time we got seated. The place wasn't packed, but there were a few tables occupied in our section of the restaurant. Our waitress didn't seem that all excited to serve us and we only saw her during the time we ordered our food and when we asked for the dessert menu. The plates were cleared and waters were filled up by another person to all the tables in our section.

My boyfriend and I decided to go for the Mussels & Shrimp combo to start. Boy, let me tell you , it was delicious! It was probably the only thing that made me want to consider coming back to Bobo's again. I had the Bone-in Filet and my boyfriend had the Bone-in NY Steak. We also ordered brussel sprouts and the twice baked potatoes as our sides.

Our food arrived at a reasonable time, but for the quality in the price you pay for the steak and sides, I was a bit disappointed. The brussel sprouts had no flavor or seasoning whatsoever and I took a bite of the bread and opt out because it was so hard to chew. The steaks were just...okay. It wasn't anything spectacular, and not to downgrade my (awesome) boyfriend's cooking whatsoever, but even HE can cook a meaner steak at home than what we had. With the steaks claiming to be dry-aged for 4-6 weeks, I would imagine a better tasting steak. The variety of steaks offered here aren't as much as other steakhouses which is also a bummer. 

For what the meal cost, I would rather go to the many steakhouses SF has to offer before coming to this one.
author: Victoria K.

description: Let me first say the servers here are wonderful. Maybe a little too attentive. I sat in the bar and there were 4-5 of them standing around in this tiny bar. Every time I looked up from my food one of them came running over haha :) but it was empty, so I don't really blame them, but I did feel a little self conscience. The food: delicious shrimp and cauliflower with parm. To-die-for olive bread!
author: Lisa S.

description:
Finally went here for the first time with a friend. This restaurant has a very odd layout -- you walk in the door, there's a small bar area to your left, and you walk up a short flight of stairs to get to a small dining room that faces the street. The tables are really jammed together, so if you get a lot of people in this room it gets very loud and stuffy. 

The food was near excellent. We shared the mussels and they were amazing. The Portobello mushrooms side dish was delicious as well. I asked for my filet mignon to be cooked medium, and I think it was a tad overcooked, but the meat was very good quality. The only thing I would pass on next time was the house salad. It wasn't anything special and was just iceberg covered in dressing. Service overall is quite good. 

One thing worth mentioning: FREE valet. Glad I didn't pay for a ride.
author: Lori M.

description:
The temperature of the restaurant was hotter than outside.
Not sure if the prices were justifiable to the comfort.
I thought the point of a restaurant was to provide a comfortable eating environment for your guests.

Our bone-in New York steak was over cooked.
If it were not for our waiter, Robert and the bone-in filet mignon, it would have gotten one star.

If you do decide to eat here, be sure to do it on a cold day outside.
author: Joseph R.

description:
A long and overdue review!

A friend of mine, now my girlfriend, took me here for my birthday dinner. This was back in May. She made the reservations and I'm glad she did!

We got to the restaurant about fifth-teen minutes early. The bar area was where we patiently waited until our scheduled reservation time. We were seated promptly by the hostess and given our menus. A bread basket was given for us to nibble on. We started off by ordering our drinks. A bottle of the 2012 Stuhlmuller vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon was our beverage of choice. 

Out of the many appetizer choices, the steak tare tare caught our eyes. We never had it and wanted to try it. The appetizer was something different. I don't usually eat raw meat, but this was pretty tasty. Mixed with raw quail egg and cured with salt and seasonings. Accompanied with toast bread chips, this was a great tasting appetizer.  

For my main course, I got an order of the Porterhouse. The Porterhouse includes a two pieces of meat: New York steak and petit filet mignon. Both were cooked a medium rare, as I requested. The meats were very juicy and tender. As I cut through them, it just melts like butter. We did order a side of mod mac and cheese. It did compliment our entrees well. 

I know that this is a very late review, but I did really enjoy my birthday experience here.
author: Jay G.

description: The food was good, but the waiter had an attitude problem almost like he didn't want serve me and the other guest I dined with. The waiter told my group we should've went to Burger King the staff ruined my visit not very interested in going again
author: William L.

description:
Hands down the best steak in the city -the Bone-in that is. Don't waste your time on any other cut but this. It's their staple, and it shows. 
My fiancee and I have been coming here for the past 5-6 years (usually about 2 times per year -it gets expensive) and we always leave happy, full, satisfied & looking forward to our next visit. The vibe inside the restaurant is always fun, thought the wait staff can be a bit tardy sometimes -so slow your roll, and enjoy your time here. You'll end up loving it!
author: Mike P.

description: Back to Bobo's!  Pan-roasted mussels and shrimp with a side of Brussels sprouts was just the ticket. There were enough sprouts to take home for another meal (reheated the next evening they were even more tasty). The Acme bread served as a sublime "mop" for the delicious pan juices (no seafood morsels left, I licked the platter clean!) J. C. chose the prefect wine for me from Hietz vineyards and for the second time made my visit enjoyable. Unless you're with a large party, I recommend sitting at the bar. It's cozy and a great place to people watch.
author: Cris W.

description: Ok. I have to say. The price matched the product. Steak was cooked to perfection. And absolutely fantastic. Service was the same. Skip Morton's. Just go straight to perfection.
author: Michael O.

description:
I'm baaaaaaaack! 

My baby turned 18. Figuring out where to take her for family dinner wasn't as difficult as it has been in previous years because the amazing 5 star dinner I had a little over a month ago was still on my mind. 

Filet - beautiful seared "crust", tender 6 week aged beef. 

Wine glass filled, Diet Coke and Shirley Temple refills always came before having to ask.  

Carafe of hot coffee left on the table in case we need a refil faster than Sergio could come. 

To go: individually boxed items, my leftover plus new garlic bread was in the bag! (listen, I come from "don't waste anything" school of thought so I wasn't going to toss the delicious leftover bread that could easily transition to breadcrumbs.) 

Sergio would be great at training new servers and seasoned servers  struggling with diner retention and tips. I wish all servers were as efficient, professional, thoughtful, and friendly as he is. 

Bobo's meal? 100% Perfection. This restaurant is a credit to my beloved hometown. 

Bravo, Well done! 

P.S. Bobo's lounge a little up the street offers whole fish entree that I spied ...who's in? Let's go try it before the New Year! My birthday maybe?
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
[+] Bone-in Filet is soooo good.
[+] Service from the server was really good. They kept coming to check on us.
[+] Mussels are a must.
[+] Romantic Ambiance - dark 
[+] Three-Story restaurant
[+] Side: Brussel Sprouts, soooo yummy
[+] Complimentary parking, just need to tip the valet.

[-] Salad wasn't that great and it's a little expensive. 
[-] A little on the pricier side
[-] Host in the front had one job to do, greet us and seat us. But she was on the phone and she took forever even though we had reservations. After she was on the phone, she kept talking to another worker. HELLLLLO, we been standing in front of you for 10 minutes and no one else is waiting.
author: Tammy F.

description:
UPDATE: second visit - came back after my great initial experience. Ordered the same seafood combo  and bone in filet. We were first served the seafood combo and when that was done we were given our steaks. However, this time our medium rare steaks looked crispy on the edges and over cooked. Sure enough, my edges were crispy and slightly more cooked than I prefer. My bf received a medium/well steak. Looks like our steaks were sitting as we were eating our apps. I now remember that last time we had our seafood combo and when the steaks were done the waiter brought it right out. I think this the waitress waited until we were done with the seafood then brought our steaks that were prob reheated. They were nice enough to cook my bf a new steak, but it came rare. Like bloody red in the middle ugh it's just very disappointing how a steak can be amazing then horribly cooked at the same place! So inconsistent. And for a steak place, how can you not cook a proper medium rare filet? Not sure if my bf ever wants to come back again...



Initial visit:
 I'm not a huge meat eater so I don't eat steak often. I do appreciate a nice prime rib from HOPR though. However I'm very hesitant in trying steak houses. Time and time again I encounter steak houses that can not cook a steak and ruin it for me...but my friend were in town for the SF Giants opening day and they wanted to try a new restaurant so we went to Bobo's. I knew I wanted to try the smaller cuts so was going to go with the filet mignon but opted for the bone-in filet mignon because I thought it would have more flavor.

My friend's girl got the regular filet...when our entrees arrived, hers didn't look as shiny and juicy as mine...when I tasted mine, it was a little salty but super flavorful and tender. There was one bite that was so rich in flavor it almost tasted like the richness you get from eating bone marrow or foies gras! It was absolutely delicious. My buddy tasted a piece of mine and he really enjoyed it, too much to the point that he couldn't eat his NY steak he ordered lol. 

We also got the combo mussels/shrimp/crab. It it was a little underwhelming and very salty!! Crab didn't have much meat and the shrimp was very small. I would expect them to give bigger and more plump shrimp. Mussels were nice and plump though. 

They also serve Mexican Coca Cola (made with real sugar).

Being that the next day I was wanting more of that bone-in filet mignon, I will def be back for it (but not much else). I just hope I can get the same tasting cut next time!
author: Linda L.

description: Amazing service! Only thing I didn't like was the man in a business suit (who I'm assuming was the owner or manager) telling the hostess that he could pay a talking monkey to do her job. From what I gathered he's the monkey in mention. Our server (Aladdin I think) was most attentive and made for a romantic experience. The food was AMAZINGGGGG and we will most definitely be back.
author: Caitlin O.

description: Unfortunately the brilliance can't be expressed in words.  Bobo's invented the idea of bone-in cuts.   Don't know what that means?  Try it.  It'll change your gastronomic life.
author: Robert A.

description: Went here a while back and don't recommend it.  Perhaps it was off day or something - It happens, anyway - Came with four friends and was disappointed with service, and food was OK.  Appetizer was good, and the waiter recommended his last bottle of don't remember exactly what the wine was, but he said we were lucky we got that bottle.  We paid around $150 for the bottle I think and then we looked it up online and it was available for $25 at BevMo.  OK, so I'm not a wine connoisseur, but don't over embellish what you're recommending by that much.   The steak: OK.  We were still eating our appetizers and waiter got frustrated when he brought our steaks and we were still eating appetizers.  When ordering, we asked him to bring the steaks AFTER we finished our appetizers because we were going to be there a while.  That didn't happen and he got upset when we reminded him to bring them after we finished appetizers.  We also walked outside the door on the second floor to check it out since it was open and waiter said we couldn't go out there even though the door was wide open and next to our table.  To sum up, it's how you talk to people and if you get what you pay for right?  Not here.  Brush up on simple courtesy, intonation of your voice, and be real about what your serving and what people are getting for choosing your restaurant.  Oh yeah, they charged us twice, over $530 dollars to the wrong cards.  Classic over promise and way under deliver on food and service.  Not worth the time or money.  The people next to us also had a complaint to the manager, but we dismissed it since they were leaving when we got there.  Listen to your gut feeling and try somewhere else.
author: J H.

description:
A friend recommended coming here for our annual holiday outing and I really didn't know what to expect. We had a reservation, so there was no problem getting seated when we arrived. 

Quickly, as you walk through the restaurant, you're immersed in the whole boboquivaris theme. A little bit eerie with the Venetian, jester decor, but you soon forget all about that because the food, specifically the filet mignon is no joke!

For our table we got the following spread:
- Caesar Salad
- Filet Mignon / Med. Rare
- Super Bone-In Filet Mignon / Med. Rare (Shared)
- Twice Baked Potato
- Portobello Mushroom

The filet mignon was delicious and deserves the 5 star rating by itself! Very tender and the seasoning was balanced and not overpowering. The sides complemented the meal really well. 

I also got the San Francisco Mule, which was an interesting take on a mule because it had a little minty, menthol-y effect after drinking. I enjoyed it and out of the ordinary, but subtle sensation. 

If ever I have a fix for filet mignon, this is definitely the place to go!
author: Vincent L.

description: Came with some friends a while back and this place has left an impression on me in terms of what a good bone in steak (some of us had new York, others filet) should look and taste like.  It was absolutely delicious.  It was cooked well and flavored well.  The twice baked potato was absolutely delicious, as was the mac and cheese.  The ambience is a nice but a little too dark for my tastes, but when we showed up (9:30) it was pretty quiet and seating was available, which is always a welcome thing in the city.  The server was pretty friendly and complimented me on my watch, which always wins brownie points (but doesn't change the rating).  All in all, definitely a place I would frequent again, and somewhere where I would want to bring my wife to (but haven't yet).
author: Charles H.

description: What can I say if anything I give this place five stars this restaurant here has best bone in filet and you have to get it medium rare awesome!
author: Kev V.

description:
I dunno about steaky.
They gotta couple beefs playing steaky but I dunno if they'll let real beefs play steaky like Bobo & Nuknuk.
Cause they let you fight.
You know it'll be a beef out there skating without a fork!
Like what, what meata now?
I wish a porterhouse WOULD!

Stevie Wonder, Journey, Earth Wind & Fire, Guns N' Roses, A-ha, and lots more for you to #breakoutwyoursteakout amidst Martes Gordo decor. Steak carefully done to your specs. I should try their normal dishes too.

(^_^) Iced Tea $4 (http://bit.ly/1MWCYEI)
Bottomless. Extra bitter.

(^_^) 49er (49oz / 3+lb porterhouse) $150 (http://bit.ly/1ODysLH)
#arap* #nosharing #noleftovers

(^_^) Table Bread $0 (http://bit.ly/1JzHYHZ)
Olive Oyl

I still don't know how to pronounce "Boboquivari".
But I know how to pronounce "Bobofunmeali".

*As Rare As Possible
author: Dan B.

description: Went here for a birthday dinner for family member.  The decor of the place is awful, pretty tacky.  And there is an odd smell...think maybe due to there being carpet and food/drink being spilled over time.  The bone in filet mignon was delicious, but that was about the only thing that was good.  The salad was awful, the bread.....OMG so ridiculously rich - good bread doesn't need all that butter and garlic.  The crab again didn't need all that butter sauce.  If you are going to put down that much money for a meal there are better options in SF.
author: M P.

description:
Remarkably great service of remarkably mediocre meal.

After a great cocktail, we ordered the shrimp and crab cocktail. Shrimp was tasty: crab was overcooked, dry, and improperly cleaned, with bitter gut residue on the crab body. When four folks get served a single crab, and there's a third left over, it's an issue.

Okay, on to the steak. Upsold to the giant New York (we split it between two), both couples ordered medium rare. Theirs was right, mine was quite rare, more than I like or ordered. Sent it back. Returned after ten minutes. Now it's medium. So tougher than I'd like, all the heavily-hyped sauce was gone.

The mac and cheese side was fantastic. My Caesar salad was ... meh.

For the price, I shoulda sent the steak back again, but we were about friends that evening, not whining about food.

Dessert was very nice.  I don't expect to be going back.
author: Michael M.

description: My parents wanted to celebrate their 30 year anniversary at Bobo's so I made a reservation for 7. The food was pretty yummy, my family raved about their seafood and the filet mignon was good but not the best I've had. It's super pricy and fancy but I felt like the service was lacking, people were not very friendly. Minus one star because while the food was good it wasn't something I would have to try again and minus another star for subpar service.
author: Angela D.

description:
Nothing that blew us away.

Surf & Turf (half crab and petit filet mignon) - Crab had decent amount of flavor, but I did feel it fell short and was missing that oomph. Filet mignon was cooked beautifully, except for the over-char/burntness to the top. I get the nice touch of a mild char and smokiness, but not the whole surface of the filet mignon (see picture)! Gave it an overall burnt taste.. Had to cut off the top!

We ordered the twice baked potato as a side... it was pretty good. Flavorful, salty, garlicy and that's about it. The complimentary bread was a nice start, as it had a garlic aioli on top! 

One thing about intimate restaurants like these... please don't have tables 1-2 inches apart. I hate when tables are like that... am I celebrating my anniversary with my date? Or.... with the four people situated to the left and right of my boyfriend and I? Hm.. I don't know, just one of my restaurant pet peeves! Plus, the lights were randomly flickering which was just.. odd. Will not be back!
author: Kris C.

description:
Insincere staff. Nothing special about food and taste. Certainly not worth the price or service 
If you know decent food don't go here
author: Ann S.

description: Interesting restaurant, liked the deco in the restaurant staff was very friendly. Steaks and crab were good. Disappointed in the shrimp, it was cooked with shell on and it was to hot to peel and eat.  Brussel sprouts and mushrooms were good as well.  I think the price range should be a 4$ not a 3$.  But over all I would recommend it.
author: Tracey P.

description: A good friend of mine took here yesterday for my birthday! I was really impressed with the atmosphere and the intimate setting. We ordered a pound of mussel, ribeye steak to share, and a bottle of their vintage wine! The entire experience was fantastic. The waiter was kind, friendly, patient, and attentive. Oh! Don't forget to try the chocolate bomb for dessert. I definitely plan to come back! Enjoy. Buon Appetito!
author: François N.

description:
I give 5 stars for the bone in filet but the seafood was very fishy tasting when I asked two different waiters about this they blew it off and said I don't know , that was disappointing they didn't offer to take it back so we got stuck with it.
Update called to talk to the manager Jim and he was very rude when I let him know about the food and that we got sick and he was like ok and hung up . Very poor customer service for such a nice place . Def won't be returning
author: christina M.

description: We were visiting the area and looking for a steak house open on New Years Day.  This was our choice, as it was among the highest rated ones in the city.  We were able to easily obtain a reservation on Open Table.  We used Uber but noted there is free valet parking.  The dining room is very cozy (some might say crowded).  Good selection of steaks - all sides are a la carte.  Good wine list including domestic and international wines. Steaks were prepared appropriately and portions were good.  The rib eye rated a 5, my filet mignon was about a 4.5 - very good, but not among the best I have ever had.  The salads were generous - large enough to share.  The sides were a MAJOR disappointment, except for the mushrooms.  The twice baked potato was half of a whole potato and had little flavor.  Brussel sprouts were just strange tasting - and I usually love them.  Service was attentive, but we felt a bit rushed.  Perhaps I set my expectations too high, but the overall experience was just ok.
author: Mike N.

description:
INCREDIBLY expensive, even for an upscale steakhouse. The sides are bad and overly rich. Service is not what you'd expect for the price, not even close. Normal, inattentive waiters, and tonight I was turned away an hour before closing time, and given fumbled answers when I corrected them. Did I mention it's overpriced?

Edit: The hours are different (what the waiter claimed) on Yelp, but incorrect on Google and on their own website. That really, really irks me. Your hours are like your prices, and need to be listed correctly. Upgraded to 2 stars.
author: Andrew B.

description: This place was such a disappointment. My husband made reservations for 7:15 pm, we arrived 10 mins early and was told they were running "a little" behind and that we could wait in the bar (which was packed) or go to their sister restaurant bobos burger bar and that they would call us when our table is ready. We waited 30 minutes at Bobo burger then headed back to see if our table was ready. It still was not ready. 15 mins later the hostess then tell us that they are getting our table ready. We were seated 45 MINS AFTER OUR RESERVATIONS at a table 6 inches from another couple. At that point I was pissed off at their lack of service and inconsideration of our time we decided to leave. I will not give this place another chance.
author: Alexandria T.

description: If you are a steakhouse enthusiast, do not bother paying this place a visit. The fillet part of the porterhouse was a 7/10 and the strip a 4/10 as it tasted like pure olive oil. The sides and appetizers were average and unmemorable. Perhaps this place was simply too overhyped for someone who appreciates a quality steak.
author: Alex B.

description:
My boyfriend and I came on a random Wednesday night. I called in to make an 8:30 reservation at 6:30. We checked in at 7:45 and the table was ready for us. Typical hole in the wall restaurant in San Francisco, I can't picture how crowded it may be during Friday nights, weekends, and holidays. 

Have you ever ordered an 8oz filet mignon with soup/salad and a side dish knowing you CAN'T finish. You don't finish your salad to save room for steak. You can't finish your steak because you ate too much of your baked potato. This entree comes out to +$50 and you don't want your leftovers given that it's basically 1/3 of your original steak and a few bites of baked potato. 

Bobo's sets the menu up so you CAN finish everything you order at a price. 

Their entrees are served a la carte, meaning no free side dish. My boyfriend and I each had a petite filet mignon (8 oz) medium rare, shared a side dish of mac n cheese, and an appetizer. This was the first time I cleaned my plate a a restaurant. 

The mac and cheese surprised me. Some form of ingredient was a little spicy and caught me off guard. 

I was skeptical before my first bite of steak because the exterior was BLACK as if they burnt it. Turns out they make the exterior crispy and the steak gets juicier as you eat your way towards the middle. 

I would definitely recommend this place for an intimate date night. 
There's a small parking garage by the restaurant. Drive by slowly otherwise you'll miss it.
author: Danae L.

description: This is a gem! We both ordered the bone in filets, Baby Bleu salad, crab cakes, cauliflower, and Espresso Martinis for dessert. The steaks were cooked to perfection! The crab cakes were tasty, but the smallest I've ever seen anywhere. The salad and cauliflower were both delicious. Service was outstanding- I wish I could remember our servers name. I also love the atmosphere here. The biggest reason I'm only giving this establishment four verses five stars is because of where we were seated. A two top at the top of the stairs in the middle of the floor. Please do away with this particular table- We were being stepped around the entire meal, and this was disappointing.
author: Colleen D.

description: To cramped. Porterhouse not to tasty. Over priced for the atmosphere and the taste of the food. Very loud. Made reservation and got stuck in the far back room on a little wobbly table with no ventilation. 2 thumbs sorry :(
author: Joey N Carey P.

description: "Like butta baby" is how I would describe the filet mignon I had. Came here for a holiday dinner. Even though the downstairs was completely empty, we were seated on the 2nd level were it was packed. Whimsical is how i would describe the decor. I won't say that the 2nd floor is small...cozy. Yes, its very cozy up top. I had petite filet surf n turf and he had crab and the bone-in filet. Our steaks were magical! Not sure if you're supposed to use the crab sauce with the steak as well, but I did and I have no regrets. With salads and corkage fee the bill was right at $200
author: Sasha B.

description: This place is really really good! Tried the shrimp and the bone in filet mignon as well as the twice baked potato (best baked potato I've ever had) and the cauliflower. Everything was delicious and staff was friendly. Would definitely come back to this place!
author: Lissa M.

description:
I've lived in New York and now in Hong Kong and have eaten at some of the best steak houses in the world. Bobos came highly recommended by a friend since our first choice of house of prime ribs were booked out. We had a party of 5 and was seated up stairs in a half moon booth. Nice ambience but that's about it. The food was mediocre. We ordered the porter house to share and it lacked flavor. I had to constantly dig the piece in the pan juice. The bread was... bland. The salads were ok. The sides were nothing special. Mango panna cotta was good. But what was worst was the service. They were not "unfriendly" but just seemed so stressed. Everything was rushed in a tight space. Couple of times they almost spilled water on the table while refilling the glass and finally when they took away the plates, a glass of water spilled all over my lap. Just slow down! Geez! 
I don't understand why is this place so highly rated. Food was really nothing to rave about. $400 bill and nothing to show for it.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Went to Bobos expecting a great meal based on other reviews. 

The food was mediocre. Taste was very bland. Seriously for a $50 steak one should expect SOME flavor. We didn't receive any flavor except the salt and pepper we added.  Service was lacking for a $250 meal imho. 

Good note: wine selection was nice. Our bottle of wine was the best part of the experience. 

In my opinion, this place is severely over priced and over hyped. 

I would have enjoyed going to Outback or Longhorn better. I'm sure there are better locally owned options for a nice steak. This isn't your best pick.
author: Ross K.

description: Had the super bone-in filet. Asked for medium they cook it a little over medium well, but that's ok still tasted good. Pricey joint. Ruths chris sill my favorite. My friends ribeye was very rare, had to send back his plate twice. So beware of that.
author: Abdul C.

description: This is a late review but my boyfriend and I recently went on a nice date night and we were reminiscing about our date night at Bobo's so I had to write a quick review! This place is so good that we're still talking about it a year later! The food tasted so good my mouth can still water thinking about it. It's the perfect dinner spot for a romantic night out. Great service. The inside is also decorated fun.
author: Kendra S.

description:
Boboquivari's might have a lot of clowns on their menus, dishes, and website, but if there's one thing they aren't clowning around with (sorry - had to throw that one in) it's their bone-in filet.  14oz (20oz, if you're ambitious) of deliciousness and one of the most perfectly seared and crusted pieces of meat I've ever had. Totally tender, full of flavor, and melting almost like butter after a few bites, this was on par with one of the best steaks I've had in SF. Having heard a lot of hype about here, I was prepared to be amazed.  And this place certainly lived up to that expectation.

While some of the other things I had were OK (the swiss chard side, the steak tartare, and the Dunce Cap cones weren't my favorite), other things like the mac n cheese and the AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS bread slathered in olive oil, butter, and capers, and the blood orange sorbet made up for it.  I'm not a big seafood fan, but the double order of mussels that were ordered for our party of 6 were a big hit too.

But let's get back to what's important: the bone-in filet.  You can entertain the idea of ordering something else, but to be honest, I'd go directly to this and leave the rest alone.  Service wise, our waitress seemed a little overstretched and seemed a little lost when it came down to collecting glasses, plates, used utensils, and even ordering.  Still though, she was very nice, and very patient with the amount of wine we had brought and were ordering. The only thing that irked me a little was that in asking for water, I got a teeny tiny water glass and had to ask for it to be filled at least three before someone came around regularly. I totally get why people come here, and you can be that I'll definitely be back here for that steak again!
author: Lisa I.

description: My filet Mignon was ordered medium and it came out burnt they took it back and it took over 30 min to get my second filet by that time my dinner party was done with dinner.  For the cost of the food and the service as bad as it was.  I would much rather not deviate from Ruth's Chris.
author: Junior C.

description: Filet mignon was perfect! Didnt like mussles & shrimps. Mussles were dry and not much meat on it.
author: Ali N.

description: My concerierg at our hotel Reccomeded this restaurant and unfortunately it was not great, with so many awesome choices in SF this is not your go to , steak was not hot and not many choices for fish, needs a total makeover very dark. Go elsewhere.
author: Evalee S.

description: This was the worst experience I've had at this restaurant so I'm only giving it a 3.  I've been here a bunch of times and hands down the best steak in the city.  My wife and I went here to celebrate the new year.  Ordered my steak Medium and it came out rare.  I let our server know it wasn't cooked correct and he took the steak away from the table.  He brought my steak back out and it was the same steak that I sent back because I had cut a big chuck out and realized it was rare.  When it was brought back it was now medium to medium well and the piece that was cut was well done.  I called the waiter over and told him I didn't want the steak anymore and he took it away.  He didn't charge me for the steak which is normal.  I'm just disappointed that the steak wasn't cooked right and then they tried to serve me the same steak again and it still wasn't right.  Just a bad experience.
author: Bob G.

description: Food and service was excellent. The ambiance fun and intriguing.   May actually  try to go again tomorrow.
author: Bonnie F.

description: Came here for New Year's Eve and ordered the Filet Mignon and Filet Mignon Bone-in, both with the twice baked potato. As a dessert we enjoyed the chocolate bomb, the cheesecake and the cones with chocolate mousse. Everything was delicious, though a bit overpriced. Unfortunately, our waiter was quite rude. Probably, there are not many guests our age (20 and 21) but he treated us like we could not afford a dinner like that. He even asked us whether we know how gratuity works. I mean serious?! I never experienced an arrogant service like that. Nevertheless, we gave him a tip which was much higher than he deserved. When we left, he was suddenly pretty nice wishing us a safe trip back home and a happy new year. That was probably because he saw the 40$ tip we gave him...
author: Evelyn W.

description:
After hearing so much from my girlfriend about how good this place was I was really excited to come try it for myself, but after driving up and back home from San Jose tonight, I left not only disappointed but hungry as well. 

We ordered the halibut carpaccio with chilis, olive oil and ponzu appetizer, mussels with full crab, and bone-in filet which my girlfriend had before and highly recommended (apparently it's their specialty).

The halibut was ok. The chilis didn't have any spice or flavor and I didn't really taste the ponzu either.

Next we had the crab and mussels but the mussels were rotten. Not just old and fishy but putrid, like poo-poo. If you've ever eaten a bad oyster or mussel you know what I'm talking about. My girlfriend and friends found a couple that were ok but we didn't touch most of them.

The crab on the other hand was pretty tasty, but every now and then we would get this strange flavor we couldn't figure out that would make our mouths go numb. It wasn't peppery, spicy, minty, or really any flavor I can describe, but it had a numbing effect that wasn't enjoyable.

After that we had bone-in filets cooked medium rare, except by the time we got them they were closer to medium/medium well. Perhaps I'm just being difficult, but if I'm spending $52 on a medium rare steak then I want it to be cooked medium rare, not medium/ medium well - so I sent it back. 

When the waitress brought out my 2nd filet and I cut into it, the first slice was raw, purple meat. I sliced into the rest of the steak and it was the same. At this point I just said nevermind and lost my appetite. The Argentinian Malbec was quite nice for what it's worth though... 

Anyway, the waitress said she was sorry but that was pretty much the extent of it. The manager didn't come out, no one offered to cook something else... like there was no problem I was leaving without having dinner even though our bill was $450. 

So here I am, sitting at home eating a bowl of cereal for dinner instead of Bobo's while I write this review. I think I'm going to stick to House of Prime Rib to satisfy my beef cravings from now on. Very disappointing experience to say the least.
author: Marty E.

description:
After years of enjoying Bobo's, I can no longer recommend them. I ordered the filet, which is one of my all time favorites here. Sadly, they sent out an oddly shaped cut that was completely burnt on the bottom. 

As you may know, Bobo's uses cat iron pans as their cooking vessels so I can forgive a rustic crust, but that steak was burnt. The bartender took my steak back and re-fired a new steak. 

The new steak came back clearly burnt on the top and bottom. Even though I knew it was burnt, I tasted it to be sure and it was. Now, with my dining companion halfway through dinner (a perfectly cooked filet by the way) and the sides cold, the bartender just stood there unsure what to do when I said this too was burnt. 

Next, a person behind him that works at the restaurant speaks just loud enough for me to hear his off-handed comment: "we cook with cast iron. That's supposed to be how it is cooked". Of course I spoke up and asked why he is getting involved and if he would like to taste my steak, which of course he didn't. 

Now things have escalated and I'm angry. The bartender did nothing to help and the other guy just walked away with a smug smile on his face. 

The bartender offered to get the manager but no manager ever showed. My steak was comped with no apology and the rest of the bill included all other items, even the cold sides I never enjoyed because I did not have a plate. 

Bobo's has had their ups and downs with me but I feel they are just no longer a decent place to go, especially with a clear lack of management, poor customer service skills, and inability to cook their steaks properly and consistently.
author: William R.

description:
This place is great!! 

I made reservations for a 7pm dinner with my husband. We were running late because some asshole wanted to throw fireworks in front of a bus we were behind. So I called to let them know we were on our way. The guy on the phone told us that it was fine and not to worry about it. 

When we got there, there was no one at the Valet stand, so I went down to get someone. The guy went out there right away! Not even a minute when my husband came in to meet me we were seated. 

We were greeted right away from our server, Teo K. He gave us water right when we sat down and gave us our menus. We didn't have to wait.

He recommended a cocktail for me because I wanted Malibu Pineapple, but they didn't have Malibu rum. He recommended a drink called Rum Baba. It had Captail Morgan Rum, Blood Orange, and Pineapple. It was good, but I didn't get buzz at all. I felt like I didn't taste any rum.

We ordered a Lobster Crostini, which had lobster, avocado, and garlic aioli served on top of a toasted bread. It came out less than 5 mins after we ordered it. It came with only 2 pieces for $17.95. However, it was really good! The bread was toasted perfectly, they were generous with the lobster, they had this really good white glob in between the Lobster Crostinis. Not sure what that was, but it was super delicious!

Then my husband for the 20oz ribeye. He wanted it cooked medium well and that's exactly how they cooked it. He says it was really good, flavorful, and tender. He says the chefs really know how to cook a medium-well ribeye steak.

I was going to get the combination with mussels, shrimp, and crab. But I asked our waiter if the crab was a whole crab and he said it was half crab. So I got the double shrimp and double crab. Yes, just for me!! It was a $55.95 dish, but it was well worth it. The garlic flavors on the crab and shrimp was too perfect. There was the right amount of seasonings. Oh my yum!! 

As for our sides, we got the twice baked potato and the mod Mac and Cheese. I have to say the sides were good, but my crab and shrimp dish made me forget about the sides because my food was just too good. I couldn't stop eating! 

For dessert, you must get the mango panna cotta. It had this flan type texture. It basically melts in your mouth. We also got the strawberry cheesecake. I wasn't really feeling the cheesecake. It was a bit tough. I never had to really chew cheesecake before.  

I would definitely come here again. The service was great! The food was amazing! And most importantly, valet parking was complimentary!! Woohoo!!
author: Darlene M.

description:
This is my second time here and my experience was pretty consistent with the first. Steak was cooked to perfection but a bit plain for my liking. I got the sinatras cut and it was quite a steak. I would have enjoyed it more if it was well seasoned (-1 star) I got brussel sprouts and mac and cheese as well as onion rings which were also cooked very well and actually had some seasoning compared to the steak. 

Average upper scale service but nothing outstanding. Place has kind of a weird vibe like you are in a dimly lit opera house plus the plain steak and high prices I think I will try other options before coming back and dropping $100+ on a dinner that leaves me wanting more (-1).

(-.5) for valet, which is convenient yet slow but there was only one guy working. He also left my car on, I would have preferred he left it off because I was talking outside to some friends before I wanted to take off.
author: Yosof R.

description:
Bobo's is an interesting restaurant. I thought it would be a high end, classy steakhouse but the interior decoration was actually very unique - red walls and curtains, and some interesting paintings, I felt like I was eating in a circus... not in a bad way though. It's always good to have some sort of uniqueness. It's a tiny restaurant which end up creating a pretty loud environment. So this is not a place for romantic dates but rather for friends gatherings.

I went with a friend on a Saturday night at 7:30pm (reservations made ~1 week ago). We were right on time, and were seated around 10 mins later. Started off by ordering two cocktails - Q-ball and Moscow Mojito. Both drinks were okay but ice amount was a bit excessive which kind of dilute the drinks a little bit.

Our server had a friendly attitude and was quite attentive, however she didn't seem to care much about what we were ordering like giving suggestions, or how we were doing throughout the meal. Would have appreciated if there is a bit more of conversations engagement with the customers.

Double Crab and Mussels on iron-plate: B.
First of all, the portion was pretty big. Lots of mussel (small size type) and one big crab in the middle. The sauce had some sort of unique roasted pepper + garlic flavor. Although the mussels could not really absorb the taste, but butter / olive oil (?) were provided as dipping sauce and they definitely played a crucial role to enhance the mussel taste. For the crab, the shell was all covered by the roasted pepper/garlic, but I think it was a little bit overcooked. The shell of the crab legs were pre-cracked and it still took quite a bit of effort trying to crack them open, which is not a convenient thing to do at a high end restaurant. The crab meat tasted pretty bland and dipping sauces were still required.

Bone-in New York (Medium Rare): B+.
I had mixed feeling about this steak. I really like the texture - super tender and juicy, and as some fellow Yelpers mentioned the portion closer to the bone were also cooked till medium rare which was a big plus. Cooking skill couldn't be doubted. However, the steak definitely needs a bit more flavor - I got tired after finishing half of it because of the lack of flavor from the sauce.

I also tried my friend's bone-in filet mignon. Personally I like the New York better. Somehow I think the New York managed to have slightly more flavor than the mignon, although again both were on the bland side.

Mac and Cheese: B.
Saw a lot of good reviews about this but I wasn't impressed. I think it was kind of over cooked again... Was it just me? I have had a lot more better ones at other steakhouses. 

Strawberry Cheesecake: B.
Nothing special. My friend said the sauce on top of the cheesecake was kind of salty which I agree. Other than that it was an ordinary piece of cheesecake.

The bill ended up to be ~$210 plus tips. Honestly with this price tag I think I could have gone to places a lot better than Bobo's. But again, I think the steak cooking skill is quite exceptional, now just need to add some more flavors to that and it would be perfect.
author: Simon C.

description:
Came here for our anniversary dinner when visiting San Fran for our anniversary. Good definitely looks better than the taste. A lot of tendons in the steak- asked for medium turned out to be medium rare. Waiter is not very friendly maybe because we are from out of town? 

We got the double shrimp and crab- I like the sauce- crab is okay, not the best season to eat it yet. Shrimp taste like frozen shrimps not those fresh jumbo ones I'm used to. 

Got a candle on our dessert but no greetings from the manager as the other couple did? 

Also I guess they don't do dessert on the house in SF? 

Overall good is ok, service is.. Ehh. Won't come back again if in SF again.
author: Claire Y.

description:
Came here for date night with my boyfriend and it was not a bad place to try. It's his favorite steakhouse in the city but I thought it was decent. 

Hamachi carpaccio: 5/5: delicious strips of hamachi with a really good sauce. Not sure what they use but it was really delicious! A bit strange that a steakhouse has good hamachi carpaccio!

Mussels: 5/5: they were sizzling on a platter and they were cooked to perfection. Loved the accompanying dipping sauce, buttery and delicious. It also went well with the bread. I would totally come here for more mussels! 

Bone in filet mignon: 4/5: it was my first time trying this cut and well I can say that it was tasty for the most part except closer to the bone. I ordered it medium rare and they did a good job of that. The only part I did not like about this cut is that once you get closer to the bone it's almost practically raw. Not my favorite but my boyfriend was happy to finish it for me. Next time I get a steak here I'll probably go with a petite filet for more even cooking. 

Overall, a great date place. It's kinda dark but nice to have curtains there for some privacy. I would come back here again! 

Total for 2: $180
author: Stella J.

description: Carnivore time with my bro Johnny! This place is so awesome right in the middle of everything . Most likely the best steak and crabs I've ever had . Nice atmosphere and everyone was awesome . The place is low lit in red and the walls full of Jasper's and jokers . 5 stars from the valet dood to the waiter ! I will be back !
author: Robert R.

description:
I've been here many times and finally got around to getting a review. The steak here is truly world class, always and I mean it's always been done perfect for me. 

The sizzling skillet mussels, crab, and shrimp are so good I often order them as meal. I've done every combination and you can't go wrong. The seasoning is spot on perfect for the mussels which are my personal favorite. The bread is perfect to dip in the skillet sauce. 

Dessert was a monte rosa cheese cake and it was light but full of flavor. Not too sweet but really good. 

I usually enjoy a Manhattan as its one of the best in the city. The new bartender now has an old fashioned on the menu (called a Bofashioned) which is quiet good. Done very nicely with no muddle cherries or too much ice as is often the case.
author: Derick P.

description: Great sizzling seafood platter. Great basil marteeeen. Good steak. But more importantly it's a circus which makes it a nice place to party with a group of any size. 4 banger
author: Kirk G.

description: Food was good, the best mussels that I ever had. Wine was ok. Server wasn't so nice. We've got a table on the 2nd floor and he complained about going downstairs when I asked for a taste of a glass wine and brought up a few drops in the glass that were not even possible to tell the taste. Go for mussels!
author: Kylie H.

description: Great atmosphere and very attentive wait staff. We got the mussel, shrimp, and crab sizzler and a surf and turf steak. The steak was super tender, but the crab on the plate completely overwhelmed the steak flavors. The steak was somewhat fishy because of the crab juices and there was a seafood seasoning of some sort on the crab that was very strong. There was a garlic butter sauce on the sizzling platter as well that was very strong and made it hard to actually taste the seafood. A lot of people like the garlic roasted seafood, but we were not a fan.
author: Tyler G.

description: I had been to Bobo's a couple of years ago when I was in SF with a friend and she and I absolutely loved it!  I was in SF this weekend with my boyfriend and wanted to share my amazing experience with him since he is a steak lover, so I brought him to Bobo's for a date night.  Well, this experience wasn't as wonderful as my first experience.  The steaks we ordered were medium rare in the center (which is how we ordered them), however they both had a burnt "crust."  Not the best filet I've ever had, and not even remotely close to the tender, juicy filet I recall from my first experience at Bobo's.  I gave it 2 stars because I still love the interior and ambiance in the restaurant.  If you don't want to take your chances on having a perfect filet ruined, you should check out any other place in SF.
author: DeeDee J.

description: Been to quite a few restaurants in the city & this one tops it all!  Service, food & all around experience was amazing!  Definitely have to order double double seafood appetizer!  So yummy!  Really flavorful!
author: Bess M.

description:
Short Story:
An excellent place for steak and crab!

Long Story:
I came here on a Saturday night and we had reservations.  We were promptly seated upstairs.  We ordered the prime cut and a whole dungness crab.  The crab was very well cooked and you have to crack it yourself.  Although it's quite easy to do and they give you the tools to do so.  The steak was cooked almost to perfection.  The prices are pretty standard for what you pay in the city.

The service is superb and the ambiance and decor are interesting.  Something that you would find out of a Nutcracker ballet or something.  

Verdict:  I'll come back after a while...
author: Michael W.

description:
