The hunt continues to find a place that can make a better steak than Alexander's, so I decided to give this place a shot. Was it able to finally able to take down the reigning champion of the kingdom of Steak? Nope, but it was noble effort. 

With that being said, this place was great. Came here for Valentines day dinner and enjoyed the experience from top to bottom. It looks like this place was once a house that has been converted into a restaurant, but I'm not going to pin that as a fault. They also offer complimentary valet services, which is very nice for a place in SF as parking is always a pain in the ass. 

I'm not quite sure origin of the name to this place, but I'm guessing it's an Italian or French clown as this place had a European Clown type of vibe. I'm a huge fan of the circus, so also a big bonus for me. The service was great. Not Alexander's great, but great. (I really need to stop mentioning Alexander's in my steak house reviews) 

They start you off with some great, which has an olive type of taste, but it needed butter. Bread and butter go hand in hand, so it was a little odd that they didn't offer breads beast friend. The steak's were all great. The bone-in filet is what they are known for, so it didn't take much to convince the gf to go for that. It was cooked perfect medium rare for optimal flavor. Remember kids, when it comes to steak get it cooked medium rare! The mac and cheese were pretty good, but the mushroom needed some more flavor. You're paying $8.95 for chopped mushrooms. You better add some flavor! 

Overall, I liked it again. I'm not sure when I'll come again, as my quest takes me to many different steak houses. Once I try them all in the Bay Area, I'll be able to decided if Alexanders will be my steak house for life or not.
author: Benny H.

description: We made reservations 1-2 hours ahead of time. We were running late so we had to push back the reservation an hour but it wasn't a problem which was nice. Upon arrival there was free valet. We ordered the iron skillet roasted Combo Mussels, Shrimp, and Crab, Dungeness Crab Roasted in Garlic Sauce, Mod Mac, Portobello Mushrooms, and Twice-baked Potato's. Everything was delicious. It was pretty crowded and a bit tight inside. It was hard to talk without the table next to us hearing every word we said and vice versa.
author: Diem H.

description: Valentine's Day...  Lets start there.  I know this is not the best day to visit a restaurant for the first time but we came to Bobo's with high hopes.  I ordered the bone in filet and hubby ordered the bone in NY.  The steaks were okay.  I also ordered the half crab, here is the reason for 2 stars...  Overcooked and whatever the brown stuff covering it was, was terrible.  They told me it was butter, it was not.  It was awful.  I made hubby try to make sure I wasn't crazy, he couldn't get the taste out of his mouth.  Sorely disappointed by my food.  The place itself is nice, they have a nice valet parking for free...  Those are pluses.  Another unfortunate thing which has no reflection on the restaurant is, there was a group of 8 single people sitting in a booth behind my hubby, they were SO LOUD...  I couldn't hear my hubby talk, and not only were they LOUD, they were rude.  They were in their late 30's and talked about all being single.  Let me say I have the mouth of a sailor but not when I am at a quiet, supposedly intimate restaurant.  I know all about their sex lives (lack of), their jobs as hand models, how they make fun of black people, and rich Marin People.  Possibly the rudest bunch of people I have ever sat by in a restaurant.  Made the whole meal that much worse.  Even the couple next to us was disgusted that they couldn't have a nice quiet conversation with each other.  I don't know that I will ever come back which is unfortunate because I really liked the atmosphere of this place.  I didn't stay for dessert because they were ordering more wine and dessert so hubby and I went and had milkshakes from McDonalds afterwards in peace...
author: Heather G.

description: From start to finish I could tell that the reviews were on point. Service was slow and food was overpriced and over hyped. Steak was rare when asked for medium, brussel sprouts were soggy with huge chunks of cheese sliced on top. To many great restaurants in SF to waste money here.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Had a reservation for 6 people on Mother's Day, was seated immediately at 5:30 PM. We were served drinks right away and we ordered. 

Mussels came out first, then the bread. The double mussels were very delicious. The dipping sauce was a good touch for the mussels. We finished them very promptly. The bread was also very delicious.

The side dishes and bone-in fillets came out. The side dishes were on the smaller side, but delicious. Most of our bone-in fillets seem slightly overcooked closer to the edges. One of them was more overcooked then the rest of ours, and was sent back to the kitchen. They replaced it promptly. 

Despite the setback on the cooking of the meat, it was all very delicious. Service was very attentive. Would recommend to anyone. Also has complementary valet, so that's always convenient, especially since parking is almost impossible over there.
author: Brandon L.

description:
I don't write a lot of reviews unless I am extremely impressed. But don't take my word for it, go and try this place for yourself. This is the best steak that I've ever had and I've been to all the steakhouses in San Francisco. Me and my girlfriend ordered the surf and turf. It came with the steak and crab legs. The crab legs were good, but forgettable. The steak on the other hand was far from that. 

We both ordered the filet mignon with the bone left inside. We both ordered it medium rare, and oh my god it was amazing! It was so good we barely spoke at the table. We would just come up for air and say something like "oh my god" and then continue on our steaks. 

Must try! If you're a steak lover. I know eating red meat is not the most Eco or animal friendly, but this place will definitely make you think twice!
author: Reliford B.

description:
We don't always have steak.  Scratch that.  We don't always have REALLY AMAZING steak.  When my boyfriend and I came here , I was informed by our server Lois that we I was in for a treat!  This was my first time and I was super excited!  

My boyfriend had recommend what he had tried when he was there before. That was the:

SUPER BONE-IN FILET - 20 oz. - $62.95
My boyfriend and I aren't big eaters which is why we decided to share a steak. I honestly think the 14oz would be enough but I didn't want us to sound cheap since we were already sharing, hehe.  This steak was amazing.  It was more than enough for both of us.  We had it medium-rare, and although it looked super rare, it tasted perfect.  I loved the slight crispy outer layer o the piece as the rest in it just melts i your mouth like better...WOW!  I was told that the part by the bone is the BEST.  We didn't finish the steak so I didn't get to try it.  Cutting this bad boy was easy too...so tender and juicy!

We also ordered sides:

BERMUDA ONION RINGS - $8.95
Hands down the best onion rigs I've ever had in my life.  It was perfect--thing and crispy on the outside batter layer, cooked enough on the onion part where its also still crispy but not raw tasting.  I mean...ever bit into an onion right where you end up pulling out all of the onion out of this batter shell?  It doesn't happen here!  Every bite is a clean bite!  Oh man, so tasty!

MOD MAC - $8.95
It doesn't say what is in here but I definitely taste truffle and some mushrooms.  There's crumbs on top and I also see chives and small red peppers.  This creamy dish of twisty/spiral pasta was so delicious.  It IS though heavy on the greasy side, but id you're like me where you enjoy unctuous foods, then you HAVE to order this!  

OH, and the complimentary sourdough bread was yummy too! 

I had mentioned in the reservation that this dinner was for our anniversary celebration.  We didn't have room for dessert and we had plenty of leftovers to take home!  We only finished half of the steak. YAY leftovers!  Gosh I love fancy leftovers..and yes it was still delicious the next day.  Anywho, Lois brought out a small dessert with a candle for our celebration...how lovely!!!  It was:

DUNCE CAP CONE (4) - $8.95
Four cones filled with dark chocolate mousse over ancho chili pepper chocolate sauce. 
So she gave us one of these, but I loved it so much I ordered one set (4) to go for my mom.  I KNOW she would love this!  The mousse part is light and not too sweet with the combination of the crunchy waffle!  LOVED it!

Lois was a huge part of why my first experience here was so wonderful.  I had an amazing time.  She really took care of us and we appreciate her so much.  Oh and valet parking is free which is a plus!  I know how muc SF suck when it comes to parking, haha.  I loved how this place is decorated so nicely in the Venetian theme.  LOVED it!  I loved the quiet romantic ambiance.  I really do hope to come back again.  :)
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: They ran out of filet minon the night we went. Our server was upset at this but we understood. We ordered the New York steak instead. It was delicious and so much flavor. To take care of us, they have a free dessert to everyone at our table. Very good customer service.
author: Liz S.

description:
When your server's first instinct is to insult you?  That's a bad sign, and I wish we'd taken the hint! 

Birthday celebrating in SF included lunch at Little Star (since pizza is my favorite, like last-meal-before-death favorite), some bar hopping, and then a nice steak dinner... or so we thought.  

We were seated without incident at an upstairs table by a faux fireplace in a small room with maybe 10 little 2-seater tables.  Only half were occupied, and the room was quiet.  We perused the menus for a short time--  Then our server, Ponytail Michael, greeted us, and proceeded to make jokes about us being "virgins" (our first visit to Bobo's... & thx in part to him, our LAST visit as well) while making weird wanna-be-French groans & sounds?!?!  

After spouting off EVERY menu item, as if we hadn't read the menu at all, and calling EVERY item "exquisite," he started to walk away...  he didn't ask (or know) that we were ready to order drinks & appetizers so I called him back.  A beer for him, a cocktail for me, Yellowtail Carpaccio appetizer, and I asked if I could sample the Lobster Soup?  It was the only soup they had, and I'm not a huge seafood person.  With an appalled expression, he replies, "No, this isn't Baskin Robbins; it's made to order."  

THAT SHOULD HAVE BEEN OUR CUE TO EXIT!  But, of course, we naively stayed.  

His famous first words to EVERY TABLE in that small, quiet room were "exquisite" like 7 times in one sentence & "liquid food" for the "ladiieeesss!!"  As if women are just wino-drunkards who can't think straight without their "liquid food!"  I heard his lines at every new seating for over an hour, sooooo lame & classless.  

2 or 3-star food, at best, unless we went on an off night??  Which I doubt given some of the reviews from regulars referencing the steady decline of this once-great establishment. 

SERVICE: 

Ponytail Michael never brought complimentary bread; he never came by to see if we were enjoying the appetizers (namely the soup that I had questions about); he never came by to see if we needed anything (like another round of "liquid food" haha); we had to flag him down for our check--  which ended up taking, LITERALLY, 15 minutes to bring out!!  We had to cancel the Uber request because he wouldn't bring us our dang check! 

Overall... unprofessional, not welcoming or friendly, a bit impatient, inattentive, inconsiderate of our time, condescending in an attempt to be "uppity" though it failed miserably & only made him look like a charlatan clown (the greasy ponytail didn't help).  

FOOD: 

**The Lobster Soup looked & tasted terrible.  3 tiny chunks of lobster (which didn't bother me, but just fyi to all seafood lovers), unappealing grey broth whose texture was thicker than thieves & whose flavor was ruined by too much salt... or perhaps someone let it cook down too far??  Don't know, don't care, just don't order it.  

**The Yellowtail Carpaccio tasted like straight raw vinegar & its texture was like chewing on gooy, slightly slimy, wet tissue paper.  Utterly FOUL.  

**The Twice Baked Potato was crunchy, and not in a good, crispy-on-top kind of way.  More like someone forgot the TWICE because it was pretty undercooked!  And it was barely warm on top with a frigid interior... meaning cooked previously & refrigerated & then not heated through.  The flavor wasn't bad; it was just difficult to keep eating it, YUCK! 

**The Swiss Chard was pretty amazing!!  Probably the best thing we'd tasted all night, and that's sad for a steakhouse.  Too bad we hadn't ordered 3 portions of it & none of the other sides/ apps. 

**The steaks:  He ordered the bone-in New York; I ordered the bone-in Filet.  Both were cooked perfectly, but someone forgot to season his!  Just super bland... especially after we traded bites...  that's when he really knew his was lacking.  Mine, however, was freakin' good!!  Thankfully too because it was MYYYY Bday, only fitting that I end up with a decent steak (I'm usually the one who gets the crappy meal... cold, undercooked, missing key ingredients, plastic wrap in it, hair, it's always MINE that's messed up somehow!!  So this was a welcome & timely change of events). 

PRESENTATION: 
 
Sub par on soooo many levels...  see pics. 

**Grey, vomit-colored soup?  Not very appetizing.   

**Goopy, sloppy looking carpaccio?  It's supposed to be clean, crisp, & refreshing.  Imagine limp sushi?!  Yeah, no.  I'm actually surprised we're not physically ill from it.  

**Messy, greasy, steak juice all over the EDGES of our plates?  Uumm not good!  What happened to wiping that clean? 

Needless to say, "we're never, ever, ever getting back together" with this place :(  Not even if it were free.  Not even if they paid me...  okay, MAYBE if they paid me :)
author: Kai R.

description:
I have been to Bobo's twice.  The first time I left very disappointed.  Granted I had ordered the portobello mushroom.  Which was gritty and just plain bad.  I know this is a place known for their steaks, so I refrained from reviewing.  
My last trip to Bobo's I ordered half a crab and a twice baked potato.  Before I get too lost in the moment I would like to mention that the crab was delectable.  It's messy, but absolutely yummy.  OK, now for the important bit, the bit that got me to change my mind about reviewing Bobo's, the TWICE BAKED POTATO.  I swear on all things pancakes, that this was the best twice baked potato I have ever had in my entire life. The taste was exquisite-creamy and perfectly seasoned, the texture was PERFECT.  I have already planned on skipping the crab, ordering a potato and dessert and calling it good, on my next trip.  Which will hopefully be soon.
author: Vickey A.

description:
Such a fun a corky restaurant! 

We sat In the bar and service was excellent!

I love that they serve martini's in a little shaker served at your table. 

We ordered the steak and the crab. Both were yummy! 

We loved the whole experience and will be back soon.
author: Alyse P.

description:
In terms of service, this place is a Bobo-NO-NO! 

My sister AKA Thine Stultifying Light AKA The Divine Reason I Breathe AKA My Everything made dinner reservations at Bobo's for her birthday well in advance and was excited to test the digs out. Renowned for their crab, steaks and side dishes that include some type of twice baked potato, Boboquivari's had come recommended from a few friends and that was enough for us. 

Bobo's gets points for complimentary valet service, which is a must in the city. But from the moment we hopped out of the car, all "point"-age came to a screeching halt. It was raining pretty hard, but apparently the upper level is known to get hot as Hades so they like to keep the door open. Of the two available booths open, our party was placed closest to this gaping formation of fierce monsoon level winds and all around deluge. I asked our hostess, Anya, if the door would remain open throughout the duration of our visit and she said she couldn't say for certain but that she would check in with our waiter. 

This is where everything goes south. Not in a tropical, birds of paradise, cue the steelpan drum sense; this is around the time that we meet Robert D., our server for the evening. The anachronistic fly in the ointment, that pernicious little platter-propeller. I could end this whole review now and sum up our experience in five words: Robert made our experience horrible. He did so by being in inattentive and totally unavailable server. Other restaurant patrons, to the best of my knowledge, were provided with complimentary bread, which we never received from Robert, even after asking numerous times. When we were able to locate him, what we found instead of exemplary service was a condescending attitude. When we asked questions about dishes or ingredients, Robert treated us as if our questions were some sort of personal offense. To make matters worse, Robert seemed to be a gratuitous, and helpful server to every other table, including the one just to our left and just across the way, easily within earshot. Just imagine a waiter that's Delphine LaLaurie to your family alone but Betty White to every other table in their section.  

But it's imperative that we note the good, too! This can be done by highlighting the real star of the show: my main man, Jose. After trudging up and down the staircase in desperate search of the elusive chanteuse known as Robert, I gave up right around the time I found this sweetheart named Jose. Jose gets things done, like getting you bread when you're hungry and explaining meal ingredients and crab preparation. Jose, you have my heart.

As I mentioned above, it was my sister's birthday. She mentioned it, I mentioned it, my brother-in-law mentioned it, and my brother-in-law's brother chimed in, just to see if it made any difference. I'll be damned if at the end of our horrible dinner, Robert doesn't saunter up to the patrons at the next table, extract a slice of chocolate cake from some nearby surface, rouse a group of servers up and put on a damn performance as we are literally hanging on by a thread of patience, having had about all we can take of being ignored, spoken down to and disregarded. That last initial fits him perfectly! Definitely will not be coming back to Bobo's. 

(But again, thank you so much to Anya and Jose!)
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
5 Stars: Atmosphere (prefer the top floor of the restaurant & the bar of course;) Service & best of all the Steak . From San Francisco to Vegas, Wyoming, Montana, Texas, Chicago, and then New York & back again... Bobo's Dry Aged Steak stands w/ the very, very best.
Add 1) Iron-Skillet Roasted Mussels, 2-3 sides (say "yes" to the bread) &  then 4) the wine list and your at a 5 Star Steak House, never disappointed.
author: K M P.

description: Super tiny bar made it hard to enjoy a cocktail here. Prices were typical -as in a bit high for the environment. We did not eat here, don't think we will be back- seemed a bit tawdry.
author: Diane A.

description:
I didn't have expectations about this restaurant. The only thing I knew before visiting is that Bobo's is one of SF's known places to enjoy a steak. Here are my thoughts about my experience:

We ordered a caesar salad, the filet minion, crab, twice baked potato, and crab mac and cheese.

PROS
My friend and I arrived for our 7:30pm dinner reservation, and we were greeted nicely and promptly seated. (It was a Tuesday night though, so I assume it wasn't nearly as busy as it might be on a weekend.)

The filet mignon was delicious! The twice baked potato was tasty too.


CONS
Our waiter was pushy and obnoxious, not likable. I asked for my steak to be prepared medium well and he rudely told me no, saying they would do medium at the highest. Um okay... That's fine I guess but why the rudeness? His attitude made me want to leave.

Our salad arrived at our table, and two minutes later our entrees arrived. We only had a bite of our salads at that point! The staff apologized, but at a restaurant like this I would expect that this kind of timing issue would not happen.

Our table was close to the door, so the cold air from outside definitely made it chilly at our table and unfortunately helped to cool off our food too quickly. 

My water glass stayed empty for most of the time I was eating my entree.

The crab was nothing special. Not worth the money. So disappointing.

The decor was a bit cheesy and parts of it were very dusty.


OVERALL
I wouldn't go back to Bobo's. I'm glad I tried it, but I'm not impressed and won't waste the money or the time trying the restaurant again.
author: Ali M.

description: This was a really good place to get my crab cravings. It's a bit pricey, but they don't skimp on the food. I wasn't really hungry, so I got the baked potato with crab. It was amazing. I wish there was a little more butter, but hey how needs all that butter anyway. The crab that came on was slot. There was I believe zucchini in baked into the potato making it taste more flavorful! The setting was dimly lit and the waiters were very attentive.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Bobo's is the spot! I had the Bone-in Filet and wifey got the muscles,  & ... We made reservations through Open Table, noted that we were on our anniversary, that was easy, they even have valet parking. The meal was good, we paid $235 for everything and it was well worth it. The combo seafood plate was on another level, she washed it down with imported champagne (How else do you do it?)... Next time I'm going with my favorite steak, bone-in Rib eye but I definitely can't knock the filet, it was descent. The service and the ambiance was good too. We ended the night with complimentary chocolate mousse and a cheese-mango dessert. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.
author: Alex S.

description: OMG this shrimp I cannot stop thinking about!!!! We ordered a few items, filet mignon, bone in rib eye, shrimp single skillet to share, stuffed potato, brussel sprouts.....all I can think of is the bread and shrimp.....next time I wont even bother with the steak, the shrimp alone will do....the bread is also AMAAAZING....the brussel sprouts were very good, the stuffed potatoe was good on the top layer but a little hard in the middle....they also played good music while eating on a Saturday night.....
author: Elena B.

description: Celebrated my birthday here a few months ago, best steak experience I've ever had. Can't wait to go back!
author: Dan D.

description: Oh boy this place right here...  So we had date night and I called this place and was lucky to get a table for 2 on a Saturday night at 7PM while calling the same evening around 5PM.  I'm soooo glad we got a table.  We had a table at the bar by the window but had full service.  The crab was sooo good.  I can't wait to go back. Parking is free.  This place got packed.
author: Tina D.

description:
I first heard about Bobo's through my coworker.  She raved about them and their consistantly delicious steaks and so I thought I would go ahead and give them a try.  We made a reservation for 7pm and we were running late.  I was afraid this would be a problem and I made sure to give them a call giving them a heads up.  Thankfully they were very understanding and reassured me that it would be no problem at all.  

When we finally arrived, we were greeted with a smile and led to our semi private table which was pretty romantic.  The place was dimly lit and decorated in a sort of Moroccan theme with lanterns hanging from the ceiling.  There was Frank Sinatra playing in the background and the vibe was just relaxing after a long day.  

After careful thought, we decided to order the Bone In Filet Minion, the cranberry walnut and blue cheese salad, and the mac and cheese side.  We also ordered the loaded baked potatoe side.  Before our courses arrived, the waiter brought some bread which seemed to be flavorful and infused with garlic.  Everything was pretty good.  The Filet Minion can perfectly medium rare.  The salad was refreshing and not too vinegary.  The mac and cheese was just ok.  it was good, but after a couple of bites you get tired of the flavor.  The loaded baked potatoe was amazing.  I would definitely order this again as a side.  

Overall, everything was good.  It wasnt knocks your socks off amazing, but it was good.
author: Christine D.

description: This place reminds me of a northern Italian gypsy style. Great for two. Priced a little higher than should be.Everything is Alavert. Ribeye was amazing. Come after the 9 o'clock hour
author: Jason B.

description: This place is very very good. And it deserves five stars. But it is not the best steak in San Francisco. Certainly Harris Restaurant and Ruth's are better, and even those two are not the best. Almost any high-end restaurant in San Francisco serves a decent filet mignon. Having said all that, I really do love this place. It's like a slice of San Francisco from the 1970s.
author: Girlie G.

description: The food was really good. However, the customer service sucks. It all starts with the head of any business. "The Owner" along with the staff is very rude.
author: Rosalyn Y.

description:
It's been a long time since I had fantastic food AND excellent service at the same time. My favorite steak place is Peter Luger; and now Bobo's is right up there with it.
The steak was cooked to perfection with the perfect char/sear, however you want to call it. The side dishes were great, especially the Brussels sprouts. But TEO really, truly made this dining experience superb. He was on top of everything, from bringing out the food with great timing, asking about the food, constantly topping off our wine, and the fabulous dessert. 
Definitely a great experience, would request for TEO again, and surely another visit in the near future.
author: Super C.

description:
I changed my rating.  was so excited to hear about Bobos because I was told they had great crab and steak so we made a reso and invited another couple to join us. I was not over the top about anything I had I am sorry to say except our bill was over the top . 
The steak- bone in filet was a nice size. The steak looked beautiful and the first bite was off the charts delicious. But I ordered medium plus and it came back medium rare. The same for my husband. I sent mine back and he kept his but could not eat it since he can't stomach a rare steak. My steak came back way over cooked. If we were not with friends I would have complained again but did not want to seem high maintenance. So I said nothing. The crab flavor was delicious but way over cooked and way too greasy. The lobster Mac and cheese was over cooked and I'm not sure if there was any lobster in the dish. 
Sorry to write a review like this but I want to be honest about our experience. I am more Disappointed to have spent so much money on a meal and not happy with the outcome on all we ordered. Not sure I would give it another try. In fact my main purpose for going to this restaurant was to order the crab but the waiters lack of enthusiasm was not impressive.
author: Lynette J.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday and we were not disappointed. 

Atmosphere: We didn't want to go to a "chain" steak house - in my boyfriends prior profession he used to go to steak houses while traveling and with clients so we were definitely looking for atmosphere, character and something more local. Bobos delivered. We got to sit on the second floor in a private booth with an awesome old school chandelier. The entire restaurant had a lot of character and charm, great staff and vibe. 

Food: To start we got the yellowtail carpaccio and caesar salad. The yellowtail was great - highly recommend and it's not something we were expecting to order at a steak house. The caesar salad was good also but quality wise comparable to any other sit down restaurant.

My boyfriend got the New York Strip and I got the filet mignon. We also ordered the twined baked potato. My steak was cooked perfectly but the New York strip was a little more medium than medium rare and pretty decent sized. 

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because it was a little expensive and having been too many steak houses expect a lot. It was quality but in general the food wasn't "unique".
author: Chelsea M.

description:
I've been coming to bobos for years and was fairly content with each visit.  Yesterday was my first time there in a long time.  Expecting the usual good food and atmosphere, I was absolutely mortified.

The iron platter of mussels and shrimp was overcooked. The shells on the mussels would shatter at the slightest touch.  The shrimp were like overchewed bubblegum.

The filet mignon I ordered medium temp, arrived almost alive. Thought it was going to moo if I stuck it with the fork.

The brussel sprouts and bacon was the lowest of the low.  It was overboiled and salty.  It was barely green. More like a mint green.  Bland and soft and gross.

Their only saving grace was their server. He was so nice and cordial.  But, after we complained about the food, he didn't try and make amends with at least drinks on the house.

3 people $300+ and walked out feeling tired off.

They should be renamed to nono's or dontgo.

If any proprietor is reading this, please fix your restaurant.  I'd like to come back.
author: Christopher C.

description: Absolutely fantastic. From start to finish. Solid service, great food and just an overall wonderful evening. I had the Bone-in Filet and it was mouth watering. My fiancé had the crab and it was just as good. We finished it all and would've licked the plate if it was allowed.  Would highly recommend and go back next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Chris S.

description: Not a big fan, the quality of the filet mignon was up there with the best, however it was not flavored to the best of its ability. I've had better steaks. The twice baked potato was chunky, not a huge fan of it. The decor is very shabby, looks like there is something leaking from the ceiling. The waiter was rude! Not to mention my glass had lipstick on and the glass in the next table had a dirty ring around it. Oh and the menus, full of yesterday, last week, last month, possibly last year's grease stains(gross)! Did I mention that the waiter was RUDE?! We went to Off The Grid right after and ate better food there, that was way more affordable. Would not recommend or return.
author: Anony M.

description:
I ate at Bobo's on a whim, only hearing briefly about it from my friend. I'm usually not a steak person, but i really really enjoyed my meal. Here's why:

I chose Bobo's for my friend's birthday (not really expecting much), and I called to make sure that they would include a candle on the dessert. We got there a little early and we were a little under dressed..it was a hot weekend and i was wearing some daisy dukes..opps. anyway, people here wear a little bit more clothes than i was, and I felt a little out of place. The waiter heard my comment about dressing up and he reassured me and said none of the staff cares what we wear (whew).

We got seated upstairs and we immediately ordered our wine. Since they're known for their bone-in filet, we each got that and my friend ordered it with the crab.

The food came out pretty fast, starting with the salad. I thought the salad had too much dressing, but it was still good. Now onto the meat:

1. bone-in filet mignon - i'm usually not a steak person, but i really enjoyed this slab of meat. it was cooked just right, very juicy and tender with a hint of smokiness. 

2. crab - order this if you don't mind working for your meal. it was a little messy, but the crab is super meaty. the portion was pretty big and i thought it was total worth the price.

3. now onto the best part of dinner, the carbs:
    - Mac n Cheese - this was the BEST mac n cheese i've ever had. it tastes like sourdough bread! i can eat 3 plates of this, it was so good.
    - house bread - i usually don't review the complementary bread, but this bread was like a loaf you buy at an artisan bread shop. legit.

4. dessert - i wasn't a fan of the dessert. i got the strawberry cheesecake - it had no crust! and we all know the crust is the best part.

overall, an A- dinner.
author: Andy H.

description:
This place is terrible and overpriced. No wonder it was the only steak place with plenty reservation slots on a Saturday. And that's the only reason I came here. Very regretful, 

Service was terrible. 
Cocktails was terrible!
Food was extremely pricy and very mediocre (had the ribeye, crab cakes, sides etc) 
Ambiance - also terrible, lights were dim so you can't see exactly how terrible the food looks. 

Aweful. Its a tourist trap because it's on Van Ness / Lombard and ppl probably come here only when the good steak houses are fully booked
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for my surprise 21st birthday dinner. He made reservations and we were seated immediately. 

You don't have to worry about parking, because there is free valet parking available. If you don't trust valet parking, you can just park your car yourself and ask for a parking permit/paper to place in your car. 

The overall place was a small restaurant. It was very dark and dim, but also a very quiet place. Service was excellent, they knew that it was my birthday and did special accommodations for me. 

We had a three course meal and here are my breakdown of each dish.

Complementary bread: The bread was good.. and a little bit hard, I found it rather difficult to pull a piece of bread out and eat.

Lobster crostini: basically cold lobster served ontop of bread. Reminded me alot of Bruschetta. I would recommend if you love lobster, otherwise, it's not really worth the price.

Surf and Turf with Mussels and Filet Mignon: Usually they offer the surf and turf with crab and the filet, however I was rather sick on my birthday, and it's bad for the throat to eat crab. So instead, I request if I can have mussels instead. The filet mignon... was to die for. It was absolutely one of the best filet mignon I ever had in my life. The mussels were also very good. They were roasted to perfection, where the shells became so thin that it breaks with a touch...yet the meat wasn't overcooked and dry. 

Twice baked potato: Once again... one of the best baked potato I ever had in my life x.x Highly recommended. 

Cheesecake with strawberry: The cheesecake was good, but I don't remember it being anything phenomenal.

The Dream Martini: Good drink! My first legal drink! Yay! 

TLDR; Free parking, get the filet mignon and twice baked potato.
author: Jenny N.

description: LOVED Bobos!!!! We stayed across the street at the Lombard Inn & decided to have dinner at Bobos. The ambience and seating arrangements are pretty neat, we sat up against the window facing the city which was pretty cool. All of the food we got was just so amazing. We split a 150oz Porterhouse, 1/2 lb of crab, the cauliflower, and onion rings. All were just soooo delicious. Highly recommend checking it out!
author: Kerry J.

description: Went here Saturday evening and I was a bit disappointed.. I enjoyed the ambiance. The easy music, dim lights, pictures on the wall, the free valet service was convenient & plus. Our server was really cool and personable, he made the experience worth while. The one knock was the food.. For the price that is asked for all the food the taste didn't do it for me. I had a medium bone in filet, crab and twice baked potato. The steak was cooked good but the taste was underwhelming. The crab was over cooked and the twice baked potato was just ok. Overall it was a good experience but this place will be a one and done especially for the price.
author: Donavon B.

description: This place truly deserves 5 stars. My family and I left extremely pleased. The mussels, shrimp and crab was superb! My sister who is vegan was even able to find tasty options! We ordered almost all of there vegetable side dishes, and they were also superb! Our server was very attentive and helpful! Everything on the menu is a la carte. The portions were more than enough and quality was excellent, so the price was worth it. Complimentary valet parking, and just a few blocks away from Ghirardelli Square! All in all, it's a must try if you're in the area!
author: Alexis M.

description: I've had the awesome pleasure of dining here several times, each time has been a delicious experience ~ The service is impeccable, the food outstanding, the wine  list is glorious ~ You can't go wrong with Bobo's ~ My husband and I will be celebrating our 10 year anniversary this October and we definitely plan on dining at Bobo's
author: Latricia S.

description:
Overall the atmosphere here and the food are both great. I've had better tasting steaks for lower prices before but for a date night, it is definitely an experience most can appreciate. 

I recommend the bone in filet mignon and twice baked potato. Both we delicious and were also highly recommended by the employees of the establishment. But for the price you pay it still is a bit disappointing. 

It is also in close proximity to the Palace of Fine Arts, so if you want a beautiful night around the Bay these two places are a great beginning to an amazing night.
author: John S.

description: Was excited to see what the hype was about and when we walked in the vibe is old and dirty like an 80's porno. The crab and lobster was over cooked and chewy. The filet mignon didn't melt in your mouth as it should. I was very disappointed as I've had better filets at Texas Roadhouse. For $600+ meal it was very disappointing. Now my friends, when I recommend a place to eat they second guess my choice and refer back to that, "one time you recommended Bobos".
author: Carmen H.

description:
I've been here three times for special events, enjoyed myself each time, and never got around to reviewing.  I had always ordered crab, which is really great. I got the ribeye this time round, and it was completely amazing.  It was cooked with a perfectly crisp crust on the outside and a perfect medium rare (slightly towards the rare side) inside.  The steak is served a la carte with drippings on the plate.  The baked potato side really stood out.  It's somewhere between baked and twice baked and it has a great scallion flavor.  

Service was attentive, and they did a great job with an older wine I brought (1984), taking the time to serve it correctly.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I came here almost a year ago and still have yet to leave a review. Well, Today is the day! I had taken a look at the pictures before coming here so I knew what to expect. This is not your romantic date night classy steak joint. The decor is absolutely horrifying, gawdy , with a Jester theme and dark paint everywhere.

Now that I have set the mood for you, and you know what to expect on ambiance, on to the food, what we REALLY came here for. I entered with a party of 14, yes 14 people , but with reservations. When we got seated, we were Hangry (Hungry-angry) Our waiter took care of everything, and answered our 101 questions.

Yes, Sides are family style and are for sharing, 2-3 sides are good for 5 people. The bone in fillet Mignon is what they are known for, so it is a must try. I have never been a fan of fillet Mignon, but what a difference a bone makes. I am a total fan!

Sides:
Modern Mac and Cheese 5/5
Brussels sprouts 4/5
Twice-baked potato 4/5

Definitely come to check this place out for great steak in a casual setting in SF. If you are expecting some high end setting like Alexander's don't hold your breath. It's the food we are coming for anyways right?!
author: Sharon N.

description: I've been here over 5 times. Usually the food is decent. Except for my last meal there. I went with 2 friends, we ordered our steaks. I always order it medium rare. Long story short it was raw/frozenish inside, I sent it back a few times it kept coming back frozen, which was weird. They comped the steak, but the meal was still over three hundred bucks, with a steak that I didn't eat. I emailed them twice with no answer. I don't think I will be back unfortunately. The waiter was good (French guy) so were the sides.
author: Yakov Jack I.

description: Great food and great service! The Basil Martini is delicious. The Dungeness Crab Crostini, Crab Cakes, Brussel Sprouts, Mod Mac were delicious. The steak seemed like it could of melted in your mouth. All in all amazing. My only compliant, is the restaurant is small so your kind of cramped in there. I would go back again for sure!
author: Jaimie L.

description:
After seeing this place on several review sites and "Check Please" we finally went to Bobo's for the famous bone in Filet. Since we did not have reservations we went at 8:30 pm. The restaurant was only about half full. The dinning areas are small rooms with tiny tables. Lot's of stairs, cozy intimate interior. I can see why this is a date night romantic dinner location. We came for the 20 oz. Bone-In Filet and that's what we ordered. Really nice cut of meat. Medium Rare was a little cold in the center of the thick cut, but for me it was fine. Yellowtail Carpaccio was over dressed and too salty. The lobster crostini was excellent $18. Cesear Salad was good two small wedges. 

Pro's
service was excellent
quiet intimate decor
bone in filet
Hanger One Basil Martini excellent excellent $14
complimentary valet parking

Con's
Garlic Bread huge loaf  crusty outside bland white bread center came half way through the entree ( might have come earlier but did not fit the table. ) 

Tiny table and chairs the plates, food and glasses are big and do not fit the table.
 
All sides and items are ala carte.

Good meal, good service, $145 before tip.
author: George F.

description:
Came here with 3 friends for a bday on a Wednesday. Decent crowd outside of the fact that this one lady behind me didn't stop (loudly) talking about politics for 2 hours but the food was incredible. 

Apps: The crab legs have this Cajun spice seasoning and were delicious.  Also had the steak tartare and lobster crostini. Both were excellent but would vote the crostini over the tartare. 

Steak: Ordered the New York strip and super bone-in filet. FYI medium rare is more of the rare scale, which is actually cool with me, but a heads up for others. Not much seasoning on the steak which really made the quality of the steak and the expertise of how well it was cooked, stand out. Both were charred black on the outside and had a nice crisp. Inside was incredibly moist, bleeding and succulent. I'm from NYC and would put this against any of the big boys back home. 


Sides: In order of taste: twice baked potatoes (must get), brussel sprouts, cauliflower and Mac & cheese. 

Negatives: Apps and sides could have been a little bigger and was a little disappointed with how small they were.  Would certainly come back even though it's on the pricier side.
author: Joe S.

description:
Came here with the senior management for our company, because we took our CEO. 

First impression as you walk in, it was small.  The bar was small.  Yet, it worked.  It made it feel like it was an actual big bar.  Maybe, the windows made the bar felt bigger.  The decoration wasn't too bad, but it was interesting.  Mirrors definitely helped with the perception of the size of the restaurant.  With the open windows, still, it was dim.

We sat in a round table booth.  We ordered drinks.  Appetizers; they were delicious.  Had the Brussel sprouts.  Very good.  Had the Crisp Crab Cakes; good.  Had the Heirloom Toy Box Tomatoes; good.  Everything was good.  Enjoyed them all.  

I ordered the bone in filet mignon with several sides.  Server recommended the steaks to medium rare.  I did.  The steak was tender and seasoned greatly.  The char was slightly done, and it was done really well.  my boss go the Bone-In New York.  He said it wasn't too bad.  

Sides we had baked yam; was ok.  Cauliflower; was ok.  Twice baked potatoes; good.  

Rating:
Food:  3.5
Ambience:  4 (but needs more lighting)
Service:  4 (I liked our server.)
Price:  3.
Overall:  3

Not sure I would come back for a meal, but I would come back for the bar.
author: James S.

description: Giant piece of meats and great sides. The ambiance is amazing as well as the service. Our server was the best ever. My steak was out of this word, 20 oz filet mignon.. can you wish for anything else? Highly recommended and loved place!
author: Billy B.

description: The place needs to be updated and a thorough cleaning. We ordered the double mussels, shrimp and whole crab. The seafood was not fresh. There was an unpleasant odor and I saw three flies flying around the bar area. It has been very cold so I wondered how the bugs were able to survive. The service was good.I had them bag the food, because my date didn't want to offend the cook. We didn't eat much food at all.   I gave it to the first homeless person I saw.
author: M T.

description:
Pretty solid steak. Very good that they give the filet a twist by offering a bone in version. This was a great cut of meat aged over 10day. Soft easy cut with lots of flavor, this was a choice steak. The grilling was done pan style likely with butter and the medium rare I chose was done to slight perfection. Not easy to get a bone in type steak done perfect through out the whole thing, they did a great job.

Crab was excellent. These things are cooked in some broth or marinade or something that adds a level amount of salt and such that pops nicely and makes for a good sideline to the steak.

The crab cake was not exciting. Won't waste time writing about that.

Brussels sprouts sucked. Soggy boring and only part about these was picking out the bacon.

Bread is excellent. I can't get enough damn sourdough in this town.

Drinks are strong, they are prepared well too, my Hendricks tonic had a slice of cucumber in it. Liked that.

Service was decent, nothing out of the ordinary. 

The dining room and ambiance was excellent. Lots of cool stuff around, the music is funny though. I haven't heard "eye of the tiger" in a high end steak house in...ever.

So to end, I would come back. I won't waste time expectations or money on their weak ass sides though. My tip to readers is to enjoy a pre dinner drink at the cool small bar first, set the pace with that and you will knock the edge off so you can not be irritated about their sides heheh
author: B S.

description: We came from Las Vegas visiting for Valentine's Day and decided upon this place for dinner, because of the reviews on Yelp. I made reservations 2 months earlier for 7:15. When we got there at 7:10, the hostess told me they were running really late behind, so we could sit at the bar which was right behind the hostess stand. The bar was packed and there was only a side table to sit at. People were standing all over the bar like sardines. Wait staff that were passing us, and people in the bar with food, would hit the tables (that we were sitting on) or we would have to duck not to be hit by the trays. We finally got sat at 8:15 (an hour later). I ordered a filet mignon and crab legs. I've honestly had better at Outback Steakhouse. I was so excited to come here and experience great San Francisco dining, but customer service and food were very disappointing. My advice, go somewhere else and spend your money on food and ambiance that is worth it. Don't believe the hype, because celebrity pictures are posted.
author: Elaina A.

description:
When I arrive at Bobo's I had no background knowledge or preconceptions of this establishment. After I left I had quite an impression.

Encore please +'s:
+ Not a stuffy stay. Enjoyed the jacquard booth seating and draped curtains. The place is tight but downright cozy.
+ Bone in filet mignon is one of the best dry-aged steaks I've ever had. Medium rare is obviously the way to go. Try 16 oz ($51.95) or 20 oz ($66.95).
+ Service was spectacular. Renaud made a great explanation of the menu and his recommendations. He appeared at all the right moments to ensure service was attentive without being overdone.
+ Yellowtail carpaccio ($15.95) was a light appetizer that was an easy start to a highly caloric meal. Seasoned well.

No on seconds -'s:
- Seating was deplorable. We had a 7:45 and didn't get seated till 8:15. That's fine because we were promised a booth upstairs. When we were seated, we were seated in the open. Another couple who had arrived AFTER us was seated in the coveted spot. The hostesses had miscommunicated with one another and did not offer anything but a mere "sorry." We had two drinks comped (we should not have to be the ones to ask for it) but it failed on so many rounds. Unacceptable compensation for wasting our time for a special occasion.
- The menu is dated. Nothing inventive here. If you want middle of the road then by all means this is what you will get: twice baked potato ($9.95 for one potato), modern mac and cheese ($9.95), brussel sprouts, standard salads and the tiring chocolate cake with raspberry. We are stuck in the 80s.
- The birthday surprise (usually $2) is an ice cream cone served upside down on a plate with a small spoonful of chocolate mousse, a raspberry and two mint leaves. I don't get it but it's free if you want it for your birthday.

Being locals of SF and the Bay Area for over 20 years, we love supporting great restaurants. I am afraid this will not warrant a return.
author: Yiven C.

description:
I seriously don't get what the fuss is about.  I've heard great things about Bobo's, where people rave that it's their favorite steak house in SF, but my impression & meal seemed subpar.  

My girlfriend took me here for my birthday, and it was the most expensive meal we've ever had.  Price aside, I didn't find the food that tasty either.  I ordered the surf & turf (bone-in ribeye with crab), along with the mod mac and twice baked potato for sides.  I usually order my steak medium rare, but when I got my plate, the steak seemed way too pink for my liking, and more on the rare side.  I had to ask the waiter if this was correct, but apparently that's how they cook their steak.  The steak was very soft, chewy, and also runny.  The crab was good, because it's drenched in garlic butter.  The mod mac was decent, but if you're only going to get one side, then I would recommend the twice baked potato.  It's so good!

Overall, I'd expect to have the best meal I ever had for the price I paid.  The portion size is very filling, but the food itself wasn't to my liking.  The steak was just way too undercooked and bloody.
author: Eric L.

description:
Bobo's was voted #1 Steakhouse in San Francisco by the Bay Area A-List. So I brought my husband along to see what makes it the cream of the crop. 

1. Complimentary valet parking. Very convenient since parking is a bit difficult to find in & within the Lombard radius. 

2. The decor is eclectic but warm & inviting. Reminds me of the 1960s...There is a bar as you walk in, to your right are tables for small groups & couples, upstairs is for bigger groups enough to fit maybe 3 large groups of 8. Restrooms are upstairs too. 

3. The food. Started off with a big loaf of freshly baked garlic bread with a crunchy crust and bits of baked garlic on the surface. 

4. Bone in filet mignon - oh my God!! It's the bomb! There aren't a lot of steakhouses that serve bone in dry aged steaks but this one won the trophy! It's very tender (med rare of course) and made me want to pick it up with my fingers and eat it like the way I do with fried chicken. My husband did this and the Neanderthal man came out of him. Lol! It was so tender that I could peel off the meat from the bone (although some portion I had to slice off with a knife but it still came off easily). 

Overall, I'm putting in my vote to keep it #1.
author: Ammie A.

description: Absolute favorite place for steak in the city! It's intimate and you will be close to people. But  he personal service and ambience is amazing!
author: L J.

description: You would think they would know how to cook their Super Bone In Filet and not over cook it the first time and then recook a new then serve me a raw cold steak. I asked for medium got well done the first time and then the second time it came out cold as ice and rare as all hell. $62 dollars down the drain but hey you live and you learn I guess. Definitely won't be coming back.
author: Giancarlos P.

description:
Whenever I visit home, I really try to pick a delicious meat-eating resaturant for my family and I to enjoy. This time, I opted for Bobo's mainly so I could get my steak and my mom could get her fish. 

I showed up at 5PM, right when they open. They do have complimentary valet, which is a plus since parking can be a pain in this area.

Their decor is super awesome. It almost feels like walking through a Mardi Gras parade with all the costumes and decorations. Their music choice was a bit random with old school stuff and slightly too loud for background music. 

The layout was a little weird too. This place is slightly cramped, which probably explains their 3 story set up. They have a bar to hang out at on the first floor.

We were seating immediately. We ended up ordering the crab cakes and the lobster soup for appetizers. The crab cakes and the perfect amount of crisp. I wasn't a fan of the soup though. It was too much curry and not enough soup. It felt like I was straight up drinking curry. They also came out with their house bread with garlic sauce. Man, that sauce! If you enjoy garlic, you will enjoy this.

I opted for the bone-in filet. I usually order medium rare and hope for the best. Here, I ordered a medium rare and got a medium rare! What a treat! It was very delicious, tender and filling!

We ended up ordering 3 sides for the table: Loaded potatos, mushrooms and brussel sprouts. The loaded potato was sooo gooood! Every bite was a potato overload! You must order this! The brussels sprouts were really delicious too! Then again, not many people like brussels sprouts My brother enjoyed the mushrooms a lot but I felt like they put too much olive oil sauce in it. Maybe that's just me though. 

My mom also ordered the basa fish. They cooked that fish PERFECTLY! If I wasn't biased for my love of steak, I would almost say that the fish was way better!

For dessert, we all shared the dunce cap cones and the mango wanna cotta. I normally LOVE mango more, but the dunce cap cones were amazing. The chocolate was sooo rich, even my mom, who's not a chocolate eater loved it. The mango was not too sweet, which I appreciated. 

Overall, I've very satisfied with my meal. Great job, Bobo's!
author: Jessica Y.

description: Overpriced mediocre food.  When you spend $200 for dinner for 2, you'd expect the food and service to be excellent.  After spending upwards of $60 for a steak, you'd think you would get a side with it.  Nope.  You can get a small twice baked potato and cold cauliflower au gratin for $10 apiece.  Really?  The waiter was terrible.  My husband ordered before me because I hadn't decided what I wanted.  30 minutes later and I still hadn't ordered.  Had to track him down and tell him I still hadn't ordered yet.  He seriously looked like he was on something.  Never made it to dessert.  Something tells me that would have been a disappointment too.
author: Allison J.

description:
We ordered 1 Caesar salad's and 2 crab cakes they were about the size of a half dollar. We paid 82.67!!!
We ordered crab on top of the salad and didn't get it. So we called the restaurant and they said we did not order it. Very over price place and the food was not good.
author: Robert H.

description:
The steak- It's impeccable. And I'm not talking about the Filet Mignon, I'm talking about the Bone-in Filet Mignon. The bone adds flavor and dimension. I've had both, on different occasions of course, and it will always be the Bone-in Filet hands down. They give you their gigantic carving knife to cut into a steak so soft and juicy; it cuts like butter. It practically melts in your mouth. And I love mine medium rare with a nice full-bodied red. The twice baked potato was great as well. I always get it. The sweet potato is alright, it's not my favorite and it's very small portioned. The Mac and cheese is pretty good, I liked it, very cheesy. I would still choose the twice baked potato over the Mac and cheese but that's just my preference. 

A good starter are the Crab cakes, they're great and they come with cranberry on the side which pair really nicely together. The Apples, walnuts, sun dried cranberries salad are great as well, it comes with bleu cheese and a tasty vinaigrette to open your palate. I love the garlic shrimp, they're delicious and they come with a thing of melted butter to dip. Down side is they come with shells but it's not that bad to peel. And if your not full and want to top yourself off with dessert, the mango panna cotta is my fave. Nice, light and creamy. 

Let me not forget to tell you, they give you amazing bread to eat while waiting for you food. It's thick and seasoned well. I love it. It's easy to spend around $200 for two people, I've done it but I don't regret it.  Hope you like Bobo's.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Ask for Sergio.  He was the most attentive, cute and hilarious waiter and put up with us 3 city girls.  He'll even make you laugh with his Chicken out of a Napkin magic trick :) 

How have I not been here sooner?! After 5 1/2 years of living in SF, I finally got my fix.  We started at the bar with delicious cocktails admiring the decor.  It really is a hidden gem.  Once our table was ready, the manager showed us up the stairs to a dark red room that made us feel like we were in another world.  After chowing down the delicious and thick garlic bread, we waited patiently for our filet's.

I prefer surf and turf because why not?  Everything was so tasty and I am still full from last night's dinner.  I prefer my crab with just melted butter, their concoction included butter, rosemary and white wine sauce which was a little too heavy for my liking.

We had a blast.  We laughed. We drank.  We ate FILET's.  How could life get any better?

Thanks for such a great dining experience Sergio and the management who comped our desserts after my crab was a little overcooked.  Don't fret my pet.  I will be back!
author: Jenny B.

description: We ordered a medium new Yorker and a mussel and shrimp. The steak was OK but expected something more juicier. The mussel is bad, some of them aren't fresh, some of them are overcooked(burnt and dried)
author: 靜宜

description:
Worth every penny! Service was great! Food was expensive, but amazing!

My boyfriend and I split the super bone in 20 oz steak, brussel sprouts and twice baked potatoes. He is notorious for eating super slow, but he downed his half in less than 5 minutes, so you know it was good!
author: Julia T.

description:
I haven't been to a steakhouse in a while. And I love love love steak! Any time I go to any type of restaurant, I automatically want to order the steak! Since I was craving a real steak last Friday, I decided to try Bobo's. I'm glad I did cuz I really enjoyed the experience! 

Complimentary bread: I normally don't even touch the bread when it's on the table, but this was sooo good! Nice and crusty on the outside but warm and chewy on the inside. And with garlic and olive oil, I just couldn't resist!

Caesar with croutons & shaved parmigiano reggiano: I love it when a caesar salad has a nice anchovy flavor. This salad had that in the dressing with anchovies on top! Yum!

Half crab & petit filet mignon: I normally order crab cakes at steakhouses, but since I was craving a salad I decided to do surf and turf instead. I was actually expecting more in terms of the crab. If you see half crab, you'd expect to have half a whole crab right? Including the yummy head goodness! But what I got was delish! The legs were nicely roasted. The steak was perfectly rare and just what I wanted!

Bone in new york (dry aged up to six weeks): I had one bite which was actually pretty tender for a new york cut. My friend enjoyed it too cuz he gobbled up the whole steak! 

Mod mac modern mac & cheese: Something about this didn't work for me. It was cheesy and had a nice crunchy top, but it didn't that that gooey cheesiness that expect from a comforting plate of mac & cheese.

Service was nice and attentive. And you get free valet parking! Just remember to tip! :)
author: Elena N.

description: Had a reservation at 8:15. Was not seated till 8:45. Hostesses did not seemed to concerned about the time. Food was good. Server needed a bit more personality.
author: Douglas T.

description: Best Filet Mignon. Service was excellent too. I thought of that meal weeks and weeks after until now.
author: rob u.

description:
Great neighborhood staple. You can never go wrong with steak or crab from here. Even their house salads are awesome, yes to avocado.

Friendly servers, funky decor, great quality food that's always the same and predictably excellent. I love it! One of our favorite date night spots, also a great place to take mom and dad when in town. Love that they have valet. 

Decent wine list but we like bringing a nice bottle of our own being the corkage fee is only $25. We always order a cocktail to start, definitely suggest that! Great bartender on staff.
author: Meredith M.

description:
Very expensive but not really worth the extra costs. Shrimp were rather small and oily and not very tasty. And YOU have to take the shells off, really!!
 I had the 9oz filet mignon which was about $53 and was very good but so not worth the premium price. Also had the Cesar salad the for $12 was very very small.. also had the twice baked potato which was very good but for $10 should have been bigger. Also ordered the Brussels sprouts which were probably the best of all sides ordered.. they were good.
I really expected a much better dining experience and was disappointed. Keep looking for a better restaurant because this is just not worth the money.
author: Photon X.

description:
Reservations Thursday evening - 6:30pm

From the minute you walk in the door of BOBO's,  you're blown away! Fancy, elegant decor with the Venetian theme!  Loved the unique cool vibe of the red colors and dim lighting, with a horseshoe-shape bar.   

We were seated, upstairs promptly. After looking over the menu, Jack ordered a bottle of wine. 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon was our beverage of choice.  Complementary bread with oil/vinegar was immediately presented.  Out of the many appetizer choices, we ordered the Lobster Crostini, which had lobster, avocado, & a garlic aioli served on top of a toasted bun. It came with only two pieces. However, it was REALLY good. The bread was toasted perfectly, and there was a generous amount of lobster. Super delicious!

For our main, Since I am not your typical carnivore, I ordered the Double Shrimp & Half Crab Skillet. Jack ordered the 20 oz Rib-Eye (medium rare). My shrimp & crab was delicious!  The garlic flavors were just perfect and just the right amount of seasoning. OMG! It was truly yummy!  Jack truly enjoyed the Rib-Eye and said the Chef at Bobo's really knows how to cook a medium-rare steak. He said it was like butter to cut and an excellent taste. We also ordered a couple of sides (actually our eyes were probably bigger than our stomach!), we had the Twice-Baked Potato, which was so different as it was stuffed with zucchini, chives & fontina cheese.    The skin even had a crunch to the skin & was drizzled with sour cream. To Die For!!!  The other side was the Portobello Mushrooms which went perfectly with Jack's steak and my garlic-y seafood.  Soooooo good! We even forced ourselves to have the Strawberry Cheesecake, it was fluffy and almost the texture of a tiramisu.  Scrumptious!

The service was spot on!  Our waiter was friendly and helpful, but seemed to have too many tables to wait on. No real complaints, however. 

Complimentary valet parking. My first time at Bobo's. Jack's second.  Definately recommend for a special occasion. Like I said, the ambience is definately unique. Swanky, nice vibe.
author: Janet T.

description:
Why oh WHY have I not been here before?!!!?!!!?
Food? DELICIOUS. 
Service? SULER SWEET, ATTENTIVE AND REAL. 
Ambience? QUIRKY AND VERY CHARMING. 
And of course does it help that after dinner upstairs and a nitecap at the bar they came running after me to bring me my clutch  I'd left behind as I sat in my ride home? ... THIS MADE IT ALL YHE MORE AMAZING. . 
Thanks for a FANTASTIC  EVENNG. 
And THANK YOU for your efforts at the end of the evening to rescue same.
author: Wendy Y.

description:
My friend chose this place for dinner because of of her friends had told her this was the BEST filet in town. I read the reviews and it seemed everybody else agreed this was the best bone-in filet they had ever had. 

We had the first reservation of the evening, and it was pretty dead in there. Our waitress was really nice and super on top of everything.

For drinks we all had different cocktails and they were all very good. I liked my Moscow Mojito very much, a perfect combo of two of my favorite cocktails.

We started with salads and soup. My boyfriend had the Baby Blue and it was awesome. A very large wedge salad with tons of blue cheese, a delicious creamy dressing, and lots of chunks of pancetta. My Lobster soup was amazing, if you like curry, you must order this! It was a very flavorful, delicious soup. 

They also bring about half a loaf of bread to the table that has roasted garlic all over the top, and the garlic flavor had permeated the bread. It was wonderful, and was a perfect bread to sop up my soup with. 

All of us ordered the bone-in filet. It was HUGE! The menu didn't say how many ounces it was, but it had to have been at least 10. And at only $45 it was a great deal. Was it the best filet I had ever had? No. We all felt it was under-seasoned, but it wasn't bad. Perhaps people think it is the best because you get so much meat for such a low price. Either way, it was a good filet, just not one that would make me run back here to have again.

Overall, a good dinner. I think the soup and salads were what made me push this place to a four instead of a three.
author: Randi B.

description:
I came here for a family dinner to celebrate my birthday last week. This place is fantastic! The food and service were exceptional. We made a reservation and were seated immediately upstairs. I ordered the famous bone in filet and crab. The filet mignon was definitely the best I have had, anywhere. It was so well seasoned and tender, as was the crab. It is pricey, but worth every penny!

*On a side note, this place is definitely not for children. The tables are very small and close together, they do not offer a kids menu and there is only ONE high chair for the entire restaurant. Leave the kids at home for this one!
author: Andreea M.

description:
Amazing bone in filet mignon. Twice baked potato is yummy. Crab cakes are delicious. Bacon mac & cheese is ok. 

The space is tight but delicious food. Reservations in advanced is always recommended.
author: C R.

description: Great steak in a great city! Sat at the bar to eat and have a drink. Bartender, Keith, was very attentive and helpful with menu selections. His place felt familiar although it was my first time. It certainly won't be my last.
author: Dan M.

description:
Yahoo!  Steak heaven, and I do mean angels delivered it with all the accoutrements.

The bone-in filet was top notch even though the portion was large and left us with doggie bags to take home.  Excellent sides with Brussels sprouts, twice baked potato, etc.

No room for dessert.  Will come back again.
author: Susan C.

description:
Free valet, parking on the streets is not that bad either. Restaurant decoration is like New Orleans/Mardi Gras - definitely eccentric. 

The steaks are delicious, tender, juicy, and HUGE. $50 dollar for a good portion of steak. The twice baked potato is a must, and yes the skin is edible. The bread is store made and quite delicious.

Unfortunately. the waiter was slow to take orders and slow to bring even the bread. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time if you can even get your order in. This took away from an otherwise great dining experience. 

This place costs a bit more than house of prime rib, mainly because you have to pay for all the sides here. Given that, I'd rather go to HOPR for better service and similar quality beef.
author: Long C.

description:
Bobo's for Valentine's Day dinner!

This steakhouse is unique in its entirety.  With its dimly lit setting, mini chandeliers hanging, cozy dining tables and red themed decor, the ambiance offered intimacy and exuded a sultry manner.

They have a bar to lounge at and different sections of this small two-floor restaurant, to dine in.

We ordered up the mussels and half a loaf of garlic bread came with it.  The mussels arrived sizzling with a buttery dipping sauce!  Both went deliciously well with each other!

Next, the twice baked potato as a side order, is special in a way that the chopped chives stuffed in the baked potato, enhanced the baked potato, altogether!  It was undeniable to have another bite or so of this side!

Last, but not least, came the bone in filet mignon cooked medium rare - the way I love my steaks cooked!  Usually filet mignons, are just known for being tender, but not only was this filet mignon tender, it was nicely cooked, flavorful and oozing with juicy steak flavor!  Yummy!  

Service was consistent and Bobo's offered complimentary valet parking!

Mr. Valentine's swept me away at Bobo's with fine filet mignon!  Thank you!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Rib Eye
Medium Rare
Enough said.  

*sides are not as large as expected, should order 1  side per person.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Bobo, where the crowd is hip..
Bobo, where the bartender knows his stuff..
Bobo, where the service is worth going back..
Bobo, Where you'll find the yummiest crab..
Bobo, Where, how we love their bone in fillet.. over and over..

Bobo, ain't no one like him...
author: Michelle A.

description:
For context, the standard steak is $55 and the a la carte sides are on the small side and $10.  For this price point I have certain expectations.

Service, as seems to be the norm in San Francisco, was simply not good:
- waiter cleared only the plate from the first course and placed used silverware on the table
- waiter attempted to clear my plate while the rest of the table was still eating multiple times

The restaurant was uncomfortably warm. The décor was stale.

My steak was severely over done (medium well when ordered a medium rare). That being said, the food was still pretty good.
author: Drew H.

description:
I have been to Bobo's a couple times when I was in San Francisco, and each time was an enjoyable experience with great food.  I have tried both their Porterhouse Steak and their Bone In Filet Mignon Steak cooked to medium, and it they were both delicious!  Their beef is aged to perfection for it to be so tender.  And each cut is quite on the lean side with minimal amounts of fat on the sides.

The Porterhouse was huge, and was cooked medium.  It wasn't dry at all, and it came out perfectly.  The meat was so tender and flavorful that I devoured it like a hungry growing boy.

The Filet Mignon with a bone was also tastefully prepared! It was cooked to medium and the steak was thick.  The aroma was as good as it tastes, with just the perfect amount of flavor. The steak was tender and easy to eat. 

We also ordered sides of brussel sprouts and macaroni n cheese.  The brussel sprouts was tender, but may be a bit overcooked... while the mac n cheese was good but wish it was a bit more flavorful if there was more garlic added.  But no complaints because we need side orders to enhance our steaks.  

I also ordered a side of Arugula Salad which is lettuce mixed with honey roasted walnuts with dried pears and cranberries, cherry tomatoes, parmesan cheese and an oil and vinegar dressing.  It was delicious!  The vinegar dressing was a bit on the sour side, while the pear and cranberries neutralized it with a touch of sweetness. Oh my... I loved it.

The waiter was really attentive to our party.  He made sure the dirty dishes were put away, and kept filling our glasses with water, while kept asking if we needed anything else.  He was very nice and professional which is a huge plus.

We made reservations and had to wait a little longer than anticipated for them to get our table ready.  Yes, we had a large party since it was a friend's birthday dinner, and the steakhouse was a bit on the squishy side.  I felt a bit on the claustrophobic side since it was crowded inside with little room to maneuver.  The whole restaurant is well kept and it's decor made the ambiance more on the classy side. 

Looking for parking on the street will be tough.  So it's better to have your car parked by the valet parking attendant.  It's free! Just tip him a couple bucks when you come out.

Yes, this is a wonderful place to enjoy a delicious steak.  I highly recommend it, and I will be back again.
author: ED L.

description:
Reservations for 14
Saturday evening

Some of the party arrived earlier than our reserved time and they would not seat us until most of us arrived so we waited around the bar.  After waiting at the bar for a bit, our party arrived and we were finally seated.  

For one server to take care of a table of 14, he did an amazing job!  He made great recommendations, answered all of our questions, and got all of our orders correct and best of all, everything came out at the same time.  

Food wise......it was excellent, but the portions for their sides were a bit on the smaller side.

I ordered the bone in filet med rare, which I should've ordered rare. The meat was perfectly cooked and melted in my mouth.  Side of brussels sprouts and modern mac n cheese.  Friend next to me ordered a whole crab, came out steaming hot and very fresh.  We also brought our own wine and corkage was only $15.  Loved the ambiance, decor, service, and the food.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in the mood for steak.
author: Erica C.

description:
For my birthday, my girlfriend treated me to a fancy dinner at Boboquivaris. I don't know which melted faster; my heart or the Filet Mignon in my mouth.

Probably the Filet Mignon :)

Bobo's Boned-In Filet at medium rare is a piece of steak masterpiece. The steak was so soft that you can eat it even right after getting all your wisdom teeth pulled. The flavor exudes on to the taste buds and then the aroma through the nostrils. I felt like I could eat it forever but I actually couldn't finish my Super Boned-In (20 oz), so you really gotta know thyself before you stuff thyself.

Mollusks are really good for your body after an intense workout so you should definitely hustle for the Mussels to take care of your muscles. They are served sizzling on a skillet platter with a cheese-like dip to boot. Totally worth it!

We made the mistake of ordering the $15 Riesling for dessert which came in something like a 15mml wine glass lol. It was really sweet and tasty tho, but I'm not diagnosed with affluenza so i can't order that on the regular. 

The Strawberry Cheesecake was good too, but the REAL icing on the cake is that Bobo offers Complimentary Valet   : )
author: Ringo M.

description:
Overall experience: meh.

Food was fine, service was good, restaurant is cool. If you're spending $180 for 2 people, your money is better spent at a myriad of other places. The $50 steaks at Alexander's are head and shoulders and torso better than the bone in filet we had, which was tender but flavorless. The crab was pretty dry and the butter sauce was overpowering. The Brussels sprouts were fine. Mac and cheese was good but I'm not writing home about it.

I'd maybe go back if it was half the price, but if I'm splurging, I'm not going back there. Which means I'm probably not going back.

I've eaten at most steak places in the city, this doesn't make top 5. Maybe not even top 10. 

I also think you, the Yelper reading this, should weigh my opinion on steak a little heavier--I'm from Oklahoma and eating red meat is basically my thing. 

**Bonus points for the awesome matchbooks, but unfortunately that doesn't add any stars.
author: Nikki D.

description:
Excellent steak. Cooked perfectly. Always great meal each time I eat here. Great atmosphere. Waitstaff was on point and took wonderful care of us. 

Would consider this in top 10 steak houses I have ever eaten at in the world. It's a must try for anyone.
author: Scott R.

description:
My favorite place to eat steak in the Bay Area!

I love that they offer a petit filet mignon because that is the perfect portion for my 5'4"-113-lb-self. The filet is all things you want your steak to be: not too bloody, not too dry, tender, juicy, mouth watering and full of flavor.

I recommend trying the twice baked potato because it doesn't taste like your average baked potato. The mac and cheese is yummy as well. Oh and I also love that the complimentary bread has garlic cloves in it! 

Also love that they offer FREE valet!
author: Gina H.

description:
If Harley Quinn and the Joker decided to open up a restaurant together, this would be the place.

The decor is circus-like, with a renaissance flare, and the food, well, it was unusual in a good way.

I've traveled to 6 out of 7 continents, but I've never had a filet minion with the bone attached. Unusual, but like I said, in a good way. I prefer my meat rare, but at the advice of our waiter Duy (who was awesome), I took his advice and got the medium rare.

It wasn't as rare as I would have liked, hence the 4 out of 5 stars, but I appreciated his attentive service and advice.

We also got the Caesar salad which was tasty with homemade dressing, and the twice baked potato which I HIGHLY recommend. It went well with the filet.

The chocolate mouse cones and the mango panna cotta for dessert were slightly disappointing. Two small cones for $8.95 filled with dark chocolate mousse, barely two bites, and super rich. I'm more of a milk chocolate person. The panna cotta was something I could get at the North beach bakery for half the price.

Yet, the service was great, and the filet was a nice and tender.

My alter-ego, Batman, would approve.
author: Jack R.

description:
Bobos is a super touristy restaurant that boasts its supposedly fantastic reputation in ads everywhere. Unfortunately we had dinner here and were pretty disappointed. The service was not good and food was average at best. We ordered the dungeness crab crostini and heirloom toy box tomatoes appetizers, two full dungeness crabs, bone-in filet, a few orders of macaroni and cheese (mod mac), and desserts. The crab was great, but everything else was either average or terrible. The mac and cheese was hardly edible (my entire party of 4 felt this way - it tasted so bad that none of us could stomach it). Before coming here, I didn't even know you could screw up mac and cheese!
