Service was also bad. The waiter asked if we would like our appetizers before our crab/steak main dishes. We said yes, we want our appetizers first. Of course, we get the two dungeness crabs first. About half an hour later, we finally get our appetizers. To make matters worse, my aunt's steak did not come until an hour later - after me and my uncle had already finished our crab..... it was pretty unfortunate. She just sat there eating alone until finished. I don't think I've ever experienced such sloooooow service.

Dessert was okay, but nothing memorable. I ordered the strawberry cake slice, and my guests ordered some chocolate cone dessert type thing that I hardly remember. Oh, and a tip: Be sure to ask for water here, because unless you ask, you will never get water. It is their policy due to the drought.
author: J L.

description:
I love me a good steak; and bobo's definitely set the bar as one of the best filet mignons I've had so far. Nothing short of amazing, the bone in filet had just the right flavors and perfectly charred to something mouthwateringly tender with a middle that melts like butter. This, my friends. Is sex on a plate. 

Since I ordered the surf & turf, my filet also came along with crab which I thought was also amazing. Extremely garlicky, just how I like it. I didn't even have to use the garlic butter! They don't come pre-cracked, unfortunately, but they do give you a nut cracker thingy :)

Now on to the mussels. The mussels would probably be the death of me. Succulent and juicy, not to mention hugeeee! Not just the portion, but also the mussels themselves. Ive seen oysters smaller than these babies, and they sure don't skimp on the quality nor quantity. 

If you still have room for dessert at the end of your dinner, I recommend trying their mango panna cotta. I won't even spoil it for you, just order it. 

Bobo's, you sure know how to make a girl happy. I will surely be back.
author: Anh T.

description: This is one of the best steaks you'll ever have in SF.  Service is top notch.  If you don't agree you're probably an uptight whining bitch that complains about every fucking thing under the goddamn sun.
author: Larry A.

description: First time @ Bobo's tonight, we sat at the bar pretty calm night. Entrees were on point with flavor, service was horrible - the waitress didn't seem to care to check in on us provide any refills on our beverages or collect the check. Nice place just stuck up waitress the other servers were more attentive then our waitress. The hostess also was bit off not welcoming nor ever made en effort to check in, although the Bar was slow. I do not recommend this restaurant
author: Kat D.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner, reservations at 6:30. The hostess wanted to seat us at a very small 2-top in the bar area, with a view to Lombard Street. I let the hostess know that we would be ordering a lot of food and that the table was too small. She didn't seem pleased and told me it would be about 10 minutes before another table opened up. Not a problem in my book. I'll sacrifice a view and wait for a bigger table, just so someone's butt isn't bumping into my elbow every 2 minutes.

Our waiter Anthony (love the French accent!) greeted us cordially. Ordered straight away: double mussels, double crab, one super bone-in filet mignon, one bone-in filet mignon, lobster mac and cheese, swiss chard, double baked potato, cauliflower, and portobello mushrooms.  The music was great, some good 70s and 80s pop, rock, R&B.

The mussels come out on a sizzling hot platter; ladies, you might want to rethink what outfit or top you are wearing. It's sizzling hot butter and soy sauce that splatters! The soy sauce is added when brought to the table...almost like how the Chinese add the soy sauce to the steamed bass once it's out on the table. The added Dijon to the clarified butter for dipping was delish. The mussels, being steamed, don't have much flavor, but swirl it around with the butter and soy sauce and you are good to go.

The crab came next. It also is served on an iron platter, but there is no splattering here. I really can't speak to the crab, as I was too busy peeling the shell off for the birthday boy. And, I wanted to save my appetite for the steak.

It took longer for the steaks to come out, but the wait was OK, because it allowed the food to settle! When our main course did arrive, so did the all the sides. The steaks were perfectly cooked and HUGE. This is not your typical 6 oz. filet. My man's was 20+oz. and about 2 inches thick at a minimum. My filet was not much smaller. Good overall flavor and char. I'm not sure what all the hype is about the double baked potato...mind you, this is coming from a gal who likes her carbs, particularly my spuds! The lobster mac and cheese wasn't anything to write home about. First, it was shells and not macaroni: it was bland as though it was not drained well, not that cheesy, and oddly, a bit spicy. I like spicy and while it helped with the flavor, I would have preferred more cheese. The swiss chard was garlicky good...the mushrooms tangy from some sort of vinegar that was not balsamic (a bit too tangy, in fact)...and the steamed cauliflower had dried garlic or something similar garnishing the top. The swiss chard and the cauliflower were the winners. On  any other night, with a bit less vinegar, the mushrooms would likely be a good choice.

Next time, we'll know what to do: pass on the lobster mac and cheese and order the crab cakes.

Get here earlier. The vibe, once it hit 8pm, got a little weird. For example, the table right next to us, with 3 apparently "single" men, one talking about 2 prior marriages with his friend stating, "Oh, cool! So you had 2 bachelor parties?" It was hard NOT to hear considering the guy was less than an arm's length away. You know how close I mean: their butt runs the risk of touching your food when they try to squeeze in, to sit down. 

The other turn off: the twenty-somethings that come in wearing so much perfume, it was like they bathed in it. I was glad my dinner was done by this time. The last thing I want to smell while eating is your cheap, sugary/cotton candy smelling perfume. Just sayin'. Oddly enough, a double date was seated nearby, and not 5 minutes in, they left. Not sure why, but price may have been a factor...they didn't even open their menus, but then again, the menu is framed at the entrance for all to see.

Overall, the birthday boy was happy. He loved his mussels, loved his crab, and loved his steak. Winning.
author: N M.

description:
One of my favorite filet spots. 

Perfectly cooked medium rare and very flavorful. 

Crab was also very good and the dipping sauce made from the cooked crab juices and brains went well with the crab. 

Mussels were ok a bit dried out. 

The garlic sauce on the shrimp is bomb.

Can't go wrong with side of mushrooms, but they put peas in it and kinda threw me off.

Side salad was small and a bit over priced.

Overall great meal.
author: Bryant C.

description:
Celebrated my cousin's birthday dinner here, just us four girls. We wished we loved it, but just liked it overall.

We ordered two (2) orders of the double mussels, shrimp and a whole crab. For sides, we shared the mac and cheese, also their brussel sprouts. The loaf garlic bread was amazing! When the mussels, shrimp and crab came to the table, boy it was sizzling with goodness and the smell was aromatic. The crab and shrimp were quite juicy and surprisingly had a lot of meat! I am not a big fan of mussels because of the earthy aftertaste, but the wine dip balanced it out. The portions were huge, we had to take some of it to-go.

Service was okay. At the beginning, she sort of made us  felt out of place. We were sitting upstairs, and the area was small; there were plenty of times were we made eye contact for assistance, I flagged her once or twice, still was not attentive. When asking her for the utensils for the crab shell, she pointed her index finger up and said to giver her a second because she is attending to the table next to us... After 5 minutes of trying to get her attention. Yet,she seemed irritable.

Love the fact that they have complimentary valet parking! Lombard can be a very busy street even on a Saturday.
author: Johanna M.

description:
3.5 stars because food is not always consistent. We're regulars here so we have definately experienced both excellent and not so excellent nights. 

We order the usual:
double mussel and double crab 
bone in filet (14oz)
Caesar salad
Mac n cheese
Portabello mushrooms
Swiss chard. 

They recently introduced the 'super bone in filet' (20 oz at 59.95) and also carry the 49er Porterhouse (a whopping 45+oz for a whopping 149.99) for you Niner fans out there. 

+1 Their mussel dipping sauce is fantastic! It's made if the rich insides of a crab with garlic and butter. Just amazing.
author: Grace H.

description:
3.5 stars rounded down! Ended up coming here for a late dinner on a Sunday night because it was one of the few seafood restaurants that was still open. The staff was wonderful! My bf and I got there an hour before closing but wait staff was still super friendly and didn't mind at all. The food comes out super quick and we were able to finish our meal by closing time.

Now on to reviewing the food... THE BREAD WAS BOMB!!!!! When they asked us if we wanted some bread, I declined because I thought it would be the typical plain bread and butter you get at steakhouses but thank goodness my bf said yes because that garlic olive oil dressed bread was enough to make me love that place. Next we had the hamachi cappacio as an appetizer which was delish. As for our main course, we chose to share the 8 oz filet mignon and the combo sizzling plate. We loved the filet minon which was super tender and juicy but as for the seafood, I would give it a thumbs down. The mussels were so fishy I couldn't eat any of it and the shrimp tasted like the shrimp you would get out of the frozen section of your supermarket. The crab was ehh and had no sweetness to it.

Overall, it's possible I would come back if I'm craving a late night steak. Other than that, there are better steakhouse out there.
author: Michelle H.

description: Omg!!! My favorite date night spot! I love this French restaurant, unique decor, but most importantly great steak and crab!!!! The secret sauce that is drizzled on top of the crab and on the side for your pleasure is to die for. Burrata salad is also a must along right their panna cotta!!!! A++
author: Jacqueline P.

description:
Our food was awesome and our server Theo was five stars for sure 
The filet was  cooked extraordinary super crispy on the outside and perfectly pink on the inside
author: Anthony A.

description: Love it everything I'm here! Delicious medium rare Bone in Filet Mignon with half crab (surf and turf), double baked potato! Oh yeah, and their portobello mushrooms are the best! Can't wait til next week for my bday!
author: Fernando E.

description:
Absolutely the worst place to eat.  There are so many wonderful steak houses in SF, and Bobo's is NOT one of them.
We ordered drinks first.  We then perused the menu and settled on a couple of starters and of course steaks.  And a couple of sides to finish the steak, and we thought we would be all set.  We KNEW something was wrong when the starters arrived within 5 minutes of ordering...in fact, they arrived before our drinks.  To make it worse...our Caesar salad was a wedge of iceberg lettuce.  I thought we were the not in on the joke.  
Let's move onto the steaks, if you call it that.  3 filet mignons...2 ordered medium well, 1 rare.  only one steak arrived as ordered: 1 medium well.  the other two were not edible.  All 3 were not seasoned: no salt; no pepper.  I have never witnessed so many people struggling to season their steaks in one evening.
Unfortunately, we spent a lot of money on an awful...simply awful...dinner.
author: Sonia C.

description: We had a nice dinner with a Porterhouse and sautéed cauliflower to share. We ordered a crab cake and lobster soup for starter. Very nice and delicious. Service also very good.
author: Suria N.

description: Completely amazing. The bone-in filet was like butter in your mouth. The strawberry cheesecake was delicious. A fabulous drinking experience.
author: Yam Y.

description: Staff was overall very friendly. I wished there was more vegetarian options but I can really complain considering it's a steakhouse.
author: Crosby E.

description:
If I'm on a deserted island, I'll request steak as my last meal.  If the zombie-apocalypse finally happens, instead of leaving the island, I'll just head on over to Bobo's.  My suggestion is to utilize their valet service since it may take a few minutes or ten to circle around for parking.  Other suggestion is to use public transportation but the valet service beats it hands down.

If you're in a party greater than 2, I suggest arriving earlier than the other group members so you can hang out at the bar to order a drink (or two).  The bartender makes excellent drinks whether it be a moscow mule or other popular cocktails.  After you are seated, I suggest you order the ginormous ribeye and accompany it with brussel sprout sides.  Potatoes are a good starchy option to fill you up if you foolishly thing the steak won't do so.  For parties greater than 2, I suggest sharing the mussel and crab double combo.  The waiter will bring a long sizzling skillet of juicy and tasty mussels and crab to your table.  The steam shows how it just came out of the oven....errr stove.
author: Ronald L.

description: After seeing several videos of the sizzling plates I decided I wanted to go here for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend. After dreading the thought of parking at 7pm on a tuesday we were relieved to find out there is complementary parking. You first walk into the bar area where a host greets you and escorts you up a couple flights of stairs to your table. It is kind of cramped but we still had a nice private booth area. Our waitress was friendly and patient with us since we could not decide what we wanted to eat. We ended up with the lobster soup for appetizer, the sizzling single order of shrimp, twice baked potato, mod mac, swiss chard and caesar salad with lobster. I am not a lobster person so I didn't try too much of the soup but my boyfriend enjoyed it with the bread. The bread was reaally good btw. Kind of had a curry taste too it and lacked in lobster pieces. The shrimp was a good portion and were tasty. The sides were definitely enough for 2 people. All of the sides were flavorful. The salads are all the iceburg lettuce that you have to chop yourself which is kind of annoying. The first time my boyfriend ordered it with the smoked salmon which he thought would be cooked. It wasn't lol. So he had it sent back and got the lobster on top instead which he enjoyed. Overall we were satisfied but nothing to jump for joy about. Maybe we needed to get a steak.
author: Alisha C.

description: The valet was the highlight of our night. The steak was sub-par, the crab overcooked, the server lacked any personality. Nearly $300 for 2 adults and 1 kid (1 alcoholic drink) our dinner was abysmal. Our experience last year was amazing; the food, the maitre' d; top to bottom was great. We wanted to bring his 13 year old son, and unfortunately we were disappointed.
author: Janine S.

description:
Ugh, this place is terrible. 4 star average? I'm gonna assume the people who are gushing over this place are also giving 5 stars to Applebee's and Taco Bell.

The steak wasn't the worst I've had but it was pretty damn far from the best. It was overdone for medium rare but at least it was tender. Everything else was a disaster. The side of swiss chard seemed to have been fished out of a salt pond. It was completely inedible but since the waiter was only around on a 15-minute schedule that was how long I had to wait to return it. He insisted I scrape it from my dinner plate onto a fresh plate so he could "show it to the chef". Classy. A new one did come but by then my taste buds were already numb.

The appetizer of yellowtail carpaccio was devoid of flavor. The wine selection was pitiful and overpriced. But the worst part of the experience was the "ambiance". First of all the place has a distinctively run-down, sleazy feel. Think Nick's Crispy Tacos meets Spearmint Rhino. And they can't even install a decent ventilation system to keep those large windows from fogging up. But ambiance is not just decor, it's also clientele. Let's just say I now know where people without taste go out for steak.

I'll leave it at that. This is just ridiculously bad.
author: Aaron D.

description:
Lackluster. Mostly the food. We had the crab, bone in filet and a baby bleu salad. The salad was crisp but but not creative by any means, dressing kinda meh. Adding some parsley or onion to this dish could help. Crab was of lower freshness and quality than I am used to in this area. It was dumped on the plate with me filet, no presentation at all. Some weird gravy on it for which there was no explanation. No plate for the shells, no towel or even a towlette for your hands. The steak was a good piece of meat but not seasoned very well and tepid at best. I ordered it rare and expected the center cold but the outer bits weren't up to temp either. Pretty poor for a $50 steak.
The ambiance could be so great in this place. The decor is there. But it lacked any music. We got to hear the sound of Lombard street and hollaring valets from the open front door on a pretty cold night. The ringing phone and the staff chatting in the bar. Just not great. Not sure why we were sat in that area, with a table so close to us that it was as though we were dining with them. Upon getting up to use the restroom, which was in a service area (tacky), I realized that the restaurant had so many spots that could have offered a better experience. 
Also, we were sitting by this old fireplace with mirrors in the place where there would be fire and it was just so dirty. Splashed with crab juice? I dunno, but that should not have gone uncared for. In the room we were eating in there was also a rack of silverware and napkins sitting in a plastic bucket. I'm sorry, but for the price of the restaurant, this just doesn't get it.
Our server was polite but he could have been more attentive.We won't be dropping in again or recommending this place to friends. Not sure what the hype is about.
Reading the responses on here from management pretty much says it all. Some canned apology and an invite to come back? Ummm.... these people are saying they never want to come back. You need to change your approach because you seem very out of touch.
author: Disco B.

description: Wife and I have been here twice. Sat in the bar at window both times... Bartender Sean is really helpful and knows his stuff. Pours drinks like a pro... Everything we had was amazing. Best steak I've ever had. Appetizers are killer, can't find 1 thing wrong with this place.
author: Gas Light Apparel 1.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here because his parents bought us a gift card to enjoy a dinner. We sadly forgot the gift card, and were traveling from out of town so could not go home to get it. We called the day of our reservations and asked if a photo of the gift card was acceptable, which clearly showed the numbers and pin on back, and the woman we spoke to said it wouldn't be a problem. 

As we walked up we both noticed how beautiful the place was. We were both very excited to enjoy a nice dinner out on our vacation together. 

As we entered, we got seated quickly and enjoyed a few drinks, two steaks, two sides and dessert. 

The table we were seated at was not stable, and shook every time either of us were cutting our steak.

For a steakhouse the food was good, but nothing special. Presentation was also poor. Everything that came out looked like the food was just thrown on a plate. 

Drinks were tasty. 

When we asked for the check later we mentioned that we spoke to someone earlier about the gift card ready to show the photo, and our waitress immediately left to request a manager. We waited over 10 minutes just to be told by another woman that their systems do not allow any form of "manual" entry to minimize the risk of "security" for their customers. 

She shared the wait was because she needed to validate with other employees if it was even possible to manually enter a gift card. She later shared that "now I have to train our employees about this " when she herself wasn't even sure. 

I find it hard to believe that it's impossible to manually enter a gift card of your own establishment into your system. When a POS system is unable to read cards, there has always been a manual entry option in my experience. 

The cost of the meal wasn't a concern to us, but we would not have come here if the person we spoke to originally had shared this with us. We didn't want to cause a scene, so kindly paid the check and left to enjoy the rest of our night else where. 

Overall, service was poor and lacked training. 
I'm extremely disappointed with Bobo's. 
While the food wasn't bad, I wouldn't go out of my way to plan a second trip here when there are other steakhouses not too far away with great food and amazing customer service. 

Our gift card will probably go to waste. 
What a shame.
author: Binky A.

description: I don't eat red meat very often but when I do, I order the bone-in filet at Bobo's. Theo was our waiter and his service matched the food! Tres bien!! Super!!!
author: Viv A.

description: Went here for the first time with the bf for my birthday. We had the complimentary house bread, crab cakes, the filet mignon , the bone-in filet mignon, and the mango panna cotta. They also gave me a mini cone with chocolate mousse for my birthday! The service was great and we were pretty full after. A bit pricey since everything is served a la carte, but great for a once in awhile splurge :) Loved the free valet!
author: Amanda C.

description: I was in San Francisco about three weeks ago with my girlfriend on a trip from San Antonio.  I had lived in the bay area for over thirty years and have been to bobo's many times and decided to take her there for dinner.  The crab was excellent but the room were we seated was a horrible.  We were placed in the room on the first floor with a birthday party of twelve.  They were loud and buzzed.  One lady was really loud and dropped several f bombs.  They were so loud that I asked the hostess if we could be seated in another area because I could not hear or carry on a conversation with my girlfriend.  With an icy response the hostess said there's another table in the same room with the party.  Go sit in it.  Instead of causing a fuss we moved which turned out to be a little better.  Our waiter felt bad.  I could see he was embarrassed for us considering the amount of f bombs pertruding out that woman's mouth.  We had a great crab and wine.  I am shocked that know one from bobo's asked the party to keep it down a little.   Then I forgot... it's the city and people can do and act obnoxious and are not called on it.  I will come back for a drink and not for dinner.  Hopefully the bar will be a little more civilized.
author: Bryce M.

description:
Location: On Van Ness, valet parking available! Once you pull up in front of the restaurant one of the valet workers is already awaiting for cars to pull up and are very fast to avoid traffic jams of incoming traffic! They hand you a ticket which you show after your dinner to get your car back.


Customer Service: Attentive and friendly!


Decor: I'm not sure how to describe how I felt walking in! The lights are dimmed and when you walk in the bar is to your left. They have seating near the window, although we got seated upstairs in another room which I had no idea this place was that big! The feel is as if it's a bohemian circus gypsy like theme? I hope I gave you yelpers a little bit of a good description! I liked it!


Presentation of Food: A loaf of bread is served which is different from the normal dinner rolls or slices of bread. If you order seafood they have have it in front of you with the dish raised and bowl underneath to put your shells. Main dishes nicely presented.


How did the food taste?: The loaf of bread caught me of guard as you pull apart a slice off the loaf it is already infused with olive oil, this was a nice touch. Then we moved on to a single order of mussels and I have no idea how they cook these mussels but they were AMAZING. From the flavor of the mussels, the slight crisp toasted texture, and the butter you dip them in its absolutely mouth watering just thinking about it! I would suggest get double of everything for seafood no regrets! Then I ended up getting the surf and turf! To be honest I've had better steaks, the filet mignon was just ok (8oz). What stole the show was the crab so garlicky and full of flavor!!! I can't stop thinking about the seafood!



Overall Experience: Good experience, what would I do different next time? Get double mussels double crab, share a steak, and a side. OR get an order of one whole crab double mussels and a side! This is only because the seafood is what got me! Although it's totally up to you!


Would I Come Back?: Yes!!!
author: Rosh E.

description:
Ok we were totally unsure of how good this steakhouse would be since it is oddly attached to a motel. I have to say the food was delicious! The waiter was fantastic (and French) and his service was impeccable. The food - we have a bone in rib eye and two petite filets- absolutely delicious. We also had the house salad which was good and the twice baked potato and Brussel sprouts. Everything was perfectly timed and delicious. We also shared a bottle of the Malbec - yummmm. 
Super happy with the mean and so glad we stumbled on this place.
author: j d.

description:
It's a bit on the kitch and cheesy side, which is probably perfect for tourists and out of towners. We went to Bobo's to see what's all the 4-stars on yelp and all the rave reviews about. I think the 4 stars are more for their kitch ambiance and all the dated "Venezian" decorations. The free Valet and Table Side Service are great and attentive so these aspects are also deserving of the 4 stars.

But if you're here for the food. It's a 2 stars rating at best. The server will tell you that they are known for their aged meat--mostly, their bone-in filet mignon. We had the regular size bone-in filet and a porterhouse. These tasted fine and cooked decent enough after a second trial when the first cut was served on the medium side (we ordered medium rare.) The server was gracious enough to take back the overcooked meat and gave us a new order that was more medium rare. 

We also tried the mussels, crabs and shrimp on sizzling plate, man these were salty and way overcooked-so overcooked the mussels were shrunken into the size of peanuts--blackened peanuts. I normally plow through this type of entre since there's not much to begin with but I had to stop eating sooner since my mouth and lips were turning pruney due to the high salt seasoning on them.

The most disappointing part is the "side dish" which is $8/plate and "large enough to share," per our server. I'm not sure if they have toddlers in mind when they mention the "large enough to share" part since these are tiny and more like a single serving of everything. 
We tried the:
 "Twice Cooked Potato," which was a mush of zombified potatoes re-stuffed back into its own half-shell skin and lightly baked so it resembles a baked potato--tasteless-zombie-potato-mush-in-its-own-skin might be a better name for this one. 
"Brussel Sprouts," totally over cooked, over oiled and over salted--not very appetizing.
"Mod Mac&Cheese," if this is truly what they think as a modern version of mac&cheese then I'd rather be old fashioned. It's super oily and salty. We had indigestion and heartburn after eating everything from Bobo's but I suspect the Mod Mac really pushed us over the edge.

Only 3 words are needed to sum up the food experience at Bobo's, Salty, Oily and Kitchy.
author: Taffany H.

description: Food was great. No doubt about it. But service was terrible. Server made racial jokes and added tips on credit card transaction slips without permission. Found out later on the credit card statement. Management didn't provide a proper solution and explanation. Will not go back again.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Goodness gracious we LOVED Bobo's! After a long day of hiking the city, we four decided to get the crab for 4 and a few sides; shard, yams, salad, and brussel sprouts. Don't be put off by the price, the crab was to die for, so fun and especially refreshing after a long day. We definitely didn't need the sides though. The shard I'd forgo, yams were our favorite. This was plenty of food, 4 adults were stuffed, next time we'd get the "Crab for 3" to fill the four of us.

The staff were kind, attentive and graceful and the ambiance was so fun!
author: Olivia F.

description:
I seriously do not know how someone can give this place more than 1 star.  Given the price and type of beef used I expect some damn flavor.  I ordered a bone in NY.  The steak had zero flavor.  It was complete garbage and a waste of time and money.  

If your looking for something better.  Try House of Prime, Alexanders, Harris, Ruth's Cris, Outback Steakhouse, and even Applebees.  At least you will be eating good in the neighborhood.
author: Will W.

description: Fun atmosphere. Quirky and old decor. Would be kind of frightened to see what this place looks like in the light of day however. 3 stars for the kitschy, days of old SF one time thing. 2 stars for the food. Had the filet, that was good. But you can't really screw that up. The bread was weird. The potato was weird, some kind of twice cooked thing and I'm not sure what it was about it, but I suspect they had been baked and prepared before and then frozen and baked again. Crab appetizer was very good. Fun with a group and lots of cocktails, but once was enough.
author: Jordan J.

description: I took my wife here for dinner for our anniversary. And we both loved it so very much. Definitely going back. We had steak, crab, lobster soup, and a twice bake potato. Some champagne to go with it and it just couldn't have been any more perfect celebrating our 3 years of marriage a little time to ourselfs without the kids. And our server was just awesome. He made us feel very welcome even tho that's not our usual dining type of place. Thanks great job. Perfect
author: Cristian M.

description:
My previous review just doesn't do this place justice. Been back maybe 3 or 4 times since then, so it's about time for an update. 

If you like good steaks, do yourself a favor and haul yourself down here for a real eye opening treat.  And don't spoil your appetite before arriving.

As mentioned before and by everyone else, go for the bone-in filet and get it medium rare. Wow. Meat that's seared to perfection on the edges, yet offers a buttery smooth texture in the middle. Each cut will have a perfect combination of crust to tenderness. As you work closer to the bone, you realize that you are already eating dessert...of the beef kind. 

They get it right every single time. There's really no topping this place when it comes to a legitimate steak. Top of its class. Any other review that tells you otherwise is filled with delusion and/or utter incompetence of the palate.

Sides: Twice baked potato is killer, portobello mushrooms are killer, swiss chard is deadly delicious.

Service is excellent. Cocktails are excellent. Free valet.
author: Al C.

description: I have never in my life Had SUCH AN AMAZING FINE epic steak!!! Oh my goodness we cannot wait to get back to San Francisco and eat there again. When walking out of the steakhouse we realized the burger spot was also a Bobos. A woman walking out of the burger spot said "oh my God they must feed their cows GOLD!" That will definitely be out next place to stop when we get back to San Fran!
author: Rachel P.

description: One of our favorite restaurants when in San Fran!! Small, quaint, great cocktails and this local hole in the wall will amaze you with the food.
author: Robert P.

description:
Its a nice ambiance here. Cozy and quaint. 

I'm going to skip the fluff and talk about the food.

Garlic bread - Complementary, and delicious! We asked for a refill and we didn't finish the second one. I figured if they were going to toss it, I would ask for a box and bring it home. Yes, I have no shame, it was that good. When it came back, he gave me a fresh loaf to bring home! Score!!

House Salad - The house salad was okay, it's almost like a wedge salad. I had a eighth cut of a lettuce head topped with avocado, tomatoes and onions. The sauce was generously provided, which I would have preferred a bit less. For those who like to hold the sauce, ask for it on the side.

Bone-in Filet - The waitress recommended this as she said its their best seller. She did let us know that it gets a bit more rare towards the bone, and a bit less rare towards the rest of the cut. I love my steaks rare rare rare, but she said it's better medium rare. The medium rare was definitely great, but I think I would have enjoyed rare a bit more! The medium rare was cooked perfectly. My only qualm... it's way too salty. The seasoning is good, but it's honestly way too salty. I finished my glass of syrah before I got through half the steak. 

Service was friendly and helpful. Prices are a bit pricy. I think the steak was 43 dollars? This must be a once in a while thing...

I like this place, and would definitely come back!
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I really want to give this place 4 stars for the complimentary valet and good service, but most especially for the amount of money I paid. But I just can't.

I tried calling 2 weeks in advance to book a reservation for my boyfriend's birthday dinner but it was hard getting through to someone who actually answered the phone. I left voicemails but nobody called back, so I waited a few more days before I called at exactly 5:00 PM when they opened. They finally answered and I was able to make my reservation.

So like I started with, complimentary valet. This was nice because we circled around twice with no luck when we were already running late before we noticed the word "complimentary." We were seated right away. For a Saturday night, I expected it to be a little busier but it seemed I didn't need to go through the trouble of making a reservation.

Customer service was good. Our waiter never once seemed impatient with us even though we took a while with the menu. The single order of mussels we got as appetizers was very worth the price, and so good. Our steaks, however. I tend to order my steaks "medium rare but closer to the rare side," which was what I did with the filet mignon. My boyfriend ordered the bone-in filet mignon in just medium rare. Unfortunately, I couldn't enjoy my meal because I think the waiter flip flopped it. My filet mignon was so much more well done. Their blood orange margarita though, was interesting because they used black salt and also because I never had a blood orange margarita anywhere else. 

The waiter also made a few mistakes on our bill, but fixed it up immediately when we pointed them out without fuss. Overall, I do like the restaurant and despite their mistakes were able to offer good service, but since my steak didn't taste as good as I was hoping and it was a rather expensive meal, it wasn't good enough to get 4 stars when they consider themselves the best steakhouse in all of San Francisco.
author: Cammi Z.

description:
Good but not great.  As other reviewers have already pointed out, there's a heavy hand in the kitchen when it comes to salt and oils.  I suspect that the majority coming to eat at a steak house are looking for that rich experience and the rest of us have to suffer through it.   The birthday boy had the bone in filet and they are not skimping on portion size, it was huge.  His report - tasted delicious though a little undercooked.  

The real question was about the crab.  If you live in the bay area and have a heartbeat you know by now you should not be eating any local crab unless you want to play russian roulette with violent illness.  Their website makes a point of saying the crab is local.  Our server only tells us that you are in charge of cracking if you order it.  No mention on the menu of the source of the crab either and there's crab listed all over it.  Not addressing the issue came off as kinda shady.  When you're getting ready to put down some real money for dinner, I'd want to know that kind of thing.  Especially when the news every night is screaming DON'T EAT LOCAL CRAB.

Food in general was good.  Our server and the food runner were excellent, friendly and efficient.  Is it worth the money? hard to say.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
My friends took me here for my birthday.  It started off very exciting ... our blood always boils with the thought of crabs and meat!  We ordered a bottle of wine, Lots of Crabs, Whole Crab and Mussels, Bone in Fillet plus sides to share, and some desserts. The bill came to 400 dollars for three people.  

Within 10 minutes all of our food came out at once.  The whole crab with mussels were served on the hot plate.  Watching the smoke come off the hot plate was deceiving.  While the plate was hot, the crab was cold and dry.  The mussels were over cooked and shriveled to crispness.  The lots of crabs was drizzled in some garlic sauce and while it wasn't as dry as the other crab, it was also cold!  I liked the flavor of the steak, but it was as well cold.  Actually, all of our food were cold.  That's the end of it.  Our experience with the dessert was not anything better.  I forgot what the name of the desserts were, but both had waffles.  All I can say is that no matter how good the filling is, if the waffle is stale and soft, the whole thing tastes horrible!

So service --- horrible horrible horrible!  The experience for the main courses was okay, except no one offered more bread and we couldn't get anyone's attention to ask for more bread.  It's when the dessert came that things got really weird.  Since one of our desserts had sorbet in it and none of us wanted to touch it because of the stale waffle, all the sorbet melted.  The other dessert also had half of it left untouched...due to the stale waffles.  Our waitress came by looked at our plate and instead of asking if everything was okay, said "looks like you loved your desserts!"  Then she cleared the table.  We laughed it off and kept on with our evening and conversation.  No one came back to offer to close our ticket not to ask if we wanted anything else.  We had to flag someone down to order coffee.  In fact our waitress never came back.  When we didn't know what to do, we grabbed a random gentleman who seem to be working there to ask for more coffee.  I actually think he was either the manager or the owner.  He looked at us, snickered and said, "people are waiting for your table and you want more coffee?...*snicker*...okay!"  We took that as our cue to leave.  But no one came by with the bill!  We had to ask for it!  The though crossed my mind that we should have just left without paying, but that my end is up in a place worse than where we were...or would it have?  Hmmm ...

The best part of the evening was when my friend and I were outside the restaurant discussing how we were kicked out after a 400 dollar bill to help the restaurant turn over tables.  The guy that kicked us out approached us!  He wanted to tell us that he was sorry he had to do it, but they needed to make sure they get a good turn over!  It was the biggest fake smile and apology I have ever seen!  Not sure how he wanted us to respond.
author: Jingrong Y.

description: There are few times in my life when I'm extremely disappointed in a restaurant and refuse to give it a second try. This is one of them. My friends and I had wanted to try out Bobo's because we love crab and steak. We had requested our food to arrive as it was cooked so that the food was hot. There was no one else in the restaurant at the time. We ordered the mussels, crab, and a bone-in filet mignon along with sides to share upon the recommendation of the waitress. The food came all at once and it was cold. Also the crab was dry and the mussels were overcooked. We had spent $400 for our table of 3 and were told we needed to leave because they turn over their tables 2-3 times each night. This was pretty ridiculous for the price of food here to push people out. I will never come here again. The food was not worth the price and the attitude of the restaurant towards it's customers was insulting.
author: Thida T.

description: Easily the best steak house in San Francisco. We always go for the bone in filet, mussels/shrimp combo and yellowtail carpaccio. Killer onion rings, too. The service is always warm and very attentive.
author: Ottis M.

description: The best steak/sea food period! love you Bobo's
author: Emma M.

description:
I came here last year for my birthday and it was delicious. The bone in filet was so tender it melted in my mouth and it was so easy to cut with a knife.... Fast forward this year to my birthday again and boy did everything change..

If people were to ask me before what's a good place for steak I would have recommended bobos but after my last visit, I won't be coming back anymore. Me and my bf both got a bone in filet, medium rare... Tell me why it was cooked differently for both of us? One was tender but the char on it made it have a burnt taste to it and the other was obviously overcooked because it only had a slight light pink in middle and the char was so dark it also tasted very burnt... It was not like this last year.. I was very disappointed on my birthday this year because I was hoping for that juicy and tender meat I had before but instead I got burnt and overcooked meat..
author: Michele M.

description:
I SO regretted coming here for my husbands 30th birthday dinner. The steak was 100% average, our waiter was awkward & didn't treat us respectfully. The atmosphere was weird and so loud. If you want a good steak - GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. If you want to pay for a good steak and enjoy it, go somewhere else. 
We will never eat here again.
author: Kristin M.

description: Everything was amazing! The fish was unbelievably good, the house salad was awesome, the starting bread was great, and the shrimp was great. The staff would use some work. They seem kinda grumpy and unpleasant, but the food definitely made up for the awkwardness of the waiter. It is a must try!
author: M M.

description: Heard good things about this place since a couple of years ago but since it's a little far from where I live, I haven't really come by till yesterday. Came here to celebrate my son's birthday, and really sad to say that it didn't really live up to the good things I have heard.  We had filet mignon,  bone in ribeye and mussels & shrimp, some appetizers and sides.  The steak was quite disappointing, one of them was medium rather than medium rare that we asked for.  The seafood was quite good, but not fantastic.  Servers (only one of the servers was really smiling and made us feel welcomed) were not quite as professional as we have expected.  The Mussels & Shrimp platter was supposed to be accompanied with garlic bread, but they served the garlic bread right on when they brought us the appetizers, so by the time we were done with the appetizers, the bread was not warm anymore, and we didn't know if those were the complimentary bread you get for each table or not, and while we were wondering, we nibbled on the bread. Then the seafood platter came when we were almost done with the bread....*sigh*  All the little things led to the conclusion that they need more improvement in their service. and I was also expecting a much better steak too given the price tag, it's way too overpriced. I could find better places with better food quality & service.
author: Marina M.

description: My husband and I ate here last night in celebration of our first year as husband and wife. The atmosphere is abstract and unique.  I ordered the espresso and my husband got a beer. Both very good choices. They served us bread as a starter. I got the bone in filet and he got the bone in new York. The steaks were cooked perfectly with a good sear on the outside. We shared the twice potato and the mod Mac. The mod Mac was my favorite where I thought the twice baked potato was way too salty and not cooked all the way. All and all the food and drinks were outstanding. The price I felt was way too expensive.  $185 including the tip. But it was a special occasion and the steaks were the best we ever had.
author: Sarah Y.

description:
Excellent.  Can I say that again, Excellent! 

 We made last minute reservations for a first time visit.  We were promptly seated.  The decor is a little unusual - Old San Francisco.  The waiter came up immediately to take our drink menu.  Our entrees came.  Each and every guest thought their meals were cooked to perfection.  
This is definitely a pricey meal.  I would rather pay top dollar to get perfection, than send less and fall short on my expectations. 

I can't wait to go back!  Too bad only five stars are offered.  I would make this a 5*+!
author: Margarete A.

description:
Went to dinner with my nursing school-family to catch up and reminisce! The food was awesome! The steaks were great and the crab that I had before the SF crab scare was super fresh flavorful. The shrimp weren't huge, but there was a healthy serving of them and I was able to share with everyone at the table and still have some left over....oh and they were delicious! We ordered one of each dessert and amongst us, there were all devoured. Complementary valet parking was the cherry on top of an amazing night with some of my favorite people.

Get the bone in filet medium rare.....PLUS THAT TWICE BAKED POTATO that ROCKED everyones world! Oh and the MAC AND CHEESE! Don't forget one of those too!
author: Krystal T.

description:
I'm shocked I didn't know about this place since I grew up so close to the city! Really great crab and the filet minon 16 oz bone in melted in my mouth 

The waiter was also super nice when I ordered a drink that I didn't prefer and he swapped it out for me. Loved the ambiance of the place, red vibes!

Amazing for a romantic date or a coy birthday party.
author: Miranda S.

description:
Fast, tasty and piping hot mussels. 

Fresh, savory and crisp tomato and burrata salad. 

Good service.
author: Jon F.

description: The best filet mignon I have ever had.  As per the waiters recommendation, I got the bone-in filet.  Flavorful, perfectly cooked, juicy. The best.  I'm normally a bone in ribeye type of guy but the waiter suggested I try the filet and I'm glad he did.  The starter bread they give u is also delicious. We also had the yellowtail carpaccio... so gooood!  Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts were really good too. 10 out of 10.
author: David S.

description:
I came here for my boyfriend's dads birthday. We basically ordered the whole menu

Our order: 
* Surf and turf, the crab and petite filet mignon
* Porterhouse, Bobo's New York style & filet mignon
* Swiss chard
* Yams
* Portobello mushrooms
* Mod Mac & cheese
* Double shrimp & crab
* Yellowtail carpaccio

The appetizers such as the Mac and cheese and swiss chard were actually served in big portions so you can have them a la carte. All of the steaks were super juicy, too. It basically felt apart when I cut it. Delicious. I think the crab was decent but the crab legs were so skinny, I couldn't really enjoy the crab. The shrimp were also tiny little things. Unexpectedly I enjoyed the yams a lot. They were flavorful and fragrant. Our party ordered so much we had a lot of food to-go and it's too much to write about.

I think if I were to return, I'd just go with the New York style. If I were in a party I'd get the carpaccio and yams to share. I would like it if they had more vegetable options besides the Swiss chard, so that I don't feel terrible about it later. I'm just going to go ahead and say it, They need more greens for easier digestion !
author: Lyra C.

description:
Still a delicious piece of meat. Just wasn't as amazing as my first time, but that happens a lot. 

Staff was great as expected from a place like this.

Had a different room from the first time and it was very cool. Nicely decorated and felt intimate.

Note to self: when ordering the bone in, make sure to order a little more on the cooked side, since it gets very bloody and red towards the bone!
author: Tiff C.

description: Found this restaurant on Yelp.  We were looking for somewhere nice to go for dinner, for my friend's birthday.  We went on a Sunday night and didn't have reservations but were promptly seated.  I started with a Caesar salad and my friend has the lobster bisque, we also were brought some delicious sourdough bread.  For our meals, I ordered a boneless filet and he ordered the bone-in New York Steak.  We shared a twice baked potato, mac n' cheese and onion rings for the sides.  I had a glass of pinot grigio and he had a glass of a red wine blend.  Everything was absolutely amazing!!  We were so stuffed but it was a delicious meal and I'd definitely recommend this place!!  It is a little pricey though, our meal was about $200 before the tip.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
2.5 STARS. 

After hearing good things and months of wanting to try this place, finally made reservations for my bf's birthday, only to leave disappointed...not impressed w the food.

*Yellowtail Carpaccio - this was probably my bf's
favorite of the night, paired w the complimentary bread they gave us. Imo I thought the bread was a bit hard and the ponzu tasted more like soy sauce.

*Surf & Turf (bone in) - bf's dish. He enjoyed his filet, but it didn't blow him away like all the other Yelpers have mentioned. He wished his crab was seasoned better.

*1/2 lb. crab - my dish. Loved how fresh and soft the crab meat was, however, it was way too salty. 

*Twice baked potato - I liked this and wanted to enjoy it, but I just couldn't....again, salty.

We really wanted to like this place, but almost everything we tried was way too salty. My water cup was constantly being refilled because of that, and or maybe because the cups were way too small! I've been to Bobo's Lounge next door and I had a more satisfying dinner there.
author: Quyen L.

description: Bobos restaurant exceeded my expectations our waiter was so friendly and gave us great suggestions . After a long day me and my husband enjoyed talking with him and the food he recommended was on point. Anthony made our night perfect. We Will definitely be back
author: DUN UP B.

description:
Overpriced ! We went with a group of 4 for a Birthday celebration. We had reservations in advance. We had to wait for our table so we had drinks at the bar. We found a hair floating in our lemon drop .. The bartender made us another and charged us? 
We got to our table and ordered crab cakes ,salads and steaks . The crab cakes were. The best thing on the menu not the best crab cakes I have ever eaten but ok.
The steaks were just ok? We had 2 bottles of $70dollar wine and the bill came to over $900 dollars !  I make a better steak on my grill at home . We were all disappointed. Better yet near the end of our meal the manager stopped by to ask if we would move to another table to make room for a large party??? It was a Thursday night we had reservations and we were not taking an excessive amount of time.
Years ago this was a good place ,it has become a tourist trap ... Stay away!
author: Rose W.

description: Had an anniversary dinner here. Yelp and Google had very high reviews about this place, even voted #3 on steakhouses in SF. Seeing that we were pretty excited about eating here. We pulled up and they have comp valet which was nice since parking is bad in SF. The restaurant has a old school feel, with a many small dining areas. We had reservation and requested a window seat. They were able to accommodate us with the request. We brought our own bottle of wine and they charge $25 for corkage fee. The food is on the pricy side and everything is al la carte. We ordered the double shrimp and 1/2 crab for $49.95. For the price I was expecting larger shrimp but the shrimp that was served was small white shrimp. It was over cooked in the hot skillets and was drenched in butter not much flavor. 1/2 crab was good but very little. We ordered the bone in NY and a bone in filet. The menu clearly states that the steaks are cooked medium rare, but when I got my NY steak it was clearly a medium cook and NY steak gets very tough when over cooked. I made a comment to the waitress and she just replied what an "that looks medium rare to me". I was kinda annoyed at this point so I didn't want to deal with it and just continued to eat my tough overcooked flavorless steak. The bone in filet was actually pretty good very tender and cooked properly. They gave us free dessert since it was our anniversary. Overall I'm giving this place a 2 star because I felt pretty ripped off, they served mediocre food for so much money. Everything we had we were happy with one thing. The service was ok. My husband and I left feeling very disappointed, my husband even apologized for taking me here for our anniversary.
author: amy n.

description: I never leave negative reviews - but I wish I had read this review before eating here.  It would have saved me A LOT of money & a HUGE stomach ache!  The food was so greasy, soaked in tons of butter, but almost no flavor!  The twice baked potatoes weren't even fully naked once!  They were crunchy on the outside & runny in the center.  The steak was decent but not $50 good.  So disappointing especially given the price!  The atmosphere was terrible, we were rushing through our meal just to get out of there. It was loud, everyone was crammed in - people were literally leaning on our table our entire meal & shouting over each other.  It was ridiculous.  I tried to use the restroom but there's only one unisex restroom for the entire restaurant & it was occupied the whole time.  Knowing what I do now, I wish we would have gone to Ruth's Chris down the street!
author: Paige D.

description: One of the better steak houses in SF. I've been here a few times and it's been solid every time.
author: Amy H.

description:
First time @ Bobo's.  I know, that's just crazy!  I've heard so much about the alleged kick ass steak here, that on the night I went in for dinner I basically expected mediocrity.  You know how the hype thing goes.

I didn't get mediocrity.  

I got one of the most tender & delicious steaks I have ever had.

I asked for medium, & it was perfectly medium.

Buttery.  

Really, just exquisite.

He ordered the bone-in fillet, I ordered the petit fillet.  

Needless to say, we both fell in total love w our steaks.  And we are definitely NOT in the fall-in-love-too-easily category.

Thanks Bobo for a truly superb meal.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Although I didn't care for the noise quality at this restaurant, I absolutely loved the food and decor! My husband and I came out to have a nice meal to celebrate our anniversary. Upon arrival, we were immediately seated, however had to request another table due to the fact that the seats are very close and we were sitting next to a table of people that were extremely loud. The manager was very kind to honor our request. We were very pleased with the service offered at this restaurant.

Ok, now on to the most important thing...the food! We ordered the following and rate as follows:

Appetizer:

Skillet shrimp - 8 (Seasoned well, however wish that they were bigger)


Entrees and Sides:
Bone in New York Strip - 8 
Bone in Filet -10 ( the star for the night!! Cooked perfectly, seasoned well!)
Dungeness Crab legs - 8 (good, but not the best I had on this trip, not a big fan of the sauce it was cooked in)
Twice cooked potatoe - 8 (Good, but noting to write home to mom about)

Overall, this was a pleasant dining experience. I would definitely recommend!
author: Nikiya S.

description: This place has a multiple personality disorder. My husband and I went here on a whim and had the time of our lives--sat upstairs tucked away in a romantic corner, excellent, warm, and caring service. Got a filet mignon that literally was the most decadent thing ever, fairly dripped in butter, but OMG the taste was everything, and though I like my steak fairly simple, they grilled it with such flavor, all was good. Even my husband who's not a huge beef guy, was blown away. We got salad and crab as starters, including garlic bread, and dessert . . . . everything was phenomenal, and of course we couldn't wait to go back. What do we do? Take our family of six there, with my niece and nephew, who's the biggest steak lover in the group. We were super excited to introduce them to this place. It did not get off to a great start: we were not seated upstairs as requested; instead despite asking, were seated downstairs (though we were one of the first people there, so it like they didn't have space). The hostess cold and austere, as if she's working for free. But I didn't want to make a big deal of it, since we were celebrating my brother's birthday, and I didn't want to make one of my usual scenes (that's what Yelp is for :-). It was downhill from there: we ordered much of the same stuff, and then some. The steak was dry and overdone, which they didn't take responsibility, despite me wanting to send it back. The waitress was surly, impatient, rude--and argumentative. Yup, getting defensive about how she thinks we ordered the steaks cooked. The vibe and mood at our table was strained and uncomfortable . . . I felt embarrassed about bringing my brother there for his brother, because everything was colossally bad. Our experience this second time was the total opposite of the first time--multiple personalities, as I mentioned. This trip was a while back--and despite wanting a regular steakhouse to go to, my husband and I have not been back. Btw., despite their messing up our orders, and my asking to speak to the manager, etc., we were not comped anything, and though I'm embarrassed to imply that I feel entitled to this (cuz I don't), but geez--the service and food were uniformly bad. Nothing could get me to go back. Instead of one star, I'm giving it two, because our first visit was fantastic and 'm giving them the benefit of doubt for the second visit--maybe thy were having a bad night?
author: Ranjan P.

description: Worst experience!  We went with our two boys tonight hoping for a nice steak dinner in San Francisco. We ordered the recommended bone in ribeye for $62, and it came out so rare it was still kicking, with no flavor, and so tough we could barely cut through it.  After 1 appetizer, two salads, one entree, and two sides we spent $250. Certainly not worth it. And the atmosphere was terrible.
author: Jason K.

description:
Overcooked steak and then there was the hair.... *sigh*

So it was such a bad experience food wise that I feel bad because the staff was kind but something has to be said. I ordered the Porterhouse and added on half the crab. FYI for Bobo's porterhouse they cook the filet mignon and NY strip separately. Now since the NY Strip portion is a dry aged steak it wouldn't need to be cooked that long but it was definitely overcooked. Medium well came back as well done. After some contemplation, I sent it back. Manager came over and agreed it was overcooked but the filet was not, which I agreed. They returned the filet and half crab. As I began to eat my filet, about half way through, I noticed a hair. Not a hair that looks from the upper region of the body but I suppose people have different hair structures where their head hair has kinks of a ...mmm...lower body hair? At that point I wanted to end the horror. I asked for the bill and was sure to mention that I will pay for the whole thing because I honestly was NOT trying to get a discount on my meal and did not want anyone to assume that was the case. The waiter still discounted it for me so I tipped him what I would have tipped if the bill was correct. 

I like to look at places for their food. I don't worry too much about service or people's personal weird preference. I'm going to a restaurant and paying $100+ because the food is the draw. Tonight's draw failed me.
author: Noelle C.

description: Before tonight Bobo's was my favorite restaurant in the city. Unfortunately tonight they dropped the ball in a major way! My wife and I dined with another couple visiting the area and from the moment we were seated the service was off. One of our steaks was delivered pink and cold and our server appeared annoyed with every order and request. Much to our surprise after racking up a $500 bill and paying it we were asked by the hostess if we were going to be much longer and rushed by the rest of the staff. Upon leaving the restaurant and entering our car the server came out to apologize, I guess he noticed we tipped him $100 on shitty service. Much to my dismay Bobo's is no longer my steakhouse of choice or recommendation.
author: Ryan W.

description: Came here for the first time with husband very small tables. Since it was my first time my husbands order a good amount of food and there was not enough room on the table! The tables are so tiny and you set so close to other people for the price of food they should not do that!! The waiter was so sweet he felt so bad about the table that he brought out a dessert on the house. Not sure if I'll come back!
author: Lizette L.

description: One of the most disappointing steak houses I've been to based on customer service and quality of the meat/professionalism. It took 2 tries to get our steak to a medium and after the second attempt the waiters excuse was since it was a bone in filet it's very difficult to get it right. Excuse me? You're charging $60 and y'all are a steakhouse. Get your shit right. The sides were mediocre we ordered Brussels sprouts which were soaked in oil and the potato was average not worth $10. Lastly the waiter had the balls to take away my phone because he wanted me to focus on my boyfriend. Really? Did you not see that he was trying to catch a Pokemon ball? And lastly don't ever grab a customers phone without asking. Your rudeness is unacceptable.
author: Lena H.

description: Turned away at the door with plenty of seating open on a Friday night. When their host judged is by our appearance, we happily judged them with our wallets by patronizing another restaurant. If a party of 5 wants to give you their money, get over yourselves and take it! Perfect if you're pretentious and smug like the host.
author: William B.

description: Some jerk met us at the door telling us the place wasn't for us and we would be better down the street!  Are you serious?  BIG mistake,  what a fool.  Guess he doesn't know how much we make in a year.  What an jerk, I have bottles of wine that cost more than your life..
author: Ashley B.

description:
Not sure when the reply was made by the restaurant ? I can assure you the staff knew. 
We told them we were leaving.  
Many people went in before us.  They were very aware of our situation. We had a reservation.
author: Tracy G.

description:
I wanted to try a new place in the city and after reading the reviews we thought  we would Bobo's a shot.

I was meeting my wife and two kids there and they arrived before me. I had made a reservation online and forwarded the email to my wife. When she arrived with the two kids, she told the gentlemen our name (spelling it out for him) and time of reservation. After a few minutes of scrolling up and down on his computer he informed my wife there was no reservation and they didn't have any room for us. My oldest son was looking over his shoulder and noticed our name and reservation on his screen and told him that's it right there. He acted stupid and said his eyesight wasn't that good. Either he's really stupid or didn't want us and two kids in the restaurant.

After we were seated, the waitress was less enthused to help us and not very friendly at all. I'm thinking that I'm going to spend some $$, she could cheer up just a bit.

My wife and I split a walnut and apple salad which was good, then split the crab and bone in filet. We ordered our filet medium, when it came out it was raw and cold in the middle. Um, hello if i'm paying this much for a steak you think they would get it correct. Crab was good, steak was just ok after sending it back. It came back well done.

We had sweet potato, crab cakes, mac and cheese and onion rings as our sides. All were good, but yet again the sweet potato came our stone cold like it was directly out of the refrigerator.

Dessert was cheese cake was just ok.

Not sure what the attitude was for, maybe they just didn't want kids, but I ended up spending $270 dollars on dinner and much rather spend it at Harris steak house or house of prime rib.

Not worth the $$, you can always count on Harris or House of Prime Rib for consistent good food!
author: Jonathan K.

description: Good solid seafood/steakhouse. We had a great dinner of oysters, crabs and steak! All cooked perfectly. The ambiance is definitely on the dark and romantic side with a touch of what I imagine to be vintage San Francisco. I recommend it.
author: Michael J.

description: Great steak and wine. Fun supper club athmosphere. Service was superb. I would recommend for a dress up or casual dinner. Both would be welcomed to this relaxed athmosphere.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
Our waitress informed us that they've been voted the best steakhouse in SF and one of the Top 10 in the USA - fun fact to start off our dinner. The ambiance was a little odd - lots of carnival/clown themed decor, red velvet, etc. We got:

- single order of shrimp - shrimp comes with some shell on, but easy to peel. Some are very small, some are decent sized. I'd skip it next time
- single order of mussels - perfect, perfect, perfect. Super delicious
- super bone in filet mignon - expensive ($65) but absolutely delicious. Perfect sear, perfectly medium rare (actually a little on the rarer side, but I like it that way) and the seasoning/flavor was not too overwhelming.
- bone in NY - didn't taste this, but supposedly excellent
- brussels sprouts - skip it. Strangely overcooked and cheesy
- twice baked potato - tasty, but it's a twice baked potato so nothing special
- cauliflower - loved it, probably the best side dish we had. 

Side dish portions are SMALL, but steak size is large. The bread they give is soft with some sort of garlic butter on it which makes it tasty but a little greasy.

Overall, I recommend this place if you're looking for a nice steak dinner, but be ready to drop some cash as it is definitely not cheap.
author: Amy Y.

description:
The food rocks here. If you are hungry for steak, you are in the right place.

Ambiance is fantastic. If you want to take a girl out to a romantic date, this is the place.

Try: Mussels are delicious, Bone in Steaks are to die for.
author: Moto B.

description:
Had better steaks, even at home. The selection of sizes is scarce. You can only choose between 8 oz filet or 20 oz + other steaks (for 62$ and up without a side). What if I want a smaller size steak which isn't a fillet?
We went out to celebrate with friends, my partner and myself shared a dinner of 1 appetizer (lobster croustini), 1 steak (prime rib), 1 side (Brussels sprouts which were by the way a great side with a really nice sauce to deep the steak in it) and shared a bottle of wine with all the rest of the table. Ended up costing us 150$ even though we actually shared a one person meal. I can easily find a comparable steak for about 30$ and pan fry it at home to our enjoyment.
author: Mashav S.

description:
Not that impressed. The food was okay; the service was okay. We came here for dinner for my sister's bday, and I could not wait to eat the food. The raving reviews got me really excited. I was bummed out because we ordered shrimp and mussels for appetizer, and it was the last thing that came to the table. If I knew it would come 15/20 minutes after our entree, I would not have ordered my entree since it was basically what I ordered as well. By the time the appetizer came, we were all full. Mussels are not good to take home, so we were forced to eat it, or we would have to waste it. I sure did not feel good the next morning =(

Besides the food, the dessert was good. I loved the Italian cheesecake. It's not heavy like traditional cheesecake. It was light and seemed like there was an angel cake.
author: Casey M.

description: Ok - so I have struggled to find a steakhouse that I loved after leaving Cincinnati (Carlos and Johnny) but this place got the mark.  Phenomenal bread, great shrimp and unreal steaks.  If you are coming to San Fran, you have to come here
author: David B.

description: I was very pleased with the free Vallett parking,  the service was excellent, the waiter checked up on us every 5 minutes with fresh water and kept the bread coming. My wife never finishes  her steak, but she ordered the bone in  NY steak and completely destroyed it. I had the super bone in filet medium rare, it was God sent delicious. The crab was a little dry but had great flavor. Twice baked potato was a first and surprisingly delicious. The steak speaks for itself. Over all I enjoyed every second I was there.
author: Craig L.

description: The bone in ribeye is the bomb! Excellent date night restaurant, bring your appetite because the servings are huge, excellent staff!!!
author: Kevin T.

description: The food was ok. Steaks not cooked correctly, waiters were not very good and definitely not friendly nor helpful, and everything was very high priced for what you got. Even in San Francisco. The steak was tender but way under cooked. The only steak that was cooked close to how it was ordered was the one without the bone. Caesar salad made with iceberg lettuce also a little weird but that wasn't that bad. Just wasn't what was expected.
author: Valerie M.

description:
Great for a date night. Amazing steak, seafood and cocktails. Skip  the crab. The rooms have interesting decor. The bartenders are great so don't be sky and arrive early for some great cocktails. 

Valet available.  

Great for parties too!
author: Heather H.

description:
I dined here one night while visiting San Francisco. I had the Crab Cakes appetizer and Surf and Turf with Brussel Sprouts with pancetta.

The Crab Cakes were cooked to perfection. The crust was a crispy, golden brown while the center remained a smooth, rich consistency. The cranberries the cakes were served with added a sweet layer which were surprisingly wonderful. I usually find Crab Cakes to be overly filling, but these were perfect. 

The Surf and Turf entrée was served with Crab Legs and Filet Mignon. The crab meat was delicate and absorbed the melted butter nicely. The steak was perfectly cooked to medium. It remained juicy and succulent from my first bite to last. 

The Brussel Sprouts with pancetta, two of my favorite foods, were perfectly cooked to crisp goodness. The Brussel Sprouts were able to cook in the pancetta fat resulting in a delightful, crusty layer. This was my favorite dish, hands down. I definitely enjoyed my meal and would return again.
author: Theresa S.

description: Service was good atmosphere was funk. We ordered the 16oz bone in New York stake. For the price paid it tasted very bland.
author: Mo B.

description: If you are looking for comfort food then this is your place. We had the bone in filet mignon and it was excellent, flavorful and cooked medium to medium rare. The side dishes were very good (brussel sprouts and swiss chard) but laden with butter just like the steak. Overall, the dinner was very heavy on my stomach. The waiter was pushy for us to keep ordering drinks and then asked if we wanted to drink our dessert as well. I would come back here for the atmosphere and try the crab next time. The dinner was just a bit heavy (buttery) for me.
author: Anne L.

description: We wanted to try a new steakhouse and this place was okay. We had the lobster soup and the crab crostini which was okay nothing amazing. For dinner we ordered double mussle and a whole crab and my daughter had the porterhouse. I can honestly say Ruth Chris is sooo much better. The potterhouse didn't melt in your mouth and it had no flavor. The crab was good not out of this world. Our sides were the mac & cheese and portebello mushrooms. Mushrooms were good mac and cheese okay. To end our dinner I ordered the cheesecake and it's not cheesecake it tasted like cake. Overall it was an okay experience. The service was great! One thing I also disliked was that we sat by the window and the tables were too close to each other where the people next to us could listen to our conversation.  I'd probably never come back. Go to Harris or RuthChris.
author: Ruby L.

description:
Bone in filet = awesome 
Brussels great too
Pretty much locals only, and we love finding those places in SF
author: Chris C.

description:
I've driven by this restaurant many times  and finally decided to try it. Came here on a Thursday night for dinner and was seated right away.

Super Bone in Filet Mignon: This was ok. It wasn't as tender as I'd expected, but I did like the nice sear on the outside.

Whole Crab: Dry and flavors were boring. I wouldn't order this again.

Skillet Roasted Mussels: This was over cooked like the crab. Some mussels were so over done it was crispy. I've had better mussels.

Crispy Crab Cakes: this had more bread crumbs that crab and it wasn't fresh. Tasted like the crab patties were made a day in advance.

Mod Mac: This was good. It was a nice classic Mac.

What turned me off was how the crab and mussels were so over cooked. If I come back it'll be to try their other steaks only.
author: Charisa N.

description: This place is amazing - called ahead for reservations and they where really friendly on the phone - party of 5. We walked in the place is authentic and vintage - love the decorations and the atmosphere. The server was very friendly and very disposed and patient. To food - OMG. The food - everything was. Amazing - died and went to heaven and then came back - and where did I go to eat BOBOs ! This pace is a must go to if you are visiting SF! Enjoy !
author: Hector G.

description:
It was my brother-in-law's birthday so my wife and I decided to take him out for a nice steak dinner. Overall, Bobo's is a decent casual fine dinning restaurant, with stellar service and interesting ambiance, although it is hard to say that it is the best steak I ever had.

For the appetizer we shared the carpaccio and lobster crostini. The carpaccio had decent flavor although we were disappointed with the freshness of the fish itself. The lobster crostini was awesome, no complaints here. Just keep in mind that the appetizers are really tiny, like one appetizer per person.

For the main course, I had the super bone-in filet minion and my wife had the whole crab; we shared both dishes. We also got a side of Brussels sprouts, sweet potato mash, and twice-baked potato. First of all, the sides are amazing. All three were absolutely delectable and I would have been perfectly happy with just the sides and some bread. Second, the filet minion was decent but I was expecting more from a place with such a good reputation. The char was great but the meat itself was under-seasoned and not cooked to my requested temperature (I asked for medium rare but it was rare). Finally, my wife's crab was awesome; I overheard the waitress say that their crab is cooked in some type of a butter sauce, and it certainly makes sense because the crab is jam-packed with flavor.

In short: appetizers = okay; sides = great; steak = okay; crab = great
author: Toby K.

description: This place was great. Good ambience and great customer service. The food was good. This was my first time here and I was craving a steak and crab. The price of the food is not bad. You pay for what you get! If you've ever been to the stinking rose in Los Angeles, this is similar. Definitely would recommend it.
author: Kristy C.

description: The interior was pleasant.  Almost like a dark circus theme.  We had high expectations for the steak. Boy was it a big let down.  Smh.  We ordered the ribeye.  Didn't even taste like it was dry aged at all. I never use steak sauce or salt on fancy steaks.  But this time I did. Very disappointed.  We were on vacation from Los Angeles and sadly San Francisco steaks can't compare to those in LA.  Service was okay
author: Jason L.

description:
Came here on a random Sunday night. Called at 5 for a reservation at 7, quick and easy. 
Ordered the double order of muscles, it was so good and the way they presented was great. The muscles were still cooking on the iron skillet, still sizzling when it came out. Ordered the Bone In New York steak (medium rare), baked potatoes, and brussels sprouts.
Overall, the whole dinner was very good, NOT GREAT because the steak had too much fat on there, I'm more of a leaner meat person, so that made it not great. Other than that, I will def come back here when I'm craving a healthy protein meal. I'll be back! #arnoldvoice
author: Q W.

description: Food was decent in my opinion. We ordered the half crab, bone-in filet, brussel sprouts, yams and mac and cheese. Best thing was the brussel sprouts but I didn't care for the fact that they put capers in them. Service was good. Valet was nice (complimentary and convienent). In the future, if I'm heading to a steakhouse, I prefer Flemings or Ruth Chris.
author: Erlinda H.

description:
The decor is interesting and it is dimly lit inside but the steaks are very flavorful and cooked to perfection. Tried the bone in filet mignon with the onion rings and twice baked potato as sides. They cook the steaks to medium rare but I ordered mine as medium. The steak was tender and seasoned greatly. The char was slightly too much for my liking but still tasty. The onion rings were nice thick slices of onion and had a nice crunch to them. The twice baked potato was good but would've been even better wirh bacon and chives on top.

Serive was on point but the steak menu is some what limited with a petite filet, bone in filet mignon, dry aged New York steak and 20 oz filet mignon along with a plethora of seafood options. The crab looked delicious but too bad I'm not much of a seafood fan. 

I would come back if hopr didn't have any openings or other choices were all booked!
author: James H.

description: My boyfriend and I came for our 3 year anniversary and the food was great, service fantastic and prices were reasonable.
author: Devon K.

description:
After scouring yelp for a good place to celebrate my love's 32nd birthday, I chose Bobo's.

Free valet is AWESOME! Now that this generation uses Uber much more, parking isn't much of an issue.

Ambiance of the restaurant is really cool. We sat on the 2nd floor which was more quiet and the decor was pretty interesting. 

Food was pretty good. I think we over-ordered! 

For starters, the bread with garlic and butter drizzled on top was pretty good. We ordered a caesar salad which was good as well as a single order of the mussels with a melted compound butter dip were REALLY good!
