For our entree, the Bone-in Ribeye was pretty good. The first bite was delicious and then afterwards was decent. We ordered a whole crab and my lady said the crab was a bit on the dry side. We asked for more of the melted compound butter to dip. Sometimes we like to over-do it and over-do it we did! 

For the sides, we ordered the onion rings, the twice baked potato and the portabellow mushroom. I thought the onion rings were well executed and had a really good creamy dipping sauce that went well with it. The twice baked potato was pretty good too. The portabello mushroom was my favorite side!

For dessert, we had an order of the dunce caps! These were small waffle cones with chocolate mousse inside of them. Pretty great way to end the meal and they gave an extra one with a candle to celebrate the occasion! 

I'll come back one day! There's so many great places to eat in SF! I would definitely recommend coming to Bobo's! Get the mussels, bone-in filet mignon (so you have more space for everything else), the portabello mushroom and the dunce caps!
author: Tom B.

description:
I Made reservations for Father's Day....
Or so I thought. 
Spencer was so nice and seated us anyway. 
Took my husband and daughter and we all enjoyed ourselves. Our server was very sweet. Our food was delicious. Great service. Very mellow atmosphere. 
We hate loud places and this was just perfect.

Thank you Bobos!
author: Eryn V.

description:
Make no mistake: If I could make love to food, it would be with Bobo's Bone-in Filet! But not before I grab the Mac n Cheese and rub it all over myself. I'll save you the details, but yes, you heard me correctly - this Bone-in Filet is a sensual piece of meat! 

I came here with a group of 6, on a Sunday night. 2 in the group had previously dined here and decided this would be a perfect way to end the night after we had just finished with a booze cruise. To their credit, the decision was spot on. Being that it was a Sunday, the wait was not long (FYI Ask them to seat you upstairs. I felt like we were secluded with a great view) 

The first thing they bring out to you, is a fresh hot loaf of garlic bread. Be careful not too eat to much, or you wont get to eat all of what is to come out. The bone-in filet is really amazing. They sear the outside of the meat so well, that it keeps the inside juicy. I kid you not, inside the meat has a buttery texture with every glorious bite. By the end of it, whether you are full or not, you will attempt to finish it. This goes well with their Twice Baked Potato. If you're not huge on red meats, don't worry! Order the crab and/or muscles - or even better....the double crab, double muscles!! I guarantee you will feel like a king! Really, they serve it to you in a big 2 foot platter. 

Bottom line, everything I had was great. What topped it off was the service from the hostess, and waiter. We were attended well at all times. I recently had a dream of being here again, so I will def be coming back. Sooner than later.
author: Leonel B.

description:
LUX OVER-HYPED LET-DOWN in SF!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
SAD STEAK-HYPE!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
DO NOT STOP!
~~~~~~~~~~~~
DESPITE THE RED!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
9 HEALTH VIOLATIONS IN JUST 3 YEARS!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Yep....it seems that the first part of the name applies...

BOBOs* ...it seems that a bunch of them run this so-called "Steakhouse"

Now for a FREE association bunch of adjectives or other words:

Too Dark & Red ( see pic), Forgettable, Flaky, Flatulent, Few, Feverish, Poverty, Poor, Plague, Plaque, Boring, Bland, Bare, Bacteria, Cramped, Claustrophobic, Cluttered, Contaminated, Cheap, Whore, Over-priced, Over-Hyped, Ordinary, Nightmarish, Nightcrawler, Garish, Gross, Gunk, Junk, Jerk, Jive, Mutant, Vampire, Vapid, Vacuous, Viral, PMS, PTSD, OCD, LSD, STD, BS, etc......

IT is Neither Romantic, nor Good....both of us totally hated the food, the service, and finally the ridiculous price...of over $200 (with tip) (see pic of bill!) with no Kobe, only one boring steak, an overpriced wine, and just a veg or two for my wife.

The interior looks like it was designed by a delusional crack-craphead who after throwing together random shit from the Ross's Clearance section, decided to invite some ladies of the evening for a S&M Thunderbird drunken orgy.

In short an amazing Yelp let down....please pay attention to the less than glowing reviews.  Apparently, this place's rating is over-inflated by either people who have no idea about how really excellent steak should taste like, or by the passing clueless "Honeymooning" tourist, where everything seems wonderful, since they are on vacation.

I so wished I did the sure thing and either had a real pricey (~$200) (but always buttery tasty & nice sized)

 Japanese True Kobe Rib Eye Steak at nearby Harris's Steakhouse.... 

(especially yummy with the Jazz Band play-in, I'm just say-in)

 or went to the other established Steakhouse's like Ruth Chris or so many others

who specialize in Steaks & not BS....

What a waste of mulla! 

P.S.- I actually forgot what kind of steak I had here, it was so utterly forgettable!
It is so forgettable, that I forget why I have given it two stars instead of one....maybe I have a warm place in my heart for Bobo Bonobos & Bacteria.

* see def. in Spanish, Portugese, & Tagalog..... or maybe as smart as a Bonobo. :)
author: Paul M.

description:
Went to dinner with friends. I was looking forward to eating here because it has the same name as my oldest son's nickname and we'd pass by the place with the kids and tease my son "Hey Bobo, theres your restaurant." Lol. Came in with sentimental memories, but left with real disappointment. 

Let me first say that it was not what I was expecting. You can't  tell at all from the outside what the inside would be like. I guessed a sort of rustic upscale kind of ambiance.

Observations:
1-The free valet parking was a nice start.
2-Decor was unusual, that of a gypsy fair. Could use some dusting though. 
3-Several floor levels of dining. Not disabled person friendly. All stairs to get from/to each level.
4-Unique seating set ups. A few tables were set inside walls that gave it some privacy if you wanted it.
5-Limited menu selections

We started out with their house bread which I didn't care for. It was some kind of garlic mushroom seasoned thing. For dinner I had the porterhouse with mod Mac and yam. I ordered it med/well but when it came out it was charred (over seared). The porterhouse comes with a small filet mignon. The filet was black (again seared too long) and was mostly well done than med but was ok. The actual porterhouse was too dry. Also charred on the outside but med/well on the inside. It was tough to cut which also was tough to chew. A bit disappointed for something that costs $70. 

The sides were good though. The yam was the closest thing to mashed potatoes. The twice baked potato comes as is so you can't add anything to it like a normal baked potato (hubby had that). The mod Mac was good. I wouldn't call it a mac&cheese though. It's pasta with sauce but definitely not a mac&cheese since the pasta isn't entirely covered with a cheese sauce but more like "topped" with their sauce that wasn't that cheesy but was good.

Everything is a la carte and definitely over priced. I've had better steaks at Texas Roadhouse but that's just me. The side dishes are not worth $9 each and the desserts as well. The desserts are pre-made so you cant ask to have it changed in any way if you had an allergy to something or substitute a sauce because of flavor preference as someone in our party asked and found out. The menu is slim pickings and with all the rave I expected the quality to be a lot more. Before I forget, the service was excellent.

So sadly, I would not go back to Bobo's. I'm probably the only one but there you go.
author: Eileen S.

description: Very good! This place is amazing.. and a must see when in SF. Seafood was fresh and awesome presentation! Flavorful like I've had in Beverly Hills
author: Ink P.

description:
Really enjoyed this dinner. I felt like I was in a lower manhattan Italian restaurant but really I was in a fabulous San Francisco steakhouse. This place has longevity written all over it. Loyal customers, longtime staff, amazing reputation.

It's not in the most modern building and the bar is small, but it's got a lot of character.

We had an awesome meal. The bone in filet was perfectly cooked to order as medium rare. It cut like butter and melted in my mouth. Whatever seasoning they use burst with flavor. The sides of mac & cheese and brussel sprouts were great, decent portions to share with 2-3 people. For dessert we had the chocolate mousse cones. The mousse was very good, but it didn't quite work with the cones for me. 

I highly recommend. You must make a reservation. People who tried to drop in were quoted at least a 45 minute wait.
author: Taj K.

description: Excellent!!! My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary with the best steaks ever. Definitely coming back again.
author: Kim T.

description: Bobo's is one of my boyfriend and I favorite restaurant to go to. We been here numerous times and we always leave with a satisfied tummy. The filet mignon is a must and the mussels is also very good! Service is always excellent and attentive. I love the decoration of the restaurant. Some people might find the clowns and lighting of the restaurant creepy but I think it's so unique! Bobo's is definitely a five stars on my list.
author: Wing C.

description:
Very expensive for average quality food.

A la carte steak was $55. Soggy heirloom tomato side for $12.95. Five onion rings thrown on the plate - $8.95. Indifferent service. Claustrophobic dining room.
author: Howard B.

description:
May be a bit overpriced I've had better steaks. Steak was only warm if that when served
 twice baked potato was excellent service was average
author: G B.

description:
My wife and I came here tonight and was very impressed.. We were late and they had no problems reserving our spot and for our anniversary they put as on the third floor. Also I forgot to add that they have FREE VALET which meant that we did not have to look for parking... 

We ordered:

a) moscow moose and another coctail which were very refreshing
b) We ordered the yellowtail carpezio with ponzu sauce ... MUST TRY BECAUSE ITS AMAZING! It melts in your mouth! WOW
c) sizzling shrimp which was not anything special
d) GARLIC BREAD was delicious...
e) The bone in Filet Mignon was steller as it was tender... It was very moist with a lot of flavor
f) we had a loaded potato which complements the meal well
g) The wedge salad with bleu cheese and cranberries is not that great pass on that.. 
h) We had the cheesecake and the chocolate cones were given complementary because it was our anniversary..

Even though, some items were just ok.. The service was on point with the waiter making suggestions and really cantering to our needs!! Great time and Great food defintely a must!!
author: Mark N.

description:
Came here because of great reviews about their filet mignon. I'm a big filet mignon kind of girl, so I have to try it and see for myself. I give it a 3.5 because our steak was cold.

|| Food ||
14oz Bone-in Filet Mignon (my order) - ordered it in medium rare+. Juicy and tender but lack some flavor. Steak was almost perfect til I sliced it in the middle to see how it was cooked. The middle part was cold, so we had to ask our server to heat it up some more. 

22oz New York "Sinatra" cut steak (my man's order) - He thinks it was a 6.5. He ordered it in medium rare+, the meat was chewy and cold as well. The redness of the steak was kind of weird like it was frozen a few hours ago. 

Sides:
Portabello mushrooms and Mod Mac and Cheese - just okay. Nothing special.

|| Service ||
Service was good. Our server, Theo was nice and patient enough when we asked him if we could have our steaks re-heated a bit more. He also recommended to order it in medium, but I don't think that's the case. We just assumed that the steaks were frozen. 

|| Ambience ||
It was cool and nicely decorated. Perfect spot to hang out with some friends.

|| Overall ||
I'm not sure if I'm going back here again. For the price that we paid, we weren't really that impressed. I guess I have high expectations.
author: Charmaine L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. Given the $, I should have.

The appetizers were delicious as were the sides.
The steak was cooked appropriately but lacking some flavor. 

What annoyed me was the overall service. First of all, it was a Monday night and the restaurant was more than 1/2 empty. They seated us at a 2-top table by the window. It took about 15 minutes to ask us for water or a glass of wine. Then, after taking our order, the reservationist asked us to move one table over - a good 20 minutes after we had been seated at the table. We got up, scooted over and sat down. 10 minutes later, they sat another couple at our table. This made absolutely no sense. At such an establishment, they should have sent over an appetizer or a dessert to apologize for the inconvenience. I just found that to be extremely unprofessional especially given the $250 bill we paid for 2 people.
author: Vic M.

description: Not sure about the hype but my steak was worse than sizzlers. My cut was very bland and burnt. I couldn't taste the age in the steak. Over priced menu. Water was not refilled. Don't recommend; won't come back.
author: Jimmy C.

description: The service was excellent.  The steaks were disappointing. We ordered the bone in rib eye, the meat quality cut was not very good and there was zero flavor to the meat. The bone in mignon was over cooked. We sent it back, received a new one answered it was ok. The crab cakes and tomato salad  was excellent.
author: Amber B.

description:
Call us lucky as we got a 9PM reservation the same day it was made (Feb 14th). Thank you OpenTable via Yelp and the refresh button! We arrived on time and waited less than ten minutes for our table. The complimentary garlic & olive bread was a good starter. Flavor was very subtle, which I appreciate since I'm not a big fan of olives.

Main entrees are served a la carte, so ordering sides was necessary. We got the house salad which consisted of romaine, tomatoes, bread crumbs, avocado, and red onions. It was very light, especially because it's served with evoo. Overall, nothing too special but definitely didn't ruin our huge appetite for the entrees. We also ordered twice-baked potato, which was great -- very creamy melt in your mouth goodness. It was cooked well enough so the skin was a little flaky. There was little cheese baked into the potato too. However, I thought the zucchini bits were odd.

Bf ordered the bone-in filet mignon, medium rare, but the doneness varied throughout; it was very rare near the bone. I ordered the surf & turf, which consisted of half a crab and a petit filet mignon. The crab was very meaty and delicious. The ginger reduction sauce served with it was very creamy, but too oily. I spent more time cracking than eating and ashamedly left a mess of crab shells all over the table and floor. The petit filet mignon (ordered medium) was very small but so so so tender and juicy! A dry-aged beef cooked to perfection and paired well with a Pinot noir.

Finally, we ended the meal with a strawberry Italian cheesecake. It was very light, airy, and not as dense as your average cheesecake. Italian cheesecakes are made from ricotta, therefore giving it a fluffier, mousse-like consistency.

Service was friendly and attentive, though a little slow in the beginning. Restaurant decor is very unique and wacky -- red walls, red carpet, jester masks, argyle-printed ornaments, etc. ...not somewhere I'd like to be alone in the middle of the night. The free valet parking is a definite plus!
author: Priscilla W.

description:
This is just to echo the recommendations to order your steak at least one notch more well done than you would like. We did that at the recommendation of other yelp reviewers (ordered medium when we wanted medium rare) and it still came out too rare (bright pink all the way through). 

It was delicious though!  We also enjoyed and recommend the twice baked potato, the swiss chard & the brussels sprouts. Not much to say that the other 1463 reviewers have not said.
author: Catherine H.

description:
WOW! This place is amazing! From the minute you walk in the door you are blown away by the decor and small horseshoe bar. I made reservations for last Monday around 7:30 but we got there to early so we sat at the bar and had two drinks each. The bar tender made them so delicious and well worth the price!

Around 7:30 they sat us immediately at an intimate two person table on the top floor and the waitress came with their house bread and took our drink order immediately. We ordered a bottle of Malbec which was delicious and the bread was so good we had to take some home with us! Then we ordered the double shrimp and crab combo with a side of cauliflower. WOW, WOW, WOW. The food was to die for! We ate every last bite! Then we ordered the cheesecake for dessert and it was a layered cheesecake. Too good for words.

I HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Wow, what an experience. I've heard great things about Bobo's, but never had the opportunity to stop by. We ordered the Bone-In Filet Mignon, Petit Filet Mignon, Onion Rings and Swiss Chard to share. Paired with the olive garlic bread and a pinot noir, the food experience was just exceptional. I was impressed by the buttery texture of the filet and the onion rings were probably the best I've had. I noticed the Petit was cooked more on the medium side (I ordered medium rare), but still delicious.  

The ambiance is casual, laid back and in my opinion channels a mix of Peter Luger's / Stinking Rose. Loved the service and the no-fuss presentation.

I'll be back for the 60 oz (to share, I think) and the seafood!

Must tries: Bone-In Filet Mignon, Onion Rings
author: Linda X.

description: Had some friends in town from Southern California and they heard about Bobo's from a friend. We went to dinner (3 adults and 2 kids under 2.5) and our waiter Renaud was THE BEST. He explained everything so well. Improvised and created a kid friendly cup (non glass) for the 2 year old and gave the 10month old a spoon to play with (she was teething and it was great for her). He just knew what to do with kids!! (I was the one person that was not a parent) The service was amazing! As we left, another member of Bobo's gave the 2 year old some ice cream and he was STOKED! It felt like a family atmosphere and I will definitely be back again. Renaud and the entire staff at Bobo's was the best!
author: Heather C.

description:
The BF and i wanted to go to HOPR, but unfortunately the wait was 3 hours... so we decided to find another steakhouse in the area. Bobo's popped up on my Yelp search, so we decided to give it a try.

Very cute interior, and we were seated immediately.

I hate how some steakhouses do steak a la cart, and then charge an absurd amount for side dishes... and this place was definitely one of them ($9 for one twice baked potato?? C'mon.....) But still, we decided to give it a try.

I ordered the surf and turf with the roasted crab and petit filet. I thought the meat was okay, but the crab was really delicious. The sauce they serve it with was amazing too.

All in all it was a good dinner.... but probably will still stick to HOPR next time!!
author: Michelle L.

description:
We stumbled upon Bobos when my husband found himself craving a steak and a reservation was open.  This place was a win win since I love crab but not steak.  He had their signature bone in filet which was excellent,  seared to perfection and tender like butter inside. I ordered the half crab and was in heaven. The garlic sauce made this the best dungeness crab I've ever eaten. And I've eaten a lot of it. The sides were all excellent, don't miss the onion rings, yams, or brussel sprouts.

The food and service were outstanding.  The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is due to the quirky outdated decor and the odd music selection that randomly cut on and off throughout our meal. They played an odd assortment of 80's music. The decor and music helps it feel more casual which I liked but could see others being disappointed in.
author: Sarah S.

description:
"The world is my oyster" is a famous quote in one of Shakespeare's scenes.  Which meant all the world's pleasures and opportunities were for the taking.

At Boboquivari's the world is my Clam, Crab, Shrimp, and steak.  All the pleasures of life were sizzling on my table, just a pick, crack, cut, and peel away.  Mine for the taking.

Walking in the restaurant, I was greeted by the friendly hostess.  It's amazing how a simple nice smile makes a person feel welcome.  I think at times restaurants forget how important the first person a customer sees (which is the hostess) can start the experience off right and be remembered after. 

After being seated the waitress who was also all smiles took my order:

Combo which included:

Crab:  At Bobo's, they make crab right, simple.  Doesn't take much to make crab delicious.  I don't need no crab cracker...  That's what my teeth are for, those crab crackers were slowing me down.

Shrimp:  kind of small, probably my least favorite of the three seafoods we ordered.

Mussels:  Like Mama Klump said "Hercules! Hercules!  Ok, she was talking about muscles not mussels.  But damn those mussels are good, I could eat these all day.

Filet Mignon & New York steak:  Filet was thick, tender, perfectly seasoned goodness.  New York was a little tough but still tasty.  When I return I'm definitely ordering only the Filet Mignon.

Mac & Cheese:  My friend who came to Bobo's with me said don't forget to mention the Mac & Cheese in your review, which was the star of the night to my amiginha.  She wants to come back just for this side dish.  I asked the waitress why it's called modern Mac & Cheese, off hand I can't remember the name of the cheese she said they use, but it's definitely not the one mom used.

How Bobo's came up with the name and decor of clowns I'm not sure.  But this restaurant is no joke when it comes to excellent seafood, steak and service.  One of my favorite seafood and steakhouses in San Francisco.  

At Boboquivari's as Nicki Minaj says "It`s so amazing I figured out this world is ours for tha taking"..
author: Michael L.

description:
Went here recently on a short trip for a vacation with my wife.  I raved about the place to her beforehand from a past experience but on this visit I felt let down.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye and my wife ordered the bone-in fillet and also some crab.  My ribeye was not served anywhere near hot nor even close to warm.  I asked the waiter about this and he stated that is how it is served.  I didn't believe him but didn't feel like making too big an issue and just ate it because it was still edible.  My wife's steak was worse, she is pretty forgiving on food but I found out towards the end of our meal that her steak was burnt in a few places and I thought it a bit late to send back since it was half eaten.   I'm not sure what happened between my visit a few years ago and now but this place seems to have fallen hard on quality.  I thought perhaps that maybe it was just me that had the problem but the table next to us also had issues with their steak that night.  The food is still good but if you have to pay that much for what we got then I'd rather go elsewhere.

Service from the wait staff was also sub-par as well.  They refilled my water once and only towards the end of the meal after we were done.  At a high-end restaurant, I think having a drink sit empty the whole meal without anyone asking if I wanted a refill a sign of a bad restaurant.
author: Charles L.

description: Probably one of the best steak houses I've had and the price was not bad at all compare to other places. I recommend getting the half t bone half crab. It is delicious and the steak is very very good. Crab is a little dry... Hmm I think it was over cooked.
author: Oliva L.

description:
3.5 star

3 star was filet mignon bone in
3.5 star was mussels and whole crab
Didn't try the ribeye this time
author: Bo L.

description:
Bobo's had been on my list for quite a while.  After checking it out, I wish I had gone there a lot sooner.

The place is super old school, both in its ambience and decor, and also in the polished nature of its service.  It's definitely cozy, especially in the quieter secluded upstairs dining room, where you feel like you're eating under a circus tent (there are colorful curtain-like fabrics draped against the walls from top to bottom).

As for the food, it was exceptional.  They do a really good steak here, I was impressed. I started with the crab cakes which were solid, not greasy at all.  For the steak, I had to go with the bone-in filet.  This was a tremendous cut, generous in its thickness and dry-aged for 6 weeks.  It was cooked to perfection, seared and served piping hot.  We also sampled a couple of sides and they were ok, good but not epic.  The sides at Bourbon Steak and 5A5 are way better but this placed is all about the steak.

Service was perfect, our waitress took really good care of us.  All in all, a really great experience.  I would give it 5 stars if the rest of the food matched the steak, that's about the only thing keeping this place from being the best.
author: Saminda W.

description: I'd give the option of 3.5 stars if I could, but only because the steak was really good. The mussels and shrimp I ordered was fresh, but the mussels were overcooked to where the meat was shriveled up. The ratio of meat to shell was about 3:10 :(. The buttery sauce had a lot of sodium but was buttery delicious. The shrimp was salted a bit too much to my liking, and I love sodium, so that's saying something. My boyfriend ordered the super bone-in filet which was no doubt delicious, but for $55 I think it's a bit overpriced. I may be biased, but the steak and seafood in Seattle is much better.
author: Lisa U.

description:
Sister restaurant to Osso Steakhouse and this place is MUCH better!
Started with the double order of mussels, the butter dipping sauce was addictive.
I shared the Super Bone-in Filet and it was on point. The best side was the mac n cheese, very creamy and velvety cheese sauce.

Service was attentive.
I would come back again!
author: Angela D.

description:
Wooooooooh! This place rocks!! So glad that I have found Bobo's while on vacay to San Francisco.  First and foremost, MUST get the Iron-Skillet Roasted Combo (Mussels, Shrimp & Crab) so you would never regret!!!!!  Seriously, this seafood platter was AMAZING!!  I could hear the sizzling sound and smell the garlicky aroma from the roasted/ grilled seafood already while the server was carrying our skillet like 3-4 tables away from where we were seated.  The seafood tasted fresh; seasoning was flavorful; portion was huge. One word, Delish!

Both the boyfriend and a friend of ours had the 6-week dry-aged NY steaks that were extra-flavorful because of the dry-aging process.  Another friend had a whole Dungeness crab roasted in garlic sauce; very garlicky and good but not impressive because we had already tried some of the Dungeness crab from the skillet combo!  I had the Basa a White Fish Filet, which was the only fish option on the menu.  Oh gawwwd.....the fish filet sauteed in soy-butter and topped with thinly-sliced dried seaweed was so Asian, and sooooooo delicious!!  The side items that we ordered, including the twice-baked potatoes, Portobello mushrooms, and roasted Brussels sprouts, were fabulous, too!  The server said that the mushrooms were like the Signature side item that everyone loved, but I personally liked the Brussels sprouts better.  One more thing, the complimentary bread along with the melted garlic butter dip was scrumptious!  

For a party of four, the bill with tax and tips included was $300-ish; Pricey but totally worth it!  I would return next time when visiting SF again!
author: Ada L.

description:
Wow, to think I about missed out on this place be cause I had to wait for our table and went to Bobo's Lounge (see my separate 1 star review). The service was so poor at the lounge, we just about went somewhere else.  

We sat upstairs back by the restrooms which didn't bother me at all. We had three kids with us ages 6-11 that felt the need to get up more regularly than normal.  The food here was outstanding. I had the bone-in Filet Med Rare, which was cooked to perfection. The twice-baked Baked Potato was delicious and the Brussels Sprouts were Fantastic. They have a great selection of wine and a full bar downstairs to satisfy any libation needs. The service was impeccable. The server seemed to sense what we were going to need before we asked for it. Everyone cleaned the plate and walked away extremely satisfied. This place isn't too far off the embarcadero if you are staying down there.

We will definitely be back to Bobo's for dinner. I think next time we will opt to wait at the bar downstairs or stand outside in the cold versus going over to the lounge.

Cheers!
author: Jim P.

description:
Came here for my bday dinner with a big group and was glad they were able to accommodate us. I was gonna give them 3 stars, but decided to give them 4 stars and I'll explain later.

Food (3 stars)
-crab, mussels, and shrimp combo in a sizzling platter. This dish was okay, but it seem more for show( the sizzling plate) as i find this dish to be salty and oily.
-filet mignon. I ordered medium rare, but came out medium well. However, i think some of our orders were mixed up since we had a big group and we all ordered steaks as that's what they are known for. Again soaked in oil.
-mac & cheese and bake potato. Very oily again and had this very weird taste i cant explain.

Service (5 stars)
- The waiter was very attentive since we had a big group. All the food came together so none of us was left out. My friend had spilled salt all over her steak and they got her a new one right away which i thought was very generous of them.

Overall, service was excellent but food is not up to par being a high end restaurant. Hopefully they can improve on the food and cut down on the oil.
author: Icy H.

description:
Three of us had dinner at Boboquivari's. Since it was for my birthday, we indulged, but just a little bit.

Cocktail: Moscow Mojito
While waiting for our table, I ordered a Moscow Mojito per the bartender. It was delicious! I didn't taste the alcohol, but I sure felt it! Thanks for carding me too! 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=iIYgOlD6b7WTdqY34SmVEQ)

Appetizer: Garlic Oil Bread Loaf & Lobster Bisque
Loved the presentation of the loaf, although I wished it had more garlic. The lobster bisque was mediocre. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=OuHx3M_fsUDuxxCIbbvszA ) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=8FfvL1B9CupPSRviQnTccg)

Entrée: Double Mussel Double Crab, Bone-in Filet Mignon, and Surf & Turf
My gluttonous self chose the double mussel and double crab appetizer as my entrée. Holy moly! A large crab and a bed of mussels! The crab was tasty! The mussels, however, were disappointing. Half of them were charred and inedible since it was on a sizzling platter. 

The bone-in filet mignon was the star. Like everyone has said, it was the thing to get. A thick, juicy, and perfectly cooked piece of meat! Yummy!  The Surf & Turf was a nice sampler plate. Best of both worlds. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=3OVy-Hbn8jrZFIxjZ9eZYA) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=2eUOjEHG-v8r0WsCMTFPoA) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=0me0YeRxZtcthiVN9lbFDg)

Sides: Portobello Mushroom & Twice Baked Potato
We didn't care much for the sides. Even the popular baked potato seemed to fall short of expectations. Plus we were too busy with our entrees to enjoy them much. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=C4VrzkqN9BprrK2TlocUDQ) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=BY_IXawcxkdaK5pjtVAKFw)

Dessert: Dunce Cap Cones
We decided to go for the cones since they sounded so interesting. But basically they were ice cream with a chocolate mousse-like filling. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=SYShRajFA8nG5Rti42OVpw)

Despite the food lacking wow factor, it was still good. I had a great experience at Bobo's. The atmosphere was great. The prices were reasonable. The service was wonderful. It didn't hurt that their valet parking is complementary. I've been itching to go back, so that means this place deserves at least 4 stars! Haha!
author: Marti L.

description:
I'm sadly not as impressed as I would have hoped with Bobo's. My sister, niece and I came here to celebrate our birthdays. Don't get me wrong, the steak and crab were fantastic. The complimentary bread was ok, not much flavor or anything special. Appetizer menu wasn't enticing and what we did get (crabcakes) lacked flavor and portion size was RIDICULOUS! Two silver dollar sized crabcakes with just as much filler as crab meat. Mind not blown. Side dishes were below expectations (modern Mac and Brussels sprouts). Everything needed more salt and the cheese used in the Mac didn't taste familiar. Ambiance is a bit cramped and pretty dark. We didn't have room for dessert but nothing looked too exciting anyway. Service was ok, but could have been more attentive and friendlier. Not the best steakhouse in SF by far, but I'm glad I gave it a try.

FYI, prices posted on Yelp are outdated. Surf and turf was $55.95 for regular filet and crab.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
This is seriously the best steak I had. It was perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked and it melted in my mouth. Their sides were also unique and delicious. We had the twice baked potato which was delightful. 

The bartender was awesome also. I had a drink in mind they didn't have on the menu and were able to make it for me just like I wanted it. Treat yourself and try this charming restaurant!
author: Lori R.

description:
Haven't been here in over 5 years.  I thought the crab had less tamale/garlic sauce then it was before.  Also, I remember in the past order the porterhouse that it was large enough that the filet and NY were on separate place.  This time it was all in one plate but still the separated style.

Friendly excellent service.  Good wine selection.  Meat always cooked perfect, rare.

Valet has my car in the front.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Ok... I'm from the east coast so I've visited the typical Morton's, The Palm, Capital Grille, etc steakhouses for business dinners. I though this places' surf and turf knocked it out of the park. I initally looked at the menu at about 3:00pm thinking 'oh I'll get a salmon or chicken dish' and to my initial dismay didn't see those types of dishes provided like other steakhouses. Thank goodness I wasn't completely lame that night and ordered the surf and turf... Oh my gosh was it the most amazingly cooked steak and very generous portion of succulent crab legs ever. The sides were fine and nothing to complain about, but I'm almost glad they weren't amazing as well so I could just focus on my crab and steak! I recommend cauliflower and brussel sprouts and the table also really enjoyed the twice-baked potatoe. Also, we ordered desserts and we were all a huge fan of the chocolate bomb and strawberry cheescake.  

Really weird ambience but awesome place that I highly recommend you visiting!
author: Aryn C.

description:
What a great little spot with great food and wonderful service.  I highly recommend the mussels which are prepared and served on a hot skillet finished in a wine and soy sauce.  I rarely order steak in San Fran as I usually am disappointed but my med rare bone in ny was done perfectly and delicious.  Wife had the cram legs which were also done on the skillet.  Wedge salad was fine but nothing special.  Choc bomb dessert good but again not crazy good.

Service and cozy vibe were a welcome change from the usual steakhouse program I am more accustomed to on east coast.

If you are looking for old school San Fran I believe this is it without being a tourist trap
author: Peter W.

description:
3.5 stars

If you have that carnal desire for a good piece of meat (no, not THAT kind) Bobo's will fulfill that need. 

The only thing you should get here is the bone in filet mignon. Perfectly medium rare, evenly distributed flavors, nice texture and very tender. The bf's ribeye wasn't as good as my filet mignon. We lucked out on the roasted mussels for our appetizer as those were wonderfully fresh and well seasoned with salt, pepper and garlic. 

Do not skip the cocktails at Bobo's! Their Manhattan is made with Fernet (oh you San Franciscans just love your Fernet!) garnished with their own brandied cherry. The Boborita is a girly hot pink color adorned with black salt on the glass;  the bf actually ordered this and it went down sooo easy that he didn't even had time to have a complex about it. 

The sides need a lot of work. You should just skip it altogether because the complimentary GIANT loaf of sourdough bread is yummy. The dessert was a fail. I immediately zeroed in on the pistachio panna cotta (Hi Miriam H, I know you love your pistachio too girly!) and was so disappointed. The texture was grainy instead of smooth and it should've been more soft set rather than firm. The mango anglaise did nothing to save this dessert. 

Our server wasn't the friendliest, I can understand that it's 7:30pm which is prime time for a restaurant, but at least our dishes came out fast. I'm giving out that half a star for the complimentary VALET parking, you really can't beat that in SF!
author: Janice C.

description:
If I had a wish for a last meal, it would be a bone-in filet from Bobo's.

The only thing bad about this place is that great food is no secret, so if you haven't made reservations ahead of time, then you're bound to wait. But they're used to this, so there's a little bar just next door that's also part of the Bobo family, with enough drink options to keep you occupied. Not a red meat eater? Don't fret, they're known for their seafood too and I can never get enough of their brussel sprouts. Yumm! Enough said.
author: T P.

description: All I can say is yum! We had a fantastic experience at Bobo's with our waiter (Alex) AND the food we ordered was delicious. It is a bit pricey, but well worth it. We ordered the 9oz filet and it was cooked perfectly... probably one of the best steaks I've had...  it was even crispy on top! The crab was also very good, but a bit messy to eat. The crab cakes were out of this world. If you are between the crab and the crab cakes because you want to add a little seafood to your meal, go for the cakes. The brussel sprouts were also great. And, although everyone gets the garlic bread - I just have to say it is probably the best garlic bread I've ever had. The place has a very cool ambiance and is both fun and intimate at the same time... not stuffy or pretentious at all. And last, I cannot rave about our Alex enough! He was knowledgeable, friendly funny, and caring. My friend was sick and without her even asking, he brought her a hot cup of water with lemon and honey. So incredibly sweet! He also dealt with our many menu questions and our annoying check splitting without batting an eye. He was the definition of excellent customer service and took the experience at Bobo's over the top. Highly recommend checking this place out in San Fran :)
author: Kristine P.

description:
Bobo, you have done right by me. Got to come to Bobo's for my birthday a couple weeks ago and enjoyed a delicious meal.

Boyfriend and I both got the bone in filet mignon and shared a mojito. Bone in filet mignon was off the heezy fo' sheezy. The outer layer was crispy while the inside was juicy, tender and succulent.

We also shared a dungess crab crostini which was delicious and had a big ball of fresh mozzarella that we got to enjoy throughout our meal.

Our side of twice baked potato was alright, there wasn't much flavor. Meh

For dessert, we ordered the chocolate cones that come on a plate of four. Twas really good. Recommended for sweet tooths with small appetites.

Mojito was good until he decided to drink all my soda and left me with scalding rum and mint.

The ambiance was great, dim light setting, perfect for date night. The props and decor kind of reminded me of harlequins or a circus.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Ambiance: Not bad. Marlesque/ circus decorations. Quiet with low dim lights. 

Ordered: Double Mussels and Double Shrimp & Filet Mignon with Bone. 

Total bill: $97 (excluding tips). 

To be honest, if it was a battle between House of Prime Ribs and Boboquivari's (bobo's) I would choose House of Prime Ribs. Why? First, Bobo's portions are about the same as the House of Prime Ribs but it costs more. Secondly, Bobo's filet mignon do not come with sides and each sides cost $8.95. Yes, that means if you want a stupid potato it is 9 bucks. And when they say it's a la carte, they really mean it is a la carte. There isn't even a freakin' granish or a piece of green to decorate the  filet mignon. Third, the  filet mignon  has no flavor. This is the part that upsets me the most. I just wish they would have added a little salt or pepper to the meat. I do have to say that the meat was tender and soft (at medium rare). 

Another con about Bobo's was that the place smoked up really badly towards the end of the dinner. My eyes were getting watery and I was inhaling a lot of bad smoke fumes. The staffed mentioned that the smoke came from kitchen but there wasn't any fire. They didn't know why there are so much smoke. There was one table left at the end of my meal and I am not sure if the restaurant relocated them to the bottom floor or what. Also, when I was existing the restaurant I could clearly see a film of smoke in the stairway (I was eating at the top floor).

The mussels and shrimps were good. The mussels were really good. It had a herby garlic flavor to it. The shrimps were a disappointment. There were like five shrimps and it doesn't look fresh. It looks like shrimps that have died a long time ago, defrosted, and just cooked. You can tell when the shrimp isn't fresh when the shells that are soft and clings to the meat. The shrimp meat wasn't chewy or juicy. Trust me, if you've had really garlic, juicy, jumbo shrimps before you won't be craving for Bobo's $34 or $35 something shrimps. 

Overall, the food isn't bad. It's just over priced. If you want good steak go to The House of Prime Ribs or even the HOUSE (near north beach). If you want fresh seafood go to SCOMA or CAJUN HOUSE for some garlic shrimp.
author: Lily K.

description: My brother and his wife brought me here for my Birthday.  It was obviously pricey, and the steak I had was OK.....but the biggest complaint I have is the small portion of ribeye they served.........I will not be back....
author: Wah C.

description: My steak dinner~I'm too busy eating enjoying my juicy steak; please don't talk to me!  Lol!
author: Shirley M. J.

description: The service was good. The food was not very impressive. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't excellent. 1st off, in their defense I don't particularly care for the porterhouse cut. I use the New York/ KC strip to make potato hash and to grill when I tailgate so I didn't appreciate that being their only option as far as stake.. There was nothing spectacular about the sides. I believe I had the mac-n-cheese.. Nothing special. My opinion is the Hose of Prime Rib is better. Parking is also a pain to say the least in that area so for all the trouble I expected more. As far as the steak.. The flavor was average. I ordered a medium steak and it was slightly overcooked but okay..I figured that since that's what they do for hours everyday they should be like clockwork, just like the House of Prime Rib..
author: damiain a.

description:
Had a reservation for 2 at 7:45 but arrived at 7:10. I asked if it was ok to be seated earlier than my reservation and they host said it was fine and to wait ten mins. The host asked us to sit at one of the table at the bar. We waited for half and hour to be seated... There were people who dropped in and was seated right away. Wasn't asked if we wanted anything to drink or anything. 
Another host came up to us and asked if we were waiting or if we were already seated at the table. Bad communication between the two hosts I assume. Our waiter was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu and the meat. 
 
My boyfriend and I each ordered the half crab and filet mignon and a side order of there Mac and cheese. Food was excellent. So gooooooooood... The crab is so flavorful, the flirt mignon melts in your mouth and the Mac and cheese is both crunchy and  savory. I do not mind coming back here again. 

Overall, good is excellent, service is ok.
author: Melissa G.

description:
BoBo's was OK, I didnt like that the Filet and Ny came from 
different T-bones not from the same Steak... My Favorite NY
Steak in The City is at PALIO de Asti, its the Perfect NY Cut
and they know How to Cook it... rumor has it one of the Chefs
worked/works at BOB''s Steak and apparently they know how
to do it. I prefer $35 not $50. . . . So Palio on Sacramento for
the Best Steak and Value in town...
author: Peter J.

description:
Review 300...Yay!  This was how I announced our dinner plans for No. 300:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TeNGVS2T_Rk&feature=related

Anyway, I saved No. 300 for one of the most popular steakhouses in San Francisco, Boboquivari's, aka Bobo's, which also means court jester.  The decor is appropriately playful and stylish, but not too much to make it cheesy.  The food, for the most part, is no joke.  The filet mignon was very tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.  If you're just looking for great steaks, I bet Bobo's will not disappoint.

The twice baked potato was excellent.  I would suggest asking for additional sour cream.  Also pretty good was the lobster curry soup.  

Sadly, some sides and appetizers failed to live up to expectations.  The complimentary half loaf garlic bread looked a lot better than it tasted; the middle part was soaked with butter while the other parts were dry and bland.  The grilled shrimp dish was small and undercooked.  Not impressive at all.  The lobster crostini was also just okay.

Other than the bread, Bobo's portions tend to be on the smaller scale.  The high price is definitely more of a reflection of the quality than size.  The filet mignon, for example, will wow you with the awesome quality of the aged beef, but the smaller portion may leave not leave you completely satisfied.

The good thing is that Bobo's gets right what matters the most, the meat.  Add that to decent service and complimentary valet parking, it will likely be a memorable meal.
author: Angel S.

description:
Absolutely delicious dinner. Probably one of the best pieces of meat I've ever had. I went with the bone in filet medium rare- it was perfect! 

The sides we got were the Mac & cheese, the brussel sprouts and the mushrooms- all awesome. I would recommend this to anyone that wanted a great steak in the marina area.
author: Lauren L.

description: Best steakhouse ever I will definitely be returning it is very expensive though our bill was nearly $300 and it was just two people other than that the place is amazing amazing definitely go here recommend it highly I will be returning in a few weeks
author: Lei S.

description:
I'm not sure if getting OLD is a good or bad thing; buckling knees, fine lines under the eyes, grey hairs, not to mention memory loss...

Ok, well maybe these symptoms are a result of wearing 5 inch stilettos, staying out all night and pounding LC shots. Nonetheless, all these symptoms are real so I guess I'm on the fast track to "Aging like a Rockstar". :X On the bright side, getting old means independence and most importantly becoming a seasoned foodie!

My first visit to Bobo's was five years ago when I was a broke college student and the restaurants I frequented most were Sizzlers, Red Lobster, Hungry Hunter...you get the point. So back then, I would have given BoBo's 5 Stars because I was blown away with their bone-in filet. As years passed, I was fortunate enough to met Mr. Wagyu and thanks to him, I now have very high expectations of what constitutes a good steak which is why my review may be biased. I know there's NO way you can compare a USDA Steak to a Australian or Tajima-ushi Wagyu (esp when it's about 4x more expensive), but Bobo's just isn't "as" good as I remembered it to be.

Initially, I was going to give BoBo's 3 Stars but with FREE VALET PARKING they definitely deserve an extra star! I'm being very generous because it is the holiday season after all. :)

On Wed, 11/24/10, my friend and I arrived at BoBo's for our 6 PM reservations. We were seated at booth on the second floor which from my side overlooked Lombard Street.

F O O D:
*Dungeness Crab Crostini w/ Smoked Salmon, Avocado and Burrata ($13): YUMMY! The thin and crisp crostini (similar to a flour tortilla) was topped w/ a layer of smoked salmon, a generous chunk of crab leg, avocado, chives, and a side of burrata (mozzarella & cream). The crostini provided the perfect texture contrast to the tender crab and soft salmon, avocado and burrata. It was the perfect combo of crispy, soft, buttery, salty, sweet, smoky, and creamy. 

*Bone-In Filet ($39): OK. I requested the 8 oz filet to be cooked medium rare, however the level of done-ness varied throughout the cut. Upon cutting the edges, it was a medium-well, the center was a medium, and near the bone, it was more a medium-rare to rare. The filet had a nice charred outer crust which helped seal in all the juices. It was semi-tender and moist but didn't cut like butter as with other (non-wagyu) filets I've had. My biggest gripe is it was overseasoned to the point the natural beefy-ness got lost in all the saltiness. 

(As a side note: The steakhouses in Vegas just don't compare to SF. If you have $$$ to burn, I highly suggest Wolfgang Puck's CUT @ The Palazzo; their Australian Wagyu is TO DIE FOR and is simply life-changing! Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak @ MGM is a close second with their Kobe Skirt Steak. 

However, an excellently prepared steak can be found in SF in the same price range as BoBo's and I suggest the Kobe Bavette Steak @ BIX or the Steak & Eggs @ Tyler Florence's Wayfare Tavern.) 

*Twice Baked Potato ($8): CARB-RRIFIC! The potato was perfectly baked until the skin was crisp and the center was like finely milled creamy mashed potatoes. The melted cheese added a savory and saltiness while the sour cream added a zing. It also had little bits if zucchini which didn't do much for it. Personally, I think bacon bits should have been added because pork fat ALWAYS makes everything better!

*Brussels Spouts w/ Pancetta ($8): Our waiter recommended this dish and it was AWFUL! We had to send the brussels sprouts back (which we rarely do) because it was so salty that it was unbearable to eat. The second batch was better, however, the sprouts had a very unappetizing bitterness and tartness to it. For a minute, I thought they mistakened distilled vinegar for olive oil while cooking it.  

S E R V I C E:
Our waiter was nice and attentive, but I felt it was very contrived. While our app came within 5 mins, our steaks took nearly 45 mins to arrive and our sides 5 mins later, so timing of dishes seem to be off. 

Oh yah, since our pitcher of water never got refilled, my mouth felt like the umbrella in the Morton Salt cover after our meal. :X

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Reminiscent of The Stinking Rose (its sister restaurant), "The Nightmare Before a Circus" is the best way I can describe BoBo's. If Tim Burton were to open a restaurant, it would probably look like BoBo's; funky, gothic and dark with cracked out jesters. Don't get me wrong, it had a unique decor, but just very odd for a steakhouse. 

BoBo's has 3 levels with little nooks and crannies where some of the booths are placed. I love how the booths have burgundy velvet drapes which you can close for privacy. Hmmm, are you thinking what I'm thinking? *wink wink*

BoBo's may not be as good as the first time around, then again not many things are right? However, I do partly blame Mr. Wagyu for this. Ever since we met 2 years ago, steaks will just NEVER be the same to me.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Used to be great- when they first opened it was almost a Peter Luger's steak.   Tonight I swear the steak was pan fried it was so tough.   Certainly not worth the price.
author: Mark K.

description:
Just came here for a birthday dinner and was severely disappointed. I chose to give this place the benefit of the doubt when reading all of the yelp reviews, but now I actually regret taking my boyfriend here and was pretty embarrassed I chose this place because I never miss the mark this bad.

I hate to give a bad review, but I'll make it comprehensive to be fair.

Ambiance: Expect a circus theme with creepy decorations. At first it was quiet because there were only two other parties of 2 - then it got incredibly loud. I felt like we were suddenly in a bar as we were raising our voices louder and louder. I know restaurants aren't able to control the volume of noise too much, but the proximity of all the tables were definitely a factor. I made reservations for this place two months in advance and you give us a small cramped table in the middle? Thanks for slapping my face.

Service: While the waitress was attentive to refilling water, I could just tell in the tone of her voice that she would rather be serving the other guests in the room. Is it because we decided to not have alcohol, thus making our bill a scratch cheaper? Whatever the reason, I did not appreciate it.

Food: Unjustly priced. There are so many other steak houses in the city that taste exponentially better and I would gladly pay that price. I would not consider this place fine dining, but they definitely charge fine dining prices for diner-quality food.

We had the following:

Dungeness Crab Crostini with smoked salmon & avocado - super tiny. A few bare and mediocre ingredients I literally could have made myself - not worth $15 at all. I've never felt so ripped off in my life.

Petit Filet Minon - they say their "medium rare" is cooked more on the rare side, but I feel like this is a cop out way of not taking responsibility for cooking their meat right. You can still get all of the flavor without leaving it blood-red if done right. My steak was really red, flavorless, and kind of tough. I didn't finish it.

The boyfriend ordered the Bone-in Filet Minon - we've both had such good steak elsewhere that these just didn't cut it for us. Plus he got stomach pains afterward.

As for sides: Portobello Mushrooms - $9 for a few diced mushrooms enough for 2 - again, overpriced. The Mod Mac - flavor was decent but that stuff was just swimming in a pool of butter/grease, kind of throw-up worthy towards the end.

Not impressed with the dessert selection, but opted with the Monterosa. This is a TINY piece of strawberry cheesecake. I thought the cake part was soggy. For $9, I could have finished this "slice" in literally 2 bites.

In summary, if you suck at making your own food and have money to burn, then sure go here. Otherwise, any other normal person could easily make better food at home or go to the many other better restaurants in SF. I've been to a lot of other steakhouses and this one does not make the cut.

DO NOT come here if you're celebrating a birthday because they'll just put a candle in IF you order dessert. Other restaurants actually value the fact that you've chosen to celebrate with them. This place is just embarrassing. House of Prime Rib, Alexander's, Ruth's Chris, anything else is better really.

*Addition: I appreciate that the business owner skimmed through my review, but why would I bother giving more of my money to an undeserving establishment? The menu wasn't impressive to begin with and first impressions are everything. SF has too many other options for me to want to give a place like this an expensive 2nd chance.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Boned in filet mignon and crab. Perfect combo for our family who are both lovers. The only complaint is that it's sooo damn dark in there. We got seated in the cave room to the right off of the entrance. I do like how there are curtains to separate tables for a little more privacy since you are only 1-2 feet away from each other. Saw another table get the tomahawk and it's just ridiculously big. Something to maybe try next time.

- Boned in Filet: yummy! a must try!
- Shrimp Appetizer: a little too oily and not enough flavor
- Crab Feast: only the legs are served, but good
author: Linda C.

description:
Bobo's, supposedly a top notch steakhouse in a city with some of the best restaurants in the world. My girlfriend took me here for my 25th birthday; but unfortunately, the best thing about this restaurant was the company I was with. 

I can honestly say that I love steak, I have gone to a number of different places all over the world including the mecca, Argentina. This place just did not cut it in terms of quality and ambiance. 

Walking into the restaurant, I was greeted with tacky decorations that made me feel as though I was entering a tourist trap. The decorations took on a circus-like theme that I wasn't too fond of, but to each their own. I'm fine with weird themed restaurants as long as the food blinds me of my surroundings, but alas, the food totally missed the mark. 

Food: Started with the Dungeness Crab Crostini. It came with two crostinis with lox, two pieces of crab meet and avocado all for $15. This dish was forgettable, and lacked flavor. The best item on this dish was sadly the avocado. Moreover, the portions size was a meager two bites, for lack of a better term, clearly a ripoff. 

Bone-in Petite Filet Mignon was $50 and the supposed must have at Bobo's. I'm all for spending $50 on a quality piece of meat, but that filet needs to be aged, well seasoned, and cooked to perfection, three things every meat lover looks for with their first bite. No of those qualifiers were met, as you could tell the aging wasn't right due to the lack of tenderness, seasoning was off  and the piece seemed to be overcooked. You can't afford to make these elementary mistakes when you have Harris's and the House of Prime Rib literally right up the street. 

Monterosa - The cheesecake was a sliver. Look I'm trying to lose weight just like everyone else in this world, but honestly I was hoping to enjoy my birthday cake not only have a tasting. Additionally, the crust was soggy and not up to standards, save your money and just head up to Whole Foods, the bakery is 3x better. 

Overall, a major disappointment. I will not be coming back here. Try your luck at one of the many other great steakhouses in the city. This place is a HARD PASS.
author: Alex L.

description:
Hmmm...no thanks. 

Must be the tourist-effect that has driven the reviews so high. Of course these days, one needs to take Yelp reviews with a BIG grain of salt. Oh well. 

Monday night reservation for a business dinner for 4. The place was deserted at 7:00 though Open Table showed no tables available except that time. Suspicious. 

Had the best mussels I have ever had in my life. Roasted deliciousness. Truly amazing as I am not a huge Mussel fan. These were incredible. 

However, the steak was very marginal. My $48 New York was overcooked, bland, and lukewarm. Pretty sure it sat in the pass...where it likely went from what may have been slightly over medium-rare but kept cooking to reach a solid medium+. Really bad form. I get that beef prices are crazy right now but the grade was barely Choice. Low marbling for sure (bland). 

The server was "ok" but again, place empty, weird vibe, very sure she didn't want to be there. 

With all of the reviews and in a town like SF, no way do you need to settle for this tired and waaaay overrated spot. 

Maybe go to the bar and have some mussels. But that's it. 

Good luck.
author: Steven G.

description:
Want to say I loved the place but I'd be lying.
There's no point to making reservations because you will end up waiting 30+ min. There was a small group of 3 who were waiting and had a "do you know who I am attitude".  Who was quite rude to the hostesses and demanded to be seated right away. (Just our luck we ended up being seated next to these fcukers). The ambiance is very crowded, and reminds me of TGIF. Haha it is supposed to be a clown/ masquerade theme. So while you are waiting you can admire the pictures/ decors on the wall. 
crispy crab cakes were delicious! The dried cranberries complimented the dish. I love how it was mostly crab because it did not take away from the taste.
The porterhouse - filet mignon was tough the new york was far better
Garlic crab - so good after getting all the meat out and letting it soak in the garlic butter and crab fat that was on the skillet
mac and cheese - tasteless, had to add salt; also, found it quite amusing that it was fettuccine noodles
twice baked potato - this is a must have! it's pretty much mashed potatoes placed back into the skin
Our server was great, but had to tend to the douchebags next to us. Who apparently had a staring problem. Snobs. What never seen someone crack crabs before? I honestly felt like asking if they wanted some since they kept gawking on my handywork. 
Will I come back to this place that is known for their steak and crabs? It was swell but I doubt it. It wasn't all that for me to come back.
author: Mary Ann B.

description: I'm a little spoiled by the Great Steak houses in Chicago so I compared this place to those and its comparable, by no means was it better. I had a NY strip, it was cooked to a perfect Medium Rare, a lot of butter on the plate, which can make anything taste Fantastic. I also had a not so memorable but average red wine. Very expensive food and I'm not sure its worth it.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
First let me say the french guy waiting on us was awesome, great service. The food was overall pretty good but in each dish I felt something just wasn't to my personal liking.

The bread was kind of odd, not really sourdough but almost, and then it had some butter and some garlic cloves sort of stuffed in it, just didn't work for me. The caesar salad was good. The new york steak was cooked perfectly and was quite thick for a New York which I loved. Although it had a butter sauce with some other flavorings that i couldn't quite place but for me they took away from the awesomeness of the steak and I never have cared for butter on my steak, seems redundant with a good cut of beef (of course you could ask to change the prep I'm sure).
author: Christopher Steven O.

description: Absolutely the best bone in filet mignon I have ever had. The service here has always been great. The ambiance is super unique and a fun time whether you are with a group or on a date.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Bobo's is aiite, not perfect or anything, but the steak itself is good, flavorful, a little underdone for "medium", it was cooked rare but tasted good nonetheless.  If you said "rare", it would come out mooing.  I came here for a bday steak dinner, and I would DEFINITELY choose a different place next time (Alexander's?) or maybe just a nice French restaurant instead.  You could come here for a normal date dinner, for sure.

The decor is humorously heinous.  I'm talking bold red walls, and crazy glass clown figures hanging from the walls, wonky gilded mirrors, and an eerie yellowish dim lighting, to go so well with their 80s hits that they play throughout your dining experience.  The brussel sprouts were drowning in butter and very salty while the "modern mac n cheese" was literally two spoonfuls of mac n cheese and was also drowning in butter.  I would say the Magic Castle decor makes for an interesting time, but with the nice steak and great service, I would still go back. They couldn't seat us where we wanted even with a reso, so they even comped us champagne since they knew it was for a bday.  The management here knows what they're doing. Dessert was the chocolate bomb, nothing to write home about, with a strong fake raspberry flavor.
author: Terry K.

description: This was a sinfully delicious dinning experience. To start they bring out a freshly baked bread topped with sautéed whole garlic pieces on the top. The crust of the bread was amazing. My entrée was hands down the best steak I have ever had in my entire life . I had the Filet Mignon which was pan seared to an optimum medium-rare that simply melted in your mouth. Biting into the filet you first taste of the perfectly seared crust then the rest of the steak melts away into your mouth. I savored every bite. I also had a side-order of the Baked Yam. The yam was prepared with butter and brown sugar that was an ideal accompaniment to the filet. I finished off the meal with Mango Panna Cotta topped with carmel, with a lemon drizzle and powdered sugar on the plate.The Panna Cotta was smooth, airy and light. This was the ultimate ending for this amazing meal.
author: Sharlene H.

description: Great service and great food. As a group, we ordered the 3+ lbs of crab, lobster Mac and cheese, twice baked potato, brussels sprouts, and each of us ordered steak. My filet mignon was ok but the rib-eye that my friends ordered were much better. The sides were great and the crab was prepared well also. Great experience at Bobo's. Plus there's complimentary valet parking. Can't beat that in SF!
author: Haben G.

description:
Came for our 4 year anniversary. Came a little late for our res, but they were very accommodating.  I can see why the decor would throw people off but I found it to add a nice sense of whimsy to the night.

Anyways, enough douchery.

Ordered the bone in new york (why no rib-eye?!?) and girlfriend got the fillet. The steaks were cooked great and tasted great but overall, I've probably had better steaks else where, even the ones I've cooked at home were a bit better.

So why the 4 star review?

The MUSSELS. 

Holy crap balls they were good.  SO GOOD. the sauce that comes with it was amazing. Even though I ate it wrong (guess I was supposed to pour it over the skillet) but I just dipped the mussels in it.  Rubbing the mussels around on the sizzling hot skillet itself added an amazing savory flavor and you can definitely tell that the mussels are nice and fresh. Even my girlfriend who is NOT a fan of any seafood said it was good.

I wouldn't come here for steak again, but you better believe I'll be back for those mussels.
author: Tu T.

description:
From the outside, Bobo's look like a cheesy tourist joint. The sign drives me nuts so I'll be the first to say that I was judging this book by its cover. And Bobo's? I think out of respect for the food, we should refer to it as Boboquivari's. 

Boboquivari's is a romantic restaurant for "the steak" and "the crab." The red interior and Venetian clown motif is very well done and not campy. The food is really good too. The iron skillets are great; my husband and I split a "double shrimp double crab" but also added a New York steak...which is a little too much food for two people (esp. adding sides). Sides are not as good as the mains so I'd almost say to skip those and focus on the meat, or get one side just to have some variety. Oh, and if you're getting crab don't expect any bibs. This is a classy joint...although there's no classy way to eat crab.
author: Emilia S.

description:
Our night started when we arrived at the Lounge after leaving the car with valet parking. Upon entering, we were told the lounge was closed due to a private party. No big deal, so one of the employees escorts us to the restaurant and plenty of seating at the bar.

We sit at the bar and check in with Spencer, the host. We are seated at 7:20, which is perfect as the final person arrived. Our reservations were at 7:30 on 12/6/14. We had a total of 11 people for the party as we are celebrating a holiday dinner.

The waiter seemed a bit stiff. He only asked two people if they wanted something to drink. I know we just came from the bar, but we had finished our drinks at the bar and wanted more. The waiter was not personable at all and did not even ask if this was a special event, how are we doing, nothing of that nature. Maybe he had a personal issue that night, but if your working, you might as well make the best of it and earn the highest amount of tip available.

The waiter comes by and asks us for our order and doesn't even ask if we want appetizers or even explain the menu. This is common sense at higher-end restaurants, such as Alexanders Steakhouse and Michael Mina. After we order, bread arrives at the table. We ask one of the wait staff for more bread and 10-15 minutes pass without bread. We then ask the monotone waiter for bread and he brings the bread. We enjoyed our meal and the steaks were cooked to perfection. It would have been nice if the waiter asked how our dinner was and if we needed anything else, but I guess that is too much to ask.

After we received the bill, we were just chatting and enjoying ourselves. After dishing out over $840, we thought we earned the right to enjoy at least 10 minutes, but were we wrong. The waiter politely asked if we were done as they had another party waiting. I would give this place 5 stars for the food alone, but the customer service from the waiter was pathetic. I'm not expecting Joel Robuchon service, but at least show some respect, common sense and common courtesy. Part of being an exceptional waiter is to be able to adapt to your clientele and build rapport.
author: Abraham M.

description:
Bobo's is hands down the best steakhouse in SF.  Whenever I'm treating myself, I always come here for a martini and a bloody steak.  Anything wrong with a girl wanting some meat and a good buzz every once in a while?  I think not.  And I wouldn't want it from anywhere else.

The bone in filet is amazing.  Nothing else like it around.  I've eaten at Ruth's Chris, House of Prime Rib, Harris', Osso.  You name it, I've eaten steak there, but nothing compares to Bobo's.  

Even their sides are amazing. The twice baked potato, the macaroni and cheese, the brussel sprouts all taste great.  And the garlic break you get before your appetizers, yummmm...

It is very pricey, so be prepared to spend a good amount on dinner, but definitely worth every penny.  I recommend this place to all my friends and will continue to do so.
author: Ladan G.

description:
Bobo's is a place where you are able to have a nice dinner or celebrate a small gathering and occasion. Food wise, this place hits the mark. Service wise, it seemed very forced and the servers seem to avoid you. 

The crab cakes is my favorite, but also the surf and Turf is pretty good as well.
author: Jan R.

description:
Bobo's is a pretty cool joint. The decor is loud in a very subtle way... If that makes any sense. The walls are covered with all sorts of interesting paintings and decals. Lined with a lot of red and crimson tones, this place was totally different than I expected. It's quaint, not a very big place but that helps cut down the noise level. I felt like I was in a members only club. That's probably the best way to describe the feeling. The staff, decor and size of the restaurant gives the impression that it's only accessible to certain people, which, in all honesty, makes you feel pretty badass while you're in there. Think old school mafia. If you watch Boardwalk Empire on HBO, you'll get my drift. 

I went with two of my friends (Jack and Josh) and we didn't skimp on anything. However, I'll only mention the steaks because I didn't feel any of the sides (shrimp, crab, brussels, Baby Blue salad, Mod Mac, etc.) were anything spectacular which resulted in docking a couple stars. Plus, the steaks, as it should be at a steakhouse, were the stars of the show. 

Bone-in Filet Mignon (Jack) ~ Medium Rare ~ 4 stars: This was all the rage going into Bobo's. Jack and Josh heard through word of mouth that this was the go-to cut. I verified their claim by reading up on how many Yelpers raved about it. It was good, not great. You'll find better bone-in filets at other restaurants. I thought the seasoning was lacking. However, the steak was cooked perfectly. They did a great job of cooking the portion close to the bone, which is usually a little undercooked at other places. Tender, juicy but lacking flavor. 

Bone-in New York (Josh) ~ Medium Rare ~ 3 stars: I thought it was just a typical NY strip. Nothing special, nothing terrible. The flavor was much better on this than the filet. Blame it on the fat! 

Bone-in Ribeye (Me) Medium Rare ~ 4 stars: You won't find this cut on Bobo's online menu, however, it was available when we went. With ribeye being my cut of choice, I had to do it. It also made sense since Jack and Josh go the filet and NY. With my ribeye we had the opportunity to get a full sampling of their carnivorous offerings. The flavor was on-point, the fat-to-meat ratio was great. However, it could have been a little more tender. Oddly enough, although the meat close to the bone on Jack's filet was cooked perfectly, my ribeye was a little too rare in that area. However, Josh and I thought the ribeye was better than the filet. 

With a standard $20 corkage fee, we downed three bottles of wine. We also ordered a round of cocktails. Of course I started out with a nice ginny T. We walked out each spending $121 which included tip, which isn't bad if you consider $60 worth of corkage fees, a round of cocktails, three premium cuts of steak, 1/2 order of crab, shrimp, brussels, three salads and an order of mac. 

Bobo's is the first official steakhouse I've dined at in SF (I don't count House of Prime Rib) and it wasn't even close to my experiences at other restaurants. Places like Mastro's in Newport Beach, CA or Craftsteak in Las Vegas, NV or CUT in Beverly Hills, CA outshine Bobo's. However, Bobo's is a step above your typical steakhouse chains like Fleming's, Lawry's and Morton's. 

It's a great place to enjoy a meal with some of your closest friends and I think I'll go out on a limb and say it makes a pretty decent date spot. Although I wouldn't suggest Bobo's for a first date. The staff was amazing and very familiar with all their menu items.
author: Bruce C.

description:
The steak itself was okay, but the service /reservation system left a lot to be desired.

I made a reservation a few weeks in advance for my parents who were visiting from out of town. The day before the reservation, I called to ask if it would be possible to delay it by 30 mins (to 7 pm). I was told that it was not possible. I was fine with that, but the day of, we all ran into some traffic and were 10 minutes late. I called them to ask them if that was okay, and was told that it was no problem, and that they would put me down for 6:45 pm.

When I arrived for my party of 4, one person was stuck at work and was going to be 30-45 mins late. The receptionist told us that we could sit down immediately for a table of 3, or have the table of 4 but had to be out by 7:30 pm! I had to tell my friend that he could no longer join us since he as going to be 30 mins late.

I was also confused. My original reservation was for 6:30 pm for 4 people. Were they expected me to eat for only 1 hour? When I brought this up, they told me I had to leave by 8 pm. This still confused me, so again, their thought was that my dinner time was from 6:30-8 pm?!

Finally, after I expressed my disappointment, they allowed me to sit down with no specified time limit, and thankfully I was then able to re-invite my friend. To be honest, we ended up being out the door by 8:15 pm anyway. 

I felt embarrassed and dismayed with this whole ordeal. Having something come up at work is unexpected, and having to uninvite someone or risk being kicked out within 1-1.5 hours seems out of line with a restaurant of this calibre. I did not see anywhere on their website or reservation confirmation, or in my calls to the reservation staff, that our entire party had to be there, or an ending time.

I will try other steak houses for better service.
author: Yan K.

description:
Came back here for my birthday dinner and loved everything.  Their bone-in-fillet is absolutely amazing.  My favorite steakhouse by far!!

The service is always impeccable, decor very romantic, and everything else here makes for the perfect dinner.  I couldn't ask for anything more.  Writing this review update makes my mouth water.

My only tip is to not even both with trying to find parking.  Just do the valet and save yourself the time and trouble.  ;)
author: Pia V.

description:
Went there with a friend to have a nice steak dinner and was quite disappointed.

Short
Although the quality of food and service was ok, it did not match the price level. 50 dollar steaks should be delicious, surroundings should be excellent, unfortunately they were'nt.

Details
Interior was bit weird for good steakhouse but ok thats just a side note.
We missed any kind of finesse: pre-heated plates missing, choice of sides little and not great. Free starter hm just bread...
filet mignon was medium rare instead of medium.
New york bone was medium instead of medium rare.
Cauliflower was cold and for whatever reasons some cheese added. 
Baked potato was in fact filled with mash. Only little sourcreme.
Bleu cheese salad was ok.

We complained about the steaks only and the manager came to show good will and they cooked my friends steak bit more. But no real compensation for such failure.
author: Marc S.

description: Best bone-in filet mignon ever!  We had reservations and were super lucky to score awesome parking a short block away. Since Bobo's is known for their bone-in filet, we both had an order of it as well as their twice baked potato plus mac 'n cheese. We enjoyed the sides, but felt like the mac 'n cheese was nothing spectacular to rave about. The twice baked potato was huge! It definitely was a shareable side. The filet was outstanding. I had mine medium and my knife just sunk into it. The meat was flavorful and tender. Also, they give you this bread that's different from other restaurants, two pieces of bread topped with a garlic sauce. For dessert, we shared a strawberry cheesecake. It was okay, but we could've passed on this.
author: Laura T.

description: One of my favorite restaurant in the city! Their steak and crab are all very delicious! You have to crack your own crab but the shell is very soft and crispy so not so hard to do it. Plus, it's so tasty that even lazy ppl like my bf is willing to crack it though he is usually very lazy and doesn't want to deal with crab with shell :) Service is good too!
author: Claudia M.

description:
AMBIANCE:
Bobo's is a laid back, old-school style steakhouse; I wore a dress and felt overdressed. The service was prompt, casual, but friendly.

THE STEAK... it was AMAZING!:
Boboquivari's doesn't serve Rib Eye's??!! Your choices are: Filet Mignon (~$43 for the bone-in) and NY Strip - even their "Porterhouse" (~$69) is a NY Strip and Petite Filet cooked separately. Wha?
