No question, I'm a Rib Eye girl who had serious doubts about the famed bone-in filet, but every bite was like sinking my teeth into heaven. The filet was cut really thick, yet cooked perfectly medium rare, tender, and deliciously seasoned. Usually a cut this thick would be overly charred on the outside, or really chewy and tough on the inside. Amazing! 

THE WINE:
They have a decent selection of wines that aren't too overpriced, or bring your own and pay the very reasonable $15 corkage fee.

THE REST... it was all pretty mediocre:
The bread isn't "stale" like many other Yelpers wrote, but it was definitely a waste of my carb intake for the week. The yellow tail in ponzu sauce was pretty good but way overpriced (I could have put the entire "plate" of yellow tail in my mouth at once), the cauliflower side was incredibly generic, and the Mod Mac and Cheese was atrocious - not worth ordering because it was tasteless and clumpy. The mango panna cotta reminded me of a worse version of Chinese mango pudding from dim sum.

Despite the unimpressive sides and appetizers, I really did love Bobo's, and I came here just for the steak. I would absolutely return, but just for the bone-in filet.

Tip: Valet is free!
author: Jess C.

description: I went here for anniversary dinner with my boyfriend an it was fancy and good food... However there are a few drawbacks, I ordered the surf n turf and medium for my steak my boyfriend asked for medium rare on his bone in and they switched it for our orders... I was upset because I don't like my meat bloody, and only when going to steak places I order medium... So that made us upset. The Brussel sprouts were delicious and the mod mac n cheese the rosè wine was okay not very sweet for a rosè wine.
author: Mary W.

description:
I went here for a congrats dinner the reservation was made by my date however I was able to call and get them to do a surprise desert for my date which was cool I would give this place 3 stars but because they were accommodating and have free  valet they get 4stars 

Our waitress was nice and the drinks from the bar were good this place is super small inside and and the tables are kind of cramped  because we made a reservation In advance and it was a special occasion  I thought we would get the special private seating they have which is only one booth but it was given to another couple that was just dining there which I was little disappointed about ..I order several things off the menu Everything was pretty decent I did have the fillet mignon bone in with the crab it was ok I've had much better filet mignon but it was pretty decent 

The deserts we had were the cake cone things and a kind of mango/flan desert my desert was really good however the cake cone thing was meh..a ok..that is their house desert I think they should choose another .

Overal I'd come back just not for the steak only which is the main hype.. Their prices are kind of steep too the bill was kind of outrageous ...
author: Alice B.

description:
My first expierience at bobos was not to pleasant my first time. I went to san francisco for the first time stayed at travelodge right next to bobos. Our room was not yet ready so after a 8 hour drive from las vegas we where in need of a beer and some food. we where causally dressed mind you. 
As we enter the host looked at us as if we where lost. As he looks at us up and down he asked "do you have a reservation." We got sat by the bar they gave us the menu. We decided to just get drinks and the host looked at us as we couldn't afford it. We sat at the bar the bartender was great, didn't make us feel out of place.
  The food looked good and so decided to make a reservation for my bday.  We went dressed up this time. The same host seen us and looked surprised we where there! 
Well the food was AMAZING!  Had no complaints on the food! Perfect steak, crab, muscles!  Would have given it a 5 star but did not like how we where looked down upon! Needless to say we had drinks appetizers dinner and two desserts! Dont judge a book by its cover!
author: Jessica Y.

description: I love Steak like a lot, a lot a lot.  I have to restrict my consumption to special occasions.  I love the aged steak and the fresh seafood they have here at Bobo's.  I came here with a friend and we both enjoyed our meals very much.  I still love House of Prime Ribs but thats two different type of meat so we can't compare that.  The server was knowledgeable and the steak was so fresh and has  a melt in your mouth texture.  I will be a happy returning customer. The ambiance and decor reminds me of a circus but I believe that is what they are going for.  Its not a fancy dressy steakhouse either so come casual and comfortable if that is your forte.  #steaklover
author: Angela V.

description:
Bobo's was ok.
The steak was good.
It was the best thing we ordered but I'm not sure it was worth its price.

We also ordered:
 -Mod mac&cheese -  surprisingly sweet :(
-The twice baked potato - it was fine
-The House salad - ok
-The double order of shrimp- good enough
-Mango Panna Cotta - good

Nothing was particularly bad beside the sugary Mod Mac&Cheese..but nothing blew my skirt up either. I guess I was just expecting so much more because of the price and yelp reviews. Like I said the steak was good but not good enough for me to come back...sorry!
author: Luz T.

description: I took my wife here for our 2nd anniversary. We order steaks, crab cake and wine. We has an amazing dinner. Food was great. Totally recommended!
author: Mark C.

description: Best bone in filet EVER!  My new spot whenever I visit San Francisco.  The decor was quite pleasant and the tables were not jammed in - plenty of space to relax.  Sides were perfect and the wife says the bartender is a pro.
author: Pastor John C.

description:
You know, i wrote a review for Bobos before and Im still a huge fan of the food but as of this past week, i was really let down. I've praised the restaurant for its amazing food and service and now i have to say I'm really disappointed in the service. We put together a large group for an event and the bill was RIDICULOUS. It was a pre-fix menu but we didn't receive half the food we were promised on the menu and the bill still came out to be $3000 when the original charge was $100 a person. for 20 people, the math just didn't add up- even with the shots we ordered. not only was the bill crazy, the new events manager is a total buzzkill. He's not very friendly nor accommodating. They implemented this new "event coordinator" position and because of this, the restaurant kinda ruined its reputation for me. its no fun when the staff thinks they're better than their patrons. 

however, our waitress was fantastic. it was for my bday and she made sure i was treated like a princess the whole time!
author: Heather R.

description:
I've been to the major steakhouses in San Francisco and in the Peninsula, so it was nice to try Boboquvari's where I hadn't been.

The most well known items here are the steaks (all dry aged for 4-6 weeks) and the crab.  This made ordering simple and straight-forward.

We started with a seafood sampler that included mussels, shrimp, and the famous crab.  A searing hot skillet was placed in the center of the table and all the seafood items were covered simply with oil, salt, and pepper.  I found the mussels to be good, but found the shrimp and the crab a bit on the oily side.

For the main entrees, I opted for their famous bone-in filet mignon.  I'm usually a rib-eye eater, prefering the greater fat and flavor that comes with a ribeye over the tenderness that comes with a filet mignon.  But other than the filet mignon, Boboquivari's only offered a New York Strip and the Porterhouse (=NY strip + filet mignon).  

The bone-in filet mignon looked similar to the NY strip and was covered with a light sauce.  A tad salty, the sauce however added a great flavor to the very tender filet.  It was one of the more tender steaks I've had and the flavor worked quite well.  They really cooked it a perfect medium rare.

I tried some filet mignon from a surf and turf combo (crab and petite filet mignon) and think the bone-in must have added to the flavor or the cooking style as there was a clear difference in both quality, flavor, and thickness.  The bone-in filet mignon is really the cut to get here.  Don't bother with the petite filet....it's not even close.

In addition to the entrees, several sides were ordered.  Mac and Cheese, potatoes, and spinach came out as small sides.  The one complaint among all of them was definitely that they were too salty.  The spinach was the worse offender and literally tasted like a salt lick or as if the cook had accidentally dumped the salt shaker in.  At $8, it was disappointing.  The mac and cheese was better but definitely had a strong gruyere cheese flavor so you better like that.  Finally, the potato skins were very popular but a tad salty and definitely very rich.  

Overall, we had a great meal at Boboquivari's.  I'd say the prices are a tad high (bone in filet mignon at $39, Porterhouse at $59) but the filet mignon bone in was excellent.  Sides were much weaker and I found the seafood to be a pass.  I'd much prefer garlic crabs at PPQ over the crab legs we had at Boboquivari.  

Complimentary valet parking was a plus in the horrid Marina area district for parking and the small and cozy (yet a bit too dark) environment was nice too.  Boboquivari's takes credit cards, including American Express.
author: Randy F.

description:
My husband and I went for an anniversary treat and the food was wonderful.

The atmosphere was interesting. It felt very intimate; there's seating on multiple levels of the restaurant which helps this. It offered a nice view and with the door to the outside deck open, there was a nice breeze. 

The Yelp reviews led us each to the bone-in filet. Definitely one of the best steaks we've ever had. Well seasoned, cooked perfectly. Our waiter was very helpful in suggestions for sides, without which we would have over-ordered.
author: Courtney W.

description:
Though I do have to say the interior of this place is somewhat nasty feeling, the food completely made up for it. We ordered the mussels and bone-in new york steak. I heard all of their sizzling skillet seafood items were amazing, and the mussels didn't disappoint. They came with a lemon butter dipping sauce infused with capers and parsley. Make sure you dip everything in this sauce, SO good. The steak was very well flavored, but I wouldnt say it was amazing. Ironically, my favorite part of the meal was the complimentary bread they provide; it came drizzled with olive oil, crusted with roasted garlic, and swirled with garlic on the inside of the loaf as well. 

Overall, very pleased with the food at Bobo's, would definitely come back for their seafood and garlic bread.
author: Angela K.

description:
I came here last Friday for a friends birthday dinner.  They had free parking which I wish I took advantage of but I didn't know.  Also they wouldn't seat people down unless everyone has arrived which I understand.  As we were seated, we were looking at the menu and deciding what to order.  We ordered  the mushrooms, brussels sprouts and macaroni and cheese.  We ordered the double shrimp and double mussels skillet as well.  We also all ordered the bone in filet.  

The first item to arrive was the shrimp and mussels which I though to be the highlight of the meal.  The shrimp was very flavorful and the butter to go with it was amazing as well.  The mussels were also good.

The sides seemed to be a hit or miss.  I wish they roasted the Brussels sprouts a bit more to have the caramelized look but it seems like they just boiled it.

As for the steak which was supposed to be the highlight turned out to be disappointing.  While the filet was very flavorful, 6 out of the 7 steaks turned out to be still raw.  While I understand mistakes happen with one or two, but when the almost the whole table has raw steaks, I find that to be unacceptable but this was quickly rectified when we informed our host.  She brought out new filets which made up for it.  

Would I come back here again?  Probably not unless someone was treating me to dinner.
author: A L.

description: Great place for a romantic evening with the wife. The food is amazing. The bone in filet mignon was the best steak I had ever eaten. I also recommend the crab. My wife ordered a bottle of Morgan Twelve Clones Pinot Noir which paired perfectly with our dinner. If you want to taste the best steak in California this is where it is, Bobo's!!!
author: Drew R.

description:
I took my buddy here for his very delayed birthday dinner. First off, they boast free valet parking... so that's awesome! I parked the car myself because there wasn't an attendant there. Kinda random.

We ordered what everyone suggests --- The bone-in filet mignon. I got mine medium rare and my buddy got his medium. We both loved our steaks! I also got a couple of glasses of red wine (the oakville cab and the cuvee.) We got the cheesecake for dessert--- it was light and not very sweet. I liked it.

I was however disappointed with everything else we ordered. The crab cakes were meh. Overly fried and the cranberries it came with felt very random. Like i just went to the grocery store and dropped dried cranberries on your plate random. The mushrooms side? Skip! The mac n cheese? Skip.

Overall, come get steak, wine and dessert! Leave happy. :)
author: Will K.

description:
I went there for a friend's birthday dinner.
They have a great steak and lobster for dinner. The atmosphere is really interesting. It seems like a house that was remodeled into a restaurant which offers a lot of privacy for group dinner. The service was great and the food was very good too!
author: Romain D.

description: Its really sad to see an award winning steakhouse, that are proud to cooking their steaks medium rare, cannot get their temperatures right at all! We ordered a couple of steak, my friends came rare (she was fine with it and kept, but that was not what she ordered) mine came medium well and had to send it back and wait. 10 minutes later I get a new steak that was so rare it was still cold in the middle. I find this pretty sad that whomever they had grilling had no idea to cook a steak. Save your money and go to a real steakhouse.
author: Zeid A.

description: UN-PHUQUING-BELIEVABLE bone in filets, service, settings (different floors, different vibes) , everything about this place. I would want to die here..... Boom
author: paul m.

description:
Not what I expected. It looked like new orleans on the inside and our table wasn't ready for the time we had RSVPed it. It was vday weekend so the staff was definitely really busy, but trying to get us seated. They didn't give us the bread until we asked for it  (just ask them right away if you don't get it since the great is good)and it was a bit hard to wave down the waiter to actually order food. The food was solid but I'm not sure if I'd come back here ahead since I am not the biggest steak fan (and it was same pricing was the Ruth Chris/morton/etc). I prefer Mastro's and Peter Lugers. The brussel sprouts (hold the butter) was good, the mushrooms (portabella) came with big portion size, the half loft of bread was hard to break apart (sourdough) but good...the steak we got was the porterhouse (nyc strip with filet too) was enough for both of us.

Sidenote: Andrea is an awesome owner and goes above and beyond customer service to address any issues during your experience. This customer service and knowing the staff is actually really trying no matter how busy they are means a lot. I suggest everyone who wants a different experience (and free valet woohoo!!) to head downtown and try Bobo's! The 4th star goes to the staff :)
author: Lily P.

description:
What I liked: 
* Food was cooked well
* Flavor was spot-on
* Bread with olive topping is amazing (comes with your meal)
* Waiter made good recommendations 
* Hostess was super accommodating even though we were 30 mins late
* Complimentary valet...very convenient perk

What we ordered:
* Crispy crab cakes with cranberry relish [cranberry relish was absolutely delicious!]
* Hawaiin sunfish filet [very flakey and buttery] 
* Twice baked potato [stuffed with yummy goodness]
* New York bone in [cooked exactly to preference but could have been slightly more tasty]
* Modern mac and cheese
* Apple, walnut, sundried cranberry salad [nothing special at all]
* Dunce cap cones [would recommend since it's unique to many dessert menus]
* Monterosa [didn't like this]

Onto the not-so-good:
* Food took forever to come out. For 10 people, it took close to an hour for the steaks 
* Food temperature needed to be more hot
* Lights went out on the entire block (supposedly this happens a lot in the Marina). We ate dessert by candlelight and the back-up light. Bathroom was completely pitch black. 
* Dislike the set up. The restaurant is made up of multiple small floors...our floor was made up of 4 tables, fairly close together. Too intimate for my taste. I felt we couldn't converse freely  without the other tables listening in or paying attention. Admittedly, our party of 10 easily overpowered the room even though we made a conscious effort to keep our voices down.
author: Emily Y.

description: What an amazing steak!  The filet on the bone was amazing with great flavor from the first bite. My husband thought the lobster (curry) bisque was amazing and said he would go back just for a bowl of that. The twice baked potato was delicious. The strawberry Italian style cheesecake light and yummy. The atmosphere is so "old world" supper club I expected Frank Sinatra to walk thru the velvet drapes. We will be back. Maybe we will check out the lounge next.
author: Andrea S.

description:
I made a reservation via OpenTable a week ahead for a surprise birthday dinner date. I had never been to Boboquivari's before then, but I definitely picked the right place. As a note to the reservation I made, I had asked them to bring out a Chocolate Bomb dessert at the end of the meal along with a lit candle, and they didn't forget!

But anyway, the food. We both ordered the Filet Mignon along with a side of Portobello Mushrooms, Brussel Sprouts and Cauliflower. The filet mignon was amazing. It was gigantic, tender, and juicy, while the portobello mushrooms, brussel sprouts and the cauliflower complimented it perfectly. 

On the whole, the waitstaff was very professional and warm, the ambiance was really nice, and the food was solid. I would definitely go again.
author: Clarisse V.

description:
This place is recommended by locals with good reason! This was one of the greatest steaks I have ever eaten in my life! I got the filet mignon with mod mac and a twice baked potato after starting with a Caesar salad.

The salad was very leafy and delicious with fresh anchovies. This led to a seafood appetizer (which my family shared) with searing hot crab, shrimp, and mussels on a skillet. It was some of the freshest seafood I have ever eaten. The steak, which I preferred medium rare plus, was amazing. It was the perfect size and cooked perfectly. The mac and cheese was very tasty with some interesting spices. The twice baked potato was good, and my only complaint is that it was a little heavy on chives. 

I left very satisfied with my meal, and should I ever find myself in San Francisco again, I will definitely be coming back to Bobo's.
author: Trevor B.

description:
Came here and got the Sonatra cut which is a huge steak.  Medium rare.  There was certainly a lot of chewing involved as the meat was rather tough.  GF had the Filet Mignon which was a lot more palatable.  Both were rather bland in flavor.

Pros: 
- Decent price for the portion size

Cons:
- Average meat quality ( I guess it reflects the price).
author: Jerry J.

description:
Seriously a San Francisco gem! This is up there on my list of favorite steak places. I know it doesn't look all glamorous or have the best location, and yes it's kinda kitschy but the place rocks!

The complimentary bread they serve is fluffy and has garlic baked into the top, it is melt in your mouth good.

The salads are nice and hearty. I loved the wedge! We ordered all of the crostini appetizers and ate them like ravenous carbivores!

Our server was hilarious and totally personable. We brought our own bottle of red wine and when it was done he recommended a great French red wine (he was French and had great taste in vino). 

My entree was a Bone in Filet Mignon, is that an oxymoron? Who cares it was delicious. Seriously the juiciest steak in the city! I loved the food and the experience and would highly recommend it. 

Sidebar: The bathroom is huge; you know those music videos that show people partying in the bathroom? Well this could be one of those bathrooms!
author: Caro S.

description:
After planning to check out Bobo's for several years now, and finally making a pact to eat there with Fatty A. a few years ago, four us finally came here for his birthday. 

Verdict?

Puff puff PASS after finding a dirty inedible sticker in one steak and utter failure to acknowledge the nastiness of said sticker.  And additional epic failure to recognize a birthday despite noting it when making the reservation.  Nonoquivari's.

The deets below.


- baked garlic & olive sourdough loaf -

It's unique, I guess.  Sounds better than it tastes.  One slice and I was outta that loaf.  It's dry and I don't need bread filling me up.  I'm here for the meat!  Bring it on.

- lobster soup in a mild curry brodetto $9.95 -

So much curry, you can't stop that. Rollout, rollout.  What is going on with this lobster soup?  It tastes like curry sauce with lobster bits.  Skip.


- combo mussels, shrimp & crab $39.95 -

The combo seafood hot plate had a street food grilled flavor to it. Like it was flambeed in Asia.  This was pretty good.  But your clothes are gonna stink.  Like hot plate food in a closed environment in Asia.


- bone-in filet mignon $43.95 -

All right. The bone-in filet was good. $45 for that size is legit. It had a great crust from the sear and was juicy inside. Only problem? "USDA Choice" sticker floating on the plate of meat juice next to the steak on Fatty A.'s plate:

http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_i8RTbNUS2Rr2fV_jurRMA/l.jpg
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IklwY4AWk5l3zg6ZtQ6X6A/l.jpg

Amateur hour!

We've all seen and eaten worse. But not at a steakhouse.  The sticker was almost forgivable (ALMOST); the waitress' nonchalance was not. Just pretend you care. Don't tell me it's all good.  Literally said "Oh, it's just the sticker on the meat, it's totally fine and your meat is safe to eat...the meat is grilled."

Ohhhhh noooo you didn't! snapsnapsnap

Then why isn't the sticker burnt?

She later brought a cold plate for my friend to plop the steak into, away from the sticker.  What?  Steak on cold plate?  Away from the pool of juices?  If the waitress was even a little shocked or embarrassed enough to take it up to the manager, I'd still be on her side.  Even if the manager didn't do jack about it.  But c'mon now.

From a January 2012 SF Dept of Public Health inspection:

049 (CFR) Wiping Cloths not clean/inadequate sanitizer turbid/not properly stored
042 (CFR) Non Food Contact Surface Unclean 
032 (CFR) Unapproved thawing methods used 

Ya don't say?


- sides $8.95 each -

portobello mushrooms
cauliflower sautéed with garlic & evoo - pangrattato

these were both good and went nicely with the steak.
author: Erika C.

description:
After coming here once before in a large group to celebrate a friend's milestone birthday, I came here with my boyfriend to celebrate my own.  It was my boyfriends' first time as I was already won over! 

We were on a time constraint and was able to be seated right away with 5pm reservations.  The service was excellent with lot's of kind birthday wishes upon arrival.  I came there for the bone-in filet and that's what I got!  The Mister chose the crab.  Of course, we shared both entrees with the Swiss chard and portobello mushrooms.  I enjoyed a delicious Malbec with my steak and the Mister had a cocktail and beer.  Everything was excellent!  The mushrooms and chard were so tasty and the crab and steak was superb.

We passed on dessert, but I was warmly given a sampling of the Dunce Cap Cones with a candle to make a wish.  It was delicious and perfect for my love of chocolate.  

The Mister was won over too!  This is a place we hope to share with other loved ones and for special occasions.  Yes, it costs a bit, but definitely worth it for the food and service.  You are definitely taken care of at Boboquivari's!
author: M S.

description:
I have been searching all over San Francisco to find a steakhouse with a steak just as delicious as Peter Luger's porterhouse in Brooklyn. I have yet to find it, so if you know of a place - please let me know!

I took my boyfriend to Boboquivari's for his birthday since he loves nice, juicy steaks more than anything. After much scouring the internet and rifling through recommendations, I decided on Boboquivari's. I can't resist a place that was named "Best steak in SF" back in 2013 or whatever.

The boyfriend and I ordered the 20 oz bone-in filet to share (~$60), a cranberry-walnut salad (~$10), and a side of brussel sprouts (~$9).  We also got complimentary garlic bread, which was warm and very tasty. 

The salad came first, and it was disappointing considering the cost. I could have thrown it together myself as it was literally two wedges and some toppings. However, I place the blame solely on my boyfriend who wanted the salad. Who orders a salad at a steakhouse? ;)

The steak came very quickly thereafter. It was charred on top, and really added flavor to the steak. The steak was cooked perfectly! We had requested a medium rare, and it was just the way I liked it - red-centered, chewy, melt-in-your-mouth tenderness. Very flavorful and I could really taste the quality of the meat. It could have been slightly more seasoned, but that is my own personal preference.

The brussel sprouts were delicious! A bit pricey for what you get for $9, however.

The waiter also brought out a cone with a candle in it in honor of my boyfriend's birthday (I had requested the waiters to wish him happy birthday when I made the reservation). I thought the dessert was something nice that the restaurant was doing for us, but I was charged $2 for an itty bitty cone. This dampened my spirits only slightly, since I did not expect to be charged, but I suppose $2 is $2. 

The service was no fuss, and I loved how efficient our waiter was. We got our food cleared quickly, waters filled promptly, and we never had to wave our waiter down for anything - he always took away our plates in a timely matter, and gave our bill without us asking (but didn't rush us either). To add to our overall lovely experience, the hostess was such a sweetheart, and there is free valet parking!
author: Mina K.

description:
First, I'm not a filet guy.  So, my review is a bit biased but I knew that it specialized in a bone-in filet so it was a must try.  Four of us shared the below.

Three House salads w. crab- Refreshing start
Double crab, Double shrimp: Extremely tasty but nothing unique
Two Onion Rings- Sauce was better than the pedestrian onion rings
Steak Tartare- As atypical as steak tartare can be
Two Super Bone-In Filets

The filet was by far the best filet mignon I have ever eaten but it doesn't matter if it's on the bone or off, filet has no flavor.  They cooked it perfectly and seasoned ok but I was hoping this steak would enlighten me on why filet mignon is so popular even it being the best, this cut is still my least favorite.  Overall, service was ok at best as our waiter wouldn't comp us for one of the house salad because it had bread crumbs and my sister has a gluten issue.  He said house policy does not allow and if thats true, thats pretty disappointing.  This place is def worth going if you love filet mignon.
author: Ricky C.

description:
Been there twice, first time it was all bad spoke to general manager after and he said if we came back he would make sure it went better, so we did a few weeks later and the second time it went even worse my $149 steak (which i ordered before as well) was so under cooked it (again) it couldn't be eaten(again).We spent over $300 each time for a party of TWO and got a dinky table twice we did get GOOD drinks and crab cakes but thats it. We got bad service and very poorly cooked steaks. 
Couldn't believe that was how round two went, and never got offered any type of anything to make things better. #stillpaidfullprice
author: William H.

description: Came here for dinner with a few friends and was happy overall with the food and service. The decor is a bit odd, but that wasn't a big deal. This steakhouse isn't as fancy as others in SF which is nice if you're looking for a place a bit more low key. Servers were great, I would return again!
author: J C.

description:
The food here is really not worth the price I paid for.

We had the filet mignon, the porterhouse and the mac and cheese. While the filet mignon was ok, the porterhouse and Mac and cheese were so oily, I still felt nauseous 2 hours later. Mac and cheese were evidently not fresh either. Microwaved at best. Even the bread is dripping with oil 

Service was ok, but cashed out a lot and that was really not worth it. I will not Come back until food gets better. Take your 200 bucks somewhere else!
author: Maxime D.

description:
I agree that it's wholly self-indulgent to go to Ruth's Chris Steak House one weekend and then to Bobo's the following weekend. You're thinking what a decadent carnivore I must be to drop so much do-re-mi on high-end beef that shouldn't really be devoured that often. Well, Ruth's was an act of culinary desperation when no other Dine Around Town eatery was available on the last day of the program. Bobo's, on the other hand, was a more deliberate choice since Jamie W. and I wanted to celebrate the few more shekels we received in our respective paychecks with a nice steak dinner. 

Here's the newsflash: Bobo's turned out to be no better and no worse than Ruth's. It's a dimly lit place that appears to cobble various nooks and crannies into a restaurant. We were placed in the Lilliputian room next to the bar in a dark, cramped corner where every creak of my chair was the result of my fidgeting between the back wall and the table. I kept straightening the front of my shirt, hoping to see space to insert my napkin but to no avail. I'd characterize the vibe in the place to be manly. Lots of Super Bowl talk, lots of meat talk, lots of boobage talk. And that was just the two guys sitting mere inches from us at the next table. 

First off was the huge loaf of Garlic-Baked Sourdough Olive Loaf that came to our table, toasted and quite a bit of starch for an opener. Jamie and I both decided to start with Baby Romaine Wedges. His was topped with tomato and avocado slices, red onions and a light vinaigrette ($8). Mine was more decorative with apples, sun-dried cranberries, candied walnuts and a raspberry vinaigrette ($9 - see photo). Both of us were challenged by the minuscule size of the oblong glass plates and would have preferred a proper salad plate to keep all the ingredients off the white tablecloth. My wedge was marginally tastier simply because it was fruitier. 

Since neither of us had been here before, we both tried the $39 Surf & Turf, which consisted of a petit filet mignon (...they weren't kidding about the size) and a half-crab already pulled apart but not cracked (see photo). The filet was easily the best part of the meal - tender, pinkish on the inside and so very easy to cut. Too bad it was so small. Next time. The crab was decent, but I forgot what a pain it was to disassemble crab with a nutcracker and try to spear it with a cocktail fork. It was a chore, but I made it. The two $8 sides were variable in quality. The Modern Mac & Cheese had several competing cheeses melted on top of the wide noodles (see photo), but it failed to make an impression.

We had better luck with the Twice-Baked Potato (see photo) simply because I hadn't had a twice-baked potato since the Nixon administration. Memories. We ended up splitting dessert, their $8 Pistachio Panna Cotta (see photo), a disappointment as it had the distinct texture of something that had been stored in an aluminum tin in the fridge way past the expiration date. There was no light custardiness to it but rather a congealed quality. Ho-hum. Bobo's wasn't a boo-boo, but it wasn't that far north of so-so either. Bye-bye.

FOOD - 3 stars....great little steak, the rest was on the meh side for such a high-end restaurant
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...very red, very dark, very cramped, very manly, very Republican
SERVICE - 4 stars...no complaints here...she also led me to the tasty Moscow Mojito - Stoli Vodka, brown sugar, mint, lemon, orange, and a splash of ginger ale (see photo)
TOTAL - 3 stars...as George Michael would sing. "Wake me up before you Bobo / Don't leave me hangin' at a place that's so-so"
author: Ed U.

description:
First of all, I can't believe Jeremy only gave Bobo's 2 stars.  That was back in 2005.  He needs to give it another shot.

Why?

Because Bobo's is the best steak in San Francisco.  Hands down.  I eat steak.  That's what I do.  And when someone comes to town looking for beef I send them to one of two places:  House of Prime Rib or Bobo's.  

And only to HoPR if they want Prime Rib.  If they're looking for a steak?  Bobo's it is.

They are known for the bone-in filet as well they should be.  It is delectable and amazing.  Want proof?  About once a quarter my group of guy friends hosts a guys night dinner.  One of them is a butcher and another is a harsh food critic.  For whatever reason, they decided to go against the grain and NOT order the bone-in filet.  However, after tasting a bit of other peoples, they instantly admitted defeat and realized they should have got the bone-in filet.  Not that the other items are not good.  But because the bone-in filet is THAT GOOD.  

Also, the mussels in a skillet are like eating pieces of heaven.  And the yellowtail carpaccio is like eating an orgasm.  

Suffice to say, Bobo's is my favorite steakhouse in the city.  They also have great cocktails.  They even keep it SF real by having a Fernet infused Manhattan.  What more could this guy ask for?  

Bobo's.  A no doubter 5-star.
author: Joe M.

description: Bobo's is by far my favorite steakhouse. Bone-in filet mignon medium rare is the way to go - every bite melts in your mouth. Their mussels appetizer plate is amazing and buttery. Also, can't forget about their crabs! Get surf and turf if you want to try a little bit of both but beware that the filet mignon will be a smaller piece and will be cooked more medium well than medium rare due to the size of the steak. In either case, I do not think you can go wrong with anything in their menu.
author: Yliana C.

description: I absolutely adore this place, it is one of my favorite steakhouses and I love steakhouses! The prize handily goes to the bone-in filet mignon, I recommend getting it cooked medium rare plus, with a side of portobello mushrooms. You will not regret it!
author: Omer S.

description: Old fashioned, a bit dingy, and hokey. But, the food was really good. We loved the grilled mussels in particular. The dipping sauces were oily and garlicky in the best way possible. It was a good time. Not cheap.
author: Andrew K.

description: A friend said that they had good steaks so four of us went there for dinner. My friend was right, the steak was good. But everything else about the experience wasn't good. Let's start with the decor: old, dingy, dusty, and cramped to the point of being claustrophobic. Also the music was WAY too loud, we could barely carry on a conversation. As I said, the steak was good, but every other food item was only ok to terrible. The salad was terrible. All the salads were made with iceburg lettuce including a Ceasar Salad! My salad, $13, consisted of a very small wedge of iceburg lettuce with a sprinkling of off-tasting vinegar and some nuts, etc. No dressing, just vinegar.  I couldn't eat it. The wine selection was very limited and very overpriced. Speaking of price, if you take the price of the steak, add a salad, a vegetable, a potato (everything is ala-cart), add their healthy SF charge, you are at $100 per person before wine, tax, tip, or desert. For that price you can eat at Gary Danko! Unfortunately the service was not very good. Wine orders were forgotten, the wait staff didn't come into the room very often, the bill took forever. I think there is a reason that I have lived for years within walking distance of this place but had never heard of it. It's basically a tourist trap. I would never eat there again. Next time I want steak I'm going to Harris or House of Prime Rib.
author: Lee D.

description: This is one of my favorite steakhouses in the Bay Area. I've been here twice and had great service both times. My bone-in filet was cooked perfectly and cut through like butter. I would also recommend ordering the mussel appetizers to share. The decor freaked me out a bit the first time I came here (there are lots of clowns and medieval paintings up on the wall) but when the food came out, my focus is focused solely on the steak. I usually bring a wine bottle and just pay the corkage fee, but their wine selection is extensive. I'm very excited to be going back in a few weeks.
author: Han M.

description:
Really top of the line place.

We got the house salad to split, lobster crostini to split, onion rings to split, then separately a 1/2 crab for me and a filet mignon for my boyfriend. We also split a delicious bottle of cab sav.

The salad was good, the lobster crostini AMAZING.. you HAVE to get this if you come here. The onion rings, great. The crab, perfect.

I did not really like the table bread that much, but my boyfriend LOVED it. I guess its a hit or miss kind of thing.

The service was great and the ambience amazing. I love that we were seated on the top floor and that when there was a birthday, they blacked out all the lights. It was so dramatic and fun! REALLY want to come back again!!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
My husband and I like to try new steakhouses whenever we get a chance. After passing by this place many times we finally decided to give it a try. I made reservations for 6:45 Saturday night. We live about an hour away from SF so it's always a treat to venture into the city and play for the day. We decided to watch a movie before dinner and realized we'd be running a little late due to all the construction going on downtown. I called to let them know and was told I had a 15 min grace period so I should "hurry up" Really?!? I'm calling to let you know, super RUDE! Lucky for us we made it just in time! Valet parking is free so that's nice. We were seated right as we walked in. The downstairs area was small and already crammed with locals drinking the night away. We were taken upstairs which I thought would be nice, quiet and romantic...UMMMM NO! We were seated in this very small room with a bunch of other people. Our table was the smallest table I've ever sat at, I think my kids art table is bigger than the one we sat in, in fact my office is slightly smaller than the room we were put in with 20+ people. 

After adjusting to the small room we review our menus and order a drink. Our waiter was ok, he wasn't very attentive and seemed very frazzled by the amount of people he had to serve. We finally got our drinks and I look up at my husband who looks so uncomfortable and ask what's wrong. His response "it's HOT in here" and he was right, the room was SO HOT! So hot it was almost impossible to drink our Moscow Mojitos because we were both sweating, not my idea of a romantic dinner. After a few full cups of water we finally started to cool down. A few other couples were led to the boiling room and actually complained and requested to be moved because it was so HOT and the room was WAY TO SMALL! 

Dinner time! I ordered the surf & turf with the bone in filet, the husband ordered the bone in new york, and we ordered the cauliflower side & portbello side, oh and we also had the crab cake appetizer. My steak was cooked perfect, a nice medium, and seasoned well. My crab was another story. When it came out it had this strange brown butter sauce over it, didn't look so appealing, at first I thought it was a mistake until I saw the side butter that was the same color. It was a very strange sauce, it wasn't horrible but it looked disgusting, not appealing at all, this very dingy brown, almost like sewer sludge. It was just different, the actual crab itself was fresh. The husbands steak was cooked perfectly, but much smaller than any other steak house we've ever been to and definitely much more expensive. We aren't afraid to pay top dollar for our steaks either, we've eaten at place like Mesa Grill in Vegas(owned by Bobby Flay) we've eaten at top steakhouses in Florida, and several in San Francisco. The sides were good, nothing I couldn't make at home. 

All in all the place was just ok, for the price we paid I would have expected some awesome customer service, a table that I could actually stretch out at, a room that didn't feel like a sauna, and a meal that fit the price. I've paid 1/2 the price at other top steakhouses and received twice the food and way better service, all without dying of heat stroke. And please be adviced, we weren't the only ones complaining and saying how hot it was in the area they stuck us in. Would I come back, NOPE!
author: Kanani S.

description:
My date and I arrived around 9PM on a Saturday night. Complimentary valet is a huge plus. The place was buzzing with activity and carried a warm, cozy aura. We were sat up some stairs in what appeared to be the 2nd of 3 floors. We had the tartar as an appetizer, and the filet for the main course. The servers here are very attentive and professionally mixed our tartar in front of us to perfection. Paired with Peirson Meyer, a delicate yet robust pinot noir, the meal was outstanding. As other Yelpers have reviewed, and I confirmed with the server, the meat here is always cooked a tad more rare than specified. If you want medium rare, order a medium. 

5 star food, 5 star service and 5 star environment. Thanks for the experience!
author: Steve S.

description:
I brought a party of 4 to Bobo's last night.   It was our first (and last) time at this restaurant and I was excited, considering all of the positive reviews.    Unfortunately, it wasn't a good experience. 

Cons
 
-  Food was bland and mediocre at best.   We ordered Bone-in Ribeye, Bone-in Tenderloin, 1 Crab, yellowtail carpaccio, twice baked potatoes, brussels sprouts, two bottles of wine and 2 deserts.  Ribeye was not flavorful nor juicy.   Sprouts were soggy, boiled as best we could tell.   Crab was ok, but nothing special.  
- Total bill for a party of 4 was $853. 

-  The place is not well maintained or well managed.  Music (Journey, Boston, etc) kept cutting in and out, every 30 seconds.  When I asked the waitress about it, she said "yes, the speakers in this room don't work sometimes".   So they've known about it, but just never bothered to fix it.      
-  Menus are old, stained and nasty.  If you are going to charge $200 p/p for a meal, I think you should reprint your menus when they are covered in old food stains, especially when they are a simple paper print out.   Not that hard, if you care about the customer experience. 

Pros
- Valet parking is excellent. 

With all of the great restaurants in SF, I can't imagine how anyone rates this one above 2 stars.
author: Glenn P.

description: This place is MOST DEFINITELY not worth the price. I chose the filet mignon and the potato....filet was very bland and potato was nothing exciting. Food is very mediocre, as previously read you pay for looks of the restaurant. Not much variety to choose from the menu so if ur debating where to go I would highly suggest Ruth Chris or Mastros. Very disappointed since our original spot to visit was 5a5. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!
author: Joann O.

description:
For as much hype and rave reviews you've received, Quiqui - you REALLY let me down.

Where to begin? First off, you gave me some complimentary garlic bread. But why in God's name did you not cut it into pieces? You handed me an entire goddamn loaf with a barely half ass attempt to cut it. I had to use my own steak knife to cut myself a piece. (Did you replace my knife before my steak came? No.) Is it so hard to cut bread into individual slices? 

This highly touted bone-in filet topped off the entire disappointment of a meal. I'm jealous of all these other Yelpers who got to experience "melt in your mouth" and "buttery" steak. It entirely lacked any sense of flavor. Even the tenderest of steaks need some seasoning. Your steak had none. Nada. Zip. Zilch. Zero. 

ESPECIALLY when your own waiter touts your bone-in filet over any other cut of meat, you better be sure it delivers. You did not deliver Quiqui.

The only positive notes were the mac and cheese and brussel sprouts (at least SOMETHING was seasoned).

I really thought I'd give you 3 stars, but mac and cheese and brussel sprouts alone do not merit 3 stars, so here's to 2 stars - "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: Brian L.

description: The high rating on this place must be because the city is full of newly converted vegetarians whose parents never taught them what a steak should taste like.
author: Bobo J.

description:
What can I say? They have amazing steaks, friendly staff, and an old school San Francisco setting. You wouldn't know it from the outside but this place is legit. Bobo's is a great spot for entertaining clients or a nice night out with the lady (I still owe her a dinner here :-/) 

Get the bone in filet and the mod mac...you won't regret it.
author: Daniel M.

description: My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary and it was absolutely amazing! we ordered the in bone filet mignon and half crab and the filet was so tender. Worth the price tag in my opinion. The service was super nice, very welcoming. The waiter even flagged me down after I left the restaurant because I forgot my cardigan on my chair. It was very nice of him. The only thing I could complain about was that our table was ridiculously close to the one next to us.. To where we could hear the other couple's conversations. But other than that, everything exceeded our expectations.
author: Heather T.

description: The food is always amazing...however, it's Christmas and they are are blasting 80's hair band music!  Seriously?!
author: Randy M.

description: Their bone-in filet was definitely the highlight of the meal. Tender, delicious and seared perfectly. My only complaint was that I ordered my filet medium rare, and as I got closer to the bone, the filet was too rare for me. Their twice-baked potato and mac and cheese sides were also good. My husband ordered the surf and turf, so he had some crab with his meal. Probably could have just ordered the filet. We split a caesar salad to start, and I liked that they served our salads on separate plates. Also recommend their strawberry cheesecake. Not too heavy, and a perfect way to end the meal. Bobo's was definitely on the pricey side though. Our bill came out to about $200 for two. I would try Bobo's at least once and order the bone-in filet, but I'm not sure I would go again.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Good was great. Expensive, but great for a celebratory meal (maybe minus the decor).

Decor was dark and red. Leather booths. Random clown decor, nothing homey or attractive.

However, this can easily be overlooked because the food is rather great (but expensive):

- free bread = yum! great texture and served hot for you to pull apart
- Crab = WOW, delicious! I didn't realize this place wasn't just a steakhouse. I couldn't stop eating the crab from the appetizer to stealing off my husband's surf and turf plate.  It was so tasty I didn't even dip it in the butter, no need!
-lobster crostini and heirloom tomato starters were both great, although a bit pricey for the portion.
- filet = yum! I ordered it medium/medium rare since the chef suggests medium rare, however it was cooked well done on the edges. My first slice I thought they cooked the entire filet well done and was ready to tell the waiter.
- italian cheesecake dessert - very light and fluffy compared to traditional cheesecake. it was good (i was looking for something sweet to top off the night) but wasn't GREAT or amazing.
- sides were OK, i did not enjoy the brussel sprouts at all and am usually big on brussel sprouts. onion rings were delish!

Overall, really really enjoyed our dinner with family in town.  Be prepared to drop some serious cash though - for the 6 of us with drinks at the bar before dinner and 2 bottles of wine and heavy appetizers, the bill was close to $1k. Everything good overall and we all left happy and with full bellies, but hefty tab and ambiance of the place and service both weren't top notch. However, would chose any day over a place like Ruth Chris.
author: Melody T.

description:
Objectively, this place is good. Meaning, I couldn't do a better job myself. But if I'm paying this much for a steak, I definitely want something that's on par with even a standard fare chain store like Morton's. 

I ordered the bone in New York. The meat quality was really subpar compared to the steak I've had in just standard steak houses
My gf ordered the petite filet mignon with the half order crab. Good texture, but again nothing spectular. 

I feel like overall, it was second rate quality of materials, but prepared well.
author: Lars B.

description: The bone in filet is to die for. Forget the high end steak chains while on vacation and visit the best steakhouse in SF.
author: Joe M.

description: The mussels, crab, and shrimp were extremely good. They came out on this very large cast iron skillet that was so hot the butter in the small metal container was bubbling. I'm not complaining but you will want to be very careful. My fiancé ordered the bone in fillet mignon and crab. He said the turf was cooked perfectly and seasoned very well. Why only three (3) stars? The sides were below average and over priced. We had the mac and cheese, brussels sprouts and onion rings. Skip the sides and go for the entree. The menu is a la carte so it won't be hard.
author: Suzette N.

description: Awesome restaurant! Steak and crab is amazing! Will deff come back here again! Beware parking sucks on busy nights lol
author: Sinat A.

description: If I could put negative stars I would but Yelp won't let me do that.  Never going here again. Always had a wonderful time in the past, but this was my worst restaurant experience in SF in over 20 years.  Where do I begin?  We waited over an hour for our table we had reserved with no acknowledgment or apologies, then sat us at a table in a room with a private party when some of the party left, and they threw together a table for us to sit at in their room.  Kids were running all over the place which is fine if you are part of the private party! The host lied to us throughout the ordeal.  Said there was another table upstairs we could move to when the guests paid their check.  But later said there were no tables.  There clearly was no manager on duty making sure things were handled right.  I would not call it an off night.  The place looked like it was in total chaos.  I am hoping management addresses the issue since this is a great place when managed right. Good news is we went over to Harris' steakhouse and had a wonderful dinner.
author: Mark B.

description: Wek wek wek....no wonder it's not busy on Sunday and such a tiny place, we got in right away. Ok the fillet mignon is good, but nothing to rave about. You can buy a good quality of red meat at butcher shop and make it at home. DO NOT ORDER THE CRAB, what a big disappointment!!!! The best seafood and steakhouse in SF??? The people who gave them the rewards must be blind. I don't think it's the best steakhouse either. There's plenty in the city. I'd rather go to Primeribs, The House in North beach serves great steak. OVERPRICED, crab is overcooked...for Crabs, nothing can beat CRUSTACEAN. It's just typical american food that nothing to rave about.
author: Clemencia S.

description:
I give Bobo's  3.5 stars.. 

The reason why?  The meal itself didn't blow me away like a steak meal usually would!  I love meat!  I am a meat eater!! I should of been AMAZED and in heaven!  But that was not the case!  Don't get me wrong!  I ordered the 10 ounce bone in filet mignon medium rare.  I do admit.. It was good and full of flavor!!! I didn't need any sauce or peppering at all!  You definitely need side orders to accompany your steak!

My all time favorite side order here was the twice baked potato!!  The potato fell right off of the skin and was delicious with the stuffing baked in! I couldn't stop eating it!  The modern mac 'n cheese on the other hand was a disappointment.  It was average but I didn't quite enjoy it like I always do at steak houses!  I was looking forward to it too but that was a bit of a disappointment.  Portobello mushrooms were sweet and delicious as per my company say. ( i don't eat mushrooms :P ) 

Iron skilled mussels were delicious though.  It was good for an appetizer. I liked the seasoning and how fat those mussels were.  Not some rip off of mussels that we pay so much for!  Melted butter sauce provided in the middle with bowl to throw away your shells.

Crab cakes were over-fried I felt like.  It comes in a pair with some side cranberries.  It wasn't as flavorful and soft in the inside as all the other crab cakes that I have tried.  I've had better!

Last but not least... I don't think I would get the crab here anymore.. Crustacean is TEN TIMES BETTER!  Crab was plain dungeness and supposedly in garlic sauce but I didn't really see much of that... That was ALSO a let down!! 

Venue-wise was very small!! I was surprised!  I was expecting this big steakhouse just like any other ones in the city!  But in reality, it basically is only 3 rooms! the front one is mainly the bar area with 2 private dining areas on the back and right side of the restaurant. One bathroom available.  Dark and intimate place to eat..  Decor was very confusing!  I personally am not a fan of clowns so that was a downside for me...Automatic doors so watch out or you'll get hit!

Service was great!  They hang your coats for you since the tables are booths in the back especially!  Complimentary parking in the front of the restaurant! So don't waste your time looking around the busy streets!!
author: Kathy D.

description: The bone in filet was the best steak I've ever eaten. The appetizers were tasty. Be ready to spend a chunk of change here though.
author: TJ Y.

description:
Great if you like salt. Lots of salt on everything.

Steaks are good (we tried filet and new york) but nothing to write home about. Been to a steakhouse before or cooked one properly yourself then you get the idea.

$9 tiny, overcooked, over salted sides is where I draw the line and drop off a star.

Lastly the place is cramped, stuffy, and looks like the inside of the cat lady's house.
author: Easwud C.

description:
42 weeks aged Filet Mignon boned-IN is great, flavor wise is amazing something different, the way they cook the steak is excellent.

I also loved their portobello mushroom excellent and tasty...

They are pricey but you get the best service and food on the price you pay !! so I can't complain abt their price and also I can't compare them to Ruth Cris or House of Prime Ribs, all of them have different specialty.

I also recommend their Twice Baked Potato, yummy......
author: Marie R.

description:
Won't go again. Terrible steaks, not worth the hype.  Went for Christmas dinner with my boyfriend & extremely unimpressed.

When we arrived, they sat us pretty quickly, but we had to request a new table because they crammed us next to another couple in a 4'x4' room meant for 1 private party of 4.  We got resat in a cute couple's nook though.

2 stars for: warm/funky atmosphere, good apps/sides, & fine service.

Ordered:
- Extremely overpriced wine (not great)
- Lobster soup (amazing!)
- Yellowtail/smoked salmon crostinis (not worth it)
- Brussell sprouts (amazing!)

- Bone-in filet (ordered this because of the recommendations. Usually I go for strips or ribeyes. I had to send back mid-rare order TWICE. 1st time: rare & cold. 2nd time: charred to the point of inedible. When they brought the final one, the juices on the plate were good, but I actually needed to salt the meat because the taste was so boring. Yes it's tender, but overall taste NOT worth $50!!)
author: Krista M.

description:
We returned a year later craving the bone in mignon. This time we got a very nice window view. This is are must stop every time we are in San Fran.
Food was amazing and I finished the night off with an amazing glass of the Remy cognac. Wow!
author: DJ V.

description: Wow.  I have to say this was the most overpriced, tourist rip-off place I have eaten at in a long time.  I was doing an event at Fort Mason on a Saturday night and this was the closest place I could find.  For $70.00 I got:  16 small shrimp, unpeeled, thrown on a sizzling iron plate and cooked within a rubbery inch of their life; a "caesar salad with lobster" which consisted of two quarters of a head of iceberg lettuce simply thrown in a bowl with a small dish of bottled caesar dressing, some cold parmesan out of a plastic tub thrown on top and maybe a dozen pieces of canned lobster; and a dish of barely steamed brussels sprouts with some kinda creamy sauce.  $70!  Seriously?  Just basic mediocre stuff thrown on a plate.  And I didn't have any alcohol--just a diet Coke.   The service was fine, she was very friendly.  But the food I got was worth about $15, max.  Don't serve lobster as $14.95 addition to a salad, if you aren't going to cook it fresh.  Total tourist rip-off.
author: Robert H.

description:
We decided to eat at the bar rather than in the restaurant and we honestly 
Had the best possible service ever.definitely will be back. Thx lois
author: Rebekah S.

description: We were in the city for Christmas shopping and struck out trying to get a walk in any any of my regular favorites and had heard great things about the crab and filet at Bobo's so we gave them a call. Got in within a half hour and couldn't have been happier. Crab cake was good as was heirloom tomatoes and roasted brussel sprouts! But let's not kid ourselves, the crab was the main attraction! Crab for 3 is 2 full crabs and it filled 3 of us up! Though I think I could do 2 crabs myself lol! Service was good and attentive. Would definitely return!
author: Rob D.

description:
Arrogant, cheesy, & terrible service. 

The beef tartar was overpowered by Dijon & capers. Presumably because the quality was on the low end (notice they don't mention a style or the way it was raised). 

We bought an $80.00 bottle of wine - not once did anyone offer to re-pour. Usually it's while asking us how we are enjoying things but that's because if they weren't bring us food they never came to check on us. 
Even though we were sitting in the lounge, in view of a manager, bartender, hostess, & several servers passing by.

The crab was old, brown, & in edible. I informed the back waiter when he finally cleared our plates. He shook his head & said sorry but I never saw him again.

Not a single person asked if we'd like something else or came to comment about the the stinky pound of paid for crab meat left on our plate.

The filet was delicious- I have to note that & the bread were the two good things about the experience.

After 30 mins of nothingness I had to ask the manager for our check & while doing so our server brushed shoulders with me as I stood up & he said nothing. Didn't even acknowledge I was his customer. 

Totally parched- our water glasses were dry & not refilled until the check was signed. I told him it would be wasting water since my coat was already on & we were about to stand up.

Far too expensive for an old gimmicky SF restaurant that has no real value.
author: Nickers S.

description:
Would not seat us. 
We were 6 plus an infant. As soon as they saw us,  suddenly the empty restaurant "had no room for a party like ours." 

We were told to try another nearby restaurant that was more "family oriented."
author: Saul F.

description:
Hands down some of the best steak I've had in SF. I came here last weekend for my birthday dinner (and made reservations, of course--a must on the weekends), ordered a bunch of apps (yellowtail carpaccio, caesar & house salads, heirloom tomato salad, complimentary garlic bread) and drinks (wine & cocktails), some sides (portabello mushrooms & brussel sprouts), and then the mouthwatering, perfectly seared steaks. The bone-in filet was incredible. 

Overall, definitely on the pricey side but well worth it for the quality of steak you get. Also, our waiter was really charming and funny!! I will certainly be back.
author: Amy G.

description:
14.06.00            First Visit

Category - Steakhouse - only
Food -----------------------   4 - 4 1/2 stars
Atmosphere ----------------  7/10
Service ---------------------- 9/10

Straight to the point:
         Top steakhouses I had ate in SF so far... Ruth
                                                                           Boboquivari's
                                                                           Larks Creek Steak
                                                                           5x5

         I do not have long list of fine steakhouse dining ... 
         I do love great steaks.
         To me BOBO is very good even I never ate at legendary steakhouse in the east.
         I wish they have rib eyes also.


         I am not going over embellish this review.
         Basically it is better than average New York steaksteak.
         Dry aged off site for 6 weeks!
author: S.K. Y.

description:
What a fantastic experience! Visited SF from LA with my wife and sat at the bar at Bobo's for dinner. The bar tender helped us out with great cocktails and wine suggestions, as well as taking care of food orders/service/everything else. 

Intimate and unique atmosphere and the food we had was spectacular. Usually a ribeye or ny steak are a treat for us, fillets aren't really our preference. Bobo's changed that with their bone-in fillet that was extremely tasty as well as being a gigantic tender piece of steak that pretty much melted in my mouth. Also highly recommend mussel appetizer and lobster appetizer. Brussell sprouts were just ok but everything else was over-the-top delicious.

Super stoked on the people working there, the food, the drinks, and our little spot at the bar. I'm happy to recommend the experience to you.
author: Brian L.

description:
The food was excellent. The restaurant was charming; I ate at a table along the windows beside the bar. The loud, drunk Canadian woman at the bar was the only live entertainment, and I only fantasized about sticking my crab fork in her forehead about seventy times. Certainly no more than seventy-five. Maybe ninety.

That having been said, the food was so darn good, my steak cooked so perfectly, and the bartender so carefully polite while trying to manage the brown haired Canadian train wreck, I will absolutely visit this great, oddly located restaurant again!
author: Exequiel S.

description:
I came to BoBo's last month to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. We've heard many good things about the restaurant and were really excited to come try it out as we both loveee steak! We had reservations at 8:30pm and arrived at 8pm. They were kind enough to seat us early and also had a booth for us when we requested it when we checked in. The restaurant looked more casual than I had anticipated but it was still in a romantic setting.

We opted for their specialty bone-in filet mignon. We started off with the yellowtail Carpaccio, and ordered double mussels and double crab with our steak. Our yellowtail Carpaccio came out first and it was so thin! Of course Carpaccio's are always thin slices and I was amazed at how much flavor that dish had. It was delicious! I probably wouldn't order it again but it was fun to try. We decided to share the bone-in filet mignon, mussels, and crab. I would suggest having one come out before the other because it was hard to eat all three items at the same time before it all got cold =(. In regards to flavors, the mussels were a bit too charred, they were dry and tiny in size. It might have been left it in too long in the oven. It was still really good with the sauce to dip in it. However, the crab I absolutely loved the flavors. I would come back just for the crab! The steak was lean and was extremely tender. I enjoyed the food here.

Service was great, my water was always refilled. She kept checking on us to make sure we were doing okay. Anyway, corkage is only $15! Great price, we brought our own bottle to enjoy with dinner.
author: Camery V.

description:
So I was a little apprehensive to commit to going here for a dinner as I felt the reviews were mixed, but left it to the spouse to make the final call on where we should go to dinner and bring my parents.  Bobo's it was.

Upon arrival, I will agree with everyone's assessment that the initial greeting and hostess isn't the best.  Along with that their sign is not obvious when you pull up and I passed the valet stand and had to go around due to the lack of parking space.

Anyhow, they were running about 15 minutes late with our reservation which was at 7:15PM.  Wasn't a big deal as there is a bar right when you walk in that you can grab a cold one prior to getting seated.  One thing I will say, is that I'm not a fan of the decor. Growing up terrified of clowns thanks to the movie "IT" really had me feeling uneasy.

We were seated on the second floor which again the decor was creepy with clowns and just the facade I'm eating in a circus. We had Jenn as our waitress and she was incredibly attentive, and patient.

I already knew what I wanted to get going in based on all the reviews and the fact I've never heard of a bone-in filet mignon.  My parent's got the crab for two, and my spouse the surf and turf and we ordered a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon (I unfortunately, forgot to grab my bottle of Caymus Cabernet which the corking fee would have only be $15 bucks).  Anyhow, we settled for a bottle of Titus which wasn't bad.

For sides we got the twice baked potato, Bahama Onion Rings, and the brussel sprouts which was recommended by our waitress.

My thoughts on the items ordered:


We started off with two salads, apple walnut and caesar salad which we opted to share between two people.  It was a good thing that we did as they are reasonably sized.  They provide half a loaf of garlic sourdough bread which was awesome as well.  The twice baked potato was very delicious, and the onion rings were not special, and the brussel sprouts were yummy and salty. 

The crab for two was so much my mom and dad didn't even finish it and had half the platter to bring home which is shocking as my mom usually can eat a ton of crab in one sitting.  The crab was cooked similar to that of the Crab House which I believe they are sister companies in some odd way down by Pier 39.  It was a little dry, which was disappointing, but the flavor was delicious.  My spouse's surf and turf is more surf than turf, but the flavor was amazing for the steak with good texture, but definitely a petite filet mignon.  

On to the main event, my dish - The bone-in filet mignon.  THE BEST PIECE OF STEAK I have ever had in my life!!!!!!!  First the amount you receive is massive, and looks overwhelming.  When I initially put my fork to it and my knife to the meat I can tell it was extremely tender as I barely had to apply pressure it just cut like butter.  The outside is charred and you see the pretty color of pink for a medium rare steak with a dark crust.  Should be used for a food magazine of perfection. At this point my mouth was salivating just looking at how perfect it was.  As I brought it to my mouth O-M-F-G, it literally melted in your mouth.  I may have said that line before for steak, but this is by far the most tender piece of meat I have ever had and the flavor just bursts in your mouth.  Wow - I wish I was more articulate for those reading this review for you to really understand how that initial 5 seconds felt, but it literally is the best thing I have ever eaten.  I continued to carve away at this juicy tenderness that had texture similar to ahi tuna steaks in some way, but a steak.  I ate as much as I could, but it conquered me and I was forced to save the rest, which I must say I ate this morning and it still blew me away the next day which never happens.  It wasn't as good as last night, but it taste on the level that I  usually get at Alexander's Steakhouse filets without the unnecessary sauces.

If you're big on steaks you have to come to this steak house and order the bone-in  filet mignon as it really is to die for  The best $44 bucks I have ever spent.  Next time I know I'll order this steak with no sides to make sure I can finish it along with a bottle of Joseph Phelps Insignia or Backus to really compliment my meal...Freaking amazing just thinking about it gets me giddy that I had to grab a beer while writing this review.

To end the night we got the dunce cap cones, which comes with 4 little cones, with this delicious chocolate mousse, raspberry, and chocolate sauce on the plate.  Delicious as well.

Anyhow, I would have given them 4 stars due to their hostess, but the steak did more than over compensate for the minor hiccup of the night!!
author: Angeline Z.

description:
The crab cakes were very good.  They came out quick, but almost too quick.  I don't think they were cooked fresh for us.  The waitress said they were known for their bone-in filet so we got two of those.  We went with medium rare.  The first part of the steak was medium, the center was medium rare but about half the steak was rare.  I couldn't eat it.    The salty, buttery crust was delicious.  More disappointing was the wait staff wasn't as professional as the other high end steak joints in the city.  The waitress never came back to ask if we had everything we needed or how the meal was.  The waitress also hadn't tasted the wines by the glass.

Overall we will always go to Harris' vs. Bobo's.  We felt like we had to try Bobo's after all the feedback we have been hearing and we live around the corner.  Sorry to say we wouldn't go back given the price, quality, atmosphere and service.
author: Frank M.

description: The best steak I've ever had, hands down.... And this is coming from an avid steak eater. It's insane and delicious. Quaint little restaurant with a cool vibe. My boyfriend also had the lobster and loved it.
author: Helen S.

description: Never coming back.   Been 3 times in my life and always leave disappointed.  My go to in SF is Ruth's Chris.  The steak was rather dry, lacking in intramuscular fat.  Did not seem to be USDA Prime wich is what I'd expect for a $60+ dollar steak. The wedge salad was smallish, lacking enough bacon and dresssing.  Last I didn't appreciate the upsetting by the waiter. I ordered a vodka martini and he chose KetelOne for $16 when a well martini would have been fine @ $8.  In asked for a glass of dry red and he just brought the most expensive.  Go to Ruth's Chris.  Everything is better there.
author: Mike P.

description: Solid steak joint. Recommend the surf and turf. The decor is pleasant as long as you don't have a fear of clowns.
author: A K.

description:
The steak is good but not overly amazing. I choose to eat here because of all the great reviews I was not disappointed but I've had a lot of steaks and these just were not overly over the top amazing. 

The service was great.
author: Angie B.

description:
A little pricey, but for downtown San Francisco (CBS News recently rated SF as the 4th most expensive city in America), this place may seem like a bargain. So take money out of it and what do you have?  A very good tasting steakhouse with a friendly staff, valet parking, intimate (and somewhat dated) atmosphere and outstanding cuts of beef with fabulous sides. 

I had the cheapest steak on the menu (8 oz filet for $39) and a side of brussels sprouts, along with a glass of Cabernet. From the first sip to the last bite - the food quality was excellent!  Service was friendly and attentive, but not overdone.

I would recommend a slight upgrade/update to the interior and stick with jazz or Frank Sinatra for the piped in music.  Otherwise, I love this place.
author: Dave M.

description: Cramped. Daaaark. steaks, from what my party said, were very good. I don't eat red meat, so ill take their word for it, bone in filet mignons. I had the lobster soup, it was ok. Cesar salad with shrimp was not that good. Not worth it for non beef eaters.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Bobo's is currently my favorite steak house in SF.
The atmosphere is a kick - all kind of wacky French circus-y.
The cocktails, while nothing fancy, are more than serviceable.
The wine list, while fairly short, has plenty of things more than worth drinking and not egregiously marked up.
And finally... the steak. Is fabulous. I get the bone-in filet every time. It's wonderful. Flawlessly cooked, rich, juicy, meaty, beefy, and of a wonderful texture.
The sides (particularly the chard) are good, and most of the appetizers are as well, though on the most recent visit the yellowtail carpaccio was sadly over-sauced. The Dungeness crab crostini is reliably good.
I also strongly recommend the dunce cap desserts - they're the perfect size of wee to share amongst the table and yet still fit even after you've powered through a whole steak.

I love this place.
author: Don H.

description:
I had the 20oz Bone in Filet Mignon and shared a twice-baked potato, Brussels Sprouts and the modern mac & cheese, Chocolate Bomb and Mango Panna Cotta . 

- Sides were amazing
- Steak was very tender and juicy but was a little too rare for my taste as I got closer to the bone
- The ambient was more relaxed than I am used to a Steakhouse which is not bad but the waiter did not seem very motivated
- I really liked the Chocolate Bomb but the Mango Panna Cotta had a weird texture and taste.

The group of people sitting behind us at the big table had a party going on so they ordered huge plates of food which were served super hot, the waiters poured water (or whatever) over the plates to cool it down and the whole room filled with smoke so it was kinda hard to breathe for about 15 min. Smelled very burned! NOT SO COOL!

All in all the food was good, the atmosphere, service, price alright.
author: Daniel J.

description:
I was recommended Bobo's a couple times by friends and since I live in the neighborhood I had to try it.  So went last night and had a great time.

There were three of us; we ordered the yellowtail carpaccio which was fantastic.  Also as an appetizer we got the lobster crostini.  The crostini came with a hemisphere of mozzarella which was as soft as butter and a perfect complement to the lobster.

For the main course, I ordered the surf and turf, a petit filet with a half crab.  My friend ordered the bone-in filet.  When the steaks arrived, I won't lie: we didn't speak a word the entire time we ate.  The meat was that good.  I started with the steak because in my experience shellfish takes longer to cool.  But I switched back and forth, and even dipped some filet in the crab butter which was exquisite (they must have used clarified butter or something).  The petit filet was perfectly tender, and melted in my mouth.  The char was just the right amount of crispiness and not overseasoned.  Then I got to the crab.  The shells were perfectly brittle and were easy to break.  The meat separated easily from the shell--a sign of a perfectly cooked and prepared shellfish.  I also had a taste of the whitefish which, as would be expected, was perfect.

Then, the dessert.  Got the "dunce caps" which were awesome, and a raspberry-chocolate cake.  Highly recommended.  And of course, to top it off we had a couple rounds of smokey Old Fashioneds.

I highly recommend Bobo's for the perfect steak night!!
author: Foodie B.

description: Been here way too many times. Go for the bone-in filet! You won't be disappointed. I do wish they brought back the petite filet as that was a favorite of my wife.
author: Robert L.

description:
Bobo's is my favorite steak restaurant in SF.  I tend to prefer rib-eye cuts, but their bone-in filet is tops!  So juicy and always done perfectly (ordered medium rare).

However, I would not recommend the crab. The sauce that it came in was too buttery without a distinct flavor.  I even asked if they had a different sauce (cocktail sauce perhaps!?) and no, it was just more butter.  Maybe it's because I prefer either Asian / Italian styles of cooked crab (Vietnamese, Chinese or in a good cioppino!), but this just didn't do it for me.  Such a shame since crab is literally my favorite dish.

Corkage is only $15, a steal!!
author: Christine Y.

description:
Jesus Christ. Amazing.

My bf & his co-workers had been here a few times & he loved it. "We HAVE to go there sometime," he said emphatically. "You will love it."

What can I say? The boy knows me. We made a reservation for four on a Friday evening, and I was not disappointed.

I am given to understand that all of the appetizers are amazing (and when a large group of them go, they just order one or two of everything), but being only four, we limited ourselves to the yellowtail carpaccio, the crab cakes, and the Dungeness crab crostini. All were fantastic. I could've eaten another serving of any one of them.

Then my bone-in filet mignon showed up. Now, I am from Texas, my dad is a butcher, and my housemate dry-ages his own meat regularly. I know from beef. I'll admit that I'm still making the rounds when it comes to SF steakhouses, but I've been to a couple, and Bobo's filet mignon beat them all. It was *at least* 1.5 inches thick. Maybe 2 inches. And flawlessly medium rare. The meat was juicy, flavorful, and succulent throughout.

I ate the whole thing.

I didn't want to waste too much space on sides, but my bf insisted that I would adore the Swiss chard, so we ordered it, and I did. (Don't order this if you don't like garlic. I adore garlic.) Again, I could've made a meal on that alone.

The wine selection was solid, with all the obligatory steak- and seafood-friendly options, and the mark-up was quite reasonable. If you want to know a secret, skip the triple-digit cabs & get a bottle of the Green & Red Syrah as we did -- in addition to good fruit and a subtle earthy component, it was older than most of the cabs, a third to a quarter of the price, and paired fantastically with the steak. Now that is what I call a hidden gem.

Our server was helpful, knowledgeable, friendly, and always around when we needed her. Perfection.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Angela B.

description:
Let me start by saying that the food is out of this world amazing.  I can't give more than three stars as my visits have been inconsistent.  I booked a table last minute for last Tuesday evening.
