It was an anniversary dinner, so I wanted to have dinner at a place that was classy, with great food and a nice atmosphere.  I usually get that at Bobo's, but this time, not so much.

To start off, the restaurant was fairly empty, but they sat everyone that was coming in in the tiny dining space downstairs.  As soon as we sat down, the music turned off.  When I asked if they could turn it back on, they said it was down and the IT guys were looking into it.  On top of that, the air conditioning was not working, so the front door was left open, so we had to eat amidst conversations of other diners (I can usually tune out with music going in the background) and with the noise of traffic from Lombard Street.  

I don't think you can get a better steak in the City, but I don't think it's right for a $200+ meal to be in the equivalent of a high school cafeteria with no a/c.
author: C H.

description: Best steak in town and Jacklyn serves up the best Manhattans as well. She went the extra mile to track down Antica sweet vermouth and it was out of this world.
author: pete p.

description: Had dinner here on a Saturday night for my birthday. We found parking right away. Place was booked. Me and my girlfriend had reservations to the lounge next door but wanted to see if we could have dinner at the main dining restaurant. The Maitre d at the front told us that a couple near the window will be leaving soon and that we can take that table. We did end up waiting about 10-15 mins before we were seated. This was not a problem since we were about 20 mins early before our reservations. Our waitress was very welcoming and nice. Me and my gf started with some wine and Lobster Crostini. The appetizer was delicious. The big half loaf of bread was also a good side for our pre meal.We both ordered the Surf & Turf. I had the Bone-in filet mignon and my gf got the petite filet mignon. The meat was juicy and tasty. The crab was perfectly cooked. I'm not one to order crab all the time because it's work to break open all those shells lol. I wasn't disappointed in the fact that the crab meat was delicious. For our side dishes, we ordered the Twice Baked Potato and Mod Mac. I enjoyed the twice baked potato, but on other hand the Mod mac wasn't up to par for my standards. The Mac was over cooked and the flavor didn't surprise me much. I would have to try it again to give it another chance, but I wouldn't eat it again if it comes out the same way. This was our first time dining here. Besides the okay Mod mac, Everything went our way that night. No complaints and no bad food/service. I recommend this place if you want an intimate dinner for 2 or if you like to bring a small group to dine. The place is a pricey, but you get what you pay for.
author: Steven O.

description: Our server claimed it was the best Steak House in the city, a bold claim but rightly justified. Fantastic food, top class service! For most, incl me, it is pricey.. But that won't stop me coming back! Go for the bone-in filet, outstanding!
author: Ciaran H.

description:
Omg best filet I have every had!!! Sorry to say but this place had replaced Peter lugers.  

valet parking , awesome bartender , and the best filet you will ever eat.

Def will be back!

And awesome deserts.
author: Darren K.

description: THEEEE BEST bone in filet I have ever had. Definitely my GO TO SPOT whenever I want a good a$$ steak :) And for the record...this girl is not a steak lover so with that being said...BOBO's did pretty darn good to win my vote :) k bye!!
author: Sheila D.

description: We went here for date night. Had a variety of different things on the menu since it was our 1st time  at this restaurant. The bone in filet mignon was delicious, the whole crab was seasoned perfectly and the Cesar salad perfect.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Bone-in Ribe-Eye... 
Damn good. 
If you've got the stones for it, order it rare.  
You'll be much more happy than ordering it medium-rare.
Ambiance... excellent. (You can't go wrong with dim lights). 


A couple years ago, I had the crab. I remember it to be really good. 
However, crab is never a sexy option on a date. Just saying...
 
Although, watching your date suck the meat out of a crab leg can be quite entertaining... If you know what I mean... Just saying (again).
author: Garland W.

description: We are here on vacation with friends and had a steak craving so decided to try out this place it honestly was the worst mistake, the food was over priced and not tasty at all but the worst is the staff!! Never again will we come back or even recommend it even tho the service was horrible we still decide to leave a tip and I guess the waiter didn't think it was enough and he deserved more because as we were waiting for our car he decided to come outside and ask for more !! Of course we didn't give him anything especially because he didn't deserve anything in the first place, he made himself and the restaurant look absolutely worse then it did!
author: Sandra M.

description:
Had a great experience here. I'd give the service 5 stars, food 3.5 (with the exception of the filet mignon & sides). The waiter was very attentive and friendly. 

Had the combination seafood appetizer which included shrimp, crab, and mussels. Not bad but not great.  Was a bit overcooked and lacking flavor. Outof the 3, I'd say the shrimp were best. 

I got the Filet Mignon and a friend got the NY Strip. The filet was outrageously good. Perfectly cooked and delicious. The NY strip was decent. The sides were fantastic (onion rings & baked potato).

The overall ambience is a bit odd but I liked it. If you're in a group the 3rd floor is a great atmosphere, especially with the big booths.
author: David R.

description: Place is great! Had to do the bone in filet and baked potato! Wow! And crab was good to
author: Gabe W.

description:
I would've given 5 stars EASILY but the service continues to disappoint once in a while.  I've been here probably a dozen times in the last 10 months but the service is really a crap shoot.  I wonder why they don't fix that part.  There are great servers but some are really mediocre at best. 

That's really too bad since the FOOD IS AMAZING!!!  The FILET BONE-IN is a MUST!  Also, the crab is really yummy too!  The drinks are delicious as well depending on the bartender (there's a young bald European looking dude who makes awesome drinks so check the bartender before sitting down for dinner and ordering drinks.)

Definitely will continue to come here once a month for our steak fix! :p
author: Jorge C.

description:
Yeah, this one is hard.  It's a steak-house.  You get a slab of meat for $55 and some sides at $7 each and that's a hard pill to swallow sometimes.
The cuts were good, the prices were too high (maybe) and it was a birthday meal with a lot of moving parts, wine we brought in and a birthday boy who wasn't having the best night already when we arrived.
I'm giving this a 3 star rating because I will go back and I will give it another try.  My first impression, without all of the other contributing factors, was that it was a bit tourist driven, the pricing reflected such, the decor was a little dated and the menu wasn't all I'd hoped it would be.  
That's what I get for having expectations, but now that I know maybe I can go back with eyes wide open and try again.  Stay tuned.
author: Sean M.

description:
I decided last minute that I wanted to eat steak for my birthday dinner and after research and some rejections, I was able to get reservations here at Bobo's. I knew what I wanted when I got here and boy, they did not disappoint.

We were quickly seated in a very small corridor with no windows so it felt like we were sectioned off from the rest of the place and customers. Now, you must be thinking thats a bad thing but one of the biggest gripes customers have with this place is that everyone is seated so closely together that its hard to have an intimate conversation we appreciated that even more so when we saw a couple who had to sit next to a table of rowdy drunk guys.

We ordered the mussels grill plate and the bone-in filet mignon. I forgot how much I love mussels until we had this big platter of mussels in front of us and we finished it way too quickly that we almost didn't have enough room for the filet mignon. Good thing I have a separate stomach for meat lol.

Food Highlight: The Mussels platter and the bone-in Filet Mignon.
author: Rich L.

description:
I would give Bobo's a 4-5 star rating if I were only rating the crab and cocktails.  However Bobo's is known for good steaks and good service, which is why a 2-star rating is more appropriate.

I ordered a bone-in filet cooked medium, and received a completely rare steak.  To be fair, my dining partner got a fairly accurately cooked medium-rare bone-in filet.  So the chef cooked at least 50% of our steaks correctly.  After sending my cold-in-the-center steak back to be further cooked, it came back as a perfect medium.

The service was poor.  Our waitress would disappear for 30 minutes at a time, leaving us to ask other staff to retrieve her so that we could order another drink.  She didn't even show up to take our dessert order; we had to chase her down for that as well.  It's not a large restaurant so I have no idea why this was such an issue.

The other staff was very friendly and pleasant.  I'll give our waitress the benefit of the doubt--maybe she was having an off day.  But this is my experience nonetheless.
author: Dan H.

description:
This is an update to my previous post. I've had Alexander's twice and Bobo's still tops every steak house in the Bay Area. I am not factoring in cost, just flavor of steak and quality of service.

Boboquivari's continues to separate itself from the competition.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Menandro M.

description:
They were 35 minutes late seating us, even though we had a reservation.  The lobster soup was oily and the tiny chunks of lobster within were dry.  The crab was terrible, overcooked and dry.  You could only eat the largest parts of the legs, the rest were so overdone they stuck to the shell.   They really hammered it.   They burnt the garlic on top of the bread they served for the table. Why serve burnt bread? The steak was perfect medium rare and very tender, but it lacked salt and pepper.  The sprouts were too salty.  Nothing was in balance.  I brought a12 year old cabernet and asked for it to be decanted, but they didn't decant it properly so there was lots of sediment in both my glass and the decanter.  

On the bright side, the old Giants closer, Brian Wilson, sat directly next to us.  The service was good. Free valet parking.   Atmosphere lively and fun.  I just wish the food was better.
author: John D.

description: Everything about this place is fantastic. The design and layout is a little odd, but the food and customer service really makes up for it. Bone in filet mignon steak is aged and is the best I have ever had. Cooked perfectly, falls apart, you barely even need a knife. Our sides were all amazing also, we had modern mac, yams, baked potato, and bread. Had a drink at the bar, it was a margarita with black volcanic sea salt, quite tasty also.
author: Rosie G.

description:
I've been to most of the major steakhouses from Los Gatos to San Francisco, none hold a candle to the superb quality and flavor of Boboquivari. I came here with my friends to have a late Thanksgiving dinner. We had a party of 9 and we all just an an absolute wonderful experience here. They recommended the Filet Mignon with Bone In. Simply amazing. For a restaurant that isn't at a Michelin level, this place blew me away.

 Their goal isn't to please you with fancy service and beautiful decor, their mission is to take your taste buds, and slap them with rainbows and wonder. Blew your mind away with the best steaks the Bay Area has to offer. Even their sides were amazing. I have NEVER gone to a restaurant and enjoyed everything that was ordered. There's always that one thing that you go, "Ehh, that's alright." EVERYTHING WE HAD, WAS AMAZING!

We had the brussels sprouts, baked potato, and mushrooms. Simply amazing. The bar was great as well, all the drinks we had were fantastic. The wine was great and the waiter was superb. 

5 Stars!!! I WILL RETURN!!!

On a side note, I got really buzzed of the Cosmo, Mojito, and Red Wine so I ended up being really loud and I made this table of 4 request to be moved. To top off the sheer volume of my voice, I have an extremely fowl mouth so they probably learned some new cuss words sitting next to me for 3 minutes.
author: James N.

description:
Simply amazing.  I rang up a $200 bill with just my girlfriend and with only one drink each.  The double baked potato is to die for.  Thinking about the Brussels sprouts has my mouth watering.  Steak melts in your mouth.  This is in the top 3 restaurant list for me..no question.

Oh and the service is perfect.  They treat you like a dignitary!
author: Mike T.

description:
Boboquivari, that affable Italian clown, is the central theme of this elegant yet festive seafood and steak restaurant on Lombard. And since said clown is European, his antics are something more refined, more matured, than an equivalent American counterpart.

Likewise, Boboquivari's, with its chic interior and romantic lighting, isn't quite as stuffy as similar steakhouses in San Francisco. You'd be just as welcome here in casual clothing as you would in formal. The seating is spaced out in such a way that you wouldn't be interrupted by the offensive style choices of others, anyhow.

The food is quite spectacular. We had a giant 20-plus-ounce steak (to share, of course), mac and cheese, roasted cauliflower and the twice-baked potato. It was all perfect. The meat was charred on the outside but melt-in-your-mouth within. The potato was huge and very flavorful.

And for dessert, we had a cheesecake made with mascarpone which may have been the best cheesecake I've ever had in my life. It wasn't too sweet, and it was the perfect balance of light and creamy. Served around it were Bobo Cones (I was told), ice cream cone ends filled with rich chocolate mousse inside.

Cocktails: great. Food: superb. Ambience: magical.

But what makes Boboquivari's truly special are the staff. Everyone I met here was incredibly friendly and full of smiles. The owner, Andrea, is an expert at telling fun stories, and he isn't shy with making new friends. I also found Jennifer incredibly sweet and charming. She was definitely something else...

Boboquivari's celebrates its tenth anniversary in August 2013, complete with a new lounge next door called Bobo's Lounge. Hard to imagine that I just learned of the place a month ago. I will return!
author: Keane L.

description:
This was a very good dining experience.

We arrived a bit before our reservation time.  BTW - they are on Opentable.com.    

The restaurant was very busy.  We were quickly greeted by the hostess. to confirm our reservation.  Soon after, we were sitting at the bar enjoying a pre-dinner drink.  Just as we finished our first drink, we were told our table was ready.

We were given a two top in the back corner.  It was cozy and comfortable.  I must say the ambiance is not traditional for a steak and seafood place.  It felt more like a neighborhood Italian restaurant   The walls were dark red.  There were lots of nick-knacks.  It was very dark.  I really liked it. 

It really has a vibe that everyone in the restaurant is just enjoying a great meal.  There were smiles everywhere.

Throughout our meal, the service was excellent.  Our server was friendly, professional. polite, and helpful.

Now, on to the food.

To start, we decided on the sizzling platter with mussels and shrimp.

For sides, we selected mac & cheese and the Swiss chard.  

After discussing it with the server, she selected the filet mignon bone-in.

I selected the porterhouse.

Iron Roasted Skillet with Mussels and Shrimp

First up, we ate it all.  It was very good.  Ok, it was hot sizzling heaven on a iron skillet.  Mmmm, garlic.  The mussels were great.   The shrimp was fantastic.  It was hot.  It was sizzling.  There was butter sauce.  There was bread.

http://tinyurl.com/6s3xdwu

Baked garlic & olive sourdough loaf

We loved the bread.  We almost ate the whole loaf.  Once again, there was lots of garlic.   It went so well with the sizzling hot seafood.

The steaks

Here again, we both thoroughly enjoyed our steaks.   They had such a great outer sear on their steaks.  They were cooked to a perfect medium rare.  The quality of the meat was top notch.  Her filet was super thick.  I was a bit envious.  But, I can not complain, my porterhouse was amazing.

http://tinyurl.com/85r7gd4

Mac n Cheese

This was very creamy.  However, it could use a little more of a sharpness or zip  to it.  Hey I have an idea, why not add some bacon?  Plus, I thought that the portion was on the small side for a shared side.

Swiss Chard

Bring on some more garlic.  I have to say this was some of the best Swiss Chard that I've eaten.

Overall - The service was great.  The ambiance is comfy and festive.  The  food was top-notch.  This is now definitely one of my favorite places in San Francisco to enjoy a steak.
author: Mark D.

description:
If I could say one thing, it's that this place's star is the steak. Not surprising considering it's known as one of the best steak houses in SF. Other than that, everything was mediocre. 

Our server was rushed and not very attentive. He didn't bring out the bread until we were 15 minutes in, and after he dropped it off, he didn't ask us if we would like to order, just rushed into his little speech about how Bobo's filet mignon is award winning (I swear he spoke 120 words per second). 

After that he left us waiting and hungry until we finally got to order. He seemed frazzled.

I got the filet mignon and a side of swiss chard. The filet mignon was to die for. It melted in your mouth and it was easily the best steak I have ever dreamt of. Usually filet mignon's aren't as tender and flavorful, but I would've sworn that steak was the greatest thing I've ever tasted. The flavor really made up for the service and the weird circus decor (it seemed like I was in some 19th century circus house, dark, creepy, and looked dirty). 

The swiss chard was good, nothing memorable but it paired well with the steak. 
I would come here again just because that steak was good, but I wouldn't sit upstairs in the dining area again (it seriously looked like inside of a circus tent, and with three parties it got way too loud). 

Go for the steak! Try not to get too distracted by the smell/clowns everywhere.
author: Sarah Y.

description: my girl and i celebrated our anniversary here. the steaks were huge! We ordered two plates but could not finish them. Great foods and wonderful service too!
author: Klark X.

description:
Vacationing for New Years in San Francisco with my husband we wanted a nice steakhouse to celebrate. Stumbled across this hidden gem on yelp. The staff was extremely nice. the food was what I would expect from a 4 star steakhouse, delicious. Order the filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection Medium. The sides don't really feed 2 people it's more 1 per person. 
I would recommend for a nice outing.
author: Letty M.

description:
It was a pleasant 1st time experience at Bobo's! 
My husband and I celebrated our 10yr wedding anniversary here and it did not disappoint. 
For starters we ordered the Combo, which had mussels, crab and shrimp!  It was fantastic. Finger-licking fckn GOOD! My only complaint, which is my only reason I knocked off a star, was the mussels were so TINY! So fckn SMALL! But the seafood was cooked to deliciousness and the 2 dipping sauces topped off the goodness! 
My husband order the bone-in filet mignon and I had petite bone-in filet mignon! It was melt in your mouth orgasmic! No chewing required, that shit literally melted in your mouth. Highly reccommended.

For sides we had:

Twice Baked potato: it was just good, nothing that really stood out. It had bits of diced zucchini in it! But half a potato for $9, I'll pass next time, I can do without.

The Mod Mac: it was good, the crispness they put on top was good, not as cheesy as I expected it to be, a tad bland but w/a little salt it was good. 

Brussel Sprouts: I really liked. Vague garlic taste, but the crisp bacon bits was the kicker.

Since I'm such a 'bread' person, I have to admit I was excited for their complimentary olive-garlic bread - BUT it was hella hard, like a loaf of croutons. Glad that shit was free.

Overall, we'll be back!!
author: Sarah N.

description: Excellent steak, I had the petite filet mignon and it was the perfect portion.  The sauteed mushrooms were awesome too but really really buttery.  I would recommend the mussels (you get A LOT!) as an appetizer, and their bread is pretty darn amazing as well.  I didn't care too much for the mac n cheese though, nothing too special about it really.  Service could have been a little bit quicker (it took like 20 minutes to get our bill since we were tucked into a small corner near the entrance).  I would vote this place over Houstons or Maestros simply because it's more affordable without the frou frou environment, and it's quality meat.  The bf had the aged bone in filet which he thoroughly enjoyed as well.  Both cuts were cooked perfectly to our liking.  The decor is a bit daunting with all the clowns and red/black but I think I would come back if I ever was in the area and craved a perfectly cooked steak.
author: Julie L.

description:
Bobo's is a smaller, quaint steakhouse adorned with eclectic style mardi gras decor against deep burgundy reds under dramatic accent lighting.  The assorted accessories throughout make for some interesting scenery.  Despite the close quarters, the friendliness of the hostess, bartender and other staff make it a welcoming place.

Now for the eats...  The lobster crostini arrived with fresh garlic aioli avocado & red onions and burrata (Italian cheese made with mozarella and cream).  It was a delectable little starter bursting with fresh flavors.  (Ultimately, I enjoyed this more than the main course.)  Their entrees are fairly large, so my bf and I decided to split the bone-in filet mignon which neither of us had recalled seeing on a menu before.  The filet is usually served without the bone.  It arrived with a soft, juicy palatable texture which melted in our mouths.   For sides, we indulged in brussels sprouts with pancetta and portobello mushrooms- both of which were average.  The brussel sprouts could have been a little greener to retain fresher flavors.  I'm not big on eating veggies cooked to a more yellowish green.  The portobello mushrooms were decent but nothing incredible to rave about.

The service here was wonderful and attentive.  Overall the food was acceptable but nothing superbly special justifying the exorbitant prices.  Valet parking is free which is a nice amenity but ultimately, the fat bill at the end of the night justifies the compliments.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Don't get me wrong the steak was great. I got a bone-in filet mignon. The quality of the meat was amazing. It was a little more rare than I am used to but the steak was so darn good I didn't even care. I also ordered the swiss chard which was meh and the crab cakes which everyone was raving about. It was just okay. I feel like the crab cakes appetizer was too dry with the cranberries on the bottom. If there was a sauce or something that evened out the crab cakes it couldve been much much better. 

The decor sucks. It's dim and a little dingy.... not sure how that would make a steakhouse appealing at all. 

they have complimentary valet parking which is nice. 

Overall for what you're paying for it's not totally worth it. I'd rather get steak somewhere else for that price range or even pay more for a little better quality and a better ambiance.
author: Gabrielle B.

description:
If you like good meat this is your place!  I had the bone-in filet and my wife had the bone-in New York!  But very flavorful!  Maybe we can get a group together and try the 49oz Porterhouse next time!  haha!  

The sides were delicious too!  The twice baked potato was excellent and the onion rings were perfect!  I love crispy rings and these were extra crispy!  Exceeded expectations!  I could eat those all day, but my doctor would cringe!  But I can do decadence once in a while and this was that day!

Oh, the mussels and shrimp appetizer was very good too.  The sauce they provided with it was awesome!

The place is smallish but the service is very good.  Before dinner we had a quick drink at the bar and the bar tender was very cool and personable.  

As for dessert, the selections looked good but their sister lounge (Bobo's Lounge) up the street had a better selection.  So we hit that place up.  Overall, an excellent!  experience all around.

That was fun, let's go again!
author: Gary L.

description:
The best steak place I have ever gone to in San Francisco.  Great date place!  Very intimate setting.  Great wine list and great service.  I ended up ordering the Combo Iron skillet (crabs, mussels and shrimps) for our appetizers.  Delicious. We got a little messy with the crab :)  I think next time I will just order the mussels. 

New York Bone-In strip was amazing!  Super juicy and large portion.  The steak sauce on top was the perfect touch. 

Overall, I really enjoyed coming to this place!
author: Ying F.

description:
I just came from a great dinner from Bobo's.  When we arrived at 6, we got a table on the 2nd floor.  The decor of the restaurant is cross between the Striphouse (NY/Vegas) and Ruth's Chris.  I thought I was at a Cirque du Soleil event with the red walls filed with clown pics......very swanky but cool.   For dinner, I had the Lobster Soup, Bone-in NY Steak, sides of Mac and Cheese, Yams and Mushrooms.  For desert, I had the Mango Panna Cotta.

The Soup and Garlic Loaf Bread were outstanding.  The Soup was full of flavor and the warm bread was excellent!  A great start.

The NY Steak was prepared a perfect medium-rare!  A bold, rich taste...outstanding, one of the best NY Strips that I have ever had.

The sides were good.....but  came in very small portions....more a single serving than for sharing.

The Mango Panna Cotta was an excellent desert......very, very  refreshing, a great way to end the meal.

The service was excellent......Overall, a great meal.....I loved the Steak and the Panna Cotta.   I will be back!
author: Raider J.

description:
I brought my fiancé here for his 28th birthday and we were seated in an extremely tiny booth upstairs with a table that barely fit all the food we ordered. We were surrounded by several parties of really loud business men, which did not really set the romantic mood that I read about in the reviews. (I wish we were seated downstairs where all the rest of the couples seemed to be!) Unfortunately there was only one server we noticed who covered all the parties in the entire upstairs area. I enjoyed the ambiance of Bobo's, it was very dark with lovely chandeliers and candle holders. Parking is a bit difficult so I recommend using their valet parking service. 

As for the food, I loved the warm fresh complimentary bread that I could not stop eating. We started off with the hamachi carpaccio which was light and refreshing. We ordered the bone in filet mignon, the crab and muscles platter, the bacon and brussel sprouts, and the twice baked mash potatoes. The meat was juicy and tender, but lacked flavor. The crab and muscles came out sizzling on a great big platter, but they too lacked flavor. I had to "chase" our entrees with the sides in order to keep my palate entertained. The desserts we ordered were definitely just "meh". 

Great portions, but I expected the meal to knock my socks off because the pictures of the food blew me away! I do recommend you to give it try if you like steak and seafood and hopefully you will have a better experience.
author: Joy N.

description: Most violent food poisoning ever. But the worst part is their lack of responsiveness and how they treat their customers. Ordered the bone in prime rib, medium well. It was served bloody and tasted off. I should have sent it back, but was with clients. The next day was stricken with the worst food poisoning ever. Called the restaurant to ask if they had similar issues. The woman did not answer my question, but said she would have the manager call me back. No word until I called back a few days later and spoke to Jim; this is after also sending an email. Expressed that I should not have to pay for a meal that made me so sick and caused me to miss work and several meetings. While my bill was 1,400 (not inc the bar tab) for 9 people, all I wanted was for them to make up for my situation and said I did not expect them to comp the entire meal as that would not be fair. Jim said he had to speak to the manager, and would call me the next day. After over a week of several attempts to reach Jim, I finally was able to reach him last night. He became argumentative and said there was no way for me to prove it was their restaurant that made me sick! I have been a loyal customer for years and the way they treated me was incredulous. I will never go back here again. BEWARE.
author: Debbie S.

description: Just like everyone says, get the bone in filet mignon! Also get the dungeness grab, shrimp and mussel skillet. AMAZING. So garlicky and it comes out sizzling hot.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Mostly I'm giving this joint 4 stars for the service and the free valet parking!

The food was good without a doubt, but it was definitely over priced. I ordered one of the crab crostini appetizers and it came with 2 tiny little crostini and that was $25. I ordered a petite size fillet and it was burnt on both sides..like so burnt i had to scrape it off.. but the inside was good and cooked the way i like it. I don't know, it just wasn't gourmet food. I could have made those crostini in my kitchen. 

the service was top notch! we took a pretty long time to order everything, even the drinks, and our server still kept coming to check on is and he was totally patient and sweet. so were the food and drink runners. the host was also incredibly sweet. 
don't know if i would come back...but it was a good experience overall.
author: Jess C.

description:
Amazing steak: juicy, flavorful, perfectly cooked.

Amazing twice baked potato: huge, delicious.

Great ambience: fun, dark, unique experience.

Great service: friendly, attentive, fast.
author: Jason T.

description:
This is a long overdue review.  It's from our visit 12/23/2012.

Not only was my filet cooked to a perfect medium rare, but service (Jorge C) was AMAZING!! We received our wine, steaks and sides all in a timely manner, and the taste of everything left us wanting more. Unfortunately, there was a customer two tables away complaining and even threatened him, going so far as to say she'll have him fired over a steak not cooked to medium. Medium? Her negative energy was spreading throughout the small dining room and other tables were giving her looks. She knew she was making a scene and couldn't care one bit as she continued even as she walked out of the restaurant.

NOTE TO THE RESTAURANT: Jorge was accommodating to the customer - apologizing, seeing what else he could do to help make her night better. But her response was "There's nothing you can do... I've been here over a hundred times in the past five years.." My opinion, her attitude matched her overall look that evening - ugly.

Overall, the ambiance is very intimate - lighting is dim, and you will be sitting quite close to your dinner date. But know you will be taken care of by the wait staff, and your steaks will be cooked to a perfect medium rare.
author: Mogi D.

description: This use to be the top flight steak house in SF, not so much anymore. Service went down hill, sides are less flavorful and the quality of meat is either not as good or just not cooked as well. Word is new ownership took over; definitely for the worse. Original ownership opened Osso steakhouse.
author: Sean R.

description: The place is nice. But the food is less than OK. I was expecting better. I've been to less expensive steak houses and had way better ribeye than bobos. When we arrived i let the host know we had  reservations, so he said "ok great let me see if your table is ready." he goes and checks comes back and sits us no where near where he went to go check. Oh and to top it off he sat us next to the entrance in front of where they grab plates and silverware a very unpleasant sound of plates hitting each other every time they came and grabbed any.. I say save your money go somewhere else bobos I over rated. It must of been great at once but not no more sorry.
author: Rene R.

description:
I bought a shirt at banana republic before I came here, because I looked like a homeless person. My girlfriend didn't compliment the shirt. 
As for the food, it was ok, a bit on the salty side.
author: Ben Z.

description:
So disappointing - our last visit was so good but the recent visit didn't live up to it...bummer.  

The valet is still a big plus.  On a Wednesday night, we were surprised to find them full.  We waited at the bar and decided to get a bottle of wine.  After narrowing it down to three, we seeked the bartender's input - he recommended the Quixote '03 cab ($89).  Medium body - it was good, smooth.

What we had:
yellowtail carpaccio 14.95 - with diced chilies & olive oil ponzu sauce.  too much ponzu sauce, can't taste the fish.  maybe just as well, a couple slices tasted fishy

lobster crostini - $14.95 - with garlic aioli avocado & red onions served with burrata.  the burrata is heaven, very fluffy light yet very rich and creamy.  The lobster crostini was delicious - my favorite dish of the night.

filet mignon bone-in - $39.95 - asked for medium rare but it was more medium to medium well.  We didn't want to send it back since a lady at another table was complaining and sending her steak back all night, ruining it for everyone else who sat near her including us.

iron skillet roasted shrimp - $15.95 - the shrimps are so small (41-50 size at best?) and it was way too oily.

side order of brussel sprouts - $8.95 - soggy and salty

dunce cap cones - $8.95 - filled with dark chocolate mousse
over ancho chili pepper chocolate sauce.  it's ok.

Have yet to fulfill my steak craving...search continues...
author: Gloria H.

description: A tourist joint. Great bar, but otherwise - steak quality not great, service spotty, prices high.
author: jeff s.

description:
I decided to come here for a celebration dinner with my boyfriend because I told him about how great of a place this was when I went with my girlfriends. Although we got to Bobo's earlier than our reservation date (free valet!), we were seated immediately. 

My boyfriend and I ordered cocktails to start, I got a sex on the beach and he got a dirty martini. 

After receiving our drinks, we ordered appetizers.I LOVE their crab cakes. This is probably one of the main reasons I do come to Bobos (....free valet!!!!!!). The cranberries that come with the appetizer is to die for. I could eat a whole tub of those things. The crab cakes never disappoint me, EVER!!!! If you come to Bobos and do not order them, you are definitely missing out. Along with the crab cakes, my boyfriend ordered the lobster soup. It was mediocre, maybe because I am not a fan of American soups (they are often drenched with sodium and just do not taste appetizing to me). He loved it, and even dipped some of the complimentary bread into the soup (which he liked as well).

I ordered the double order of mussels and he ordered the filet mignon without the bone as our entrees. The mussels were okay, I ordered shrimp here before and was not very satisfied. Yes, Boboquivari's is a steakhouse, but that does not mean that the seafood has to taste strange. I tried a piece of the boyfriend's filet mignon and it was SO good. I normally am not a beef eater but I LOVED it! It just melted in your mouth and definitely made my taste buds dance.

The service was great as always, the waiters are extremely nice (which wouldn't be any less from a restaurant like this). 

I will definitely be back here not just for a special occasions but probably when I just crave to eat some good crab cakes.
author: Ann Z.

description:
First time at Bobo's. We came here to celebrate on a special occasion. We wanted to reserved a table 2-3 weeks prior to get an early time. Every single date we mentioned, all they have available is 9:30pm. It's for a table of 11. We were wondering, why so late at 9:30pm?! That's left over meat for us and the chef probably wants to go home. 

Anyhoo, we got there by 9:30pm and the place was weirded out. The entrance is off to the side. Felt awkward. It was too dark inside. Saw the bar and didn't know where the host was. Finally the hostess took us upstairs to our table. Ohhh, no wonder they reserved us at 9:30pm. It's because the restaurant is hecka small. Not too many tables. 

Got our menus and yes, it's expensive. Not too much on the menu. I got the bone-in filet mignon with baked potato. I loved the baked potato. So velvety good. I also took a sample of other dishes at the table. The macaroni & cheese was very good. And so is the crab cakes. The filet mignon was delicious. Moist & tasty. Seasoned just right. It's actually one of the best filet mignon I've had. Huge portion. I couldn't finish it because it was too stuffy inside the dining area. The dining room upstairs is so small & boxy. All 4-5 tables were filled up in the tiny room. I was feeling hot, nauseated and feel like fainting mid-way thru. Had to get up and stretch for some fresh air outside. Usually I don't box my steak to go but this time, I had to. I'm glad I brought it home because my left over was even more delicious. 

I would've rated a 4 star but since I've never experienced a dining room so small with no air ventilation & 9:30pm reservation, had to give it a 3 star rating. This place is meant for a party of 4 or less due to the small tables. Didn't enjoyed it as much as I would have like to.
author: Amy H.

description:
We came here for my bfs birthday!! The restaurant is very small but it is decorated very nicely. We were seated in this cute little booth with curtains and drapery around. All of the food came in the perfect order, sizzling hot and delicious. 

-Lobster Crostini: absolutely delicious with actual big chunks of lobster on top of a crispy crackers with other toppings arranged with it.
-Iron roasted skillet (combo mussels, shrimp & crab): came sizzling hot and fresh on a big platter of seafood. the candle was lit underneath to keep it hot and there was a bowl placed underneath for us to place the shells. it came with some sauces which blended nicely with the fresh, hot seafood. very fun to eat and you gotta use your fingers!
-super bone-in filet: VERY GOOD, VERY TASTY. one of the BEST filet mignon i have ever tried out of all steakhouses (which include mastro, ruth chris, flemings, etc.). Very juicy because the bone is still attached to the filet mignon. they are famous and popular for their filet mignon so make sure you get the bone-in!!! definately worth the money
-Twice-baked potato: if you love carbs with your meat, then definately try this. it is a great compliement to the steak, especially the bone-in filet mignon. 
-Dunce Cap Cones: their famous dessert. comes in a bunch of small, crispy waffle cones with some kind of smooth chocolate mousse inside. very yummy!
author: Cuc N.

description:
Main courses: 
Surf n turf, bone in NY, filet mignon

Sides:
Yam, baked potato, chard, mushrooms

Desert:
dunce cap cones, mango panna cotta

Drinks:
Old Fashioned

The first thing I noticed was the lack of ribeye on the menu. As a steak lover, this omission from the menu made me very sad. I settled for the NY strip. It was pretty disappointing. It was cooked to the wellness I asked for, the meat itself was just unimpressive. Lacked the flavor and tenderness I expect for a 45 dollar cut of meat. You probably want to stick with the filet mignon if you eat here, at least that was tender. The NY strip really is that uninspiring. 

The sides were all pretty good. Nothing bad to say about any of them. I especially enjoyed the mushrooms.

The old fashioned was served in a pretty lame glass. When you charge 11 dollars for a drink, I expect much better presentation. Looked like a bartender at TGI friday's made my drink. Please don't put a plastic straw in my drink, I'm not a 12 year old drinking cola. 

Desert was pretty decent. Neither the panna cotta or cones were worth 9 dollars. 

Free valet, always nice to have. Finding parking is actually not that hard around here, it's just a pain in the ass with all the constant traffic, one ways, no left turns, etc.

My overall impression: 
This place is vastly overrated. The steaks aren't that good. It's not really that much cheaper than eating at Harris up the street.  Maybe if you want to eat a steak in a more casual atmosphere you would come here.
author: Wes C.

description:
Divine. This place is Divine. 

My dining companion surprised me with a meal here last night. Upon entering I wasn't sure what to expect, I've driven past this place for years and expected to see a normal steakhouse inside, boy was I amazed and delighted by the decor! I love the Red walls with mish-mash and BEAUTIFUL decorations, it's playful and warm. 

We sat near the bar, without a reservation at around 7PM. We ordered drinks and my dining companion handled all the ordering in Spanish so I had no idea what was coming (what fun!).

Iron-Skillet Mussels & Shrimp ... YUM. When they brought out this steaming delight I was grinning Ear to Ear and upon first bite I think I died and went to heaven. The butter with lemon and garlic was a soft addition to the tender flavor of the mussel. Whatever they use to cook them in is also amazing (we tried to guess and came up with Worcestershire or Soy Sauce), I rather enjoyed dipping their AMAZING Garlic Bread on the iron skillet to soak up that crazy amazing flavor. 

Yellowtail Carpaccia ... WOW. They brought out a very beautiful dish, thinly cut yellowtail with diced chilies and minced chives in an amazing Ponzu Olive Oil.. MmmHmmm, If I didn't die eating the Iron Skillet I surely did with the yellowtail. This was amazing and complimented my slightly sweet drink very well.

The service was wonderful, FRIENDLY and polite staff, attentive even on a really busy evening (picked up around 8, the place was packed)

I really liked the fact that the bar seating near the window had hooks on the walls to put my purse, very nice and thoughtful touch.

They have free Valet Parking, defiantly take advantage of this as parking can be hassle. 

My biggest regret... that I didn't take photos of our dishes I was so enthralled with the amazing smells, decor and.. ok yea maybe my dining companion, that I completely forgot.. ah well, a good excuse to return!

We are planning on returning to try their steak soon! 

YUM!
author: Meghan L.

description: Best steak in the city and a totally great, fun ambiance. Love this place!
author: Jason H.

description:
JJ and I wanted a special steak place which also does seafood. As it's crab season, I thought Bobo's was a good choice, esp. as he loves it and I have never been. 

We were seated in an intimate little room off the main bar area. We were far enough from the other tables and the one right next to us was separated by a curtain. It was quite romantic, low lighting, soft music, etc. etc. 

Okay, okay, now to the food. We declined the appetizers and went straight for the main course - surf 'n' turf (petit filet and half a crab) for me and bone-in filet mignon for him. We added Mac 'n' Cheese (which was very good), the twice-baked potatoes (outstanding) and the pancetta brussel sprouts (good, but not the best I've ever had). Oh and great wine (I forget which one, but it was a Pinot). 

Our French waiter was lovely; he timed everything perfectly and was super friendly. We finished off with the chocolate bomb - there may have been some surreptitious plate-licking going on (blush). We left very happy and very full. 

Oh, and they have complimentary valet parking!
author: Mi M.

description: We went here for my roommate's birthday and loved it! Once you get past the mildly creepy clown decor, you get to enjoy wonderful service and absolutely delicious food. Robert, our server, was awesome and had great suggestions! Delicious cocktails, appetizers, seafood, and steaks.
author: Erin O.

description: I overall enjoyed the restaurant but the steak was not as amazing as I had expected. Great ambiance however ....just not sure I get the hype
author: Kameela A.

description:
This review is quite late, but none the less special for me.  My family and I took my Grandpa here for his Birthday last September--what we didn't realize was that it would be the last Birthday he'd spend with us.  

Grandpa has a huge passion for food and is a carnivore lover so Bobo's was a natural choice. We've done HOPR way too many times.

He always loved himself a good glass of Merlot, so Merlot it was for him. 
 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=tmD8wagYBuU1phDNo3ubww

I loved the sourdough bread that is served here--it's drizzled with oilve oil, and chopped garlic on top, so the juices seep in the middle of the bread.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=LIBNdWpYRtwnk3jrBMU6hA

We also started off with a variety of appetizers--the Crab Cakes, the Apple Walnut and Cranberry Salad, and the Iron Skillet Mussels. 

*The Crab Cakes were cooked to perfection, crispy on the outside, and a decent size thickness.  The cranberries were a great compliment of tartness. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=Itl9dScX1l4EGXLzKIPsQg
*The Apple Walnut and Cranberry Salad was so-so, I would've preferred a different type of lettuce other than ice berg and romaine.  It was drizzled with a raspberry vinaigrette. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=oSUvdcHXW4NY5qKwHRldfQ
*The Iron Skillet Mussels were pretty good, considering I'm not much of a seafood eater, but they were flavored well with the lemony garlic butter taste. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=JRQ9yt7EFxpe024xURLGvg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=RoNlhLgUYUuqfL1dX6MNIA

As far as the meat goes, I ordered myself the Petite Filet Mignon. Petite it definitely was, but it was so tender and juicy in the middle, and hardly required any energy to cut the center. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=JB7DUHy7yifkB5-Z73Goew
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=s7mXzQLP7AzhtZVk0gEEHg

Mom and Grandpa both ordered the Surf and Turf, which is Half a Crab and the Petite Filet Mignon. This is probably the best deal if you want a little of both.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=pvF8PnaFlzgkh1yqfTyLHg

For dessert we ordered the Pistachio Panna Cotta which was not so great. It looked yummy at arrival, but the texture was a bit paste-y.  And resembled a little bit of play-dough.  The pistachio flavor was definitely there. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=lTrMsSeCzM05Cn4Yh4Pazg

Overall, I enjoyed the meat, I would  I would recommend the Filet Mignon again for sure. 

Bobo's did a great job in helping us celebrate my Grandpas Birthday with us. He is a lover of food, and it's only fitting that his final Birthday before passing on would be at a Steak House.
author: Cass J.

description:
I came here with the fam to celebrate hubby's birthday. My husband been here a few times, first for me. The food
is great! service is on point! Bone in Ny steak was delish! porterhouse= yumm! filet mignon= yumm! my daughter ordered the seafood plate, she wasnt impressed. 
side dish= sweet potato and mac&cheese=yummm!
author: Eve W.

description:
Easily one of the better steakhouses in SF, but they aren't limited to just good steaks as the seafood here is exceptional as well.  As their signage states, "The Steak," "The Crab," and honestly both are a must order here so do yourself a favor and make sure you get steak and crab when you finally feel like doing something nice for yourself and dine here.

We sort of did it pretty big with our awesome little group -- delicious beef carpaccio and the hot and steamy crab, mussels, and shrimp platter to start.  As I mentioned above, the seafood section should not be ignored (it's San Francisco after all).  The crab was very flavorful as were the mussels which were perfectly cooked and had no hint of fishiness.  For the steaks we ordered the bone-in filets.  It's possible they would allow you to order a regular filet mignon sans bone-in, but I doubt they would recommend it if the bone-in is available.  It was an excellently cooked medium-rare steak and full of flavor, especially with the hot melted butter sauce it's served on.  I enjoyed every bite of mine and hers when she couldn't finish it all (it's a pretty hefty portion).  The sides were excellent as well -- the brussel sprouts and twice baked potato paired well with our steaks.  For dessert we shared the chocolate bomb which was a very nice and sweet finish to a very delicious and filling meal.

Friendly service and healthy pours of wine!  

We finished the night off with a visit to their new spot, Bobo's Lounge (adjacent to Bobo's, just up the hill), which was really quite awesome.  A very well decorated and ornate interior with obvious Venetian inspiration, but also had a comfortable and casual atmosphere.  I'm looking forward to going back and trying some of the food which is very different from Bobo's menu.

4.5 stars.
author: Erich D.

description:
Went to this restaurant on Saturday for my GFs birthday, and was skeptical at first about this steakhouse, which I had not heard of. After about 15 minutes, I was impressed by this restaurants decor, and service. Our waiter was very friendly and offered his expertise and advice on every dish. We both ordered bone in filet, and lobster crusto? as well as some portobella mushrooms to have on the side of our steak. Though the lobster appetizer was small, it was incredible. Tender, tasty, and with a side of cheese that I have never had before. I was very happy after the lobster, and was enjoying it with the wine I ordered. 

On to the steak. This was a steak like I have not ever had before. I have had some great steak, and this definitely joins the pack. The filet was grilled perfectly, and the top was seared and glazed with a sauce that was delicious but not too sweet. I thought it was perfect.

We sort of rushed out, because we were meeting with some friends after, but next time I go here, I would like to hang out for some time, have a few more drinks, and suck up the ambiance.
author: Rick B.

description:
The ONLY reason I'm not giving Bobo's five stars is because the decor gave me vertigo. While I get the whole "Venetian Jester" theme, I'm not sure I understand why EVERY WALL has to be checkered. 

But the food was freaking fantastic, and the service was even better than that. I followed the mainstream and went with the bone-in filet and was incredibly glad I did - the filet was so tender it practically melted in my mouth! And it was delicious the next morning (I couldn't even wait until lunch to eat the leftovers).
author: Tori D.

description:
For me, this was steak heaven!  The bone in fillet was better than I remember and the dry aged New York was fantastic... both steaks had a delicious crust and arrived perfectly cooked.  We split the heirloom tomatoes with the burrata for our appetizer... the burrata was creamy and enticing.  We were starving, so we chose several sides... my favorite was the portabello mushrooms and a close second was the decadent modern mac and cheese... super rich and creamy.

The service was doting and amicable.  We arrived with a bottle of wine, which the hostess promptly stored for us while we waited for our table to be ready.  Also, the hostess took our coats as we were getting seated - which I thought was a nice touch.  Our waitress did a great job; she was knowledgeable and friendly.

All around, a great experience from the food to the service.
author: Scott P.

description: Bone-in Filet Mignon was incredible. Our waitress, Michelle, was a total delight. But the new manager, Kent, decided to end years of 80's music tradition here and deny all of our music requests. C'mon Kent, get it together. Play the jams. The four stars are because of the steaks and Michelle being awesome, but Kent took the whole thing down a notch.
author: nate b.

description:
Am I missing something here? Of all the awesome restaurants to eat in the Bay Area, people go out of their way to come to Bobo's... really? Don't get me wrong, I've had worse meals. But I really don't get what all the fuss is about. 

First of all, the service left much to be desired. Everyone from the hostess at the front to the bartender seemed less-than-thrilled to be waiting on our group. Yes, we were showered and didn't look like homeless people, so I know it wasn't us. It also took forever and a day to get our table - and yes, we had a reservation. 

Once seated, our waitress did a nice job of explaining the menu and was by far the friendliest staff member that we encountered. By by then, I was tired and hungry and didn't really care so much. 

Everything on the menu is pretty pricey, so why not order the surf and turf? If I ever went back, I'd stick to the turf. The steak practically melts in your mouth. Probably one of the best pieces of meat that I've ever had. The surf? Not so much. Good crab doesn't need to be cooked with rosemary... All it needs is some butter (maybe some garlic), nothing else fancy.  

For what the meal cost, it probably wasn't worth it. But hey, that's just my humble opinion. Great steak, but not *that* awesome.
author: Abby S.

description:
Great steak, amazing garlic bread and delicious roasted, garlicky crab.

What's even better? COMPLIMENTARY VALET PARKING. Like, does this even exist at all?

Crostini is ok and overpriced. Would advise against.
author: Nanette W.

description:
So tender I don't see how the cow could even walk... seriously, you could gum this steak down. I usually get the bone-in filet, a cut they are very proud of; and they should be because its done extremely well.

The sides - gotta do Brussels sprouts! I also really recommend the chard; it's nice and acidic which helps counteract all the other rich stuff you're putting down.
author: Mike J.

description:
First time at Bobo's with my wife last night.  The bone-in filet is definitely quite good, in the upper tier of any filet I have had.  Despite my doubts that cooking a steak with a bone gives it more flavor, it did seem to be a bit more tasty than my wife's filet sans bone.  Steaks 5 stars

Service 5 stars, moved our table when asked and servers were fantastic with recommendations and overall attitude.

Ambience 5 stars - like the music and decor, definitely a unique place worth checking out.

Sides/placesettings - 2 stars.  It could have been what we ordered, but the heirloom tomato appetizer with burrata and avocado was not great, bordering on blah.  Ordered brussel sprouts and twice baked potato which were just ok, maybe too much salt or seasoning...we would definitely order something different next time.  Final thing which is a bit odd but thought I would mention, all side dishes and appetizers came with normal sized forks for serving...a bit awkward when you're trying to plate chopped up sprouts or small tomatoes.
author: Adrian B.

description:
Settings: Fathers Day Sunday, 2013. 

I actually enjoyed the evening here. The service was amazing, the waiter was very attentive and came by often to check up. Since I drink water like a fish, he filled my glass often which was kind and he really didn't have to.

The meat was good, cooked just right. I had the Surf and Turf which was basically a "petite filet mignon and crab legs". I have my meat "medium-rare"  and again, cooked just right. The crab was also delicious (It was as good as Crustaceans SF BUT it does have a different flavor and taste which I can't put my finger on). For the sides, twice baked potatoes, brussels sprouts, and the sautéed mushrooms. Everything was delicious and flavorful.

Total bill for six (split amongst 5): $85 bucks. Not too bad (Cheaper then when we took my dad to Harris Steak House up the street for his bday). Only difference, BOBO's has great service, free valet, good food. It's worth it. I'd probably take a date here one of these days because it's such a chill, relaxing setting for two IMO.
author: Roger C.

description:
Vibe: A circus clown's brothel. 
We laughed off the cracked window pane and the fly on it by the front booths

Price: Expensive

Service: OK

Parking: Free valet

Bathrooms: Not good. Three individual bathrooms. One downstairs that requires a wait. And two up stairs.

Wine List: Nothing great. Ojai Syrah $39 best buy. Light, tight, austere

Table Bread: it looked great but it turned out to be a flavorless Pullman loaf with fresh roasted garlic.

Food:
The bone in filet mignon $51, was one of the best I ever ate. Quality beef
The crab cakes were over fried and burned. $15, Horrible
The onion rings $8, were over fried and burned. Horrible
The swiss chard ($9) looked as old as it tasted and was overly salty
The portobello mushrooms ($9) were cubed and overly salty

WIGB? This was a tough one. The filet was so good. But if I add up the entire experience, no. P
author: Hungry K.

description:
Went here on a recommendation.  It didn't disappoint.  

We started with the yellowtail carpaccio, then moved on to the ridiculous 14 oz bone in filet.  Had a twice baked potato for a side.  It was all fantastic.

Great ambience, off the beaten path a little, awesome martinis.

Short walk to a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.

Hope you like it.

Almost forgot about the bread, wow....
author: Kyle J.

description:
Finally gave Bobo's a try after hearing so many good reviews/things about it. I made reservations on the same day a few hours before arriving and shockingly they had multiple spots open. Can't go wrong with complimentary valet.

What we ordered:
Yellowtail Carpaccio
Iron-Skillet Roasted Mussels, Shrimp, & Crab
Bone-in Filet Mignon
Twice-Baked Potato

Don't come here expecting a fine dining experience as their ambiance and service are not to par. DO come here for the the dry aged bone-in filet. Usually I'm not a big fan of filet mignon as it's too lean for my taste, but Bobo's cut was perfect. Seasoned and seared to perfection. The rest of the food was not too memorable and regarding their crab the gf bluntly stated that Thanh Long's is much better.

Their portion sizes are quite large and admittingly I no longer have a black hole of an appetite like back in the college days, we had leftovers at the end of the evening. Filet for lunch the next day, check. Another day's paycheck gone, double check.
author: Danny C.

description:
Are we at the carnival? Definitely a weird circus theme that I was not expecting and didn't really make sense... but hey, I guess that's what the owner is into? 

The food is amazing here. 

Starters:
Grilled Shrimp
Tuna Carpaccio

Main Course:
Bone-In Filet Mignon
*A pretty big cut. I originally wanted to go with the petite filet but the server advised the bone-in really is the best cut. I had a lot leftover but it made for a great dinner the next night too!

Dessert:
Nothing looked good. I'd pass on dessert and go elsewhere.

They put us in a private closet sized area that felt a bit dark and stuffy at first but ended up being a nice dining experience. Next time I'd put in a special request to sit in the dining area with windows.
author: CL S.

description:
Wow. I can't believe I still haven't written a well-deserved reveiw... so here it is.  

Here's what you should try: 

-Bone in filet mignon medium rare (it is crucial you get medium rare for that awesome melt in your mouth softness!)
-Brussel sprouts with pancetta
-Swiss chard with garlic and olive oil

I quite like the complimentary olive bread and look forward to it during each visit. There was a period of time where I was coming here once a month because my friend and I would just crave for the bone in filet mignon. 

I've tried the surf and turf. This is a good choice for someone who isn't too sure if they want to just have crab or just filet mignon (but just know it isn't bone in). The petite filet mignon doesn't satisfy my cravings so I always opt for the bone in filet mignon. 

You don't have to make reservations but if you have a large party, I do highly recommend it. If you're around in the area and want to satisfy a steak craving, you can make reservations via opentable.com or just give the restaurant a call. I always ask to be seated upstairs (there are three levels, though the restaurant isn't that big) because you have the windows to look out and it's not as dim/dark as the other two floors.

Oh and if you really care about SF politicians, Mayor Ed Lee was dining here one time when my friend and I had a random steak craving.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
So far, our go-to for steak in the Bay.

- Kooky atmosphere 
- Warm welcome and non-intrusive service
- Bone-in filet mignon medium-rare is a must
- Twice-baked potato and bread are my favorites

Minus one star since we were served cold yams, which was a an unwelcome notice that the side dishes are not made fresh. The steak makes up for it though.
author: Janett R.

description:
Visited Frisco on my honeymoon in December and heard from some friends that this is the spot for steaks. I gotta say that the ambiance on the interior is not what I was expecting. Its kinda like a mix between Mardi Gras and Circus Vargas. We were seated in a booth on the top floor but unfortunately something had gotten burned in the kitchen and made its way up to the top floor. The whole dining experience was engulfed in that crappy burnt smoke that was hard to ignore. They have a bone in rib eye on the menu that I felt I must try since thats what I fancy, the wife had their accredited bone in filet. We shared the twice baked potato which was delicious and also the lobster mac. The rib eye was good but definitely not worth the price tag but the filet was very good. This is obviously their staple.
I wouldn't be opposed to visiting again but would definitely get the filet next time or even venture off to try another spot all together.
author: Eric H.

description:
poor service; cheesy, dated interior; mediocre cocktails; raw and cold "medium rare" steak; lackluster sides; expensive

and i used to genuinely like this place (years ago)
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Bobo's had one of the juiciest and most delicious steaks I've ever eaten. We ordered the bone-in filet and it came out more rare than I expected it to be, but it was so meltingly tender I didn't even notice. No sauce required. I only wish I was more hungry for this meal. My best friend and I made a huge mistake and ate a late lunch and had ice cream.....all before this glorious meal. 

I can't wait to come back and eat a fat juicy steak all by myself.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
The steak, portobello mushrooms, and mac n cheese was very good. The service was great, until we questioned a charge on our bill. Making sure we were charged for the right bottle of wine was not wrong in any way. We were charged double the price and wanted to double-check. The waiter was very defensive and answered us with "What do you want me to do? You drank the wine!" Is that an acceptable response? NO! That should never be an answer. SIMPLY bring the menu back and go over it together! He grabbed the menu, brought it over, and rudely told us, "the price you see is for 1/2 a bottle and you drank the whole bottle!" Okay, got it, we missed the little portion that states it's for 1/2 a bottle, no big deal! We assumed it was for a full bottle since the others were for that amount. We answered "Okay, we see that, sorry." His response: "Ah HA!!! (In your face, basically). 

That entire experience was just awkward. I don't know if it was an egotistic thing or his normal behavior, either way, it should be corrected. 

You won't catch me returning to this restaurant. None of their dishes were spectacular enough or couldn't be found at another steakhouse... with much better service.
author: Arinda P.

description:
After a full day exploring San Francisco, we decided to have a steak dinner at this establishment since it was reviewed pretty high by fellow Yelpers.

Valet is complimentary if you dine here, obviously. We were here on a Saturday night and didn't know that a reservation was needed but they seated us anyways since it was our first time.

The place was somewhat dark, but the decor was nice. We were seated on the 3rd floor, which was overlooking the street.

The server came by and took our drink order after we were seated for about 15 minutes or so. When he came back, we decided to place our order in. I had that New York steak (medium) with a side of Portobello Mushrooms, my friend had the Double Mussels & Crab, and her boyfriend had the Filet Mignon Bone In (medium rare).

They have complimentary bread that was served nice and hot. They don't cut it all the way through so you have to do that yourself and it can get messy. The olive oil is already on the bread so you don't have to dip the bread. The bread itself wasn't bad.

The New York steak was very flavorful and cooked just the way I wanted. I'm not sure if it was cooked with some type of sauce or it was the juices from the steak itself, but it was pretty damn good. The portobello mushrooms were excellent. Very, very flavorful. This dish was very enjoyable. Highly recommended.

My friends enjoyed their dishes as well. No complaints on the Filet Mignon or the mussels and crab.

Only downside, the server checked on us once and never again. He didn't refill any drinks either. I had to fill our own water glasses and the pitcher that it was in, was empty. The server only noticed when he walked by after an hour and was putting away extra glasses. Gotta knock out a star because of this.
author: Scott N.

description:
Best filet I've ever had. Bone in filet, medium rare. 
Atmosphere is great and the service was excellent. 
LOVE this place. My boyfriend and I compare all other steaks to this place now.
author: Becky O.

description: Hands down the best bone-in filet mignon I've ever had in my entire life!!!  I know this might sound exaggerating but I'm only stating the fact.  :P  Our server shared with us that Bobo's is voted #1 best steak house in San Francisco and #3 in the country not long after we sat down, definitely some high expectations to follow.  Corkage fee is $15 which is very reasonable considering almost every restaurant in the city now charges $20-$25 in general.  I literally have not had something THIS good and every expectation is overwhelmingly exceeded!!!  I agree with most people who recommend the bone-in filet mignon because this is a MUST TRY entree.  Truthfully, I would like to go back again like this week already.  :P  It really is THIS great.  :D :D :D
author: Vicky H.

description:
I was extremely let down by my experience here for my birthday dinner. The waitress was very inattentive to our table of 2, we were there for 2 hours and only saw her twice. 

I ordered their award winning bone-in filet mignon medium and they served it to me well-done and my girlfriend ordered the filet mignon medium-well and they served it very rare. 

After about 20 minutes we actually had to flag the waitress down because she never checked on our table, and their solution to serving an bloody rare steak was to put it back on the grill, which is a health code violation. 

I spoke to the manager about the poor service and his only response was " you should have let us put the steak back on the grill." 

After spending almost $170 for 2 steaks, 2 drinks, and one side I expected more from this restaurant. Neither the food or the service was superb and I will never go back.
author: Andrew R.

description: Well let me start by saying the steak and crab are delicious. The service null and void.  I came here for my birthday had always wanted to try this place ; definitely not a good service experience.  They give you tiny glasses for water and barely refill them and do not clear plates or check on you. Tacky low class service for the prices they charge . After all of this I returned home definitely not a place to spend your special day .
author: Athena C.

description: It has been some time since I've been to this restaurant, and this evening's service over the phone would give me pause. I found out a dear friend of mine was now working at Bobo's and I wanted to find out her schedule to come see her. Robert told me "I don't have the schedule, can't tell you" when I said this is a friend of mine, I still got I don't have the schedule. If you would like business, and you have someone calling asking for a server's schedule, you think a little extra effort could be afforded. Not sure I'll be stopping by. With so many places in SF to choose from, again, a little extra effort goes a long way.
author: Ring Leader D.

description:
Free valet in a city that is so incredibly hard to find parking! A+++!

Started off the meal with a complimentary garlic olive loaf brought to our table - warm and soft and delicious. There were 5 of us and we were sat at in a large round booth that was intimate and cozy at the same time - seating was perfect. 

For dinner, I ordered the sizzling mussels - probably the best mussels I have had ever to date. Very impressive and delicious! Also other dishes noteworthy of mentioning were the mac and cheese and the yams, we ordered seconds of both! For myself, I did not order the steak, but the others at the table did and everyone definitely expressed enjoying their steak selections.

For dessert, we ordered the Monterosa, a strawberry Italian cheesecake. A delightful ending to the meal, but overall nothing memorable.

I still think of those mussels though...can't wait to visit there again next time I am up in SF!
author: Minkkwan W.

description: I have been eating here for years and this is still by far my favorite steakhouse. The bone in filet is the only steak I've ever ordered here and is cooked to perfection every time.The rich buttery flavored meat just melts in your mouth!!! I've been to Alexanders, Morton's, and Flemings in Walnut Creek and I do enjoy the sides, but none of their steaks can compare to Bobo's they are one of a kind, the best hands down!!!
author: K H.

description:
Bobo's name isn't obvious since their electronic signage is in korean.

it's been a while since i  ventured inside. the clientele is exclusively korean. patrons are addressed in korean. hostesses are korea immigres.  payment is accepted in u.s. dollars, not korean wons.

as i recalled. drinks pricey. doubt they made many cocktails. the drink of choice in korean bars is usually beer, cognac, or  (johnny walker)  whiskey.
author: Victor G.

description:
Mediocre steak; gloomy atmosphere; inattentive service

Food:
-garlic bread- the best part of the meal (unfortunately)
-petite filet mignon (they removed their bone-in petite filet mignon from the menu) really salty and a little tough
- Modern Mac- really creamy and made me squeamish afterward
-Brussel Sprouts- tasty but doused in oil

Service:
-we didn't get our bread until we asked for it 3 times
-don't expect a freebie dessert on your birthday

Ambience:
- old jesters and clown everywhere
-large windows facing a motel
-we got stuck next to a loud group so we felt like we had to yell across our tiny booth to have a conversation

will not be coming back here!
author: Sangita A.

description:
This place was so great.  My wife and I went with my parents over Christmas and it was worth the wait and money!

You think of this place as a steak only place right? WRONG!

My dad was the only one not to get steak, and he ordered the mussels, clam, crab, and shrimp skillet.  It literally came out on like a 24" skillet filled with shellfish.  The serving size was one thing but the quality was what took the cake for me.  Yummy.

Everyone else got the fillet.  It was incredible, tender, and cooked to order.  I like mine a bit more rare and they did it perfectly.

I will go again, and will most likely try the seafood skillet as mentioned above, with a small fillet.  

So good!
author: Jeremy E.

description:
Everything was spectacular. I came here with my brother who is a steakhouse aficionado, and he claimed it was the best steak meal he's ever had. 

We had the crab cakes as an appetizer - perfectly seared on the outside, and amazing texture inside - not mushy or falling apart. The cranberry relish it was served with was such a surprising complement to it. 

We ordered the Super bone-in filet (20 oz.) to share (it was less expensive than getting 2 petit filets. We got it rare, and it practically melted in my mouth... I am usually a medium rare person, but this was superb. 

The twice baked potato and swiss chard were both delicious and rounded out the meal perfectly. Oh, and the bread is to die for... served with some garlicky olive oil on the side. Crusty on the outside and soft inside :)
author: Taylor A.

description:
Garland and I had made plans to go to midnight mass but before that we wanted to grab dinner and catch a movie. Being Christmas Eve, we had a really hard time finding a restaurant that's open for the evening. We made a couple of phone calls to some restaurants and all of them were either closed for Christmas or booked for the entire night. Garland then made a quick call to Bobo's and the hostess informed him that they will be able to accommodate us as a walk-in. +1 star. 

Not long after we arrived, our hostess took up upstairs and handed us our menus. 


For starters: 
-One bottle of Cabernet kenwood "jack london" sonoma 
-Yellowtail carpaccio 
-Lobster crostini 
-Crispy crab cakes 
-Complimentary bread 

All of the appetizers came out together and really quick. It made me wonder if they had premade all the appetizers ahead of time. My favorite was the lobster crostini because it was served with their homemade cheese and the cheese was so darn tasty! 

For entree:
-Petite filet mignon 
-Bone-in filet mignon 
-Mac n' cheese 

Steak is steak, there are only so many ways to prepare a filet mignon. Our steaks were good but I don't know if it was "the best". I've read in some reviews that the steaks were overloaded with salt. Luckily for us, ours weren't. I had my petite mignon cooked rare and Garland had his bone-in mignon done medium rare. Both were good but his steak was a lot more tender than mine. He claims that it's the bone. We could have gone without the mac n' cheese but he insisted we get a side. 

3 stars for the dining experience + 1 star for opening on Christmas Eve!
author: Jenny K.

description: I felt bad for recommending this place to my friends. Despite waiting in line, apparently VIP/locals gets to cut in front of the line.
author: John C.

description:
The seafood iron skillets are my absolute favorite items on the menu! 

If you need proof about how good their steak is...I brought clients from Kansas City, Japan, y numerous other places around the world here...every single one of then said it was the best steak they'd ever had in their lives!

In addition, one of the best wine selections of any restaurant I've ever seen!

Add the fun decor and a great set of bartenders y this is one of my favorite restaurants on the planet! Enough said? :)
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: Great quality of food,excellent preparation, service and a great setting, overlooking the Lombard street. I had a filet mignon and lobster (comes in a shell) and it was absolutely delicious. Even the price is relatively decent given the quite of food and service. This is my 2nd time at Bono's and I never had to wait for a table.
author: Matija A.

description:
We were lucky to get reservations on Christmas night and treated ourselves with the bone-in filet. Steaks are incredible. Big slice of cow for the money, tender and tasty. Bobo's is very San Francisco, tourists looking for something memorable, won't be disappointed. I also like their lounge/bar just a few doors down. We arrived 30 minutes early, not knowing what traffic would be like and enjoyed a Bulleit Rye until our table was ready. Even though tables are placed closely together, sound is dampened and you hardly notice any conversation but your own. This is something I would like to see more of in other restaurants. This really makes a difference in your experience.Service is top notch. 

Highly recommended!
author: Steve S.

description: The place is kinda small and creepy but the steak is really good.  Not the best steak I've had by far, but as good as you're going to get in San Francisco where it's very difficult to find good food in general
author: Tommy M.

description: Can sum it up in three words. bone-in filet = delicious!  Probably one of the best steaks I have ever had - very tender and juicy and cooked right. The sides were awesome too - we had swiss chard, some excellent brussel sprouts and also the onion rings (yum).  We also had a new type of mac and cheese - they changed their recipe slightly and added truffle oil and mushrooms? I thought it was very good.  Will definitely go back there again.
author: David Z.

description:
Great steak, but I'm afraid Bobo's is skating on their reputation.  I've dined at Bobo's for many years and have generally have enjoyed a great steak with good appetizers and overall excellent service.  Unfortunately, this my last experience was just not.   

A little background: we are a group of 6-8 guys that get together to laugh, eat, tell stories and enjoy a night on the town together.  We're easy going, well traveled and all have solid steakhouse dining resume's.  We have a level of expectations when it comes to steak houses:  Attentive service, good drinks and an excellent steak.  Attitude does not matter as long as our waiter has a good sense of humor and knows how to take care of his or her clients.  With a bill that now often exceeds $1000 and tip that often exceeds $200, we think it's fair to hold these expectations.  

Unfortunately, Bobo's service completely missed this mark and really the reason for this review.  To start, our server was slow to welcome us to the restaurant, slow to take our drink order, slow to bring the drinks, slow to bring water, etc... Similar to the current 49er offense, there was no sense of urgency to simply attend to the basics you would expect to make a group of hungry men happy while they await their feast.  I got the feeling that the entire restaurant staff a had recently turned over.  This was no longer the Bobo's I'd come to know and love.  

OK, we've got our drinks and are ready to order wine.  My friend is a bit of an oenophile and Bobo's showed us a wine list that included a number of 2010 Cabernet's that we thought would be good to enjoy with our meal.  We chose two bottles from a single winery.  Our waiter brought the wine, two bottles of... 2011.  No problem, easy mistake.
