However, instead of apologizing for the oversight, our waiter suggested that there was no difference.  No difference, eh??  OK, no thank you, please check to see that you have the 2010.  Waiter returns, "no we do not".  Here is our wine list again.  OK, we select another 2010 from a different winery.  Waiter comes back with two more bottles... of 2011.  Hmmm.. now we're getting frustrated, we select a third 2010 on the menu.... again, sold out.  

Now, I'm not sure how many people notice when their waiter brings the wrong vintage of a wine, but in San Francisco, that is a huge mistake.  Some steakhouses have aspiring sommelier's as waiters.  Evidently, Bobo's does not.  We're now a little ticked off as the manager arrives.  He gives us a song and dance about how they were in the process of updating their wine list, blah, blah, blah, but it's too late.  I'm now convinced he's lying to me and that they were trying to rip us off.  How many other patrons noticed the year swap that night?  Am I being too sensitive regarding wine list vintages?  I think not.

To their credit, they amazingly found a few 2010's of a well known Cabernet that were not on the list.  Saving them for their regular clients maybe?  Unfortunately at that point, the damage was done.  

I am hoping this review gets read by management and the issues are resolved.  In the meantime, If you're looking for an experienced waitstaff, accurate wine list, or to impress someone, search elsewhere for now.  If you're just plain hungry, the bone in filet is quite excellent!
author: Wile C.

description:
I took my wife here for her birthday. The environment is fantastic. The low lighting is a great romantic touch. Our waiter was great. She answered all our questions and had some good suggestions.

We ordered the clams. They were delicious. The steak was not great. It was an okay steak. Certainly not worth the price. I've had much better steak at lower prices and less fancy places. I can't remember what we had for an appetizer, but that was great too.

I wouldn't recommend going here for their steak. I would definitely go here for the romantic environment and good service
author: Carlos E.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for a late dinner and we wanted to try  the Roasted Crab but after reading reviews on the twice baked potato, I decided we had to try that also.

The twice baked potato was the best thing! The crab must have been overcooked because soon as we cracked the shell, it just crumbled and all the crab meat was stuck to the shell... we were not happy about this ... also the ceasar salad was bitter and not very good... I should have just ordered a steak.. I am not sure I will be back anytime soon... Maybe if I am in the mood for a steak because that smelled SOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOODD!!!

Best thing about the restaurant is the ambience, and the free valet parking, also the waitress was really nice!
author: Kamika T.

description:
I am amazed at the multitude of positive reviews for Bobo's Steakhouse as my dinner there was appalling. I took three close friends there for a "thank you dinner" after they helped me move.

I budgeted for about $450 for the meal and it turned out to not quite cover our costs. Had to borrow a bit from one of my guests (whom I repaid shortly thereafter with another meal at a better restaurant).

So, onto the Bobo experience. Walked in the door and was met with some very gaudy circus decor that included very random elements: dusty feathers on the hostess podium do not bode well for kitchen hygiene. The red, imitation velvet carpet was threadbare. Their strategy of keeping the lighting very dim is probably for the best; it is a place that I'd be loathe to lay eyes on in the daylight.

In short, the food was incredibly salty. I don't know if a new chef was working, or some sort of sodium frenzied saboteur was manning the gas range, but each dish, from the crab and shrimp starters, to the very cold twice baked potatoes we ordered to accompany our entrees, featured enough salt to pay a legion of Roman soldiers.

The only redeeming quality was the service. Our waitress was very attentive and nice and seemed to commiserate with our plight. When I complained to the manager on the way out, she nodded in agreement and told him - "this is what I have been talking about." I did not demand a refund or another meal (don't want to develop hypertension). Just politely suggested that he look into the kitchen sitch. 

I worked in the restaurant business for many years so always treat servers and other restaurant staff with great respect, so I did not make a scene or place undeserved blame - just expressed my disappointment. 

Honestly, with the money spent for a truly awful dinner, I could have taken them all to Gary Danko's. Oh well, you live and learn!
author: Carole B.

description:
Took my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday.  Originally we had plans for Alexander's steakhouse but switched to bobos based on a recommendation from a friend. 

We ordered the ceaser salad and how salad and that was just ehh. Wasn't very impressed with either. 

I also ordered the blood Orange margarita and the
 mojitos which seemed to have only a few drops of alcohol and the rest ice. The drinks were 1 3 bucks each and I was very disappointed. 

We both ordered the filets which were decent but the sides were terrible. We ordered the modern Mac and twice baked potato. I hated the Mac t seemed like the noodles were over cooked and the potato was nothing special. 

For dessert we had the cheese cake and it was a small sliver that could of been consumed by 1 Person. Also told the lady when we made the reservation that it was my boyfriend's birthday and they didn't do anything special.

Overall 200 dollars later I still feel very disappointed and will stick with Alexander's.  Not worth the money or the hype.
author: Victoria D.

description:
Went here to celebrate a birthday, and was not disappointed. We started with the crab cakes, and I loved the contrast of the cakes themselves with the cranberries they came with. The bone-in filet was DELICIOUS! I'm glad we ordered the swiss chard and the twice-baked potato to go with it. The portions for the sides were on the smaller side, but a good amount for the two of us dining. The cheesecake tasted really light and fluffy as well. 

Overall, everything was really tasty, and major bonus points for free valet! Only complaint would be that I wish the food was a little warmer.
author: Linh L.

description:
Despite the look and name of a jester, this place is famous for its signature filet mignon with the bone-in for a tender and flavorful cut of meat served with a bit of gravy from the juices of the meat.  Although the twice baked potato and swiss chard sides are mediocre, the garlic and olive oil loaf is a great way to start the evening.  Of course, the only way to end the evening is with a chocolate bomb.  

Service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  The ambiance is dimly lit and cozy with minimal noise in rooms with a reddish tint on the walls with various interestingly hung portraits for decor.  Parking on the street can be tough, but there is always valet and perhaps the lot.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Yum!

What a little gem I found thanks to yelp.  Went there for a date night with the hubby.  He wanted steak and I wanted seafood, and what a great marriage we found in Bobo's.  

Came early, and thought the bar area was a bit casual.  Not a problem to me, but I felt a little out of place with my 'dressier' clothes for a nice night out.

Were seated promptly, upstairs in a corner that was like a makeshift space.  3 walls all around us, except for my back which was the only way out.  Did NOT like this space at all because we somehow were close to the 'waiter's corner' since all we heard were slamming dishes and clanging from the kitchen.  That's why Bobo's didnt get 5 stars. If could otherwise suggest for them to just dish this spot because this is where you'll definately lose stars, even if your food is wonderful tasty. 

Started the night with their Hamachi.  YUM!  Wonderful marinade of soysauce, ponzu sauce, and their own taste.

Out comes their mussles and shrimp sizzling platter I couldnt keep my hands off of!  My mouth is watering just talking about it.  Olive oil, garlic, salt, (probably some butter) all hot on a sizzling plate.  I could taste it in my mouth just talking about this dish again.  I would suggest to get more shrimp, since this 1/2 combo comes out with a heaping serving of mussles, but only about 5 shrimp.

He ordered the porterhouse, great mix of a tbone and filet minon.  I had a small bite, and it taste wonderful!  I ended with the full crab. Tasty, AND fresh!  You can tell the crab was newly cooked/killed because the crab meat was hearty and filled the shell.  

 One last gripe.  If you plan on going elsewhere after this restaurant and dont mind the smell of 'food', this is a great place to visit.  Otherwise, you'll be better off bringing a pair of changing clothes, because the ventilation is HORRIBLE.
author: Barb B.

description: Underwhelmed. Place is overpriced for average food. Additionally....We went to great lengths to explain a food allergy to red peppers, but they still served the person with the allergy food with red pepper then tried to charge us for her meal! They took it off after we asked about it but you shouldn't have to ask.
author: G B.

description:
I went here for a celebratory end-of-internship dinner but more importantly, to eat my first steak ever. As a non-red-meat-eater, I have never had steak, and we came here to experience what is considered to be one of the best. I ordered a medium rare petit filet mignon, which I could not even finish! Unfortunately, I did not enjoy it as much as I thought I would, but everyone else loved theirs. Pro-tip: if you want to be adventurous, order it blue-rare! They make it perfectly.

I was actually full after eating all the delicious appetizers, my favorite being the brussel sprouts (not kidding). As for dessert, we ordered every single one, but we all decided mine was the best: the Monterosa strawberry italian cheesecake. 

Overall, a great place to go for a very intimate atmosphere and for incredible service.
author: Vandy P.

description:
3.8 stars for this place:

Great bone-in filet mignon and the portion was actually twice as big as normal filet you would get. I think it is worth the $49 although I've had better filet before at Gary Danko, Ruth Chris, or Alexander. I ordered medium rare as usual but mine came undercooked and it was rare. I guess it's better than overcooked. The NY steak my bf ordered was not as good, and he was upset that how much bigger the potion should be for the $50 steak. True. The side order we got were mushroom and swiss chard. They were both very good but toward the end it started to taste too rich with butter. The Mango Panna Cotta was delicious! It was smaller but light and nicely flavored. Also the chocolate mouse was very light and very yummy!

The only thing about this place is that this is really a casual place meaning some people are dressed in sweatshirts. We were sat in the back in a more intimate section so it made it ok, but it made my head tilted to see a casual place like this with oldschool decor charging this much. Also a cocktail was $14. That is overpriced for this type of place.

Over all, my steak was good for 2 meals so I wouldn't refuse to come back, but for the best steak experience in SF, it doesn't need to be here.
author: Cartman P.

description:
While sitting in my hotel, I found a magazine with photos from local restaurants. There was a photo of a gorgeous bone-in filet mignon. I grabbed my jacket and was on my way without giving it a second thought.

After 15 min looking for street parking, we decided to just pay for valet. To our surprise, it was only $2 (or $3.. I forget). 

Excited about yummy food, I go overboard with the ordering. I got an order of iron-skillet roasted mussels, twice-baked potato, and a bone-in filet mignon.

The mussels came with a half a loaf of awesome bread!!!!! It was a meal on its own. Then came the steak! 90% of the steak was perfect! Actually... beyond perfection. However, there was a small part (see pic) that was not really medium rare, but rather undercooked and unpleasant. The rest of the steak was so good that I overlooked that part. As for the potato, I did not like it at all. They had some large greens veggies mixed in with the potato and I thought it ruined the taste of what could have been the best potato ever.

I really did not like the small tables that were at arms length away from other small tables. It was really hard to enjoy my dinner when I could hear weird noises some people make while eating.

It's a small place with really good steaks and sea food. I would definitely return.
author: Roman T.

description:
Everyone seems to rave about Boboquivari's but I left a little unsatisfied.

My boyfriend and I shared an order of the porterhouse which honestly was pretty massive in size and an order of the mussels. The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare) just the way we like it! But it was a little lacking in flavor. The mussels were good, but they also weren't the best I've had either. 

No one at our table seemed too enthusiastic about their food. Our responses were pretty much "meh".

For the $$$$ you have to pay, I don't think we'll be back...
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Disappointed! We have been to Bobo's before, a couple years ago and remembered it was good. 
This time started off bad when our crab cakes tasted fresh from the freezer- strait to the frier. No flavor at all.
The bread was too dry.
Our meat was very undercooked. Once the meat came back it was good.
Overall, the meal was over priced for what we got.
author: sonja o.

description:
It was way more expensive than I thought and for the price, wasn't so sure about the quality of the food.

The bone-in filet was pretty good. The mussels were awesome. The mac & cheese was not good at all. It seemed like there was no cheese, just a whole lot of butter.
author: Jessica J.

description: My boyfriend and I had dinner here last night (1/31). We had reservations for 7:45. We arrived about 30 min early. They told us about their lounge right next door which we could wait at, which we did and it was lovely! We walked back over at 7:45 and our table was ready. We ordered our drinks and those were brought out relatively quick. Next we ordered appetizers, we got the crab crustini and steak tartar. The crab crustini was good but I felt it was lacking something. However the steak tartar was amazing. The waiter started off by presenting it, which was amazing. He also prepared it at the table. I've never had steak tartar so I can't compare to anything but this tasted delicious!! My main course and side came, I ordered the bone-in filet(rare),which they are known for. For the side we ordered swiss chard. The sides comes family style, which I enjoyed. For me rare, is when you cut it and blood runs. It was SLIGHTLY more cooked then that, which I didn't mind but cooked more then I had asked. None the less my steak was delicious. Buttery, pan fried delicious! And the Swiss chard was just as good, VERY garlicky and citrusy. After having ordered several drinks , we then decided to order/share a skillet of half crab and mussels. The presentation was beautiful and I loved being able to crack my own crab. HOWEVER the first issue that I had was they brought us a whole crab and mussels, when we only asked for half. I also felt the crab was slightly over cooked. In my opinion crab is best served slightly warm, this crab was literally scorching hot. We had a table in the top floor and it was rather warm. They eventually turned on the air and also opened up a door. Overall my experience there was AMAZING! My steak- perfection!! I will most definitely be returning! Oh and if your thirsty and want something sweet, ask for a purple hooter!!  ;-)
author: Dene L.

description: If we could give no stars we would!  Such a huge disappointment and way over-priced for what we got.  Walnut salad was lettuce that was old, brown on the edges and nothing special at all (for $12.95)!  Baked potato was small and not fresh-tasting at all, but rather seemingly old also, or sitting out for a few days and covered up with sour cream.  But worst of all was the Frank Sinatra New York steak.  Just awful.  We ordered medium and it was bloody--disgusting. Waiter brought it back and it was burnt and crusty and not edible.  We didn't even eat half of it and didn't want it 'to go' either...so bad and left an awful taste in our mouths too.  As if this wasn't enough, we were seated upstairs in a room filled with two very large tables who were both very loud!  Ridiculous because we could not even hear each other talk...noisy and most annoying and we left as soon as we could amidst one of the worst meals in memory and we are native San Franciscans.  This place is awful and maybe just caters to unknowing tourists...not up to par at all and never planning to go back...that's for sure!
author: Louise S.

description:
Here for the weekend to visit with friends. This place has an eclectic atmosphere which oddly enough, was fun. People greeted you as you walk in and was very friendly.  Waiters are attentive making sure your water and libations never run dry. 

I was told to skip the  appetizers to leave room for the steak.  Our meal came with a big loaf  garlic bread goodness. I had to control myself and not eat 2 to 3 slices. Amazing! 

So I ordered there famous bone in filet medium. OMG!!!! The steak came out and it was perfection. You really did not need a knife to cut the steak. That's how  tender it was. It was flavorful and juicy. I would highly recommend going there. We also ordered the cauliflower, onion rings and the Brussels sprouts. 

Dessert- love love love! Had the mousse that was placed in a waffle cone and the chocolate bomb. 

I would highly recommend you make reservations. You get seated quickly. 

Loved this place and will come back here again. Everything I had was amazing!
author: maria a.

description:
Went there on a good friend's recommendation that its quite easy to taste the quality of the meat at Bobo's. The reality was a little different, the meat was a bit rubbery and the overall taste was just quite underwhelming. I guess the expectations were quite high coming in and we were treating a steak aficionado friend for his birthday. This turned out to be the wrong establishment. have had better steak in any number of joints, for even cheaper in New York see - http://www.yelp.com/biz/buenos-aires-new-york.

But within SF, I would go with House of Prime Ribs (different cut I understand), or Ruth's Chris or Fleming's in PA is solid.

Apart from that service was pleasant, the dining rooms are quite dark. Not returning any time soon.
author: Ash S.

description:
This place is 100% legit and if you like/love steak in any capacity you are doing yourself a disservice by not coming here.

Yeah it's a bit pricey but well worth it. Get the porterhouse with a side of the filet, rare, and seriously melts like butter. The crab is quite good too so try that if you can squeeze it in, the porterhouse + filet and crab for 2 is a solid meal.

The only bad thing is this pretty much ruined steak for me anywhere else.
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
The food here is amazing.  I've eaten here a few times and am never disappointed.  Steak is always done just right, maybe improve the choices for side dishes.
Selection of wine is great, servers are more than friendly.
Maybe next time I'll try the 49 ounce porterhouse.
author: Alex P.

description:
I'm so torn about how to review Bobo's.  With House of Prime Rib right around the corner, it's REALLY hard to give Bobo's anything more than an "eh it's okay" rating.  I get it... I get it.. Prime rib and filet mignon are two completely different cuts of steak. I GET IT. But in terms of flavor, it's really hard to justify a $40+ steak with just so-so flavor. 

The bone-in filet mignon is totally unique.  It was SUPER tender, and literally melts in your mouth.  I couldn't taste that much flavor in it though.  Sure, some butter smothered on top, and the nice charred outside, but something about it just doesn't make my tummy sing to the heavens.  

To be fair, the bf and I only ordered the twice baked potato as a side to share.  So, I can't judge ALL of the sides, but the one that we did order was just meh.  Nothing special about it, and to be honest, I could probably make something better at home.

I will give kudos to their yellowtail carpaccio. DAT PONZU SAUCE. I'm pretty sure my bf was dipping his bread in it and probably would've picked up the plate itself and just drank it straight up.  

I sat on the lower level of the restaurant, and it was pretty small.  Some other customer ordered some sizzling plate thingy that made the entire room fill with smoke.  So, that also was a downer for my experience at Bobo's.

If Bobo's didn't have their bone-in, I really don't know what would make them stand out against all of the other steak houses on steak-row (i.e., Van Ness).  Cool place and definitely unique, but I doubt I'd be going back anytime soon.
author: Stephanie L.

description: My girl and I have were here a year ago...OUTSTANDING. My girl took me here for my birthday on 11/7/15, outstanding. I had the apple walnut salad yummy, garlic crab and cauliflower. My girl had the filet mignon, Caesar salad and twice baked potato yummy, server--Robert was great. Everything was great, had dessert, 20 minutes later left, took Uber. With in 25 minute my girl is about to puke her brains out, of course we're stuck in traffic on Van Ness, finally got home and it's not good. She raced up the stairs and was in the bathroom all night. So after about an hour I called the restaurant and spoke with Gabriel, informed him of everything. Remember from my prior post I have been in the food industry for 30 years. So Gabriel went on to tell me that it can take up to 12 hours to feel the effects of food poisoning. I told him that it can take 10 minutes to 12 HOURS. I only informed him because of the recent outbreak of shigella in San Jose. He said they will follow up, I don't care at this point, I'm not looking for a comp or freebie, I just want you to know that after spending $250 and $50 tip that you never followed up. He also told me that the chef was the owner...ya okay whatever. My girl got FOOD POISONING from the meat. Thanks for following up. Joy
author: Joy P.

description: I went here last night for a business dinner. My partner chose the location based on where I live and where he was staying. It is a little hidden as it is located between a few different lower end motels but don't let this fool you. When you first walk in the atmosphere is extremely welcoming and the waiters are extremely on top of it and super knowledgeable. They recommended the Yellow Tail Carpaccio to start. I normally don't love fish but this was delicious! Then they recommended the bone in Filet Mignon and Brussel sprouts and a baked potato to share as sides. Get the Filet medium rare - it MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. It was perfectly seasoned also... I didn't even add salt or pepper (an anomaly for me). The Brussels had bacon chunks and the baked potato - oh my gosh talk about cheesy goodness! Even though we were stuffed full from finishing our entire 14oz filets and side dishes we proceeded to dessert....Strawberry cheesecake. It wasn't overwhelmingly sweet like cheesecake can be and was the perfect ending to our meal.
author: Jenny L.

description: My boyfriend took me here for my Birthday. Overall it was a good experience. The decor is uniquely designed with beautiful chandeliers, puppets and curtains for privacy. The service was good and very straightforward, as the menu is not hard to figure out. We were greeted with a garlic, buttery loaf of bread that was very good. I ordered the Surf in turf with crab. The filet was so tender, it almost melted in my mouth. Crab was good but messy. The Mac & cheese and the twiced baked potato were dangerously good as well. I left here full and satisfied, I will come back again!.
author: Breya D.

description:
I don't normally post reviews on Yelp, but I was so disappointed with my experience here that I really wanted to.

I came here on Friday night for a special night out with my boyfriend.  First of all, we were seated about 25 minutes after our reservation time.  As we were waiting at the bar to be seated, the bartender accidentally spilled an entire drink on the bar which drenched my pants and my dry clean only sweater.  He managed to clean up the drink before even offering me a napkin to dry off and there was no apology.  We ended up paying the $30 bar tab for 2 drinks.

Once we were seated, I was really looking forward to a good dinner.  The shrimp, salad, and bread were all fine.  However, we then waited a long time for the rest of our food and as soon as our meals was brought out we were immediately disappointed.  The sides were COLD, and our steaks were lukewarm, so obviously the food had been sitting for some time after it was ready before it was brought to us.  It took us a long time to flag the waitress down, and when we finally let her know what was going on she took everything back.  I have never had to send food back at a restaurant before.

Once the food was brought back out, she let us know that they were really trying to not overcook our steaks given they had to reheat it.  They did manage to not overcook it, however only the edges of the steaks truly got warm and about 3 bites into the steaks they were still lukewarm.  We actually abandoned our steaks in order to save ourselves the embarrassment of sending them back for a second time.  We each only had a few bites of our steak, and we just focused on the sides which weren't all that great either after having had to be reheated.

All in all, we paid over $200 for a meal for two people that was very disappointing with no apology from the restaurant.
author: Marissa P.

description:
Came here for valentine's day this year, and the food was delicious.  For appetizers we had crispy crab cakes, super good.  Then we each had the filet mignon bone-in stead for our entrée.  It was so tender and perfectly cooked...and the portion was ginormous, so big that I had to take part of it home (and I eat a lot).  We also shared two sides, swiss chard and portobello mushrooms.  The mushrooms were a little too salty for my liking, same with the swiss chard, but both were flavored well.  

The only bad thing I'd say, maybe because it was v-day's, was that upstairs the seating is so cramped that I think I learned too much about other peoples' lives that night, and would've instead liked to have more space.
author: Liz W.

description:
BEST. STEAK. EVER. PERIOD.

The Bone in Filet Mignon at Bobo's is the finest steak I have eaten, and I have paid WAY more for steaks at places like Carne Vino in Las Vegas.  It is truly like no other steak I have ever eaten. 

OK, enough about the steak, let's get into the rest of the experience.  I also had a half of a dungeness crap which was drizzled with garlic infused olive oil  Also spectacular.  The side dishes were not my cup of tea, I prefer more greens and there were not a lot of options, but the baked potato was still excellent.  My wife had a cocktail, which she described as delicious, and we skipped dessert as we were both stuffed from our meal.

The service was excellent as well.  My only real complaint aside from the fact that they didnt carry my style of side dishes was the atmosphere.  Its a bit dated, but FULL of character.  This place is a must visit if you are in San Francisco and want a phenomenal steak.
author: Tony M.

description: This place is really tiny so get cozy with your neighbors. The decor is kitchy, cute and has a lot of personality but could use some re-vamping. While the food was nowhere near terrible, the price point was pretty expensive. While I've come to expect at these types of "touristy traps" in and around San Francisco, I feel like that raises the standard & I was not very impressed. I will say that the one memorable thing here was the crab cakes were to die for - and this is coming from a person who doesn't even eat crab. However, the steaks could use some serious work - filet mignon was fine but the porterhouse was not what I was expecting. The top of it was completely charred, the inside way tooo rare - not the way we had ordered. They were also flavorless. The sides could use some work & be a little more creative than just some veggies tossed in EVOO/salt. If you plan to share 'em, be aware they're quite small. I was really looking forward to this place to celebrate my SO's birthday. I opted to come here instead of our typical steakhouse fav's, Ruth's Chris or Morton's - I'm definitely made a wrong choice.
author: Sia P.

description:
So I have not ever written a review mostly because many places that I've been to have been reviewed to death and never thought I really added much by adding my review.  But I had such a depressing experience this evening at a restaurant that was awarded 4 stars on Yelp that I felt I needed to do something to right this wrong.

We were in search of a good steak restaurant to take my brother who was visiting from out of town for his birthday - and Bobo's was recommended by a friend and I also decided to validate the recommendation by checking on Yelp and thought 4 stars with 1000+ reviews must mean the restaurant is pretty darned good.

How disappointed we were!

First off, what kind of steak restaurant does not carry Ribeye!? Waiter recommended New York Steak instead claiming it was more marbled than the Filet Mignon and therefore a closer choice to a Ribeye. My brother and I looked at each other and thought - really? But we reserved our judgement till the steak arrived.

First, a review of the bread - it was dripping with garlic oil - definitely not the most appetizing loaf I've seen.

Next, a review of the appetizers - the lobster soup was nasty - the description on the menu said "in a mild curry brodetto" - there was nothing mild about the curry, it was quite overpowering and the consistency of the soup was a cornstarchy goupy mess and the lobster was nowhere to be found.

The lobster crostini with burrata was a much better option - although the combo of smoked salmon and lobster was kinda odd, but at least the burrata was creamy and fresh and delicious.

Next up, the steak and seafood - my brother ordered the NY Steak (on account of it being more marbled), but of course it really wasn't and my husband ordered the Petit Filet Mignon.  Neither steak was very impressive (NY Steak was kinda dry) and they were definitely way over-priced for the quality.

The shrimp was swimming in oil and wasn't particularly fresh.

The twice baked potato was overly creamed and disgusting and the brussel sprouts with pancetta was (once again - theme of this restaurant clearly) swimming in oil.  

We were so disappointed with the meal we decided to cut our losses and skip dessert.

Lastly, the ambiance - it was kinda a depressing place - the carpets were worn and tired, and the ventilation in the restaurant wasn't good, resulting in the whole place smelling of oily steaks.  They had to keep the door to the patio open to create ventilation which made for a very cold evening, but at least that way you didn't entirely reek of an oily steak.

I say, save yourself some money and go to Ponderosa instead - you won't be missing that much, that's how bad this place was!
author: Nik T.

description:
I smoked a bunch of weed before taking my wife here for our wedding anniversary (whoops, my bad), and had a bit of an anxiety attack after being seated in the small upstairs dining room with the checkered wallpaper.  

While I was outside getting some fresh air, my wife explained to the waitress that I was feeling ill and may be gone a few minutes.  She snapped in to action, letting the kitchen know to delay our meal until we were ready, and brought extra water.  She offered to re-seat us closer to the door, but by that time, my paranoia finally wore off and I was able to get back to the business of being a rad husband.  So as far as service goes, we were more than impressed. 

All of my co-reviewers have already said everything there is to say about the terrific food, so I'll leave that alone.  But, when you embarrass yourself after smoking college grade dope in your 30's, the staff at Bobo's will have your back.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description: This place is an institution in and of itself. A great place to come for special occasions, the ambiance is unique (feels like you are eating backstage at a costumed theatre) and the dry aged steaks and fresh crab really rise for the occasion. I'm lucky to live in the area and be able to walk here whenever I'm feeling extra special!
author: Mark Y.

description: Interesting, fun decor inside.  Killer steak and mussels.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Service was excellent. The bread was to die for. My filet was literally melt in your mouth good.

I don't like that EVERYTHING is a la carte style... and it costs an arm, leg and my first born child... BUT the food is pretty legit. 6bills well spent.
author: So H.

description:
First timer. 
Excellent service from Jenn.
Delicious wine.
Super bone in filet mignon cooked to medium rare perfection.
Flavorful whole crab.
Overall great experience.
author: shellz w.

description:
I had the chance to eat in other steak houses in SF before. This restaurant is clearly disruptive.

The bone-in filet mignon was like butter - I never had such a piece of meet before. All the sides were incredibly good as well. The service was perfect, I really have nothing to say.

If you get the chance, ask for a table on the second floor.

This place was a discovery for us, but will now proudly rank at the top of our favorite steak places list.
author: Milan K.

description:
I came here about six months ago. It was not planned for - we were just looking for a place to eat and one of the divas in the group just really wanted steak. We tried to catch HOPR but we wouldn't have been able to make it before closing. Yah, we were eating pretty darn late. The only one still open at the time and within walking distance was lo and behold, Bobo's. Honestly, I was not really impressed and if you've already read Jenny C.'s review (http://tinyurl.com/d4rkf8m), mine is not gonna be that much different.

The ambiance is what you expect out of a fancy-shmancy restaurant - dark, quiet with lots of maroon colored decor. Considering the time and day (I think it was a weekday) we were here, it was uber quiet. Our complimentary bread was a garlic topped bread which was surprisingly pretty hard. Maybe it was because it was late in the night. Still, it's complimentary so can't really complain about that.

Jenny and I ordered a filet to split with a side of mac n cheese. The filet was whatever. Not as tender as other places I've had and the mac n cheese was just okay. I felt it didn't have enough of the gooey cheesiness I usually like. The baked potato on the hand was the winner of the table - warm and super buttery.

It was quite an unsatisfactory meal for me and just to make myself feel a little better, I took a few of their matches.
author: Linh V.

description:
I brought my boyfriend here to show him that I could setup a nice date. So, I made reservations and when we got there we were seated right away. The waitress we had was awesome. 

Now the food- I thought the bread was extra  hard and very messy to eat, but not so bad. I ordered the steak which tasted like any other steak I've had (overrated) and half a crab which was delicious and last but not least the stuffed potato which was extremely good, maybe the best part of my meal. I think the prices are pretty reasonable; however, next time I won't pay $8 for some bottled water. 

I will give this place another try.
author: I luv L.

description: This place is off the hook! My New York, New York (Sinatra Cut) was cooked perfectly. Everything was delicious. Theo, our waiter was very friendly and knowledgable of the menu. He definitely helped me out with my steak decision. The guy is awesome. I am definitely coming back! I love this place!!
author: Harvey D.

description:
M  E  A  T

Done rare and done right.

I paid a rare visit to this rather outlandish spot sitting on the much touristed Lombard street near Van Ness, only because of the following points of major importance:

1.  I have been craving an excellent rare steak.
2.  Wanted to spend the experience with the funny man.
3.  Friends all recommended the "Bone-In Filet Mignon.

After locating a much treasured parking space two blocks away, I dreaded the entrance because it was so reminiscent of a cheesy steak house I've been to in Chicago :  outlandish colors, stripes reminding me of a joker's cap, and the usual crimson lining the rugs/walls.

Actuality, it was not too bad, even though I had requested a window seat.  We were seated in a corner alcove complete with drawn curtains in the need we required privacy during the consumption of the meat.

We both requested the bone-in filet mignon, because I kept on repeating at the dinner table and of course, I requested it rare.  I did not order any sides as I heard they were mediocre for the pricing listed and the bread with drizzled olive oil.  

Our steaks came out in record time, since I have usually waited around an hour or so (Ruth Chris for example) and let me just state this:

A large baseball cut of the filet mignon, with the bone in, immaculate in conception from the grill to my station...cutting into it was smooth and effortless, literally a bite of silken heaven.  Seared on the outside, and rare, with the perfect cool center.  

The steak was so large, I could not finish it.  

Service is pretty good in that our waiter was quite attentive and patient, given the numerous side conversations "w" and I had that took up most of our decision time.  He did, however, manage to seduce us into ordering their espresso, which heightened my caffeinated senses.  

25% tip.  And most of it was because he was nice.

I'll be back, but remember: bone-in!
author: Miika M.

description: Great place!  Great service!  I was very glad not to take the negative comments too seriously.
author: Angela Z.

description: Funky location and vibe. The crab cake app was good. The roasted mussels were great and the biggest I've ever seen. Bone in filet was very good and maybe a tad below Mortons level but still good! The dungenous crab was very very good and the Mac & cheese side followed suit. I could easily come here again for the mussels and crab! If I was going just for beef I'd pick another place.
author: Charlie R.

description:
Four of us showed up right before closing but they were extremely accommodating.  

Started with roasted dungeness crab legs and mussels.  Best mussels I've had in a very long time.  Cooked perfectly, really good flavor on both the mussels and crab.

Then we went on to the porterhouse and bone in filet.  Both were cooked perfectly. The meat was like butter and nicely seasoned.  

Sides were mac n' cheese, brussel sprouts and cauliflower.  Sides were cooked well but lacked seasoning.  This was the only downside to the meal.

Service was excellent and overall an experience as the atmosphere is very "festive", in a good way.  

Will be back.
author: Dan W.

description:
Sidenote:  I used to laugh every time I heard someone say they went to "Bobo's" for dinner because it sounded like some sort of restaurant in an Italian mob movie.  Seriously, it's like it's straight out of Goodfellas or something; I could imagine Ray Liotta narrating a line like, "Paulie got whacked at Bobo's for ratting to the feds about Gino" and Joe Pesci on the screen staring down some dead body.  Okay, anyways, on to the review!

The place is somewhat oddly shaped, as there's apparently tiers of seating areas for customers.  Didn't really see how big the other areas were though, as we sat in the small dining section right by the bar, just off the hostess podium.  We were seated pretty promptly after we claimed our reservation time (party of four), and the waitress we had was pretty nice throughout our meal.

To kick off our meal, we decided to split a couple of their appetizers to go with our entrees.  The first was the Heirloom Tomato dish served with avocado, onions, and burrata cheese.  It was my first time trying burrata (that I know of) and it was some good stuff.  Definitely liked how it had a creamy texture but still retained that stringy mozzarella consistency.  The second was the Dungeness Crab Crostini with smoked salmon, avocado, and burrata.  SO DELICIOUS.  Even though avocado and burrata is listed in both, the two dishes tasted so different.  Made up entirely of some of my favorite things, I only wish they had more than just two crostinis on the plate.  Lastly, they give a plate of bread that seems like it's been baked with olive oil.  Pretty nice having that flavor built right in, but didn't eat much of it to save space for the steak.

And speaking of the meatiness goodness, we each ordered their signature cut - the bone-in filet mignon.  Generally, I think filet mignon can be a little overrated; sure, the meat is tender but it can also be a little lean for my liking.  That's not to say filet mignon isn't good, just that depending on how it's prepared, it doesn't strike me as amazing as everyone raves.  This one though, was pretty damn good.  I don't know if it's because the bone was still attached or if it was the butter sauce left over from cooking, but lots of natural juices, great flavor, and still oh so tender.

For sides, we decided to try two - the Mac n Cheese and the Baked Yams.  The Mac N Cheese was just okay, and I've had better.  I didn't notice a crunchy topping which disappointed me, and the cheesey part was almost like a pasta sauce.  They might have been able to salvage it if they drizzled some truffle oil on top (truffle oil can do that to a dish).  As for their baked yams, not bad but I think the one at Ruth's Chris is better.  Creamy texture with minimal lumps gave it a sort of mashed potatoes consistency, but sweeter than it's pale counterpart (especially with the brown sugar sprinkled on top).

As for dessert, our table split an order of the Dunce Cap Cones - four mini waffle cones filled with chocolate mousse with an ancho chili pepper chocolate sauce.  Pretty tasty dish, but halfway through the cone, you realize that the mousse filling stops.  It'd be nice if it was fully filled, but I guess that might also be too much of a good thing.  I don't know if I would get an order for just myself in the future, but certainly I would split it again with a friend/date (in this case, three other guys...no wonder the waitress gave us an odd look).  It went really well with their black coffee (which was really good) and, oddly enough, the red wine I still had left.

I was going to give them a four star review for their average sides, but I'm going to bump them to five stars specifically for the bartender and waitress, and their free valet.  While waiting for a couple of the guys to show up, the bartender was nice enough to comp a sprite for me (yeah, yeah...was saving myself for the three bottles of wine we brought).  As for the waitress, she was really accommodating of our request for three wine glasses each just so that we could settle an ongoing bet of which of my three friends could pick the best wine.  Overall, will definitely come back again for the crostini appetizer, their steak, and to try their crab (looked good at the neighboring table).
author: Mike L.

description:
Wow - new favorite steakhouse
Let me count the deliciousness...
1. Bone in Filet - cooked perfectly, goes down smooth
2. Shrimp - not nearly as good as the steak, but still quite tasty 
3. Twice baked potato - they snuck something green into the mixture, but it didn't ruin anything 
4. Mod Mac (Mac and cheese) - SOOO good - I will be using these types of boodles next time I make it 
5. Mushrooms - tasty - goes well with any steakhouse order. 
5.5 free half loaf of garlic bread
author: Sam A.

description:
The amount of oil (and probably the type) that this food was cooked in was absolutely disgusting.  I left last night with a REALLY bad stomach ache - to the point that I had to try to make myself throw up (I wasn't successful but I've just never been good at that) and I had to drink quite a bit of Pepto, even this morning.  I would NEVER go back to this place.  

Also: this restaurant is weird.  It's got this super creepy clown-themed decor.  Not exactly what we were expecting...
author: Leslie C.

description: My husband and had dinner here for our 6 month anniversary ( its 2014, thats an accomplishment) reservation only as its a fancy, elegant restaurant.we were a little early so they offered us to go next door to their "lounge" ( bar) very pleasant there. It came around time to go eat. We got back there and were greeted nicely and they sat us down. Seats are close and cozy next to other which is fine didnt bother us. We started off with water, then I ordered a glass of champagne,  and my husband said cocktail. We checked out the menu, my husband had the bone in fillet in mind yet a guest at the bar "lounge" told my husband the bone in ribeye was delicious... So he ordered the bone in ribeye. I LOVE seafood. ( cooked and hot plates) I ordered the crab and double shirmp. As we waited we chatted about how nice the place was and pretty fancy. Food comes out. .. most amazingly looking shrimp and crab! !! My husband ribeye looked great as well! We dug in. ... honestly I would say that was the BEST can and shirmp I've ever had. Buttery garlicy etc mmm... my husband's ribeye was a bit too greasy and too much fat yet good, he knew he should have gotten the bone in fillet. My husband's exact words were " I could have made this at home" as he's a mean cook, especially steak. He ended up eating shrimp and crab from my plate. HUGE amount of shrimp which could have fed us both! As the night go's on I take a drink from my water cup, as it touched my lips I notice something black floating.  IT WAS A FLY. I has a fly in my water!  My husband was so embarrassed and upset at the fact we go to a nice fancy elegant  restaurant and their is a FLY. As we try to get our waitresses attention the bus boy comes by and my husband shows him the fly. He goes to the waitress and shows her the cup. Time passes and she brings another water cup and whispers " here you are"  NOT EVEN AN APOLOGY!  We were almost done so we asked for the check. It was 180$ and we left her a 20% tip even after that! We didnt say anything we were too upset. My plate was AMAZING yet we should have received and apology of some sort. Would I come here again? Its a tough decision  after all they didnt even make us feel important enough for a simple sorry. I dont like giving back reviews especially after my plate was the best, but that was unacceptable
author: Maira B.

description: Bobo's is one of the best restaurants in the city. Great food amazing services and wonderful atmosphere.lf you want to a great evening just go there..
author: Mashael S.

description:
Four stars only because I called in advance requesting nice seating within the restaurant as it was a birthday celebration and when I arrived, we were put in a dark small corner. After I voiced my unhappiness, they moved us which I greatly appreciated. The food was tasty and expensive. I am not sure if the cost was equal to the quality. 

Unfortunately, during our dining experience, there was a group of men (age range: 30-40) that were reliving their college days. They drank excessively and were loud and disrespectful to the rest of the diners. In the end, one of them threw up at the table and they all left abruptly. Long story short, this establishment is not meant for Frat Boy Reunions and everyone else would appreciate it if you took that behavior to a dive bar. Extremely disrespectful and embarrassing. It definitely ruined our dining experience.
author: Ajna V.

description: Acme bread smothered in garlic. Perfectly seasoned lobster curry soup. Yellowtail carpaccio and brussels sprouts - yum. And, filet - glorious medium rare filet. I'm in heaven. Merry Christmas to me!
author: Jenny S.

description:
I was taken here for my birthday and was pretty impressed by their food and service. I would ramble on about each dish and how delicious it was but unfortunately that meal made me rush to find a bathroom while I was getting ice cream at Mitchell's. 

Yeah, finding a bathroom in SF late at night when you REALLY need it is HORRIFIC. I didn't come back to SF for several months because I was so traumatized by the whole situation. A restaurant may serve "good" food but if it comes out the wrong way it is NO GOOD.
author: Christine S.

description:
Possibly one of the finer steaks that I have enjoyed. 
A side of portobello shrooms was added.  
Great meal, great environment. 
Staff wasn't as up to participate as they should have been.  When I am spending more than $100 per planet  I expect phenomenal service.
author: Malinko ..

description:
Service wasnt very good, took them 15 min to get us water. 

We wanted cocktails before dinner but they took so long to bring them to us that we got the drinks with dinner and the bottle of wine we had ordered.

Not a huge deal but it all added up and I wasnt impressed.

The fillet minon was very good, not wild about the T-bone. Personally I think money could be spent somewhere else, paying less but getting better service and similar quality food
author: Sara G.

description:
Wow, a really great experience here.

Everyone told me to order the Bone-In Filet and it really was incredible.  The meat was extremely tender and flavorful.  I ordered it medium, which was their recommendation and, except for the portion that was really close to the bone which was extremely rare, I thought it was an excellent way to have it.  Along with the beef we shared a plate of Macaroni and Cheese and Twice-Baked Potatoes, which were also really good and perfect to complete the hearty steak dinner we had.

The décor is pretty unique and the service was very attentive.  This is a great option if you are a meat-lover and want to indulge.
author: Ken G.

description:
The hubby and I stopped by on Saturday night for dinner around 9:30pm because House of Prime Rib was too long of a wait (1.5 hrs...crazy!) The valet here is complimentary but was full so we had to drive around.  I jumped out first to get a table but luckily enough, was seated right away! Everyone else had to wait at least 30 mins, but lucky me! :) 

We ordered:
- Single order of roasted mussels (SO GOOD!!!)
- bone in filet mignon
- surf n' turf (petite filet and garlic crab)
- twice baked potato
- house cabernet

The food was spectacular!  The mussels were amazing and the steaks were perfectly cooked.  I love the beautiful crust on the filets (VERY important) and quality of the meats.  My only complaint was that there was no seasoning on the meats.  As in, no salt - nothing.  I wish they would have at least seasoned the meat or offered different sauces to go with it.  
The crab was good at first but you have to eat it right away or else the sauce congeals and then it's kinda unappetizing.  

Service was flawless. 

We passed on dessert because we were so full.  Will definitely be visiting again when in the area.
author: Yvette T.

description:
After hearing about my first experience at Bobo's, my friends made me go back for the bone-in filet, for which Bobo's is known. 

The steak was delicious and I'm glad I went back. I'm still on the hunt for a bone-in ribeye in SF.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Bone in filet.  Just get it if you want an amazing steak experience.

I feared the worst when I agreed to go here (take a look at the website), then was more disturbed when I actually realized where it was located.  Tourist central, ug.

But it was really good and I would go back.  The bartender was cool and made some interesting cocktails.  The food was very tasty, if a bit heavy handed.  And the steak was five star, which is mostly all I care about when I go to an expensive steak house.  And it was pretty expensive, but not more than other reasonably high end places.

Service was very good.
author: Patrick S.

description:
BIFM.

That's all I have to say.   Don't even mess with anything else.  I'm dead serious.
author: Isaac L.

description: This is by far the best steakhouse in San Francisco. Order the mussels and pretty much any steak on the menu. My wife insists on coming here for every special occasion.
author: Cailen D.

description: Very disappointed. I had friends tell me this place was amazing, so we tried it without second guessing. Not from the area so I expected great service stealk and drinks... I got none of those. Waitress was pissy. Drinks were tiny and under poured. Mine and my wife's steak were charred black completely. My wife got snobby looks the whole night. If I'm paying $170 for a nice dinner w my wife I want it all, and this place had nothing. Never again!!!!
author: Billy G.

description:
June 19, 2010 @ 5:30 PM,  Saturday Date Night


YUMS!  My parents taught me not to lick my fingers when eating at a restaurant. But being a Filipino and trained to eat with our hands came in handy at Bobo's. (You should at least know how to eat with your hands in theory even if you don't do it in practice if you are a Pinoy kid.) 

Because at Bobo's, you'll get the best of both worlds:  STEAK AND SEAFOOD. 

And my Filipino seafood eating skills were put to the test. Who needs those metal thingy-s to crack crab claws? Bite into it and use your choppers!

Our dinner date started at 5:30 PM. We were seated at a  super-tiny corner booth but the cuteness of the hanging colorful ribbons to give us privacy from the next booth made up for the feeling that we were being put on "time out" in the corner. Couples and groups of friends dressed to the nines started pouring in.  They got the bigger, padded booths. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=KaPc4oNFfee6bKmp1BAsMQ

The decor at Bobo's  might be playful but  there is nothing funny about Boboquivari's food and service. They definitely do not clown around when it came down to the real thing: steak, seafood, bread and their server. Our server was very attentive and friendly.

DRINK AND BREAD: And few minutes later, I was sipping a BOBOTINI (yummy but not strong enough) and devouring the half loaf of HOT, garlic bread oozing with butter that was served to us almost as soon as we sat down. (Note: I finished almost this half-loaf by myself with little help from fiance.)  So addicting!!!http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=Q-BC1kHEsfjPzyVgpM-ejQ

SEAFOOD APPETIZER: And not long after that, fiance and I got down and dirty. How could you not when you have a GIGANTIC SKILLET OF PRAWNS AND CRAB placed  in front of you! Delicious seafood very seasoned in butter and herbs served with 3 flavored butter sauces for dipping.  They were on the dry side and the prawns were not plump but they were delicious none the less.  I have no mercy and took home the last 5 prawns left. And that's just for appetizer! ($40)http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=soimFTR-upzbcZIPXEVHBQ

STEAK: And the FILET MIGNON STEAK! Bone-in for fiance ($40), http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=uLL3OSFIaqbDL2gdAMiUOA petite for me ($30).  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=DXG7nIeCMI-uZR4Y6iClNg Bone-in Filet Mignon is the MAIN ATTRACTION. Bobo's signature steak. Both steaks were so tender. Melt.in.your.mouth. Period.

SIDE: As if we didn't have enough, we ordered a side dish of TWICE BAKED POTATO ($8).  Big enough to share but ending up to be not our fave. We had two bites each and decided we did not like it. Tasted like a veggie quiche on top of the half-potato. Very untraditional. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=IVNdN8WggJolVzPsjli6eQ

DESSERT: And a CHOCOLATE BOMB ($8))! A mound of chocolate with truffle-like consistency drizzled with raspberry glaze. Even this lacto could not resist! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=R5ipc1QOrgSdXpJnl5BIAw

TAB: $180 including 2 diet cokes, tax and 20% tip.  Pricey but definitely a very enjoyable dinner.

By the way, I licked my fingers all throughout dinner and I didn't care. My parents were not there to scold me!
author: Leah E.

description:
We asked for medium(pink) for our steaks but was served more as medium rare(red) and when we asked it to be cooked a bit more, the flavor was completely lost and was not juicy.  The steak needs to be cooked right the first time for the price they charge.

They also don'f have the basic baked potato and string beans.  Sometime it's best to offer the stable basic sides and not try to over doing it with bunch of toppings and off-regular vegetables.
author: Sandy S.

description:
Great steakhouse. Went here yesterday with 2 of my buddies for a get together. Unique with all the lighting and the decorations, hostess and waitress were friendly. I heard this was a quality joint, regardless of the funny name, and one of the best steaks in SF. I definitely concur with that. Great selection of steak, a fine variation of seafood appetizers. I had the shrimp and mussels for appetizer (4/5) and the bone in filet which was (4.5/5). They cooked medium rare just right!

Alongside that, will return for another steak. I give it the complete 5 stars just due to the dining experience, waitress checked on us a few times, and the food was great!
author: Howard J.

description:
My wife and her brother planned an early Christmas / Date Night dinner here with some other family after hearing and seeing rave reviews about this place. They were nice enough to accommodate our reservation of 9!

Pros:
1. Love the fact that there's free valet parking and coat check
2. Love how there's 3 bathrooms and they're all CLEAN
3. Love how the bar has almost everything and its really a mixed crowd
4. You can bring your own bottles of wine!!! (corkage fee though i believe)
5. Yellow fin carpaccio was awesome!!!!
6. Our server (Hope) was ontop our drink orders

Cons:
1. Bone in filet is just OK... still really good but I've had better
2. Iron skillet shrimp Appetizer was just OK as well... small shrimp and was lacking something, and was overpriced IMO
3. Dungeness crab wasn't as fresh or tasty as I thought it was going to be...especially for the price.
4. Everytime one of the servers brought out our food, they placed the food down infront of the wrong people. We basically had to point the server in the direction of who ordered what.

Fun little place to go to, but a little too far from us for steak and seafood.
author: Jason L.

description: The best steakhouse in San Francisco, and the in the top five in the country.  Highly recommended is the bone in filet mignon, not seen on steak menus very often.  The sides are quite expensive but good.  I would order the larger steak and take it easy on the sides.  The only drawback to Bobo's is the way overpriced drinks.  For example,  Lagavulan scotch whiskey goes for 30 dollars a glass!  Price at Costco for a BOTTLE is around 65 dollars.  Even with that, we go to this excellent steak restaurant every two months.   Great bartender on the weekends when we go there is another plus.
author: Bill S.

description: This waiting area and bar are tiny-tiny but the service is fabulous. The bartender was great and so were the drinks. We had a group of 6 and there was no problem splitting 3 main courses. The surf and turf was delicious with the crab cakes were delicious! The decor reminded me of the Stinking Rose!
author: Joleen Q.

description: We were here last week in a party of six. We ordered 49oz porterhouse, a bone in ribeyes and super bone in filet to share with few appetizers, salads and side orders etc. we were too full at the end because we didnt know the steaks were so big. We thought bone-in "must be" coming with a big bone but the truth is opposite. I would say besides steaks all others were just average. I didnt go to steak house for a while because i was disappointed by a few other famous steakhouse. But this time i came back to Bobo's i feel it differently and would like to come back in future.
author: T Y.

description:
My parents and I found this restaurant via Yelp as we were walking around through the city. We are pretty big steak/seafood fans, so we figured it would be a place to try. Any expectations that we had were blown away. We ate way too much, and every bite was worth it. 

The servers and other staff were gracious and helpful, and clearly whoever cooks/preps this food knows what he/she is doing! If you are looking for a nicer, quieter, and more unique place to try out for the best stake around - this is the place to go.

Other reviewers say to have the filet, surf/turf, double baked potato, and to try the basil martini... I agree with all of those things! AH-mazing.
author: Kelsey A.

description:
Came here on a Sunday early evening with two other friends. The restaurant wasn't booked at all, so I was able to get any reservation that I wanted.

We walked in and were directed to a nice booth with a window view (of the street though of course). Our waitress took our coats, which was nice.

The free garlic bread was pretty damn good, although in a form that was new to me.

I got the bone-in filet mignon, as well as baked yams and brussel sprouts.

The filet mignon was amazing, and the juiciness was amazing. They cook it so it has a crispy crust, which was pretty mind blowing. Excellent, I couldn't have done better myself. The baked yams was very good, although I wish it had more texture vs. being mashed. The brussel sprouts with pancetta was very good, although I personal prefer baking them to get it really soft and less bitter inside.

I didn't realize there was free valet, otherwise I would have parked there! I was able to find parking pretty easily across the street though.

The crab smelled really good from other patron's tables, but it seems like they aren't that good from other reviews?
author: Michael W.

description:
This was the best dinner of my life and yes I said my life!!! They offer free valet which was awesome, tipped the guy a couple bucks of course.

Upon entering your taken back to a Mardi Gras in New Orleans. Its pretty cool the decor and vibe to the place. I made a reservation and we were on time, however the host told me that there running a little behind which was fine cuz I just got a drink at the bar.

We finally got seat upstairs in the little nook. It was romantic and peaceful cuz I was with the boy. We first received there delicious garlic bread!!!! This bread is soft, just baked, with garlic pieces on top. Then we got the lobster Crostini, now I prefer Crab but got this one cuz I didn't like that the crab one had salmon on it. Let me tell you THIS LOBSTER crostini was luxury in your mouth.  They didn't skimp out on the lobster either. It had red onion on it with avocado and burrata cheese. Seriously it was so fricken good!!!! Then I got the petite filet medium and the bf got the filet bone in. We both adored our steaks. Then we both got a twice baked potatoe.   This was the most  delectable twice baked potatoe I've ever eaten. It has chives, cream, butter, and sour cream drizzled on top. 

This meal was a combination of all these words:

delightful, delish, distinctive, divine, enjoyable, enticing, exquisite, fit for king, good, gratifying, heavenly, luscious, lush, mellow, mouthwatering, nectarous, nice, palatable, piquant, pleasant, rare, rich, sapid, savory, scrumptious, spicy, sweet, tasteful, tasty,

I will come here as much as I can. That is how much I enjoyed my meal.

Thank you.
author: Jess O.

description:
bobo is actually booboo!!!

a sea of oil is still sloshing around in my stomach, keeping me awake and thus i'm writing this review.
i've been feeling like a pregnant woman wanting to throw up ever since i was at the restaurant having my meal.
the reeking smell of oil is just everywhere you look!
from their bread to their shrimp and their brussel sprouts.
oil and then more oil.
am i eating in beijing or sf?

ok, is it even legal for steakhouses not to have ribeye on their menu???
if you so choose not to serve this particular cut, which btw is my favourite, then you jolly well better do your other cuts perfectly!
my medium order of bone in new york steak came medium rare.
sorry, no excuse allowed and i'm not the sort to send my steak back.
i'll just eat, split and then no repeat.

a big thank you to my sis for paying for my meal.
otherwise, it would have been way too much for me to stomach!
author: Nik T.

description:
I took my bf to Bobo for his birthday dinner ! The dinner were amazing and a lovely experiences. Our server were friendly and lovely. We ordered crab cake for appetizer, they were really crispy with lot's crab meats. Also, a single order of mussels, they were the best mussels that I ever had !! The mussels were so juicy, fresh and sweet. For entrees, my bf had medium rare bone-in New York steak and I had a medium rare petite filet mignon. We really enjoyed our steak, the meats were perfectly cooked with amazing flavorful and soft like butter!!  We ended our meal with blood orange sorbet . 

This is one of the best steak restaurants at San Francisco, I will definitely go back!! Also, I love their complementary parking made parking super easy in this area during dinner time.
author: Stacy L.

description:
Been 3 times

I always sit at the bar - bone in filet is my MAIN squeeze. 

Would eat every meal there if my wallet allowed. 

Recommend the tomato + burrata appetizer - TRUE palette teaser.
author: Jordan Z.

description:
I really want to like this place, but both times I went there the steak was just OK.  Went for dinner with friends and tried their new, special bone-in filet.  It was wanting for flavor and not very hot, even though I ate it right away.

The crab was pretty good, although I prefer vietnamese crab from PPQs, Kim Thanh, etc.
author: Joseph C.

description: Very yummy.  But too pricey for this level of food so I have to give 4 stars.  For this price I would expect even better compare to other steak house in the same price range but better tasted food.  But still it's DeLiCious!
author: Natalia k.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate his birthday. I've heard great things about this place for years. Yes, the food and service was great. I would have given this place 5 stars, but when I got the bill, I was disappointed. When we sat down  the host knocked down my purse that was on my chair. When I went to pick it up, I'd stepped on the base off the table and everything spilled over. Yes, red and white wine all over me.   Hard for stemware not to tip  over with padded tables. Anyways, they staff was quick to help me get cleaned up. They offered to get us new glasses. When the bill came, the 2 glasses of wine were on the bill. When I doubled checked with our server, she said since it was not the fault of the restaurant, the mamager said they would not comp it off. I don't complain at all when it comes to restaurant service since I am a restaurant manager myself.  However,  I would not have charged
For the wine, since it was an accident,  Made more so, since it all started with the host knocking over my purse , and I had to pick it up.
author: Mimi S.

description:
The Good: The quality of steak was amazing. I had the bone-in filet, and the portion of actual meat was a generous 10 oz if not more.

The Bad: Compared to Harris, Morton's, and other nice steakhouses, the sides were small and therefore relatively expensive. The same goes for the appetizers. Menu is somewhat limited as steak choices include only filet and new york strip.

The Ugly: The decor of this place leaves so much to be desired for and is a big contribution to the poor reviews. We were sat on the second floor, which is a space with no windows and somewhat tight seating. There was no feel of elegance or class in this restaurant.
author: Michael L.

description: Had dinner here again - having been a dozen times over the years - I can honestly say they've lost there touch - absolutely nothing special - over priced for below average food and portions now.  Too many other great steak houses in SF now.  I will not be back.
author: Paul B.

description:
A good steak place.  But there are too many in the City.  Here is what I say, and what should matter to you:

1) They pride themselves on having a "bone in" filet.  I say nonesense.  Get yourself edumacated and look it up if that is what's making you salivate: that's false advertising for a more "prime" cut of a T-bone or Porterhouse (aka New York Strip w/ bone in you smucks).  So stop raving about this.  But yes, a T-bone steak is generally juicy because it is cooked with the bone in.

2) What IS worth raving about is their wine list.  You can get yourself some good wines here at somewhere closer to 2x the retail range.  And they have a great wine list.  THAT my friends is why you would come all the way out here to the middle of nowhere to eat.

3) Food is good, but very traditional.  

Service I hear is hit or miss.  I had great service here.  But my friends, eh, had less.
author: Mark M.

description:
mmm mmm mmmm.. steak get in my bully! This place is awesome! The ambiance is awesome! Free valet parking? Even more awesome! 

I ordered their bone-in-filet Mignon and omg, it was delicious. Ok, I was a little spoiled and had the opportunity to dine at Del Frrisco's in Dallas, this wasnt as good but came pretty close! Definitely something to order if you are a meat lover! We also ordered their crab for an appetizer dish. Personally, I really enjoyed the crab dish but others at the table thought it was only ok.
author: Katie N.

description: This is by far the best steak house/ seafood in the bay area. The muscles are amazing and service is always super friendly. The atmosphere of this restaurant is very mellow yet inviting perfect for a romantic date.
author: Michelle I.

description: Hands down my favorite steakhouse in all of San Francisco and I've been to quite a few. I highly recommend the bone in filet mignon. It melts in your mouth. As for the sides, I would recommend the Brussels sprouts and the mushrooms. Service is excellent as always. Keep up the good work!!
author: Ernesto D.

description:
Where to start, where to start? Love Bobo's! This is an all encompassing type of love.

1. Love that it's raised above Lombard Street - potential for a fun nighttime view if you can snag a table window side.

2. Love the intimate, warm, romantic feel.

3. On to more important things....their filet is probably my favorite in the city.  I've never had to resort to the regular filet, I've lucked out both times I've been with getting the bone-in. Caloric galore! 

4. They also nail the appetizers.  Bobo's, please don't ever change / remove the toy box tomato and avocado appetizer. I cringe even thinking this may ever be non-existent in my life. The lobster crostini is also "wow" worthy.  

I've been here twice on special occasions, but I'm getting antsy, so may have to stop in just because. So good!
author: Brianna M.

description:
WHOA, this place is a major DISLIKE! ... and here are my reasons why:

1) We made reservations for a SURPRISE birthday dinner at 8:30 pm.  Our table was not ready until 9:30 pm!!! What kind of surprise do you think our beloved friend got?!?! 

Sure, the hostess did apologize and told us that some people take longer than others.  But I honestly think that's an excuse for bad time management.  Having gone to plenty of comparable fine dining establishments, a one hour wait is unheard of!!  By the time we got a table, we might as well have just walked in at 9:30 pm without reservations at all.

I say, if you can't handle reservations, don't take any at all!  

I had already originally asked for a 7:30 pm reservation.  Given that you offered me a 8:30 pm reservation, could you at least have made it on time?!?  In total, that was a 2 hour delay!!! 

2) Highly overrated food, high prices! I'm okay with paying high prices for either impeccable service or great tasting food.  However, as stated, service was terrible given that we had to wait for an hour!  You would think after waiting for an hour, they'd treat you nicer or give you bread/ water once you took a seat, but even then things took forever!  We had to ask for our bread! The steak was a decent sized cut, but the texture was bad for 40-50 bucks!! For a fillet mignon, it was quite chewy.  One of my friend's medium rare was cooked pretty rare!  Gosh, for being a supposedly 'reputable' steakhouse, can anything more go wrong?!  To top it off, the sides were extremely pricey, and did I mention dinky?!  Baked potato for $8!  Mac & cheese was the tiniest portion I've seen relative to many other places -- $8!! Mussels and shrimp were okay.

Loud environment, over-crowded.  Theatrical like decor a la Cirque du Soleil. 

I think we were one of the last ones to leave the restaurant! I'm definitely not recommending this place to any of my friends!  I was hoping I would have a lot of good things to say about this dining establishment, but apparently not! (Maybe except for the free valet parking)

I'm all for Mastro's!! Flemings!! Harris!!  Gosh, even chain restaurants are better then the experience we had here!!! :P
author: Tramy V.

description:
When we first walked into Bobo's, I felt slightly claustrophobic because it is such a tiny place and everything is squished in tight, but I had no idea of the experience that was yet to come.  We were celebrating a friend's birthday, who had been told that the food here was excellent.  Whoever told her that did not steer us wrong.

We were seated in a booth in the back room. We all ordered steaks, either filet or rib-eyes, and most of us ordered it with crab legs.  Our sides included a twice-baked potato, mac n cheese, and green beans.  The service was great and our food all came out quickly.

My filet was cooked perfectly.  The crab legs that came with it were plentiful and I shared some with my friend and was still overly stuffed when I was done eating.  They were covered in a garlic butter sauce so I didn't even need to dip it in butter once I got the meat out of the shells.  The twice-baked potato was amazin and I'm not even a big potato fan.  

My only gripe was that the server recommended three sides to be enough for our party and I didn't even get to try the mac n cheese because it wasn't enough.  We could have easily ordered two more sides.  Maybe it's our fault though, for being giant piggies!
author: Mandi L.

description: This may be the best steak house in San Francisco -- or anywhere.  The bone-in filet mignon was amazing, as was the twice baked potato.  I'm a purist, so I was skeptical of the addition of fontina cheese and zucchini to the twice baked potato, but it was creamy and delicious.  The toy box tomato salad was also very good, as were the brussel sprouts with pancetta.  No misses with anything we ordered.  It's also nice that they offer complimentary parking.
author: S S.

description:
REVIEW NOTE: I am not associated in any way with this restaurant or any other restaurant.

I'm not sure whether this restaurant has good food or not.  We never made it that far.  My friend and I were looking forward to a memorable evening, but left after just a few minutes inside, not even bothering to finish our drinks.

I have been dining in San Francisco for over 30 years, and have NEVER felt as unwelcome as here.  The attitude of the staff was stuffy, snobby, aloof, almost arrogant.  Very, very disappointing.
author: Mike H.

description:
Yuck

Rubbery overbuttered low quality steak
Rubbery overbuttered overcooked Dungeness

The best part of the meal was the Coke.
Sizzler quality at steakhouse prices

And the final nail in the coffin: CLOWNS EVERYWHERE. So creepy.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Amazeballs:

the bread 
mussels
bone-in filet mignon
mac and cheese
twice baked potato
chocolate bomb
freeeeeeeeeeeee valet (still makes me feel baller after i've just spent all my money *sidenote* maybe they should open a Bobo's in Vegas???)

$45 a la cart steak, $12 sides, $9 dessert

I'll definitely be back on the next special occasion!
author: Calvin W.

description: Disappointing.  While the food was not bad, for the price paid, the experience was a letdown.  I've had better meals for half the cost.  Didn't care for the lighting and waiter was not that friendly (responded to question about the size of the salad just by pointing to a plate).  Steak was ok, but not seasoned at all.  Onion rings were the highlight, actually.  It wasn't a terrible meal, but given that I would not return again even though it's my kind of food, I feel this rating reflects my feeling appropriately.
author: Marc S.

description:
This place was just ok in my opinion. 

Decent cocktails, pretty good steak, and a terrible twice baked potato (baffled how you screw that up). 

Ambiance is humorous (think circus meets TGI Fridays).

At this price point there are much better options in SF so I don't see my self coming back anytime soon.
author: David F.

description:
delicious steak. medium rare is a little too cooked. rare is too bloody... wish they could do rare plus!

the olive bread they serve in the beginning of the meal is very satisfying! 

onion rings is a MUST as a steak side dish!
author: Betty T.

description: If you want the best steak in San Francisco you need to come to Bobo's! Me and my husband and all of our friends have been coming here for years and every time it's the best experience. The staff is always phenomenal and the ambience is great!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Arrived with a party of 6 and we were seated within 5 minutes. Started off with the lobster soup, which was delicious, interesting flavor with the curry. I ordered the BONE IN FILET, it was amazing. Cooked on the rarer side but was delicious and very juicy. We ordered the mushrooms and the twice-baked potato, which I highly recommend to accompany the Steak. My boyfriend's brother ordered the 1/2 crab with mini filet, which was served with perfect proportions of both. Our server was a Hispanic man in his 30's (blanking on his name) and was an excellent server with a great personality. 
The next time I am looking to eat a good steak, or want to recommend a good steak to someone I will think of BOBOS
author: Rachel H.

description: Don't waist your money pricey to crowded & Noise level is over the top.   Where is a manager when you need to speak with one?
author: Martha O.

description: Best steak I have ever eaten. Very unique spot, not packed full of tourists. This is for those that know the difference between a good steak and a great steak.
author: Jason B.

description:
The rating would of been a lot better with out the mediocre service.    Don't get me wrong, there was nothing wrong with the food, the bone in filet mignon was cook to perfection, and same goes for my girlfriend's bone-in new york steak. This was a very special night for the 2 of us because we're celebrating our 2 year anniversary, so we decided to give this place a try.
