Parking was surprisingly not too bad, we found street parking on the same block. They do offer valet if you chose to do so. 

Anyways back to why this place does not deserve a higher rating, so we were seated to our table, our server comes up to our table to greet us, asked if this was our first visit, we replied yes. he chuckled and walked away. We felt a unwelcome vibe from him because it felt like he thought that this was the very first time we've dined out at a steakhouse and that the tip probably wouldn't be that great, so he didn't even bother to tell us about the specials or what he would recommend. This guy totally ruined the vibe for our dinner, but good thing I had good company and we made it an enjoyable experience. 

The complimentary bread was awesome , I may consider going back , praying that I don't get that same waiter.... treating your guest like that will likely not get you a nice tip.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Seldom do I feel motivated to write sub par reviews but this evenings meal was worthy of a rant. Prior to tonight I've dined here twice. Service and food was commendable. Unfortunately, on this occasion service and food had deteriorated. Our empty appetizer plates remained on the table 20 minutes after consumption. My empty martini shaker remained on the table the entire meal. I refilled my own water x3 and martini x2. At the end of our entree, which we sent back due to being under cooked, our server (Tao) attempted to refill my glass with the melted ice water from the empty shaker.  When we mentioned that our medium rare filet's were under cooked (meat was black/blue) our server was very defensive and gave me a short lecture on steak!  It shouldn't come as a shock that our empty entree plates were never cleared either.

Needless to say we felt inclined to voice our observations to restaurant management. The manager was apologetic and offered to comp our cocktail. However, the manager failed to return with our change!  

By the way, this was our anniversary dinner. What a bummer.

The twice baked potato, Chard and vodka Gibson up were delicious.
author: Alfonse P.

description:
I've eaten many a steaks, believe me...not is sf, but San Diego mostly. I worked at a steakhouse in sd. I've been to Ruths' Chris, Donovan's, Morton's steak house, and in SF I've been to Bourbon Steak House; but Bobo's (Boboquivari's, whatever! They have two Yelp pages) gets an honest 2-star from my taste buds.

I went there with my fiance on Valentines day this year. The service was okay, but I got the vibe that they were short-staffed for such a big day.

The steak I give a 2 because the so-called prime filet was choice at best.
I give the service a 3; but because the steak was not what I expected from the Yelpers' reviews, I would probably give the restaurant as a whole 2 1/2, and that's being nice (from my taste buds anyways).

Swanky, overpriced, and not the quality advertized on their website.
author: Michelle R.

description: Went to dinner here with my gf. Steak was excellent as expected. Both steaks were cooked to perfection. I got the New York with bone, and she got the petite filet mignon. She got yams as well which was a great side dish. Only downfall to the place was that the lighting was a bit too dark. Other than that, good service and food made this dinner an excellent choice.
author: Nathan G.

description:
Made reservations and was seated within 10 minutes of it. The bar area is very small and was very crowded. After being seated, our waitress came to get our drink orders and pour water after about 5-7 minutes (which is way too long for a drink order!!). She waa friendly but looked busy (it was MDW). After ordering appetizers and our main course, the food took a little too long but it was definitely worth the wait.

Yellowtail carpaccio was freakin delicious! Definitely 4.5/5 stars.
Grilled shrimp was good, not great.
Petit filet and bone-in filet were sooooo good! Tender, juicy, tasteful.
Twice baked potato was delicious, too.

I think we would come here again. The food was worth it but the service is only mediocre.
author: T N.

description:
I had been to Bobo's once before with my friends and wasn't a big fan, but I decided to give it another shot along with my wife (her first time) due to all the good reviews.

One word to summarize: mediocre.

We waited about 15 minutes at the entrance of the restaurant for our table and were then led up a confusing set of stairs to a low-ceilinged, jam packed 3rd floor of the restaurant.  There were about 5 two-seater tables that were available, so I'm not sure why we waited, and I'm also not sure why they decided to seat us in the small dark "alcove" of that room when there were so many other available tables that were getting some nice sunlight from outside.  Our table was extremely close to another table which basically made us feel like we were sitting at a 4-top rather than having the intimate dinner we were looking for.  I noticed all of the other tables were like this, so if you are looking for a private, intimate dinner, then this is not your place.  It was IMPOSSIBLE not to overhear our neighbors' conversation (and vice versa) so we inevitably ended up talking to the couple next to us.  Luckily they were cool people so we had a good conversation with them.  That was probably the best part of the experience to be honest.  

Bobo's decor is old.  Not in the classic, ageless way.  But rather in the dusty, "this place is about to fall apart" way.  At one point I had to go to the bathroom and it required that I walk down a set of stairs, through another dining room, and past a set of curtains.  Nothing was clearly marked and it made me feel like I was trying to find the Wizard of Oz.

Our waitress was polite and relatively attentive, but nothing extraordinary.  When ordering our steaks, she walked away without asking for our preference on how the steaks are cooked.  I understand if the restaurant/chef has a standard method of cooking steaks, but they should verbally state "we cook our steaks medium-rare, is that okay with you?".  As it turns out, this is indeed the way they operate.  Both of us prefer medium-rare anyways, so this was a non-issue, but it did make us wonder and worry about how they would actually cook our steaks, so we had to follow up with the waitress to ask and find out.

Now for the worst part.  The food. And the associated cost.

I ordered a dry aged, bone-in NY strip and my wife ordered the filet mignon/crab leg combo.  The steaks were mediocre.  That is all I can say.  They were cooked okay, but my main complaint would be flavor.  There was none.  The grass fed steaks that my wife and I cook at home are better than what I had there.  At least some basic seasoning (salt/pepper) should be applied.  The absolute worst part was the seafood.  Someone else commented on Yelp that their seafood was poor, and I can definitely attest to that.  The crab legs were.... fishy.  Straight up.  They were dry and fishy.  

After an extremely sub-par meal, our tab came to the table for more than $200 for my wife and I.  We have decided never to return.  If you are thinking of going to Bobo's, I would recommend taking a look at Alexander's, Ruth's Chris, or you can try picking up a nice steak from Brian's in Presidio Heights or from Fatted Calf and cook it at home.
author: D. L.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner with my parents. We made reservations, although it didn't seem like we needed them because there were a bunch of open tables at 7:15, but maybe they were reserved for later times, too. Cute place, but a little dim. I sat by the window so I had plenty of light, but my mom kept complaining there wasn't enough lighting, especially with the iron skillets casting a shadow on the table. Then she tried to bring the candle over, but it was a fake candle so it didn't do much. Haha!

We started with the Yellowtail Carpaccio. Yum! Lots of flavor, and cut very thinly. We all had a hard time biting through the bread they serve. The edges were REALLY hard. I ordered the Petite Filet Mignon, which I LOVED. They also had the Bone-in available, but I don't like bones. I hear it's amazing, though. I ordered it medium, and from my experience, medium was a little more pink than what I got, but was delicious nonetheless. My parents ordered the Combo of crab, shrimp, and mussels, and also another order of mussels and shrimp. They seemed to enjoy it, and really liked the dipping sauces. I also got the Twice Baked Potato. Very flavorful, perfect texture (not dry), and a pretty big potato! I couldn't finish it. The only thing I didn't like is that you have to order vegetables from the side orders. Everything comes a la carte, but I usually expect it to come with some potatoes, and a little side of veggies. 

Oh! They also have this AWESOME after dinner napkin presentation. I call it a presentation because I asked our waitress to do it again. It's basically a little compressed napkin the size of a huge mint, and they pour water over it and it grows into a folded up wet nap! Pretty coooool.

Service was excellent. Our waitress was great. Overall, we all enjoyed our meals, and I'd definitely be back!
author: Jaime H.

description: Amazing place the steak melts in your mouth like butter and what i got is the mussels and crab it was the seafood plate I've ever had, comes on a hot skillet amazing dipping sauces
author: Brittany S.

description:
I have 3 words to say about Bobo's 1) Bone 2) in 3) filet...thats it. 

Oh and maybe 2 more words...Brussel Sprouts!

and maybe...garlic bread (man their garlic bread is like baked crack)

How many words are in Dirty Bombay Martini with extra olives? Anyway, everything is good in this place AND they'll valet your car for FREE!!! Free parking in San Francisco...can you believe it!?! Well sure you'll believe it when you get the bill because this place ain't cheap and I can attest to this having over paid for their delicious food oh...6 times or so and counting. Easily one of my favorite spots in the city and a lot has to do with the ambiance of this joint. Quarky floor plan, lots of dark corners, red velvet everywhere and strange things hanging from the walls and its 100% perfect.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Wow------try this gem because the steak is AWESOME.

There were one or two complaints my wife and I had initially---but the owner actually contacted us. How rare is that?

Listen----in my book if an owner cares enough to contact you to address your concerns---the restaurant is worthy of your time and money.

Give it a try----and get the filet with the bone !!!!!!
author: Chris O.

description:
Edit: Changing my rating although I do think the bone-in filet deserves 5 stars!

I thought Boboquivari's was decent. The steak itself is a reason to come back. 

The restaurant was a bit difficult to get to... well just traffic/ good old hilly SF city-wise. Make sure you don't miss the restaurant because the valet area is only about two car lengths long.

Our party of four ordered drinks and then mussels for our appetizer and I believe each table receives bread. I enjoyed the mussels, nice and warm and dare I say buttery. I didn't like the bread much at all... very dry and hard, I hurt my teeth trying to take my first bite!

I just ordered the crab salad since I ate a late lunch. I know...bad idea :( It was okay but not to die for. Everyone else in our party ordered the bone-in filet mignon and for good reason! I tried a piece of my bf's filet and I must say it was the most tender piece of steak I have ever had! Loved it. 

Our party ordered 3 sides to share: brussel sprouts, kale and yams. I liked the yams so so much but I only got about a tablespoon since we all shared. It was nice to try a few different sides though!

For dessert my bf and I shared the Panna Cotta. I would've licked the plate if my tummy wasn't so full. The other couple got the chocolate cake and pretty much licked the plate clean as well.

I would come back here if I was really craving amazingly tender steak (kudos!) and my friends wanted to go!
author: Tiffany T.

description: After making reservation, we still had to wait 15-20 minutes to be seated, this restaurant is multi-level so we were seated by the little corner on the top floor next to a huge 20 people party, if we were 10 lb heavier, we would not be able to fit in that section, the curtains framing the seating area made me feel like I was in the penalty room, I was feeling completely claustrophobic, and the greasy smell in the restaurant didn't help making me feel any better, I was nauseated. They cannot help it if they are busy and had to make us wait, and cannot help the layout of the restaurant, what was I thinking eating at a steak and seafood restaurant and expect it to not be greasy? but to be honest, other than the crab dish, I cannot remember anythiing else I had that night unless I access the photos I took with my phone. So it wasn't memorable, all I remember was how uncomfortable I was.
author: Helen H.

description:
I went here on Valentine's day, they didn't have a separate designated menu for vday, which is good. It is really small and cramp in here and there's only one restroom.

The service was good and the food didn't take too long to come out either.
I ordered the surf n turf which comes with:
- Petite filet mignon (I got it medium rare), it was the perfect size for a small girl like me and juicy
- Crab legs, it was too salty for me
I also ordered extra sides:
- Twice baked potato, I thought this was a really good compliment for the filet mignon
- Mac n cheese, I didn't like this dish, neither did my date
author: Xaviera L.

description:
I like it when businesses are proactive in wanting to know our experience at their establishments.  So I took my friend Kevin L here for his bday dinner.  Quite possibly the fastest dinner I have ever had in a steakhouse.  Keep in my mind, they also have FREE valet parking.   Yes...............FREE!!!!!  

From the moment we stepped out of the car, into the restaurant, ate, paid, and came back to the car, it was 40 minutes.  I'm pretty sure the engine was still warm when we got back.

So............onto the meal.  Started out with a cocktail.  My new drink of choice is now whiskey, and Bulliet is it's name.   A very smooth whiskey might I add.  Started out with their house salad.  As I get older, I seem to gravitate more towards rabbit food.  I hate it when girls say I don't eat rabbit food.  Girl.............look at yourself.  Throw in a salad once in a while and you won't look like that.  haahahahhaa.  Ok.........back to the food.

I ordered the bone in new york.  Mine was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  Seared evenly on both sides and seasoned perfectly.  The quality of the meat is probably one of the best in the City.  I believe Omaha still have the best steaks but we aren't in Omaha right?  Kevin ordered the bone in filet.  His came out more on the rare side.  Had some of his meat as well (I'm talking about the steak) and it was very tender.  I like my steak with a little bit of texture, so believe it or not, I don't like filets that much.   You really can't go wrong with any of the dishes.  Had some mushrooms, nothing really special about them.

Paid the bill...............went to get the car and the valet guy said so fast?!?
author: jason g.

description: That many reviews cannot be wrong! The bone in filet and twice baked potato were very good.  Looking forward to another visit
author: Will I A m.

description:
My fiance took me here for my birthday and we had an awesome time. Ironically I'd found this place over 7 years ago but for whatever reason never found my way here. I have several friends who swear by the filet on the bone here and they're right. The filet on the bone is amazing. Service was great and personally I dug the unique decor. 

We ordered the lobster crustini which was really good and the baby romain salad with panchetta and bleu cheese dressing. The salad was simple and good. We also got the mac and cheese and onion rings for sides. As far as everything besides the steak, it was good, pretty good even but not on par with the how good the steak is. So  I was told the garlic bread they provide is amazing. It was really good but not sure about amazing. To sum up the food, the fliet on the bone amazing. Everything else was good and very typical steak house fare but not blow me away type of food.

One thing I have to say about this place is they make a solid cocktail. They had this drink called a Bohattan which had one of my favorite bourbons Basil Hayden and Fernet. Two of my favorites and it was awesome. 

All in all I will say it was an awesome dinner and I will definitely be back.
author: Hyung L.

description:
My bf's been raving about this place since his co-workers were telling him that their steak is so good. 

So we made reservation last saturday and ordered:
Mussels (appetizer)
2 Bone-In Filet mignon 
side of twice baked potato & portobello mushrooms
2 glass of syrah
Total: $160

Excellent..Excellent steak! I love meat and their steak was incredible as if I was slicing butter ;)  My bf loves prime rib & loves to go to House of Prime Rib, but he enjoyed his meal as much as I did. TWO THUMBS UP!
author: Maria S.

description:
It pains me to give Bobo's 2-stars. I've heard that this is one of the (if not) best Steaks in SF...me totally thinks not! I booked reservations way in advance for Father's Day. +1 for the free Valet in front, I LOVE Valet! Once we walked in it took nearly 5 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. While standing there waiting it gave me the opportunity to check out all the weird decorations and clowns on the walls. Once the hostess finally came over she informed me that our table wasn't ready and it would be a few minutes. 10 minutes later we were finally seated. 

We started off with cocktails, I ordered the Q-Ball (hangar one citron, fresh cucumber with lemon & mint) $12. This drink tasted more like cucumber, 7up and tonic water with a TON of ice mixed in. Overpriced (nasty) beverages generally put me in a bad mood, put I put my reservations aside and was ready to devour some steak! 

Here's the rundown of of our order: 

- Bone-in New York
- Surf & Turf (half crab & petit fillet mignon) 
- Swiss chard with garlic & olive oil
- Mac & Cheese 
- Twice-baked potato

My NY steak was completely overcooked and tough to chew (I ordered it Medium). The Crab with the Surf and Turf had absolutely no flavor, it was as if they boiled it with no seasoning and thew it on the plate. +1 star because my husband REALLY enjoyed the Petit Filet - he described it as one of the best he's ever had. The sides were all bad - Mac & Cheese being the worst, tasted like it came out of a Kraft box. 

$200 later I can say without a doubt that I will never come back here again! There are far too many great steakhouses in SF and sadly, this isn't one of them!
author: Krystal C.

description:
I would bypass the sides & go straight to the bone in filet. The service is good, but make sure you make reservations. 

Great for dates, with all the little nooks & curtained tables.....
author: A. B.

description:
I really like their petite filet mignon, bone-in.  The meat is so tender.  Jr. yelper had the same and hubby got the NY steak.  We all started with different salads - Jr. Yelper liked the Caesar, I got the usual cranberry/walnut/apple one and hubby had the house salad.  For sides, we really liked the onion rings which was a 1/2 onion with lge rings, well breaded and crunchy.  The portabello mushrooms was just lge mushrooms diced into lge pieces.  I couldn't finish my mignon and Jr. Yelper consumed it the next day for a late evening snack.  Grrrrr.....'
We shared the choc mousse in 4 sm waffle cones.  It was OK, wouldn't re-order next time.  I should've gone with my gut feeling and tried the blood orange sorbet instead.  
Talk about coincidence, we sat in the exact same booth upstairs the first time we came here! 
Service was polite and prompt.
author: Ry T.

description:
The food was poor quality.  Mac and Cheese had the wrong noodles and was soggy.   Bone in filet had. I flavor at all.  Overall this place is very over rated and over priced.
Thank god for the bartender as he saved the night with his stiff drinks.
author: Michael A.

description:
It's with some reluctance I write this review, but I have to say beware of Bobo's. I've been here at least a half dozen times and have enjoyed myself each time. However, I recently had a disturbing event occur. 

The dinner was excellent and the service was good. We left a 25 percent tip. 

However, like a dumbass, I left my computer bag there. I call the next day to see if they have it. They claim they do not. I call again later - specifically asking if someone has found a computer bag - they again say that no one knows of any bag that has been turned in. I find this odd.

I call to make a police report, assuming that a fellow patron made off with it. They ask if the restaurant has video surveillance. If they do, an officer will meet me there to review the surveillance with them.

I call Bobo's today and ask them when a good time would be to stop by and review the security footage. The hostess immediately gets a manager (the guy who served us our drinks that night no less) who tells me they have the bag. He claims that the hostess from the previous day asked if a computer had been turned in. She didn't ask about a bag, despite being told it was a brown messenger bag with a computer in it. Again, very odd. 

What's more, my business card was clearly visible in the clear plastic holder in the front of the bag. Apparently, no one looked in the bag to determine the owner or bothered to look for this card, which had all of my contact information on it. This, despite my having called in twice to ask about a computer bag and also having left my number. 

Pretty shady IMHO. Perhaps I'm being too cynical? Anyway, to the excellent servers and cooks that created my meal, kudos. To whomever at Bobo's thought they could keep my bag, get fucked.
author: Jay N.

description: Went to Bobo's on Thanksgiving Day for an early dinner with friends. Overall the experience  was really nice, easy going. This is one of the few places in the city that has free valet; two thumbs up for that. However on the flip side to that; you are going to spend over $200.00 on a shared meal......uhmm so yea......they know what they are doing with that ......for real. Getting to the food........the bone in Ribeye was perfection.....medium inside nicely charred outside......like butta baybey.....not to mention the twice baked potato was doing a lil sumthin' sum thin' too.  This place is a San Francisco favorite for locals like myself. Driving down Lombard street it stands sexy and proud with its iconic black and red awning.....park, go in.....and yea that's a different explosion all together. The decor is a bit dated and ma-sug-na.....but hey it all starts to look like the red light special after a few drinks......not to mention that the service from the staff is very personable and engaging. And I may want to restate  while a shared meal with a couple cocktails and some wine with your steak and twice baked potatoe...Ooooh almost forgot....and a shared apple salad.....it's the tip that will push the amount closer to $300.00.  Loved every minute of it.....Bon Appetito!!
author: Stacie J.

description: Restaurant is adorable. Really cozy, and has a really nice red and purple theme going on. The steak was good but isn't the best I've had, but the Crab is to DIE for.
author: Cheri K.

description:
I really liked the complimentary valet .... cause looking for parking when steak beckons really sucks.

The drinks we tried were also pretty good.  We tried:
Q-Ball - This is like a manly girl's drink.  Refreshing and tasty for those who don't like super sweet cocktails, but don't want a shot of whiskey either.

The Beau - what is it about ginger?  This was tasty ... and had it not been for the $12 price tag, I could probably drink 9 of them.

As for dinner - filet mignon (8 oz) was great - prepared accurately, quality meat.  The twice baked potato and the swiss chard were also pretty good - as to be expected.  You don't come to a steakhouse for the steak to be anything below "very good".

Minus 1 star for the weird service.  A robot would have been more personable I think.  The first thing he said to our group as we waited for the birthday boy to arrive and as we were admiring the magnum of wine one of the guests brought was - "I'm going to be charging you for 4 corkage fees".  Yes - good evening to you too ... and how are YOU doing?  

Everyone else was friendly and otherwise we had a great evening.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
3 Star because of the following:
     -Poor service (party of 8) - one server and was very unfriendly.
     -Cocktail was HORRIBLE (Had the dream - was more of a nightmare) - waiter didn't care.
     -Building is a bit run down 
     -Best Steak I've ever eaten! 

Go here for the quality of steak you'll get, not the quality of service or drinks you'll get.
author: L N.

description:
Free valet. Score! 

Drinks were watered down. 

Hamachi carpaccio was bomb!

My house salad was good and my date also enjoyed his walnut (?) salad.

Bone in filet was so good.. I couldn't finish it. And it was a bit too oily for my taste. If I didn't have the salad I'm sure I could've at more!
author: L M.

description: Bobo's was recommended to us by a native SF person. We went for dinner and were promptly seated.  Very knowledgeable & polite waiter, who helped with suggestions.  We wanted dessert so we split a meal and he didn't mind. Everything was spectacular.  I love crab and my daughters have never eaten it where they had to actually crack the claws and get the crab meat out. It was a fun experience for them. ( a little messy, but still delicious) We had just enough food so that we could get dessert and it was all worth it. Our favorite was the mango panna cotta and the blood orange sorbet.  The best we have had.  Thanks to Bobo's for a memorable meal. We will return when we come back to the city.
author: Richele P.

description:
My bf and I felt like having a good piece of steak so I turned to yelp to give us some guidance. We were trying to look for this place and there was  a guy standing right outside ready to park our car, perfect! I hate looking for parking in the city.

As we stroll inside, the ambiance looked very romantic inside: dim lights, quiet and peaceful, not a place for an after party, but romantic.  The host asked for my bf's name and she told him that there was a wait but we can sit at the bar because is was open. I wanted to sit at a table for more comfort so I said we'll wait but we scooted by the bar because there was no waiting room which was a bummer.

After a few minutes my bf said, lets wait by the door instead so she'll see us. So we were waiting there and the host asked us for our names again. My bf' reminds her that we just put on the waiting list. She then asked for his name again and was not put on there the first time. Ummm ok... I have patience but the woman seemed off?
She then tells us that it will be a 30 minute wait, and we were fine with that but she didn't say that the first time. She then tells us again to have a drink at the bar if we wanted to drink. I was like "ok, I know whats up, I use to be a waitress" but no, I do not drink so I do not want to sit for a drink, I want my meat dammit! 

So, we waited for only 10 minutes, then she told us that reservations didn't come so she sat us down near the window upstairs and it was of nice of her. I think she knew I was kind of irked. 

Our food: I had a surf and turf and my bf had a bone in Filet Mignon. We got our food and I swear! It was like sex in my mouth! Freakin good food orgasm! My dad is a chef and he cooks great and all but sorry dad, I've just had the juiciest, tender meat go in my mouth! We  also had the mac and cheese and half baked potato. The mac and cheese was too heavy and bland for me but the potato was pretty good.

If I had to order again, I would get my bf's dish because the crab was ok, it had a poop looking sauce on it that I was not too fond of but the meat was awesome!  

Overall, I would come back for the filet Mignon =)
author: Tammy V.

description:
Amazing food, service and atmosphere! From the attentive waitstaff, the between course refreshers, and the yummy desert make this more of an experience than just a dinner.
I would definitely come back here again...
author: Rosyan C.

description: Canceled reservation at Ruth's to try this place. Not a happy camper! Food (bone-in filet mignon, twice baked potato (over rated), Brussels sprouts, and mushrooms) was alright. The bread was the best thing there.
author: Sione K.

description:
Surf & Turf my heart!!!
Sizzeling goodness of shrimp scampi and sautéed crap legs.... And an aged new York strip steak to die for. Sides I also enjoyed were the brussel sprouts, mushrooms, and mac & cheese. This is one of my top favorite steak places in the city. Swank ambiance & vibe. Friendly & helpful staff....
author: Teena Marie T.

description: Twice baked, brussels sprouts, bone-in filet, and a pair of Anchors... AMAZING!  Be back every time I'm in town.
author: Gannon M.

description:
I love the decor of this place and the food.  The bone in filets were fantastic and I split the new york strip with my Mom which was done perfectly (as we like it very rare and the chef did listen to this and prepare it as asked).  We also did the lobster and crab cristinis which were fabulous, I loved the lobster one best.  We did the lobster soup, also.  Upon the first glance on the menu, the lobster soup includes curry, which can turn some people off, but it really is some great flavors that meld together quite nicely.

The sides we chose were the mushrooms and mod mac.  Both were very yummy.  The steaks were all great.  

The complaints I had were the hostesses.  We came in and I had planned a dinner reservation months and months ahead of time and told them it was my Mom's birthday and would love a nice table.  They took us upstairs and to this back little dungeon room, which is the room they have the large table in and the bathrooms and put the 4 of us in a little cramped table right next to the bathroom.  I went back downstairs and asked if we could get a different table and they looked annoyed and gave me a bit of attitude... like "that table is perfectly good"... and that is fine if they think that but it was a customer preference and I shouldn't have had to give a reason (in my opinion).  They took us to another table in the front room upstairs which was gorgeous and bright and by the window.  I noted that they tried to place 3 other groups in the table they tried to put us and only one stayed at that table... I think they may just put people there and hope no one complains.  I loved our new table though.  our waiter was nice... not overly great service but not bad by any means.

The food was great, the atmosphere was very nice, the wine list was great... I just think the service could have been a bit better or people could have given a smile and attempted to give a feeling of the customer being wanted at the restaurant.

I will go back for dinner again, but I hope service improves... :)
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
My gf took me here for my birthday dinner.

I can absolutely vouch for their steak. I ordered their new york cut which was cooked to perfection - seared nicely to give that nice hint of smoky flavor and at the same time having the tenderness of a beautiful medium rare. Probably up there with the most well made steaks in the Bay Area.

Their roasted muscles were delicious as well. Coming sizzling to the table and cooked very well. They were nice little morsels of tenderness. Also highly recommended.

I can't say the same about their crab. I'd go so far to say that I've had better crab at a value Chinese buffet. Granted, we didn't go during crab season which may have played a role... but I thought it was unacceptable how dry the crab was. Better left unserved in my opinion. 

I was also kind of turned off by the service. I remember asking one of the servers what kind of muscles they served us (because I liked them so much) and I was never given an answer. He said he would check with the chef but he never came back to tell us. Second, the drink cocktail they served me was very haphazardly made. It was supposed to have a rim of black salt on it, but when it came back there was hardly any salt on the rim and most of it was on the side of the glass. I actually had to have the waitress confirm because I started to believe it could've been steak grease. The drink itself was good, but I think you should get what you pay for. If I wanted a crappily made drink, I could've done that myself!

In any case, I might be back for the steak and muscles but I'd probably avoid anything else. Hopefully the next time I visit, the service will be better.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
Very trendy place with a fun, funky atmosphere
Yellowtail Carpaccio- Excellent, would order again

Petit Filet was cooked perfectly. I would recommend a steak here
author: Bryan H.

description:
As long as steak is not your main reason for trying this place out, I am sure you will have a pleasurable experience. 

I chose this restaurant based on an email I received from Open Table. I love myself a good steak, and my date enjoys crab so after some quick research I thought "why not?" 

I pulled up to free valet service which was a major load of my shoulders given how bad parking is in SF. We were quickly greeted and seated for our reservation.  The venue is quite nice and has a very intimate feel. The tables were rather small though and space was limited. Our waiter was prompt, knowledgeable, and when given the opportunity to choose a drink for me, he did not fail to amaze. Now on to the food.

My complaint is in line with many of the other complaints about this place. The steak says they are cooked "medium-rare" ....(I even requested medium-rare)....but the steak came medium-well to well done. I ordered the porterhouse and though I was happy with the portion size, the steak was not cooked correctly. It was dry and tough. Even my date asked "how did you order this?" Not impressed especially at $60+

Now the crab, that was amazing. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. I wasnt able to hold much of a convo with my date because she was busy enjoying every bit of her half crab. Im not a big seafood fan but even I got in on the action. Succulent and flavorful. Oh and the bread everyone keeps mentioning....yea...its pretty darn good. A bit messy, but definitely worth it. Almost spoiled my appetite by eating so much of it. 

I spoke with the manager at the end of the night and gave him a heads up to my experience being in line with the negative Yelp reviews. He suggested I should have sent it back and was willing to make it up to me. I had to get back home so I unfortunately turned down the offer but it was nice to see him take responsibility and not make excuses like some managers at other restaurants.

Overall, free valet parking, great drinks, superb service, succulent crab, and an intimate atmosphere make this a great date or weekend drink spot. I DO recommend this to people looking for a nice atmosphere, great drinks, and some tasty crab.
author: Derek F.

description:
OMG. BOBO'S IS DELICIOUS!

Just GO. But before you go - make a reservation. And after you've made a reservation, order the Surf n' Turf. Best of both worlds. Twice baked potato? Yes, that too. You will thank me later.

P.s. Don't forget the Dunce Caps for dessert.
author: Felicia G.

description: Expensive but good. You get great service and great food. Surf and turf. That's the life. Make reservations because they can get packed.
author: Sean J.

description: The ONLY reason they don't get 5 stars is the fact that they do not have Kobe Wagyu beef on the menu. That said, this may be the best steakhouse in San Francisco without Wagyu. The service is impeccable, food prepared correctly and delivered in a timely manner. The roasted seafood platters are unbelievable and I don't remember ever having anything like it anywhere. I love Brussel sprouts and they have it right. Meat is prime, aged and cooked perfectly. Please give them a go, I asked my wife where she wanted to go for her Birthday on Monday Bobo's or Alexander's and she chose Bobo's. Nuff said.
author: Steve E.

description: My favorite place to eat steak and a bottle of wine . Best tasting steak and good service. Come here for all occasions.  Free valet .
author: Bob L.

description: Came here for dinner a while back and had probably the worst experience with service in my life. Our waiter (can't remember his name since it was a while back and quite frankly I want to forget about the whole experience) was unbelievably rude, my husband and I were both in total shock. We were so upset by the way we were being treated that I honestly don't remember how our food tasted because we had both lost our appetite before the food hit the table. My husband and I are very friendly people and we were so disappointed by the way we were talked to. His tone was very condescending and it seemed like he was made that he had to serve us, almost like we were beneath him. Maybe the food is good and maybe the service is normally better but my experience at Bobos was horrible.
author: Angie B.

description:
Here's all you need to know about this place:

Bone in filet mignon.  Twice baked potato.  Martini.  

I've had filet mignon (my favorite dish) all over the States

I've eaten out at some fine steak houses.  And I've made some great steaks myself.  

But.

The ambiance and the service, coupled with the quality of the food and preparation,  made my dining experience at Bobos the best meal I've ever had.

I can't explain to you how they take a 28 day dry aged cut of bone in filet mignon and cook it so perfectly a hard glance could cut it.  I also can't explain to you how the perfectly grilled steaks start attacking your olfactory senses a block away.  And I can't explain to you how the magical process of dry aging beef creates a new zenith of flavor constructs that puts anything else you've put in your mouth to shame.  

All I can tell you is if you've got the scratch, and are in San Fransisco (and eat meat), you must go to this place and see why this is the best country EVER.  

Even if you don't eat meat...go.  Now.  

ps-don't mind reviews of people who've had bad experiences.  I've managed a restaurant for 2 years, and the bottom line is, this stuff happens.  Also, you'll note most bad experiences come from bad service or the seafood.  seafood is a cruel mistress restaurant wise.  

they deserve their bad experience if they aren't getting steak.  if you want seafood, go to mccormick and schmicks for god's sake.  Also, as far as service is concerned, stuff happens.  if you're not there savoring your meal for 2 hours anyways, you need to just hit mcdonalds and go watch real house wives of portland or something.
author: Adam G.

description: We went here on a friends recommendation. I would never go back. Service was horrible, food was okay and I hate being stuffed into a small room sitting so close to the next table I could eat off their plate and hear every word of their convo. The only thing I thought was good was the twice baked potato.
author: Lisa P.

description: Great service! The lobster crostini was amazing but the crab stole the show. The decor was quirky - I'm thinking of renting a room for a private event.
author: Rita C.

description:
My fiance and I were feeling like some good steak.  I did a quick search for steakhouses in SF not the norm RC or HOPR.  Wah-la Bobos!  I've been by this place before but I've never heard of it so thought nothing more of it.  
Anywho, when we arrived, the place was quite small to my surprise but nice and cozy.  Circus/clown theme.  Duh.  Boboquivari's - look it up for you reviewers who were caught off guard with the decor.  Anywho, we were seated upstairs.  The menu had striking resemblances to The Dead Fish menu and as you have it, the waitress confirms that the chef who designed The Dead Fish menu also designed Bobo's menu.  Turns out this place is sister restaurants with The Dead Fish in Crockett, CA.  Now that was music to my ears.

I ordered the bone-in filet mignon. My goodness!  It was the juiciest piece of filet mignon I've ever had.  Minor exception is my "medium" came out more "medium rare" but still I devoured it.  He ordered the combintation petite filet mignon and half crab.  His steak was not the bone in so it was relatively dry and petite it was.  I felt awkward my piece of meat was bigger than his.  The server actually swapped plates on accident.  We giggiled about it after.  Moving on, the crab was fresh and so sweet.  Cooked to perfection.  The dipping butter could have more seasoned though.  I found it to be just a bowl of oil.  No flavor really.  I'd go back again without a doubt.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I almost don't want to write this review because it may make it more difficult to get reservations in the future, but Bobo's deserves a 5 star rating. Even though I may spend a small fortune on each visit, I try my best to never leave San Francisco without dining at Bobo's.

I've never had the crab here so I can't comment on that, but the steak is delicious! Bone-in filet all the way. A real carnivore knows the value in dry aging steak and Bobo's does it right.

And for those of you complaining that your steak was over-cooked...stop ordering prime cuts of meat medium, medium-well or well done because "I don't like it bloody"! If the meat is questionable and it's on your buddy's grill, then go ahead and turn it into charcoal if you want. But when you have a bone-in filet at Bobo's, medium-rare is as far as you should go. It won't be bloody. Instead it will be the best steak you've ever had! Try it once and you too can be a steak snob forever.
author: Joe B.

description:
I go here probably more than any other restaurant in San Francisco.

The bone-in filet mignon here must be best in the US. Not really sure how it can be improve upon.

What's also amazing is the crab. Whenever you're not in the mood for steak, it does not disappoint.

The negatives:
- They recently screwed up the mac & cheese :(
- People now get how awesome this place is so it's tough to get resos
author: Alexander K.

description:
I came here last night with my wife in celebration of our anniversary.  Because of the special occasion, we fudged a bit on doctor's orders and came out here despite my wife being ordered on bedrest.  Don't worry, we  used the free (yes, free) valet.

I was ready for a fight when I got here based on the reviews indicating a rude hostess and even more ready for a fight when we arrived 15 minutes earlier than our reservation.  When we got in, we were given no flack or attitude and shown directly to our table by one of the 3 hosts/hostesses.  No fight needed, and I did feel a bit embarrassed taking off my Ultimate Fighting gloves as we walked up the stairs.  Kidding (about the gloves, not the host).

Because I told them it was our anniversary and requested a booth on OpenTable, we were given a little nook with a secluded table for two upstairs.  Very nice.

We ordered the crab cakes and mussels as starters, each got the bone-in filet (petit for my wife), twice baked, and brussel sprouts.

The highlight of the meal, after the steaks, were the brussel sprouts.  Most people shy away from these mini-cabbages because they've never had them cooked right.  Bobo's does it right.  I'm not a filet guy because there's less flavor in more tender cuts (hence the tendency for restaurants to offer a sauce with filet), and have long since conceded to that being my wife's preference.  However, I had to order it here because of the reviews, and I was not disappointed.  We both ordered them medium and they came out juicy, tender, pink, and no blood.  Perfect.  The potato was not as bland as people claim; it was good not great.

The mussels were very good although the sizzling hot butter did splash onto my wife's eyelid at one point.  Be careful.  Burn potential aside, they were great but I don't know if I'd order them again.  Then again, I might.

We both got a dessert:  the chocolate bomb and the cheesecake.  Not impressed and won't be getting dessert here again.  Shied away from the dunce caps since we'd had them before.

Overall, it was a great experience.

Oh, for those who are afraid they might miss the restaurant and valet, it is almost immediately on the right if you are turning left onto Lombard from Van Ness, so just be ready to stop in the right lane as soon as you turn and you'll be fine.
author: Roger C.

description:
What an excellent steakhouse.  This is 1 of my fav steakhouses in the Bay Area.  

The prices are reasonable, both for the food and the libations.  The atmosphere is cozy & somewhat romantic if you can manage to score the right table & the place isn't crowded; otherwise, you might be stuck sitting next to a loud chatter box(es) & there goes your blood pressure. 

I always order the bone-in filet mignon.  Their side dishes are pretty good too.  I've had the yams and mushrooms.  And of course, wine.  It's always about pairing the right wine with the steaks, isn't it?  You can bring your own & pay the $15 corkage fees or get one of their bottles.  They have a decent selection to choose from.
author: Michael L.

description: By far the best steaks we have ever had. The restaurant itself is pretty old but it gives it so much character and makes your experience there so much cooler! Our server was amazing and gave us a lot of info about the way their steaks are prepared prior to us ordering. We live in San Jose and would gladly make the drive again to have dinner. It is a little pricey but soooo worth it!!!
author: K F.

description:
Best BONE IN FILLET ever!  

Bobo's is known for their bone in fillet, it is so tender, juicy and delicious, melts in your mouth, like butter.....

Have tried a couple of the sides, but so far my favorite is the burrata with heirloom tomatoes, so fresh and fantastic!

For an appetizer, the sizzling shrimp hits the spot. 
 
My last meal on earth, you ask?  Yes, Bobo's bone in fillet!
author: Heather K.

description:
Our poor server was slammed - he made up for it by being very polite and attentive.  The original steak we ordered was delish!  However, it was overcooked to our liking.  We unfortuantely had to send it back.

When out steaks came out the second time, they were cooked to our liking temperature-wise..... however, there was no flavor.  Having tasted the first steak, the second was a disappointment.

Dear Management:  Please give your staff a little more support.  That way they can delivery the food out as soon as it is done and these magnificant steaks will not be sitting under the heating lamp cooking themselves.

Third year in a row for my husband's birthday - least favorite visit
author: Paula S.

description: The steak here was honestly the greatest I've ever had.  I mean just seriously perfection.  The crust from the sear on the skillet was truly exceptional.  Just top notch!  Our services was great, the wine selection was good, I enjoyed the atmosphere and dim lighting.  Can't wait to come back.
author: Robin R.

description: Food was great!! Husband had the Filet Mignon and it was perfect.  I had the crab in garlic.  Yum.  The only thing about the place to be aware of, is that it is small.  So you will be in tight quarters.  Free Valet in SF, wow!!! Loved that!!! Service was great and I would go back, again and again.
author: Kitty C.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for a special date and I was not let down! We started with  Basil martinis and salmon burrata --- amazing. The salmon was perfectly smoked and flavors were amazing. Then we ordered/shared  a whole crab, the bone-in-filet, brussel sprouts and twice baked potato. Everything was to die for.

Note - they do cook their steak medium rare by default as that's what they suggest. I thought the steak was amazing but seemed a little more rare than medium rare. If you' prefer less red and more pink, keep that in mind when ordering. It watered in my mouth though!!
author: Karin Z.

description:
This is a unique place.  The decor is odd.  It is quite small.  That being said the food is quite good.  I had the bone-in filet.  It was delicious and prepared perfectly, medium rare.  I had the twice baked potato as a side.  It was good, but not great like the steak.  They also have a solid wine and liquor assortment.

Free valet parking is a nice touch in a city with so little parking.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Wanted a nice dinner for my birthday but couldn't decide between 3 different restaurants.  After looking at the photos for this place, I knew it would be the choice and I was glad we chose it! I had the combo iron-skillet roasted and the BF had the bone-in filet mignon.  Everything from our dishes, to the bread, to the drinks was delish! Only complaint the dessert....it was only so-so! Sad since everything was soooooo good! But other than that, I will definitely be back! 

*warning: the combo skillet is not meant to be eaten alone - tried but it was too BIG!!! So good for sharing!*
author: Melody M.

description: We were seated upstairs at the smallest table imaginable. No big deal, but the food was just okay and the service was just... bad. Unfortunately my bf has stopped eating beef, so we got to try a few seafood items. Not good; do not recommend. My steak was great though (I got the fillet mignon)! So I'd suggest sticking with steak if you're eating here. Also the sides were gross (cold, and not tasty). We agreed at the end of the meal that we'd never come back. I mean it wasn't terrible, but considering the prices and all the other amazing restaurants in SF to choose from, this is definitely close to the bottom of our list.
author: Salimah J.

description:
I made a reservation and took my parents out for a holiday dinner here.  The service is excellent and the restaurant called ahead to confirm my reservation.  The service was as expected.

I ordered a New York bone-in steak.  Maybe I should have ordered it medium, but the medium-well steak was a bit overdone.  For an dry-aged steak, it seemed kind of tough and not what I'd expect from dry-aged beef.  

I did try a piece of the filet mignon and that was excellent.  So it may just have been my piece that was not prepared well.

Either way, I have to give them an good grade for service but the food was just average for the price.
author: Philip L.

description: Sat in bar and had great service with great recommendations on wines. Bone-in-filet is a must!!
author: David S.

description:
My husband had this place on his list for birthday dinners.  Since we both haven't been here before but are fans of the sister restaurants, I thought why not check it out.  I hadn't done much research about what this place was known for before hand so we were both going into this unprepared.  

We got there a little early so we sat at the bar and chopped it up with the bartender, Michele.  He was very friendly and asked if we had been there before.  We told him no and he immediately mentioned that this place is known for their bone in fillet.  He said that it's so popular that it sometimes is unavailable.  OK, if hearing something like that doesn't intrigue you then I don't know what does.  After only waiting about 15 minutes, we were seated at a very nice "romantic" table.  By this time we had pretty much made up our minds on what we were going to order.  We ordered the muscles (we order this at all of the sister restaurants so we knew this was gonna be good), bone in fillet, brussels sprouts w/ pancetta (sounded interesting but my husband likes brussels sprouts and the waitress recommended it) and Mac and Cheese.  

When the food came, the meat looked great.  But because it was my husband's birthday, he had the first bite.  I could have sworn his eyes teared up (LOL).  The bone in fillet was absolutely delicious!  The meat was so soft, it was like butter!  You didn't need any additional steak sauce, the au jus was just fine.  Our sides were also delicious... the brussel sprouts were a nice surprise.  I guess anything with pancetta is gonna be delicious!  Mac and cheese was yummy because there was a hint of bleu cheese flavor that gave it just the right amount of tart-ness.  

All in all, this was a wonderful meal.  My husband was definitely pleased which made me extremely happy.  He couldn't stop talking about the meat.  There is also complimentary valet service since finding parking in this area looks a little difficult.  The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because you have to order everything a la carte (at the sister restaurants, meals come with the sides).  Can't come here a lot but we will definitely have to make another trip someday!
author: Gabriela R.

description:
This place was recommended by a friend. Went with my wife and had the bone-in filet, mussels, and appetizers. Food was good as recommended/expected. The mac-and-cheese was surprisingly tasty. The decor is a bit funky and interesting. Free valet is a plus!

I was told the seafood platter is awesome too. Next time!
author: David W.

description: Great service. The bone in filet is the best steak I've ever had. Get it with the twice baked potato and thank me later. It is pricy though.
author: David H.

description: The crab served on the iron skillet with the garlic butter is amazing. I am from the east coast and take my crab very seriously! This place was definitely up to par. Also had the 14oz bone in filet. Was slightly undercooked but unlike most places that overcook once sent back it came out perfect seconds later! Would definitely suggest this to a friend. Be prepared for the weird clown decor tho :/
author: Brandon B.

description:
My new favorite steak place in the city.  I am kind of luke warm about Harris and while Alexander's is good, it is pretty pricey.  Boboquivari's and Ruth Chris are now my go-tos.  I was able to drop in with no ressies and was seated promptly.  That is always a plus in this busy city.

The Bone-In Filet is the way to go.  Nice crispy exterior with tender goodness on the inside.  Pretty generous portion -- 10 oz Steak (12 oz including the bone).  The only side we ordered was the mushrooms.  Mushrooms are a pretty simple side, but they somehow made it taste amazing.  I would definitely recommend the bone-in filet and the mushrooms.

As for appetizers, the mussels we got were pretty good too.  They gave a very generous portion.  I would pass on the lobster soup, however.  It is not a typical bisque you would expect.  It just tastes like curry with lobster chunks.  

Definitely would come back.  Service was excellent.  The bar side is nice for a casual dinner and the dining room is nice for a more romantic setting.
author: Bert N.

description:
Fabulous incredicle Thanksgiving evening! Our out of town guests were impressed. Order the bone-in filet and twice baked potato. 

Vibe is great. Have drinks at the bar after your dinnr
author: Vicki L.

description:
I must say I was pretty disappointed with this place. After reading Yelp reviews I expected this to be AMAZING, to me it was just okay. We had the lobster soup, crab toast (can't remember the name, but it's an appetizer), crab and surf and turf. I didn't really like the soup that much, the small crab toast was pretty good. My crab was mediocre, I've had a lot of crab in my life and this wasn't memorable at all, it tasted pretty bland in my opinion.

The service was attentive, but our server didn't really come off as nice at all. It did seem like they were trying to rush us out of there, which seemed odd to me since there were only a few tables occupied in the entire restaurant.

The complimentary valet is a big plus though, really came in handy.

I doubt we'll come back, there's too many other places in the city to visit for us to give this place another chance.
author: Haley S.

description:
Celebrated 2 birthdays here with 3 girls on 9/24/11.  Our waiter was very french and very forward when it came to communicating his attraction.  Kind of wished we had a lady server... anyway, on to the food.

NY T-Bone =  2 thumbs up
The Fish = No bueno, wasted $23 on mushy fish
Filet Mignon = (take off your socks) 3 thumbs up
Sides: Brussel Sprouts (undercooked and not very memorable), Twice baked potato (yum), mac n cheese (so-so)
author: Two P.

description:
I have no idea what everyone is talking about on Yelp, but Bobo's is not that great of a steakhouse.

To be frank, Bobo's is not a bad restaurant, it's just not very good either. I'd say it's pretty average steak, especially for the high prices. You'd get a much better steak at Harris' or Bob's Steakhouse, that's for sure.

Bone-in filet mignon = Good, nothing spectacular.
Bone-in New York = Medium Rare is way too much like a Medium.
Twice-baked potato = Meh. Definitely not worth $8.95.
Garlic table bread = Meh. Came out lukewarm and tasteless.
Tuna Carpaccio = Meh. Fish was too warm. Flavor was pretty good.
Mac & Cheese = Meh. Not enough cheesy flavor.
Brussels Sprouts = Meh. WAY too buttery and oily.

Service was good and it was definitely a cool atmosphere. The food, however, just doesn't cut it for a restaurant with these prices.
author: Roy C.

description:
Fun restaurant - I love the decor and there are little hidden cubby nook tables for couples on all three floors.  This seems like a fun place for a group dinner, or a date.  

I tried the surf & turf (with crab, they don't seem to have lobster except on a crostini appetizer).  Also had the brussel sprouts, mushroom side, and yellowtail carpaccio.  Everything was great...especially the little ice cream cones filled with chocolate mousse.  YUM!
author: Janelle C.

description:
I like the filet mignon here.  It was probably one of the best filet mignons I've ever had.  I also ordered the twice baked potato, per the recommendation of people on yelp.  I was not as big of a fan of that as I thought I would be.  I mean I love starches, but I just wasn't a fan of it.  

Other pros: The free valet parking (you should still tip btw), the service, the bar area before eating.

Cons: I was expecting to have a nice dinner and conversation with a friend, but I was thrown into a room where a bunch of people were celebrating a birthday, I think they should fix that.  There seem to be a lot of separate rooms there, so if you set a reservation, you should not have to be seated in a room with an extremely loud party.  Just my two cents.
author: Joe N.

description: Over-priced for what we got. The service was definitely sub-par for the amount we had to pay. The waiter forgot parts of our order twice - once for drinks and once for our sides. The food was solid but not exceptional. The new york strip steak was cool and not hot enough, though the quality of meat was high. Would probably not come again.
author: Pick P.

description:
Was visiting and Sf and wanted to try this place.
Food was good, at least the important parts.
Loved the mussels and my bone in filet was good too (med rare).
I also like that they have half bottles of wine here.(New 1/2 bottle sizes)
I usually don't finish a whole bottle, even with 2 ppl.

Now the cons...
I felt like I was eating in a box.
And inside this small box was decorated like Buca di beppo.
It didn't help that it was right next to Travelodge.
The table was lob-sided and small. Barely fit 2 steak plates and 2 side dishes and 2 glasses.
Sf's steak was cooked bloody med rare and not medium as requested.
The sides (brussels sprouts and sweet yam) was too heavy.
I had a taste and that was it.

Last but not least, it's really hard to get a taxi at this location.
Even if you call, it's expected to wait 30min+.
I came here for NYE and so there was no way of getting a taxi, so we had to get a town car.

I kinda regret not going to Ruth Chris or maybe even Harris'.
author: Christine K.

description: Came here randomly on a random day for no specific reason, just very nice steaks, even if you are in a bad mood on that day, this will put some smile on your face and the world becomes a slightly better place after meal.
author: Tian W.

description:
Lobster crostini with burratta!
Brussels sprouts with pancetta!
Petit filet mignon!
All delicious!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This place was smaller than I expected, but it was still comfortable. 

We got there a little early and hung out at the bar. They have glass windows that overlook outside, so you can drink while you look out on Lombard St. The room where our table was at was initially pretty stuffy. I don't know if they have a good ventilation system or not, but when the waitress brought out that sizzling plate of crab for another table, it completely steamed up the entire room.

Ok - so onto the food. We ordered a bunch of appetizers - yam, baked potato. modern mac and cheese, and brussel sprouts. The baked potato was baked not once, but TWICE, and it tasted flippin' awesome. Doesnt have the thick consistency as normal baked potatoes and it was full and rich with flavor - LOVED it. The mac and cheese was also very tasty, not too heavy at all. The yam and brussel sprouts dish was good, but not really worth mentioning haha. The appetizer sizes aren't huge btw, so if you have a big group (4+), get a couple of appetizers. I got the filet mignon BONE IN. If you're planning on getting the filet, you have to get in BONE IN. So much juicier. Full of flavor. I loved every bite of it.
author: Rosie W.

description: Worst customer service. It took 4 waiters and a bar tender to tell us someone will be with us while standing by bar for so long while they are not working or serving anyone. Big lies - told us no other tables available but when went upstairs- plenty of empty tables. Place looks old and carpet drapes need serious de infecting  before remodeling. Never ever going back to this hell hole.
author: May T.

description: Had dinner there Thanksgiving weekend.  This restaurant could use a face lift.  Additionally, while the service was good, the food is just adequate.  My steak was at best average, and I would not return here.
author: William B.

description:
My boyfriend and I celebrated my birthday here. We ordered a crab cake, a double mussels and double crabs, and a Bone-in Filet Mignon. 
The crab cake tasted awesome with cranberries. The mussels and crabs were impressive!!! They tasted fresh and delicious! The bone-in filet mignon was tender and juicy.
Their service was as good as their food. We will definitely come back for their mussels and crabs!
author: Chalina C.

description:
After my husband made reservations, he told me Boboquivari means "clown" and the place is decorated with clowns and circus like stuff.  Great, I'm afraid of clowns AND I've told him a few times.

The location is strange and the decor & atmosphere are even stranger.  The decor is really not my cup of tea.  I felt like I was dining in the middle of a Mardis Gras.

After reading reviews about poor service, we were braced for the worst.  Our waitress was very friendly and did everything I would expect.  So, we were pleasantly surprised.

We both ordered the bone-in filet.  It was so delicious...cooked perfectly, moist, flavorful, one of the best steaks we've had.  We also got the tomatoes and buratta (homemade) which was very good.  The mushroom side was delicious too, great flavor to them.  For dessert, we shared the dunce cones.  They are waffle cones stuffed with chocolate mousse.  It's a fairly small dessert so it's a perfect little treat to end the meal without putting you over the edge.

All in all, my love for the bone-in filet is greater than my fear of clowns.  We'll be back!
author: Shelly W.

description:
We visited this place for a work outting and had a reservation for a party of 14 at 8:30 PM.  

we came 10 min early, ended up waiting an hour before being seated.  I ordered a medium rare bone in filet, roughly $40.  I was excited as my friend had been raving about this place's bone-in filet.

The food took quite a long time to come out, but perhaps it was just a busy day.  In either case, when i got my steak, it was well done - not even a smudge of pink in the center.  If this was a Denny's, i suppose i would have just kept on eating, but for $40 - i want to actually enjoy my steak so i sent it back.

10 minutes later, they brought out a new steak.  I cut into it and tasted a piece.  To my unpleasant surprise, it was ice cold.  I had the urge to spit it out, but that would have been unpleasant for everyone else around me, so i swallowed it.  A horrible mistake.

Anyway, i sent that piece back again, still hoping they could get it right this time.  The third time, they used the same piece of steak i cut into.  The plate felt hot... perhaps they just placed it in the oven.  I hope so... i hope it wasn't some microwave.

The steak sucked.  It came back in two pieces, well done on the outside, and barely pink in the center, but it was edible, and i was hungry.
  
The check came out and i saw that they removed my steak from the bill.  I was almost mollified, though thought to myself - i would rather have paid twice as much for something i actually enjoy.  Well, it turned out they charged me for 2 steaks, and the removal was just only for the 2nd charge...  So i did end up paying for dinner.  

And continued paying the next couple of days for that piece of cold hell that i swallowed.

Maybe they don't always suck, but from my experience - they're not worth the one star I'm giving them now.  Save your money, and your time - go to a real steak house... one that knows how to cook.
author: Kris V.

description:
Complimentary valet! On a busy street such as Lombard, this is a huge plus! On top of that, this place has it's own private parking area where the cars can be parked inside! Another plus. 

For roughly $80-90, I got myself the following: 

Crispy crab cake (real crab) - It was crunchyy yet soft. Served with cranberries - which provided good balance to the crab. While I had better, it was not bad and decent. Funny enjoyable. 

Bone-in Filet Mignon w/ a side order of brussels sprouts with Pancetta. The portion of the Bone-in was definitely unexpected. It was alot bigger than I expected. I believe it was 10oz, but it felt like 12oz....I couldn't even finish it! It was pretty juicy still and was not bad. Definitely tender. Alexander's steakhouse I think was a little better seeing that it did not need to have any sauce to enhance the flavor. But for the price, this simply can't be beat. 

The brussel sprouts were very flavorful. Packs a punch in the taste buds - complements it well. 

Overall a pleasant experience. The service was pretty good - the waitress was very attentive and the servers often replaced our dirty plates/utensils with new ones. Would I come back? 

Yes.
author: Killah K.

description:
***4.5***

My fiancé made reservation for my birthday in the city with the help of my really good friend Jenny.   

When we passed by the restaurant and I saw were he would be taking me  to eat, I was like eeee.... So excited!!!!   I have been viewing Bobo's for quite some time.  It's just making the time to head out there.

Menu:

House Salad
Portobello mushrooms
Surf and turf
New York bone in steak
chocolate bomb

We both enjoyed and savored each bite of the steaks we ordered.  I on the other hand got the best of both worlds.  I was able to indulge in the succulent and juicy crab, it was finger lickin' good!! The portobello mushroom mmm so tasty.  

Definitely coming back!
author: Jay B.

description:
A huge part of being successful in the food industry is, well.. good food.  IMO, an equally important aspect is service.  While the food was decent, especially their mushrooms, their service really was lacking.

The steaks were good, albeit a little over cooked.  Swiss chard tasted too charred.  Mushrooms were great except for the piece of crab shell they had in it that poked my gf's gums.  When brought to the attention of the waitress, she just took it away with an attitude, and she didn't bring out a new one.  Dude, I was enjoying the best part of the meal.  Plus, no apology?  Next time, bring out a new side and comp it.

Not only that, after my gf posted a review on yelp, some ignorant a-hole from this restaurant writes a hostile private message to her.  Write it in public so we can see what kinds of people run this place.

I really wanted to go Hell's Kitchen on their ass.

Food 4.  Service 0.  Avg 2.
author: Steve H.

description: Amazing steaks. Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked. The restaurant is simple, out waitress was welcoming and prompt, and it made for an overall fantastic dining experience.
author: Jared N.

description: My favorite place in the city! I always make a point to come here when I am in town. Everything is amazing. The bartender Sean makes an amazing Dirty Martini!!!
author: Aubrey S.

description: Filet melts in your mouth. Be sure to order the mussels - they come sizzling hot with a few delicious dipping sauces. This is a good place to treat yourself.
author: Lina M.

description:
We went in May 2011; I'm just slow in posting my review (I wrote it the night we went, but the Yelp! iPhone app won't post it, so it sat). ;-)

Excellent date spot! Low lighting, warm deep colors, relaxed but attentive service and tables that feel somewhat intimate because of the good placement design. 

My date and I walked in without reservations around 8:45 on a Thursday and were promptly seated. 

As for the food, Boboquivari's treated me to the BEST filet mignon last night - perfectly cooked to order and amazingly tender and juicy. I highly recommend the brussell sprouts and swiss chard sides (the cauliflower side was the only thing that wasn't impressive) and their garlic and evoo fresh baked bread. The basil martini was a treat (lots of basil flavor with a hint of sweetness) and my date enjoyed his cocktail, I can't recall what it was but YUM sums up the whole experience (minus the dull cauliflower)!

They cook their steaks to medium rare unless otherwise requested. I requested medium for my filet and it was simply perfect that way. The petit appears to be about 6oz, but I didn't ask so it may be otherwise.
author: Heather M.

description:
The steak (bone-in filet) was FANTASTIC. I mopped up the juices with every bite. And I wanted to lick my plate. It's a huge piece of meat, and it went down beautifully.

The rather expensive sides are tiny portions, totally not worth it. Focus your attention on the steak, maybe save some dough. 

The mussels/shrimp grill plate was tasty but none too special. The real standout here, and I keep coming back to it, is the meat. If you're saving some money, go straight for the meat, they give you a half loaf of garlic bread, and maybe a salad on the side if you're trying for a palette cleanser. 

Valet parking was fantastic as the neighborhood was impossible to park in. Quaint little place (or seemed little, we were tucked in an alcove with super low ceilings.) Hipster hostess and server, but we had very little interaction, so it didn't matter.
author: Maya G.

description: Three of us for dinner last night and it was so bad that it is one of those stories you tell a year from now.  Filet mignon ordered medium well.  Came to the table burned and butterflied.  We asked the waitress why a filet is about one inch thick and her explanation of butterflying the meat was to cook it evenly(new one on me).  My wife and I split the Frank Sinatra cut which was ordered medium rare and arrived raw and pretty thin for a supposed 64 ounce cut of meat(I guess the bone was heavy).  After both dishes sent back the Filet arrived cooked in different areas from raw to medium well with no flavor and tough.  The Sinatra cut was cooked medium rare but was chewy with no taste.  When a server saw a lot of left over meat, and already aware of our problem he asked if we wanted to see the manager.  Manager came over and before we could say anything he took both steaks off of our bill.  Smart business decision so adjacent clients would not hear our complaints.  Paid for sides and wine and left never to return
author: Larry A.

description: Steak was cooked perfect. My husband had the bone in filet and twice baked potato. Said it was excellent! I had the mussels and shrimp which was very good. I love the decor in this place. I will definitely return.
author: Sharnay T.

description:
Came here for my big bro's birthday. I had made a reservation so we were seated promptly which was great. We had one of those side corner tables which was a plus considering how loud one of the tables were on the same floor. I had brought a bottle of wine and the server asked if we would like it opened. Once he uncorked it, he put the bottle on the table and left. Isn't it customary for the server to pour the wine into our glasses? Throughout the meal, we had to refill our wine glasses and our water. 

To start, We had the iron skillet mussels which was fantastic and the lobster soup which was more like curry paste which lobster pieces (not impressed). For our entrees, I ordered the bone in filet minon and he had the bone in new York. We shared the twice baked potatoe.  Mine was a little undercooked so the server took it back into the kitchen and returned 10 minutes later but the steaks were amazing! When the desert menu came out, we decided to not order anything and go elsewhere for deserts. The server brought out a strawberry cheesecake for his birthday which I thought was very nice of him to remember. Too bad when the check came, he had charged me for it. Overall, I think the service could had been a little better.
author: Christina Z.

description:
Fantastic: Great steak, great martinis, good wines by the glass, free valet
Passable: Salads, apps, sides
Horrible: Service

Wife and I had lobster crostini, house salad, petit filet and bone-in filet, side of mushrooms.  

Runner brought crab crostini.  Had to flag down waiter to correct it for lobster crostini, which showed up 2 minutes later.  The 2 Lobster crostinis had been prepared much earlier and sat in the fridge, flavors were all dull and the temperature of everything was uniformly slightly chilled.  lobster was a little rubbery.  Not worth ordering again.

House salad was a solid refresher before steaks.  

Steaks were perfectly cooked, amazingly tender, super flavor.  Had to flag down waiter to get a drink refreshed

Overall, it was great for the meat/drinks, which is why I'm here.  But everything else was so mediocre, I'd try the other steak places in SF before coming back here.
author: N C.

description: The only way to describe this restaurant is "Better!" The bone-in filets may be the best steak I've ever had!!! The mussels ARE the best I've ever had.  Every dessert is amazing! The wine selection pairs beautifully with anything on the menu.  My husband and i will spend up to $400, including tip, but we expect to and we really treat ourselves.  This is where we go to be treated well.  Enjoy!
author: Cathrine S.

description:
decor is nothing fancy and you better check your available credit before coming here but the steak is great.  i had the sinatra cut NY strip and it was about 22 oz. bone in.  very flavorful. 

twice baked potato was great, as well.  

my friend had the bone-in filet and mussels, and i think we had brussel sprouts and a caesar salad plus two diet cokes and a glass of groth. 

total bill out the door was about $240.
author: John O.

description:
Bobo's is a top-notch steakhouse with amazing seafood to boot.  I had a fantastically indulgent meal here that included both.  Upon entering, you'll notice the warm, deep red hues on the walls and the whimsical decor inspired by the Venetian court jesters of old.  Our group of four sat at one of the booths by the window which looked out onto Van Ness.

We started with the beef carpaccio, which was prepared table side. The raw beef was tender and all the ingredients mixed together made for a very flavorful dish.  Next we had the combo iron skillet, which included mussels, shrimp and crab.  Everything tasted amazing, but the best part was the mussels.  I don't think I've had better mussels in SF.  The waiter then brought out the warm, fragrant garlic bread that many reviewers rave about.  It was scrumptious indeed.  For the main course I ordered the bone-in filet mignon, medium rare.  The steak was cooked perfectly and was melt-in-you-mouth delicious!  I loved the savory buttery sauce poured over the steak and wished the dish came with more of it.  It was quite a hefty piece of steak, so the mister ate what I couldn't finish.  For sides, we ordered the twice baked potato (I would totally want an order of it to myself next time) and the brussel sprouts, which were cooked with bacon, yum!

To finish off our meal, we had the chocolate bomb to share amongst the four of us as we were stuffed the the gills from the delicious meal.  Overall, excellent food, good and friendly service, and a great place for that special occasion, or whenever you have a hankering for some amazing steak!
author: Thi D.

description:
Holy shiz.

We came in last night with 2 other couples. I'm not sure what our waitresses name was, but she was blonde and bubbly. She was great. 

Their brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had, they were almost sweet. So freaking good. (They might have been better than the steak. Oh yeah, I went there.) The twice baked potato was awesome too. The mac and cheese needed a stronger tasting cheese.

The bone in fillet was like butter. So delish. A head up if you like well done meat, they can do medium well on the petite fillet. 

I wish they had a bigger non shell fish selection of appetizers. I'm allergic and always feel left out. I know my life is rough. 

All in all the night was great, I can't wait to go back.

P.s When eating the bread, eat the bottom or the top, that's where all the good stuff is.
author: Angelina M.

description:
It's a good place for tourists wanting decent steak or crab (i.e., it's way too overpriced and has average food (for the price)).

If you are a local, head down the street about six blocks. If you don't know where I am talking about, then you're not a local and I don't want anymore people visiting one of my favorite little steak places.
author: Yum N.

description: The steaks were delicious. The service amazing. Sides were awesome. Very small place but don't judge a book by it's cover. Very diverse culture. Went there with my wife and brother in law and his wife. No doubt I would've ordered the bone in ribeye but I never had a bone in filet. All steaks are cooked medium rare for taste but can change if you request. You don't need to. The steaks melted in my mouth. There was one dish I wished we did get but didn't. It was a whole platter of mussels, clams, crabs, etc. On a sizzling pan. Definitely next time.
author: Bilal R.

description:
Sorry Bobo's. 

Yelp has a "Meh. I've experienced better" for the hover on the two stars. While I can't remember "going to a steakhouse" before, I'm sure a better experience awaits elsewhere in the future. This would have been a three star review, but for the price, an "A-OK" for the three stars it's not.
