The ambiance is dark and intimate, and space is pretty tight, and while the service was good - relaxed but quite attentive - the problem for us and those in the small dining room was our next - over table. One of these four losers was just flat out drunk; whiny, loud and nearly belligerent. Not cool, for his party or anyone else. Thanks a lot.

I hadn't been drinking myself, so I went ahead and ordered a cocktail - the Dream - a vodka Martini sweetened with amaretto. Different, and very enjoyable.

The food - The Cesar salad was shredded, and while reasonably good, looked too "out of the bag" at that chopped up size. Perhaps rather than confetti size, the appearance could be better with actual leaves of romaine? The heirloom tomato appetizer was good - tomatoes were flavorful and brought with soft cheese.

The dinner consisted of two NY bone-in steaks and one order of crab, while tasty, was fine, not bad, but nothing particularly amazing in my opinion either. Moreover my steak arrived almost cold to the touch from the kitchen. Medium rare or not, I got the impression it sat in the kitchen window and had come off some steak assembly line. The sides, ordered À la carte, were quite good however - especially the Swiss chard which was hot, garlicy and a great side to the steak.

The deserts were actually super - no faint praise here. The blood orange sorbet in a waffle shell was the perfect light palate cleansing desert, and the chocolate mousse dunce cones with spicy chocolate sauce were a surprise hit. I think the panna cotta was good, but my mind can't see any thing but "flan" in that shape, so that is what I expect to taste....

That said, this meal for three was no bargain either, one that I wouldn't care to repeat at Bobo's. There are livelier places, more enjoyable food, and nearly every one will be a far better value elsewhere. Which isn't to say that you can't have a great time here, it's just not my cup of tea.
author: Johnnie W.

description: Not sure what the hype is. There are much better steakhouses in SF. Service was non existent. Food was just okay. Prices are super high for what you get. Place is so dark it seems dirty. No comparison to HOPR.
author: a b.

description: Enjoyed it!  Our only complaint was that some of the mussels were off at tad.  But the bone-in filet was out of this world.  It was New Year's Eve and we were not in the least bit rushed.  A special occasion place that will see us again.
author: Ronald M.

description:
The Steak, the Crab, the FOOD POISONING! The combo seafood plate with crab... the crab tasted like ammonia the last bites I experienced. In the early morning I awoke with severe pains in my tummy and spent 4 hours vomiting. Not cool. I love love crab and now am never eating it again! Did I mention the steak was nothing to write home about? Well, maybe just the price! Overpriced Marina neighborhood garbage.

L
author: LaLa N.

description:
Medicore... I ordered the fish filet.. it was somewhat drenched in the overpowing salty sauce.   I did remove the fish from the original plate that it came on to escape the sauce.  

My husband ordered the double mussels and crab.  He liked the crab much more than the mussels.  I did enjoy the crab myself (I snuck a leg off his plate ^^)

Next time he wants to try the surf and turf.  Because he wants to come again, I'll probably order the crab.  It was seasoned perfectly and had a nice crisp shell, unlike Thanh Longs crab that kinda bends when you try to crack it.  Yes I said Bobo's crab is better than Thang Long.
author: Alice E.

description:
My boyfriend and I had an early dinner here last week just because. I've never heard of Bobo's (shocking!) but my boyfriend wanted to go here so we did.

One great thing about this place is that they have valet parking for their guests so you're not driving everywhere just to look for parking which is nice.

The place has two floors, I think? But downstairs was the bar and upstairs is where the dining is. It's actually small from what I remember but there's different rooms. We were seated in this awkward fabric gazebo which was kind of claustrophobic and kind of meh. The fabric was not clean and the mirror hung on the wall scared me for the most part because it kept moving..

Onto the good stuff, food..

We ordered 2 lobster soups w/bread, 2 filet mignon (1 with bone in), modern mac and cheese, and the two cheese baked potato.

Everything was delicious but I wasn't really a big fan of the lobster soup. I don't like a lot of seafood (except tuna, shrimp and sometimes crab), I know.... but I decided to try it.

We were too full to get dessert, as always.. haha.

I didn't know they were featured on FoodNetwork until my friend told me which is cool. But glad that it wasn't busy when we got there.
author: Jessica R.

description: i have eaten at bobo's a few times.  on the previous occasions the food was good, not great but definitely solid. i dined there last night and it was terrible.  i ordered the new york steak and it arrived cold and tasteless.  the meat itself looked very thin and not at all good quality.  i exchanged it for a filet mignon.  the filet was cooked well but it lacked any type of seasoning and we ended up taking it to go to give to a homeless person.  the sides we had were mac & cheese, which was also lackluster, the twice stuffed baked potato, again no flavor and cold and the brussel sprouts, which were actually good.  the desserts were terrible- we had the cheescake & the chocolate bomb and my kids would not even eat it.  our bill was over $200 and it truly felt like we had been robbed.  the service was nothing special, the place needs a makeover and the food was really disappointing.  i do not recommend and will not be back.  :(
author: Samantha B.

description: It is not the best steak I've ever had. But for sure it is one of the top-notch steaks. The valet parking is quite convenient. I highly recommend the lobster soup and the bone-in fillet mignon. It is a bit expensive but I think the food is worth the money.
author: Hua W.

description:
Excellent food, TERRIBLE SERVICE. 

For the prices you pay at this restaurant, I expect grade A 5 star service. First off, when we arrived at the restaurant for our 9pm reservation on a Friday night for 10 people, we waited an additional 30 minutes to be seated. A large party that was about the same size came in AFTER us and were seated before us, with no apology or explanation. There is not much of a waiting area or a bar area, so you're stuck feeling completely in the way as people are trying to get through and walk around the dining area. 

It took us about 20 minutes to get our drink order in (several bottles of pricey and "meh"  wine) and another 30 minutes to get our steak orders in. The menu is not enormous, it doesn't take that long to figure out what cut you want and how you want it cooked. You also have to order a la carte for sides for the table. That is expected at a nice steak restaurant. Our food arrived about 20 minutes later. Most of the steaks on the table were cooked perfectly medium rare. Mine was not, it was about Medium Well to Well in some places (I ordered medium rare of course). I was fine with eating it as is, but my friend the birthday boy INSISTED that we send it back. So he flagged the server down, and we sent it back. Minutes later the server comes back and they had cut through the middle of the petit filet and said it was "medium rare in the middle." So naturally I didn't want to make much of an additional scene, so I took the steak back (now cold with a bit cut through the middle) and I just didn't eat it. I had some of my friends' steaks that were cooked wonderfully. About a minute later, my friend spills his wine all over my steak and my dress. The bus boy comes around and I ask him to take the steak I didn't eat. They didn't take the steak off the bill, I paid $50 for a steak I didn't eat. Major sad face. However it was my friend's birthday and I didn't want to make a fuss. 

As I have been told before, don't complain until the check comes. Since we had a large party, there was auto gratuity, so I couldn't take the money off there for the service. However I did try to leave a note that our server was great, but how the steak temperature situation was handled was very poor. I made sure to put the slip in the middle of the stack of all the other slips at the table, since we had multiple credit cards that they accommodated. In poor form, the server comes back to pick up the finished checks while we were still sitting there. And as we're getting up to leave, he comes back and says he has "lost" my signed slip with the note. Therefore he demands my copy. I should have refused and said it was my copy. Feeling defeated, I gave him my copy, and he stood there and made sure I didn't write anything horrible on it I guess. 

While the steak if cooked to the right temperature is tasty and well seasoned, I wouldn't patron this place again due to the lack of professionalism. When I pay ~$100 for dinner, I expect the service to be exceptional. Go to 5A5 instead, their food is amazing, as is the service.
author: Matty T.

description:
Delicious, except for TOO MUCH butter. Everything tastes like butter. My belly hurts. 

If you go, ask them to be light with the butter.
author: Lady L.

description:
Had high hopes for this place, which unfortunately were not met. Overall, the food was very average at best. We got the porterhouse and the crab. While the porterhouse was tender and cooked properly (med rare), it absolutely lacked in flavor. I'm one to enjoy a good steak with just salt and pepper but this had none of that good beef flavor. The crab was no better. Maybe their crab is better when it's in season locally, but the waiter assured us that it comes from "way up north where it's now in season." As skeptical as we were we gave it a shot, since they're known for crab, but we should have trusted our instincts. Was flavorless and just didn't taste fresh. On top of that, service was sub par.

The sides (twice baked potato and brussels sprouts) were good, but like everything here, over-priced. We wanted to like this place but really did not. Will not be returning.
author: Brian W.

description:
I'm definitely a Yelp leech; I don't typically like writing reviews, but I'll go to restaurants based on other folks' reviews. However, I had an exceptional experience at Bobo's, and feel like I must share it.

My friends and I went here for our Fantasy Football league banquet-yes like all other athletes, we must have an end of the season award banquet. Let me preface the rest of this story by saying that we are a rowdy bunch. 10 men, and 2 girls. We're young and loud, and don't fit the "old, sophisticated, mature money" mold. And they treated us amazingly anyways.

There was a short wait before we got in, so a few of us grabbed some drinks before going in. I guess the manager or owner is a Detroit Red Wings fan, and he was jokingly giving my buddy a tough time for being a San Jose Sharks fan (should maybe minus a star for not being a Sharks fan...haha jk). Super friendly guy, checked up on us a bunch of times to see that we were doing well over the course of the night.

After we ordered, we got our bread and the wine we ordered shortly. I did say that we were loud and rowdy right? Well, if you put a bit of alcohol into young, rowdy, immature young men, language becomes more and more colorful, and stories become less and less appropriate. Unfortunately for our neighbors (or maybe fortunately cuz our stories are funny), they did not tell us off. Instead, once our neighbors finished, they didn't seat other folks upstairs with us. Honestly, that blew my mind. I half expected us to get kicked out of the restaurant for our poor behavior. Instead, they treated us in a way we didn't deserve to be treated-extremely well. This blows my mind the more I think about it. 

It took a while for us to get our steaks, but I suppose that is to be expected when there are 12 of us. One of my buddies said that his medium steak was not cooked long enough, so they took it back and fixed it for him. Everyone else had a great experience with the steak. My buddies all loved the sides as well.

I forgot our servers name, but he was a nice young Asian gentleman who treated us awesomely. Although we looked and acted like folks that would not tip well, he treated us with respect and dignity. I will be back because of how well I was treated here. Bravo, Bobo's.
author: David C.

description:
Fantastic bone-in fliet mignon, cooked perfectly. Also, their baked potato was equally as impressive.

Will definitely be back again!

Also, fun ambiance with the court jester theme.
author: David R.

description: I have to add that I almost NEVER give 5 stars, but since this was exceptional, I felt compelled to rate it as such.
author: Foodie I.

description: First they sat us in a tiny room next to a bachelor party that made a game of seeing if they could get us to leave. Then they brought wine that I said tasted like it had gone bad then refused to replace it or take it off the bill. Then lost our order in the back and we waited over an hour and a half for our food. We were offered a free dessert and when I explained I am diabetic they just said "sorry". At the end of the night, we were comped one $8 appetizer after a bad $120 bottle of wine and food that was an hour and a half late. At over $50 a person, I expected better food, more courteous service, and a conscientious effort to make customers happy.
author: Erin A.

description:
Contrary to preconceived notions, Boboquivari's does not have a clown named Bobo.  Nor a picture of Bobo the Clown.  But they do have a jester on the menu.

I was feeling like a big fatty that day, so mucho ordering was in need.

Trying to be fancy, we ordered a bottle of voignier.  Trust, any bottle that comes with a screw top is not fancy.  Do not recommend this with your food.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=-CxMtDke2YCph7hYi8DP8A

We had one heaping plate of mussels.  It was huge!  And so worth $15.  You can even double or triple the order to accommodate more people, but one is definitely enough for three people.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=kNfSRIDfWAzLUZtbuofj9w

The waitress recommended their signature steak, the bone-in filet mignon.  But, I had my eye on the surf & turf, so we ended up getting both.  And it was delicious.  Finger lickin' good.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=HD5oWkvyWRxvbi53TNHBrg.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=OeyeLVvg9Is4bKBHBUt89Q.

Dessert time, and we couldn't decide between all our choices.  We ended up with a prosecco sorbet and the panna cotta.  Oh my god, I'm so glad I saved room for both.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=8eSZsPUPhSTI4YxQYlRtCw
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is the second 5 star high end steakhouse! Trust me I have eaten at a lot of 4 1/2 stars:) I love me some red meat! But it takes the total package to get 5 full! Bobo's has never failed to meet expectations and my wife and I are fortunate to live half a block away! Sometimes we just get a craving for there bread and lobster bisque! Have celebrated great friends birthdays here, business dinners and just sat alone while the wife was away to enjoy a nice steak at the bar! Never have I left disappointed! If you want to spoil yourself; go with four and do Bone in  filet and the full crab deal! Its a mess so make sure its people that love you:) 

Before we leave our apartment whenever that time comes; we will have one last amazing dinner with the gang at BoBo's. Oh plus I almost beat the S--t out of this giant ass racist here once; so that was really cool! Instead I called him out and embarrassed the S--t out of him in front of his party and everyone in the joint:)
author: Keith C.

description:
I had read a number of reviews and there were a couple of 3 or 4 star, but glad I ignored those.  We wanted an experience unique, a dinner at a place you can only get in San Francisco city.  Not a chain steakhouse where you can find in any major city.  With that in mind I went seeking Bobo's.

We arrived with no reservation - since there was none to be had.  We sat in the bar open seating.  
We had a great waiter- a frenchman.  Due to all the recommendations I ordered the bone in filet.  I ordered it med rare plus - just above med rare.  My girl ordered the filet - they are small 6 oz. perfect for her.

My steak came out wonderful - cooked dead on. It came out very hot, juicy, and so tender.  

I love a good steak, and this beat Morton's, Ruth Chris, Flemings, Mastros - all of them.  It was tender and juicy.  My girls filet was great- she was so happy.  We ordered the yams, which came out creamy and delish.

The atmosphere is nice- and the hostess was really helpful getting a place in the bar.

We had great service from the hostess and food server.

So if you're in the city and want a steak don't miss this.  Due to my experience  -  amazing steak and service / I had to rate 5 star.  Next time in town we will be back.
author: David P.

description:
Don't let the cheesy name and questionable decor scare you away. Bobo's is ridiculously awesome. It's like Medieval Times only replace the cosplaying knights with clowns/jesters/whatever and questionable-looking Frenchies taking your order while leering creepily at you as if they have an extra special baguette of theirs they'd like to suggest.

Simple menu, be a man and go for the porterhouse. One of the better steaks I've had in a long time. Sides all seemed edible too (my large group pretty much ordered every single one)...desserts...not so great. Tasted like they should have been presented in the Safeway box they started in.

Thought about taking away 1 star since my server originally refused to serve me the petit filet I wanted for dessert but he eventually complied after he realized that I was being serious. If there's a fight I can always win, it's one with the French.
author: Leo K.

description: I had the in-bone filet mignon, which came recommended by nearly every reviewer on the planet. It was ok. Not life changing. I've had better steaks. It was certainly a massive portion. I ordered a side of swiss chard that was forgettable. Make sure to get seafood of any kind... it looks like it's simmered in butter. There was a crab salad that looked particularly good.
author: Jason G.

description:
I only have great things to say about this place.. 

Had the iron skillet mussels for starters.. YUMMY! Then, had the filet mignon for my main course- it was SO DELISH! So flavorful and cooked to perfection and the side dishes (Cauliflower and twice baked potato) were super tasty too! 

I will definitely be going here again!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I have long heard about Bobo's but have not had the pleasure of checking it out--until this week.
The four of us came here for a quarter end celebration...without reservations. 
While waiting at the bar we ordered the burata app with heirloom tomotos--excellent. 
We were seated in about half hour--which isn't bad considering the place is fairly small and we didn't have reservations.
We ordered some apps that weren't so memorable..and for dinner I went with the bone-in filet with a side of cauliflower. 

Overall I thought the service was attentive...the ambiance was a bit lacking--the food was pretty decent...but I think I still prefer Harris and Ruth Cris if I am opting for a steakhouse.
author: Mimi T.

description: Only gave 4 stars because i couldnt give a half star. Best steak I've had, was under cooked for med well, however told the waiter and it was cooked longer a lil on the charred side, but i like a Lil char on my steak. I got the 20oz bone in filet, and half order of crab. I would rate their steak better than Ruth Chris (not by a lot). Drinks were stiff. Sides were good, bread was great, service even better. If you're looking for good steak you will not be disappointed
author: R R.

description:
Met with a couple of old friends and had dinner there. This was my first time.

Ambience: The restaurant has a pleasing ambience and the decor is cozy but rather "loud" --- it has a distinct old house charm.

Service: Our waitress was attentive and quite knowledgeable about the dishes. She was also quick in her service in terms of any request we made. No issues with service, looks like they kept it up at a high level.

Foods: the quality of the foods were fresh and conscientiously prepared. I liked the side dishes (sautéed portobello mushroom, mod mac & cheese, twice-baked potato) and, of course, our steaks. The steaks were well seasoned and the meat were perfectly cooked. Skillet-cooked steaks --- quite a charming way to do steaks.

Environment: If there's one complaint, it will be the size of the restaurant. The place is kinda small and so, everything felt somewhat cramped and when you walk from one location to another, you have to kinda walk gingerly to make sure you don't knock down anything or hit someone. The toilet is located on the furthest edge of the top floor and you have to traverse the maze upstairs or should I say that you have to pass other tables within 1 to 1.5 foot clearance between tables.

Valet parking: we used the valet parking service and he was pretty prompt in taking and returning our car. Excellent.

Conclusions: we'll be back but will probably still keep our no-alcohol regimentation, just in case we lose our balance and step on someone's toes along the way in or out. Remember, the place is tight.
author: Art Y.

description:
From 1 star to 4...  What the hell happened to turn this baby around?

Well, following my bad review, Bobo's reached out to me to apologise for the terrible way I was treated (and the glass in the mouth thing) and offered me a voucher to come back and try again..  And you know what, a year later when back in San Fran I took them up on the offer and glad that I did.

The steak was to die for, the garlic bread is still as lovely and as novel as I remember. The service was top notch and the drinks flowed.. The old manager who couldn't manage a p*ss up in a brewery had gone, replaced with someone who knew how to run a place whilst keeping it friendly and a place people would want to come back to.

Thanks Bobo's for putting your neck on the line and offering for me to come back.

I'm glad I did and I've already recommended you to many friends traveling to the West Coast..

See you soon..
author: Paul L.

description: Not sure what the hype is all about... We got their award-winning bone-in filet, which was cold, and the garlic roasted whole crab, which was dry and fairly bland. Don't think we'll come back anytime soon... :(
author: Cindy T.

description:
FILET MIGNON.  The softest steak I've ever had.  And I've had A LOT of steak.

Went with my bro who was visiting, and two other friends...  We ordered the shrimp and crab platter and a salad to share, and we each got our own petite filets.  The seafood platter, I thought was meh.  Just grilled seafood.  Can't go wrong, but just wasn't special.  But man, the steak was amazing.

Next time I'm getting the large filet mignon.  That and a nice glass (bottle) of wine, makes me a super happy gal.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Me and my man popped in here at 6pm on Memorial Day. BF was berating me for having worn cut-off shorts. Yeah, I wasn't really thinking about the fancy place we were going to when I put them on, but it was too late now. He was thinking that we might get bad service because of it, since we are in our early 20s sometimes we get looked down on in places like this.

Not so! Service was great from start to finish. The hostess barely batted an eye at my outfit and seated us in a very nice little private alcove for two, despite us not having a reservation. Nifty!

Our server recommended the bone-in filet, which is their specialty, so that's what we got. We also ordered the lobster crostini for the appetizer, chard and mac n cheese for the sides.

Lobster crostini was amaaazing. It came with a creamy buratta mozzarella as the 'dipping sauce'.. however it's not quite creamy enough for you to dip, I recommend treating it like butter and cutting off a piece to smear on top. The lobster was very flavorful and I ate every single little piece.

I'd also like to mention here that I got a glass of the Rose, and it was HUGE. I actually had trouble finishing it. Good value on the wine glasses here!

And for the main attraction, the bone-in filet! It says on the menu "Our steaks are served medium rare for maximum flavor", and I had no arguments with that. The filet was buttery and delicious as filets should be, and it was especially flavorful in the area right next to the bone. Also, it was nice and BIG! It came very lightly sauced, but the sauce did not interfere with the natural flavor at all, and was merely a subtle compliment.

You know the steak is beastly good when you have to keep reminding yourself to cut smaller bites so you don't freaking choke on the thing.

For dessert we had the pistachio panna cotta, which was light, creamy, and refreshing, a perfect way to end a fabulous meal! I will definitely be back!
author: Rachel H.

description:
My five star rating is for the Atmosphere and the Food.  If I were judging the wait staff, I'd probably give them one or two stars.
That being said...The Filet Mignon is so insanely good!  It seems they've changed the way they prepare the steaks.  They used to be seared and roasted with garlic and rosemary, but now it seems they're seared and roasted with salt and butter.  I'd definitely prefer the old recipe over the new, but either way, the steaks are amazing.  For the average person, no other steak you've eaten in your lifetime will compare to this.  Assuming most people have chosen to go to the roadhouse or outback for a steak.
We always order the crab cakes and lobster soup for our appetizers.  The crab cakes we absolutely cannot get enough of.  I could probably eat those for days on end and never get tired of them.  The lobster soup also is amazing, IF you like curry.  It just so happens that I love curry.  You can't go wrong with those two appetizers!
Back to the steaks.  I've done the bone-in filet and a regular filet.  My recommendation is the bone-in filet mignon, medium rare.  In my opinion, the more you cook the steak, the less flavor it has.  Fortunately Bobo's uses quality aged beef.  I believe it's aged six weeks.  So if you can't bring yourself to order it medium rare, don't go any further than medium.  Trust me!  
I realize there are a couple other steakhouses in SF that have better reviews, but this is the first one I've been to, and it's hard for me to try a new spot when I know this one is always on point.  My only complaint is that the wait staff has been sub-par the last few visits.  I consider myself a decent tipper (minimum 20%), but this wait staff doesn't warrant a tip over 10%.
author: Chris K.

description:
O.M.G!! Bone in filet minon. Amazing! One of the best steaks I've ever had is this bone-in here at Bobos. Don't go there too late in the evening though if you want one of those bone-ins. They do run out! Happened to me once and I was devastated. Had to settle for a different amazing steak. Poor me.

The ambiance is a bit weird... It's dark with some interesting decor and accessories. Definitely not the typical steak house environment.
author: Jessica W.

description:
We went there for my husband's birthday. 

The valet parking was great - prompt and courteous!

As soon as we entered the restaurant we were greeted with a friendly welcome.  We were immediately seated by the window. The ambience in that particular room - the room with the booths - was very comfortable.  Perfect for a date night or just a nice quiet and classy dinner with the family (with older kids - our daughter is 14) or with friends or a low key and impressive business dinner.

For starters we ordered the yellowtail carpaccio, the heirloom toy box tomatoes and a Caesar salad.  The carpaccio was to die for especially when you soaked the garlic bread in the sauce! The heirloom tomato salad was also delicious.  The Caesar salad? Not so good; it was rather bland.  However, if you combined all three dishes, the carpaccio and the tomatoes added zest to the Caesar salad.

Our waiter suggested the bone-in filet mignon. I personally didn't want to try something other yelpers raved about! I ordered the roasted crab.  It was interesting as I am more accustomed to steamed crab.  The texture was drier yet had a nice grilled and smoky flavor to the meat.  I think some warm drawn butter could have been added to the presentation.  Otherwise it was good.  My husband and daughter loved it!  My husband also enjoyed his bone-in New York steak and my daughter - who is not much of a meat eater - finished her petit filet mignon!

We didn't order any dessert.  Nothing appealed to us and we are chocolate lovers!

Our waiter was professional, knowledgeable, friendly, and discreetly attentive.  He did, however, miss the mark on checking our wine glasses before and during dinner.  My husband would have enjoyed another glass if our waiter had been a bit more observant. (We are restaurant people so we are hyper-aware of customer service.)

Overall, though, this was a fantastic experience for us! My husband thoroughly enjoyed his birthday dinner.

We'd go back!
author: Rae A.

description:
Went to Bobo's for the first time for my boyfriend's birthday on Friday night.  We were in a group of 5 and had made the reservation about 2 weeks ago for 8:30pm.  We arrived to the restaurant in our complete group around 8:20 and were told there was a slight overlap in service and we would have to wait an extra 10 minutes to be seated (the website does advise that reservations may not be kept on time due to dining room traffic, so that was understandable).  The hostess sent us to "The Lounge", which is their bar a couple doors down, and said she'd text us when the table was ready.

After fighting through the narrow walkway crowded with middle-aged drunk people, we get to the bar.  It must have been the bartender's first day EVER - he had no fucking clue what was going on, never acknowledged any of us standing there waiting to order, had no idea what a Tom Collins was when my friend ordered it and had to go next door and ask for help multiple times with using the register.  Needless to say, after waiting 10 mins for him to get my order (I even tried just waiving and talking at him) and feeling completely ignored, the rest of us gave up on ordering drinks and waited to be texted that our table was ready.

Finally, at 8:50, we were seated.  Granted, the restaurant was very busy, but 3 of the 5 of us at have worked in food service long enough to know that it was just very disorganized service and took much longer than it should have for everything.  We were thrilled that the corkage fee was only $15 and brought a bottle of champagne with us, which was great because that was the only beverage any of us had for the first 20 minutes we sat there.

Eventually our server came over and apologized and brought water for everyone and took our orders.  Maybe they were short on staff, but one server for a room with 4 large parties (there was a group of about 8 people sitting across from us) is a little ridiculous.  And the poor guy was so clearly overwhelmed, constantly being grabbed by each table to get something else.  I don't remember if he had written our order or not, but he definitely came back about 5 mins later and asked one of my friends how they wanted their steak cooked again, though she definitely had told him.  Garlic bread was brought out shortly after we ordered and everyone seemed to enjoy it.  The wait time for food was acceptable, about 20-30 mins, and everything was served at once,  which was great.  The food was definitely phenomenal.  I had the bone-in filet mignon, which was perfectly cooked medium rare as I had asked.  Everyone's steaks were actually cooked perfectly medium rare, even my boyfriend's giant Porterhouse, which had been ordered a medium well.  He still ate it and said it was delicious, but at a top-shelf steakhouse, you would expect them to know how to cook a steak to order!  We ordered the brussel sprouts, cauliflower, mashed sweet yams and mac-n-cheese as sides.  All amazing and great to share with the table.  After finishing, our plates were immediately cleared by a busser, but it took another 20 mins to flag down our server and get the check.

Overall it was an incredibly delicious meal and we had a great time, but I doubt I'll return to that restaurant for the simple fact that I'd rather pay for good food that comes with equally good service, and not feel like I was a less important diner than any other party there.  And really, if you're going to spend $70 on a steak at a top rated steakhouse, you'd expect it to be cooked right.
author: Katie S.

description: yup the bone in filet is as good as everyone is raving about. Nice lil restaurant, casual and not very expensive.
author: Ali H.

description:
I really don't understand the high rankings for steak.   I had the bone-in New York strip and I have to say it was tough and not tender.   I felt like I had to really hack into it with the steak knife.    We also had the mac n cheese which in all honesty needs to have a friggin' side note telling you it's really pungent with blue-cheese and fishy odors.  Would not come back for steak.  Gave it 2 stars because the service was great at so was the atmosphere.

For steak:
Go to Harris' (or Alexanders if you want a modern, trendy feel)
Or, just buy a cast iron skillet and read methods online.  You will find you can make a pretty darn good steak yourself (and never want to grill it again!)
author: russ h.

description: This was my first time here ... I loved it.... We had an order of mussels and crab legs and they brought it out on a sizzling skillet... Wine selection was excellent... Highly recommend the filet (super bone-in) this place is legit- don't let the fact that it's next to travel lodge discourage you- actually that's part of its unique appeal... Very very cool spot.
author: J T.

description: First off, we were 30 minutes for our resos and they were so accomodating to hold our table even though it was a busy Sat night. Luckily, they have complimentary valet so we were able to run right in. The service was attentive and informative but not overbearing. We had the 20oz ribeye which was good... But their bone in ribeye is the real winner here! It just melted in your mouth and was perfectly medium rate. We had the mod mac and brussel sprouts which were both good but I really loved the sourdough bread with olive oil and herbs. I will definitely be back!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Here's some tips about this place:
Bring an appetite
Order a cocktail or two 
Bone in filet is the best cut here - Tender & juicy
Order the twice baked potato & mac n cheese - You won't be disappointed
Quit thinking about work/the driver that cut you off - Enjoy your dinner
Use your credit card that has rewards points - The meal will cost over $100
Interior does not look like a typical steakhouse - Don't be surprised
Valet is free - Yes, free!
Arrive on time
Remember to leave room for dessert
I love rib-eye but I think I found my second favorite cut - Bone in filet 
Start thinking about another reason to come back for more!
author: Suzi K.

description: The customer service was excellent and the food was so good, I went there to celebrate my birthday
author: John L.

description:
MICE MICE MICE!!!!  Do not go to Bobo's they have mice!

My girflriend and I went to Bobo's a few weeks ago.  The food and drinks were good, but upon leaving my girlfriend who had placed her coat on the back of the chair got up and found a mouse glue trap stuck to her coat WITH A DEAD MOUSE ON IT! It must have been placed in the corner on the floor.

Needless to say she was freaked out and her coat and blouse were ruined.  We didnt see the mouse trap until we were already in the car on our way home.  I tried emailing and calling Bobo's to see if they would rectify the situation and at the very least pay for our dry cleaning to remove the glue residue.  It's been 3 weeks now with no response.  I will never go back and will make sure everyone I know doesn't either.
author: Brandon A.

description:
Yum. We waited forever to go here considering we live a few blocks away. Love the atmosphere, and I was surprised at the bustling happy hour scene. I felt like I was in Aladdin's lamp, but more tasteful. 

Sizzling shrimp app was literally too hot to handle and not really worth the fuss IMO. It's all about the steak here, duh. I got a NY strip and my fiancée got the bone in filet, which she wept softly about later upon finding out how many calories it had. So worth it. Most flavorful tenderloin I've ever tasted.

Dessert was aight...I should have ordered another steak instead.  This is the second outstanding restaurant I've found right on our doorstep (the first being Cafe GoLo). Good to know you can skip Chestnut or Union for a night.
author: Alex L.

description: San Francisco is light on good steakhouses and I think this is a by product of so many good restaurant options outside this category. Bobos"s bone in filet is the best steak in the city hands down. Only drawback to Bobos is the creepy clown décor.
author: G T.

description: Was super excited to have a  New Year night Steak Dinner! Bobo was awful!!! Steaks  came out under cooked sent back twice! Server was  keep making excuses for their food. Don't come here-you're better off buying a slice of pizza. In contrast, the manager ended up comping our steaks.
author: Monica K.

description: Best steakhouse in the city. Got the porterhouse medium rare.  Must order the Bermuda onion rings
author: Michael E.

description: We came across this fantastic steakhouse last night when searching for a place to dine in the Marina Bay Area. The service was great and the bone-in filet and bone-in New York were terrified. We also got crab, but was hard to eat. Stick with the steaks!
author: TJ U.

description: I thought this place was bad. My fiancee had made us reservations and the place was packed and running behind schedule.  They seated us 30 minutes after our reservation time.  When we were seated the waiter seemed rushed when he took our order.  He asked her if she would like her steak butterfly cooked to speed up the process. My fiancee said, I guess, he replied well it's up to you guys implying that I wanted mine the same way.  We both had the surf and turf which is a petite filet and crab legs.  Steak came out well done and crispy. We had asked for medium rare. Crab isn't pre cracked... Most steakhouses have already cut the crab for you. Twice baked potato was ok. Brussel sprouts tasted like they were heavily seasoned with mustard. Definitely disappointed.  I read so many good reviews, it sucks we had a bad experience.  Not going back.
author: Evan G.

description:
Food was overrated!  I read quite a bit of reviews and was pretty stoked to try Bobo's.  The only thing that was good was the yellowtail carpaccio, other than that everything was overpriced for average food.  I must say the filet mignon was cooked a perfect medium rare.  It was a bit under seasoned, the bread was not the best given that they put a smidget of garlic spread on top and it was pretty crusty, too crusty in fact that it tears the upper roof of your mouth.  

The service is something to be desired, it was slow and drawn out.  The server was not attentive and sometimes hard to track down.  Honestly for this kind of money i would rather go to Ruth Chris or Harris.  I didn't feel the price was warranted for the food and service.
author: Derrick L.

description: So I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Decided to go on a Saturday night. The place is nice but kinda small. At least the table I sat at was! I felt like I didn't fit in the booth and table! And I'm not huge or anything but I felt very cramped and tight. Now for the steak. So disappointed, I ordered the New York strip as they did not have any rib eye ( my favorite cut ). It was extremely bland. Had no flavor what so ever. I tasted Nooo seasoning not even salt or pepper! And it was pretty tough too. Now I'm a huge steak eater and I've been to many steak houses and had many different cuts of steak. I didn't want to finish it cuz it was so tough and un-flavorful and I was starving! They did have a good clams and shrimp dish which was a appetizer but I went there for steak! I won't be going back, at least not if the steak is the same
author: Roger P.

description:
I like the place.

I ordered the bone fillet mignon, whole crab and a side of brussle sprouts. Everything tasted amazing as I expected, but I had to knock down a star for the ambiance and the prices. While the food was great, I would expect a little more from a $40+ plates.
author: Assaf B.

description:
I've been to Bobo's a total of three times and I don't know why I didn't write a review sooner.  The atmosphere is very interesting, the room being mainly red and dim with images of jesters and whatnot, basically reminding me of the Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland.  It's probably best to make a reservation, although a friend and I did manage to get seats at the bar right away without a reservation.  Get seats towards the front side of the restaurant where there are windows.  The ones in the back are rather stuffy and too dim, I didn't like it at all.  

Anyway, I've tried several different plates at Bobo's.  I have tried a steak from here once, but considering it was a while back, I don't want to give an inaccurate description of it so I won't critique it in this review.  
However, in all honesty, the Iron-skillet Roasted entrees are really what you should be coming here for, despite the rave about the steaks.  (I base this off the fact that the steak doesn't seem to be particularly memorable.)  I've ordered the combination orders of Mussels & Shrimp, and also Mussels & Crab; point is, get the mussels, it's amazing; shrimp and crab are good as well.  It comes out sizzling on a huge skillet and the portion for the combination orders are perfect for two, maybe with a side.  They pour some sort of buttery, white wine (?) sauce right when it comes out and it is sizzling, drooling, delicious awesomeness.  
Their steak tartare (called Filet al Crudo) is a good choice for an appetizer, tasty as a steak tartare should be, sorry I don't know how else to explain it; if you like raw beef just get it.    
I've also ordered a side of brussels sprouts with pancetta, which were a bit soggy for my tastes but not bad in flavor and of a decent portion; however, personally I think it's a bit overpriced for just brussels sprouts. 
Lastly don't forget the best "free" bread you'll ever get ever.  They bake a fresh loaf of garlic bread to come with your order, with chunks of caramelized garlic on the crunchy top and a soft middle.  
It's a place with a creative atmosphere, good food, and decent service. Eat here.
author: Esther J.

description: I been there so many times, Just love the filet mignon,it's only 6 weeks old meat,world class ! after first bite you will have nothing to complain.everything great taste from the menu.sorry i been there so many times had try everything, all great !!
author: DontHurtMe T.

description: Our best friends introduced us to this restaurant and have loved it every since.  I think I started eating mussels due to this place.  Had only a x 1 bad experience with our  friends here.  Brought my parents recently and they loved mussels and crab!  Also must order the bone in filet which usually my Bf and I share.
author: Nicole M.

description: Great steak. We tried to make reservations but were told that we had to wait till 9:00 pm rather then 7:30. I used opentable app and booked it at 7:45.  Small place.
author: Ben M.

description: WOW!!! Food is off the hook!!! Service is super. I was there on Mother's Day and everyone was super nice. The valet guy, the host, and even our server was nice, funny and very attentive! The food speaks for itself! I will be back!
author: Michele T.

description:
The twice baked potato is freaken amazing! I'm going to come again just for that ( I only live 2 minutes walking distance). 

The filet mignon was better than the rib eye, so I'd recommend that. The bread is also really good here.

But once again TWICE BAKED POTATO?! HELLL YESS
author: Stephen N.

description:
Arrived on a late Saturday night without reservations. Surprised to see it pretty packed and decided to take one of the tables around the bar area. Took awhile before a waiter came by to offer us drinks and to take our order.

Had to try the bone-in filet mignon based on all the positive reviews and it did not disappoint. I'm not usually a fan of filet mignon, but this piece was really really good. I'm not a fan of olives so I had to take those of our complimentary fresh bread. Ordered the lobster soup as well but it was more curry flavor than I wanted. Ordered a double mussels and double crab as well. It arrived on this huge sizzling iron clad grill and smelled awesome. Even the tin cups of sauces were bubbling! Good flavor overall but I'll remember to order the smaller portion next time. Didn't get a chance to try dessert. 

It's a nice splurge spot and a unique atmosphere. I'm definitely a fan of their filet but within that area, I'd probably still choose House of Prime Rib as my first choice.
author: Rick T.

description: Im a huge fan of steak and googled "best steaks in the Bay Area" and Boboquivari's was one of the top choices. I decided to dine in with a couple of buddies on a mild weekday evening. I order the surf n turf which is a steak and crab dinner. I order most of my steaks medium rare to get the full flavor of the meat. My steak was very well flavored and had the taste I was looking for. The crab was descent not one of the best but ok. The sides are alittle different than any other high end restaurant I have been in.
author: W S.

description:
This place is too fucking cute.. Just too FUCKING CUTE! 

And the food is just absolutely MMMM.. I'm drooling just thinking about it! I would fly up north for one day just to have dinner here again. I'm not exaggerating either.. haha.. 

From my Martini to the Mac & Cheese to the Filet Mignon to the Crab to umm forgot what else I ordered but everything was so delicious! I just remember it melting in my mouth!

Man I miss Frisco now :[
author: Linda L.

description:
I went this restaurant weeks ago and ordered a whole crab. That was a mistake. If your female and somewhat of a dainty eater, order a half crab. This is only if you HAVE to have crab. It's messy and not so 'lady like" to be splashing around tiny crab parts  everywhere. The food is not that good here. My boyfriend  ordered the filet mignon with brussel sprouts. It was ok but again, not that  great. 

However, the ambience is fun. It reminds me Cirque Soleil. There is free
  valet parking!

That's all i have to say about this place.

Love,

D
author: Denise C.

description: Really really love their steak. More than Alexander's, more than Harris. Their signature filet with bone is to die for. I enjoyed the side dishes and dessert too. Also love the ambience and decor. And free valet parking if I remember right.
author: June W.

description: Sides were great, I ordered the bone in filet magnet Rare.  Everyone in the group regretted getting the Medium Rare (which is recommended on the menu).  The Rare came out very tender and delicious. The sizzling mussels were excellent too. Not usually a mussel eater, but I would definitely get the mussels here.  Drinks were quite strong.  Service was a bit pushy, but I guess with 14 people in the group, you sort of have to take control.  Valet Parking FREE is a major plus!
author: James W.

description:
Tired of driving around the city looking for a parking spot while you're running late for a great meal? Look no further Bobo's provides valet and good food!

I've been twice now and I didnt want to get slap happy and throw up some review so I went back 2 weeks later in a huge party and you know what?, Bobos killed it again.

I'm not gonna bore you with details so here it is. Get the combo to start shrimp, crab and mussels. The toy box tomatoes are so fresh and the burrata is so creamy and wonderful. We tried the crostini's too and they were real good but not mind blowing, but I cant say I've ever had a mind blowing crostini. All the steaks are great but my choice both times was the bone in filet. Its so tender and full of flavor, they dry age their beef like 45 days and its super delicious in my opinion.

The layout of the place is really weird but it goes real well with the motif and decor. The bar is kinda cramped from my experience as the layout is kinda wild too, but the cocktails are worth trying thats for sure.
author: Michael B.

description:
This is by far one of my favorite places to dine when in the city.  The filet Mignon is simply amazing.  I tried the twice baked potato and just lost myself in it's goodness.  I'm not a big veggie eater but their brussel sprouts were nothing like the ones my mother made me eat as a child!  They were wonderful!  The flavor just savored in my mouth.

I will continue to frequent Bobo's for it's food, excellent cocktails, and friendly servers.
author: Gigi L.

description:
Bone in filet! Just about the best steak money can buy.

Mac n Cheese made a great side dish.

Dunce Caps were a nice finish ;)
author: Michael K.

description: Went here for a double anniversary dinner with some good friends and it was a great experience. I love their surf and turf. The place is a little too dark inside for me but the food is amazing! Like any other place in San Francisco it is hard to get good parking space. It's on a pretty busy area. Pricey place but there's a reason why. Go check them out! I love this steak house!
author: Faye C.

description:
During my first visit to Bobo's for a friend's birthday. I ordered the surf & turf (half crab & petit filet mignon). I was more impressed with their crab. The steak didn't seem to be anything special. Would definitely come back for the crab! Our waitress was very accommodating.

If your just looking for a place to enjoy a decent meal at a somewhat decent price point. Consider checking out Bobo's.
author: Kristina S.

description: I took my wife here for her first post pregnancy meal. We had the surf and turf (fillet and Dungeness crab). The steak was perfect, the cocktails and wine were top notch, and the onion rings were some of the best I've ever had. My only complaint is how they prepared the crab. As a Pacific Northwest native, I believe all Dungeness crab needs is a little butter. The roasted garlic flavor was overkill. I didn't really care for it. Overall a great meal at a high price.
author: Erik C.

description: The Bone in filet mignon (medium) was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Its pricy but you can share one main dish if your on a lighter appetite.. The drinks came out great from the bar. The crab was fresh and tasted amazing. I kind of like the small rooms and atmosphere where I can see how/why others don't. I would recommend this place to others. I will definitely be back.
author: Roman J.

description: Great experience. Wonderful service and delicious food. Kind of dated appearance inside. Could be facelifted for the $$ of the food.
author: Katherine L.

description: Thank You for always being a place where we can come to eat and feel welcomed. The staff has become like family and the food is always on point. They even squeezed us in for 6 people last minute on a Saturday night for my Wife's belated birthday dinner last weekend. You guys ROCK!!!!!
author: philip S.

description: My new favorite for a good steak;I highly recommend the bone in Fillet Mignon
author: Domnica M.

description: Food was excellent. I have never paid $50 for a steak, but took the leap the other day for a special occasion. I'd come back.
author: Vincent R.

description:
Do I really have to Yelp this place?  No.
But what's one more review about how noteworthy their Filet Mignon with the bone-in gonna hurt?
Besides, I'm somewhat obligated since it was a special dinner.

We started off with the clams -- not bad.
They were cooked just right, seasoned well, and flavorful.
The olive bread, on the other hand, was so dry that they couldn't drizzle enough olive oil on it -- meh.
 
But who cares about the bread?  This place is known for their Filet.
And for very good reason.
It was so exquisitely tender that each bite simply melted in my mouth.  Yes, it's a little pricey, but for the quality and cut of meat, you're getting a bargain and very fond memory.  Good deal.

The only thing is if you overly savor each morsel of filet goodness, the residual fat may harden and make the meat near the bone kinda gross.

Side dishes are not included with the meal, but if there's any consolation, they are pretty good and enough for sharing.
- mushrooms: good meaty texture and buttery.
- swiss chard: good tasting greens and healthy.
- onion rings: good crispy outside and sweet red onion inside.

I'd be remiss if I didn't mention anything about the restaurant's ambiance.
There is a definite theme to this place.  I still don't know what that theme was exactly but it did scream funky bordering on gaudy.  Then there was the sounds of house (or trans) music playing in the background which could've been a distraction.  In the end, the steak made all things bearable.

I'm just happy an actual boboquivari didn't serve our food.
http://tbn0.google.com/images?q=tbn:j-K9_70r5W1rWM:http://www.kellypro.com/images/performers/Christmas/Marti_Cate_Jester.jpg
Scary yeah?

Overall, a highly recommended meal and surprisingly good choice by my kid sister.

Dinner topic of the night:
Have many native San Franciscans have been to Alcatraz?
Curiosity got me and I finally went three years ago and I now it feels like I'm bearing this badge of shame for doing something so obviously touristy.
Is that weird?
author: Dan B.

description:
The steak is the business!! Yummy I ordered it well and it was still juicy! The portabella mushrooms are Sooooo good!!

The shrimp is OK, the mussles are good, twiced baked potato I can do without :-/ 

The worst is the crab, its fried and then the top is dipped in something, it wasn't the greatest at all :-(
author: Niah N.

description:
Always cooked to perfection!  Filet Mignon bone-in rare!!!  That is what I always get and you should too.  Mac-N-Cheese is the bomb...so is the mushroom side, mussels and yellowtail carpaccio ...you won't be disappointed.  

Don't bother with the crab...this is a steak house so stick with the steak!  Also, their petite filet mignon is totally NOT worth it...when they say "petite" they mean "petite"...pay an additional $10 and get doubled (maybe even tripled) the size.  

Valet service for the horrible street parking availability of San Francisco Lombard Street.  Service is attentive and just plain great!
author: Patrick C.

description:
Was not impressed at all. I had been wanting to check this place out for a while, as I had heard good things. In particular, the decor was a bit odd. It felt like a Renaissance-times haunted house. 

The appetizer (shrimp) was decent, but the bone-in filet mignon that I had heard so much about was very bland. Absolutely no spices/flavor whatsoever. It was tender, at least.
author: Theodore N.

description:
GREAT steaks.     Really really great.    But about 10-15% overpriced.   $45 for a 10z filet with no side.   

We had the yellow fin carpaccio -  very delicate - delicious

The lobster crostini - I would have liked 4 of these over 2 at the price.  good, not amazing

Also had the 2x baked potato - that was crap.   Maybe sat in the fridge too long before cooking or something but utterly lacking in flavor, too bad because  I had high hopes for it.

All in all a nice restaurant though.   Kinda of a weird joint.   New Orleansy decor, bad 80's music on a never ending loop that sometimes skipped.   Kinda weird.    It's sort of like going to a nice steakhouse at disneyland near the pirates of the Caribbean ride.

It's no Harris's, but you can also be pretty relaxed here, no need to feel like you cannot get a drink on.
author: Rick R.

description:
Called at 830 on fri night asked if there were seats and the hostess told us we could sit at the bar. 

Free valet parking awesome

 We got there and she told us to take the seats at the bar she was right as soon as we sat a bunch of couples came.

Ordered the filet mignon bone in med rare. 1 baked potato and Brussels sprout.

We got the food within ten min this meal was going great.

Filet mignon med rare . Baked potatoes 

i dont recommend the crab it was dry and meat stuck to the shell, it was pretty bad. it looks good when people get it but dont do it.

service is quick for all servers pretty much on top of their game.

i've been back 5 times in 2 months
author: DOM d.

description: This used to be my favorite place, but during my recent visit, I noticed this restaurant has some cleanliness issues. The booth seats had food crumbs, the plates and silverware have oily spots. Gross. Food is still ok though.
author: Yen F.

description:
BONE-IN!!!!!!!!  BONE-IN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  BONE-IN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  BONE-IN FILET!!!!!!!!!!!  HUGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  HUGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  

Once you go bone-in, you can't go back!!!!! :P  Seriously.....its one of those MUST TRY places!!!!!!  I've been all over the country for best steaks and I am blown a way by their bone-in filet!!!!!!  

So juicy and delicious!!!!  Definitely the best!!!!  Waaaay better than the too formal Harris.  Seriously, unless you have a huge appetite, you do not need to order appetizers.  The freakin thing is a monster.  Just go in there and order the steak with their also very delicious sides and you can thank me lataaaaaar!!!!!!   :DDD
author: Crystal A.

description:
Date and Time:  Various late-night (for SF) dinners for the past 5 years
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Nice Stylish Mix
Atmosphere:  Lively
Decor:  Unique and Whimsical with lots of zebra prints and Big-Top stripes, the building itself is different.  Tri-level(we've only been to two)
like a house.  Tables and booths everywhere!
Service:  Very affable!
Imbibe:  Basil and The Dream martinis and all their wine
Devour:  The Bone-In Filet Mignon, yes that's all and well worth it!
Notes:  For some romantice renedzvous(not us, we're married) though I wish for the little tables with drawn curtains.  Sigh!
author: Genevieve Y.

description: It was my pre- anniversary dinner with my husband so we decided to come back to BoBos. If you like steak you have I come here!  We ordered the apple, Gorgonzola , pear, cranberry salad , man and cheese, onion rings and bone in filet minion! Everything turned out fantastic! Service was awesome and on point .  We had the chocolate bomb for dessert. If you like chocolate you have I get it! I highly recommend you come here and enjoy!
author: Louise T.

description:
Ahhhhh, this place! Had the pleasure of going here for a work dinner.

Let's get the easy stuff out of the way: Yes, it is expensive, yes it is a bit small on the first floor (I'm a tall guy).

But it is ridiculous! I had the filet mignon (no bone) and the waitress was not joking when she said it was their specialty. This was the best steak I've ever had: Perfectly cooked, rich texture, tender, cured to perfection. Don't put ANYTHING else on the mignon!

They also make good strong drinks!
author: Name R.

description: Have heard great things about Bobo's for quite some time now so we finally went to check it out. Get a reservation because it can get really packed in there...especially on the weekends. Anyway, we started out with the blood orange margaritas. They were tasty and I loved the touch of black salt on the rim. The fresh loaf of sourdough bread was a pleasant surprise. I always love some fresh bread and butter, but this loaf was not only buttered, it was topped with fresh garlic and olives. My husband ordered the blue cheese salad and was happy with it. For my entree, I ordered the Filet Mignon and we shared asparagus and cauliflower as our sides since all the entrees are a la carte. I should of gone with my gut and asked for the steak medium-well, but I went with the recommendation on the menu and ordered it medium. It was a little bit too rare for me. I still ate it, but I know I would of enjoyed it even more had it been cooked a little bit longer. That's my fault though. The prices are steep, but you get what you pay for when it comes to fresh cuts of meat. If you're looking to have a romantic steak dinner, Bobo's will do the trick.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
I must have missed something. Most of the reviews on Bobo's are really great, so I'm sad that I didn't have a better experience! 

Here's what I liked:

-Got seated right away, nice hostess
-Had seat by the window
-Super responsive waiter - cool arm tattoos
-Food delivered quickly
-Swiss chard side was delicious - just yummy


Here's what I didn't like: 

-The smell of disinfectant blasting me in the face when i walked in (big pet peeve of mine - kills my olfactory senses and appetite)
-Guy on kitchen staff left toilet seat up and floor a wet mess when I went to use restroom (at least, I'm assuming it was him)
-Caesar salad dressing was some gloppy icky substance..not good, not good at all. I was really craving a good salad so I was bummed 
-Crab cakes appie - also overpriced for what I got
-$39 new york strip bone-in was really a $19 steak. Way overpriced
-Split bottle of pinot ($39) - should have just brought my own. My mistake.

Lived here 12 years, had never gone but people raved about it, so I finally went. It was mediocre. Bill was $140. I was disappointed and pissed at spending that much and not loving it. Found myself regretting not listening to instincts and going to Izzy's instead.  Oh well - first world problems; I think I'll survive. :)

Hopefully you will have a better experience!
author: Karen E.

description:
I'm usually a bone in rib-eye kind of girl, but there wasn't one on the menu!  Was sad for a moment until I realized someone had once recommended the surf and turf.  I never trust surf and turfs (not sure why), but I thought I'd go crazy and give it a try.  I'm so glad I did!  The petit filet was actually REALLY REALLY good.  And I always love crab legs :)  

Can't remember what Mike had ... was way too into my own dish.  

The star of the show was definitely the twice baked potato.  I'm pretty sure I actually said "MMMMMMMMM" loudly after taking a bite.  Mike and I shared an order, but next time we're each getting our own.  

Prices were reasonable for a steakhouse ... but I'd still rather someone else pay for the meal ;)
author: Dina H.

description: This place is off the hook! the food and service is on point! the aged bone in filet mignon, the combo seafood, twice baked potato and carpaccio was absolutely amazing!  I cant wait to go back , and between my girlfriend and myself the tab was only 150$.  Free valet parking in SF who is going to complain to that.  The only problem i do have about this place is its seating arrangement.  You literally sit about a foot away from the next table, and without music or any background noise you literally listen to each others conversation.  That was a little awkward other than that we'll be back!
author: Jorlyn W.

description:
We do love our steaks and seafood, and have been to many fine steak restaurants in the area.  We decided to try Bobo's for a fun family dinner before seeing a play to celebrate the holidays.

Loved the interior - Warm, inviting, nice booths, charming, & a bit funky.

Loved the staff - Hostess was welcoming, efficient, and communicative.  Bartender (Shawn) was excellent!  Our martinis came with a shaker with more to pour.  Shawn was professional, very pleasant, and was fun to watch.  Our server was delightful - she was very knowledgeable, kind, helpful, witty, and attentive.

Loved the food - Roasted mussels - the best we've had in years - large succulent, tender!  Especially liked that they were roasted and not steamed or swimming in broth.  Roasted Dungeness crab - good sized with large legs and claws, garlicky (yummy), prepared to perfection.  Steaks - we shared bone-in filet (it was 10 - 12 oz not counting the bone - large enough to share and be satisfied), and others had petite filets - melt-in-your-mouth, perfectly seasoned, flavorful, and sublimely prepared beef.  Our sides were:  Sautéed mushrooms - chunks of Portobello mushrooms in a bit of wine sauce - delicious!; Cauliflower; Brussels Sprouts.  They were all good, and we shared the three between 5 of us - ample servings.

We brought a couple of bottles of wine, so paid a corkage fee, but it appears they have wine of all budgets and styles on their list.

All in all, a great experience!
author: Casey N.

description:
Excellent service but we had some issues with the food.
Contrary to some of the reviews we had no trouble requesting our meat cooked outside of the default medium rare. The problem was, my request for medium well came out well done.  All of the juices covered the plate as if they didn't let the meat rest properly. The result...a dry steak.
My wife requested medium and received medium rare. We would have sent it back had she not filled up on the crab she received as part of her surf and turf dinner. Outside of the meat, our olive bread was tasty but burnt on top. The twice baked potato was a bit bland. I loved the Swiss chard and brussel sprouts, but my wife thought they were a bit salty for her taste. The tomato salad was excellent.
Overall nothing was bad, but for the same money we much prefer the impeccable quality of Harris' just down the street.
author: Jeff G.

description:
What can I say about Bobo's other than INCREDIBLE!!! This is my second time visiting this restaurant and it is pure bliss. The first time I went on a date with my boyfriend and it made him look like a superhero for taking me to such a delicious place. 
The second time was for his birthday and the bone-in-filet was like butter and melted in our mouths! If you can afford a good night out, do it! The Steak is incredible and the muscles appetizer is to die for as well!
author: Jenna R.

description:
Excellent. Everything here is excellent. From the jester decor to the blood orange margaritas- worth coming again and again and again. 

Bobos has THE BEST steak in the bay area. They surpass Ruth's Chris and Harris' (and all that nasty dry-aged crap) but do not serve prime rib. Sigh. 

Still, check it out, even just for dessert and drinks - ALL FABULOUS!
author: Catherine L.

description:
Tried out Bobo's for the first time and was not disappointed. The bone in fillet mignon was delicious and tender. Highly recommend. The entrees are served a la carte, so you have to order sides separately. The sides are just okay and a bit expensive for the tiny portions.

ABSOLUTELY love the complimentary valet parking at the restaurant, as it is rather hard to find parking in the area.
author: Christina W.

description: We came to Bobo's for our one year wedding anniversary dinner. We really enjoyed our meals- surf & turf and the New York steak. The crab cakes were very tasty too. However, the decor was very odd. We couldn't figure out what the style was or what era we were in. Other than that, over all experience was good.
author: Alicia L.

description: The best steak I've ever had in SF. The grilled shrimps are delicious, and the filet mignon is fantastic.
author: Casber W.

description:
Had a reservation - still had to wait 50 minutes for a table. We thought they might comp us a drink at the bar but no, we still payed. Maybe they will waive the corkage fee? No, we still payed.
The steaks are good, but need to be better for $45. The salads and sides are unexciting and overpriced. The twice baked potato is more like half a potato. 
A potato for $9? Are we in 1850's Ireland?
The upstairs tables around the bar are cramped and with groups of people waiting for there reserved tables (!) I saw people getting bumped while trying to enjoy and overpriced meal.
I guess I'll keep searching for a decent steak restaurant in SF.
author: Kes A.

description:
Deducting 1 star for the bad appetizer and overpriced side items but overall they have AMAZING steaks. Here is what we had:

- crab crostini with smoked salmon and burrata: NOT GOOD. You get two small crostini's for $14.95 and the smoked salmon completely overpowers the entire dish so that you can't enjoy the flavors of the crab and creamy burrata.

- Bone-In Filet: Excellent steak but I actually preferred my husband's Porterhouse more! Perfectly cooked with a light sauce that really compliments the meant (not too much sauce so that you can really enjoy the dry aged beef.

- Porterhouse: This was absolutely one of the BEST steaks I've ever tasted. The New York section was so flavorful and the filet was super tender. A MUST!

Sides: modern mac and cheese was really good but a very tiny portion for $9. DON'T get the onion rings. You literally get 5 small mediocre onion rings. We had to get a second order. 10 small onion rings for $18? no thank you

Overall - come here for the steak and just the steak. The sides were disappointing.
author: Janelle R.

description: Steak was great, service was even better. Not my fav, but a good spot to go when visiting SF.
author: Jessica J.

description: Went here last night on a whim and not only did they take our patty of 4 at 10:50 pm (we did call ahead at 10:30), but they gave us fantastic service and an amazing meal. Started with the roast crab and mussels with the butter dipping sauce which was insanely good. If it is crab season, start with this! We then had the Porterhouse (which I shared with my husband because after all that rich crab, there was no way I could eat that huge steak by myself!). The steak was cooked medium rare and done to  absolute perfection!  The brussel sprouts, roasted cauliflower and mac n' cheese were great side dishes (although the mac n cheese could have used a little more salt). The nice bottle of Langtry Petite Syrah went well with the steaks. I would definitely come back here again!
author: Samantha W.

description: If you're in the city of SF and craving a good steak this is the spot. The steaks are cook to perfection as it should and the meat itself is top notch cut. The front receptionist was very helpful. Keep up the excellent cooking. Cheers!
author: SAMAY A.

description: Took my girlfriend here for her birthday dinner. We ordered the seafood combo on the sizzling grill, the bone-in filet mignon, twice cooked baked potato, and the portabella mushrooms. The seafood combo was good, however if I would rather have it on a regular plate than a sizzling platter.. The presentation is good but seafood gets over cooked on that sizzling plate, especially the shrimps. The filet mignon melted in your mouth like butter. The baked potato was bomb and the portabella mushrooms complimented the steak. Our server was pretty good. I told the host it was my girlfriends bday but they didn't do anything special for her.. Overall we had a great dinner and the price wasn't bad.. $135 and that's including wine and a dessert. We will definitely come back there again soon. Oh, and I heard you can order a 50 ounce porterhouse off the menu!
author: Marco A.

description: Quality if meat is excellent. May be best in SF. Chef refused to prepare my steak according to my wishes - twice - which pretty much ruined my meal.
author: Stephen M.

description:
I'm all out of witticisms.  And it's Saturday.  Early.

STEAKS:
Bone-in fillet mignon - juicy and flavorful, gives butter drenched Ruth's Chris a run for their money (And I mean butter drenched in a good way).  Dry aging the steak for weeks at a time, we were told, gives it the buttery flavor and tenderness that other more marbly cuts have.  We asked how much butter is used in preparing the fillet mignon and the waiter comes back and reports 1/2 tablespoon.  Sure.  I believe that.  I also believe that we're exiting Iraq real soon, the economy is headed for an upswing and George W. is Pro-Choice.  



SIDES:
Twice baked potato  was excellent.  I could feel my hips widening with each forkful.  Creamy, cheesy, buttery and with little bits of broccoli to make you feel better about stuffing your face with all those carbs.  I'm not crazy about cauliflower but Bobo's sauteed version was tasty and had a chili, garlicky bite.

APPS:
Lobster soup with giant pieces of lobster and croutons on the side was rich and flavorful.  I've no idea what the crab crostini tasted like because Pru didn't (or maybe--wouldn't) share.

DESSERT:
Pistachio panna cotta was passable.  I would go with the wild strawberry cheesecake next time, or the chocolate bomb.

ATMOSPHERE:
Go ahead and bring a real ugly date here.  The lighting is so dark, you'll miss that ginormous mole on the side of her nose.  

The tables are packed very close to each other that you'll feel like you know everyone in the neighboring tables.  Be prepared to be drawn in to other patrons' conversations about "how fabulous Rome was" and "Tyrone's bringing wings on Sunday".  

COST:
Expect $150-200 for a three course meal with one cocktail.  

WORTH IT and WOULD I RETURN?  Yes
author: Joc V.

description:
I've had a lot better food at this price point, it's just your typical overpriced steak restaurant. The table was wobbly(not something you'd expect from a 3 dollar signs restaurant), the lights were dim(it made me sleepy, and I couldn't see my food). The whole place feels cramped, you were literally right next to the other tables, they  could hear what you're talking about, and they almost splattered food on my GF, that's how close the tables were to each other. The waitress kept bumping into me when she was trying to walk by, she even hit my arm once when I was trying to cut my steak.

On the up-side, there's free valet parking which was a surprise, I figured they would milk whatever they could.

Bottom-line is I will not be coming back.
author: Killua Z.

description:
Wife and I had dinner there on Friday by accident. Driving down Lombard, we were actually going to another place when Bobo's caught my eye. Made a U-turn, pull in and we were being seated in the bar by the window.

Service was great, our waitress Jennifer was friendly and prompt. Really great personality!

Starters:

Bread with some sort of olive (lack of a better word) relish on top. Bread was a little crunchy but just wonderful. Herb aromas filled your mouth with every bite and not to mention the tanginess of the mixture topping the bread..

Lobster Crostini: Just fantastic, very flavorful and just an amazing app. It came with bur rata cheese with black sea salt sprinkled on top, very tasty!

Main:

Bone in filet and petite filet. What can I say. it was magnificent! There was a wonderful seared crust that was delicious and the meat just melted in your mouth. The pan drippings reduction was a perfect accompaniment to the steak.

Side: Twice Baked Potato - Another home run! At first site you are not sure what to expect but after the first bit it was an explosion of flavor. You could taste herbs, green onions and the buttery goodness was running through and through.

Dessert: Mango Panna Cotta. - Beautiful dish. Not too sweet, delicate and just right. Very smooth, creamy and well prepared.
author: A P.

description:
Great place to go to when you want to get away and go to the city.  It has a very New Orleans vibe, very lively.  

The burrata is incredible, and our crowd always goes for the crab. The crab is probably the best I have ever had.  It comes out on a piping hot cast iron plate.  Take their awesome bread and dip it in the seasonings and butter left on the cast iron - ridiculous!  

When we get steaks, we go for the bone-in-fillet. (Typically not a fillet man, but that added flavor makes it worth it) 

Free valet parking is also a plus.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Danny L.

description:
Our party of 6 was 45 minutes late and we never phoned in to warn them. But luckily, they were very accommodating and we got seats within 15 minutes. 

I shared the roasted mussels and shrimp appetizer with a friend. It was pretty good. The shrimp still had its shell but it was still able to soak in the flavors and juice. And the mussels were yummy. Great choice of appetizer!

I ordered the Petit Filet Mignon, and it was the tiniest piece of steak I've ever had in my life. And it is served A La Carte so no sides of potatoes or vegetables, nothing. Just your little steak and the sauce. So I would suggest the normal size or bone in because I hear it's a bit larger. My filet mignon was alright. The flavors and seasoning were on point. But I wasn't completely satisfied. And it wasn't even because it was so tiny. The bites were kind of chewy here and there. It wasn't as soft and tender as I hoped. But it was still good. The Mac n Cheese side was delicious! And the cheese flavor was really prominent.

And the dessert was mehh. We ordered the chocolate bomb I think and it had this kind of raspberry drizzle over it. It was whatever. SKIPPPP
author: Amy X.

description:
Bobo's passed its heyday at about 75 mph on the highway, and apparently never looked back.

A real shame, because a longtime favorite of mine and my wife's has clearly now become an obvious mess.

Abysmal food with an unprecedented degree of awful service.

Improperly-cooked steaks with zero flavor, accompanied by side dishes that are truly as close to dog food as must be allowed by our local legislators. The twice baked potato is a culinary confluence of mush and more mush, housed in a soggy shell. 

The only thing worse than the food was the service, and it goes all the way up to management.

if you get off on spending $100 (or more), per person, for a bad meal with apathetic servers, knock yourself out - Bobo's is for you.

This city has so many other choices - spend your money at those establishments instead.
author: D B.

description:
mmm mmm good. 

I came here with my sweetie, while it was a somewhat last minute trip to the city, finding reservations was not all that easy. I was going through my list of must eats and bobo's popped up. After a quick check they had a table available. SWEET!

After a rather long strange cab ride with a driver who got lost, i mean how hard can it be? Oh well we still made it on time. 

We had a short wait while the table was being prepared. The house specialty cocktails all were fantastic, I had both the Q-ball and the Rum Baba. Very nice...

Dinner was excellent, the appetizers perfect, if you've never had a dry aged bone in filet. Do yourself a favor and make a point to try it. WOW like melt in your mouth buttery goodness. I've had steaks all over this wild planet and easily Bobo's ranks up in the stratosphere.
author: Cooper M.

description: Food was good, I little tight on the seating (too close on neighboring tables).
author: Danvi P.

description:
I came here with two good friends on Christmas day a couple of years ago and had the best meal I have ever had.
