My friend picked Bobos, he'd found the restaurant online and we were doing a road trip round California over Christmas and new year and thought we should book something up for Christmas day.  What a find!

The Steak was incredible. Fillet Mignon on the bone. Just amazing.  We didn't hold back as we were on holiday for Christmas so we spent a hell of a lot but it was really worth it. Service was great and very helpful.
author: Richard S.

description: good steak, attentive service, and very very good mussels. I would definitely recommend to anyone. If there was a 4.5 option, I would give it to them. Just not sure it warrants a 5.
author: Sarah M.

description: One of my favorite steakhouses in the bay area...like everyone else says, get the bone in filet. But, check in ahead of time to make sure they haven't run out!
author: Christopher L.

description: Great food and superb service! The bone in filet mignon and the crab was popping with flavors!!!
author: Lakeen W.

description:
All those people who are vegetarians obviously have never had a steak from Boboquivari's.

The New York Bone-In, baby!  Taste it, chew it, enjoy it, and get fat.
author: Ally W.

description:
I spent $75 on dinner. Not bad, but I definitely can't afford to do this every night.

Three of us split the triple mussel order. After having 1 or 2 mussels I realized that they coat the shell with tons of salt!! I wonder why, maybe to mask the fishyness of the mussels or the oldness of it? I noticed that a handful of the mussels weren't even open all the way which means A BAD MUSSEL! 

I had a side of their twice baked potato which was good, but not 'tha bomb.' Definitely could use some work to it. But their yams were GOOD. I should have ordered that instead. I didn't get to try their crab but I'm not sure if I want crab from a steakhouse -- I think I much rather get it from Thanh Long. 

BUT BUT BUT...the winner of the night is their BONE IN FILET MIGNON. OMG. If you don't order this when they have it, then something is seriously wrong with you. I think this is the only steakhouse I've been to where they do serve the bone with their filet. The filet is about 13oz including the bone so it's a hefty size. Plus it's way juicier than normal filet because of that heavenly bone piece and the meat next to the bone kicks ass!!

I have to comment about their service though. The waitress who took our order was nice and very helpful. BUT the servers who brought out our food were something else. They kept confusing who ordered what. Setting down crab in front of us when we didn't order crab, or asking who ordered the filet, who ordered the blahblahblah. This was REALLY annoying especially for such a fancy restaurant like Boboquivaris. They should damn well know who ordered what instead of making it such a messy havoc! Minus 1 star for that.

(Photos uploaded)
author: Heidi C.

description: Had great potential with a relaxed, but refined atmosphere, great service, and excellent cuts of meat. Ended up just a mediocre experience since the chef couldn't seem to cook a steak medium-rare (even sent one back to let him try again). The wine list is quite good, but extremely overpriced. As much as 2.5x over retail. The cheesecake dessert was inedible. Will plan to try another steakhouse in the future.
author: Jacobus B.

description: Get the delicious bone in filet and share the shrimp and crab combo. Done deal. the meat was a little burnt on the outside but delicious nonetheless. I just have to stop by this place every time i am in SF.
author: duong p.

description: The gf and I both had steak!  it is a great 1st date location and they charge only 15 bucks for corkage fee.  Also the carpaccio yellowtail was very ...out of this world!!  Steak was cooked perfectly med rare and the seasoning was spot on!!  We kind of too chatty and were the last patron on the second floor and the waiter kindly let us know they were closing and was not rude about it!!  oops!!  I love the decor as its not to formal and easy place to get to know someone one!!
author: Geno L.

description:
Despite never having heard of this place (ohhh the shame), we were lucky enough to have been brought here by some good friends of ours....oh so good friends. 

A cozy and intimate space, the decor is chaotic and circus-themed. Jewel toned and lush, the first thing that impressed me was the fancy automatic double-swing front door. Enter this and the first thing to greet you is the bar. Don't ignore this sign. The bartender whipped up some well-crafted martinis (go for the basil). 

Once we were seated in a small-ish room just to the right of the bar, we indulged in the Heirloom Toy Box tomato appetizer. Amazing...so simple but delicious. It was hard not to gorge myself on that salad and still save room for my entree. They give you this fresh-baked loaf of olive bread. I don't even like olives but this bread was beautiful. 

Ordered the waiter's recommendation...if you can even call it that. He basically told us we were disgraces if we didn't order the bone-in filet mignon. Normally, I don't even really like filet mignon but with this rousing recommendation, I had no choice. And I'm really glad I listened. 

This steak..ordered medium rare, came on the lighter side of medium rare....almost fully rare. But I ate it anyway. So tasty and bloody. I fully embraced my inner carnivore and attempted to finish that big-ass filet. But my carb-loving self was fighting the good fight as well. The twice-baked potato was not even my side dish but i ate well over half of it. Baked yam was decent enough for me to clean the dish. Swiss chard was very garlicky and very good....Modern mac and cheese was great but nothing to write home about. 

Finished off the meal with the recommended Dunce Caps- very rich ...very nice, but I was already past the point of no return with my meal. 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Lauren G.

description:
I had nothing but salt for dinner at bobo's. what did i eat? i don't know...salt and something. what's that something? i don't know, the salt covered up all the taste! 

I tried:
yellowtail carpaccio: yummy, tasty, flavorful (not salty)
bone-in filet magnon: SALTY SALTY SALTY 
bone-in new york steak: not as salty. good? eh..not "the best"
bake potato: pretty good, but still on the salty side
Brussel sprouts: SOOOO salty, i cannot bare to take another bite.
dunce cone cane: yuuuummy

will i ever go back? ehhh.... neh
author: Anita C.

description: My bf and I went here for our anniversary. Complimentary valet and they greeted us happy anniversary when we walked in which I thought was a nice touch to our evening. Great/friendly customer service. We ate the garlic bread with yellowtail carpaccio as appetizer. Then Swiss chard and portobello mushrooms with bone in filet mignon (salivating right now). It was the best filet mignon I've had. Soft, juicy and so tasty with simple ingredients. Effortless to chew to say the least. We also ordered red wine, merlot peju. I'm not much of a wine drinker but it was easy to drink and a slight sweetness to this red.
author: Nana N.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner one year. 

The food was great...from what I can remember. The petit filet mignon was good, the sides were excellent. Mac n Cheese, portobello mushrooms, twice-baked potatoe. All deliicious. 

Not so good: The ditsy waitress who didn't seem to take us seriously. The service was..eh. I've had way better, even at their other resturants (Stinking Rose, Franciscan, Crab House, Calzone...pretty much all of them except for The Dead Fish, which I've never been to). For me, the service makes or breaks the experience. Would I come back? Maybe after I'm done being butt hurt.
author: Jeanette P.

description: If you are in the mood for a quiet intimate dinner do not come here.  However, if you want a delicious steak, and great service this is a must.  I gave it 4 stars due to seating is way too close to others, can't have a private conversation, which is part of the reason to dine out with my husband. The meal is all ala carte, so be prepared to spend $$$.  We chose wisely by sharing the bone-in filet along with a twice baked potato and super yummy portobello mushrooms, which added a lot of flavor to the meat.  The roasted shrimp had good seasonings, yet were over cooked.  Corkage fee is quite reasonable, 15.00, so bring a favorite bottle of vino to enjoy!! Maybe requesting a quieter table will be the plan for our next visit.
author: Neice K.

description:
Came here for the first time with my lady. The layout of the place was very cramped. The lighting was very dark and we were so close to one another you can hear the person next to you there conversation.

The food was good. I ordered the New York steak with the twice bake potato and my girl ordered the double shrimp with crab. The steak and crab was very good. The shrimp was just ok. I do not recommend the shrimp nothing special. I could have done it myself.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I had high expectations for Bobo's. I can't say that I was blown away, but it was definitely very good. The meat is fantastic and it's true what they say- the steaks come out more rare than you order. If you order medium rare, be prepared for a VERY rare steak on your plate (probably still has a pulse). Knowing this ahead of time, I ordered a bone-in ribeye medium, and it came out just as I like it - medium rare. The steaks are served with an au-jus like sauce...I usually don't like gravy or sauce on my steak, I like the meat's natural flavor to speak for itself. But in this case, the au jus was very mild and only enhanced the flavor.

We started with a caesar salad (split) which was fresh and light with homemade croutons - definitely a big salad, perfect for sharing. We also ordered the lobster crostini with burrata. SO good. For entrees we each had the bone-in ribeye, and for sides we ordered twice-baked potato and mac n cheese. Twice-baked potato was delish - a little on the salty side but very tasty. The mac and cheese was disappointing- it tasted strongly of sharp bleu cheese, which was unexpected. Bleu cheese is for salads, not mac n cheese! We also ordered a couple cocktails - Qball and Blood Orange margarita. The qball was delicious! Needless to say, we were way too full for dessert.

Bobo's is great, but I'm not convinced it's the "best steak in SF." Even though Ruth's Chris gets a bad rap because it's a chain establishment, I have to say that for the price, I prefer their steak, service, and ambience over Bobo's. 

Above ALL else, if you come here, request a private booth or table that isn't bumping elbows with the table next to it. Some of the tables are literally 10 inches away from the table edge next to it, maybe less. We could hear the couple next to us CHEWING for chrissake. That's my only major complaint!
author: Kristen S.

description: I have mixed feelings about this place - as I went out with a group of friends, and I really enjoyed the eclectic atmosphere, great tasting steak (I had the filet mignon), and the sides. But that is a far cry from what one of my friends would say about this place. He ordered a medium-cooked filet mignon, and it came out very well done. He sent it back, and it came back almost raw. Needless to say, he didn't finish the steak - and the meal was comped. I will have to consider if I would come back or not.
author: Laurie S.

description:
Must order:
Bone-In Filet Mignon (dry aged)
Garlic Bread

One of THE best steakhouses in SF...

Dry age makes the meat extra tender. Tons of marbling on the filet mignon with gives it big flavor. Salted just the right amount to bring out all the wonderful beefy taste to it.

Garlic bread was maybe $4 bucks but well worth it. Comes out super warm and garlicky. Can't go wrong. But don't fill yourself up too much because the bone-in filet is humongous.
author: Lily V.

description: I picked Bobo's for my birthday dinner, and it definitely met our expectations.  We tried to get a good sampling of the menu, but with just two of us we could only order so much!  The only disappointment was the yellowtail tartare appetizer.  The flavor of the fish was over-powered by the vinaigrette, so the whole plate was a bit boring.  But the tomato salad appetizer was delicious, it was like a caprese and had the best, creamiest, mozzarella.   I had a steak, and my bf had the surf n turf.  My medium rare steak was cooked perfectly!  The crab legs were the best I've had (although I don't order them often).  We also had a side of brussel sprouts and pancetta, which was a great side.
author: Anastacia S.

description:
I've been meaning to try Bobo's for quite some time now, and when my date surprised me by taking me here the other night, I was very pleased.

We were seated at a little table in the back for 2. It was somewhat secluded, with curtains separating us from some of the other tables, and the lighting was very dim-- perfect romantic atmosphere.

We ordered the basil martinis as a drink to start. Can I just say that this is probably my favorite cocktail I've tried in the city thus far. VERY much worth it, and I'd recommend it to anyone. We also ordered the heirloom salad with buratta, and a caesar salad to start. A complimentary half loaf of garlic bread was also served and was quite good, though I didn't munch on too much of that. All the appetizers were absolutely wonderful, with my favorite being the tomato salad.

My date ordered the surf&turf (a petit filet mignon and crab), and I ordered just the petit filet mignon. Our plan was to share the crab. My steak was cooked to a perfect medium, just as ordered. It was melt-in-your-mouth good. One of the juiciest steaks I've had in a while. The crab was also wonderful, and tasted great in the butter sauce it was served with.

Service was just fine, nothing special there. Our drinks were always full, and the gentleman bussing our table was very good about clearing empty plates, and getting clean plates to our table.

I very much enjoyed my experience here, and am glad to cross it off my list of places I need to try. I'll be sure to recommend this place as one of the best steakhouses in the city, and hopefully I get the chance to come back here again!
author: Ashley D.

description: I had a wonderful Mother's Day here with my daughter. Our waiter was professional & friendly and other staff members were courteous as well and all of our food arrived on time. We had an order of the lobster as well as the crab crostini. I liked them both but my preference was the crab. It comes with homemade cheese on the plate and once you add a lil salt to it, the flavors pop! We had the bone-in filet and the ribeye and both of our steaks were prepared as we requested. Loved the cauliflower... although I wish I had asked for extra parmesan upon ordering, it was quite tasty! The toasted Bread! Yum especially with the leftover cheese from the crostini... The mac & cheese... with the toasted bread crumbs... (I suggest adding crab!), was not the soul food mac that I am personally used to but it was also Yummy! I also had a Blood Orange margarita with a shot of Gran Marnier, which was on point.
author: Reelle L.

description: Good steak! Most importantly, they have valley! I cant say this would be my first pick, or the best steak comparing it to other places, but a different experience for sure. The waiter seemed rushed when taking our orders and didn't give us too much of his time.Would I go back? Maybe but wouldn't be my choice.
author: Christa S.

description: Everything amazing - steaks, drinks, oysters, the works.
author: Steve M.

description:
My filet mignon was very good, and we chewed it down to the bone.  The fish was excellent and so was the Lobster Crostini, with what I think was a divine mozzarella slice.

The portobello mushroom side was not that great.  I thought portobellos would be too firm and they were.

Love the decor as well.  We sat right next to the window to Lombard Street, and it is nice to see the cars roll by.
author: Steve F.

description: Our picks for the night: blood orange margarita,  dungeness crab cakes, double stuffed potatoes, brussel sprouts, and the fillet mignon bone in. Everything was good. My only complaint is that my steak was not rare enough and the brussel sprouts tasted like pinches of salt  sprinkled in our mouth.  The steak took forever to be served so I didn't want to order another steak. I had a nice pink center but the rest of the steak was too cooked for me. The server was nice enough to take our brussel sprouts back and it returned perfect because there was less cheese on it. The service excellent and there is free valet at the door.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Fabulous experience! Gerald Murphy took great care of us, and showed some guest we had in town true hospitality!! Bone in Filet perfectly prepared, and still in my opinion the best in SF. Service was spot on. Not overly baring, but attentive to our needs and to the fact we were there to enjoy a meal not just eat. The Bleu salad was on the next level with a generous portion of high quality crumbles and cubes of premium bacon. Twice baked potato, and sauteed brussel sprouts complemented the steaks greatly. To conclude the meal the chocolate mousse stuffed waffle cones with fresh raspberries was perfectly executed and portioned just right to please the entire table. Worth every penny, and love introducing out of town guest to the City's local legendary restaurants!!!
author: Michael K.

description: The steak is Amazing !!! My favorite steak house that is affordable in SF. such wonderful customer service
author: M P.

description:
The decor feels quite different from the actual food. It's a little bit of class, a litte bit of indie (and some very strange questionable decor piece). 

We came here for dinner, and sat by the window, while it's raining outside. It was quite romantic (if it was for dinner 2).

Every single dishes that I ordered was delicious. And by delicious, I mean there was nothing left by the time we stood up. Probably should leave some room for desert next time though.

The filet mignon was juice, medium-cooked, and so tasty and tender It melt in your mouth. If you order the surf and turf, which I did, the crab legs was quite fresh, required a bit of work, but was well worth it.

Definitely come again.
author: Truong N.

description: Have been to this place now three times and every time it's been great. The bone in filet n the New York is to die for. The  combo mussles and crab is amazing. The only problem I had was the lobster bisque. It was terrible, more like a curry soup with no lobster in it.
author: Will E.

description:
Pricey but absolutely worth it.  I went there for a bachelor party dinner, and will let the following exchange encapsulate most of my review:

(Group mostly decides to get steak with crab, which I understand comes in the shell)

Guy from my group to waiter, after ordering for us: Do you think you could crack the crab shell in half?  

Waiter: Huh?

Guy: Yeah, I'm kind of lazy.  I can't reach some of the crab in the whole shell.  But if you crack the shell in half, it would be easier to get.

Waiter: Really?  (eventually acquiesces and leaves)

While it sounds like the waiter wasn't helpful, he actually was.  When our entrees came out, there wasn't a shell at all.  The cook staff had taken all of the meat out for us and placed it in a separate dish to eat along with the steak.

Did I mention it was all delicious?  Definitely going back.
author: Ken L.

description:
It's surprising that I've been here for 13 years, live in the neighborhood and never went to Bobo's!

I thought it was a bit of a touristy place but to my surprise yesterday it is one of the cutest spot i've been in!

The decor is adorable, all red with Italian masks all over, 3 levels of fun, though the ones I liked best was the first and last floors. 

Now onto the food: My oh MY!

We got the Iron Skillet mussels and shrimps to start. Very good! they're already seasoned in garlic and butter (they do provide extra butter for the butter lovers out there - you know who you are)

The boned filet mignon has got to be one of the best cut i've had in the city. We also got the half crab which was good (i like my crab simple but this one was pre-seasoned) The heirloom tomatoes salad with burrata was also very tasty. 

We'll definitely go there again!
author: Nez B.

description: the steak is soft as butter, the yams, brussel sprouts, mac n cheese, twice baked potatoes...etc etc everything here is excellent!!!! even things that you never liked or thought you would like are exquisite!!!
author: Jenny P.

description: Bone-in filet minion was awesome. Porterhouse was good. Sides were okay. Probably will be back, but not sure if its worth the money.
author: Josh C.

description: They are known for their steak. My colleague had nothing but good things to say about it. I enjoyed several of their apps, soup, and salad and loved all parts of the meal. The seating is close but it doesn't feel that way, perhaps the service is what brings this place above the rest. The waiter was attentive and answered any and all questions. I even lost the receipt and they were able to assist in pulling it for my business expense.
author: Andre F.

description:
This review is more of a 3.5 stars but since I would recommend this restaurant to friends I am bumping it up to 4.

Came here for Valentine's day.  We had reservations and was seated right away (plus).  Hostess put us in one of the worse corners possible (minus). It was very (too) private (plus) but was also very claustrophic (double minus). You can't even wave someone down without tipping your chair backwards or straining your neck. So yea, watch out where they seat you if you get an upstairs seat!

Service was excellent, even though no one can see us, someone still stopped by every 10 minutes or so.

Menu is really simple.  Just a page of appetizers, salads and a handful of selection of steaks. Easy choice for us. We both love filets so i got the surf & turf (petite filet + crab legs) and he got the bone-in filet.

Steaks were cooked perfectly. When they say medium rare, they mean medium rare.  Plain steak with some oily sauce on the bottom.

It was my mistake to order crab at a nice restaurant. Obviously I made a mess trying to crack my crab legs.  The crab was really fresh but really oily. Why they didn't include a wet nap with my dish is beyond me. I had to make a fuss with my husband to get him to exchange my napkin while i went to wash my hands.

Sides are extra. Since i've been stress eating all day i skipped out on the sides. We shared a twiced baked potato.  It was good, nothing to really rally about.

Bobo's is good but I still prefer the sizzling plate of Ruth's Chris. That's just me.
author: Terry D.

description: Not what we expected especially considering the prices. Steak tough, crab overdone, way too greasy. Won't go back. Service, barley. Not very attentive. Big dissapointment.
author: Artie C.

description:
THE BEST MEAL I'VE EVER HAD. 

I took my man here for his birthday, at his request, and WOW I was blown away!

We had the bone-in filet and half crab surf and turf along with the twice baked potato, Brussels sprouts, portobello mushrooms and truffle mac and cheese that was so good you don't want to stop eating it.  The filet was perfectly cooked with a crispy crust on it and warm juicy pink center and the crab was to die for! Whatever sauce they serve with the crab is like crack. 

Go.
author: Nikki M.

description: After a review I posted pointed out a small problem, I see that the General Manager immediately responded to me with a helpful apology. This is outstanding, and is just one reason Bobo's continues to be so highly regarded. By the way, their bread with the meal is so unusual and outstanding!
author: Richard T.

description: I can't complain about the food or service. Everything was good but for the price I don't intend to return. It feels like a step up from Black Angus...
author: johanna a.

description: I enjoyed this place but for sure make reservations! This is NOT a relaxed environment at all...lol...It was extremely busy and loud. Their specialty drinks were ok but they had my scotch so that saved the day lol...The steak (I had the petite) was made just perfect and the mac n cheese was yummy too. All in all - a fun experience. I may come back again.
author: Bella B.

description: To keep it short..you definitely get what you pay for here. The Filet Mignon was juicy to the touch and cooked to perfection. They suggest it medium-rare in which I usually order all of my meat cooked medium to medium-well. My GF and I went with their suggestion and while the food was fantastic, the seating arrangement was what bothered us. I guess this really wasn't Bobo's fault but it did make our dine-in experience a little...uncomfortable. Overall, I would give this place 4 stars.
author: Marc B.

description:
Can I give them negative star?!?  Rude service along with overpriced, over-salty steak.  No thanks!  Wouldn't even come here on my enemy's tab!  We came here earlier in the month with a party of 10 for my brother's birthday.  Everyone from the hostess to the waitress were being unfriendly and bitter just cuz none of us wanted to order any alcoholic drinks.  But both my brothers had a hangover from the night before and none of the girls wanted to drink.  No big deal if we're paying $40 for a steak with no sides and we each have to order  2 sides for $8 each in size that I can eat in two bites.  That two hours dinner costs $700 which includes a $108 gratuity along with an ungrateful waitress who wouldn't even lift her head up from cleaning the table to say a simple "Thank You."
Oh, and we also got an earful from my dad for how unwisely we spend our handworking money.
author: Linda P.

description: The best steak Mignon and the best garlic crab. I just walked in as this was on the way, and came out perfectly served and satiated. Congratulations
author: Avinash M.

description:
Hands Down, the Best Steak in Town!

I reviewed Bobo's on Check Please Bay Area season 5 episode 12.  I LOVE this place and if you want you can check out the Check Please episode go to kqed website and search for the Check Please show (512).

I like to go out for steak and I enjoy dining at some of the steakhouses in the city but, Bobo's is the best.  Harris's for me, is the second best and Alfred's after Harris'.  Unfortunately, I have had below average steaks at Morton's and Ruth's Chris'.  Bob's and Epic as well as Morton's and Ruth's Chris' are too expensive and the steaks aren't as tasty as Bobo's.  Lark Creek Steakhouse is hit and miss, Izzy's steaks are just not that great overall.  I haven't been to Michael Mina's new digs at the St. Francis Hotel.  It's probably good, but I have kids to feed and a mortgage to pay!  I heard that 5A5 is good, but I haven't been.

Food:  Dry aged- Great Bone-In Filet and Bone in NY- best I 've had.  They arrive at the table hot and very rare.  Order it medium if you like it medium rare.  The sides are delicious.  My personal favorites are the Brussel Sprouts and the Twice Baked Potato.  Mac and Cheese one of the best in the city and the Yellow Tail carpaccio is outstanding and the Lobster bisque has a curry flavor.  You can also get crab, and mussels- which some of my friends criticize, but I think are delicious dishes.

Service:  Fabulous, fantastic, super service.  The wait staff is friendly, yet not over the top, efficient, professional, and seem like they are genuinely NICE people. 

Atmosphere:  Circus like,with colorful walls and decor, which I admit, I had to get used to, but now I wouldn't want it any other way.  It's unique and a good idea to decorate in this manner because it is a small space.

Bar:  Small, but good things come in small packages.  Comfortable u shaped bar with cool lighting.  Very tasty homemade recipe martinis,   great wine list with some very reasonably priced, but delicious wines.  

Price/Value:  Bobo's is NOT as expensive as Harris', Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Bob's, or Epic.  Most steaks are $39.00 as compared to steaks that are priced in the $40-$50 range for the other steak houses.  Alfred's, Izzy's and Lark Creek are probably cheaper than Bobo's.  While it is not inexpensive, it is by far the best value steakhouse in the CIty. 

Parking:  free valet

Overall: 5 stars- go to Bobo's- I would go on a weekly basis if possible.
author: Edmond S.

description:
First of all, this is not a steak place.  It is a crab place with a couple of options for steak.

It is also not a place for wine.  Their wine list is really embarrassing if they want to call themselves a steak place. When the girl at the next table said "I like this Peju wine, it's hella good", I knew I came to the wrong place to enjoy my wine...

When the waiter opened my bottle, instead of pouring a taste for one guest first, he went ahead and poured half a glass for everyone.  He did try to comment and say the wine has a nice red color to it.  The wine of course needed to breath, so i had to steal a glass from another table so we can aerate one glass to another.  I spotted some bigger glasses on their top shelves and asked the waiter if we can use those instead.  The waiter said it's house rules patrons only get the big glasses if they order a full bottle from their wine list.  Just a side note, by the time I left the restaurant, only one table on our floor ordered a full bottle.  So those glasses just say there on the top shelves collecting dust.  Big minus.  I asked the waiter if they have a decanter and he said he will try to find one.  The dude, brought back a flower vase, poured my wine into the vase and literally shake rattle and roll my wine in the vase! I almost fainted at that moment.  BIG BIG minus.  Later when the waiter came back to pour me some more wine, I had to wave him off, fearing what other brutality he had up his sleeves.

As for the food, it was not bad.  The bread was very beautifully baked.  The dungeness crab crostin is not something you get everywhere which is good so I have something to remember this place by.  I ordered the boned in filet since it was the same price as the bone free filet.  My friend warned me about the steak at this place but what the heck, anyone can have an off night.  Cause my expectations were set so low, when my filet came out medium rare just as i asked, I was pleasantly surprised.  They add this peppery salty sauce on top.  The bone was rather forgettable cause it was like a small piece of shaved bone.  Later though when the party next to me order the boneless, I realize you get a much bigger cut with the bone in.  I also saw the petite filet, just an fyi, it's like an appetizer cut. 

Bobo is located in the middle of a residential and restaurant area.  So depending on the time you go, street parking is a toss of a coin if you don't want to do valet.
author: Vito L.

description:
really liked this place.  had a kinda cheesy decor inside, but i dug it.  really felt old school (clean), and they had good service.

didn't really get into the apps and stayed with the bread and cocktails.  it felt like a good decision considering how much we ate later, but those sizzling platters looked delicious.  bread seemed freshly baked and had olives on top - great bread.  love bread.  .... bread.

stayed with the classics and got the bone in filet, med rare.  first time having this cut and it was cooked perfectly.  simply cooked, tender, and great flavor.  sides of chard, cauliflower, and brussel sprouts - all great.  

highly recommended and i'll be back when i feel like having a steak.  solid experience all over.
author: Robert K.

description:
Hands down, one of the best Steakhouses in the City.  Only reason why it's getting 4 stars is because it's a steakhouse without ribeye (Right, Roman Y?)  BUT...it's undoubtedly a mecca for Bone-In Filet Mignon.  What?  Bone-In Filet Mignon?  Oh my, yes!

My parents treated me here for an early bday dinner.  I loved the cirque du soleil-esque decor and old school vibe with little nooks and crannies everywhere.  Everything was exceptional, including the service.  Our server was super nice and gave us lots of great recommendations and we took each one of them!  The only gripe that my mom had was that the music was too loud.  Maybe that was atributed by the fact that she was sitting right under a speaker?  

Anyhoo...on to the main event: 
-Bread/loaf: Perfect-out-of-the-oven loaf, crisp on the outside, warm and soft on the inside.  
-Lobster Soup: Curry-based soup with HUGE chunks of Lobster.  Goodness Gracious!
-Mushrooms in a marsala-like sauce.  A classic side to steak!
-Twice-Baked Potato: Loved the zucchini bits in the oh-so-creamy potato!
-Mac n Cheese: I will have to say that I've had better, but it definitely was good, nonetheless.
-Surf n Turf: Crab Legs with a slight taste of garlic butter dipped in sauce (I'm drooling...) and a petite filet mignon perfectly cooked medium rare.
-BONE-IN FILET MIGNON: One cannot have this cooked more than medium rare.  Mine was a bit overcooked (but the middle was still rare), but my mom's was SO GOOD...It was so good that she literally kept saying "this is SO GOOD!"  with every bite.  

And as if I wasn't full already, the pretty server tempted us with the dessert menu.  
-The Dunce Cap Cones: Little waffle cones atop sweet and light chocolate mousse.  PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT!
-Strawberry Italian Cheesecake: Layered, almost like a tiramisu...but not.  :)

I'd definitely come back in near future...I recommend starving yourself the day of, just to make sure you have enough room in your tummy for the wonderment that is Boboquivari!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This place is great.

Eclectic decor, solid wine list, and the food... oh, yes, the food.  Let's just start with the bread.  It's pretty awesome.  I mean, you wouldn't expect me to mention the bread, right?  But here I am, mentioning the bread.  It's yummy.

And then they bring you the meat.  I took my dad here when he was visiting, and we both ended up getting steaks, so we didn't try out the crab.  But the steak: excellent.  I'm a medium-rare kinda guy, and it was cooked exactly as I'd expect.  The portion was generous considering the classiness of the place.  Sides were tasty as well.

Ah yes, and: lots of red.  (Now I'm talking about the decor again though the steak was of course dripping red.)
author: Brian T.

description: They are getting two stars because i LOVE the food (brussel sprouts and mac and cheese is to die for.) But i have worked in the restaurant/event planning industry for years. if you are thinking about hosting party here, i discourage it. I made a reservation through Lisi, their "event coordinator" After no phone response, or email response, and having to call the restaurant to try and figure out how to accomplish this she emailed me back. I signed a contract stating that i had to pay $50 a head for every person that didn't show up. She confirmed our reservation for 18 people. I show up Saturday night with an entire party for my boyfriends 30th birthday party and i should have figured..... NO reservation. I was so embarrassed. I had 18 people standing around while they figured out a room to put us in. The manager only did this after i threw a fit. After waiting an hour they put us in a nice room and i was content. But i at least figured after making us wait an hour they would do something to make up for the inconvenience.. Nope we were charged corkage fee and all. Sad to say, i don't think we will be back after this experience. And we were defiantly considered regulars before! But Lisi's lack of attention and care is something that this business will lose a lot of customers over.  so sad :(
author: Hilary M.

description: Best steak I have ever had! Bone-in filet is a must.  Chocolate mousse cones...average. Overall great experience!
author: Jaime E.

description:
Oh my holy sweet fancy jesus h. christ in a chicken basket.  This place is amazing. 

I've been here with clients for work.... been here with my veggie fiance... been here to hang out with friends... and I think it's at least in the top 3 steaks I've ever had.  Right up there would be Ruth's Chris and Corpers 5 Oclock Grill in Milwaukee.  

Ok... so the place is a little crazy, with a New Orleans french quarter kinda theme... lots of clowns, and I mean lots of clowns.  lots of them, some are creepy.  

The drinks are amazing, but expensive... the sides are unbelievable, so good that my fiance said she would totally eat there again even though it's a steak/crab place... the sides were more than enough delicious for her meal.  

The steaks... oh, oh the steaks.  so so good.  Like, good enough to make you pause for a few minutes after you first bite, and you just get lost in the flavor.  You reach some sort of clarity or something.  It's practically religious.  Nirvana in the form of a sirloin.  (how's THAT for irony)

Anyhow, it is amazing.  If you're looking this place up, and read this review... drop the iphone... shut down the laptop and immediately leave and go to Bobos.
author: Bill L.

description: Nothing special. I had the crab and it wasn't as good as other place's I've been. I would definitely give this place another shot.
author: Alan V.

description: Ate here last night and it was delish! Hubby and I ordered the combo of mussels, crab and shrimp. Wow, what a lot of food but incredibly flavorful. The bread that came with it was good too. We also ordered the bone-in filet which melted like butter in our mouths as well as the brussel sprouts and twice baked potatoes. Everything was delish and we will definitely go back. Also, the portions are very large so while the prices are high, you could def share with someone and leave plenty full.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Food is just amazing!  Even though the tables are close and the place "feels" crowded it's the opposite.  I felt like we were in a room all our own....service is excellent and wine list complimentary!  Definitely a special occasion kind of spot!
author: Valerie R.

description:
Arguably the most bizarre steak house I've ever frequented. The theme is high-end fun-house. Expect a few dining rooms partitioned by velvet curtains and lots (and I do mean lots) of clowns. I didn't think steaks and circus clowns went together, but here it kind of works.

As for the steaks, they did not disappoint. The waiter recommended I went with the bone in filet---first time I ever had a bone in my filet mignon. Imagine the tenderness of a filet with the stronger flavors of a ny strip, and viola you have a bone in filet. Portions are exceptionally large.

Pricey yes, but hands-down this is the best clown-themed steak house in San Francisco!
author: Dave S.

description: Been to a bunch of steakhouses - consistently the best ambiance, food quality, service... Once seated it is a great place to relax and with conversation or just enjoy the 9.75/10 food. Best to get a reservation but I've been able to stop by and get a table for two on occasional weekend nights.
author: John O.

description:
The first bite I took of Bobo's bone-in fillet transported me back to my childhood when grandmother would make me, what I still think to this day and have yet to experience otherwise, the best steak ever.

Bobo's steak is definitely worth the comparison to that juicy, buttery, perfectly seasoned, well marbled, and cooked to perfection steak.  During dinner I was convinced that they had my grandmother somewhere in the basement frying up steaks.

Get the steak.  Get the crab.  Enjoy!
author: James G.

description:
Brought my b.f. here for his 25th birthday after spending the day watching a Chinese Theatre show at the Orpheum. This restaurant along with the whole day surpasses any other birthday he's had so far. He tells me all the time.

We arrived at this restaurant at around 9:00pm. I made reservations here 2 weeks prior to coming. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess that led us to a dimly lit secluded corner of the restaurant that gave us privacy and a romantic setting. I had included in my reservation that this dinner was special because of my b.f.'s birthday and they apparently listened. 

I was somewhat doubtful since we were so secluded in the restaurant with even a curtain to give us even more privacy, if we were going to get good service. What if they just forgot about us back here? To my surprise the service was excellent! Our waiter was charming and treated us with the utmost respect and gave us a good recommendation to a very expensive though tasty bottle of red wine.

We ordered a well portioned fillet mignon and cracked crab. The crab was a little on the salty side but was cooked to perfection. I dipped it in some butter and lemon and it was heaven in my mouth! The fillet was melt in your mouth delicious! It was tender and juicy! Could not eat it slow enough! The wine made our meals taste even better!

The decor of Bobo's was eclectic and fun although had a somewhat mysterious feel to it. By the time we finished off the bottle of wine in a two hour timespan, the restaurant was getting ready to close, we had our bellies full, our minds fuzzy; though happy, and our wallets empty! Could not ask for a better night to finish off my b.f.'s 25th birthday! Thank you Boboquivari's! Will definitely be returning!
author: Jacqueline P.

description: Fair service but nothing special for the price you are paying. The food is decent. The customer service... Terrible! We ordered 2 steaks medium and received 2 steaks that were rare. We nicely told the waitress that we ordered medium and she confirmed that they were very rare. She took the plates away and came back in 5-10 minutes saying that they will cook the pieces that we had left and bring it back. And they did just that... On the same dirty plates. Even places with the price range/class of elephant bar will ask to remake your entire dish or comp you for it if they were the ones that messed up! Nope... Not here. Definitely will not be back!
author: Elena L.

description: as  much I have enjoyed this place over the last ten years I am very disappointed  that  my early reservation for my sons 18th birthday was lost. We were not getting a new reservation at any time this evening and only  being asked to speak the manager! sorry, no more bobos for us.
author: Hans A.

description: I got the petite filet mignon which came out relatively quick and was cooked to my liking. With so many good steakhouses in the city, there wasn't anything that particularly stood out in my experience. If I'm going to pay that much for a steak, I hope that either the ambiance, service, or some amazing preparation/quality of the steak was of very high quality.
author: Kirk A.

description: This place is stupidly expensive, with marginal atmosphere and only passable food . . . Except for the steak, which was exceptional.  Seriously, I was ready to leave as I sat in the dank little room and contemplated a small-pour cocktail at $14 or wine priced 4x retail. It screams tourist ripoff.  But the steak hit the table, and I got it. It's a great steak. Is it worth the mediocrity of the rest of the experience or the absurd prices?  No way.  But I will remember that  steak, even though it is highly unlikely I would ever want to go back.
author: Douglas E.

description:
I really wanted to be "wow-ed" by Bobo's but wasn't. It started with our hostess seating us in a tiny corner of the restaurant with the walls around us being a crazy plaid design that made me super dizzy! Then our server was brand new and definitely let us know by stating on several occasions that she had only been there a week. She definitely needed to learn her boundaries. 
Now onto the food! Ordered the Filet and Steak. Both were very good. For appetizers we ordered the Lobster soup and the Brussel sprouts with pancetta . I enjoyed the flavor of the soup but to me lacked that 'something' like a spice maybe. The Brussel sprouts were nothing amazing but still tasty. Unfortunately, I got really sick the next day though. I think I got food poisoning from something I ate because it was one of those days where I couldn't be far from a restroom. 
All in all I'm not sure if Id go back. It was a good experience but left me nauseous.
author: Natasha I.

description:
My wife and I have been going to Bobo's for a couple years now. It's our go to place for an expensive night out. We have probably visited 5 or 6 times in the two years plus we've lived in SF and have never been disappointed.

They prepare the best steaks I have ever tasted. Always done perfectly, no matter what cut you order. The sides are really good but not off the charts awesome, but you come for the steak, right? My wife rates the salads very high but I wouldn't know because I'm a dude and I don't do salad. :)

The decor is whimsical and fun, they check your coat and remember which one is yours when you leave, and the staff is extremely professional and knowledgeable about the menu, wines, etc. It's just always a pleasant experience top to bottom at Bobo's.

Sorry about the generic review. I realized today that all my reviews so far have been negative reviews and I wanted to put something up that had more than one star. Ha ha.
author: Matt J.

description: My wife and took the Powell-Hyde cable car nearby to Boboquivari's off Lombard. The super bone-in filet was as fabulous as the first time I remember it being, when I found this place on a visit to SF back in 2011. The service was exceptional and made for a great romantic evening.
author: James N.

description:
Found this gem on Yelp while i was looking for places to eat that were close to Ghiradelli Square.  I'm becoming somewhat of a steak snob so I liked the idea of trying a cheeky place that isn't your run of the mill "steakhouse" but is still known for its steaks.

First off, the restaurant is quite small.  It's not crammed, but if it was busier it might have been a little noisy and packed for my taste.  And yes, the other reviews are true - the decor is tacky.  But that's the point.  The name is derived from the Italian word for court jester, and it's run by the same guys as restaurants such as The Stinking Rose, so they're going to go with an Italian theme of course..

So our server Michelle was very pleasant and really helpful, telling us a little about the menu and whatnot.  So now on to the food:

Bone-in filet - Their specialty dish is, like many reviews state, A+++!  The dry-aged steak is cooked in an iron skillet with garlic and rosemary and its own juices, no marinades.  It taste absolutely delicious and the filet can be cut with your fork and melts in your mouth - Just like filet should be.  I guess the bone-in is slightly larger and more tender.  The juices are spectacular and it's such a tasty steak!

Porterhouse - Essentially just a bone-in NY strip and a petite filet on the same plate.  Not really worth the extra price.  The strip was good, but not great.  I'd stick with the filet here since you can probably cook a strip just as good at home.

Whipped yam with brown maple sugar - Just a scoop of whipped yam, but I'm a sucker for candied yams so I gave it a whirl.  Not worth $8 but it was good.  Not too sweat and slightly savory.  If this had marshmallows baked on top it would be better but hey this isn't my Thanksgiving table so what am I expecting??

Bermuda onion rings - Very sweet onions with a very nice, crispy outside.  Not greasy and the crust does not overpower the onion and vice versa.  I would get these again for sure.

Caesar salad - Absolutely delicious caesar dressing!!  Just a few leaves of lettuce though - Not really worth $9 or so.

Just Burrata - I would defnitely try one of their crostini con burrata dishes as an appetizer if you're planning a visit.  I had the Just Burrata, which is essentially just toast points and cheese, but the cheese is great house-made fresh mozzarella.  Very creamy texture and sprinkled with sea salt and EVOO, this appetizer is not filling but is very very tasty.

Easyrider on the rocks - Jameson and a splash of amaretto and I think Disarono.  Oh yeah I forgot I don't like Jameson.  Why did I order this?  Oh yeah it sounded good.  But wasn't worth $12!

Overall a 4 star place.  What could make it 5 stars?  Less cramped quarters, slightly larger portions for your dollar.  Other than that it was definitely a hit in my book.  

Note about the dress code - It is not "dressy" but it is not supposed to be basketball shorts and a hoodie, either.  That being said if your money is green they won't turn you down.  But for the record the OpenTable website calls their dress code "smart causal".  Jeans and a nice shirt are fine, I wouldn't call it "dressy".

Fun note on the side - when we were aout done a group sat down and I couldn't help but overhear their conversation.  The young 60-somethings were discussing Yelp and how it's "useless" and full of "opinionated know-nothings" who "have no life" =)
author: Robert K.

description:
I had somewhat high expectations...

Pros:

Free valet
Ambiance
Side dishes

Cons:

Service was terrible from the moment we walked in
My bone-in filet was way too chewy and undercooked 
A lot of the food was incredibly salty
author: Kimberly P.

description:
My dad was in town so I wanted to go out to a nice dinner with expensive red meat involved since I cant really afford to take myself out for a nice steak. 

The location of this place is kind of weird. I was expecting it to be in a cuter part of the marina, but it's next to a Travelodge on a pretty seedy strip of Lombard.

The restaurant was nice, although I sort of felt like I was in a fancy fun house. The steak, however, was delicious. Considering you just get a steak on a plate and then have to order additional sides, I thought it was slightly pricey, but my petite filet was cooked and seasoned to perfection. I thought the bread and twice baked potato had a little too much going on, but also tasty. 

The overall experience was fine, but I wouldn't bother going back.
author: Molly S.

description:
the service is definitely 5 star - i don't remember her name but she was an excellent server and took care of our party.  

the famous bone-in filet was superb indeed.  the only thing i found difficult to manage, while dining, was that the bread and crab had too much olive oil.  don't get me wrong - the bread and crab was very fresh and very tasty; however, all of us in the party felt overwhelmed by the olive oil.  

i would probably bring special guests here again for the filet but would have to advise them about the olive oil in advance.    great service and great food overall.
author: n y.

description: Best filet mignon ever! And order the Brussels sprouts.
author: A B.

description: I had high hopes for this place. They were dashed. We ordered the lobster crostini as an app and it took forever to come out. We also got the bone in filet and they both came out cold. Our side dishes also tasted as if they may have been sitting out a while. Mac and cheese was a bit hard and the Brussels sprouts were soggy. The waiter was very apologetic and took our entree's to warm them up. However he came back with the wrong cut of meat. I ordered bone in and he came back with the regular filet. However, he was apologetic for that as well. We asked him to just box everything up because after the long wait to get food and it coming out cold, we were very disappointed and wanted to just get out of there. As we were outside waiting for our uber the GM, Gabriel, came out to apologize and said that the next meal would be on him. Very nice gesture, that we will unfortunately not be taking him up on. I went ahead and gave them 2 stars instead of my original zero as the lobster crostini, when it finally came, was very good and the waiter and GM were really nice.
author: Philiam K.

description:
I'm an easy guy, really. Just point me in the right direction and I'll be there, but don't steer me wrong or  I'll unleash my fists of fury upon your face. So I get a text from my buddy at 4pm telling me that I need to be there by 8pm. I get excited with glee, rush home after work, shower and get prettied up - this better be worth it, pal. 

I arrive and get treated with free valet, that's fucking awesome (GD charged me $11, boo). Connecting up at the bar we order a few drinks and an appetizer so ridiculous that I silently cried when the waiter swiftly carried away our empty plates:

http://media3.px.yelpcdn.com/photo/K7rjocaEZmmtTiF1QVlSrw/l

Hot sizzling fizzling and dizzling bouncy shrimps cooked so well that I ate them whole with the crunchy shells still attached. The mussels were tender and chewy, you know, like those things from Slither. But except these mussels were the exact opposite. 

Don't have a picture of their house bread (garlic and olive) as I didn't have enough hands to hold my camera. But our 35lbs worth of meat wasn't something to be missed:


2x bone in filet cooked medium rare. 

http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/photo/ck_RzT8DjDWWAQrUzVouTw/l

(Okay that was about the worst picture I've ever taken but my damn BB doesn't have a flash)

Sides were mac n cheese and onion rings which were both very satisfying as you can see. The mac had a great strong salty flavor and the onion rings were crispier than a bag of pop rocks. 

Towards the end I was so damn bloated and top heavy that I almost fell down when trying to stagger myself to the restroom. But I should have expected that since I just devoured half a cow.
author: Hungry Dan o.

description:
My girlfriend took me there for my birthday and we had both heard great things. I had a so-so food experience there. The meat was good and cooked to my request. My girlfriend had the crab and fillet combo and I noticed an unpleasant odor and discovered it was the butter dip that came with the entree. It was rancid and becuse we were having a good time otherwise I didn't bring it up to the server, who was very pleasant and attentive. The wine was very good as were the crab cakes, the salad was fresh, and the coffee was also good. 

Was my meal bad? No. But I guess Boboquivari didn't live up to my expectations based on reviews. Would I go back? Maybe.
author: Ray S.

description: Went here last night.  From all the reviews I expected the steak to be amazing but was sadly disappointed.  It wasn't terrible.  It was an okay steak and even then for an aged NY Strip it didn't stand out much.  The iceberg lettuce with crab was good.
author: Vincent N.

description: Old school interior with great service and the best bone in filet, I've ever eaten.  Look out Gibson's and Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House, this place is legitimate.
author: Gregory E.

description: Yeah bone-in NY and filet were exceptional. So if you're there just for the steak, you're good to go. On the other hand, service was sub par. We had some milfy gal serve us. Didn't introduce herself or give her name, no smile and on the grumpy side (strike 1),  they must have ran out of caeser salad dressing because I know bottled hidden valley ranch dressing when I taste it (striike 2) and wine by the glass menu was unimpressive. i'd recommend byo and $15 corkage (striiike 3.....I'm outta here)
author: Keith H.

description: Best bone-in filet mignon! Best filet mignon to touch my palate!
author: Debbi S.

description: It is very close to my home, we often walk to there and use it as our dinner or lunch place. Very good and yummy! My son love the steak dish there very much.
author: Runner L.

description:
Finally! I get to try the famous Boboquivari's. All I have to say is Yummy! They have the best Filet Mignon here. We ordered filet migon with bone, mussels, crab, yellow tail carpaccio, cheese cake and panna cotta. Everything was really good. The crab is good but not as good as the Roasted Crab at Crustaceans (but you have to remember, this is a steak house). The desserts were good but nothing to rave about.

To the good stuff: The carpaccio was really good. I didn't t expect a steak house would make a good fish capaccio but it was quite delicious. The Filet Mignon is prob. the best I've ever had. Cooked perfectly and really tender. The Mussels were amazing ~ A must have starter! 

The best part: FREE VALET PARKING! This is very important in SF. Who wants to drive around looking for parking, right?!?
author: Karen L.

description:
Friends in town from LA and they wanted a good steak.  I suggested Bobo's since it's got great reviews and lots of friends suggest it.  8pm reservation was made.

Arrival = free valet parking.  Really?  Points awarded already!  I walked in and my friends were there and getting ready to be seated.  Perfect timing!

We were seated on the top floor in a private table with curtains about half drawn.  Kind of weird, but it quickly grew on us as we were able to have a good conversation without too much noise.

I ordered the heirloom tomato salad to start and my friends ordered the shrimp plate.  We got a bottle of Groth, which was excellently priced at $79.

The shrimp was just OK.  It came on a skillet and you had to peel it first.  I hate having to peel my own shrimp, but I only had one to try, since it was my friends' dish.  At least I know I wouldn't order it.

The tomato dish, on the other hand, was heavenly!  Cherry-sized tomatoes with avocado and croûton and a balsamic vinaigrette.  Plus very, very, very fresh mozzarella made it a great appetizer!

I ordered the bone-in fillet for my main meal with a side of sweet potatoes. The waiter challenged that if this wasn't the best fillet we've ever had he would buy it for us.  And at $39, it's reasonably priced.  Folks.. it was one of the top steaks I've ever had.  Perfectly seasoned and a great temperature for "medium".  The potatoes were just OK, and frankly weren't even necessary.

Overall, we had a great dinner.  Highly recommend and will be back for sure!
author: Todd M.

description:
I so want to come back here.  This place was my kind of steak house with that lounge-y atmosphere (red mood lighting, soft music, weird deco, cool vibe...).   I only was here for a quick drink, but service was on point.  This place is tiny!  If you're a tad claustrophobic you might be a bit uneasy (that bar is small and cramped - but I love it).  Looks like the key to eating here is reservations.  They brought out some plates while I was waiting and OMFG.  Smelled so good.

So yeah, 4 stars after 700 reviews - I don't think this place is effing around!
author: Chris B.

description: Best steak in SF, IMO.  Very quirky funky decor, if you like that.  Service is friendly but could be more attentive.  I will return for sure.
author: Andrew B.

description:
3.5 Stars

What in the world is a Boboquivari? With such a quirky name for a steakhouse I was amazed to find out what it really meant. The name actually had nothing to do with steak at all.

boboquivari
(bo-bo-kwee-var-ee)
The venetian court jester of comedy, embodied in a popular Italian marionette.

Interesting. As a San Francisco native, I've just heard this restaurant referred to as Bobo's. Apparently you can't call it Bobo's unless you've dined there before, so with me writing this review it looks like I've earned my rights of passage!

Bobo's isn't a traditional steakhouse in terms of the decor. Following suit to its name the decor is quite festive that fits the mood of Mardi Gras with the black and red color scheme and masks hanging on the walls.

Let's talk about the food, notably the steak. Most of our group picked the signature Bone-In Filet Mignon. This was my first time ordering Filet Mignon attached to the bone. I'm not exactly sure if it added that much more to my experience. It actually was more of a hassle to cut around the bone or to extract the meat that got stuck to the bone. I didn't find that it added any extra beefy flavor to my piece of steak. The steak did come with a unique brown steak sauce that was slightly tangy.

I ordered my Filet Mignon rare, but I felt it came out more on the medium rare side. The cooking was slightly uneven throughout the steak. There were spots that were more rare than others. The Filet Mignon at Bobo's also wasn't the most tender piece of Filet I've had before. The outside of the steak was nicely seared though.

For our group's sides we shared the sourdough bread, macaroni and cheese, swiss chard, portabello mushrooms, and the twice baked potato.

I really enjoyed the baked garlic and olive sourdough loaf. It was crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. The olive spread gave the bread a slightly saltier taste. The macaroni and cheese was considered a modern spin on the dish. They used egg noodles instead of elbow macaroni and it wasn't overly cheesy or heavy. The swiss chard tasted like spinach and was a good balance to the steak. The portabello mushrooms were a definite winner at the table and I would recommend ordering it. It was also cooked with capers, which was pretty unique. The twice baked potato was also very tasty. It was mashed potato inside of a baked potato.

I didn't get a chance to try the crab this time, but I'd be interested in coming back to try it one day to make my meal a surf and turf. Although the steak wasn't the best I've had before, the sides were very solid.

A last thing to note, Bobo's offers free valet parking!
author: Jason H.

description: Great small steakhouse. Never disappointed and always a good time.  Quality, quality quality!
author: R W.

description:
I don't know why but I have never heard of BOBO's until a few months ago. 
I'm not a big fan of STEAK, yes you heard me haha. I rarely order steak at restaurants. A friend brought me here and insisted that they have the best steak in town! So I said OK, let's give it a try since I can do Surf and Turf!

Ambiance:
chic interior and intimate lighting with the red wall and everything, however it's quite stuffy and crowded in here. The smoke and amazing smell of the food can get quite overwhelming after a few drinks. We got there a bit earlier than our actual reservation so we decided to stay by the bar for a drink or two. It gets really crowded by the bar with waiters walking around, people waiting by the door and the managers checking on the bar and seating area. 

Drinks: Mojito was refreshing and their Margarita was very strong and delish as well! You will definitely get a buzz on! 

Food: 
Spectacular!
I definitely like the seasoning for the steak here. It has a beautiful crust around the steak. I tried both the bone in filet mignon and surf and turf here. The bone in filet is definitely more tender! When my friend ordered his bone in, they had a special deal for slightly a few oz more for just 20 dollars more. If you are a meat lover, you might just get lucky for a face size steak! haha.
(big disappointment for my friend: they messed up his choice of rare with my choice of "medium rare" so he was very disappointed, although he still enjoyed his meal).
The roasted crab is very delicious. It has the best seasoning and it was very tender. 
Appetizer - Dungeness Crab Crostini with Smoked Salmon, Avocado and Burrata - ABSOLUTELY delightful! The Burrata was so creamy and buttery pairing with the crisp of crostini and smokiness of the smoke salmon. Superb!
The brussel sprouts with pancetta here are amazing as well (I'M A BRUSSEL SPROUTS LOVER). Main dishes do not come with side dishes FYI, you have to order them separately (which costs about 10 dollars each).
 
Service:
not as great - they are super busy so it was hard to get their attention. The server messed up our order (meat preference) which was a HUGE disappointment. That's why im taking one star off my 5 star review. 

In general, the food was super flavorful and yummy. The service was ok. The ambiance was intimate and romantic. It might be slightly over priced. $44 for surf and turf(however the filet mignon in surf and turf is a lot smaller, maybe a girl's fist size). $39 for bone in, $8-10 for sides like brussel sprouts with pancetta.

I will come back for the food and ambiance for sure!
author: Mindy C.

description:
Bobo's is a unique dining experience.  Their steak is superb and their sides and atmosphere are quirky and unique.  

My only criticisms are a) that it's very expensive for what it is, b) the crab cakes were mediocre, and c) it's really too unreliable for a place this pricey.  I used to be a big fan, but they've let me and my guests down a few times now, so I'm probably not going back soon.
author: Ian F.

description: GREAT GREAT FILETs.  WOW honestly I didn't expect much coming to this place, but everyone told me to order the filet and I don't even like filets.  This must be the most juiciest tender steak I've EVER EVER had.  You won me over Boboquivari... I'd love to be back.  We had the crab as the appetizer and it was good as well. It is pricey here, but well worth it.  I would recommend anyone in SF to try their filets here.  They are located in the Marina as well so its a great date place for dinner and drinks!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Incredible!  If you're looking for a fantastic cut of beef, then look no further than "Bobo's".   The minute we walked in the door (we went for our anniversary), we knew we were in for something special.  From the appetizer to the dessert, it was one superb dish after another...  I just can't say enough about this place!

I've lived in Philadelphia, New Orleans and now San Francisco and I've done my fair share of travelling and eating out, and "Bobo's" served, by far, the best steak I have ever eaten!

Do yourself a favor and check this place out... you won't be sorry!

I was so impressed by this place that I joined Yelp just so I could write a review!  I rely on the information I get from Yelp, so I decided to join in and give my opinion about this extraordinary place!
author: Jack B.

description:
I feel guilty saying this but Bobo's was my backup plan if House of Prime Rib didn't work out. Well it was a damn good thing HOPB was booked. The 1st thing you notice is the age-old char-grilled aroma of Bobo's. This alone should be marketed and sold. Environment is dimly lit, colorful, cozy and quick to seat you if you don't have a res. If you've never had a dry-aged steak before then for the love of god try one here. I'm a 1st class carnivore but I got the Petit Filet. You can have a bigger cut but the richness of the dry aged steak and the sides together will zombie-fy you if you're not careful. My dish came out in 15 minutes! Don't get it well done. The staff knows you need it medium to medium rare. Melts in your freaking mouth. Buttery. Well seasoned. For sides I had the twice baked potato and the 'ModMac', which was so good I had to ask the waitress what evil henchman created it. 3 kinds of cheese: Sicilian Parmesan, Port Reyes Blue, and White Cheddar. If you can somehow get a bite of steak and the 2 sides on your fork and into your mouth, you may die of ecstasy. If you survive, wash it down with a sip of good red wine. Repeat. 

Steaks were a bit pricey but I have to say I feel like my money was well spent.

I'll be back Bobo.
author: Chris A.

description:
I'm more of a Prime Rib and Rib Eye kind of guy and not so much into Filet Mignon but,  not only did I have to try it, it had to be their Bone-In Filet Mignon!

They suggest it is served best Medium-Rare, I tend to like my meat Medium but decided to go with their suggestion.  The FM was seriously tender and you could literally pull the meat off with your fork.  I was afraid I would need steak sauce but the seasonings they used was perfect.  I would probably order it Medium next time, as it was just a little too red for me but, you wouldn't have known since I ate that piece of meat down to the bone!

The s/o ordered the Mussels, Shrimp & Crab, which was a presentation in itself.  It came out on a griddle and managed to continue cooking for a good 7-10 minutes while at the table.  I think the portion was big enough for two to share, so long as you order an appetizer and salad to start.

Oh yeah, their appetizers, we had the Crostini with Crab and Smoked Salmon.  Not a smoked salmon kind of guy but, damn that was delcious!  It was also served with a nice chunk of soft mozzarella cheese that tasted awesome when spread on the Olive Loaf.

Sides, we had the Portabella Mushrooms, which I think could've used a little flavor.  Seemed like it was just cut up, blanched and served.  The Twice Baked Potato was awesome!  I swear, every bite I took, I experienced a different flavor.  Definitely worth ordering!

For dessert, we shared the Monterossa, an Italian Strawberry Cheesecake.  It was heavy like your standard cheesecake but instead, very light and delicious.

Our server was outstanding!  I forgot her name but she kind of looked like Amanda on Ugly Betty.  Very pleasant at all times and was genuinely friendly.

I actually love the eclectic style of the restaurant, the decor and the multi-levels.  It kind of reminds me of my hotel, in "Hotel City" one of the many apps that's sucked me in on FB.  It's quite intimate as the dining rooms are small but, IMO, the best place to sit are the bistro tables at the bar, you get a prime window seat!

Parking is valet and it's free.  Yup, FREE!  What?  Free Valet parking in SF?  Hell to the yes!  Granted, they park the car in the garage right below the restaurant but it beats the hassle of finding a parking spot.  Just tip the dude a few bucks, it's so worth it.
author: Nick D.

description: I came here on a whim one night when I was visiting SF, and honestly, not impressed. There was nothing special about the meat - in tenderness, flavor, sauce, etc. I also didn't think the bread and dip was exceptional. For a fancy-ish steakhouse, I expected more. I would have much rather gone to House of Prime Rib for some juicy, flavorful beeeeeeeeeeeeef.
author: Jenny C.

description: Good place, enjoyed my dinner there.  Bone in fillet was good.  Glad I came here.
author: Charlie H.

description:
What it is: A solid, atmospheric, mid to high grade surf and turf joint with a short but delicious menu of high quality steak, seafood, and other gourmet victuals, with the menu prices to match.

What it isn't: The sort of place you just pop into for fun or on a whim because you're craving good steak or yummy seafood at a reasonable price.

Don't misunderstand, this place has some very excellent food. But for the prices, you won't be making it your local haunt or weekly go-to unless you've got a considerable amount of extra income.

The menu selection doesn't offer a ton of options, but if you just want some well above average steak, crab, or lobster, you'll have plenty of ways to satisfy that craving. Just know going in that you're likely to spend at least $60-$100 a head minimum if you're having an appetizer, drink, entree and side.

The decor, ambience, and atmosphere are very nice, if a bit dark. The layout and design of the dining areas does well to make every space feel intimate without sacrificing that all important "energy" and chatter that makes a restaurant feel alive when it's full. Also, the music is surprisingly good despite being contemporary. This does an excellent job of keeping the mood relaxed even though the prices would otherwise indicate "stuffy."

Dress Code: None enforced, but everything from jeans/button-up to suits/evening wear is acceptable and seems in-place.

Best Suited For: First dates, celebration dinners, "nice night out" dinners with family, friends, and significant others.

Avoid If: You're on a budget, aren't interested in the difference between a $20 steak and a $50 steak, or don't love fresh sea food and the associated cost.
author: Aaron C.

description:
We heard about this place on Check Please and thought that this would be a great place to try out. 

Dark but great atmospere. A bit cramped if your out on a date night but the food totally makes up for the cramped feel though. 

The bonein filet mignon is melt in your mouth goodness. Cooked on a skillet with garlic and rosemary and cooked to perfection. Like I said, melt in your mouth good. The salad portions are perfect sized for about 2 ppl to share. The crab crostini was delicate but bursting with flavor. My wife was all over the Mac and Cheese with it's different cheeses and buttery taste. 

Overall this place deserves every praise that it has been given and worth every penny spent and then some. Will definitly pass the word on this place to many of our friends as well.
author: Greg L.

description: Went to Bobo's last night. The art work throughout the restaurant gives the place a feel of Arte de Comedia. The food from the shimp and mussles to the appetisers, sides and of course the Steak were great. The staff are attentive but not overbearing. Would highly recomend this place for the meat and fish lover. John P
author: John P.

description:
Pros: there are two, and they are pretty huge: dry-aged bone-in filet mignon AND heirloom toybox tomatoes with burrata cheese.  apparently sometimes bobo's runs out of the bone-in filet and if that happens to you it will be a world-class travesty.  our server was a total sweetheart and was really attentive, and the free valet parking was also a nice surprise.

Cons: clowns. hate them. wish they weren't a major part of bobo's decor.  they are scary in a child molester sort of way and don't really make me feel like eating lightly bloody meat.  if the clowns weren't omnipresent, the ambiance would be more romantic - there is low-lighting downstairs and it feels intimate.  also working against bobo's is it's location: the marina.  fortunately bobo's is right on the edge of that part of town, but i still felt like i was getting hives as we approached the location.
author: Veronica Y.

description:
Mouth-watering and well-aged steak and free valet parking! What gets better than this? 

Party of 3:  Because we ate some delicious steak that melts in your mouth, we were just so full and happy at the end of our dinner. You are in for a steakhouse treat! :P

Try any of the following plates:   
1)  Porterhouse----New York style steak & petit filet mignon cooked separately
2) New York Bone-In
3)  Surf & Turf------Half crab & petit filet mignon

Sides Dishes:
1)  Twice baked potato
2)  Baked yam
3) Modern mac & cheese

OVERALL RATING: 

Food: Excellent!!! 
Ambiance:  Very nice!!! 3 stories high, New Orleans decor, red lighting
Service:  Greatt!!! Teo was very friendly and funny! 

For a side tip....
Make a reservation ahead b/c this place gets crowded.
author: Deborah C.

description:
Free valet parking! What a bonus in an impossible-to-find-parking area. The attendant is very considerate, so please tip him well!

Host: greeted promptly and graciously.

Ambiance: Very quaint, more on the casual side, but still cozy and romantic. I would be comfortable in fashionable jeans and a nice top and shoes. Not too loud for a nice conversation, though the place wasn't crowded.

Service: our waiter / bartender Eric was wonderful! He was very personable, attentive without being overbearing, and knowlegable about the menu and preparation of the food.  I like it when our server pours our water from the carafe at the table, instead of expecting us to do it ourselves...it is just a very nice, hospitable gesture.

Food...oh boy.
Bread: The fresh loaft of bread with baked garlic flakes and butter on top is to die for. Nice and hot...crusty on the outside, and sooooo soft on the inside! i normally do not eat bread but this is just one of those things you can't pass up. Your fingers get very messy from the oil and butter.
Appetizers: We had two appetizers (recommended by our server), the salmon and lobster crostini...both were very tasty, and the textures and temperatures were perfect!  
Mashed Yams - pure heaven. How can anyone not like yams? How did they get it so fluffy???? Perfectly seasoned with a hint of spice, and not overy oily or buttery.
Bone-in Filet - We had ours prepared medium-well. Delicious...the meat was so tender it practically melts in your mouth.  Is it wrong to want to make out with your food?

This is definitley going on my list of "must introduce to everyone I know" places!
author: Sasha P.

description: Love Love Love!!! I always get the surf and turf which is a half a crab and a petite filet Mignon.  Always cooked to perfection.  The staff is friendly and the wait is never too long.  They also have a basil martini that I love.  You should definitely  go this the restaurant, you will not be sorry
author: Krystin C.

description:
What i remember most is the free valet parking.... i can't quite tell if that's a positive or a negative.

To be certain though, bobo's doesn't disappoint on the food front, but i wouldn't call it amazing either.  It is what you would expect from a steak house of this caliber.  The pricing is very reasonable, and the atmosphere is very intimate with some cool decor.

I think essentially the whole table went with the bone-in filet and there wasn't a unhappy food bud in sight.  

I've had better steak houses and i've had worse, but its worth trying out.. atleast you know you won't have to search indefinitely for parking, and in the city... that's gotta be worth something.
author: Felix W.

description: Im sorry to say this used to be my favorite restaurant to come to when I visit the city. The food is not as good the portions are smaller and the drinks are not as good.
author: Kurt D.

description:
How can this  place be called a steakhouse without a ribeye cut on the menu?!? All they had were a filet, NY and porterhouse cut.  My favorite cut of meat is the ribeye and I was very disappointed when it wasn't on the menu.  I feel that the filet although very tender lacks flavor and the NY lacks both.  I settled for the petit filet since I had my hopes up for some red meat and I didn't want to get the other stuff.  Like I said before the filet was tender but the it was missing something.......oh yeah FLAVOR!  The roasted shrimp we had for the appetizer was pretty good though.  Not planning on coming back here.  
A bit on the pricey side also.
author: Mike K.

description:
We went here for our holiday party.  There were 13 of us.  For a large party you would expect to have delays in sitting down, food or drink.  We had no wait.  Everyone in our party loved the location (sat upstairs) and the food.  I think everyone said "this was the best steak I ever had".  If you can - order the bone in filet!  It will change your life!

We will go back and take our friends!!!!
author: Adina E.

description:
Bobo's, you've let me down. Sure, your steaks were some of the best I've ever had, but a girl cannot live (and dine) on steak alone. Taking everything else into consideration, I was underwhelmed. 

I came here with my mom while she was visiting and we certainly feasted, starting with the IRON SKILLET-ROASTED SEAFOOD COMBO with mussels, shrimp, and crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=kobhqDwU0lKRIFYARQqzjQ). It really wasn't that great. The skillet was scorching hot and sizzled loudly for a good while. There were a ton of mussels, 5 crab legs, but only 8 shrimp. The shrimp and mussels were tiny and the crab legs were dry. Nothing was all that flavourful (where was the garlic in the garlic sauce?) and everything was doused with copious amounts of (i.e. too much) melted butter.

We also got the CURRY LOBSTER SOUP (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=9bhbBOXmFaSU0duUPeYzNQ) and yellowtail carpaccio.
