The soup was more a thick curry soup with two lobster pieces than a lobster bisque. The YELLOTAIL CARPACCIO (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=F-ENPjrFhnw1jdAVu6BxCQ) was way too thinly sliced to get the nice buttery texture I like in yellowtail (it was actually kinda rough) and the other components overwhelmed the delicate flavour of the fish. On top of that the fish was drenched with way too much olive oil.

For the sides we got the "modern" mac & cheese (what makes it modern? I have no idea), twice-baked potato, and baked yam. The MAC & CHEESE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=U-MYG_37XH7cen05N-MHcA) was ok but a litttle too rich for me. There was way more cheese sauce than I knew what to do with (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=Af11doxiqaBvDRknNnoJTg). The mashed BAKED YAM (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=lNLNT1EU7U3_TTV4RRLZJA) was cloyingly sweet and really didn't need the brown sugar on top. The TWICE-BAKED POTATO (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=vxPjlHC73YEOBcPXCM_pSw) was the only non-steak dish we really liked. It was a halved hollowed out baked potato filled with a yummy tangy warm potato salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=dwOsLpan7k85-TmihdKyLA) with zucchini to add crunch.

As for our steaks, we shared a PORTERHOUSE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=JsSWNPXdsYm29TAv-_vWpQ). Though cooking the bone-in new york and petit filet separately ensured both cuts were cooked properly, it took away from the wow-factor of a porterhouse. Presentation aside, the steaks were spectacular! Cooked perfectly rare (as I requested - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=eZEmblPxN-O3WAGDOFYu9A, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=bs7ERDKjcF9pDy06Vos5jg), both were so tender with the new york (surprisingly) more so. The steaks were seasoned well and no salt and/or pepper was necessary (unlike at Harris'). Best of all was the slightly nutty flavour from the butter - it was the most amazing steak butter I've ever had!

For dessert we had the PISTACHIO PANNA COTTA (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=zN324c4zHgJJpKvSxlbi7Q) and MONTEROSA (strawberry Italian cheesecake, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=vhB6yTWuA7KgJW89C9Ke2g). The cheesecake was delish. Similar to a tiramisu, it was light and fluffy. The panna cotta was a miss, both flavour- and texture-wise. Instead of pistachio I tasted coconut. And unlike any other panna cotta I've ever had, this one was dense, heavy, and grainy (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=sgZphVa_dAll5CSdCTUXDA). Blech!

One last complaint was the dim lighting, which made "eating with my eyes" - and getting all the crab meat out of the legs - extremely difficult.
author: Steph L.

description:
went back here for my bday dinner recently....  and wow, the food was the complete opposite of the first time I went.

My steak was eh...ok,  the crab tasted off, my friend's steak was medium well on one end and raw on the other, and another friend sent his steak back because it was completely undercooked....

what happened bobos?
author: kevin w.
Brian J.

description:
Let me start by saying that I love steak and can be quite discerning when it comes to a good cut of beef!  That being said, some of the so called "great" steak places really fall short in my book.  For example, Sparks (NYC) and Smith & Wollensky (NYC & Philly) are average at best.  But if you're a fan of Mastro's (LA) or WOlfgang's (NYC), then we're on the same page.

Boboquivari's is an old school steak experience at its finest.  Decor is basic, but the food is amazing!  This is the second time I've been, and it was as consistent as the first.  

For starters, the crab legs are better than you can get at Crustacean.  Then jumping to the entree, the bone-in-filet, NY strip and porterhouse were all prepared to perfection, from the seasoning to the temperature.  I recommend the sauce on the side.  Who would ruin a good piece of meat with too much sauce?

Extra bonus is the valet.  A nice touch that you would expect in SoCal but find as a luxury in SF.
author: Thom P.

description:
Satisfying, an intimate set-up, and a really good deal.

Celebrated my buddy's birthday here and they sat all 10 of us in our own room. My bone-in filet mignon was delicious and I managed to bring back a good chunk for my bf to try later. Anyone who serves oily, crunchy, and hot bread is after my heart.
author: Christine H.

description:
Bobo's has THE best petite fillet mignon I have ever had in my life!  My husband and I come here about once a year to treat ourselves to a decadent, delicious meal.

The ambiance is fun and reminiscent of a Mardi Gras-themed Cirque du Soleil.  The tables are a little on the small side and crammed a little close together so prepare to be cozy.  I think you have to request a table by the window and if you don't, be prepared to sit in a darker room with no windows.  The darker rooms aren't bad; in fact they can be cozy and romantic.  Bobo's service has always been excellent with attentive and pleasant staff.  We feel like we're treated to a very special experience whenever we dine here.

And the food!  I don't think there's a bad item on the menu.  So far I've only had the crab and the petite fillet mignon entrees, and the petite fillet is what I keep going back for again and again.  All of the side dishes are tasty.  I particularly like the mushrooms and the twice-baked potato.  So yummy!  The wine list is quite accomplished but there are lovely vintages in all price ranges if you want to splurge on dinner and save on wine.

Spoil yourself with an experience at Bobo's.  It is a treat for the senses and your tummy will be soooo happy!  (I'm actually drooling a little just thinking about it.)
author: C C.

description:
This place is EXPENSIVE!  But it's really good.  I only had the crab legs, and man they were good.  I don't know what they do to make the buttery goodness stick to the crab, but it works and is so good, I was sopping up all the buttery goodness with the bread I had and the burrata was so awesome I wish I had had 10 of them!  But they only serve 2 at a time for  a little more than I wish to pay.   

I will say its a little messy and not somewhere to take a date if you want to keep clean because the crab and butter get all over the place!
author: Charles Y.

description: I've been meaning to eat at this place for 5 years now.  I finally had the opportunity to give this place a try.  The bread had good flavor but is on the dry side.  We ate two loaves and both were on the dry side.  The caesar salad was disappointing.  I had a better caesar at Dick Clark's restaurant in Salt Lake City.  Dick Clark doesnt even freakin cook.  The grilled mussels, shrimp, and crab was ok.  It comes out on a hot platter that will burn yo face with splatter from the sauce they put over it.  Now for the main event.  The BONE in FILET!  All my fat friends have been raving about this steak.  I am not a huge filet fan but the steak itself was good.  I just had Delmonico's in Vegas a few weeks ago and for the same price Delmonicos destorys this place.  Half way through my filet I found a sticker that I took a picture of and posted it under their photos.  I eat a lot of food.  I have fucking 1300 plus reviews.  I have been to a lot of steakhouses.  This is the first time I ever found a fucking sticker in my $50 steak.  The best the waitress could do was to take my plate away and give me a cold plate to finish my steak.  I wonder if this was still sanitary to eat.  She said when the grilled it it stuck to the bottom of the steak.  If it was grilled how come the sticker isn't burnt?  In the pic it looks like it just fell in the sauce or some shit.  This place takes the first place in a major steakhouse fuck up.  On top of this shit when we get the bill they overcharged us on an addition soup we did not order.  Someone in management needs to be fired.  But it does make me feel better my $50 choice steak was USDA approved!
author: Fatty A.

description:
This is the first review I'm writing as a 2011 Elite! Holy sh*t, you wouldn't believe how excited I was when I saw the welcome email last night. Many piercing squeals of joy rang throughout the house. THANKS, YELP!

First things first, did you know that a Bobovaquivari is a court jester? Did you know that their floppy three pointed hats represent the ears and tail of a donkey? It's good to learn something new everyday.

This is definitely a one-of-a-kind steakhouse. The decor is dark, loud, and funky, and has a large hand-painted marionette hanging above the kitchen. Various frames and knick knacks adorn red and black striped wallpaper in a charming hodge podge of clutter.

The loaf of sourdough topped with garlic and olive oil was a bit of a miss. The bread was so oily I had no desire to oil-fy my fingers trying to tear a piece off. 

Crabcakes! Two decently sized cakes sat upon a bed of cranberries sauteed in butter and deliciousness. Those cranberries freaking partied in my mouth. Tasty morsels, get in my belly!

Bone-in filet mignon! As tasty as everyone raving about it said it was! Juicy, tender, and so flavorful! Such a large cut of meat too, only a true carnivore will be able to stuff the whole thing down into their stomachs!

Even though we were absolutely stuffed like no other, our greedy piggy eyes eyed the cheesecake as a dessert. Each bite was a chore, but what a delicious chore it was. 

Good for a date, or for a group of classy diners. I would quite enjoy having a glass of wine (or three) while chortling away in a classy way with friends.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
I've passed by this restaurant a dozen times and never thought about going there because of the simple building hidden by residential flats off a busy street of Van Ness and Lombard.  I have been missing out!  These are the times I am ever so thankful for reviews and sites like Yelp which would in many time uncover great restaurants like these without too many misses.  (thanks!) 

So I ordered the twice baked potato and the bone-in filet mignon.  Wow the portions are generous and the filet mignon was such a thick cut.  I ordered a medium rare as I couldn't chance a overcooked steak.  I was so impressed how perfectly cooked it was as a medium rare and consistent to my dining mate's filets were.  We all ordered the same, medium rare, and they were all consistent in 'pinkerture'.  I was one happy camper and hope to be back to Bobo's!
author: W. L.

description: The mussels and bone in steak are to die for .. Forget the crab .. Meat was dry
author: Jimmy D.

description:
Boboquivari's is the one of the best steak houses in the city. There are several good places, but this one of my favorites. We went here again last night after our favorable prior visits. The sides are good, but not great, and yes, sides can be great. We ordered Filet Mignon Bone in and Bo Bo style Porterhouse and they were perfect. Another hearty meal experience with every expectation met, save the noise of Lombard traffic.

Update. We went here again and the appetizers were once again uninspiring and the Caesar salad with crumbled Point Reyes Blue Cheese was lousy. Fabio is an excellent server with a great sense of humor. We like the booths upstairs. Sadly, I am downgrading my prior rating of five stars to four.
author: Michael G.

description:
I came for dinner on Valentines day with my boyfriend, and it was quite cozy and romantic. The decoration inside the restaurant provides a very warm ambiance. Looks italian inside at first but its not! The entrance is kinda hidden and mysterious. I would recommend reservations because it's a popular place.

Anyways on with the food... It was delicious! I had the surf n turf that came with half crab and filet. The filet was so tender and juicy. As for the crab, I had never had crab before so I decided to try it.. It was good, except opening the crab was a pain..  but isn't it always? LOL. oh yeah dip the crab in the butter ;) as if you already didn't know that! Ha

My boyfriend ordered crab cakes for an appetizer... One word, yum. If you come here you must and I mean MUST  try the crab cakes! 

We ordered several sides but my favorite were the mushrooms; they melted in my mouth.

I ordered the Bohattan martini... It was crisp and refreshing. 

Portions are a good size, food is on the pricey side but well worth it! 

Only thing that was weird, is that the tables are really close to eachother. My boyfriend and I were literally 1 foot away from this other couple.. Kinda awkward.. I felt like I was easedropping on their date lol. 

Overall this place is good, fun, funky and romantic.  I will definitely go again:]
author: Erika M.

description: Not impressed with the service. We weren't greeted by anyone, they just basically gave us our reserved table and left. The waitress took a while to come by and check in. She didn't introduce herself, didn't talk about the menu, nothing. We ordered drinks, sides, and entrees straight away, and the food came in super fast and all at the same time. Too fast in my opinion considering the couple of made to order steaks. Bread came after the food though, and only because we asked for it -again-. We had to stand up and go look for our waitress a couple of times because she didn't check in after taking our order or while we were dining. At one point, we had to flag down a different server when the first one was no where to be found. It wasn't the businest day or time either. The food was excellent though, we really loved it; but again, the service, terrible (except the valet guy, he was actually nice and did what he was supposed to do).
author: Maria T.

description:
This restaurant is right next door from our apartment, so we gave it a shot after a long day of bike riding with my folks. The food was decent (not great, but not terrible either). The prices might hurt your bank account, but you sort of know that going into the place. I felt like everything was super salty. The Brussels sprouts were delicious, but after a few bites, I realized what made them appear to taste so good. The SALT!! The steak was simple and well prepared.

The bread to start was hearty.

I appreciated the fact they had Peju on the wine menu. We enjoyed a bottle with our steaks.

If I had to choose a place to go for a special occasion, I probably wouldn't pick Bobo's again.
author: Danny C.

description:
i have been wanting to come to bobos for a while.  my friends speak highly of their food and i was excited to finally come for my sisters birthday dinner.  sadly, the only reservation i could get for saturday night was 530 so an early dinner it was.  

the valet opened my car door with such force he hit it against the podium.  first fail of the night

i think bobos is in need of a renovation.  the windowsill looks dirty and a bit old.  the wood is splintering.  there was a little bug crawling around.  a tiny beetle?  not sure what it was.  i "covered" it with the candle before my mom could see.  but the bf found another one!  two bugs?  two fails!  maybe if we had a later seating we wouldnt have seen the bugs in the dark.

the food though is quite good.  service also good.  we ordered everything to share.  to start we had the lobster soup which is more of a curry soup not a lobster bisque if you were expecting that.  crostini of cherry tomatoes, avocado, and mozzarella.  deconstructed?  it was more of a salad with croutons, tomatoes, and avocado.  then we had the lettuce with apples, cranberries, walnuts.  the combination was a bit too sweet.  oh they called it tuna carpaccio on the menu but the hamachi carpaccio was really good!

we also got the mussels and shrimp.  it was very oily and the skillet was so hot i think some of the mussels got a bit overcooked.  their shells turned brittle and cracked everywhere.  also crab.  you dont get one big crab that is 3 pounds but rather pieces that weight 3pounds.  so we got about 5 claws in our stash!

the bone in filet was good!  the only negative being that we ordered it medium rare and we got it rare.  or almost blue.  we got a lot of sides to go with that and they were all cooked the same way with the same sauce that came with the shellfish - a caper, garlic butter.  we had cauliflower, portobellow mushrooms, twice baked potato and mac and cheese.

too full for dessert
author: claudia y.

description:
There is something about dry age steaks...simply delicious.

Lobster Crostini, New York Bone-In, Twice Baked Potato are great.

Might have to try the iron skillet roasted mussels and crab next time.
author: Francis M.

description:
The aging process for all of Bobo's steaks is what makes the difference here. 
Also, they offer a bone-in filet that really increases the flavor and character of the cut.
If the sides were just a bit more sophisticated, this place could be a 5-star. 
It's not the sides are bad - they just don't touch the quality of the steak itself. 
If you are craving a good, solid, tasty cut of beef, please go here!
author: Melody M.

description: I had the bone in filet mignon and it was delicious!! We also had the triple order of mussels for our appetizer and it was a lot of food.  It was my first time there and I'll definitely go again!
author: Georgie T.

description:
When I read reviews I actually don't read the good reviews because there are just too many.  I actually read all the bad reviews because I find them more useful.  So all I have to say is "5 stars" and a picture is worth a thousand words so check mine out that I uploaded.  We had a good sample of the quality of food at Bobo's and it was all superb.

Oh and did I mention they have complimentary valet?  That's hot.
author: James F.

description: The bone in fillet is one of my favorite cuts of meat in the city, and all things crab are simply exquisite here. This place has a very unique ambience and is definitely a must try. Also, the service is excellent.
author: Marc M.

description:
The steaks were fantastic esp. the bone-in NY or filet. However the ever mentioned Surf and Turf is not work getting at all. The crab claws were overcooked, the morsels inside were already dry. The sides were just Ehh,Brussell Sprouts w/pancetta (not sure why they decided to coat it in soy, capers and baslmic vinegar; too sour, and over done), Twice baked Potato (hmm you could do this at home, nothing special), lobster crostini (not for $14.95, a few pieces of lobster mixed with avocadoes, drenched in Balsamic dressing once again, on 2 pieces of toast and a round of basically mozzarella cheese).
I don't think that I will be coming here again, there so many other steakhouses that I have sides dishes and ambiance that it's not worth coming just for the steaks.
Kudos however to the server, she was nice and comp'd us on the brussell sprouts dish, and came around at the right times to check in on us. That I would have to give at least 4stars. Overall 2 stars.
author: J. C.

description: Yes the decor is cheesy, but honestly this place falls into the top 3 steaks I have had in the bay area. They do offer free valet, which was convenient as parking may be a bit hard to find when it gets busy. I had the wagyu steak and it was perfectly made (medium, as thats the only way to truly eat a steak), although it would have been better had it had a slightly crispier crust.  The service and wait staff were great all throughout the meal, but again it is a bit expensive. 4.5 stars if I could give them a rating and I will definitely be coming back to this place.
author: Eric L.

description:
My shabookie turned the big 25!  We went here awhile back, which was in November of 09, but I clearly remember how dinner went.

We came here with a party of 10.  They were very accommodating.  We were seated in a secluded room that was sectioned off to the right of the restaurant.

The service was decent, but for what you pay to eat here, I'd expect top of the line.  Our server was very professional, but lacked a bit of character.  We would ask him a question about the food and for some reason he wouldn't smile or say anything the exuded any type of personality.  He was very straight forward and monotonous.  I didn't quite appreciate that.

The food...IS GREAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had the bone-in fillet mignon and it was awesome.  My bf had the porterhouse steak and he absolutely loved it just as well.  From what I remember, no one had a single complaint!  Everyone was happy with the food :)
author: Alicia A.

description:
Great steaks and crab.
I enjoyed the lavender martini as well.
The decor is fun and service is fantastic.
author: Diranasaur D.

description: Came here for dessert. Dunce cap chocolate cones and Monterosa cheesecake. DELICIOUS.Coming back for dinner next time I'm in SF.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
2 stars for the unprofessional way the hostess handled our "hair in steak" situtaion. STRAIGHT UP BITCH.

We saw that this place was 4 stars on Yelp, so we decided to give it a try and so my boyfriend and I came here for our 1 year anniversary. So while we were enjoying our meal, I found a hair in my boyfriend's steak. We told the hostess what was going on and this little bitch responded us with a  "Uhh, all of our chefs and staffs have hats and hair nets in the kitchen". EXCUSE ME?! So are you implying that we are lying to you that we found a hair in he steak that you guys served us? We then told her that we just found it there and she just walked away without doing ANYTHING. Ridiculously rude! Not only did she not handle the situation, she gave us attitude. OH HELL NO, BITCH. Then our waitress came and took care of the situation. My boyfriend then asked if that hotess was a bitch, and of couse, our lovely waitress laughed(Yes). So my boyfriend had his steak switched, and when our waitress brought it back she told us that they found more hair in that steak. How disgusting...After that steak situation, I was in no mood to eat anymore, for that hostess has ruined my evening on our 1 year anniversary. As we were planning to leave, I waited for my boyfriend to finish using the restroom. When he came back he told me that when he look through the kitchen window, only TWO people were wearing hats. I was about to about to explode in anger at that moment!! Not only did that bitch accused us of lying, she fucking lied to us as well. Shake my head...I hope she gets fired after I talk to her manager. As the bill arrived, yes it was expensive.

Now, let's talk about the food. Personally I would not come here again. However, their steaks are really delicious. My boyfriend ordered a suf & turf ( steak and crab)while I ordered my filet minon in bone. My steak was fat and juicy. Their medium rare is basically a rare steak to me , so to all those medium rare steak lovers,  I prefer you guys order medium or else it'd be too rare to eat. My boyfriend's steak was quite small, but it made sense because he had the crab, too. We also ordered the mushrooms and the twiced baked potato as sides. Oh, and the mussels, too! The mushrooms and the baked potato were good, but the mussels were the best. They also had their complimentary garlic sourdough bread, which was a bit too oily for me. Overall everything was delicious, but I personally felt that everything was just too oily. Even though their mussels were good, it arrived in a puddle of oil, which was not that appealing. Even if we didn't experience the unprofessional service from that bitch hostess, we still would not come here again. Maybe it's because the place was just too small and dark. But overall, Bobo's was just not my cup of tea...in other words, THIS PLACE SUCK! Come to BoBo's if you want to eat hair.
author: Anna F.

description: I had a really great time here for my 30th birthday.  Everything about my meal was delicious.  I had a mojito to start the evening, a lobster crosini appetizer which was delicious, and then bone in Filet Minon and a whole crab.  Everything was cooked to perfection, the waiters were perfect, and the wine selection was excellent.  It exceeded expectations.  My only gripe is that my girlfriend had booked a couple weeks in advance and asked for a romantic table, and they sat us at a booth that was obviously not as romantic as many booths they had in little corners with curtains around them.  Oh well
author: Solomon S.

description:
Visited in May 2011. We had a great experience.  Wonderful heirloom tomato appetizer.  This really stood out as a great starter.  I would highly recommend it.  We both had filets for our entree.  They were well seasoned and cooked perfectly.  no complaints at all.

The restaurant itself has a strange feel and decor that is themed after its namesake, a court jester.  I doesn't look like a fine steakhouse when you enter.  It is somewhat cramped.  We were seated at a table back in a little cubbyhole that seemed like an afterthought.  But it was actually quite nice, and the style of the restaurant grew on me as the evening went on.  And the service was first rate.

Overall, I would like to give it 5 stars, but it falls just short of the "as good as it gets" standard.  Call this a 4+ star rating.  I would definitely go back.
author: Scott S.

description:
Unfortunately this place is not a gay dance club even though it sounds like one..

Their steak, I mean their bone in Fillet Mignon is very nommy~ I ordered it medium rare and it was thick, juicy, pink, and delicious! My mouth is salivating just thinking about it. I also ordered the baked potatoe side but am not a fan... it was too salty.

Four stars mainly for that delicious piece of steak because the restaurant itself is not that great-- very small.  We were in this one room that had a claustrophobic fun house feel to it. The couple next to us were seated too close and I could hear the entire conversation of the group sitting at the other side of the room (which was only about three or four tables over).

On the other hand they had free valet parking! This is a big plus for any San Francisco restaurant...
author: Jennie S.

description: OK their prime rib is out of this world. I don't even like Prime Rib as much as Rib Eye and I got this since the Waitress said it was what they are known for. This could be my last meal before I die. I loved it!!!
author: A L.

description: Great Steak, If you love a good steak come here and get the FILET MIGNON BONE IN! Well worth the price.
author: Irma S.

description: The steak is good, the decor is nice. And the service is way better than those big chain, like Morton's(the worst), Ruth's Chris, or Harris' (not a chain but it is very close to this place).  I will be back.
author: Racky W.

description: Eclectic atmosphere and excellent food. I've tried several steak houses in SF and Bobo's  is one of the best. They have a decent beer and wine selection as well. Complimentary valet is a plus. Great dinner experience!
author: Ryan K.

description: Delicious food, but subpar service. The food is worth the trip, but the service was disappointing especially given the high price. Our issues with the service - the waiter was initially in a hurry to take our order (turns out a big reservation was coming in within an hour, so he wanted to rush us), then he got the order wrong (switched the cooking requests on our steaks), we had to flag him down after a very long wait to place our dessert order, then he forget to bring our dessert order, we had to flag him down again to get the bill and pay. It took longer to get the check and pay than the entire dinner took, as he was busy serving the large group and ignoring us despite our $250 bill. He also added a table next to us that hemmed us in to make more room for the large group. Lucky for us that the large group shared some of their wine with us while we waited for @45 minutes to get the bill and pay. I'll go elsewhere for my next steakhouse meal.
author: Amy M.

description: After making an 8pm reservation we were not seated until 830 by a rude hostess that never apologized for running late instead asked twice in a stern voice if we settled our bar tab. Finally seated and my water glass was dirty in which the waiter tried to tell me it was the stain of the glass in actuality it was smeared lip gloss. He finally got me a new glass but after a dispute if I say my glass is dirty just give me a new one man. The food was excellent had the surf and turf with the Mac cheese so if your looking for great steak and crab with piss poor service and water downed drinks you found the right place
author: DeAndrea S.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant for a great piece of beef.   Bone-in filet mignon that has been dry-aged for weeks is simply amazing.  I go here as often as possible with out of town guests that enjoy beef and to catch up with bros I haven't seen in awhile.

0) Wine list is pretty darn good IMO.  Lots of options, reasonable prices.   
1) Side dishes are pretty awesome.   I really like the brussel sprouts.   The correct strategy is to share side dishes amongst all diners to get maximal variety.
2) There's also good seafood here too!  I really like the sizzling platters, particular the mussels.   Crab and shrimp can be a bit of a delicious pain in the ass to peel at the table live, so steer clear if you're trying to look fancy.
author: Bob T.

description:
Only four starts because this place is overpriced. The service was exceptional though.

I had the filet bone-in, which was one of the best pieces of meats I have ever had.

The side dishes were great, but small! Dessert was overpriced, and small too, but very tasty.

Overall, this is a place where you take a dame or client you wanna impress.
author: Andrew M.

description: Always a pleasure from the excellent shake of the cocktail through any dessert. On our last visit we had the bone-in filet to share, mushrooms, a twice baked potato, onion rings (which are so delicious they are worth the calories, unlike most) And actually I don't remember the rest of what we had. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and were joined by our daughter and her husband, and every one of us was thoroughly please. Excellent service.
author: Anne N.

description: Not a bad place to eat in the Marina.  They have free valet parking which is great since parking out there is notoriously bad.  There is a bar waiting area when you first walk in which is nice.  Bartender that night wasn't very good.  They have several floors of seating with window views.  The bone-in filet seems to be the winner there, unfortunately I got the petite filet and the fish, which both were ok.  Service is ok, they don't add gratuity on the check even though we had a party of 8.  I'd come back and only order the bone-in filet next time.
author: Spencer T.

description:
STEAK and CRAB!!! That's the breakfast of champions. Here the food just explodes with flavor everything from the bread to the sides to the steak dinner is great. I feel that although the food here is really expensive, the flavors in a way make up for it. However, if it's just once in a while it's alright. 

My experience here came when I went for a friend's birthday party. We probably ordered everything off the menu, I'm serious! The food came out nice and hot and each item I was not disappointed in. I kept thinking throughout the night of the cost though, I kept saying to myself I'd rather go to House of Prime Rib and get way more than this (which is true, but the food specifics are not the same) Other than that portions here are kind of on the small side, but the flavors pack a punch. When you order your $40 steak or crab it comes with nothing else. You must order sides which are $8

Overall, Bobo's is a great place to bring someone special, your family or even your boss (to get that next promotion right? ). The prices are a little steep so make sure you cashed your paycheck. The food has a lot of flavor so balance it out with the delicious complimentary garlic and olive oiled bread. I will not see myself here anytime soon, but if you want to try some good flavored crab and filet then come to Bobo's

Recommended Items: ***(my photos are in the photos section)***
- Surf and Turf ( petite filet mignon and half a crab)
- Bone-in Filet Mignon
- Twice Baked Potato
- Portobello Mushrooms
- Shrimp (tastes great, but definitely not worth $15 for several small shrimp)
author: Michael J.

description:
I love this place, the broiled mussels are exceptional, Steaks mouthwatering, and sides are scrumptious.  
I suggest ordering with caution, there are a lot of rich foods on the menu. 
 It's easy to over do it here.
author: Todd S.

description: Intimate dining experience made super easy with an open table res. thx SF for letting us know where to eat!  Solid service, quality eats and a wonderful atmosphere. Just watch that step by the bar. We did have 1 server take a pretty serious spill.
author: Holmes P.

description:
Went to Bobo's this past Saturday, had a 9:30 pm reservation...super late.  But it was well worth the wait! We were greeted with complimentary valet (whaaaat???!!)) So rare in the city.  We went here on a friend's recommendation...said her husband proposed to her after she took him there lol so we figured we had to see what this place was all about.

Everything we had was awesome!

We started with the bread (bomb!) and the lobster soup (super good!). The waitress explained it was made out of a puree of cauliflower & potato w/coconut milk and curry and big chunks of lobster (no dairy!)...it was deeeeelish!!!

I had the surf and turf (petite filet & half crab).  The steak was divine.  The crab was finger-lickin' yummy.

He had the whole crab, and it was so much, he was defeated by the crab (he doesn't get defeated by food ever, always cleans his plate!).  And as he sat back in sheer euphoria from his meal, his eyes began to droop from food coma lol.  Poor guy.  

We opted to have a salad served as our side, so we went for the house salad.  Simple yet delicious.  

Our service was great, the food was great.  We were both impressed, and now understood why my friend's husband proposed after that meal :)

I can't wait to come back!
author: Vanessa M.

description: Great food! I don't really remember the steak because we ordered so many starters and a huge mussel and shrimp platter, which came out sizzling hot on a hot skillet, Very tasty. Overall had a great experience! Staff was good too.
author: Lin C.

description:
hmmm...i don't know why i haven't written review for this place yet..its hands down my favorite steakhouse in SF, possibly ever. haha

ok, so i know that there are a lot of fancy steakhouses in this area, i've been to them ALL. i know that each have very high quality beef, and are cooked to perfection. (they better be too, at the price you're paying). 

so why is this place my favorite? because i like the way the meat is seasoned here. its more flavorful. and that is my only reason. i feel like thats fair. i mean, why else would you go to a steakhouse and pay $100/person? because you want steak, right? I'm not gonna go to a steakhouse and order chicken... 0.o (i don't even think they serve chicken here). 

anyway. if you like your steak to be more seasoned and flavorful, i think you'll like this place better than most of the others. it might be because bobo's has the oldest dry aged meat in the city...or is west coast? i forget...but whatever. its really good. 

a regular cut or surf and turf (petit filet mingot and half a crab) is about $44. the bone in filet mingot is slightly more tender. they do not come with any sides. sides are about $9 or $10 and are all delish. 

the fish carpaccio is really good, but the slices of fish are HELLLLA thin and there's not much of it...i recommend the crab cake appetizer. i get that every time. they have  mussels and stuff, but i don't care much for shellfish so i never order it. 

desserts are...ehhh. i usually go towards the pier for dessert after. make an event out of it. haha

service is ok. not bad, but could be better. 

(damn, my review doesn't sound like it should be 5 stars, huh? i guess overall it should actually be like 4...but i'm gonna go ahead and give it 5 anyway, just because their MAIN DISH is the STEAK. and their STEAK is better than the other places. and also, they have free valet parking!) haha. 

5 stars. I'm standing by it. haha.
author: Linh P.

description:
Brought my girl for dinner. I was impressed with the decor...it was romantic enough to set the mood right. The lights are dimmed, and has a warm feel to it. The place is small, and only seats about 10 people.

The food is pretty good. Not worth the price, but good food. If your in the mood for steak, I would recommend just going to Alfred's or Ruth Chris Steak house. 

All in all the place offers a nice ambiance, good food, but TOO expensive.
author: Nick C.

description:
Made a late reservation on a Friday night. I think we came about half an hour before their kitchen closed, so the place was almost empty. 

We were seated in the corner, but it was cozy, so no complaints. However, the table next to us was loud and obnoxious. They were from out of town, go figure.

We ordered the Baby Romaine Wedge with apples, walnuts, sun dried cranberries in raspberry vinaigrette. It was so good. It was the perfect complementary of sweet and sour. 

My main course, I ordered the Petit Filet Mignon and Eggs got the Surf and Turf. We ordered the Baked Yam and Twice Baked Potato which was TO DIE FOR. I'm guessing it has in it cheese, zucchini and crack or something in that potato. It was sooo delicious. My filet mignon was cooked to perfection and Eggs had no complaints. And he's usually picky about his meat. 

We ended our perfect meal with the Mango Panna Cotta. Not as good as it looks, but then again, you go to Bobo's for their steak, not dessert. 

We'd definitely come back and bring our friends next time.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Ah the Marina with my bride of a decade... 

We chose Bobo's for our 10th anniversary dinner on a recommendation from a friend and I can say it exceeded expectations.

Our Menu:
 - Blood Orange 'Rita's - Generous and delish
 - Lobster Crostini - Came off a little bland, but decent
 - Twice Baked Potato - this is the way these are supposed to be made!
 - Bone-in Fillet - one of the best steaks I've had since my Argentina trip
 - Surf and Turf - More crab than one should voluntarily try and handle... w/ a fillet!

Go there; enjoy; roll on.
author: Todd E.

description:
Bobo's is strange to me, I love all the food here 'except' the steak.  Their bread is fresh and soft on the inside.  The curry in the Lobster soup is a very nice touch.  the Lobster Crostini is delicious. Heirloom box tomatoes are my favorite there. Any appetizer with the Burrata is a must get!  The fresh Burrata is the best in the city.

All their steaks on the other hand are underwhelming.  Don't get me wrong, they're not bad in any way; just not worth the price.  Though i must say the bone-in filet mignon is an expensive treat.

The service is great, the atmosphere is a bit quirky and the food (except the steak) is great.  I'd recommend Bobos for a date, just tell your date that this is the only steakhouse where the steak is not recommended.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Allow me to set the scene.  

The intention was to eat at the House of Prime Rib - only their reservations were booked further than a week and  a half and walk-ins were waiting 2+ hours. That's right, TWO plus hours!!  

Upon driving up to the city we also called Bobo's who was booked but took down our number in case there was a cancellation. We arrived at Lombard Street only to find there complimentary valet service! Simultaneously, as we walked through the doors Andrew's cell rang briefly as the attractive brunette hostess was hanging up the phone- another party had just walked up to her. As she looked to us, we asked if she had just tried calling. She smiled and said yes! and immediately took us upstairs to a cozy spot semi-hidden behind curtains. 

It was perfect.

We started with the dungeness crab crostini with smoked salmon and avocado, a Q-ball and a Moscow Mojito. Our delicious drinks arrived followed shortly thereafter with two crostini's which were simply delightful.  It's ashame presentation is "everything", I'd have liked more!  Though, just as we finished the app the garlic baked sourdough loaf donned with kalamata olives atop arrived to our table.

[please note: the Q-ball, made with Hangar One Buddha's Hand Citron, Fresh cucumber with lemon and mint was SO amazing and refreshing, I replicated it two days later at home]

I ordered the surf & turf [crab - NOT lobster!] with a side of swiss chard, he the filet mignon bone-in and side of portobello mushrooms. If the bone-in is available - DONT hesitate. Prepared medium rare, closer to rare by the bone, it was simply amazing. {yes, I managed to score a piece of his}

Satisfying and nearly full, we shared the kir royal champagne sorbet in a waffle bowl. YUM.

I walked in discouraged I was unable to eat at the House of Prime Rib and walked out more than content with my dining experience at Bobo's.

I'll definitely be returning.
author: Michelle C.

description: Visited on a business trip for the fourth time and again had a great meal, especially the bone-in filet.  The service was also very attentive to our needs.  See you next time.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I have been coming here for a while now and always order the bone-in filet mignon, because its amazingly good. Last night, I ordered the bone-in new York and was pleasantly surprised. It's not as tender as the filet of course, but it's tastier.

Appetizers:
1) Yellowtail Carpaccio
2) Crab cakes

Both were delicious. This come with their famous bread, which used to cost money, but now they give to you for free.

For sides:
We got the Mac n cheese. They were amazing as well. On prior visits I ordered the twice baked potato, which is great too.
author: Ahmed H.

description: Busy place but I had a great time just eating at the bar.  Aged bone in NY medium rare excellent.
author: RJ V.

description:
Three words. 

BONE

IN 

FILET

This steak melts in your mouth. I wanted to pick up the bone at the end of my meal to make sure I get every little morsel of meat, but I was told by my date that would be inappropriate. 

I also absolutely demolished a twice baked potato on the side which was straight out of heaven.

Service was excellent. Definitely will be back.
author: Adam L.

description: The Combo here is full of fresh seafood. very wonderful. and the fillet with born is very tender! great restaurant!
author: Yin C.

description:
Very very very nice steak.  I had the bone-in filet, and it was probably one of the best steaks I have ever had.  Yes, even including the imported Kobe beef at Harris.  That was more on the "tender and juicy" side of the scale, and I'm more inclined toward "lean and flavorful."  

Olive garlic bread was nice, and my prawn appetizer consisted solely of delicious grilled prawns, with some butter sauce for dipping.  I didn't bother with the veggie sides, other than sharing a salad with my dining companion.  It was a nice salad and all that, but I was mainly here for the steak.  Which exceeded all expectations.  And the pistachio panna cotta was nice too.
author: C D.

description:
Came here the other day with some of our visitors from Canada. We had a family style dinner. We ordered the combo seafood platter. There were two large pieces of crab, a few shrimps, but plenty of mussels. This is great to share with 3 people. My boyfriend ordered the fish....OMG this is the greatest dish I've ever had. The sauce on it was AMAZING!! For our sides, we ordered the brussels sprouts and the shard.....again, AMAZING. The sprouts were glazed with this superb coating. 

4 STARS for the Food: pretty unique place

4 STARS for the Restaurant: 2 levels, very spacious, great decor
author: Cnn F.

description:
Since the moment you enter the restaurant, you notice the decoration, which is very cool and different.
I've heard the steaks at this place are pretty amazing, but we were craving the roasted crab. Sadly, it was a little dry and overcooked. On the other hand, the bread was addictive! 
Maybe we should give it another chance, this time with the steaks...
author: Veronica M.

description: Good food, steaks are definitely the best bet.  Loved the side dishes too.  Service was very desirable and place was very busy on a Friday night.  Glad we had reservations.
author: Greg B.

description:
I tried this place last night because I wanted to try a different steak place and this is not your traditional steak house with the dark wood, leather seats and dark ambiance. This place is more like red painted walls, red chandeliers, and black and white banners. Definitely different. We sat upstairs and arrived at 5:30 and the place was empty but filled up fast. There is a complementary valet parking in front. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The food on the other hand, not as good as I hoped for, I went with the Benin fillet ($45) and it was pan seared not grilled. I should have known by looking at the photos of the steaks. The sides are $8 and I went with the twice cooed potato, portobello mushrooms and cauliflower, They were ok, The complementary garlic bread was pretty good. I chose the chocolate bomb for desert which basically is chocolate cake with chocolate mousse and raspberry puree. Not to bad.
It was not what I really had my taste buds prepared for so I will just put it down as my been there done that list and move on to the next restaurant for a special occasion.
author: jack d.

description:
Went here for the first time last night for a birthday with a group of six and we all could not stop raving about how delicious everything tasted! 

We started with the combo skillet which had shrimp, mussels, and crab served with butter and garlic butter and it was phenomenal! Then we ordered the bone in filet, surf and turf, and petit filet. It was some of the best steak I have ever had but if I had to chose one I'd say the bone in filet is the way to go! Cooked to perfection, it just melted in your mouth. Paired with a side of chard and modern mac n cheese, it was a wonderful meal!

The service was excellent and the free valet parking was awesome, especially considering it was raining. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Alex D.

description:
I think I may have finally been initiated into the Jeh clan, with Joe Dirty asking me to join the family for a pre New Years dinner. Usually when I eat steak, I don't give a fuck and wear sweatpants so that the elastic waistband can freely expand unlike the skinnies I wear.  However, because this was a first impression opportunity, I sadly shucked off the sweatpants for khakis and a shirt for a button-up.  Our reservation was at 6:30 and there was plenty of parking around Bobos.  Like many Yelpers have mentioned, Boboquivari does not look like much, situated between some cheap motels.  However, once you enter into, it is visually completely different than its surroundings.  The interior has a very intimate setting and you can immediately tell it is upscale.  The good thing about a large party is that it gives you an opportunity to try many dishes that a party of two can't.

Our waitress brought out a loaf of bread and it was okay.  The middle parts were soaked with butter, however, the butter was not evenly dispersed.  As a result, you got some really unbuttered pieces.  The bread they give is fleshy and thick so it easily becomes dry if you land a part that isn't doused in better.  For appetizers and sides, we ordered:

crispy crab cakes: 4/5  The crab cakes were delicious, especially with the cranberry relish.  It was the perfect pairing.  

yellowtail carpaccio: 2/5  The yellow carpaccio was basically an appetizer that wasn't.  The fish was sliced so razor thin, it was pretty much invisible.  Whenever I thought I got some fish, I ended getting a spoonful of sauce.  This was pretty much a $15 non-appetizer.  

twice-baked potato: 5/5  The twice baked potato was the best side of the night.  It was so creamy and you could non-literally inhale it.  I loved baked potatoes, especially twice baked because it comes out so much creamier.  The only grip was that 5 greedy hands had to share one potato.

baked yams: 4/5  My mom used to make yams for me when I was a child and force me to eat it.  Back then, it looked so odd that I refused and many civil wars were fought over it.  I have never acquired a taste of yams since, only politely taking a spoonful of sweet potato pie, which is not bad.  Because the paramour's parents ever seeing eye was fixed upon me, I had to eat everything.  Taking a spoonful, I was very surprised.  It was delicious and I ended up polishing this side off.  

swiss chard: 3/5  Your staple vegetable.  It tasted like anything a mother could make.  

portobello mushrooms: 3/5  I believe these cubed mushrooms, along with the chard were ordered for its fiber properties, to induce a smooth turd later on that night.

modern mac n cheese: 2/5  I was a little disappointed in this mac n cheese.  They used a different type of pasta, a longer one.  However, it wasn't that creamy.  

filet mignon bone in- 5/5  Because Bobo's still had filet mignon bone-in, I opted for that.  I felt like eating a piece of meat that was so tender that it didn't require that much chewing.  The waitress explained that their steaks go through a period of aging, creating the perfect texture and taste.  When the steak arrived, it was neither too small nor too big.  It would be considered small if you didn't order additional sides, however, with side dishes, yielded the perfect portion.  My knife cut through it like hot butter and forking a piece into my mouth, I rolled my eyes to the heavens.  It was very good.  A good steak doesn't need much flavor besides salt, peper and some butter.  The thing with me is that I am not really a steak person.  I love it, but am hesitant to pay $50-70 for a steak.  I had a horrible experience at Chops in Chicago and since then, will never pay that much.  The reason being is that I feel I can make something that taste just as good as home.  In addition, it's just too much meat and nothing else.  That is why I always would rather have a good burger than a steak.  WIth that in mind, it was a perfect steak.  I also had some of KJeh's triple platter of mussels was was very disappointed.  Fucken 2/5 type disappointed bro.  While the portions were huge, it wasn't very flavorful.  The lemon garlic butter sauce was barely tastable.  You want some good mussels, go to Frites.  

If you are a steak lover, go to Bobos.  Nobody had any complaints with the steak.  It was most savory.  I am sure if you go to any higher priced steakhouse, the quality and taste is the same.  It isn't very hard to cook and there is minimal seasoning.  However, refrain from anything else.  The mussels were not that great and Mama Jeh said her fish was too salty.
author: Brian V.

description:
Boiled food sucks.  

Have you had a boiled chicken that tasted good?

I think not.  

Yet we continue to boil and steam our seafood.  I can live with clams, but mussels are just plain yuk.

Enter Bobo's.  

They dry roast on a cast iron skillet their mussels, crabs, and shrimp and holy crap it's delicious.  

I have been here twice and both times I was absolutely shit housed walking out. 

Their drinks are strong (and expensive) and the food is good.

I am giving them a solid 4 stars.  

I have never had a problem with the wait service, they are always awesome.  It's the front host that always irritates me.  

Show up a few minutes early for your reservation to have a drink and you get the feeling they are rushing you to your table so they can get ahead of schedule.  That makes me nuts.

Try the basil martini and get at least two of the burrata cheese appetizers.

Pittsburgh.
author: Archie R.

description:
Awesome old school steak joint. For some reason I wasn't expecting much from this dimly lit mafia-esque deco with all the signed celebrity studio photos on the wall. But I've always searched for another place to have steak besides House of Prime Rib, Ruth Chris, Morton's or Izzy's--and this was a wonderful alternate.

I ordered the filet mignon medium rare, perfectly moist with all the right seasonings. And I finished the meal with the pistachio panna cotta---it had an aromatically  "almondy" taste that was precisely smooth and creamy.

The service was great too, the only drawback was the prices--seemed too steep for an older feeling restaurant.
author: Ash T.

description:
The boyfriend (JP) suprised me this valentines day and took me to Bobo's.  I didn't know what to expect.  

We pulled up to the complimentary valet guys right infront of the restaurant.  This is a plus since the parking in SF can a pain.  

Anyways, on to the food...
appetizer:  yellowtail carpacio... yum.  very good.  if you expecting something light, this is what you order.

We ordered Crab legs, twice baked potato, and mac n cheese.  The crab legs were amazing not too much garlic.   The twice baked potato was buttery and had pieces of broccoli in it.  Lastly the mac n cheese was not like you ordinary mac and cheese, i felt like there was some alfredo sauce in but no complaints, it was very good.  

Desert.  
Blood orange sorbet in a waffel and italian cheesecake.  The blood orange sorbet is a MUST a great combination.  The italian cheesecake was very light and fluffy the strawberry sauce a little tart but it was good as well.

Over all, where can u find a place that has great people?  from the Valet guys to our server, everyone was pleasant and I truely  enjoyed our experience at Bobo's and we will be coming back in the near future.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Food 5 stars
Had the petite filet mignon - delicious
brussel sprouts -eh
mac and cheese - eh
garlic bread - wonderful

My only complaint, the seats suck!! 
The chairs are so uncomfortable and we felt as though we were crammed in like sardines.
The red coloring and crooked pictures on the walls were just bizarre to us.  We felt like straightening out the pictures, it almost made our party of 4 dizzy!
I was so uncomfortable the entire meal, i wish the tables were a bit bigger and the chairs a bit more comfortable.
The food top-notch, but I'll go to Harris Steak house next for the cozy booths!
author: Pug P.

description:
I found this gem a couple of years ago on the way to seeing the fireworks by the water. Since it was on the way and provided us parking it was a win win situation. I love that it looked nothing like a classic steakhouse. Stylish decor, funky bar layout and the twisted path to the dining room upstairs. It's almost psychotic in personality. 

The dry aged bone in NY steak was excellently cooked and I have to note that Bobo's seared one of the best crusts I've ever had. The long dry aging gave the steak a great flavorful, meaty pungency . The mac & cheese and the sauteed spinach made great complementary sides. 

My only complaint is even though there weren't many people there it took a while to get our reservation table. So we killed some time at the bar with the lone bartender/hostess. The service was on the slow side but definitely affable and engaging.

I'll definitely have to make a return trip and try some of the other steaks and seafood.
author: Kim N.

description: Was in town on business and brought my wife.  We found Bobos here on Yelp and decided to give it a try. Like many of the other reviewers, we found the steak to be the highlight of our visit.  She had the filet and I had the bone-in version.  Both quite tasty. Had twice-baked potato and mushrooms as sides (each was plenty for the 2 of us).  I also had the bisque-was okay but had too much rosemary (?) Service was just okay.  Our waiter was a bit surly and not particularly friendly.  The décor is downright dismal; lots of drapes and the rooms are dark. Felt cramped and tables were very close together. But of course the giant drape made us feel quite secluded from the table right next to use (laugh).  Also found it odd that they played 80s hairband music in the background.  I'm a fan of the genre but the music was out of place. A little makeover and I think this place could be rated higher.
author: Bob S.

description: Bobo's is the package deal. Amazing food, nice environment and great and friendly staff. They also provide complimentary valet parking which was a nice perk. Its a great spot for special dinners and occasions. My only request is that I wish they provided a side dish with the main course.
author: Ryan H.

description:
My 2nd time dining at this gem and even if you're not a turfer (like me) but more a surfer (like me) this spot is delicious.  From the bread, to the crab cakes, to the mussels: everything was delicious. And my dining party raved about the steak. 

And the wait staff was excellent.  A must!
author: Tina B.

description:
Bone-in fillet was to die for! Soo simple, but yet soo delicious! We tried the twice baked potatoes, mushrooms, spinach and onion rings as side orders and they were all delightful!

We brought our own bottle of red and it complemented the meal perfectly. The restaurant setting is small and decor/theme is very playful but not overly cheesy or tacky.  We had a  very cosy and intimate table. 

the service was great and they were able to accommodate and seat us right when we got there. We were approx 25 minutes late on a rainy Friday night, not to mention that traffic was horrible getting us there. 

Finding parking in the city is usually a nightmare so the free valet parking was a plus. 

Overall, recommend!
author: michelle l.

description:
My friend has been telling me about this place for a couple of years now and if she tells me a place is good, it has to be good.  But a part of me questioned how good a steak house can be that's called Bobo's.  After eating here I can tell you that Bobo's serves steaks that are as good as they get.  Coming here for the steak alone is totally worth it.  
My wife and I came here for our 1 year and she ordered the bone-in filet mignon and I ordered the bone-in NY steak.  Both equally delicious, cooked to perfection.  The food came out quick too.  The steaks came out soon after we finished the crab crostini which we both agreed was good but for $15 we thought we'd get more.  We ended the night with the wild strawberry italian cheesecake.  It's as good as it looks.  Being that it was our anniversary, I thought we'd get something nice, but all we got was a candle in our cheesecake.  I mean they waived the corkage fee for someones bday at the table behind us so of course I thought that.  Not a reason I wouldn't come back though.  
Looking forward to trying the garlic crab next time.  We had great service too.  The decor was different, looked as if we were seated inside a circus tent.  But trust me, the steaks are worth it.
author: Lester A.

description:
One of the classiest places to dine in the Marina.  The food is always consistently good,and the service is also amazing. The best steak in all of SF.   Lets not forget the wine selection.

I
author: Jay Y.

description: Besides the super douchy marina dudes sitting at the table next to us talking about bangin chics,  the dinner experience was awesome!! From the ambience to the servic,  to the food, we loved it all! Only thing I would change is to leave that sauce off the crab. Not necessary. I wish they would tell people that order it about it, and offer to give it to you on the side. We didn't care for that sauce!
author: Melanie L.

description: So I went to bobo's for my bday and I had by far one of the best steaks I have ever had.  The
author: Zaya H.

description:
Bobo's was really, really good.  The bread was so fluffy and so yummy!!  Crab cakes for appetizers deeeelish!!!  Ordered the surf and turf, just enough food.  It was great.  The filet mignon was very tender and had a lot of flavor. I wouldn't say they surpass Ruth's Chris though.  

We all came for a friends surprise dinner, had a party of eight.  The waiter was decent until he rushed us saying we had to hurry and place our order since we were already late, which clearly that wasn't the case since we all showed up on time.  Either way, for a waiter to rush you during your dining experience is a major NO NO!!!  The only reason he felt compelled to do that was because gratuity was already included on the bill.  LAME!!! 

All in all, we had a good time with friends and the food was great, minus the rushing waiter...I'm a fan!
author: Monique M.

description:
Woohoo! After a yelp hiatus due to crazy work induced sleeplessness. I am happy to report that I decided to have our end of craziness celebratory expensive dinner here at Bobo's. Damn what a good idea. *pats self on back*

First of all, I had 6 people RSVP and 7 show up. Whoops! The hostesses were great about accomodating it - however it took almost 2 hours. The reservation was for 7pm and we did not get sat until almost 9. However, note the 5 stars I gave it. Thats due to the fact that after an hour plus we were starving and asking how much longer it was going to be they let us order 6 apps - on the house. Which, due to my reservation snafu, it was entirely my fault that we were not seated on time. So kudos for them for customer service. It also probably has something to do with the 4 (ok 5) martinis I had before dinner. But thats how it goes. My favorite app was the mussel shrimp and crab app. served on a sizzling platter - yum!

Dinner was simply amazing. Five words for anyone thinking of going to Bobo's: Get The Bone In Filet. 'nuff said. Perfectly cooked (well, mine was at least - one got sent back but came out perfectly the second time) Our server was a delight and always around when we needed her - quite the feat considering the restaurant is spread out over 3 floors and at some point every other guest had left but us. And they were smart and put the large loud group of 5 martini folks in a quiet velvet curtained area. Made me feel all important. Love this place. I will be back many times!
author: Brenda K.

description:
Ummm... what do I say.. should I rip all the other steak houses in the city who think they are the best (ahem - Harris') or just simply state the obvious.   Bobo's you rule SF and here is your virtual crown.  Bone in Filet = Yes!   

Oh yeah - the complimentary Valet is oh so beautiful!
author: Tom C.

description:
I'll never forget this experience. My buddy and I decided to come here because a friend recommended it. He said the steak was good and the crab was excellent. I got there stood at the podium for a good 60 sec while the Maître de and waitress was having a conversation. When they were finished talking, they made me feel like i was intruding when I told them I was here for dinner and need a table for two. We waited 15 min to be seated...which is a very long time considering 3/4 of the tables were open. They seated us, 2 6'+ guys, in a tiny booth for two. We were planning on ordering quite a few dishes so we asked to be seated at a larger table. I'll never forget the the waitress said to us..."We're expecting a huge rush after the giants game ends so we're kinda saving those tables". W...T....F....!?!?! Are you kidding me?! We should have gotten up and left but I was starving. We ended up switching table after we assured them we'd have a quick dinner. I'm so upset still, I'm shaking as i write this. FYI...this was during the giants second round playoffs 2010.

The food: Steak was perfectly cooked but a bit too salty (and buttery) for my taste. Crab was really good....the sauce on the hot plate was soooo good...I sopped every drop up with crab meat and bread. Mac and cheese was good also.

Overall...the food was very good but unfortunately...I'm NEVER going back there. Their front of the house need a huge attitude change. Even getting a refill for water was a task.

While i was waiting for the valet...i talked to a few of the cooks that were smoking outside and they were super cool. I'd rather have them serve me any day. 

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!!!
author: Ham N.

description:
I've been here about half a dozen times and once or twice with a big group. I know I've tried at least half the menu (it isn't really large, and quite frankly I like it  that way)... yet I don't remember anything I've eaten there except the bone-in filet mignon.

At your first bite, the lights lower to a soft glow, restaurant chatter turns to angel harps, and the overwhelming sensation of epicurean happiness engulfs you... and you realize you truly have eaten the best thing (steak) you have ever had... seriously... (completely beats out House of Prime Rib, Ruth's Chris, Peter Luger (yes I know!), and whatever else you can think of)

So this review isn't really helpful as far as other food items are concerned... but here are a few other things I love about this place.

The restaurant is larger than it might seem; they try hard to make it more of an intimate atmosphere. Although this seems like more of a couple's date place; it's definitely meant for group of friends or family in celebration. Make reservations!

The bar is fantastic. The bar tenders are attentive, the selection is good for a restaurant, and drink menu full of classics and some innovative choices. 

Valet is free

Even better... if you're visiting from out of town or being the tour guide for some folks; its usually about a $12 cab ride from typical tourist spots (union square, fisherman's wharf)
author: Joanna L.

description:
I love Bobo's. Tonight we had a group of 6, we had a round table booth. The steak was "like butta" 
Perfect.
Yeah, they charge you for anything other than steak on your plate. You want a potato? 8 bux, brussel sprouts ? 8 bux, glass of your basic Sonoma red? 9 bux. So, it adds up a bit. 
But you're so stoned from your perfect steak that you don't really care. Well, I can only speak for myself. 

When the bill came. It was just one bill. So someone asked it to be broken up. They divided it by 6. 
Uhhh, thanks, we could have done that. We want s-e-p-a-r-a-t-e bills, get it? Like -I didn't have a side, I didn't order an appetizer, etc. So, then the floor manager has to take over, she splits it up in repeats, has us circle what we had, then prints it out again.
What a circus. The funny bit is that she was sassy about it which I found amusing.
Also somewhat amusing is the automatic 18 % they give the service. Um, is it just me? but I like to choose.
All's good, steak was great who cares. It's just money.
author: Roanna Z.

description:
Not too impressed. Seemed a bit pricey for what you get. I had the crab and a filet mignon surf and turf and neither was anything special. The crab at the Stinking Rose was much better and they both came with a similar anchovy butter dipping sauce.
I couldn't taste the alcohol in my drinks either.
author: Chow L.

description:
Wow. 

My boyfriend and I went here for our Valentine's Dinner. 
It was Saturday night, and the place was packed. Loved the valet parking, the upstairs view, each and every staff member, the menu, and the wine list. 
We still dream about the smoked mussels. 
He had surf and turf, mushrooms, and brussels sprouts. I had a petit filet medium rare. 
So. Good. 
So. Good. 
So. Good. 

Go.
author: A. H.

description:
Definitely the best steakhouse in town.

The crab was good. Still you can have similar crabs in other places. But you cannot find the same steak as Bobo's bone in fillet in any other place. It's not cheap, yet every bite worth the money. I would love to give 6 stars just for the bone in fillet if there's any. The only downside is every table is so close to each other. I could hear clearly what next table was talking about. So I take 1 star away and rate it as 5 stars.
author: V L.

description: Great place to eat and drink. The bone in filet was to die for! We had a drink in the friendly bar atmosphere first. Then ate the scrumptious meal. Would definitely go back. Oh by the way free Valet parking helps since its located on Lombard which is a plus.
author: John M.

description:
My family was visiting from out of town to celebrate my graduation and Bobo's was recommended.  We were not disappointed!  Everything was fantastic, with only one exception...

Baked garlic & olive sourdough loaf
Yellowtail carpaccio with diced chilies & olive oil ponzu sauce - Unbelievable!
Heirloom toy box tomatoes bermuda onions & avocado in a balsamic vinaigrette served with burrata
Petit filet mignon
Bone-in filet mignon
Dungeness crab roasted in garlic sauce whole crab
Twice-baked potato
Brussels sprouts with pancetta
Modern mac & cheese - This is the exception.  It was good when first served; but as it sat it had a funny texture and no cared for it.
Dunce cap cones four cones filled with dark chocolate mousse over ancho chili pepper chocolate sauce - These were so good we had a second order!

Very good wine prices.

The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because they were trying to turn the table, and it was obvious.  I understand they were busy, but we had not been together in 4 years, and we wanted to have a relaxing and enjoyable meal together.
author: Maureen R.

description: Get the Brussels sprouts. Also the NY steak. Entire meal was good. A bit pricey but good food and service. Will return
author: Mike L.

description:
Came early and sat at the bar, was the only one in bar for quite some time. 
 The bartender was not in the mood it seems to really serve me , drinks or otherwise.
 I had the crabcake appetizer which seemed it was brought from fridge to deep fryer, off in flavor, too dark outside barely cooked inside. Then it was a long wait for my steak. medium rare is the standard and I was assured" we meet the highest standard of doneness" came out extremely rare and pointed this out  to Bartender who explained: thats our medium rare. 
  Bar jocks should not be giving doness explanations.
 I told him" I am getting used to rare steak" and don't take it back, then I asked him to find someone who mattered in the steak dept. 
   No one showed so I ate the very rare steak and kept a small portion uneaten attached to the bone and told the busboy please take this to someone in back who cares about the food here".
  A slicked back guy appeared and formed an apology about my food and lack of attention. he comped me the wild strawberry cheesecake and a double espresso. 
 Sixty bucks for one person and that was with dessert and coffee comped 
The food and service fall way short of an epic steakhouse.
author: Craig S.

description:
I just changed this rating to 5 stars when I realized that I had no 5 star ratings.  

I suppose when someone asks you for a restaurant recommendation in a city as big as SF and you consistently recommend the same place...well that's gotta be a 5-star rating. 

Bobo's is the spot for sizzling muscles, a juicy steak and a bottle of vino.  Hidden under a Travel Lodge, the decor is almost Shakespearean and very unique.  Depending on the type of place you like, its a little bit of a maze inside, so intimacy is your friend here.  If your dinner requires loud main dining rooms and lots of people watching, Bobo's is probably not your best choice.  If your require however a unique place to take a client or treat your lady, Bobo's won't disappoint.  

Don't be shy with your wallet... you only live once.
author: PJ M.

description:
We have been to Bobo's before...the food is excellent and so is the service.  
We do have one criticism this time.  We ordered the Prime Rib on the bone, because we wanted an order large enough to share.  We also had Crab Cakes for an appetizer, which were wonderful, and ordered a salad and (for an extra charge) had crab added to that, and we ordered a side of onion rings with the steak.  The salad, which we planned to share with the steak, was the one with apples, cranberries and nuts etc.
The steak was excellent, as were the onion rings, but the salad was vastly overpriced...it ended up being a rather small bowl of the salad greens etc and about 3 pieces of crabmeat...for $19.00!   We were ok...did not go away hungry, but since we have ordered salads many times in restaurants, and have come to feel that the ala carte salads are usually too big for one person, which is why we planned to share, we were surprised at this one.   
We consider Bobo's a "special"  place, and went for my husband's birthday.  It was still very good, and we will return, but we won't order a salad!
author: Roberta G.

description:
My friend turned 25 and made reservations weeks in advance for a party of 15.

On the pre-set menu,  I chose the Surf and Turf, a medium rare 8oz steak served alongside Garlic Butter Crab as my main entree. My  friends opted for the Filet Mignon and T-bone Rib Eye Steak.  

I have eaten at the House of Prime Rib several times and I do not plan to go back after Bobo's! My medium rare steak at Bobo's was by far more flavorful, succulent and softer than my cuts at House of Prime Rib.  The meat practically melted in my mouth.  And the flavors were just enough so that the flavor of the meat was not lost.  

The Garlic Butter crab was equally delicious.  Drizzled with melted butter, the crab meat was seasoned with the perfect balance of garlic and salt.  All my friends were equally impressed with their Filet Mignon and Rib Eye Steaks.

Alll the main entrees were accompanied with side dishes.  My favorite was the twice baked potato.  Never have I seen a baked potato crumble when cut.  It was as if the insides of the potato were hollowed out, seasoned with pepper and garlic, cooked, and stuffed back into the potato, sprinkled with cheese and butter and baked again.

The baked potato was the table favorite while the onion rings--a usual favorite at diners were left untouched. 

For dessert, we had the chocolate mousse dipped in a divine sauce of wine, cayenne pepper, and chocolate. I ended up licking the plate clean.  Boboquivari's is definitely a San Francisco gem.
author: Shirley W.

description: Food here is amazing. Sides are things you'll be familiar with but done with a unique twist. Meat is fall apart good, the bone-in fillet is out of this world. Even the medium rare melts like butter in this place.
author: Genevieve W.

description:
One of my FAVORITE restaurant up in the city.  I found out after eating here that I was allergic to everyday common foods.  - Beef, chicken, shellfish, rice, wheat, etc.  (VERY DEPRESSING) but it doesn't stop me from coming here.  Popped in a Zyrtec and I'm good to go!  The sacrifices I make...

Anyhow...on to the review...

Pros:
- Complimentary Valet (ohh yeah...no need to look for parking SCORE!)
- It's really cozy
- BONE IN Filet Mignon (Mouthwatering goodness - touch my meat and DIE!..JKing...but really don't touch it - I am not sharing!) - Harder to cook a filet mignon with the bone so they'll pop it back onto the grill if you want it cooked a bit more.
- Mussels - small, simple, and light (you can get tired of mussels real fast, but these were super tiny so it just gave you a quick snack without being overpowering or filling before your entree)
- Brussel Sprouts with Pancetta - need I say more? yes, because brussel sprouts aren't really that tasty, but add some pancetta and it's golden!
- BAKED FREAKIN' YAMS - brings me back home to my southern roots.  I really don't like to share this either...
- Surf and Turf - a petite filet mignon with a bit of crab (best of both worlds) - I ended up not eating much of the crab (gets a bit messy)

Con:
I am a little bit peeved when I mentioned in my reservation that it was my bf's birthday when I saw the table next to mine get a birthday surprise.  Minus one star.

Please pay attention to detail, but overall a WONDERFUL MEAL that I will frequent again and again.
author: Kathy N.

description:
This place has strange decor and decent food. My co-workers raved about it. They said that despite it's location on Lombard, it was not a tourist trap and was a great place for steak.
We ordered the steak and crab. We found it fine, but not great. When I told my co-workers about our decent experience, they said we should have ordered the bone-in fillet. Too bad we'll never find out.
author: Peter P.

description:
The food here is some of the best I have ever had.

-1 star for not having REGULAR BEER.  No miller, no coors, no bud, no corona.  Just 4 or 5 dark beers.
author: Shawn L.

description: Best of the best. This was our 3rd time there. Valet is easy. Showed up early for a reservation, expected to have a drink at the bar while we wait, but were seated right away. I don't think this has happened to me anywhere else before.Service is good. Food even better. My girlfriend and I attempt to try something new every time we come and haven't been disappointed yet. This is our go to spot for special occasions.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Bo-Bo's never fails to deliver a great dining experience! I have been going for years and although it seems the overall experience is always different, the food is constantly good. 

This last visit was not my favorite due to our seating arrangement (the room off to the immediate right as you enter the restaurant). I would recommend sitting somewhere else, but we made last minute reservations and the place was packed. Unfortunately we had a huge table of drunk guys yelling profanities all night, but my girlfriend and I dove into our meal and made it a great time overall.

We started with a vodka martini and the iron-skillet combo, which is a garlic joy! Followed by the petite filets and sides of Swiss-chard and a baked potato paired with a nice Cab. We left satisfied that we ate too much and were happy.

Overall the prices are above average, but so is the food.
author: B U.

description: This is not your typical steak and/or crab house.  had a very dark-- almost goth feel inside. very small and intimate.  the bone-in filet was simply amazing! also, great dungeness crab.  Bobo's is expensive, but worth the money.
author: C R.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in San Francisco.

We had the mussels for 3 as an appetizer for the 6 of us, it's like a bathtub! May be the best mussels I've had, ever.

We were lucky enough to sit on the top floor near the patio and large windows. We brought in 4 bottles of wine and a bottle of barley wine - corkage is only $15 bucks a bottle.

Surf and turf + mac and cheese, excellent. The onion rings are decadent, and we were really surprised by the sweet potatoes, all around they were our favorite.

The service was perfect - he knew when to "kill another bottle" and had fun with us.

Great place to go when you have a budget of at least 100 bucks - ours was a going away party, and we sent him out right :)
author: Chelsea D.

description:
As I'm writing this, my mouth is getting all watery for another piece of steak :)

We made reservations but we were running late due to the schedule. So when we got there we were lucky enough to get seated but they said we only had a 2 hour limit until the next party. So yay :)

It's a little pricy for a steak house but it's great to come here and celebrate. One bad thing is that they sometimes don't tell you the sides are extra so I made that mistake.
