I had the bone in filet  with the double stuff potato. Sooo yummy. Apparently I thought this piece of steak was awesome. It was chewy and crunchy on the sides :) the potato was so yummy. However though, my bf's piece was a little more rare and had to fire it up again. 

Since it was a birthday dinner. They gave him dessert for half the price :) good job. 

I seriously want steak now....
author: Lisa C.

description: This is the best steak in town, be prepared to moan and groan as you get through it. They serve up steaks that are dry aged for 4-6 weeks giving it an amazing flavor. The restaurant is named after a jester of the old venice court, its funky circus decor with cirque du soleil style is casual yet inviting inside. You can come here wearing a suit or a tshirt and you would not be out of place. Bring a bottle of wine with you, the corkage fee is only $15. Free valet, so parking is not a problem.
author: Eugene D.

description:
Pricey but v. yummy!  

We came on a Sunday evening and it was pretty quiet and perfect for a family dinner.  There were 5 of us and we ordered:  fish (2), 1 steak and lobster, 1 bone-in filet and 1 filet.  Everyone loved their food.  Steak was melt in your mouth..mmmm...amazing!!  Both the bone-in and regular filet were really good.  We did order some appetizers and they were just okay, nothing memorable.  The sides though were great, we got the brussel sprouts (delish!), mushrooms and the twice baked potatoes.   They also provided bread for us, it was a garlic bread, it was good but a bit on the greasy side, it was either soaked in olive oil or sitting on a bed of olive oil and it was a little difficult to separate.  The one thing I did notice was that the food came out a little fast and at times I felt like we were being rushed.  All and all, I think we all left happy and full.

Side note: something else I noticed while there - beware of the raised booths (esp if you are drinking), it's a little dark in there and I guess maybe after a drink or 2 you could forget that you need to step down but while we were eating we witnessed not one but two falls of someone getting up from the booth and just eating it.
author: Selena G.

description: If I could give it 10 stars I would! The service is amazing, their recommendations are amazing, and the food is AMAZING! Don't come here if you're in a rush, but the relaxing atmosphere is wonderful. Apparently all the locals come here, and coming from Seattle, it was top notch! I will definitely recommend this place to my friends. Such a great experience! Ask to sit in Teo's section! I left my heart at Bobo's!!!
author: Kristin S.

description: Amazing food every time I come here! Everyone who works there is very kind! I had crab and steak it was amazing! Great flavor all around! Even the desserts are to die for! I can't wait to go back!
author: Crystal H.

description:
I chose the bone-in strip over the bone-in filet. I made a mistake. I took a bite of my strip and it was perfectly cooked and juicy then I had a bite of my friend's filet and it was like butter. I'm not saying the strip isn't good because it's damn good but if/when you come here get the filet. That's what they're known for. It's unbelievably tender.

Sides were also various and tasty - portabella mushrooms, onion rings, mac n cheese, brussel sprouts, etc...

This place is rather interesting as it appears to be connected to one of the hotels on Lombard so it appears like a cheesy looking place and it does have quirky decor and it's definitely cozy. It's a series of small rooms connected by a stair case. I only have to knock off one star because the service could have been more friendly and more attentive for such an expensive restaurant but the filet is well worth it.
author: David C.

description:
I was surprised, albeit very pleasantly.

Friends told me I have to check out this place when I go up north.  On my last trip, I finally did.  I was skeptical as the friend recommending Bobo's doesn't actually eat beef.  Upon entering, I was put off by the multicolored decor and booths.  I felt like I stepped into a strange David Lynch film and I was going to be the supper.

I'm glad I don't scare easy.  The food was SPECTACULAR.

Crab was good, but the sauce that it came in on the bottom of the pan is what I dream about.  It's made with the "good stuff" from the middle of the crab with lots of garlic.  It is artery congealing yummy goodness.  

The steak was good.  I usually don't praise steaks as I can't really see nice places messing it up too much.  But this steak was good.  Really good.  Juicy, tender, flavorful good.  

But what made the meal for me was the crab and sauce.
author: Jerry W.

description:
I have a mixed 4 star review of this place. The quality of the meat is outstanding. You can taste the benefits of their extensive aging process. This is what all great meat should taste like. That being said I do have a small issue with their orders being ala carte and the portions being on the smaller side. My bf ordered the $59 porterhouse and while quality definitely trumps quantity, I have to agree with others that this is still overpriced.

We had the crostini and toy box tomato appetizers. The crostini was definitely delicious but for $13 it was a bummer that it was only enough for two people to have a taste. 

I was also slightly disappointed by the bread that they advertise on their website. My bf and I are suckers for places with amazing bread and while theirs was tasty, I wouldn't say I prefer it or that it was even that memorable.

Side dishes were very good - esp. twice baked potato though it is very, very rich so it is one to share for the table. Brussel sprouts in pancetta were just as tasty was they sound.  Portabella mushroom side was good but the all the oil used drowned out a lot of the taste.

While the food was an overall 4 stars, the service was an overall 2 stars. Our waiter did the VERY, VERY bare minimal to get by. On several occasions our water glasses were empty for some time until we poured it.  Meanwhile he stood in the corner, when he noticed he would rush over to do so but I mean seriously, you have a bus staff and food runner so really your only job is to make sure we're sufficiently tended to and that was not the case. I just expect more if we're forking over close to $100/person for a nice meal.

Good experience, glad we went but prob wouldn't go back until it was a SUPER special occasion AND their wait staff was better.
author: Kristine T.

description: Had a party of 12 on 07/14/12. They don't cater to groups but made an exemption for us. The waited on us hand and foot. The bone in filet was outstanding and the portion was huge!. Very nice atmosphere. Each person in our group was taken away by the taste of the mod-mac and other fixings. If you love steaks this place is a hidden treasure.
author: Erwin R.

description:
When I'm in the mood for some good steak...

"Hello, Bobo's."

"Hi, do you have your bone-in fillet?"

"Yes we do" 
"reservations please"

"No not today"
(hang up and cry)

-1 star for their sides...I only like the sweet potato. Everything else is bleh.

Crab cakes were a bit oily. Their roasted crab is supposed to be really good but I thought it was just ordinary.

The stand-out and star of Bobo's is the bone-in fillet. It is the most amazing, buttery, juicy, flavorful steak. I like to just pick up the bone and gnaw the meat off of it, manners be damned. I may end up with grease and meat juices all over my mouth, but each flavorful morsel is worth it. And the steak portion is very very generous.
author: Mary M.

description:
Why does a good meal have to end?! I came here with my buddies for a birthday/get-together and I have to say that this is one of the most simple, expensive and best filet mignons I ever had! Hands down!

Bobo's interior is a little cramp and dim, but the environment itself is comfortable. Walking in, you'll see the bar straight away and I notice there are seatings in several places in the building, so it's not just one big dining room. The waiting service, I thought, was professional, yet casual. 

Alright! We didn't order much, just 3 pounds of crab, Bone-In Filet Mignon each, and a Twice Baked Mashed Potatoes. Topping the orders was the Bone In Filet Mignon! The plate was nothing but meat and it was resting on its own juice. I could taste the butter that they used to cook the steak, but it might have been pan-seared. Whatever it was, the steak was cooked to perfection and to the letter! My buddy's rare steak was cooked on the outside with a thin layer of pink and a whole lot of red! I got mine medium and it was still juicy! Remember, Bone-In!

The crab was roasted with garlic and herbs. 3 pounds of it was good enough for appetizers for 5 guys. Not the best crab I ever had, but it's still good. The Twice Baked Mashed Potatoes was peppery, but I didn't see anything special other than the fact that it's mashed potatoes sitting in a hollowed out potato cut in half (I don't know if that made sense, but order one and you'll see what I mean).

The pricing is pretty reasonable for the quality, but don't expect a whole lot to eat. Oh, and I believe there's complimentary valet parking, so that balances the cost up a little.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
i love this place.  i took my gf here for a romantic dinner.  we got caught in traffic and ended up arriving about 45 minutes late.  we had called ahead and let them know we were going to be late and once we got there we were seated right away.  great start to a great meal.

the waitress was very cordial and the service turned out to be good.

this was my 2nd time eating here and it defintely didn't disappoint again.  they are the traditional steakhouse where you order your steak and sides.  the sides are decently big and the steak, out of all the places i've had steak this is my favorite.  i've eaten at ruth chris and michael mina's at the westin st. francis but i always remember bobo's.  the only other place i like along the same lines is cattleman's but that's a different pricepoint.  don't know what they do but its the best steak in my opinion.  makes my mouth water thinking about it.

if you're looking for a romantic dinner and don't mind spending a little bit you won't be disappointed here.  even driving an hour and a half it was an amazing night.  definitely need to make reservations and you'll have to valet your car out front since parking around there is a pain to find.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Thank you, Bobo's, for sincerely caring about your customers' thoughts when it comes to your food, service, and provided experience. 

I recently came back here for a do-over, and left feeling much more content than my first time.

I kept an open-mind and decided to try a different entree: Surf & Turf (half crab and petit Filet Mignon). 

The crab was deliciously buttery and garlicy (just how I like it).  However, the crab at the Crab House (same owners as Bobo's) was much better.  Makes sense since that's their specialty! 

Granted the petit Filet was indeed tiny, it still managed to stuff me after I devoured every bit of the crab.  The steak was melt-in-your-mouth good and was actually cooked medium-rare this time around. 

Unlike the main entree, I stuck to the sides that I originally loved: The Twice-Baked Potato and Modern Mac&Cheese.  To confirm, yes -- they are both still delectable.

Bobo's made my night, so I'll forgive them and come back again.  In the future, though, I'll stick to steak entrees only (since I'd rather save my crab bingeing at the Crab House).
author: Judy C.

description:
My wife and  I went here for my birthday. This place rocks! The decor is perfect for a romantic evening, the staff is fantastic, and the steak is cooked to perfection!

What more could you ask for from a steak restaurant?
author: Daniel R.

description: We were in town on business and a friend suggested Bobo's, from appetizers to my bone-in filet it was absolutely the best! I have eaten at Morton's a number of times , but my steak at Bobo's was better than any Morton's steak I've had! Great job to everyone at Bobo's we'll be back every time were in the City!
author: David E.

description:
Definitely good times and a tasty meal at Boboquivari's last weekend. Celebrated a friend's birthday here and the group ordered 3 servings of mussels and "mmmmmmmmmm!!!!" is all that needs to be said to describe it. Cups of melted butter and garlic accompany the mussels for dipping and believe me, what appeared to be a ridiculous pile of mussels disappeared fast with this crowd!

Bone in filet mignon was delicious. However, I would definitely suggest ordering a side of sweet potato as it distracted me away from the filet mignon during the meal from time to time. I was surprised at how creamy and yummy it was, although many at the table commented that it was a tad sweet for their taste. 

Anyways, back to the filet mignon. It definitely didn't need any sauce at all! One of the better prepared filet mignons I've had. I had to restrain myself from eating the whole thing and leaving my boyfriend with some extra though, as he is the #1 meat-eater of all time. The whole group (and I think even the waitress) stared in amazement as he helped 3 other people finish their servings....clean...to the bone after finishing his own.

All in all, a great experience at Bobo's!
author: Angela S.

description:
I'm going to go out on a limb here and say not only is this my favorite steak I've ever had in my life, but also happens to be my favorite restaurant in the city. 
The service is great but much more importantly, the food is absolutely phenomenal. 

The reason Bobo's stand out from every other steakhouse is the way in which they cook their steak. In every other steakhouse they either broil or grill your steak. At Bobo's however, they season your steak and sear it in a cast iron skillet, then put it in the oven to finish it off depending on how you like it. This creates a crust on the outside of the steak searing in the juices, that is unlike any I've ever had. The concept has caused me to cook every steak I've had since, using my cast iron skillet. Finishing it off with a bit of butter, garlic, and rosemary, combined with the juices of the steak makes for an incredible bas
e "sauce" to which they lay this Devine piece of meat on top before serving. 
The mussels appetizer (also cooked in cast iron) Is absurdly amazing. And if you like dungeoness crab, they boil it in a base liquid that makes the meat taste incredible even without needing to dunk it In butter as I usually do. Once again, unique to anything else I've had, And all around pretty much the best place ever.
Every one of my friends from out of own that I take there (3 so far) have all walked out agreeing it was the best steak they have had.
 
If your looking for a cheaper steak house that is also phenomenal, with the best au gratin potatoes In history, go down the street to izzy's. but I you've got the loot to drop on the best steak you may ever taste. Do yourself a favor and EAT HERE!
author: Brett G.

description:
Great steak house, and Divine drinks. 
Our party started at the bar with a Cosmo then headed off to the table. We ordered a few appetizers for the table to share, but what really got me was the crab cake... ooh WOW. So firkin good! 
I ordered the Lobster soup, which was absolutely amazing and for dinner had the surf and turf, chard and twice baked potato. The petite steak was AWESOME and Lobster was Delicious.
author: Monica O.

description:
Best steak in the city and probably the best I have had.  This is my go to spot for steak in San Francisco.

Bone-In Filet, nuff said. Enjoy!
author: John F.

description: Bone in filet mignon.  Nuff said!  Try it!  You'll enjoy it!
author: Brian A.

description:
Having read all the glowing reviews, we were very disappointed to to be served mediocre steak and substandard side dishes.   The service ranged from perfuntory to downright poor.  Restuarants like this that offer a limited menu usually ensure that their few offerings are outstanding.  Here, the limited menu is a sign of their limited commitment to quality.

In detail-
* The Steaks- We all ordered the bone-in New York strip.  I was pleased to see that they served bone-in versions of the strip and filet.  Usually, finding the bone-in version on the menu means the restaurant really cares to serve the best cut.  Not in this case.  Our steaks were smallish (12-13 ounces) and they weren't seared on the outside.  Instead, they came out brown with a light covering of a slightly-sweet steak sauce.  A good steak does not need to be covered in steak sauce  (offering the diner steak sauce on the side is a reasonble option, but a good restaurant shouldn't smear it over my steak as a matter of course).  My steak was cooked reasonably properly.  A pink, but not pink/red medium-rare.  The waitress actually told us that their medium-rare was closer to rare, but this was not the case at all.  My steak wasn't tough, but clearly less tender than the usual prime grade New York strip.  In addition, it actually had a streak of gristle through through the middle that required me to cut around it.  Flavor was that of a high-grade choice steak, not a prime one.

* Cocktails-  I ordered a Beefeater gin martini, up with olives.  The waitress had to come back later to tell me that they don't have Beefeater.  She didn't know this when taking the cocktail order.  My martini was served with hot pepper olives.  Who in their right mind serves a hot pepper olive martini to a customer without telling them or asking them if they like it this way?  I'm glad that I didn't order a premium gin only to have the flavor so changed by hot pepper.  Ridiculous.  I should have sent it back.

* Side Dishes- They serve a reasonably good baked garlic and olive sourdough bread.  But the crust on the loaf is so hard you can't cut through it without a serrated knife (which of course, they didn't provide).  The smooth-edged knives on the table weren't sharp enough to do so. We managed to chop and tear it up (crumbs all over).  The bread is not served with butter or olive oil, and the bread is fairly dry.  Whose idea was that?  Our apples, walnuts, sundried cranberries salad was standard fare, with an standard dressing.  The twice baked potato was good.  But only  1/2 of the potato was served.  We were told by the waitress that each side dish was enough for two people.  If a half potato serves two people, they must be light eaters.

* Service- When we walked in, the maitre-d did not greet us, or even seem to notice we were standing there.  Instead, she was on a long coversation on the phone, turned around so her back was to us, jotting down reservation info on a form that she held against the wall.  After a few minutes of us just standing there looking around, she paused a moment to say "hold on, I will be right with you".  After about five minutes more, she finally greeted us, then seated us.  Our waitress was a pleasant person, but we saw her once for the cocktails, once for the dinner order, and once for the check.  (as mentioned before, she didn't know what common drinks were available at the bar).  During the dinner,  I dropped my knife, and no one was available to ask for a replacement.  After some time without seeing anybody to ask for a replacement, I had to take one from the table next to me.  I guess I should have just stood up and walked over to the bar to find a live person and asked for a new one. Very innatentive amateur service, that bordered on ungracious.

* Ambiance-  This was the high point of the meal.  It is a funky space, decorated in an eclectic 19th century way.  Fun and cozy.

* Parking- Free valet.  This is great!

Overall, a third rate experience at first rate prices.  We enjoy steak very much, and we have dined in some of the best steak houses in Los Angeles, New York, Las Vegas and Chicago (and a few in Japan).  From the reviews, I thought we had found "our place" in our home city of San Francisco.  Although we have had a few disappointments in the past when dining in other highly regarded steak houses, in my opinion, Bobos was the worst steak and worst dining experience that I have ever had at a restaurant that claims to specialize in high-quality aged, prime grade beef.
author: Preston F.

description: The bread is awesome. The mussels are even more awesome. And the steak is the most awesomest (:P)! Bobo's you rock.
author: Elisa C.

description: Birthday dinner with friends and while Bobo's may be pricey, it's worth every penny.  If you like steak, this is your place.  Some day I'll save up some money and come back alone to see if I can conquer the porterhouse.  Alone so that I don't shame myself with the meat sweats.
author: Corey V.

description:
Visited on Aug 7th. My wife reserved a table a month ahead of time for my 60th birthday dinner at BoBo on my request  Even after my son called a week before our dinner and asked for a nice table for a special ocassion we were seated in what appeared to be a dark closet minus the murphy bed, When we asked to be moved the receptionist was none too friendly and moved us to a table down stairs by four loud drunks. The place is run down, the prices are over-priced and the food is average at best.

While the bone-in filet was good it nothing special, the bread was a joke, the sides (brussel sprouts and mac and chesse) were over-priced and salty, the salads were un-impressive in regards to quality and not very fresh, and the drinks were small and watered down. 

With all the great places to eat and celebrate in San Francisco and I picked BoBos and It was a huge mistake.
.
Thanks for the horrible birthday dinner BoBos - we won't be back. Don't waste your money and be diappointed as we were. Go to Morton's or A5A or Tthe House of Prime Rib for a great dinner if your ready for beef or to the wharf for crab but stay away from BoBos..
author: Ron V.

description: 3.5 starts to be exact! This is a unique place, very cozy and visually appealing when you first walk in. The bar and lounge area is very intimate, as is the restaurant as a whole. The steaks are solid, and the wait staff do fine job. I would not have a problem going back here for a good meal.
author: Gabby M.

description:
this place has to be one of the most memorable dinner experiences around town.

first off, decor wise...it feels like someone wrapped up a bunch of mardi gras decor into a red velvet carpet, then proceeded to blow it up inside this place.  SO VIBRANT...so much energy coming from this place as soon as you walk in...

staff is all very helpful and everyone working the bar is very attentive as well

as for the food. make sure you go with at least 4 people so you can order a bit of everything...

we ended up ordering up appetizers such as the yellowtail carpaccio, crab crostini, lobster crostini, mac and cheese, brussel sprouts, and a salad...as for the actual meal, we ordered up a ton of crab and just a couple steaks that we could all share as well...

bone in filet mignon. you gotta do it. trust me...one of THE best steaks ive had in my life...perfect char and crust on the outside, perfectly cooked on the inside...buttery beefy flavor with every bite...id go back JUST for 1 piece of steak again.

as for the other thing i really, really enjoyed there....LOL, has to be the house bread...

the dining room is dark upstairs...from what i saw...they put a loaf of crusty bread on the table...sliced up all along the length of the loaf JUST SO they could pour in some type of butter and garlic sauce concoction. i dont even LIKE BREAD...this loaf here at bobo's is insanely good tho.  

great meal and although a bit pricey, i would take this over most steakhouses in the City.
author: Kyu L.

description:
Bobo's kinda feels like a classy circus. With Steaks... and wine. 

Dinner was especially cool the other night because we were seated at this small nook table upstairs. It was very private and dim, so nobody could stare as we covered ourselves in crab shrapnel.
author: bm b.

description:
We came to dine here on a random Thursday night and boy, was I in for a delightful treat. 
Table for 4? No reservation and we were sat in a whim. That's nice...
To start off, the double mussels, double crab was a BIG hit. Well seasoned and not a single empty shell.
A few bottles of the Stuhlmuller Chardonnay to go with it and it was like heaven.
The girls shared the crab cakes and the twice baked potato. Very very good.
The boys had the filet bone-in and David claimed that it was amazing.
Absolutely no room for dessert.
The leather banquet seats were super comfy that I didn't want to leave.
Service was on point.
We will definitely return for another Bobo experience.
P.S. Free valet parking!!!
author: DayDay D.

description: probably the closest to the best in the city, this is second on my list of good steak houses, parking is kind of hectic again this is in the city, steaks are always juicy and tender through and through with each cut, not buttered like ruth chris (blah) way better. Porterhouse med-rare every bite worth the $$$ haha, ambiance are nice, somewhat tight quarters depending where you get seated, probably good first date spots haha but the steaks you can't complain...
author: Clarence A.

description:
Everyone who knows I love steaks always told me to come here. We finally came here for a friend's birthday one night, we had about 8 people. 

First off, this place is packed on the weekends, we came here on a Friday night. I am not sure how it is on the weekdays, but I bet it gets really booked. We had reservations but it took a bit of time before they sat us, completely understandable though since it was so full. 

We ordered a few appetizers, the iron skillet roasted mussels were pretty darn good. We also had the crostini con burrata with dungeness crab, smoked salmon and avocado...but I have to say, I wasn't all that impressed. The salmon overpowered the dish so it was almost pointless to have crab and avocado in it. There were so many ingredients but just one flavor. But the burrata was good (Just in case you didn't know, a burrata is a fresh Italian cheese, made from mozzarella and cream.)   We also tasted the brussels sprouts with pancetta and the mac & cheese, both were only okay. 

But...the Filet Mignon Bone-In...WOW...now that was good!!! I was definitely impressed by the juicy and plump piece of filet mignon. And when I devoured it, I was definitely in a good mood. So my 5 stars is mainly for this entree, I will definitely come back again for this piece of steak!
author: Eva L.

description: Great restaurant!!! Came here with a group of friends and we all thought this was a great pick. The staff was very accommodating and the food was very good. I would definitely recommend this place to any meat lovers.
author: R S.

description:
If I could give this place a BIG FAT GOOSE EGG, I would! The service here is HORRIBLE. Let me put it into perspective for you. This review is long over due. I ate at this place a couple years ago, and since have never returned nor have forgotten about how poor the service was. I've never been to a place that did the following all in one night: 

1) Lost our reservation and then blamed us for it. 
2) When clearing the tables the server pushed us aside to get the dishes or yelled at us to give our dishes to them, 
3) Rushed us to finish. 
4) Left a finger print on our dessert. 
5) Never asked if we need a second round of drinks. 
6) Tried to overcharge us $100 and when brought to their attention they took it off, but made it seem as they were doing us a favor. 

Do yourself a favor and DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. The food was MEDIOCRE, and the service will make you feel like you have been taken advantage off.  If I were you I would just skip the aggravation.
author: Jean L.

description:
DO NOT GO!!!!!!!

I was not impressed. Our waitress has told us that they are known for the steak and crab. I decided to get the surf and turf and it was a bad decision. My steak was not cooked to how I wanted it. The crab was dry and was sticking to the shell. The kraft mac and cheese taste a lot better than their mac and cheese. It tasted like old milk. You would think the waitress would have noticed that it was not like if we barely touched it. Lastly my sisters asked her steak to be medium and it was rare when she sent it back to get a little more cooked it came back burnt. It is not a kid friendly place and overall we were not happy DON'T go if you are a foodie.
author: J J.

description:
My husband and I showed up 15 minutes prior to our reservations and were seated immediately.  We instantly loved the decor.  It is set up to feel like a true "date" as you are separated into small booth areas and not a huge open room.  The staff was extremely friendly and service was very quick.
  I'm not sure how to even explain the food.  How about this....  ABSOLUTE HEAVEN!!  I have truly never had better food in my life!!  I am a huge fan of Ruth's Chris and never thought anyone could beat their steaks.  I was wrong!!  Both my husband and I had the petitie filet.  No knife was needed!  It was the tenderest meat I have ever tasted.  The flavor was perfection!!  We ordered two sides to share:  the twice baked potatoe (based on previous reviews) and the cauliflower.  Both dishes were excellent.  
Needless to say we will definitely return.  I have no doubt that all of their dishes are fabulous, but I plan on ordering the exact same meal.  Why mess with Heaven?
author: Marcy B.

description:
Went here last year with the wife on our trip to the bay area. 

Had a 7:30 PM reservation, but of course we were running late and did not even the hotel until 7:45 PM. Called them to let them know we are running late and they said it would not be a problem. Arrived there and was happy to find that it was free valet parking, always a plus. 

Went inside and we were immediately greeted and seated at our table. The wife ordered the Petit Filet and I ordered the Bone-In New York and of course we both order it med-rare and we decided to get the Portobello Mushrooms. 

The steaks came out and were cooked to perfection. As we sliced in and and we engulfed by the amazing aromas. Finally we took the first bites the steaks were beyond perfection! The flavor of the steaks were unbelievable. Then we finally tired the mushrooms and were blown away! The wife isn't usually a fan of portobello mushrooms, but these were to die for! 

Overall everything was great and can't wait until we're in the Bay Area again to go back!
author: Samir R.

description: I can't honestly say that I'm in love with this place or will recommend in the future.  I would like to let you know that if you're in love with the Garlic Roasted Crab flavor from restaurants like Crustaceans, then you probably won't enjoy this place. I ordered 2lb crab and it was more oily than anything.  There was no real garlic or parsley (another herb I was told it's seasoned it) taste to it at all.  My husband ordered the filet, and he enjoyed it a little, however he's a big lover of the rib eye which they don't carry, so his opinions about his entree weren't very praising either.  Medium Rare is how the steaks are served, and that's great because a lot of people enjoy them like that.  I'my opinion they did the cow now justice, I believe of you're going to slaughter an animal for profit then the dish should be mouth watering and justifiable!  Not the case with this piece of meat in my opinion.  The services is impeccable, the ambiance is very casual however.  No need to get dressed to the 9's as we did because it will truly be time wasted.  Bobo's has a great following and my review is strictly for informative purposes.  Not to bash or belittle an establishment that has achieved several accolades.
author: M. R.

description:
The place is nice & any were u sit will be equally enjoyed because the decor is very POSH! Nice, nice, nice place. The food is good, but takes too long to get done. We were 4 of less than a dozen people in the restaurant yet the food took forever... 

It was my GF's birthday & my friend asked to have a cake & candle brought to the table, but they brought out the dessert menu & forgot to bring her cake period. That honestly put a damper on the restaurant. 

Sorry there were not many guest, I would hate to come here when it is packed.


BTW I had the muscles which truly were tasty!
author: Bianca C.

description: I'm no steak connoisseur but this is now my new go to place in SF.  The steaks here go through a stringent dry age process and the prices are very reasonable.  There is free valet parking.  I would go back.
author: Laurence H.

description: Excellent Steak ...  Came here for our sons Birthday and it was perfect.Well cooked and extremely flavorful steak(had the bone in Filet) with amazing sides.I highly recommend the Brussel sprouts and Tomato salad.A little loud yes but great ambiance.
author: Carlos G.

description:
Dry aged steak cooked nice n rite(salt n butter). Sides aren't bad either. 

Enjoy the sleek, zany decor and solid cocktails help the air. 

It's def all about the meat tho. Normally cooked med-rare and can b a tad too salty(happened twice now so minus 1 star) but bone in New York or Filet is the way to go. 

A couple going with drinks, apps, dinner, dessert, rounds out about $200 or so. 

Easy curbside VALET parking, which is a blessing in SF........
author: Rafael N.

description: Brian is the best bartender!!!! And come on...bone in file minion? File m- die . Soooooo goooood. Such great service and atmosphere. Quaint, cozy & high end. If you're looking for your little hidden Jem your friends will be jealous of, come here.
author: Candice C.

description: Lovely place with a touch of new orleans flare.  They make filet mignon that melts in your mouth... like magic...
author: Anna Y.

description: So this is maybe my favorite restaurant ever.   I had my B-day here.  So much fun and the steak is amazing!  I love the over the top laid back atmosphere and the staff is great to put up with 14 drunks eating red meat.  Love it!
author: James D.

description: Sizzling, fresh, delicious.  We were able to "dine" without feeling rushed.  The meal started with a huge sizzling crab and mussels appetizer finished at the table with soy and white wine.  Oh, I could have stopped there and forever been happy! The appetizer was perfect foreplay leading into the main course. The steaks are prime and aged appropriately.  They are cooked to perfection.  Filet Mignon is served with bone in.  Who else does that?  Oh but they should.  The bone really enhances the flavor.  Great veggie sides.  The chocolate Bomb dessert was our favorite.  Atmosphere is warm and friendly.  Service was sophisticated and knowledgable.  Complete wine list.    The music helps to mask the sound of your neighbors but is soft enough to be able to speak comfortably.  We savored our meal from start to finish.
author: Nancy P.

description: The best steak i have ever had! I had the bone-in filet mignon (which, I'm told, sells out quickly, so thankful it was available!). The only (tiny) thing I'd change is the music selection, which didn't really fit the ambience.
author: Theresa B.

description:
What a great place. My bf and I went here last night for Valentines Day and we were not disappointed. We were seated upstairs which we had to ourselves for part of dinner so we had the chance to have some intimate time together. We both ordered the recommended bone-in filet medium rare. Now I have never had a bone in before so I was a newbie. We ordered two sides, Bermuda onion rings and Pancetta brussel sprouts to accompany our meat. They started us off with a loaf of delicious garlic olive bread. I was care not to indulge as to have room for the main course. Our steaks arrived with great timing. The smell was intoxicating and it looked like it would melt into the plate. I had my first bite and was in love. So flavorful and tender. They really dry aged these steaks. The onion rings with the steak together was even better. The spouts were excellent as well, a little stingy on the pancetta but still great. The bf cleaned his plate and I had a good 8oz wrapped to go. For the price it was perfect. Great service, food, complimentary valet (so awesome) and vibe made our night. We will definitely be back soon. 

Side note: steak reheated the next day still was perfect. Now that's what I call a piece of beef!!
author: Bri R.

description:
We needed a steak house around the Van Ness area of SF.  Did some yelp searches and settled on this one.

Got a last minute ressie thru opentable

free valet, yeah

no issues getting eated.

the place is like 4 separate small dining rooms staggered over 3-4 floors.  Creates more intimate space...but the decor is a bit cheesy and dated (venetian style w/ dates red walls, drapery, glass, and clown figures).   This is the main reason for minus 1 star.

server was well informed about the menu (which wasn't very large, just really a handful of appetizers, entrees, and sides...all ala carte...i won't hold this against them because they are a steak house.

didn't try the crab due to yelper's reviews to stick w/ the beef.

mussels appetizer was huge for a single $15 platter.  The shrimp was good too, but skin on was annoying.

the steaks were impeccably cooked...medium rare and medium porter houses.  This alone earns them 3 stars.

sides were all good...nothing great, tho I loved the sweet potatoes and the rest of the table was going on about the brussel sprouts.

twiced baked potato was meh (contrary to some yelper's)

good all around, but the decor and ambiance is totally old school steak house (think late 80's).  If they updated their decor so it didn't feel old, dark, and dingy...it would have been 5 stars.

price was reasonable for what you get...USDA Prime dry aged steaks cooks properly with great service and good sides.  Wish there was better marbling of the NY steaK side of the porterhouse...but the flavor and juicy-ness was still there.
author: Dank I.

description: Overpriced, consistently over-fried crab.  The filet is fine, but nothing special.  For the money there are many, many better alternatives in the city. Look elsewhere.
author: Chas J.

description:
Well Let me start off with my preconceived notions.  My Wife and I really love the "Crab House" and the "Dead Fish" that are part of this restaurants sister establishments with a very similar menu especially when it comes to the Crab.  

So we thought lets try out this place because they have steak too... Well we call and the hostess Rosemarie was very nice but let us know that it usually takes about a week in advance to get reservations.  So we thought well this place must be great!... right? 

Well a week later we pull up to awesome free valet parking and then walk in to get seated.  At this point we have all these built up expectations but instead of continuing to be wowed some more we got let down completely from there.  

We'll the server who I guess didn't understand English very well just pretty much did horrible at his job.  He hardly came to check on us and left the door open that let in an extremely cold draft in.  Since he hadn't been up in ten minutes I decided to close the door on my own.  Once he came back up he opened it right back up again instead of looking around or asking if anyone was cold.  However 5 minutes later they seat a party right next to the door and do what of course... close it!!!  My friends ordered beers and we tried to ask him for the same cold glass he had given me for my beer and all he did was reach over to the table next to him and pull the water glasses off of those??? Of course part of dinning is your servers personality and recommendations right... well this guy didn't really have either.  When we got the food it ended up being good but the steak was definitely not as good as Ruth Chris for the price they were charging.

So at the end of the day we realized we can say three things now.
1) We have been to Bobo's...   :-\
2) The food is pretty good but not "amazing" by any means.  
3) It is definitely not worth a weeks wait for the ambiance or price for anything on their menu except the Crab and were going to stick to the "Crab House" and the "Dead Fish" and wont be back to Bobo's.  

Sorry to everyone else who raved about this place but you all should really eat out more. Just because it looks like a really nice steak house with black napkins and wine glasses ready to go that doesn't mean other places with the same prices don't blow this one out of the water.

I hoped this helped someone???
author: Guillermo R.

description:
Went for the bone in filet and was not disappointed! This was one of the best steaks I have had in a while. My wife had the surf and turf, petit filet and crab - she really loved the crab and steak. But, if you want a big ol awesome steak, I suggest the bone in filet! 

I had heard good things about Bobo's steak but the rest of the experience also exceeded expectations. We had a great waitress so service was perfect. The sides and salad were also really good. The layout of the restaurant is a bit funky - laid out across multiple floors and little alcoves. We had a small table for two tucked away in what was practically a private little room. Great spot for a romantic dinner for two.
author: Bill M.

description: If you can arrange it, ask to sit on the upper floors and if you are lucky.. you will enjoy a fantastic cozy, romantic nook with a view. This place is perfect for a date night, except if you happen to get seated in the dungeon. They offer free valet service and their menu is a perfect steak lover's dream come true. An offering of assorted seafood is served on sizzling platters. The cocktails are smashing and the staff is knowledgeable and on point. I am always impressed whenever we dine here. Don't forget dessert!! The mousse cones were other worldly delicious.
author: Sara F.

description:
I took my BF here for his birthday and expected to spend about $250-$300 just by the looks of the menu.  It was a special occasion and he deserved it so fine by me. =)

We started off with their Lobster soup and my only complaint is that they didn't give us enough.  I would have ordered a 2nd helping but we also had crab cakes coming, and the main course.  I love meat and I love crab so I was torn to choose between the 2.  Bobo's surf and turf offers the best of both worlds.  Their crab was on par with Thanh Long, succulent and tender (not rubbery like some places).  The filet mignon was juicy and cooked to my liking.  The twice-baked potato and portobello mushrooms are a must try!

We devoured a delicious meal, had great service, and drank plenty of alcohol.  Although next time we'll bring our own bottle.  Cocktails, wine, and bubbly... it certainly added up.

-1 star for the creepy decor (clowns everywhere!!) and b/c I can't afford to dine here on a regular basis. =P  Other than that it was a wonderful experience and we recommend Boboquivari's to our friends and family. It's a bit pricey but worth every penny.  Great for special occasions whether it's a romantic evening or w/a group of friends.

We will surely return!
author: Nikki C.

description:
Best steak in San Francisco, and I mean that.  Better than Ruth's Chris and cheaper as well.  The bone in filet mignon is the only way to go.  I have tried the crab there, which is also good, but definitely overshadowed by the steak.  They sides seem kind of expensive when you are talking $8 for macaroni and cheese, but don't knock it till you try it!  Also good are the brussel sprouts and sweet potatoes.

This place seems to be somewhat of a San Francsico secret, I've never had a tough time getting reservations here.  While Ruth's Chris is very good, no complaints, Bobo's is better and cheaper.
author: Frank P.

description:
I went to Bobo's expecting just as good of an experience as Harris base on the reviews but the experience severely fell short.

Valet parking was prompt, courteous and best of all, free.  My friends and I arrived 30 minutes early but we were seated in few minutes.  The restaurant has a very cozy feel to it but I felt really cramped and stuffy but it passed as soon as we were seated.  The decor is very original.


On to the dinning.  Our waiter was attentive but seemed preoccupied of had something on her mind.  She was attentive in making sure our drink cups were filled but still seemed kind of off.  It gave my group a bit of an ackward feeling.  My friends and I proceeded to order our entrees and sides.  Here is where the explanation of the two star rating comes in:

We ordered the following items:

Petite Filet
Porterhouse (to share)
Portabello mushrooms
Onion Rings
Twice Baked Potato


When my friend received her petite filet, I remember thinking to myself that Hostess cupcakes are probably bigger than this, but hey, it's dry aged so it must taste friggin awesome if they're gonna charge $28 for it.  The porterhouse steak turned out to be the NY strip and petite filet cooked separately and served on the same plate.  I figure, makes sense, a porterhouse is two different cuts on the same bone.  That said, the steaks were cooked perfectly.  The problem was that they had absolutely no flavor.  Seriously, no flavor.   Don't get me wrong, they were tender, but if you think I was drunk, sick with a cold, or on crack at the time, I wasn't.  The sauce that was served with the steaks help, but didn't justify the hype or save the experience.  

On to the sides.  You normally can't go wrong with Portobello mushrooms and this time was no exception.  I did, however, wish they didn't cut it up into half inch chunks.  The sauce on top was a bit too lemony.  Onion rings - served with aioli.  They weren't anything special.  Worst off, I paid $8 for five small pieces (nowhere near the size of Ruth's Chris onion rings which are the size of donuts).  Lastly, on to the baked potato.  This was awesome.  Creamy/chunky/cheesy.  Order it if you go.  Period.

We glanced over the deserts but nothing appealed to us and we ended up going to Byrite Creamery instead.

All in all, I was seriously disappointed but not enough to give this place a 1 star.  Not my preferred way to spend almost $200 bucks and believe it or not, we were in and out in about an hour and twenty minutes.  I've been to McDonalds were I've stayed longer.  If I had a chance to do it over, I think I would have opted for spending $30 for the three of us at Sizzler instead but hindsight is 20/20.....  Maybe I should've ordered the crab?  Don't know.  I won't be coming back unless it's on someone else's tab.  If you're looking for steaks, Harris or Ruth's Chris are your best bets.  Harris being smaller portion/more flavor.  Ruth Chris being larger portions/slightly less flavorful but still a great experience.
author: Tang K.

description: I really want to give this place 4 1/2 stars.  I can't quite give 5 stars, because it's not the best steak I've ever, but that being said, my filet mignon was absolutely delicious: juicy, tender, cooked perfectly.  The bread (with baked in butter and garlic), dungeness crab, twice baked potato, and panna cotta They have free valet parking, which is a plus.  I liked the decor a lot.  It is a bit cramped, but they do a good job with the space they have.  The service deserves 5 stars: I took my dad there, who uses a walker.  They all went out of their way to help us out: getting us to the elevator, holding the doors, bringing our food extra fast, not rushing us even though we were late.  It was a really great dining experience.
author: JJ M.

description:
We were seated right away for our 6:45 pm reservation. Party of 2. 
I believe this restaurant has ?3 levels of dining area, small spaces between other tables/chairs. Not recommended for claustrophobic. Very interesting dimmed-light  interior. Small bar area in the first floor. 

Appetizer:
iron skillet-roasted mussels: so good and buttery, him and I finished the whole thing. 

Entrees:
petit filet mignon - whoa, they weren't kidding when they said "petit", it was good, but not great, a little on the salty side
bone-in filet - WOW! that's all I have to say

Sides:
twice baked potato - very flavorful
onion rings - nothing special
*the portions were a little bit on the smaller side

Service: excellent, our server was visible at all times, which was kind of awkward at time.

Complimentary valet parking! 

Overall experience: good service and ambiance, but menu options are a bit limited
author: Tink B.

description: Mmmmmmm bone in petite filet cooked PERFECTLY! Sides were great too. Very tasty mac and cheese! Brussel sprouts were good as well..we went there on a very busy night and still had amazing service! This place is a hidden gem! I prolly drove hy 100 times and never knew about it...Cant wait to go back
author: Tru D.

description: This was my 2nd time here, 1st was on New Years eve a couple years back and Ive had the Bone in Rib eye both times so that's all I can review besides the service.  I have to say one of the Best steaks I've ever had.  The service has always been great.
author: Michael S.

description:
A STEAKHOUSE EVERY WEEK IN MAY....
#1 Title: A Rainy Evening 

COULDY SKIES:  Started with the crab cakes 2 @ ($14).  A little bigger than a silver dollar and encrusted with breading.  They were alright, even better with the cranberry served with them.  Paired with glass of Savignon Blanc. ($9)

Limited wines by the glass, but affordable choices for bottles.

IT STARTED TO SPRINKLE:  I ordered, without hesitation, the New York Strip bone-in, Medium rare. ($39)  It was brought, rare, blue at that.....had to send it back....darn it!  I'm used to this practice at Morton's...

Cooking a steak properly is the most essential thing at a steakhouse. (duh) Everything else is secondary.  They failed at this.  Putting a great cut back onto the grill, no longer makes it a great cut and devalues it too.

Brought it back.  It was fine...a little tough and dry.  But excellent taste, the closer the meat was to the bone.  

Paired it with a lovely Merlot, ($9) gave the server a choice between the Merlot and Zinfadel, but she said, they were OUT of the Zinfadel. How could they be out  of it on a Friday night?  Hm...

IT'S FINALLY RAINING:  So, for dessert I ordered the Italian Cheesecake.  Very sweet, and good.  The top was a layer of strawberry cream cheese, the middle was regular cream cheese inbetween white cake.  Like a strawberry tiramisu without the rum.  ($8)

Finished with a Reisling dessert wine -lovely.

COST OF UMBRELLA: $101.  Wow.  

THEY LADY HOLDING MY UMBRELLA: Service was great.  She was very friendly, charming and very helpful, even when the others tried to take my half-eaten steak, thinking I was done, as well as reasurring me my payment was fine when another server was confused with my OpenTable dollars.

MY SHELTER:  Small rooms.  Could be claustrapobic, but nice if you want the evening to be intimate. Kind-of an all over restaurant, not sure what it's trying to look like...Small.  Had a table in the bar area, over looking Lombard, but the table was incredibly small, at least if two were dining.

All in all, I have 4 more steakhouses to go to finish my project.  So far....well....at **2-1/2 **stars....I'll see what's next.....
author: Jackie M.

description: bone in filet is the best i have ever had, crab and mussels are great too.
author: Robert C.

description:
Great place to eat complimentary bread great must try the muscles I will give it a 5 star steak 4.5 service 5 I will recommend this place.

Love the complimentary valet parking as well. 

Def will go back ^_^
author: April M.

description:
Service was amazing.
Ordered the surf and turf. Was VERY underwhelmed with my dish. Far better places in the city for steak and crab.
Wont be coming back.
Disappointed.
author: M L.

description:
Bobo's is exactly what I want in a steakhouse. Great cocktails, easy going service, a menu centered around meat, a long list of fattening sides you can pick and choose from, and quirky borderline freaky decor. I think they call it "venetian". That's one way to say it.

A group of my nearest and dearest and I set up a date between ourselves and plates of beef to celebrate the birth of baby Jesus. I liked that the place was relatively full, even on Christmas. Guess we weren't the only ones hoping for a less traditional dining option on December 25th. We arrived early and grabbed a cocktail. I snagged and gulped a terrific blueberry margarita. 

The tables are set up in various offshoots of rooms, so each dining experience is unique and intimate but not isolating. We sat in front of a fireplace surrounded by diamond patterned wall coverings with a large clown-friend guarding the entrance to the room. I only wish there was a tight-rope walker.

We sat down, ordered way too much food, and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Lots of petite filets, some bone-in NY strips, a few orders of crab, twiced baked potatoes, chard, iceberg wedges with blue cheese, some with walnuts and berries, bruschetta with fresh burrata cheese and tomatoes, and lots of onion rings. In my opinion, the NY strip and the twice baked potato are the must-haves. I'd skip the bruschetta, 'cause the house-baked bread they give you before your meal is delicious and hearty enough. 

All in all, so worth facing your fear of clowns.
author: Sarah M.

description: The new york steak was far from tender. Ok taste. When we had finished the first bottle of wine, we ordered a second one from the waitress. When we FINALLY got the wine, we were pretty much done with dinner. If you want to be fancy by having a sommelier, then he better deliver. Otherwise, just have the waitress pick up the wine and serve it before we finish our  steaks.. The place was only half  full, how hard can it be to serve a bottle of wine? We're locals and wanted to try this place as we normally go to Izzys. This place is not better but twice as expensive. Seems like they cater more to tourists.
author: Peter J.

description:
I was very disappointed with my recent visit to Bobo's and kinda surprised with the 4 stars it has.  Maybe it's a tourist trap?

From start to finish it was a less than mediocre experience especially considering the amount we payed.

We were a party of four with reservations pretty early in the evening. They put us in the front of the restaurant in a booth with a view of traffic and the motel across the way. Ick! The ambience was similar to a Denny's.

Maybe the server was new because she seemed a little nervous which is ok but she was overly attentive and throughout the meal stood nearby polishing water glasses. It was distracting and at one point she joined in our conversation. Also, we felt rushed when the restaurant wasn't busy at all.

I have to give the cocktails a B. Good selection and pretty tasty. I had the basil martini and my table companions had the mojito which I tasted and loved.

We had the combo appetizer which was a large sizzling hot skillet filled with mussels, shrimp and crab. It was mostly mussels and had a few overcooked and soaking in oil shrimps. The crab consisted of two flimsy legs. Not worth the $39.

Now the bread is awesome. They bring out this mini loaf with little chopped up pieces of olive and garlic and then drizzle the whole loaf with olive oil. Pretty tasty except our loaf was a little dry like day old bread, not so fresh.

I was not impressed with their steaks at all.  First, poor selection, they only have New York, Petite Filet and Porterhouse which is a combo of both.  They claim their steaks are aged 4-6 weeks. Everyone had the New York which I think was $39 per steak. The steak was very fatty and where there was meat tough and lacked flavor.  I had the Petite. First, I ordered medium and got well done.  Second go round landed me a small piece of meat looking like seared ahi tuna in the middle, raw. I didn't eat it.  For a steak house and for a $29 piece of meat I was surprised they couldn't get this basic order done right.

With those prices and quality you have to then fork over another $8 to $9 for sides which were good enough except our server over charged us two things we didn't order or get.  I didn't catch this until it was too late.

I won't be going back to Bobo's.
author: Jen H.

description: Always a 5 star meal and dining experience here. Do yourself a favor and get the bone-in filet, with a few sides like the swiss chard or the potatoes. MM MM MM
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description:
I not one to Yelp a restaurant, not my thing...But I was at Bobos last night and just want to support the staff on the incredible job they are doing!  The food and the Service is 5 stars.  It was very busy and very loud in the bar area...due to a group of competetive loud English men...these guys were big and taking up the bulk of the bar...but the hostesses are really good at what they do even though it was a bit of a long wait for our reservation. 

We were seated on the first floor and our pretty blond Server was a pro!  Very knowledgeable and truly commanding her space.  I was impressed with the food and the atmosphere -for a steak house the $100-$150 per person was definitely worth it because of the quality and experience being genuine. I was first struck by the smiles from everyone when we walked in and I got the feeling that it was a great place to be.

That being said, I did overhear a table behind me giving the hostess a very hard time for no real reason other than the fact that they knew they could...I could hear them saying they owned a restaurant and that they were going to yelp because they spent $500 and accusing her of something that she was not doing.  She was being very kind smiling and apologizing but this party was being rude for no reason.

I just think that these gals have a really tough job trying to make everyone who is hungry and wants to be seated happy.  As a man who enjoys a good Steak and service, I don't like to see others who are enjoying it to, thinking that because they can pay for it, they are entitled to treat the service badly  I am yelping because I heard those people mention yelp to this little lady who was quite humble in the midst of their storm - and I don't like anyone bullying someone with technology when they have the means to spend $500 on a meal, and this poor girl is just trying to do her job well.  I found out later that those people were there for almost 4 hours which they obviously felt they were entitled to the real estate even though the place was packed with people looking forward to sitting down.  The pretty hostess with a great smile did a great job and Bobos is the best Steakhouse in the area!  Hats off to them and definitely worth the wait!
author: James F.

description: I brought my husband here for his birthday. We had steak, mussels and shrimp. Passed on the crab, although it looked extremely delicious on everyone else's table. We both thoroughly enjoyed the food. And to add on to it, Wendy Williams was dining there at the same time. Didn't want to intrude for an autograph or picture lol. Good enough for celebrities, so it must be worth trying, right?! =)
author: Rachel C.

description: Bone-in Filet Mignon... My goodness that was delicious! The steaks were perfectly cooked and the flavor was to die for. Not only were the steaks great, but the sides were amazing too (especially the sweet potato!). The whole experience lead to a great dinner. Its a bit expensive, but definitely worth it!
author: Delaney L.

description:
3.5 stars
Very cute spot, great atmosphere.

I've only sat at the bar and eaten their appetizers, so im judging based on that alone. -- One was better than the other. I definitely recommend the burratta, mussels and the tuna carpacio mmmm so good. 

The staff is friendly and the place definitely has a locals spot feel.
I hear the steak is really good, so i'll be back to try that soon!

They have complimentary valet, which is nice, but parking is pretty easy to find.
author: Shadi N.

description: The best surf and turf I have experienced in San Francisco. Their filets are always superb and their crab is excellent. We always start with the seafood appetizer sizzling platter - it comes out steaming and is soaked in butter and salt. I then try to find room in my stomach for their petite filet with a few sides - their mac and cheese, onion rings, swiss chard, mushroom sides are all great. Go in a group so you can sample many! Their chocolate cone/caps are delicious for dessert. I think it's a dark chocolate mousse. We tend to go 1-2 times a year and it's always good!
author: Shannon W.

description: Great steaks, and they had the best double baked potato I've ever had.
author: Andrew B.

description: Another masterpiece on a plate. I recommend with friends date etc... food is SF priced so $50 a person for a meal is common but the steaks are good , prepared perfect and the bar area is great..... Good stop for Steak in SF and the complementary Valet is another reason to go.... spend your money on food not parking your car
author: Sam B.

description:
Anywhere that serves a bone-in filet mignon, I'm a huge fan of.  So it definitely didn't take much for me to like this place.  It also doesn't hurt that their steak was, indeed, super delicious either!

This was recommended to us by a friend who raved about how awesome the steak he had there was.  I've been on Lombard street so many times, but honestly never really noticed Bobo's.  Only did we decided to look this place up online and saw a picture of the outside did it dawn on me that I've driven by it so many times!

We, of course, got the bone-in filet mignon and it was all it was hyped up to be.  Cooked perfectly to my desired doneness, it was super tasty.  We had the twice-baked potato and sauteed cauliflower as sides and they were good too.  
They have a nice bar too.  It was hopping on the night we dined there - mostly business people after work.  They were super amusing though.  There's nothing better than a bunch of business people unwinding after work, drinking and loudly cracking jokes.  I don't think I've spent so much time at dinner laughing at the random stuff people were talking about the table over.

Only thing that took some getting used to was the decor, as many other reviewers have mentioned.  But whatever, for the bone-in filet, I can ignore it!
author: Crys L.

description: I had the Bone-in Petite Filet and my boyfriend got the Bone-in Filet, both awesome.  They come medium rare which was perfect, medium would have been over done.  $15 corkage was a bonus so we brought a bottle.  Would definitely go back!
author: M C.

description: Went there on my bday and it was one of the best steaks I ever had.  The bone in filet was perfect.  Even reheated the next day it was excellent.  We had a brussel sprount appetizer which I loved.  We only sat downstairs so I don't know what the rest of the restaurant looked like but the downstairs was interesting.  Kind of a "New Orleansy Circus" vibe.  Our drinks were expensive but I had a blood orange marg that was so yummy.  It's a pricey steakhouse but it's worth it.
author: Rose R.

description: Came here for my anniversary and was not impressed by the decor at all! The walls are a weird red and it was dim and not my style for a steakhouse. We were cramped in a little corner by the entrance (maybe since it was for two) and was not very cozy. Complimentary valet was a plus. We ordered the bone-in New York and the half crab and filet mignon which were both very good. I could not stop eating up every last scrap of the crab. When it comes to the appetizer and side let me tell you to just pass. Crab cakes (only two) for $15 was not worth it at all (i have had better) and we also ordered the twice baked potato for $9 lets just say this is only one piece of half a narrow potato and it was dry and small and very disappointing. The main meals were delicious but for the overall experience I will probably not be back.
author: Nancy F.

description: Steak. it should be dry aged, cooked to perfection, and not be ruined with crappy Asian inspired sauces on it. (cough, Alexanders, 5A5)  The NY bone-in and bone-in fillet accomplish that. Cooked perfect, tasted great. Would have gotten 5 stars if the sides were more "wow". Lobster Crostini was just meh. Free Valet is a nice touch, as well as the friendly attentive service.
author: James L.

description: Best filet mignon in SF. Twice baked tater a must and my second favorite side is the brussel sprouts.
author: Everette R.

description: Can't beat the sizzling seafood platter with clams and crab and the sauces taste like heaven :) It's even more rare that they also serve great steak! The setting is quite intimate too if you can get a table inside spots with curtains.
author: Cindy B.

description: Boboquivari was very accommodating for my yearly xmas secret santa event with my girlfriends. They have seated us all in a separate cozy dinning area and the service was great. Had the bone-in filet and it was so tender. Everyone else seem to be pretty pleased with their entree. Towards the end of the night, the waiter helped us take a couple group pixs. I know having 12 girls at one place can get a little crazy and loud so i really appreciate the service and the patience from the staffs. I will be back!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Mmm decicded to check out this place as it's highly recommended for steak. If you are looking for a great steak and have hit up the other places, say second helpings House of Prime Rib, you won't be disappointed. Though House of Prime Rib would be my first pick.

We celebrated a birthday there, and made reservations. Upon arriving we were promptly greeted but left to stand, well, just there. In the middle of everything. Right where servers need to exit the kitchen, right where new guests needed to enter, and right where the bar and service staff grab drinks. So it's a small entrance. Once seated, we scored a nice oversized booth, perfect for a celebratory, steak coma lounge.

Food was amazing, the bone in Filet Mignon is like butter and so flavorful, and I know, you are thinking there are NO bones in filet mignon, but you'd be wrong my friend. In any case ,they serve it on the rare side, which fine by me, but it's ridiculously thick, so if you are squimish about blood and rare meat, bump up the doneness. We also enjoyed many of the apps (salads, tuna tartare and a tomato salad, all to rave reviews) and ordered 3 sides to share. Twice baked potato (tad salty), mac and cheese (too "crispy" that the noodles were dry) and the brussel sprouts (too rich but very tasty). For 4 of us, we barely put a dent in the 3 sides, so I'd recommend 2 sides for 4 people, but the sides are not as impressive as that buttery steak goodness!

Service was polite and not intrusive. Good timing and allowed us to enjoy our evening... BUT I speak servernese. Having served for 4 years in a steakhouse, and spent 8 years in the industry and trained over 1,000 national restaurant staff (FOH and BOH) I know when I'm getting the one over, eye roll from the server. Which we did. Big time. Once she asked if we had dined with them, that's when the eyeroll started. And from that point on she never redeemed herself. She was pleasant yes, but a tad cold, and lacked personality. Shame because she was pretty, and knowledgeable about the food. Though, not so much on the restaurant. I had inquired on the restaurant's history and the decorated room, we got a "well I'm sure this room existed before the restaurant opened" speil. Ah ok, pretty for sure. 

Anyways, as the evening winded down, and after coffee and dessert (I mean her eye roll was because thought we were cheap, bad tippers, or annoyed to serve us altogether) she then realized we were celebrating a birthday (aside from gifts at the table and the cheers "it's your birthday" toast) I guess the hostess forgot to point that out to her. I'll never know for sure what they do for birthdays, but I hope friendlier staff makes it on the list, because that would have made the dinner even better.

Enjoy and knock yourself out. Literally.
author: Sara G.

description: Love Love Love this place. I have never had a bad meal. From appetizers to main courses to desserts. This place is my must visit spot at least every couple months. Valet parking makes it easy access. Bartender that is usually there is very cool and pours a good drink. I have never had bad service and have never felt rushed when I am there. Would recommend this place to anyone.. Have to try the mac and cheese!!
author: Jen W.

description: I've experienced a fair share of good steakhouses in the past, but for the price, this place was just okay. My boyfriend and I ordered the yellowtail carpaccio to share. It had way too much ponzu sauce which completely masked the taste of the fish -- what a disappointment. For the entree, I got the signature bone-in filet and the boyfriend got the surf and turf. The filet mignon was good,  but I ordered it medium-rare and got it more rare than I would've liked. And compared to the bone-in filet at Mastro's Steakhouse in Beverly Hills, it just doesn't do it. Tried the crab and it was good, but nothing to write home about..
author: Cathy C.

description:
Two words:  FU^KING AWESOME

I really don't know what else to say.  We showed up with our 2 yr old in-tow and the serving staff could have been rude, but they weren't, if anything they were even more accommodating.

Can't wait to go back.

By the way, if you don't get the bone in filet, you have to ask yourself, why am I even here!!

Well worth the price!
author: Craig S.

description:
Ok so I was in San Francisco memorial weekend and decided to stop by this restaurant due to a review posted in a magazine. This place sits in a nice trendy spot in the Marina area with plenty of bars and lounges within walking distance. 

I had made my reservations online and had no problem being seated when I arrived there. It was suggested to me to indulge in the the Costini Con Burrata witht the dungeness crab and smoked salmon. The appetizer was fantastic, much like a harmony of foods that melted in your mouth. Since I am not a huge wine drinker I asked the waitress for her help. She recommended a great wine to go with the went well as a starter, during the meal and during the dessert. The wine was in the 29 a bottle range.

As for my meal I had the bone in filet mignon and it was done medium. The steak is dry aged and is soooooo good. The waitress told me it was a little red towards the bone but I loved it that way. 

For dessert I had the four chocolate mousse cones which where a perfect light dessert to follow a hearty meal. Overall I ended up spending about $210 including tip. So It is not an everyday meal place but is definitely worth the time to eat here. I was planning on going to Harris another steak house in SF but tried this and I am glad I did.
author: AARON A.

description:
A friend had a b-day party here, and after checking out the website, and more importantly, the fact that that it had a solid 4-star rating of nearly 500 reviews on Yelp, I had to go and check this place out.

I love steak, but unfortunately, due to allergies, can't eat crab.  Most of the people at the table had the surf and turf which looked really good, but since I couldn't partake in that kind of a feast, I went with the bone-in NY Steak.  

The waitress told us that they are one of the only restaurants that serves a bone-in filet, and I did want to try that, however, being that I was sharing the steak with a friend, I thought that the filet might have been too small.

We also ordered up some sides:  mashed yams, mac n cheese, mushrooms which were all good, but the steak was definitely the main star of the meal.  My date ordered a lobster soup that looked really good, and smelled really good, but since I am allergic to crustaceans, I couldn't try any of that either... 

The atmosphere of the place reminds me a little of the Old Spaghetti Factory in downtown SJ, and it was a bit cramped in there, but then again, we're in SF, so it was a bit to be expected for me.

The ambiance of the place was pretty nice, though, reading through other reviews, I can see how people might think it feels a little creepy in there... Kind of had that Winchester Mystery House feel to it.  

So the funny story for this trip was about the group of people sitting next to us.  There was this one FOB who every once in a while would get carried away and make these loud laughs or something, and it made me laugh everytime because then he would start trying to use curse words, but it didn't come out quite right... well, at least he was trying, and he is a foreigner, so can't give him too hard a time for not knowing how to swear...
author: Michael C.

description:
Came here on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving with a party of 8 for a celebration and was seated on the 3rd floor. I feel like Bobo's is a bit of an inbetweener steak joint, between something low-end like Black Angus to something high-end like Ruth's Chris. The lighting isn't as dim, the decor isn't as formal, and the service isn't casual but isn't snobby either. The problem, however, is that it's priced like a high-end steakhouse. Also, their steak selection isn't as varied as dedicated steakhouses. Granted they do specialize in crab as well, so that is an option. Looking back, no one in the party actually got the crab, which is kind of a regret as I would have liked to try that. Anyway, onto the food:

Appetizers:
- Crispy Crab Cakes: Pretty good, but only come in pairs of normal smallish size servings
- Lobster Crostini: What little bits of lobster were good, but once again small.
- Heirloom Toy Box Tomatoes: My favorite appetizer. Amazing how good well seasoned fresh vegetables can taste

Bread:
- Very interesting and different. Not too heavy in butter.

Entree: 
- New York Bone-in: maybe a 16oz. Pretty good.
- Filet Mignon: Choice of regular or bone-in. It seems everyone who got the bone-in, the meat portion was slightly bigger than the non-bone version, even though they cost the same. I didn't actually try any so I can't say if there was a significant difference in taste. Apparently, the bone-in version is not always available either. Wouldn't advise getting the petite unless you really want a light meat portion, I think they said 6 oz.

Sides:
- Twice Baked Potato: TINY! It's like half a potato. Taste was decent, but couldn't get over the portion size.
- Brussels Sprouts: cooked well, and bacon makes everything taste better.
- Macaroni and Cheese: nice and cheesy, albiet a bit plain.
- Portebello Mushrooms: my favorite accompaniment to steak. 

Dessert:
We got 3 desserts, that I can't specifically remember, but the chocolate cake one stood out as the favorite for most people. I also enjoyed the custard/flan type dessert as well. 

Corkage: $15/bottle - no limit that I'm aware of.

Parking: Free valet! Definite plus in SF.
author: Jonathan H.

description: This is by far the best restaurant that I have been to! Fantastic streaks, yummy twice baked potatoes & modern Mac & Cheese...everything was perfect!
author: Christi B.

description: The most amazing food!! Best piece of meat I've ever eaten. The decor was slightly odd but the food makes it so worth it!!!! Intimate place to eat.
author: S H.

description:
We had reservations for Saturday night (5/21) for 645. We showed up early expecting to have a drink, but were seated right away.  But it took the waiter almost 45 mins to get our food orders.  
The food was good, I do wish my steak was cook a little more as I ordered, but since I had to wait so long for it, I didnt want to send it back.  The waiter was horrible!!!
I will not return.
author: Matt W.

description:
Bone in filet mignon!  Seriously great flavor and when asked to be cooked medium rare, it was PERFECT.

The onion rings and shrimp scampi we got for appetizer were just okay, nothing special.

Service was nice, the place is a little dark and the seating feels a little weird and outdated.

Next time I come back here, it will be the bone in filet & some potatoes.  That's IT!!!
author: Bill Z.

description:
BoBo's is known for their steaks, but let me just make one thing clear:  

"Their MUSSELS are super fresh and oh so juicy and succulent."  

Honestly , I only give them their stars just for that.  The place itself is not all it's hyped up to be.  Their interior lacks personality and looks kinda dingy.  The space inside is very tiny and limited, not at all personal.  Our table was literally so close to the next that we can hear their whole conversation.  So minus one star for the interior design. 

We ordered the Crab and Mussels for two.  The crab was a bit dry and it wasn't up to par.  However the mussels made up for everything else.  The order was suspended in mid air and the portion was quite generous.  Three butter dips helped compliment the dish.  

We also ordered the Petit Filet Mignon for me and Filet Mignon Bone In steak for the bf.  Honestly I don't quite remember the steak much because the flavor and taste of the mussels still lingered on my taste buds.  But they were pretty good.  We ordered the mushroom as a side dish, which went pretty well with the meal. 

I thought it was a some what alright experience. I think I expected a lot more for the price.
author: tammy c.

description: Had steak dinner here tonight and it was good. I love the atmosphere and the food was tasteful. The bone in New york steak was really really awesome, juicy, had it medium rare. Service was very slow but it was OK because it's saturday and the restaurant is busy, I could understand.
author: Suabot J.

description:
ahhhhh.. i wanted to like this place sO bad! 

i'd been passing this establishment for years wanting to try them.. and i was sO disappointed! =(

-we started with the crab.. (i dont think it was fresh, the taste was ok)
-i LOVE fish, so i HAD to have the hamachi carpaccio... (again, it was only ok. it was marinated in like a shoyu.... some time of soy sauce.. really nothing special)
-we both had the bone in rib-eye. (again only OK. it was Not bursting with flavor... -_-)

-for our sides (and you have to order them all separately, nothing comes with the steak) we ordered the 

-portabello mushrooms were pretty good..  and the brussel sprouts {which i must say, were freAkn amazing.. UNTIL i found  a freAkn hair in it! ugh!)


the drinks are realllly good.. 
i thought the servers could have been a little more attentive... 
*(oh shit. let me not forget to mention. that the fkn waiter scraped the crumbs from the table onto my dress! WTF)
the valet guy was really nice.. (if thats any conciliation. lol)


needless to say; i will NOT be back..
author: Lisa N.

description:
3.5 - 4

Boboquivari's would be a solid 4, but they fall short because while I was eating (and thoroughly enjoying) a side of portobello mushrooms, I bit into a sharp plasticky object, which stuck itself inside my gums.  Apparently, I chew aggressively.  Anyhow, I took the ufo (unidentified food object) out of my mouth to examine it and it felt and looked like a small piece of plastic.  I couldn't see since the restaurant is so inadequately lit, but from the light of my cell phone saw that it could possibly be a piece of crab shell.  I brought this to the attention of our waitress and she took the mushrooms away!
