It was still half full and I wanted to eat them because they were SO good :(  Granted, she comped the mushrooms, but didn't come back with a new side.  Sigh... there goes one of the best parts of the meal.  In addition to the mushrooms, a side of swiss chard was ordered and I don't think I'm a fan.  I don't have much experience with swiss chard and to those who like it, I'm sure you would enjoy this side, but it just was a little too bitter for my liking.  

Also, I had reservations for two and we were seated at the smallest table imaginable.  Yet I could see other couples hogging up roomy booths... what's up with that? 

Oh, Bobo... Your service is lacking just a bit, your restaurant is too dimly lit, and your tables for two too claustrophobic.  On the upside, your bread is beyond delicious, and you make delectably juicy steaks and some of the best mushrooms I've ever had, so I'll probably be back one day...
author: Peggy L.

description:
So I'd heard this was a great place for a bachelors party. At least for the starting point for a bachelor's party....

The atmosphere for that type of event leaves just a little to be desired. The downstairs bar area was pretty cool and lively but the decor was similar to Grandma's living room. 

In any event Bobo's passes two basic tests for a chop house. 

1. The martinis are excellent (and Archie can attest to that because he had four) and 
2. the steak was superb! I've dined at the some of the top steakhouses in Dallas and this is up there with them, if not better.

Everyone has written about the bone in fillet so I can't add much more other than to say, "get it"  Don't get the petite one either, you'll feel inadequate. 

Finally, the seafood platter is worth coming back for by itself. The crab legs were the highlight. This alone makes it better than any place in Dallas
author: Skip F.

description: Took my hubby for his BDay and we loved it! Shared the seafood platter and a steak. It was divine and we were super full!
author: Madelyn Y.

description:
Great place for a date or dinner with Dad.  Strange how those things are completely opposite, but how the atmosphere and food lends so dramatically to either.

This is a very dark, traditional restaurant.  There are two floors and a great bar area where the martinis are abundant and delicious.  Try the basil martini.  The upstairs area has cozy booths which are perfect for a date.  The filet here is superb, as is the seafood platter.  This review is making me hungry so I better not write more.
author: apple r.

description:
My brother, his gf, and I went here for my bro's bday.  What a celebration it was!  A food celebration that is! 

LOCATION: Lombard is classic.  Parking sucks HOWEVER they have valet which is A-plus in my book.  
TABLE LOCATION: We sat upstairs which is great.  There are probably 10-15 table/booths up there.  There's a window looking down on Lombard.  And a balcony!  
MEAL: Fabulous!  We had the garlic crab for an "appetizer".  (Don't judge our moment of gluttany - we were celebrating!)  The crab was average.  I wasn't impressed.  For mealtime, I had T-bone medium rare which was to die for.  YUM!  We shared sides.  I recommend the twice-baked potato. 

TO DIE FOR:  GARLIC BREAD.  I'd come back to Bobo's just for their bread!
author: Deanna A.

description:
Ate here with my Mom, Aunt and Uncle.  Food was delicious.  I had the crab, Uncle and Mom shared the crab and steak and Aunt had some light appetizers - including delicious crab cakes.  Appetizers are definitely on the small side in terms of actual amount of food, but taste was delicious.

The steaks were of course delicious, the crab was fun to eat (and difficult as always) and the side dishes were also very delicious.  Interior decorations were not my style, but fitting for the area.

Also, a big plus if you are a drinker, their drinks hit HARD.  You will definitely get your value out of your drink if your bartender is anything like the one we had.  Yes, it takes away from the taste of the drink a bit (because some sound amazing), but it does make for a fun night.

Although not my favorite SF steak or food place, this is definitely worth your time.
author: Bryce G.

description:
I had a great experience here! Four of us waited at the bar and ordered a few cocktails before we were seated. They started us off with some nice warm bread. Mmmm...I love carbs! Next, we ordered an appetizer plate of mussels which were excellent. For our entrees we had crab...crab...crab...and filet mignon!! So buttery and so sinful! We also had a side order of swiss chard (not that great)...but the beet salad was good and so was the baked yams.

The decor is a bit odd too but that won't stop me from going back!!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Bobo's is my boyfriend's favorite place to have a steak in the city. He's the biggest meat snob I know so "favorite" already set really high expectations. Definitely met. It's heaven!

He was feeling fancy last night so took me to Bobo's for my first time. We both had the bone-in filet mignon -- which was fantastic. Probably top 3 steaks I've ever had in my life! To start, we had the beet salad. To share, we had the baked yam and swiss chard. I loved the baked yam for it's creamy texture and semi-sweet taste. My boyfriend liked the swiss chard for it's tanginess. Oh, I can't forget to mention my amazing moscow mojito. It's heaven!

Service is pretty good, the space is cute, and amazing food. Check it out!
author: Han C.

description: Four of us went to Bobo's for my birthday. It was our first visit and the night started out nice at the bar. The drinks were excellent. The food is good and the astral is quite good but the service was not good at all. Our server barely took any time at our table. It was noted in the reservation and the hostess that it was my birthday (and my friend's who was with us) but there was nothing extra for our birthday. We were disappointed. We all agreed that we have had a MUCH better experience at Harris' and will not be returning here again because of the poor service. My wife and I don't get out often due to child care so we had high hopes for the time out and the money spent.... That did not happen
author: David M.

description: I was quite disappointed in the quality of food we chose when dining at Bobo's. After reading the many positive reviews, I would have to strongly disagree that this is an exceptional steakhouse. Having eaten at several high profile steakhouses, I would not consider Bobo's to be in the same caliber. This has nothing to do with decor or service which in my opinion were also nothing special. Our party of 4 ordered the sauteed shrimp appetizer which should have been our clue re the caliber of food we would experience. I was completely astonished that the shrimp skillet arrived with what are considered small size shrimp when ordering in bulk as well as still had their shells in tact and literally saturated in butter with little flavor. We also ordered several starters and side dishes and all were lack luster at best. As for the entree's, the steaks were not cooked with any consistency among the four ordered. Only one was ordered medium rare and was literally raw at the center. What made the experience even more disappointing was the price paid for such a mediocre meal. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant unless one had no other options for dinner. The best part of the evening was the free valet parking. There are too many fabulous options in the bay area for a great steak. From hole in the wall, off the beaten path establishments that you either stumble upon or experience thru word of mouth, to higher profile and acclaimed restaurants. Do your homework so you are not disappointed or left feeling monetarily cheated.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday dinner about two weeks ago.  We had reservations for 8:30pm, but had to wait for an hour (a lil over actually!) before we were seated.  There really isn't a good place to wait while inside since the bar is in the middle and we didn't want to buy drinks... It was also cold outside, so that wasn't an option unless we wanted to get sick. Anyways, they kept telling us our table would be ready soon, blah blah blah, and had to keep moving out of people's way... Ugh. Turns out, the people who had our booth were taking their sweet time before leaving, which is fine, except they (bobo's staff) could have told us instead of making us wait thinking it was their fault.

Now, onto the food!

Their bread is delicious!!!! I wish they gave more. haha. I got the double shrimp and crab.  It was SO GOOD.  I've eaten the crab and stinking rose and dead fish, and for some reason, this crab was the best of all three!!!!! The shrimp was good too, but I could have easily just eaten the crab and been satisfied.  They give a lot of shrimp (normal size, not prawn size!) probably about 20 pieces and I definitely had to share... I think we had 2 pieces left over because everyone was stuffed. Everyone enjoyed their meals (most got the surf and turf which came with half crab and prime rib...) For dessert we opted for the mini cones w/ chocolate mousse (yummy, but I think I could have done without it... not anything spectacular... haha) and the blood orange sorbet... that was so-so... a little bitter for my taste.

All in all, a great meal.  The atmosphere is definitely more upscale (although, you don't have to dress that way) than stinking rose or dead fish, which makes it kind of more pleasant to eat at... Service was good (besides the hour long wait... ) - we always had our glasses filled and the server checked in on multiple occassions without us feeling like we were being bombarded... haha.

I would definitely come here for any other special occassion since I wouldn't be able to afford eating here besides those times.... lol.

PROS: COMPLEMENTARY VALET PARKING! Fantastic, tasty, delectable crab, decent table service.

CONS: pricey, host/hostess should learn how to take care of customers if their table isn't ready.... ugh.
author: Roxanne K.

description:
If there is a single word to summarize this place, I'll have to say: BUTTER!

Overall food quality is great - Crabs seemed fresh, mussels were sweet and fat, fillet mignon was tendered and full of flavor. A special mention on the sourdough: The garlic sourdough was surprisingly pleasant - warm and toasty - even though sourdough usually is not my thing.

Mussels were served on a hot iron plate with melted butter sauce on the side. You don't have to dip into butter 'cause the mussels were cooked marinated. Crab cake was impressive with noticeable amount of crab meat, not just fillers, found under the crispy skin.

Crab were roasted with butter sauce that layered the outside and osmosed inside through the shell. Fillet mignon was cooked just right for medium rare.  The steak with a nice texture and flavor was served with butter sauce.

I do like this restaurant - however, you have to be aware of the priciness associated with a good darn steak in this place. My last word on this restaurant is that Bobo's is NOT your everyday's restaurant if you want to keep your wallet healthy and your health in great shape.
author: Edmund L.

description:
As most everyone has said, this is easily the best, or one of the best steakhouses in San Francisco. I've come here a couple of times, each for a special occasion, and have never left disappointed (or able to fit inside my sweatpants for that matter). 

Location of Bobo's feels a bit off to me. It's not a classy, old-school steakhouse along the lines of Peter Lugers, etc., but still several notches above most of the other places on Lombard in the Marina. We've come here each time in blazers and dresses, and have felt slightly overdressed each time. 

Always have ordered a seafood appetizer for the table, almost all of the side dishes (especially the twice-baked potato), and the New York bone-in (I've heard the filet is also amazing, but I personally prefer quantity over everything else). Crab here is supposed to be awesome too, but I think there are other places where you can have crab that is just as good, but few places with comparable steak.

Last note - the bar area is very crowded. Each time I've been, there has been a wait to sit down, and its been nearly impossible to wiggle your way to the front of the bar for a cocktail while you wait.
author: Nils H.

description:
Dear RuthsChris,

I know that this is a weak way to break up with you via text message and all. But our threesome is just not working out for me anymore. 

There were some nights I wasn't sure if you wanted to be Ruth; there were other nights that you acted like Chris. It just got too confusing and weird for me. I will miss the kinky way that you used to put butter on everything---my meat included : ). I loved how everything was sooo hot, sooo juicy and steamy. Vavavooom, RC. But Hon, all good things must come to an end sometime. Unfortunately, that sometime is now. 

I'll come right out and say it. I am seeing someone else. Her name is Boboquivari, 'Bobo' for short. I know, I know. You can't believe that I've been seeing someone who lives down the street from you.  I know that this won't make things easier, but look at her! She's amazing!

                                  _______________
                                             
                                                   / \
                                                  / * \
                                                 /_*_\
                                                ( ' o ' ) 
                                & {{{{{   {    ^*^     ])   }}}}}&
                                                ( *)( *)  
                                               /           \
                                                 /  #  \
                                             _\__|__/_
                                          (  ___/ \___   )


                                               "Bobo"

                               ____________________

Bobo's likes to give it up! She offers me fillet mignon, bone in!  She also gives me an amazing seafood platter that I just, I just can't get enough of!

Bobo's has attentive people looking out for my every need. Bobo's has  three floors---three floors decorated in a circus-like motif! C'mon RC, you know as well as I do, there's nothing like a circus atmosphere to get this party started right! 
 
Finally, for the voyeur in all of us, you have a direct view of the apartment right across the street. Nothing happening the last time I was there, but one can only imagine.

RC, I have found my true love!

I know that this is going to sound selfish, but I AM A GUY after all. Would you be open to hooking-up at at least once month? O.k., o.k. every other Thursday works for me too. 

I gotta leave you right now. Just remember, it's not you, it's me....
author: RJ A.

description:
4.24.09 - Bobo has decor that reminds me of Britney's cover album "Circus!" It's very bright lit on the outside and dim lit in the inside. Colorful jester-y wall art were hung all over. It definitely had a romantic feel with an entertaining feel. Not a place for parties of 10 but 2-6 makes for a nice intimate dinner where you can still chat and have a good time. Our server Michelle was very friendly and always had a nice pretty smile.

We ordered
1. 1/2 bottle of Alexander Valley cabernet '05 (very good)
2. Blue Cheese salad (made with pt reyes cheese)
3. Tuna Carpaccio (fresh and made with ponzu sauce)
4. Seafood skillet with mussels, shrimp, and crab (never had seafood served on a skillet before, it was delish!)
5. Bone-in filet (cooked rare and it was buttery) w/ side of sauteed portebello
6. Chocolate mousse cone for dessert MMmmmm
7. Cup of coffee (kinda sour tasting, worst part of the meal)

Overall, it was a great dining experience. I enjoyed every bite and would recommend this restaurant to all my friends. Make reservations if you plan to dine on Fridays or the weekend.
author: Oanh N.

description:
Real tender, real rare, just how I like my.... steak.

I still wasn't completely full after devouring my bone-in filet mignon and that was even after having four gastronomically satisfying side dishes of mushrooms, baked potato, fried zucchini, and mashed yams.

I think I can still taste... cow.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
Went to Bobo's for a friend's birthday last night; I heard that this place had a great reputation and was eager to try it. A great perk is that they have complimentary valet parking which was perfect since it was raining. 

My boyfriend and I were the first to arrive of a party of 6. We checked in and waited by the bar. The bar/waiting area was tiny; it was a backwards "J" shaped bar with stools surrounding and a few bar tables along the window. Between the tables and the bar seats was only about a 2-3 foot walking space; it's hard to walk by without bumping into someone. I must add in that the bartender with the Hello Kitty Tattoo was very nice, chatted a bit, but not annoyingly, and was very attentive when needed. 

We sat at the bar and I ordered an unsweetened iced tea. We sat at the bar for about 30 mins waiting for the others in our party. During that time, I did a lot of observation. The plates and the table settings were very elegant. There were hooks under the bar also along the side of the bar tables for people to hang their stuff. I also noticed that the bar area felt very crowded with just 10 people in it. Before dinner I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and was directed to a door in the middle of a serving area; all the bathrooms were single rooms but had either a bench or seats for personals while using the restroom. 

When our friends arrived, we were seated up stairs. In the dining area, there were tables sectioned off by curtains. I really liked this because it gave some privacy to our party. The setting felt like an old circus tent with lots of red drapery on the walls and serving as dividers. The light was very dim. Our server met us and she was very friendly. 

We started off with drinks. I still had my iced tea, my boyfriend enjoyed his Merlot, while our friends ordered cucumber cocktails and Cognac. 

For appetizer, we shared the muscles, a mixed beet platter, crab cakes, and a Caesar wedge. The muscles were nicely done with a buttery dipping sauce, while the crab cakes were nice and crispy on the outside, while still being soft and moist in the inside. The beet platter was yummy, but the taste got too overbearing after a while; it was the only appetizer that wasn't devoured. I ordered the wedge expecting a salad; i guess i didn't read the menu LOL. It was like any ordinary Caesar salad. 

For dinner, I ordered the New York Bone In with the Double Baked Potato, my boyfriend the Porter House with Swiss Chard, our friends Porter House with Brussels Sprouts, the Fillet Mignon with Portobello Mushrooms, the Fillet Mignon Bone In with Portobello Mushrooms and the Surf and Turf with Modern Mac and Cheese. 

All our food came out, but was served to the wrong people. All the people on the left received the orders for the people on the right and vice versa. We had to play "pass the steak" in the dark. They also brought out two Double Baked Potatoes and only one Portobello Mushroom sides. 

We all enjoyed our food. My steak was cooked properly, but I wasn't too impressed with the potato; i wished i had tried the Yams instead. The Swiss Chard was cooked to a good texture, but was too salty. The Portobello Mushrooms were cooked perfectly, but i didn't appreciate how small they were chopped. The Modern Mac and Cheese looked so dry that I didn't even bother tasting it, and the Brussels Sprouts were also just OK. 

Although the sides were mediocre, we enjoyed our supper with jokes and conversation. Everyone was stuffed and we decided to skip dessert. I even got a doggy bag because i didn't over do myself =) 

We split the bill amongst ourselves and went to pay, that was when i realized that we hadn't even checked the bill. We had paid for 2 Double Baked Potatoes. She had to give us a refund in cash for the mistake. 

We left and i had realized that i left my doggy bag. I went back up to get it and caught them right before they were going to toss it. 

All in all a great night. 

I did deliberate with my boyfriend in the car afterwards, I still appreciate Ruth's Chris Steakhouse much more and he still appreciates The House of Prime Rib. We don't know if we'd go here again; over rated and $$$
author: J-nine I.

description:
I thought this place was a joke.  A tourist trap.  The marina dinner version of clown alley in north beach.  I bet my friend a dinner that Bobo's steak would pale in comparison to Harris'.

Joke was on me.  So was the bill.  

I tasted my buddy's bone in filet and thought it was the best steak I had tasted in SF.  That is until I tried my porterhouse.  Maybe the best steak I've had in this country.  

They cook the NY strip and the petit filet separately so if you order medium rare, both come out perfect.  Sides are good, wine list is solid and arranged by price.  

Anyone want to make me the same bet?  I'll take Bobo's.
author: Brad C.

description: I think it's the best steak in the city (a city without a ton of good steak places).  So meat gets five stars.  The place is soooo f'n weird though.  It's like some pedophile went to Le Cirque and then decided he wanted to open up a creepier and tackier version of the restaurant in SF...That said, the bone-in fillet is really delish.  Service is ok if you're on the first floor, but a little less bueno on the second or third floor.
author: Michael N.

description:
Yes, I have eaten at Boboquivari's and like everyone else, I loved the flavor. Expensive price aside, I want everyone to note that they advertise "corn-fed beef". Anyone who has read the book "The Omnivore's Dilemma" by Michael Pollan knows cows are not meant to eat corn. Cows are grazers and their entire digestive system is designed for eating grass. Humans are force-feeding them corn and then brainwashing the consumer with the notion this "corn-fed beef" taste is most desirable.

I had not read this book before my visit to Boboquivari's. If I do return, I will be ordering seafood and asking the chef to consider serving grass-fed beef.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
After visiting Bobo's last Friday I made a promise to come back for their signature bone-in filet.  I saw a waiter serving it to another table and it looked fantastic! Unfortunately I had only an hour to sip on delicious cocktails and bite on small plates in the bar area. 
       Boboquivari's cocktails deserve special attention as they  are extraordinary and tasty at the same time. Q-ball, probably my favorite, is made with local Hangar One Citron vodka, fresh cucumber, mint and lemon. The Basil, a mix of premium vodka, fresh basil, lime and touch of sugar is another piece of art. My friend, who was visiting from Russia was ecstatic about Moscow Mojito; for a moment he reminded me of a Japanese tourist as he couldn't help taking pictures of drinks and food.        
       Almost all the appetizers we ordered were excellent, especially iron-skillet roasted mussels with garlic drawn butter and homemade creamy mozzarella buratta... Crab cakes were good as well, although I wished for a bit less of breading. Cranberry relish, a garnish to the crab cakes was super sweet which worked well in combination with finely diced grilled onions. 
       Although we were seated at the lounge area, which is great for people watching, we received a five star service by courteous and friendly manager, Bernard.
author: Vasil A.

description: It was a special occasion for my wife and I. We had a 5:30 pm reservation. I called to inform them we would be late due to traffic. The Maitre d told us to come anyway. We arrived and was seated right away. What an experience! We started out with the crab cakes and a salad.The bone-in filet was sooo tender, and may I recommend the brussel sprouts, they were to die for. Never had them so good. The service was excellent and very attentive. I have eaten at the other steak houses on Van Ness and this one is the place to go by far.
author: Harold W.

description:
We came out of here battered and bruised, but with full and satisfied stomachs.

Things did not begin well. We showed up at 7pm on the dot for our reservation and were made to wait half an hour in the non-existent waiting area (the bar was full) where we were being shoved around by the wait staff and ignored by the hostesses. I don't mind waiting around at cheaper places, but when you're going to drop $50+ on dinner, I want to eat on time, or at least wait somewhere pleasant. We weren't even compensated. In contrast, the evening before I had been to Front Porch, a much cheaper place, and suffered a similar wait. However, the staff were thoughtful enough to offer us a round of mulled wine to keep us happy. No such luck at Bobo's. Just as we were about to leave the restaurant to eat somwhere else (we had to be quick as we were watching Avatar at IMAX that evening), our table was ready.

So 1* for service, but 4.5* for food. It's really good here. I got the bone in New York strip. I normally go for rib-eye but Bobo's doesn't offer that, so I thought NY strip would be the next closest. It was good, but my friend's bone-in filet was delicious. Very tender and juicy and with good flavour too. The sides were also impressive particularly the twice baked potato and the yams.

The decoration was rather odd - it was explained as "Venetian", and they had a CD with about 6 songs on (random stuff from the 80s) that repeated at least 3 times that we were there - totally killing the ambiance.

My favourite quote of the evening "This place looks like it was designed by a blind man and DJ'd by a deaf man".

Overall, the steaks are really up there, but the experience was really tarnished by the very poor level of service. I'm hoping it was a one-off so I may come back one day. If I do, I'll definitely go for the bone-in filet next time!
author: Jeremy H.

description:
The bone-in-fillet is done perfectly here. It's seared to perfection, and the only sauce is a natural rosemary sauce with the meat's own juices. It's absolutely delicious. 

Service is attentive and the atmosphere is cozy although a bit quirky, but who cares when you're busy devouring the garlic crab with your fingers and getting it everywhere. 

Never took a look at the wine list - I've always bought my own cab to go with the steak. 

If you share crab as an appetizer with friends, get one side, and get the bone-in fillet, the meal comes out to around $80 with tax and tip which ain't bad at all, and you'll be stuffed afterwards.

I'm going back this weekend.
author: Jingsong W.

description: Had a last second dinner here during a visit to the city after taking in a GIsnts game at ATT PARK.  Man, I am glad we did. My GF and I were at 5A5 steak lounge the night prior and this place was everything I was hoping and wishing my dining experience was the night prior at 5A5.  Food was spectacular, service was very solid. ARIEL (forgive me if I spelled that wrong) "PINCHE" LUNA was our waiter. It was his only his 3rd day, but he was great!  Funny, attentive, and just made us feel comfortable. The vibe in there was cool, relaxed, and the ambience overall was exactly what I was looking for. Food was top notch. Had a delicious iron skillet full of marvelous mussels, incredible crab legs, and succulent shrimp.  We shared a filet that was magnificent. After a couple bottles of vino we ended up shutting the place down with a full content belly. Man that was some good stuff. We will def be back when we visit the city. Thanks to BOBO's, the staff, and our waiter Mr Luna for a great dining experience!
author: Jimmy E.

description: Wooohooo! Best steak house ever! Start it off with a sizzling iron skillet filled with mussels, shrimp, and dungeness crab. Sop up the amazing sauce with the bread....delish! The  bone-in filet is a must. Possibly the best steak I have ever had. The twice baked potato and swisschard top off a great meal! Every time we go we order the same thing, and it is just like the first time we had it! AMAZING!!!! The quirky decor is fun and I love the atmosphere at this restaurant.  The curtains separating the front room's tables are romantic. The staff has always been very friendly and attentive here. When we showed up for our 730 reservation we decided we wanted a cocktail at the bar  before dinner and the hostess said no problem at all, even though it was prime time for Saturday night. Bonus-- FREE valet! Can't wait for our next meal at Bobo's!
author: Kate N.

description:
The bf & I have been here twice for a "date night." The first time, we were seated in the first floor, in one of the comfy booths and the second time, we were seated upstairs (a little close to the other tables) and had an amazing view of Cow Hallow, thanks to their wide windows. The upstairs & downstairs look very different; The downstairs is full of reds & velvet & dimly lit- good if you are on a date The upstairs is better if you are with a crowd- more light & airy & color scheme is more toned down.

We've had their:
- crabcakes with cranberry relish ($14.) Disappointing. I'm always looking for lump crab meat & lump crab meet this was not. texture was a little mushy and the flavor was very mild, maybe a little too mild...
- me: petite filet mignon ($28) cooked just right, well done but still tender and juicy. Awesome flavor.
- the bf: new york bone in ($39) bf liked it A LAWT
- whole crab ($35)- wow, their crab & the butter dipping sauce is amazing, definitely worth getting if you even *think* you like crab. 

The pluses: 
- free valet (free is always good & valet is much needed in this area without much street parking.)
- free garlic bread-it's yum
author: Fancypants X.

description: this place was just to die for. My sweetie spotted it one day a few months ago, and we have been trying to get to it, well, it was an awesome pre-birthday dinner. Let's start with the table, we had no reservations and the hostess gave us the most romantic table at the corner and we could close the courtains. the bread, brushed with oil and herbs.. so yummy! the meat was very good and tender.. we shared our appetizer. everything was deelicious.
author: patty r.

description:
This was almost a 3-star review, saved by the heavenly steak that is served there.

Bobo's, you let me down!  If we were friends, we would have to have words.  I don't like to start my evening feeling unimportant and ignored, never mind that you made me & my family wait an extra 1/2 hour for our reserved table.  

We sat at the bar for about 20 minutes, with maybe 5 other customers at the bar, so it wasn't that full.  The one bartender was very busy filling orders from the wait staff, but all we received in that time was a paper napkin.  A paper napkin with no drink, sitting there for 20 minutes.  There is no more sad sight to me - a bar full of liquor, and us with nothing but a napkin.  This made everyone in my party ANNOYED and CRANKY.  Not good.

The hostess was good.  I will say that.

Our table service was also lacking.  I felt like we were constantly having to hail or waiter to ask for things.  Here we were in this wonderfully cozy room, but there was no warmth from the staff.  Strange.  

Skip the bread - not worth the calories.

All of that said, I loved the food.  My Buratta salad with baby heirloom tomatoes was fresh, creamy and so very good.  My bone-in Filet Mignon?  Divine.  Best steak I have had in San Francisco.  Butter soft, beautifully aged, perfect crust, hardly any fat, and full of flavor!  The mushrooms were an excellent side dish.

Dessert was OK - Wild Strawberry Cheesecake which tasted good, but was a cake, not a cheesecake by any stretch of the imagination, and Pistachio Panna Cotta with Mango Creme Anglaise.  I'd skip this course next time.

The steak was excellent, but I was put off by the service, so I will be back, but none too soon.
author: Liz S.

description: Came here for dinner and had the bone in filet medium rare with the baked potato and it was an okay meal- not sure if the $57 price tag was worth it. The steak was good but needed some seasoning and more sauce and the $8 potato was not very good.
author: Genaro R.

description:
Came here on friday for dinner. I'm from LA so i found this place to be too small for a nice fancy dinner. The decor is just not my taste in steakhouses. It felt like i was in a magic show room with all these weird clowns and dark red everything. But i love the fact that they have a coat check! 

appetizer: 
the tuna carpaccio was EXCELLENT. yellowfin tuna with diced chilies and ponzu sauce. i loved it.

the sides:
twice baked potato and portobello mushrooms. MMMMMM!

now the STEAKS: 
before ordering my surf & turf, i asked the server how many ounces the petite filet was because many people had said it was really small. Since she said it was five ounces, i decided to order it thinking five ounces plus half a crab would definitely get me full. uh. it was more like THREE ounces. it was good. but seriously, it was small. not worth the price.

My bf ordered their signature filet mignon bone-in. our server said the filet was about ten ounces.. but it was more like seven because you have to minus that big piece of the bone. nonetheless, he loved it.


overall, it was good. but not great.
author: Steph S.

description: average steak house restaurant. All the dishes were salty, overpowered the food itself. Menu was very limited.
author: C L.

description:
Super delicious steak house, but the place is very unique and small, so make reservations. 

My friend took me here to make up for my birthday, we both order a mix drink and two different appetizers, salad  with bread and baked potato, also of course bone in filet, they were all delicioussssssssssssssss. It is kinda pricy, so expect a 200 dollars meal for two. 

It is hard to find parking around this area, but just do valet parking, and tip the guy, it is well worth it. : ) I would definitely come here again, it is so far my fav steak house in the city and I am not even a steak fan.
author: Sandy L.

description:
This was the most disappointing dining experience I've ever had anywhere! The reviews were so good I was really excited to spend my birthday with a great filet and some good friends.  Our reservations were for 8:30 and they didn't even seat us until 9:45. We were about to leave when they told us a table was ready. They blamed the wait on large parties who would not leave but I find this totally unacceptable and a lame excuse for treating us so poorly. The only person who was cool to us the whole night was the female bartender. Our waiter had little personality and never offered an apology on behalf of the management for making us wait so long. Neither did the manager, who made eye contact with us many times but never bothered to come over to apologize. My friend had even mentioned to the hostess that it was my b-day. 

Once we got seated we were still ignored while they were taking other peoples orders who were seated after us.  They definitely cater to blow-hard groups of men too. I think we were served our very crappy meal at about 10:30! My friend and I each ordered the Surf and Turf and the filet was not memorable at all and had little flavor and the crab was just bad! It was stringy, dry, and tasted horrible so I didn't even eat it after a couple of bites. I didnt know the crab was dry aged too! What a waste of money.

We chose the place in part because of the sides that my vegetarian friend could order like the Mac and Cheese and the fondue everyone raved about in the reviews. Well guess what... no fondue and no Mac and cheese anymore! They just changed the menu that day and hadn't updated it online.  

We were really shocked at how bad the service and the food were and this was on a Wednesday night! They didn't even have the decency to offer me a complimentary desert for my b-day and god knows we didn't want to give any more money to this place, we just wanted to get out of there. Other reviews said this was a local secret but seemed more like a tourist trap to me.  Luckily my hillarious friends helped me see the humor in the whole experience and they made my night fun anyway!
author: Lisa J.

description:
Ever since I came here for the first time, I have been dreaming about the meat.

Ok, so its only been a month, but its still pretty impressive.  My friends, they all say Harris is the place to be, and Harris makes a good steak.  But I don't sit around and drool over their steaks the way I drool over Bobo's.

I don't know exactly what they do to their steak.  They claim to age it for 4-6 weeks, and to have the best steak west of Peter Luger's.  A bold claim indeed.  But whatever they do works for me.  The seasoning, almost too salty, and yet, not.  The meat melts in your mouth.  S**t I'm drooling again.

The marina crowd, well, I guess I'd rather avoid them, but where else in San Francisco can you get into a huge discussion about football with 2 OTHER TABLES?  I mean, other than a spots bar, but you know what I am saying.

But who cares about the people there.  Go for the meat, stay for the meat, return for the meat,

Did I mention MEAT?
author: Steve S.

description:
Bobo's has exceeded every restaurant I've been to in the city thus far! In fact, I feel bad for my future reviews because the competition just got steeper. Here's the complete run-down of my PERFECT Anniversary Dinner.
First off, I have to mention free valet parking! In this city, that's priceless. We were sat immediately for our 8pm reservation in one of their cozy dining rooms. The place is small and dimly lit with kitchy decorations I thought looked cheesy in the photos, but were more comfortable in person. In fact, I felt bad for thinking I was going to get freaked out by the clowns others mentioned. Not a single clown stared me down during dinner. I actually found the decor to be charming and warm. Even the dark lighting was perfect for our intimate dinner. 
Service was impeccable. Our server was Amberlee. She gave us advice on what to order throughout the meal, kept our glasses full of wine and cocktails, and gave us the perfect amount of attention without being too intrusive. She was very charming, wishing us a Happy Anniversary dinner. Even the Manager stopped by and made us feel like we were dining WITH him rather than just a customer. I had requested a table worthy of an intimate celebration. Bobo's Manager made a personal trip to our table to wish us a Happy Anniversary and to make sure we couldn't ask for more. 
We started with a few Cocktails - The Belle  and the Q-ball. Both of us could not decide which we liked better. Then we had the Lobster Crostini which were heaven. We then had Mussels and Crab. I cannot emphasize how much my Boyfriend HATES mussels. He ended up fighting me for the majority of them, mentioning we HAD to get them the next time we come. The Skillet was just dripping with garlic and flavors I couldn't help but lick from my fingers. My mouth is watering even now. Our server brought us hot towels to wipe ourselves down for the next course. For this, we shared the Baby Romaine salad with Pancetta and Bleu Cheese dressing. Just perfect before our steaks arrived. Of COURSE I got the Bone-in Filet. No words. Really. It's the best steak you'll ever have. I didn't even use my knife. My Boyfriend had the New York - he only allowed me a single bite before he practically licked the bone clean. We shared a twice baked potato and the onion rings. Both were so packed with flavor I found myself overwhelmed with what I should take a bite of next. We had a bottle of BR COHN Olive Hill with dinner for $89!! (That's an incredible deal). Their wine list here is impeccable with prices impossible to find even directly from some of the Vineyards! Amberlee recommended the Chocolate Mousse filled Cones for desert. Just the right amount of something sweet to take us over the edge.
I'm already planning my next visit! This is the kind of meal you save up to afford, but worth every single penny. They allow you to take your time and enjoy the entire experience. I can't wait until I have tried everything on the menu. Thank you to Bobo's for the PERFECT Anniversary Dinner! The Staff and Management along side such an incredible meal made our special day one we will be sharing with everyone we know!
author: Jena D.

description: Let me first qualify this review by saying, this was my first experience at this restaurant. The decor is funky and bold, with red hues and black-topped tables. The space is a bit cramped. My crab cocktail starter was ok, however the meal was rough after that. My steak (filet on the bone) was served lukewarm and as I worked my way towards the bone I realized that the steak was undercooked (the marbleized fat was still visible). I suppose I could/should have sent it back, but I wasn't that hungry anymore. Besides being undercooked, the steak was sitting in melted butter (as Lijia also noticed). Sorry Nish it happened again :).
author: Jeremy S.

description: Best filet mignon I've had in the city. They had a pretty good wine selection. Must get the dunce caps for dessert. The place is rather small. Love the free parking valet they offer.
author: Ro B.

description:
We went here because my dad said that he had the, "best steak in his whole life here". With that being said, I was very excited. 

After our dining experience here, I have to say that our server, Erin was the best part of the meal.

We both ordered the New York, bone in. We asked for them to be a very generous Medium. Knowing that restaurants hate it when people order a steak well done. We received ours prepared very rare. I know that that on their menu it says that they cook their steaks rare for optimum flavor. But if you are going to go their and plunk down 40 bucks each for a steak, you darn well better get it the way you asked for it. The flavor was delicious and it if was cooked to how we specified, we would of probably enjoyed more of it.

Needless to say, our dog scored big last night eating our rare steak we brought home for him.

The sides we ordered: Twice Baked Potato and the Zucchini Fritti were just okay.

I did like their wine menu because of the many options of 1/2 bottles they had on their menu.

After paying $200 bucks on dinner, I can't help feel dissapointed in the meal.
The service provided by Erin was very friendly and attentive. 
I am not sure I will be back, I have had much better steak dinners here in sf.
author: Christine S.

description:
Does it matter what I usually like?. Who cares if I rarely eat steak or drink BV tapestry meritage.? 

What does matter, is that Bobo's was as serious as a butter congealed heart attack.My arteries are hardening as I speak. I didn't go for the sides, I didn't go for "The Crab" I went for "THE STEAK" .

 This was steak love pure and simple. Bone in Fillet Mignon that put a hurting on my previous ideas of steak from H ranch in west Marin.
Yes you can cut the steak with a fork.The sides are what you would expect. I enjoyed the 2x baked potato for what it was, another creamy accompaniment to the fillet . How could you judge this place based on side dishes?(and Petite fillet is just that.... petite)

Our server, a "petite", cute perky woman was very knowledgeable regarding the menu and the wine list. She was a superstar but the table maintenance was atrocious. Still what do you go to Bobo's for people........?

"The Steak"
author: Ellis D.

description: Meh, okay - so the decor's different - kinda like Mardis Gras 24/7.  Foodwise, it was nothing outstanding....
author: kim n.

description: Delicious food. Attentive dining staff. Cool circus theme with dim lighting. Small dining space. Only negative was that the shrimp were difficult to eat because the shell wasn't removed.
author: Tami O.

description:
Very good service.  Friendly, efficient and polite.
Mussels were fabulous.
Everything was buttery and delicious.
Had the mushrooms, sweet potatoes, and onion rings...very healthy selections.  But none of the side dishes disappointed.
Filet was tender, NY was not, but NY is not known to be tender so that was ok.  Flavor was good.
The one gripe we had was the crab.  The menu stated half a crab, but where was half of the body?  We got the legs, but no body.  The best part of the crab is the body.  They should state half of the crab legs.  Also, they should crack it a bit before bringing it to the table.  It is saucy and wonderful so cracking it at the table can leave your party spattered.
Sorbet was, according to my buddy, the best sorbet she ever had.
We had a nice table overlooking Lombard street so that was a plus.
Free valet!!!
We all agreed Bobos was a winner.
author: Miss F.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner here tonight with our party of 6.  Started off with the heirloom tomato salad with burrata (absolutely devine).  It had these great little croutons, avocado and onions with a balsamic vinegar dressing.  Ask for a side of black sea salt to sprinkle on the salad and you will be in Heaven.  Also had the crab cakes, which were crispy on the outside and filled with delicious crab on the inside.  For entrees, we all ordered the Bone-In Filet.  They steak was the BEST I have EVER had (much better than Ruths Chris and Mortons).  So tender and flavorful.  We shared the mac and cheese, twice baked potato, brussel sprouts, cauliflower and onion rings.  All were delicious.  

The only gripe we had was the dining area where we were placed.  It was on the second floor where they had one of those wall papers that makes your eyes get jumpy when you look at it.  I think that's why I got a headache.

We will definitely be back!
author: Tina N.

description:
No idea what people are raving about. This is a sorry excuse for a steakhouse. 

The décor looks like a mix between a run down strip club and a circus closed for the season. There was a constant draft from the open door that had to stay open to keep the windows from fogging, service was mediocre and managed barely to get the job done, starters were decent, but who ordered the half loaf soaked in oil? Steaks, the bone in fillet and the new york was ok but the swiss chard was so salty it had to be returned.

Price performance was this experience horrific. 

Only highlight was the wine - oh we brought that ourselves!
author: Jesper W.

description:
OK, simply not what it could have been or should have been.

"Would you like any drinks?"

"Yes, we would like X, Y & Z."

...

...

...

"OK, sorry for the wait, here is your A, B & C."

"But, we ordered X, Y & Z."

"I'm Sorry."

...
...
...
...

"OK, Here is your X, Y & C."

"2 out of 3 ain't bad.  Can we order some food."

"Sure, what can I get for you."

"Sunfish..., Porterhouse..., Petite Filet"

"Great, thank you for your patience."  -- We thought this was for the patience we had already exhibited...

...
...
turns out it was verbal forshadowing
...
...
"What the hell..."
...
...

"Again, sorry for the wait...  We are out of the Sunfish, the chef recommends..."

"Forget about it, can we have the check?"

Should give them a 1, but can't bring myself to do it because the drinks were good, once we got them - at least the bartender knows what he/she is doing.

I would probably not go back.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
Complimentary valet - good thing, but i also read about how a yelper said something was stolen from his car so we made sure we locked any valuables away.
the decor is hORRIBLE. the checkered walls were making my eyes hurt so i kept focusing on the people we were eating with. Don't look at the walls....
The lobster soup was also horrible. there were 2 big chunks of lobster claw in it, but it was CURRIED lobster soup. I think the menu should've said something about that. it wasn't what we had expected.
bone in filet mignon was damn good. it came off a bit salty to me, but it was too delicious to complain. each piece was tender and the meat came right off the bone when i got to it. 
the only side i had was the portobello mushrooms and they did those right.. nice big chunks. MMMMMMM 
for dessert: the strawberry cheesecake and the pistachio panna cotta. cheesecake was just eh, strawberry cheesecake but i was impressed with the pistachio panna cotta. i could go for some more of that!
author: Susy C.

description: Quick update to the previous review.  I was thoroughly impressed that the owner took the time to respond to my posting.  I am confident that my next experience at Bobo's will be a great one.
author: Don R.

description:
I brought my husband here for his b-day because he wanted a good steak.
We got the bone-in filet (as recommended by other yelpers) and it was amazing....rare..like butter...
the garlic crab was pretty good. I've had better.
I would go back for the filet for sure..
The complimentary valet service is nice.

I was bummed because I left my camera there and it was never found
author: Karlee D.

description:
I love the steak here so much that I would marry it if I could... tres yummy.

I had the petite fillet & 1/2 crab dinner... I probably took two or three years off of my life with this rich, delicious, fatty food... but, I don't care!  Mama loves her steak.

The ambiance is kind of corny; but, the food defs is five star.  Great wine list, good service... I will be back.
author: Kate R.

description:
We ate here on Valentine's Day, and everything was AMAZING!

First I have to mention that the service was exceptional. We arrived early, and they kindly served us anyway. The woman at the bar was very kind and helpful, and our server was excellent.

The Food: I ordered the crab and a side of portobello mushrooms- all excellent! The flavors were balance well and everything tasted heavenly.

My husband ordered the bone-in fillet mignon, and it was mouth-watering! We also had sides of Cauliflower, which was served with parmesan cheese (delicious!), and the twice-baked potato. Good stuff.

The ambiance was nice, the service great, and the food delicious. We will return!
author: adrienne l.

description:
I'm a steak lover from New York, so it's hard to impress me. Since I moved here in 2000 I've been looking for a place with a tastier filet than New York's Old Homestead steak house. Bobo's is it.

The bone-in filet is by far the tastiest bit of meat I've ever had the pleasure of sinking my teeth into. Every single morsel of meat was perfectly cooked, ideally tender, and mouth wateringly juicy (hell, I went out of my way to coin the word "wateringly" just for the sake of Bobo's, that's got to count for something!).

Truly a steak lover's paradise. What more can I say? Let's go to Bobo's.
author: Tal K.

description: Do not be fooled by the seemingly chain-like feel of this new steakhouse. This is by far the best steak I have had in San Francisco; they use a special dry aging process which makes their beef cut and melt like butter.
author: Nish N.

description:
Wow. Wow. And triple wow. It has been to long since I had a good piece of flesh. And Bobquivari, or just Bo Bo's, made me a believer again. Not that I had forgotten, but ordering the Bone in Filet Mignon made my mouth water, toes curl, body shiver and made me feel all warm and fuzzy inside.

Chalked this place up as a tourist spot not worth a visit. But it sure is! Parking is easy if you valet it. With a reservation you will end up waiting so grab a drink at the bar. The decor is carnivale themed. And the seating is unique. Spread over three floors, and tucked into random corners. It is intimate without being dark and candle lit. 

If you can handle more food beyond the wonderful steaks. Try the Yam and Onion Ring appetizers. And an irish coffee is served in a giant wine glass with a red straw. That was the head scratching moment of the night.
author: Ryan G.

description:
The recommended steak: Filet Mignon Bone-In

The tasting: I'll never say that a steak is perfect, or that anything in life is perfect, but this steak comes damn close. As effortless to cut as it is to chew, and as buttery going down as it was on the first taste, this steak is everything you'd dream a piece of meat would be. If you live in San Francisco and haven't had this steak, shame on you.

The sides: My buddy Cecil ordered the mussels because he's a mussels guy, and he really dig them. For me, I liked them, but they're not my thing. The swiss chard was good but not great, and the zucchini fritti was nice. Honestly, you don't come here for the sides.

The wine: 2005 Flowers Pinot Noir from Monterey. Smooth and thick, fruity and clean. A perfect complement to a near perfect steak.

The final verdict: 93 out of 100
author: Steve T.

description:
I don't understand all of the love on yelp for this place. It is WAY over-priced for the quality of food, service and setting it delivers.

If an Outback Steakhouse were to open down the street, Bobo's steak would be #2 on the block. It is an abomination that these steaks are compared to Luger's or any other steak establishment with a legitimate reputation, record of service and effort to deliver a quality experience.

We ate some crab, which was adequate, however, how about a towel to clean up.... an extra napkin???? A basic crab shack trumps whatever they deliver here.

Petite filet was the size (and as flat) as a silver dollar pancake.

The mac & cheese was a disgrace. It was more like fettuccini alfredo with runny cheese sauce.

Why did we bother to make a reservation? Walk-ins seemed to be seated before us.

I want my money back.
author: T O.

description: Steak was Soooosoooooo tender and flavorfull...next time I'll try the crab...
author: Tikisha O.

description:
pretty good.  came here to celebrate my friend's bday while visiting in the bay.

we both had the bone-in steak, sweet potatoes, and the mac and cheese.  our starter was the crab cakes. i opted for no wine but my friend had a glass with dinner.

crabcakes were amazing.  i loved the fruit relish and the cakes themselves were soo yummy.

bread was also delish~ i liked how they cut into the bread a little and poured olive oil and baked it crispy and warm.  it was a little messy to eat but it was really good.

steaks were served in a similar style to ruth chris~ hot plates that cook the meat.  make sure you order one level rarer than you prefer.  i usually go with medium and i made a mistake in ordering the same (it was my first time here).  half of my meat was a little more cooked than i preferred.  the part nearest to the bone though was just right - flavorful and juicy.

i absolutely loved the sweet potatoes.  the mac and cheese was pretty good but nothing to go nuts over.

service was also great.  we had a reservation through open table and they seated us quickly.  server was friendly and nice too.

a little pricey but about equal to the quality of the food and the service.

i would definitely come back and recommend this place. :)
author: Kimmy C.

description:
Ok this place is fucking weird. I don't know how it gets rated as one of the top steakhouses in SF.

A group of friends and I have been hitting all the different steakhouses in the Bay Area and finally made it to Bobo's.  When we arrived, we are led up to our table on the second floor, and are put in this tiny room about the size of my friends apartment living room, with a low ceiling. The walls are covered in an Argyle tablecloth like material and have a gross mauve/tan color scheme, with the same tablecloth like material in a solid color making up a tent-like ceiling. I guess this is to give you the impression you are in a circus tent? If you are claustrophobic, this room may bum you out.

The room has a couple smallish tables that seat 4 and 4 small tables that seat 2 pushed up against the walls. There are two other tables filled when we are seated and the place is DEAD SILENT aside from the really quiet music playing in the background right by the entrance. It's immediately clear you are going to be hearing every single word anyone in the room says and vice versa. It was really awkward how silent the room was.

The tables are really too small and they have these crappy narrow glass plates to minimize the space taken up on the table top. There wasn't really enough room on the table for all our appetizers once our steaks are served.

The food arrived and I will say, the steaks were actually very good. Possibly one of the top 3 steaks of all the places we have been so far. All of our steaks were cooked perfectly and tasted excellent. The steaks definitely save this place from a 1 or 2 star review from me. The sides however left a lot to be desired. I ordered the swiss chard with garlic and olive oil and it was so ridiculously oil soaked it was just plain gross. It felt like I was taking a shot of olive oil with every mouthful of chard, and after a couple bites I had to give up. I didn't try the onion rings or deep fried zucchini, but based on the full plates at the end of service and expressions on my dining companions faces, no one else was impressed with their sides either.

The desserts we ordered were pretty tasty. Two of us ordered coffee after dinner and it was served in these totally ridiculous glasses that were hard to hold as they had these stupid "arty" handles. The coffee was hands down the worst coffee I have ever had at a halfway decent restaurant. Heavily watered down and flavorless.

Overall, despite the steaks being great, Bobo's is probably one of my least favorite of all the steakhouses we have visited so far. The ambiance was just too weird and uncomfortable and the small selection of poor side dishes and appetizers leave a lot to be desired.
author: Dan W.

description: Old school charm... great filet mignon, especially on the bone.
author: Kristen S.

description: Over rated. $8.95 for a twice baked potato and $45 for a filet.  Crab legs so tiny and hard work to get very little meat. They receive stars only because the service was good.
author: D s.

description: I wish I could rate their food and service a 10.  I have eaten at Steak Resturants across the US. This is the best I have had.  Excellent choice...the best choice for a steak dinning experience in San Francisco...great service!  Bone in filet is highly recommended.
author: Nick S.

description: Went for valentines day and got a whole lotta food.. it was delicious.. best steak ever! I got the aged steak, sooooooo yummO! Muscles were delicious too.. cute quaint ambiance.. meat cooked just right! Moijito was good too.. service was OK.. not the greatest for the money u spend, but the food is worth every penny... twice baked potatoe sooo good, best ever!..the bread not my favorite, but i just dont like sourdough....  i totally want to go back.. $200+ for two people but worth every penny.
author: Jennie P.

description:
I feel like the hubby and I took one for the team at Bobo's.  We went there last week with visions of delicious steaks and potent cocktails.

So here's how it played out.

The bar.  Not so clean glasses hanging from the overhead racks.  No problem.  With confidence that the alcohol would kill any pesky germs, we ordered on.  No top shelf gin.  Well ok, they had Sapphire gin but that isn't top shelf to a 10 drinker.  Once you've had 10 you can't go back.   Not too many vodkas that I could see but I wasn't really looking that hard since I wanted a G&T.  Anyhoo.  The drinks came in tiny little 6 oz or less glasses with a $10 price tag.  Hmmm..  Nice trick.

The table.  This is the one reason I gave them an extra star.  The table was good.  I had asked for a booth when I made my Open Table reservation and was slightly miffed that they said all they had for me was a table.  Grrr.  But it was a good table.  Nice for a date or a romantic evening out because it was enclosed by curtains on 3 sides.  Nice touch. 

Ahhhh but then it starts to fall apart.... 

Crappy service.  The frickin waiter must have walked by us 11 times (okay I have a slight case of OCD, and I was hungry, and my drink was empty, so I counted) before he stopped by.  In said time before he stopped by to say "hello" he stopped by the table next to us 6 times.  Yes 6.  Unacceptable.  He promised us bread.  The bread arrived...after our entrees did.  Never mind keeping the buzz either because the cocktails were not flowing.  Apparently we should have ordered wine like the fat guy next to us (the guy that got 6 visits from said waiter) This guy had "expense account" stenciled on his forehead so clearly that's what our waiter was enamored with.  

People - they have plastic coated menus in this place.  Warning right there.  But it was too late we were committed.

The food.  Steaks were pretty good.  Not Houston's good (see my other review for those fine details) or Ruth Chris good.  But not bad.  The twice baked potato was nothing to write about (although I just did...).  We passed on dessert because we were just ready to call it a loss and get on down the road.

So....skip it.  And mark this another victim of the Lombard Street curse.  Just like El Barfo (aka La Barca).
author: Kim M.

description:
a very solid steak (bone in filet), as well as a heaping plate of mussels (got the triple order), for a group of 5, along with several sides, including cauliflower, potato, yams, chard, and mushrooms.

key takeaways:  get the bone in filet, the mussels, and the olive bread.  use the bread to soak up the juices on the mussels plate.  

perhaps i haven't had my share of high end steaks, but this is definitely top in my book.

quite a glorious meal.
author: Jason J.

description:
This is what I call heaven in your mouth!  I've been here a few times and when I went this past Monday, oh my lordy!  The first couple of times I went, the steak was great but it was undercooked one time and very busy.

I went on a slow night courtesy of some pals for a bday and we ordered and shared the roasted mussels to start, a bone-in filet mignon and bone-in new york (both cooked medium rare) and a whole roasted crab.  Variety is the spice of life, right?

I don't know if it's cause it was a slow night and they had a better opportunity to concentrate on the preparation of the food than my prior visits, but the food was exceptional and better than the other time I've been here.  The meat on both cuts was so full of flavor and tender.  I usually lean toward new yorks since they're more tasty than filets but not as soft but the filet was so tasty, especially when you got near the bone, that I couldn't decide which was better.  The meat on the bone literally was like butter in your mouth.  The waiter told us that all the meat is dry aged four to six weeks, at a constant 33 to 34 degrees, and with a constant air flow (forget the number here).  I even heard another patron tell the waiter that it was the best steak he's ever had in his life.  

The crab was delicious and good thing it was on a hot plate so that I could focus on the steak while it was warm.  After getting my share of the steak, I'd pick apart each of the legs and dip it in the garlic sauce on the plate.  My only complaint about the crab was that they removed the insides before they serve it.  If you've ever had the insides prepared like they do in Chinese restaurants, you'll understand why alot of folks consider it one of the best, if not the best, part of the crab.         Check out a place like R&G lounge for it.  

Sorry, I know I'm going in reverse order here but the steak was so good, I had to talk about it first.  We had the roasted mussels as an appetizer that were deliciously sauteed in olive oil and some kind of salt I couldn't help licking off the shells.  There's also a dip that has butter, olive oil, and capers that's delicious, especially for dipping w/ the tasty, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, olive bread.  Helluva meal!  I'll have to try some of the other appetizers next time like the roasted shrimp.  Drooling thinkin about it...time for dinner!

DSKO favs: all the bone-in cuts, house bread, crab, mussels - it's all good!
author: Dik Shun K.

description:
**DEE-LISH!** BEST filet I've EVER had! 

One of my girlfriends and I stopped in late on a Sunday night after we spotted it while driving down Lombard St. We both had the filet (which was AMAZING) and we shared a twice baked potato, ceaser salad, and crab cakes. Everything was delicious. 

The place is small and quaint but isn't everything in San Francisco? I can see how it could get loud in there on busier nights since it's a small space and the tables are all very close together( If you're close to your neighbor, you're going to hear their conversation no matter what). We went on a Sunday so there were still quite a few people dining but we didn't have to deal with any large crowds. It's worth it no matter what night you chose but if you might want to try a slower night of the week like we did. FIVE STARS.
author: Kristin B.

description: Great atmosphere, Nice prompt serves without any airs of pretentiousness and one of the best Bone in Rib eye's I've ever had. Fun PLace
author: Erik G.

description:
The olive bread they serve before dinner - EXCELLENT

The sides (mushrooms, califlower, sweet potato) - Very good, but nothing that blew my mind.

The Bone-in Filet - Hands down the best steak I have ever tasted!!!

The Service - Could not have been better!

The ambiance - It's ok.  Can get a little noisy.
author: Virginia A.

description:
I went here  with some buddies for a great meal. We always heard good things. We were seated for our reservation promptly, and started on our way up to the  second floor area. It is a bit more crowded on that 'floor' as it is more of a mezzanine level.. but it worked.  

We sat, the waiter may have been busy because  he didn't come by for awhile.. we had drinks from the  bar so we were good for a bit. Menus arrived about 10 minutes after we sat. No real explanation is needed of the menu, and the waiter didn't give us one anyway. 

Four guys = 2 bone-in filet mignons, 2 bone-in NY Strips... 3 salads .. 1 order of the  crabcakes, and one oder of the  burrata. We each had a side item.. and a couple of glasses of wine each. Standard meal. 

Here's the  thing, the food was all all little less than hot.. no huge deal.. it was good tasting . The steaks were all over-cooked aside from one that was pretty undercooked, but we switched them to make up for that (even though one was a filet, and one was a NY.)

Over all it was down to the service. I just couldn't bring myself to leave over 20% or 20% at all.. so %18 was left. .. just as an idea.. it was good and I would go back for sure. The service lacked pretty badly. Could have ben that guy.. who knows?

We decided to have the  cheescake and "dunce caps". Standard.. Nothing  over the top. All in all, a descent experience, aside from you know who. I say check it out.
author: Ric H.

description:
Compared to Alexanders in San Jose, where I had the best porterhouse I've ever tasted, Bobo's failed slightly in comparison.  But what made up for it was their side of sauteed mushrooms that made anything we dipped in it (especially the steak) taste like heaven.  I liked that you could order 1/2 of a roasted crab, but flavor wise, it was no Crustaceans.  The bartender made an aweful grey goose and tonic... my hubby and I are still wondering how someone could mess that one up... I mean... the ingredients are listed in the name for goodness sake.  So if you want a cocktail, I'd suggest sticking to what they already have on their drink menu.

Request sitting at  a table by the window on the 3rd floor, and I'd recommend reservations... even on a weeknight.  Also, if you mention that it's your anniversary or other special occassion, they'll bring you a  free dessert!
author: Trina M.

description:
The steak was decent, but was it worth it? Not so much. 

We had an 8 PM reservation on a Saturday night. We arrived on time, and the place was packed. The bar area was totally jammed, so my party of 4 was dispersed to various corners as we waited while they "set up our table." They must've been "building the table" because it was an HOUR before we sat down, after checking in several times and being told it would be "just a minute." That's with a reservation. Not to mention that the people kept pouring in for reservations that were scheduled at 15 min. intervals, meaning the crowd just continued to grow.

The service was uninvolved. The NY Strip bone-in was pretty good. Two of us ordered it, and the steaks were completely different -one was huge and thick, the other about 3/4 of an inch skinnier.

The sides pretty much blow too. There is only one potato option - a baked stuffed thing that was unremarkable. No hash browns, no mashed, no fries. And the only vegetable offered was a fried zucchini fritter. And it's not as though you're getting a bargain here and willing to overlook the traditional steakhouse offerings. It's just as pricey as Harris' or any of the others. And that's exactly where we'll we be going next time.
author: Erin B.

description:
I like places that make my life easy. Bobo's (I hope it's all right that I use my pet name, but we've shared a meal together and have fond tipsy memories) is one of them places. The bread? It already comes to the table soaked with delicious butter, crispy and flaky and melty bread pieces sliced at the center like a pineapple. I don't have to dip it in oil - it's already done for me!! I just put it in my mouth and smile as it slowly moves its way into my arteries.

The crab cakes are flavorful and quite loaded with crab. The yellowtail carpaccio was an interesting idea but didn't quite deliver. I did like the dungenesse crab bruschetta, however. 

My only complaint with the petit file mignon was that it was petit. I should have ordered a full order. That was some really delicious steak. It was the kind of tasty that made me feel guilty eating it. Don't you ever get that? Something is so good that you immediately in your mind start repenting for committing gluttony AND loving every second of it.

For dessert, I had the  Kir Royale - Champagne - Chambord sorbet in a waffle nest. Dear lord. I sometimes question whether or not I'm a lush because it seems like all the tasty desserts I like lately (with the exception of creme brulee, but hey if they made a creme brulee with some kind of liquer I wouldn't mind) are laden with alcohol. I'm not complaining.

The waitress was pretty nice too. Service with a smile. My dad, who has the advantage of being able to speak our "secret" language to us, somehow got confused and said in English, "The waitress is pretty hot, huh?" to my brother. I said, "Dad, what's the point of us speaking a language nobody understands if you're going to be like this?" So then he ordered me another drink to shut me up.
author: Tanya F.

description:
We went here for our anniversary dinner.  I wasn't too big of a fan of the decor, as it was mismatched eccentric to say in the least.  I thought it would have been super fancy (like Harris's).....but I was wrong and also overdressed!  I guess I wouldn't want the steakhouse I eat at to look like a slaughterhouse like Outback.  Ok, decor's not so important, so for the food...

We got crab cakes as an appetizer, and it was alright.  The sauce and the dried cranberries, however, were to dieeee for.  I don't think I've ever had dried cranberries sooo good.  Too bad the waiter took our plate before I got to eat the last cranberry.

The steak was pretty damn good, and now I know what all the hype about the Filet Mignon Bone-In is. yum - it is a MUST order if available.

Oh, and don't forget the side of yams and mushrooms.  I don't think I've ever had mushrooms taste so delicious.

With my love of champagne and chambord, you would think the Champagne Chambord Sorbet would be perfect.....wrong.  It was literally ice with a shot of champagne and chambord blended in. just blah.

p.s. The specialty drinks there are straight nastyyyy.  Tastes like rubber and alcohol. Just say no.
author: Betty W.

description:
Ok so I win a steak dinner from my boy and we decide on this place because we have both never been here before and the yelp reviews have been been damm good. So we make reservation's for a Tuesday night (didn't get packed maybe its Tuesday or maybe its the economy)  and I promised I would pop open a 97 Mondavi Cabernet Reserve that I think i've saved for 6+ years.  $15 Cork fee for a bottle they probably wouldn't have or if did would have cost $300+. So anyways we get there early for our reservations and decide to have some drink's at the bar. Super friendly bartender (smoking hot Persian girl) that chats it up with us. We have a couple of drink's ( a bit on the pricey side but expected for a nice restaurant)  the last drink the bartender made some kinda special margarita that basically knocked him on his a*s haha. So after the drinks we are seated (server also smoking hot) I was reading the review's and wanted to order the Iron skillet roasted mussels, shrimp & crab but my boy don't like mussels so we order crab cake's for starters. Then of course we would order what everybody raves about the bone in filet medium rare and for sides we shared twice baked potato & onion rings. So how was the food?........... Well the crab cake's with cranberry where very very good, the onion rings are just onion rings nothing special, the twice baked potato was damm good but the bone in filet was wow freaking amazing. I thought it was going to be over hyped and i was just gonna be like eh its steak but man you gotta have it to truly understand how tasty, tender, perfectly cooked (medium rare is medium rare) that it was. Now to the ratings.:

5 stars for the steak alone
-1 star for the not so fab ambiance (kinda circus like)
+1 star for the attractive staff :) (please note my boy and I are not perverts  he is happily married and I'm in a happy relationship)
total= 5 stars********* I'd give them a extra half star for the free valet parking if I could******  I will absolutely come back again and try the iron skillet starter next time. This place is a must try for anybody that loves steak!!!! I have pic's posted of the meal ( sorry its from my BB so not great).
author: mitchell l.

description:
The only thing that this place is missing is the decor.  It is an old small restaurant, not new and trendy.  But it definitely feels like you are in San Francisco.

The food was spectacular.  The filet was the best I've ever had.  The lobster appetizer was yummy.  The Swiss Chard was to die for.  The french apple martini was yummy.

Cons: service.  The waiter was nice enough and got the job done but I would expect better service for the price.  

Pros:  the food!
author: Laura Z.

description: This place exceeded expectations.  We were a party of 5 there for my son's 23rd birthday.  We were greeted warmly upon arriving & my hubby & I had a drink at the cozy bar while waiting for the rest of our group.  We had the Baby Blue & Caesar salads & bone in filets.  The waitress was very attentive & added a birthday candle to my son's dessert.  We brought our own wine & gifts for the birthday boy.  We sat at a roomy booth & were very comfortable. The meat was heavenly & we shared brussel sprouts, onion rings & chard sides.  My only complaint is that the chard WAS quite salty.  We'll be back!
author: Virginia B.

description:
i felt bold that night - i ordered my steak rare. i loved it.

unfortunately, the sides we selected were not so lucky. sauteed mushrooms were too overpowered with garlic and the baked potato was dry. the caesar salad consisted of 3 leaves of romaine lettuce.

overpriced? a tad.
author: Rosalee C.

description:
Good steak but my dining experience was flawed. First of all, it was colder than a mofo inside. Get some space heaters or something in there people. I know it's an old building -- like every building in SF -- but when I'm paying $40+ a plate I expect a little more than usual. 

I decided to go with the bone-in fillet but I think it was a mistake. I guess it's supposed to taste better. It tasted alright but it was a bit of a hassle to eat. Maybe this proves I'm not a steak connaisseur. Or maybe it just means I'm lazy. Either way, I'm skipping the bone next time. The sides I got with the steak weren't very good. I really wanted to like this place more than I did. One of these days I'll head back for another try.
author: Aaron V.

description:
OK, 3 stars.  There was a lot to live up to.  First visit, fell short.  Second visit, fell short.  At this point I'm usually done but gave it a 3rd attempt and BINGO.  It was finally spot on.  Bone in filet is the only way to go and they nailed it.

IMO the portions are smallish, so order plenty of sides.

Decent wine list and yes, good booze.
author: david s.

description:
From my experience Bobo's is home to the best steak in the city.  As previous reviews have mentioned the one to go for is definitely the bone-in filet.  This combined with one of the crab appetizers makes for a great meal.  The prices are decent although most trips I have made here have been for work dinners.  Don't let the interesting decor scare you away.  

The staff is always helpful at fitting your group in but if you are lacking a reservation and there are only two of you, try the smaller tables at the bar to avoid the wait.
author: James M.

description:
I can not believe people call this the best steak in San Francisco! 
OVERRATED.

Service was terrible. Our waiter deserved less than a penny. He had the attention span of 1 second. Ask him a question and he's running away. 
They rush out the food regardless if you are ready for the next course. 
Steaks were totally rare (like 20 second sear) when we asked for medium rare. Our server said that is what medium rare is. I'm sorry, but oozing blood is not medium rare. 
Sides are a rip off. Zucchini friti was too thin. I'd rather eat fried zuchhini from Carl's Junior! 
Decor is horrendous. It's all red inside with clowns and they play some psycho music on repeat throughout the dinner.
The crab was the best part - meaty and juicy.  Good sauce, but it was kind of over drenched in the butter caper sauce. They put capers in all the sauces. 
Burrata with heirloom tomato in balsamic - very good.
Lobster soup - gross. 

WOULD NEVER GO BACK. it is a disgrace of a steak house.
author: patty c.

description:
after reviewing all the yelp reviews..i was pretty excited about going to bobo's...yeah...after the dinner..i thought the name, bobo's, fit the restaurant fine..it was a restaurant for "babos"...it has that bright red whimsical affair going...thought it would be an interesting meal at boboquivari's...but yeah..it ended up just being an overpriced meal at bobo's

my dinner...shot of kamakazi..(oddly $8.30 a shot??...wth...how they come up with $8.30?)....my ny steak..$37...glass of wine..$11...side of twice cook potato..$7...dessert..chocolate cheesecake fondue..$14...TOTAL = $92 after tip
