author: Jazzleen H.

description:
I used to be an extremely loyal patron of Bobo's.  Every birthday, celebratory dinner, anniversary dinner was at Bobo's for the past 10 years.  Anytime anyone asked me what my recommended steak place was, I undoubtedly recommended Bobo's.  After my experience last week at Bobo's, I will NEVER return to this restaurant and more importantly, I will NEVER recommend this restaurant to anyone who asks me again. 

I recently had dinner there last week and yes, the steak was delicious as usual.  The crab and mussels were sizzling as usual.  But the service was horrendous.  Normally, Bobo's has pretty mediocre service considering the quality of their food.  We were the very last patrons sitting in the restaurant.  As expected, they immediately closed the restaurant right after we left.  After driving into our car (which was valeted immediately in front of the restaurant) for approximately 10 minutes, I discovered my camera was left in the booth, where I had set it down 5 minutes before we left.  We rushed back to the restaurant and despite them being closed already, two of the cleaning staff or kitchen staff members let us in to examine the booth and the surrounding area.  The booth was however, completely cleaned but devoid of any camera oddly.  The following 2-3 days we were given a run-around and vague answers with no one ever calling us back even though they promised to do so.  Finally, we gave up realizing that most likely someone in the Bobo's staff had taken our camera.  Four days after the incident, WE finally got hold of one of the managers who promised to call us back the very next day (which of course they did NOT.  There was an e-mail sent to us two days after saying there was no camera, shocking). 

I am incredibly disappointed with Bobo's.  Considering how pricey their food is, it is unacceptable with how unprofessional and downright shady their staff is.  

This is actually my first review on Yelp but I was so appalled by my experience that I had to share it so that the Yelp community is aware of what exactly they are walking to at Bobo's.
author: Melissa K.

description:
I hate to be a contrarian (okay, not really), but this place just doesn't do it for me.  The steak is good.  I'll give you that.  But EVERYTHING else was mediocre at best.  The romaine wedge salads are microscopic and not very tasty.  Imagine a tiny wedge of romaine lettuce that is slightly wilted.  Now pour some Whishbone blue cheese dressing over it.  Not too good, is it?
My basil martini was good, but my husband's cucacabra was narsty.  It was very chunky (not fun to drink through a straw) and very harsh.
The sauteed cauliflower was completely boring, and under-cooked.  I like my veggies crisp, but these were positively raw.
Service was rushed, decor is very cirque du soleil.  I'd rather spend my money at Harris' or Acme.
author: Michelle A.

description:
I'm giving it 4 stars since I like to have room for other potential fives, but this place was mfin good. probably one of the bestest steaks I've ever had, other than at Arnie Mortons in Beverly H. 

When I first heard of bobos, i was def not as impressed as I should be. Maybe cuz it wasn't the name of some old white dude (or maybe it is). The place was pretty sweet, and the service was cool. Although we didn't get seated for our reservation right away, we didn't wait too long. Oh yeah, make a reservation. 

We got the shrimp, that was grilled and seasoned to perfection. I'm not a seafood guy (a result from hitting up those Chinese fish markets when i was young), but this was good shrimp. Being chinese and all, I even at the shells, and the tails. Holla. 

You must get the bonin fillet. Its really freaking good. According to my friend, the bone is important, as it adds flavor to the steak. Makes sense to me, but I don't give a hoot as long as the freakin steak tastes like heaven. Like I said before, one of the best steaks, EVER. 

Not sure if I got this orgasmic experience because I didn't eat all day, but this is def one of the best steakhouses. Lisa our waitress was the bomb too. tip her well.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Pretty cool place with the whole marionette theme...Multilevel, cute cozy rooms. They also have free valet parking and the guy was super nice!

The food was pretty good. The romaine salad with crab + EVOO/balsamic was delicious. We had the fillet and the shrimp. The fillet had a little too much au ju sauce on it. The shrimp was good but on the salty side. The sides were tasty as well. The twice baked potato needed more oomph or something. The mushrooms were decent. The swiss chard was pretty rocking..

People were ordering the mussels left and right, so make sure you order those when you come.
author: Tom L.

description: Dined here for the 1st time. I was very excited about dinning a place that sooooo many people I know spoke HIGHLY of. Ordered the Muscles and shrimp for apetizers. I then ordered the surf and turf. I will say the shrimp was toooo much work(they still had the shell on them) but Muscles were Great. Ordered filet med and it came rare but overall it was a nice dining experience. 3 people total bill 350.00...Good thong this Medical Sales Rep. was buying!!!!
author: Moria Mo W.

description: Best. Steak. Ever.  Amber should be your server.   Sweet and knowledgable as hell.  We would almost consider driving from Houston to San Francisco just to eat there again.
author: David V.

description:
If you feel like a steak house: this is the place!
Excellent food, great service, and warm ambiance.
A very creative menu, with perfect balance between surf and turf.
author: Elle H.

description:
This place has a great seafood platter which will awe you. Their steaks are extremely delicious as well. My favorite is the Filet Mignon bone in. As we all know, Filet Mignon should be rare which gives out that extremely savory taste. I enjoy their seafood more since it's place on a sizzling platter. 

I do hate the atmosphere.. too dark for me

Also the parking around here suck, but the valet here is pretty cheap.
author: William C.

description: Great tasting food. the surf and turf is your best bet.  Mushrooms are also great.  Kind of pricey but we don't go there every week so its fine.  2 entrees with 1 appetizer, 2 sides with 1 beer coast $150 (includes tip)
author: Blanca A.

description: I made a special trip because of all the hype about their bone in fillet.  When I went on a Sunday night at 8PM I think I was the only one in the whole restaurant.  Well, I should have taken that as a sign/omen? I got the bone in fillet and was very disappointed.  It was greasy and the flavor just wasn't there.  I am very surprised at their claim to fame.
author: Jim J.

description:
Came here with a former co-worker for steaks while he was visiting from Boston. Nite started off weird because the cab driver dropped us off at the incorrect location :-/

Finally made it to Bobo's and they tried to seat us upstairs in a booth with curtains that enclosed us. NO WAY JOSE....luckily the hostess obliged and moved us to the main floor with a window seat. We were famished so we started off with the skillet fried seafood medley of mussells, shrimps, and crab legs. This app. was fantiastic and could've fed four people. We almost finished eating all of it!

The waitress recommended the bone-in filet and both ordered that. Our sides were twice baked potato and mushrooms. Both the entree's and the sides were delicious! I'm a fan of the corporate steakhouses like Mortons but this place is now my favorite local steakhouse! The steak was seasoned perfect, melt in your mouth, and didn't need any bearnaise at all. Great wine menu consisting of all local varietals and also was reasonably priced. Did I mention cute waitresses? Also had a good warm pudding type dessert to finish off.

This place was excellent and I would not hesitate to recommend it for steak and seafood fans alike. Luckily I was not in a food coma after this grand meal, and could still make it to Otis afterwards for some hi-jinks!
author: John F.

description:
Sissy Alert!!!  Yet again I am writing a review for a steakhouse...and I don't eat meat.  Why?  Because steakhouses are always fun.  Even if you don't eat steak.  Bobo's is no exception.  

Had a little bit of trouble getting a reservation, so make sure you call well in advance.  I called three days ahead and all they had was 6:00 and 9:00.  Since I don't like eating looking out at a sea of blue hairs, we waited until 9:00 p.m.  (If you see a pack of tourists enter before you, elbow them, kick them, jump over them, just do anything to get ahead of them.  They tied up the hostess for about 5 minutes...which is 5 minutes too long when you have a reservation.  The hostess was incompetent and could not get this particular herd of felines to get the HELL out of the way.)

The booths are nice and comfy, but I was slightly creaped out by the decor.  It felt a little too much like "The Masque of Red Death" in there.  Anyway, on to the non plague aspect of the restaurant.  The waitress was very nice and patient.  I was still frazzled from standing behind the entire Joad family.  She must have seen my frustration because she immediately asked us if we wanted a drink.  I went for a rather sissy cocktail called the Toasted Hazelnut.  (Real men should not be drinking cocktails with "Toasted" in their name, but it had Frangelico in it.  Plus it was in a steakhouse, so you don't lose too many man points.)  The drink was excellent and soon my visions of ax murdering the annoying tourists were awash in Frangelico.  

For appetizers we went for the Burrata and the Crab Crostini.  The crostini was very good.  The burrata left a little to be desired.  Not enough cheeeeeese.  However the half loaf of bread that comes with your meal was like a meth/crack speedball.  Awesome.  It is absolutely soaked in olive oil and garlic.  It took all 12 steps to avoid eating the entire loaf.  

My dinner was very good.  I decided to be a complete slob and order the whole crab.  It was a mess, but worth the effort.  My girlfriend was a bit disappointed with my crab because all the guts had been removed.  She ordered the bone-in filet mignon.  (How much do you want to snicker like Beavis and Butthead whenever someone orders "bone in"?)  The sides were also excellent.  I enjoyed the twice baked potato...a lot.

For dessert we got the Italian strawberry cheesecake.  For those of you who have subsisted on Noo Yawk style cheesecake, your lives are empty and void of meaning until you switch to Italian style cheesecake.  While Bobo's was not as good as my grandmothers, it was still damn good.

The bill was a bit steep, but it was worth the experience.  Next time, I'm going to force my girlfriend to pay!
author: Chris I.

description:
I'm going to yada-yada through the excellent steak and go straight to reviewing the bread. Table bread is my first impression of a restaurant. If it sucks, I pretty much can't appreciate the meal; if it's mediocre, I might not care either way, but if it's amazing--I'm in a swoony coma and the food pretty much has to be steaming poo on a plate for me NOT to love the whole restaurant. 

Clearly that exposition was all for the bread at Boboquivari's, which is the kind of amazing only Katie Holmes would know about.  This is bread *soaked* in olive oil. Covered with olives or something on top. It has probably changed my life. I will probably try to go there every night next week and order water and The Bread, and I will not care what you think of me.
author: Shannon V.

description: Just returned home from Bobo's....was not impressed with the steak. It was ok, but not worth the price. Also, the waitress brought the porter house to the table instead of the New York bone-in as ordered. Now, I don't know if this was an honest mistake or a dishonest mistake, but it cost me an additional $20. I don't think I should pay for mistakes made by the wait staff at any restaurant. I won't be back. Make sure you read your bill!!!
author: Isaac M.

description: Ate here last night and the food was amazing. I had the bone in New York. It was cooked perfect to medium. We also had mussels that were great tasting. The wine list is good and very reasonably priced. Our bill for three people was $221. Don't come here if you want some frilly salad this is a steakhouse and a great one. Arrive early and have a drink at the lounge right up the street, Bobo's Lounge.
author: Travis M.

description: A nice cozy place with a wonderful ambiance, fitting music, and professional and courteous staff. The free valet parking was a definite plus! I was brought here for my birthday, and we shared their crab and shrimp. The crab felt like a lot of work for not too much meat, but the crab that I was able to pull had a good subtle taste to it. While the crab rates "good", the shrimp however rates awesome! We had plenty left over, so we had it boxed up for us and I enjoyed even more shrimp at home the next day, and it was still just as tasty. If I had to choose a word to describe the shrimp, it would be "addictive". I'm debating going back to order a ton more shrimp for takeout.
author: Michael A.

description: Awesome steaks!! Bone in filet is the way to go hands down!! Seared just right medium rare!!! That's the way u do it baby!!!
author: Daver B.

description:
Bobo's.  Ugh.  I almost gave it 2 stars.  But I've had a 5-star experience there as well.  It's just soooooooooooooooo inconsistent.

I've been a few times and have sent a number of people there, but no longer go or recommend it because the experience (both service and food) is just so wildly inconsistent.

I've mainly had the steak there, but have tried some of the seafood.

They haven't had my favorite app there for a while, a bacon-wrapped scallop they used to have.  Yum, that was great.

Friends have had the mussels (I'm not a mussels guy) and said they were OK, not great.

Apps in general are good, not great, here.

Cocktails are really delicious, I've tried a bunch of them.  Especially like the Basil Martini, very refreshing.

The vibe is cool.  Good looking staff and when the place is busy it's a really cool feel.  When it's slow, the place just feels weird.

The layout is sort of weird and I think it impacts the service.  Just tough to navigate the place and leads to some weird timing issues with food coming out and stuff.

I and friends have tried a number of the steaks, my favorites have been the bone-in filet and strip.  Which have sometimes been perfect.  And other times they have just plain sucked.  So weird.  Friends have had similar experiences.

I haven't tried the crab.

The sides I had were all quite good.

The chocolate mousse filled "dunce cones" are delicious and a really great dessert.

If this place were like my best visits there, it would be up there with Harris' as my top steak place.  But it has been just way too inconsistent.  I haven't been in about a year, perhaps they have tightened things up.  I'll think about giving it another try sometime.
author: Deva H.

description:
Not even a question in my mind that the answer to the question "What's the best steak house in the city?" is Bobo's. Again, just like Lemongrass you can put the menu away. You don't need it. Just order as follows:

Bone-in filet (I like it medium myself)
twice baked potato
(2nd side... sigh... they used to have this great mac and cheese or these amazing brussel sprouts but both are gone from the menu, thus the 4 star rating instead of 5. Bring those back Bobo's!)
author: Michael K.

description:
Tonight my wife and I went to Boboquivari's for our anniversary, the service was great and the flowers that I had pre-ordered were waiting at the table on our arrival.

The ambiance was poor with a loud party on either side of us (one with a loud child) and the other were young 20 somethings having a raucous dinner evening.  The music was overpowering and eclectic.

We ordered our meal and were immediately told that my wife could not order the bone-in fillet medium well, it seems they could not butterfly the steak and could not cook it to her desire.  We were told she could have it high medium.  It came medium almost rare.  I ordered mine medium and it came very bloody and rare.  The mushrooms were salty but tasty.  

If I were going to recommend an alternative, I would recommend McNamara's in Dublin.  Old fashioned and they are detail oriented with a very strong commitment to customer satisfaction.
author: Kenneth G.

description:
It was ok.  I went here after a 3 day walk and the restaurant was completly empty.  They asked if we had a reservation then tisked at me when we didn't.  They would see if they could fit us in.  Gave us the smallest table for two you could see near the kitchen.  Restaurant was EMPTY.  I asked to move to a booth.  They needed to check the reservation book...  More waiting.....more waiting....place is EMPTY!

I starting drinking..drinks are good.  When I did finally get the booth and my steak it was good.  Not romatic at all.  Odd service.  Odd decor for a steak house.  Customer service - EMPTY

Hope you get a better server and seater.  Food is good
author: Doreen D.

description:
Amazing and Delicious!

We decided to share the bone-in Fillet Mignon and twice backed potato.  The Fillet had a wonderful sear to it.  It just melted in my mouth, it was so good.  The service was excellent also.  We brought our own wine and they charge a $15 corkage...no big deal.  The atmosphere has a funky decor (not indie) I that I though was a lot of fun.  If you are wanting a romantic place to take someone special, this is the place.

I'd eat here again in a hot second.  ENJOY!
author: Tbtotally H.

description: The food here was just okay, could be better for the price.  First we were given bread, which was spread with lots olive oil but nevertheless pretty good.  The ny steak was a bit chewy.  Also the filet mignon was burnt. .  Plus, the sides were ridiculously expensive for such small portions.  The mac & cheese was alright but i love the twice baked potato! The service was just okay, perhaps we weren't given the most attentive service because we looked young.
author: Ann L.

description:
The filet mignon was superb!!! I did not taste the difference between my bf's bone-in and my regular filet....but both filet merits 5 stars!

However, decor is scary.  Clowns, clowns everywhere!!!  It's like a little fun house (cramp, red and full of CLOWNS!!!)  That's the only thing I have against it.  Oh and the bread.  I did not like the bread...believe it is olive flavored. 

Would want to try the crab, but not sure if it's better than Thanh Long / Crustacean.
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
I love meat! The bone-in-fillet is the best steak I've ever had. The crab is also very good.

I ordered my steak rare and it came out perfect. The service was also perfect. The seating was good because it wasn't cramped. It was busy but not noisy. 

This place is expensive but it's well worth the money for special occasions.
author: Eric m.

description:
Came here for dinner on New Year's Eve.  Even though we were the *only* guests in the restaurant at 17:00, service wasn't very attentive.  

Ordered a bottle of wine, and the waiter dripped wine on the table.  Anywhere else, I would have been like whatever.  But when you're paying a lot of money to eat at a place like this, the least the waiter could do is have a wiping cloth ready when pouring wine.

To start, I ordered a baby romaine wedge salad (7$) with apples, walnuts, and sundried cranberries in a raspberry vinaigrette.  It was super delicious.  See photo.

For the main meal, I had the Surf & Turf (39$), which was half a crab and petit filet mignon.  The crab was super tasty, especially with the garlic sauce; my only complaint was that it took so long to eat (I'm a n00b crab eater) that it was kind of cold by the time I got to the end of the crab.  The filet mignon was also equally delicious.  See photo.

For the side, I had the portobello mushrooms (8$).  These were also really good and prepared quite tastily.  See photo.

My friend ordered the twice baked potato as his side.  When it came out, it was actually cold.  He summoned the waiter and had him take it back; the waiter didn't even apologize.  When the second potato came out, it was definitely warm and quite tasty.  By this time, another group had shown up, and we actually watched as one guy from that group also sent the potato back and received a new potato.

Bottom line: tasty expensive food with poor service.
author: emilie k.

description:
The steak and crab was great! the steak was very tender and flavorful. The crab was tasty also. 

the deserts were awesome. i had the wild strawberry cheesecake and the chocolate moose cones. the cheesecake was so light and i loved it! the chocolate moose cones were amazing. it was a nice end to our meal.

although i liked the food, our waitor wasn't very on top of it. we ordered an appetizer and never received it. it took a while to receive our drinks in the beginning. talked extremely fast at times and it was hard to understand what he was saying. they took some of our plates when we weren't finished eating yet.

overall it was a good experience. i want those chocolate cones again! lol
author: Anthony H.

description:
Locale:  Think Carnavale meets Vegas, baby.

Service:  1 star.  Waiter absolutely suh-hucked.  Took 20 minutes for our 1st round of drinks to hit the table, and another 30 for a 2nd glass of wine.  However, we brought along a nice 1997 Rafanelli Cab, and our request for a decanter was met promptly.

Cow:  Steaks were, as they say, some of the best around.  Bone in filets for the guys (10 oz. off bone) and petit filets (5 oz) for the gals.  All very tender, and medium rare as promised, with 1 tending closer to rare as requested.  Bravo to the chef!

Apps:  Shrimp and crab skillet... extra garlic anyone?  Super tasty.  Burrata with toybox tomatoes also very good, save a lack of crostini to spread the love onto.  House bread soaked in olive oil and garlic was tasty but literally dripping with olive oil.

Takeaway:  Needless to say, if you're looking to have a romantic meat fest away from home, the atmosphere at Harris' far surpasses this locale, and the service there is as you would expect when paying high-end steakhouse rates.  

If you are looking for a fun evening out with friends who don't wince when blood drips off of your knife, and don't shudder when the service is sub-par, bring 'em here.  

The meat, as the dude would say, abides.
author: Don N.

description: Seriously the best steak I have ever had. What a treat to stumble across this place! Staff was very cool and the food was great!
author: M E.

description:
I like my steak well done and Bobo's does it best! I've never had a more juicy steak in my life. If my husband could eat here every night, he would. Also, best pistachio panna cotta I've ever tasted.

We went for my husband's birthday and when I made the reservation online, I noted it was his birthday.  I didn't say anything once we got there, but they remembered and surprised him with "happy birthday" written on his dessert place.  Totally made him feel special.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Easy to make reservations, easy to change reservations, free valet parking, awesome dining room ambiance, awesome wait staff (Dewey is the man!), food is to die for... Ya it's a bit expensive... but whatever!! Oh and our coffee wasn't served piping hot, let the server know and it was back in 3 minutes super hot.. not worth knocking a star off... because everything else was sooo yum! Appetizers, salads dinner, dessert and coffee for 4 with tax and tip $250. We kind of just shared everything and it worked out marvelously....
author: Jackie N.

description:
I dont know why everyone loves this place so much.  I have been three times and am always under impressed.  I love steak, and their steak is good, but nothing that special.  Perhaps its because it is always cold when it gets to my table.  I also dont like the a la carte style... steak should come with some sides.  The atmosphere is weird too.

The one thing I really did like is that one time we ordered a bottle of wine.  We didnt finish it, so they took the rest to be served as wine by the glass and only charged us for what we consumed.  Pretty cool.
author: Mary S.

description:
A basil martini in a topsy-turvy world.

Great basil martini.  Decent steak.  Was a bit disappointed with the bone-in filet.  I've had better without the bone.  Woof~

The portabello mushrooms were good.  If you're an onion ring fanatic, 21st Amendment has better, but this place makes a decent ring of fried.  

The service was friendly and prompt.  The decor is a bit cheesy but fun.  Most likely the only place in SF that has free valet.
author: L Y.

description:
Ambience and service were good. The bar was a tight fit and it seemed like a night for bromance. I think there must have been 20:1 male to female ratio... I drank Manhattans (called Maker Mark) and they did a nice job with this drink.

I had the "amazing" Hamachi caarpaccio and would recommend that over and over.

I was intrigued by the filet on the bone but went with the rib eye. It was good but far from "amazing." I had the chard side - eh.
author: Kevin N.

description:
The steak and crab were fantastic.  Service miscues draw this rating down.

We arrived an hour before our reso for a drink at the bar, we checked and in asked if we could be seated earlier.  Our reso time came and went...finally we were seated 30 minutes late...after arriving an hour early!

Our waiter was very knowledgeable and attentive....aside from forgetting our salads....

The bone-in filet is a must, the iron skillet apps are fantastic as well.
author: Anthony J.

description:
My friend Birthday and we went to BOBO. It was 10 of us.
The decoration is very festive. It reminds me of Christmas time.
I had the garlic crab. It very rich in seasoning of garlic, black pepper, and olive oil. It was delicious, I love it. It was to much for me so I shared it with a few friends and they all enjoyed it.
My other friends enjoyed their meal too. 
We had a great time here, good foods and fun too !!!
author: Kim L.

description:
I came here with some friends after church. There were about 10 of us. I thought this place was going to be much larger, but we got a nice private room.  I had the petite fillet magion with 1/2 crab. The steak and crab was excellent! I have to give the steak 4 stars, but it is pricey here and I had better for less price. 
Service decent, I recommend this place if you dont mind paying for it.
author: Leon C.

description: Not as impressive as I was expecting.  The hype overshadows the food.  Cocktails were affordable, crab cakes were so so.  I don't like corn in my crab cakes.  Mussels were roasted but not seasoned, mignonette sauce was what made them special.  The table all ordered bone in filet.  As far as I am concerned you have to try really hard to f that up.  I had the "whole" crab which turned out to be crab legs shoved under an empty carapace which they made great drama about removing.  Over cooked to the point of dryness and again no seasoning.  The body ends of the legs had a garlic spread thingie on them.  Nothing to accompany.  The sides are 9.00 each and do not expect to share.  The potato was gross and looked like cafeteria food.  Loved the squeeze bottle zig zag of sour cream over the top.  We ordered four bottles of wine as well as dinner and our waiter was more interested in the 15 top seated next to us.  Cane later, served first and outta there before we got our check.  Won't go back.
author: Keith W.

description: The food was excellent, the wait staff was really great.  Negatives: Our table for two was very very small. We had a heavy curtain on one side of us (hitting it with my elbow while dining) and our table was so close to the table next to us we felt like we were dining with strangers!  The bathroom is a unisex for one person so we had to wait to use the bathroom in this very small area near the kitchen while getting in the way of the waitstaff that was bringing food out of the kitchen.  Overall it was a good and interesting experience. I thought the tables along the windows in the bar area were actually much nicer than the dining room we were in.
author: Jamie B.

description: Best steak house in the city.  The bone-in filet is outstanding.  Good service, a bit noisy, but that is how most restaurants are today.  Right before our meal was to be served, we were asked if we would mind relocating as a large bachelor party was arriving and, although I believe they needed the space around our table, they didn't wish us to be disturbed by the expected to be loud group of young men.  We did move and they waived our wine corkage fee plus offered us after dinner drinks.  Thought they handled everything extremely well.
author: Richard K.

description: Best steak I've had this millenium!  Three of us had the bone-in filet, fantastic!  Two petite filets & a new york also received good reviews.  The lobster crostini and yellowtail carpaccio are alone worth another trip.  And next time, I gotta try the mac n cheese that somehow eluded me this time around.
author: Peter C.

description:
Misleading review, those people haven't been to house of prime rib and eat the real meat. 
Aweful, won't return, and outback quality with 3x price...
The bread and crab were so oily....we have to ask additional bread w/o olive oil.
author: Naruto G.

description:
Garlic. Roasted. Dungeness. Crabs.

'NUFF SAID.

I could eat this stuff EVERYDAY. So good. OMG.

Try to get a seat on the top floor. The first floor is kinda crowded and the second floor is... I dunno what the English word for it would be - . No windows. It's like being in a box. Top floor is very nice - full windows looking out onto some motels/hotels on Lombard street. Haha. And the waitress (that we've had each time we've sat up there)  is a very sweet English lady. =)

The lobster soup is also very good here. And I am a BIG fan of their savory bread.
author: Karen K.

description:
YUM YUM YUM! By far one of the best Filet Mignon's I've had in the city of San Francisco. The atmosphere is very cute and eclectic - its fun for a group or can a be romantic dinner for just two people (in this case ask to reserve on of the more private tables off to the side)

I would skip the sald though, its less than exciting... Its just one long leaf for $8 with dressing on top. 

But overall Bobo's will NOT dissapoint!
author: Molly N.

description:
I still have dreams about the petit filet I enjoyed at Bobo's in March 2007.  It was like every heavenly fantasy I'd had about life and the supernatural exploded in my core and seeped into my extremities--slowly, patiently, diligently.  The only reason I didn't lick my plate when the steak was gone was because my best friend reminded me I'm a lady.  (Okay, I'll be honest... when no one was looking...)  My goodness--I think they might have sprinkled some crack on the filet or the mushrooms because I cannot stop thinking about them 18 months later...

We got nice wine sent to us by some gentlemen at the restaurant (which my best friend enjoyed for both of us) and she declared it was impeccable.  Our appetizers were also delicious...

Yes!  It's expensive.  Our server?  The best?  Not so much.  However... it's still the best steak I've ever had and I can't wait to win the lotto so I can go back every night.
author: M. F.

description:
Undoubtedly the best steak I had in recent months.  Service is great.  Knowledgeable waitstaff (and Lisa is also pretty cute).  I can't even think of going back to my old fave Ruth's Chris on Van Ness.

Barkeep also mixes up great drinks.  It has a quaint European feel.

Pricey, but worth it.
author: Scarlet L.

description:
Obviously I'm not a steak connoisseur, despite my love for red meat, since I really cannot tell the difference between dry aged beef and not dry aged beef.

I've been to Peter Luger's and was not impressed. Yes, the steak is good, but did it really warrant a $400 price tag for four people at LUNCH? No.

I'd heard incredible things about Bobo's by major foodies (and those with more discriminating steak tastes than myself), so I was curious to try it.

Verdict? Great steak. Tender, juicy, flavorful, and really really big. Still not sure that I can really tell the difference between Bobo's and Harris' though. I had the bone-in filet and ate about 1/6 of it. I wished I had a puppy at home that I could take the leftovers to, it seemed a gigantic waste to let them take the plate away with most of the meat still on it, but I knew I wasn't going to eat leftovers of a medium rare steak (although now that I think about it, I DID do that with leftover steak from Harris' once - cut the meat into cubes and stir fried it with Soy Vay from Trader Joe's and it was pretty much the most delicious thing ever so now I'm regretting that I didn't take home the rest of my steak from Bobo's. Darn.) The burrata - soft mozzarella with heirloom cherry tomatoes and croutons was also really good.

Decor is a bit bizarre - very red, very...clowny, but it kinda works for this place.
author: Deb I.

description:
Attached to a Travel Lodge and a hop from Union Street this is a must stop pirate ship restaurant for anyone who is in San Francisco. Do not be fooled by the touristy look and cheap motels that surround this establishment.  The Bone in Filet was great, but what really stood out was the Crab, Mussle, and Shrimp combo skillet with the bread. An Oily mess to die for!!!!

If a good friend comes in town and you want to go drink some beers and eat food in a quirky place, this is it.

Only thing that they need to change is the wine list. Who sets a list up based on prices? I had a headache reading it.
author: Bryan M.

description:
My mom and I visited San Francisco from the Boston area a few years ago and whenever we reminisce about the trip, one spot invariably comes up - Bobo's!

The atmosphere was interesting and not what you typically see on the east coast.  The dining room we were in was just off the bar and only held a few tables.  Interesting lighting and salt and pepper shakers adorned the room, which was decorated in a sort of jester-like fashion.  


A lot of places are touted as having the best steak around, but Bobo's actually holds their own.  The aged steak was mouth watering and worth every (pricey) dollar.  We often joke about flying back out just for a night at Bobo's!
author: Erin V.

description:
After reading the reviews I decided to take the boyfriend here.  We ate like a pack of wild animals.   First, we dove into the sizzling shrimp appetizer. It's juicy and full of seasoned buttery garlic.  It's damn near amazing.  Then we moved on; I did the surf and turf and he got the whole crab.  Crab was nice but it's ALL ABOUT THE STEAK.  It has this amazing outer layer that I cant begin to describe but it's one hell of a steak.  Next time we go we're going to blow the wad on the STEAK and stay away from the sides which are really nothing special and like $8 each. The champagne options are nice with some french thrown in there but the prices are steap.  Our server was a real sweetheart.  Can't beat the free valet service either.  Go for the steak and you can thank me later.

Cheers!
author: Shelly S.

description:
Our friends that live up north go to Bobo's every time they are in the city.  We decided to join them last night to see what all of the hype was about.  First off, I was really impressed by the dcor.  It was very unique, red walls, plush booths, marionettes, fun lights, and blown glass vases.  

The waitress came by and was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the menu (both the food and the drinks).  I ordered a glass of Syrah that was from a local winery and delicious.  Everyone else ordered one of the many specialty martinis or cocktails on the menu and raved about them.  Especially the cue ball (mint, lime, lemon, vodka, etc.).  Our friend said to order either the steak or the crab.  Bobo's has a bone in filet which is supposed to be incredible.  Not being much of a steak person, I ordered the crab.  Everyone else ordered steak or a steak/crab combo.  

Everyone raved about their steaks.  I tried a bite of my boyfriends and it was delicious.  Just melts in your mouth.  The crab was good too.  A little too much oil and not enough garlic but still delicious.  Oh, and the bread they bring out is amazing.  It was warm with a black olive tapenade on the top.

The bill was huge, as to be expected, but huge.  Definitely worth it for special occasions and if you want one of the best steaks in the city.
author: Zoe H.

description:
Had a team meeting/off-site at Bobo's...I think best off-site I've had so far since it was company expensed steak.

Decor is definitely very eclectic, not sure what theme they were going for.  We got decent seating since our reservation was early and we had a party of 7.  Waiter was very knowledgable and polite.

So apparently their filet mignon on the bone is the ideal thing to get, so that's what I went with.  (Almost went with the surf and turf)  The recommended level of cookedness was medium-rare so that's also what I went with.

When I got the steak and cut into it, the steak looked like it was cooked medium well, so I was a bit perplexed.  (There have been many occasions where I've had my steak overcooked...is it cuz I'm a girl?)  However, the waiter told me because  the steak is dry-aged, there's less blood and may appear less pink/red than usual steaks cooked to a medium-rare degree.

He sure as right, the steak was tender, flavorful, moist, it was DELICIOUS!!  I don't know if I'd vouch this was the best steak I've ever had, I feel like I haven't had the best steak yet but this is up there as GREAT.

The sides are not spectacular.  I ordered the swiss chard, it did it's job as a vegetable.  The portabello mushrooms was cooked in a very over powering capers sauce.

The appetizers are pretty good - tuna tartare, asparagus, and crab cakes.

Would I go there again?  Probably..but not for a while since there are so many unexplored steak joints I have yet to try.
author: Winnie L.

description: Best tasting steak in SF...worth every penny.... not too pretentious, but awesome food. Can't wait to go back.
author: Geronimo K.

description: The filet mignon bone in here is the best steak I've ever had. I wouldn't call myself a steak connoisseur but I have been to my share of nice steak houses and this is easily the best. Twice baked potato and the mushrooms are also great. I go almost every time I'm in northern cali which is a few times a year. Definitely recommend it. The steak will run u about $50 but if you've got it or its a one time splurge its worth it. Atmosphere is great too.
author: Ivan M.

description:
After attending Artist Gallery opening @ Gough St, surprised Mr with a dinner @ Bobo's. He loves steak. So per fellow yelpers recommendation, I made sure that the filet mignon bone in would be available that Saturday night. ^_^

First, there's a complimentary valet parking w/c is a total plus in the City. Made it at the restaurant around 8:15 PM, the host was talking to some tourists who walked in & was told that the next table available will be at 10 PM or they can come back tomorrow. Mr looked at me & asked, did we make reservation?  My reply "of course babe, also booked it at opentable.com w/c means 100 pts towards our dining credit." ^_^ 

Our host greeted us and was told to wait by the bar while they prep our table w/c by the way I requested to have a booth facing Lombard St. Right on time, @ 8:30 we were seated immediately, our waiter greeted us. Offered us the bread yummy but not complimentary. Got a half bottle of La Crema 2003 Pinot Noir, since we already had wine at the gallery. It was just right wine for our steak.

Mr ordered FILET MIGNON BONE-IN, medium rare w/c totally melts in your mouth, crispy on the outside & very tender on the inside, Perfect! Side order: SAUTED SPINACH & MOD MAC (MODERN MACARONI & CHEESE) Like the Spinach but not too crazy about Mod Mac.

I ordered HALF CRAB & PETIT FILET MIGNON, medium rare (YUMMY) & SAUTED PORTOBELLO MUSHROOMS like the Portobello but wish that they didn't add vinegar on the sauce.

Mr & I like the Decor, it's different and not pretentious like the other steak houses. I find the establishment to have character besides we were there to enjoy the great filet mignon bone in together. Did I mention its aged dry, you can tell the difference.

Gave it a 5 star coz, steak were perfect, service were awesome & good comparable price, were definitely coming back. Mr love me even more, coz sometimes boyfriend needs to be taken care of too. As far as dessert, we didn't get any, we were so full besides he can have me for dessert *wink*
author: jubi l.

description:
A last minute deliberation , lead me to this fantastic SF flavored steakhouse. With a name like Bobo's, a jester as the mascot, the color red splashed over you might think .."what the #@$%" .. but you will be amazed. That reminds me - if on a date - get the girl to wear Red. 

The gastronomic experience commenced with the "Garlic Baked Sourdough Olive Loaf".  The baker had my attention already.  
I was so ready for the bone-in filet mignon. My jaw dropped on learning that they ran out of their most popular cut. Apparently, they were out of the same only once before in FY07 (provided their year starts in July) :)  In hindsight - one suggestion - call ahead and find out if they have it available. (geez, who would do that ?). 

Without a formal backup plan, I requested Jonathan (who gave us just the right amount of attention), to suggest a flavor on the same lines as the MIA bone-in filet. My only hope -  considering they are all dry aged, the disappointment could be contained.

I went with the  "New York Bone - In". The dry aged classic arrived  medium rare, pan seared and with a garlic buttered top . One bite and I knew that the food gods were on my side.  The twice baked potato and Kenwood cabernet was just about the perfect bridesmaids. For those who tread the white wines - Bobo's doesn't offer a Reisling. (Though I think that's probably with due diligence for a steakhouse. )
The grand finale was when the baker nailed the night  with the chocolate moussed cones. I wanted to do a cartwheel.

For those who like to know where they are eating - the same trio of restaurateurs'  who run the Stinking Rose, The Crab House, The Franciscan, The dead Fish,  and Calzone's also run the show here.
author: Ajay J.

description:
I'm not much of a meat eater, but YUM! is all I can say about the bone-in filet mignon. My hubby and two friends all ordered it and absolutely loved it! I ordered the Hawaiian Sunfish and that was pretty damn good too... But don't order it if you don't like seaweed, cuz all the flavor seems to be in the seaweed that is topped on the fish. We also ordered a whole crab, which was just ok. The appetizers (crab cakes and the tuna carpaccio) were average to good. The lobster soup was good, but you have to be ok with curry, cuz it has some of that in it. The sides of Swiss chard and the onion rings were also good. Total bill for all this plus the YUMMY espresso martinis and couple other drinks came to about $350 including tip. 

Service was good. My only gripes are that its a unisex bathroom, and that they had wet paint on their wall near the entrance, but no sign by it somy friend got paint on her shirt. They did offer to pay for her dry cleaning though.

OH, and they have complimentary valet service!
author: Mikolo R.

description: 4 star food, but inattentive, slow service to get & refill water and corking wine bottles. Food didn't take very long. Nice ambiance, even though a little bit too dark to read menu and see food. bone in filet was extremely tender and flavorful. Steak tartar had so much dressing you couldn't taste the meat. Twice baked potato was creamy and delicious. Mussels were probably the best mussels I have ever had, cooked to perfection with no added flavors, perfect!
author: EG H.

description:
I'm a HUGE fan of the San Francisco cuisine. And Boboquivari's made my friend's birthday DELICIOUS!!! The tuna carpaccio was gone in a blink of an eye, then came the crab, filet mignon, artichoke... HEAVEN!! I love meat and seafood and this was just a treat! 
Definitely going back!
author: Cris K.

description:
So i heard of this place after a discussion on steaks was brought up on a ferrari forum. One of my friends was jonesing for some steak so the timing was right, then got a few more friends to come, and made opentable plans for it.

I got the $39 NY Strip, med rare. Got the $12 crab cakes, and the $9 twice baked potato.

The comp olive bread was good, it was toasted and oiled up. Perhaps it was a little too toasted, hard to eat around the edges.

Next came the crab cakes, they were alright, but tiny. I actually ate the cranberries, and that doesn't happen often.

Then the steak + potato came. I liked both. I almost picked up the bone to rip it clean.

Then I ate my friend's potato, since she didn't really like it.

Bobo's your friend. Visit Bobo.

Comp valet parking below, i didn't drive into the city, so I didn't valet it.
author: qirk z.

description:
Beautiful, festive atmosphere.  Everything at Bobo's is done with a unique twist from the way they cook their steaks and the dry aging, the addition of capers to the traditional side of mushrooms, to the salads all being done in a "wedge style".  
We tried the bone in filet, and it was as good as it gets.  I haven't had a better steak in SF! We loved their mushrooms with the capers in the sauce.  They make a great companion to the steaks.  They have a nice, well rounded red wine list.  We brought our own bottle of wine as their $15 corkage fee is reasonable.  The salad was fair, but the chocolate cups for dessert were excellent.  They too are unique with a bit of ancho chili powder in the chocolate.  
The room is unique, and interesting to look at.  There's so much red on the walls that we couldn't take a good picture at the table.  Iif you want a photo of the night, you might want to have the valet take a shapshot of your group before he parks your car.  The rooms are small and the tables are very close.  The group behind us was quite loud and that can be distracting.  The service was just right; not too much attention, and we never felt ignored.  We will be back!
author: Jason B.

description: Bobocraparis.  Just bad.  I go about once a year - the bone in filet always sucks me in - but each time that I do, I ask myself: "why?"  Let's start with the positives, the bone in filet is an exceptional steak.  The yellowtail in ponzu is good.  But then it ends.  The lobster soup was Dr. Seuss time - green glue.  Perhaps something for the Incredible Hulk?  The twice baked potatos were the worst I have ever had.  Whacked out production with zuchinni and glue like consistency.  Last time I checked, bacon, cheese and some buttermilk are just fine for twice baked.  These can only be eaten if done after the green glop soup.  By comparison, you will trick yourself into the belief that the twice baked are good.  I wish someone in town would do a bone in filet so I can avoid my annual disappointment.
author: Lena D.

description:
Filet Mignon Bone-In with Portobello Mushrooms

BEST STEAK I EVER HAD!!

Nothing beats a great, happy, satisfying meal than you're friend voluntarily paying for it =P

Definitely way high on my list.
author: Joanna W.

description:
Bobo,
nobody beats you in not cooking steak
best chunk of red meat
author: nate l.

description:
my visit to the bay area has been full of amazing sights, weather, and food. and, has caused me to gain about 5lbs. but that's ok. 

bobo's was a memorable experience. you know when you eat something REALLY good and you're like "dang, i wanna do that again?", even though you're about ready to burst? that's how i felt after i ate the bone in filet. after i took my last bite, i just wanted to do it again....

ok- the whole meal went as follows...
crab cake app- crispy, crabby, no filler, nice cranberry relish to cut through the sweetness and richness of the crab. great start!
bone in filet- me and my bf got the same thing. omg. tender, juicy, very medium rare throughout. and huge. and whatever that sauce is, i want it bottled!!!
sides- we got the portabellas and the mashed yam- mushrooms were meaty, seasoned well, great complement. the yams were sweet, but not overly. i wish the portion was bigger though...
dessert- i got the monterosa, my freind got the pistachio panna cotta. mine was great, the berry sauce was nice and tart. the panna cotta was also great. a little firm for me, but delicious.

service was attentive, but not overly, so it was a great balance. drinks were also amazing, by the way. dimly lit, eclectic decor, and it looked like everyone was enjoying themselves. great food, ambiance, and service. 

hopefully i'll be doing this again soon!!!
author: Salvina B.

description:
I had my 5 year anniversary dinner at this place.

We had:
Filet mignon bone-in, we asked it to be cooked medium well came out medium rare.
Mussel and shrimp had no flavor except for butter, but the mussels were very fresh.
Brussels sprouts wasn't okay, but way too much bacon.
Baked yam was good though.
Bread was fresh.

Service, food, and staff was okay. Dislikes: they didn't pack my left over steak like I requested. They didn't offer anything to us for knowing that it was our anniversary dinner.  There wasn't enough lighting during dinner, but it I guess it would be considered very romantic. I felt over dress for this place. I called to complain since they didn't pack 1/2 the steak I had not eaten. The manager said they would call back, but it has been more than two weeks and nothing.

Sad that they do not follow-up like he said he would. This will be my first and last time there!
author: annie m.

description:
The category:
Steakhouses

The seven-word skinny:
Four to Six makes all the diff

The review:
Steak is the single biggest reason I can never be a vegetarian.  Of my laundry list of carniverous favorites, a choice piece of steak will always be at the top.  I've sampled steak in 15 states and 10 countries and I can safely say the bone-in filet at Bobo's is the best of'm all.

To give you an idea of my steak preferences, I am a big fan of Harris' Kobe ribeye and both the double filet and cajun ribeye at Morton's.  House of Prime Rib is alright (I'm not big on prime rib - personal preference) and I don't much care for Ruth Chris.  I especially dislike Izzy's.  It pains me to even type the name of that awful place.

That being said, I was extremely upset at myself for not having discovered Bobo's earlier in life.  The bone-in filet is the only thing that should be ordered and it should only be ordered medium-rare or below.  If you want a discertation on the specifics of the 4-6 week, off-premises, dry-aging process your waiter or waitress will happily provide it.  If you want to hear about the benefits of the process, just ask anyone who's dined there.  The meat melts like butter in your mouth and packs more flavor than a ball of five-spice.  It's truly a religious experience for steak-lovers.

The appetizers are pretty tasty as well.  The sizzling iron-skillet roasted starters are great for sharing but keep in mind your clothes will likely have a skillet scent to'm at the end of the night.

While the decor is a bit cheesy, the waitstaff is attentive and very accommodating.  Last time I was there, we ran up a big tab and stayed a bit past closing time and they were still gracious enough to serve us complimentary limconcello aperitifs.

The good:
Unforgettable steak for under $40, easier to get reservations than at the Big Four (Harris, Ruth, Morton, House), lots of appetizer choices

The bad:
No free bread - only a problem if you ask for it and it "unexpectedly" shows up on your bill, the decor - almost feels like they'll kill the lights, throw some music on and host a burlesque show after midnight.

[edit] On my second visit here, the service was a solid D.  The waitress was unfriendly and it seemed like serving our table was the last thing she wanted to do in the world.  Based off my two visits, I'd say the food is always excellent but the service is hit or miss.

The notable:
One of only a handful of places in the country that dry-ages more than 21 days.

The Junius pick:
Filet mignon, bone-in.  The menu says "when available" so call in and make sure it is to avoid disappointment.

The person you're dating:
Should be brought here if and only if he/she likes steak.  Nothing worse than watching an incredible pieace of beef go to waste on a less discerning palate.

The significant other/spouse:
Should probably be brought here under the same conditions mentioned above.  Then again, if you love steak and he/she's already locked in to the relationship, there's nothing wrong with the occasional selfish dinner.

The last time I was there:
October 3, 2006

The number of times I've been there:
2
author: Junius H.

description: Two of the best steaks I've had in the city were here- The bone in filet and a petite filet.  Twice baked potato was excellent and loved the brussel sprouts too.  Only thing preventing me from giving it 5 stars is the odd Lombard St location and the somewhat strange layout and decor inside.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description:
I came here on a weekend afternoon with a friend and had quite a delightful time. Note, I am a vegetarian (but not the crazy meat-eater hating type), so my review comes from that standpoint.

Location: A bit far out for most people, but still central enough to not be hassle. Unfortunately there's no night scene and not really much to do around that area, which is half a star minus for me. Where am I supposed to stumble into after I get liquored up with those fabulous espresso martinis? 

Space: Nicely decorated, classy. I am really into the lighting there. There's also seating by the window, so that you may enjoy the beautiful sea of cars racing down Van Ness street. Also, the bar is quite beautiful; Modern, yet classic, with trippy green little lights.

Ambiance: Quite a variety of people. I thought it would be mostly business types, but that's San Francisco for ya: You should never expect to get what you expected. There were young people, old people, latinos, asians, the works. Quite diverse and no one was annoying or awkward.

Service: The service was absolutely fabulous! The house manager checked in on us the entire time and even entertained with his glibly comic demeanor. All the waiters were professional and diverse. They liked us so much that they even brought over a complimentary dessert!

Food/Drink: Again, I'm a vegetarian, so what was I doing at a steakhouse? The alcohol, sweetie, the alcohol. They have the most fabulous drinks, specially their Espresso Martini. The drinks here are a work of art, truly down to the very last detail. There was unfortunately not too much vegetarian variety, so if you're a vegetarian and hungry DO NOT come here. I had the onion rings and a walnut, cranberry salad; Both of which were perfection to the core. The lack of vegetarian items for me is another minus half a star--Yes, even if it IS a steakhouse. It's San Francisco for goddess' sake, they should know better.

Overall: I had an absolutely wonderful experience, some yummy appetizers and fabulous drinks. What more can a boy ask for?
author: SF N.

description:
As a recovering vegetarian, I had no idea where to begin when selecting a steakhouse for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. I turned to the good people on Yelp Talk to guide me in the right direction. Hands down, this steakhouse won the most votes and now I know why. The beef was perfectly cooked and melted in my mouth. The twice baked potato was like an orgasm on a plate. The service was attentive, but not overly so.

Thanks Yelpers for reminding me why I gave up vegetarianism!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Bobo's bone-in-filet is legendary, but unfortunately when we went they were all out of it.  It is worth noting that even though we didn't get the signature dish, this restaurant is still worth a 5-star rating.

We got the surf & turf and Porterhouse steak.  The steak was excellent, and the side dishes were all good. Of the surf & turf, the crab was tasty but a bit awkward to eat since it was still in its shell.  I really liked their martinis and wine selection.

The decor is eclectic and European -- straight from "Carnivale" in Venice.
author: Cate K.

description:
We decided to treat my bf's cousin to dinner for a late bday present. Eric said he wanted steak and/or seafood. What better than both at Bobo's? So Jeremy and I took Eric and his gf (Alfie) here last night for some good feastin'. 

Everyone ordered the "Surf & Turf" consisting of a petite filet mignon and succulent crab legs with a butter dipping sauce. I was pleased with the delicious crab but my filet was just ok. I enjoyed the bone-in filet way more last time. That bone probably makes all the difference and of course, a thicker piece of meat. Eric was the only one who had the bone-in filet and he literally devoured it piece by piece very quickly. 

The sides and appetizers were perfect from the sauteed portobello mushrooms to the sweet yams and crab cakes. The only one we didn't quite enjoy was the sauteed cauliflower. The lemon sauce was a little to strong I think. Other than that, this was another delicious meal at Bobo's!
author: Anne E.

description:
Get the bone-in filet mignon.  I've had it twice here, and each bite is truly paradise.  For experienced steak-eaters, order it medium rare.  It will be rare near the bone.  Those who are not so much into their dinner mooing might want to order it medium, so that it's not quite as bloody next to the bone.

Lots of great wines to choose from.  We had a petit syrah with the steak, which was perfect.   The mussels and portobello mushrooms accompanied the meal quite nicely as well.

It's pricey, but well worth it for special occasions.
author: Dave C.

description:
BEST STEAK EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

And the portobello mushrooms and twice-baked potato and swiss chard are yummy as well!!

Bobo's is definitely my favorite steakhouse.  I just wish the prices weren't so steep...
author: jackie m.

description: Wow....WHAT A HORRIBLE DINNER.  I do not think the food even deserves one star.  I do have to say the wait staff was very nice and courteous but the food was BLEH!!! My best friend took me here for my birthday dinner.  I was extremely excited to go because I have never been and have heard great things about this place.  Upon our arrival, the hostess said that our table was not ready yet so we decided to have a drink at the bar.  Moments after we were seated, we were told that our request of being seated upstairs has opened up and if we would like to move....heck yeah!!! Things were looking up until our appetizers arrived....if you could even call them that.  We ordered the yellowtail carpacio and lobster costini.  The yellowtail was submerged in a concoction of oil and spices, you could not even tell there is tuna on the plate.  When I scraped up the tuna, it looks like BEIGE flakes of mystery stuff....not cute.  Then we moved on to the lobster crostini which was SALTY!!!!!!  The only good thing about that dish was the burrata that came with it.  They had the bone in Filet that night so we both ordered it medium rare.  We also ordered two sides, the mushrooms and the swiss chard.  The swiss chard tasted like five lemons were squeezed in to it and the mushrooms were mushy.  We decided to cut in to our steaks and boy....was it disappointing!  The meat was completely RARE inside with a slight char on the outside with an EXTREMELY salty crust.  The meat itself have no flavor except for the saltiness of the crust outside.  They did comp us dessert which was good and the bottle of wine we had with dinner was excellent.  Our bill was over 300 dollars and we both left there still hungry :(  I dont know if they had an off night or a new chef but I have NEVER had such a horrible meal while dining out.  So for the staff I would give three stars...for the food...NO STARS!
author: Kiencye T.

description:
5 stars!

Bobos is a mouth watering establishment for certified beef lovers!

This place is by far the best steakhouse in the Bay Area.
All you need  to order is a Bone in NY cut for complete bliss...

Great cocktail list as well - go for the Qball!! Hanger one vodka - infused with cucumber and mint - yummy!

PS - I hear the crabs are good as well -:)
author: Christian S.

description:
I was craving steak.  I was craving steak and texting my friends with "Steak?" or "steak steak steak".  Finally, I had a taker!  Now where to go?  We thought about Izzy's but the last time I went there me and my steak were cold because the door was left open, and the "peanuts on the ground" feel wasn't really hitting close to home.  I've never been to Boboquivari's before but have driven by countless times and I heard good things about their steak. So I called and made an 8:15 pm reservation for two with no problem at all. Free valet in the front for diners and we walked right in at 8:15 and seated immediately.  The place is a bit dark and reminds me of a 1920s establishment - dark, red, table for two a little tight, but not terrible.  

We were hungry girls and ordered mussels for an appetizer and I ordered the regular filet mignon (10 oz.).  SG ordered the petite filet (5 oz.) with half crab. We shared two sides - sauteed swiss chard and portabello mushrooms.  The waitress helped SG pick a glass of red to go with her meal.  The menu states that the meats are cooked to medium rare for maximum flavor, so if you like your meat done or rare, be sure to say something early.  

A loaf of bread was brought out - it looked impressive but didnt taste that great and looked warm but wasn't.  The mussels came on a sizzling cask iron pan and served with warm garlic lemon butter.  These were delicious with or without the butter.  I would order again! Although a bit small, there were quite a few of them, each one plump and succulent.  

We came here for the steak and my filet mignon was done to the perfect temperature.  The beef was flavorful, could have done with a little more salt, but mind you, I'm getting over a cold and I couldn't taste too much until this day anyway.  SG's half crab was an ample portion and she gave me one of the legs that were roasted in garlic.  More butter was served with the crab. Her 5 oz petite filet was quite petite, but a good portion considering the size of the half crab.  The swiss chard was sauteed nicely, not overcooked and gave me inspiration to make it at home.  We felt the portabello's were to cut up and stemmy.  We could have done without the stems, and i tend to prefer my portabellos in whole caps or thick strips with no stems.

The service was pretty good, the shining stars were the attentive servers who brought our food out.  They didn't just bring our food out, they wanted to make sure we had everything we needed.  Super!  

The place is a little dark, and a table for two is a little crowded, so my preference would be to come here with couple more friends and sit around and hang out.   Overall very good.
author: Betty L.

description: Food was excellent. Bone-in filet amazing. Service attentive. I'm not a big fan of the decor, but understand it's the "Italian Jester" look they're going for. The dining rooms are cool and quirky and the horseshoe shaped bar is cool. However, the music was awful. It ruined the atmosphere and took  my attention far away from the food. Unfortunate. They loudly played crappy pop music like "Feist" (thanks Shazaam) And that damn song with the whistling... At a steakhouse with an older, tourist clientele, I was quite surprised and annoyed. For the prices you pay for a steak, they could provide some milder background music that won't upset your stomach?
author: Jason G.

description: Last minute party of 8, great bar, great choices... Menu is solid, Steaks are great, a nice treat when you are running out of good steak choices in SF. fun little bar downstairs.
author: Troy S.

description: GREAT STEAK!  My filet was super tender and juicy.  The crab was just ok in my opinion, but perhaps it was due to the fact that it had to compete with the awesomeness that was my steak.  I also highly recommend the mussels.  I've had over-cooked rubbery mussels before, but these were perfect.  Sides we had were brussel sprouts, portabello mushrooms, and twice baked potato - all delish.  Wine corkage fee is only $15 (though for some reason they didn't charge us this time), but either way that's still really inexpensive.  And did I mention the complimentary valet parking?  I'll definitely be back.
author: Pam S.

description:
We go here every few months to get a steak fix.  It's amazing! 
The Filet Mignon bone-in melts in your mouth.  With the natural seared in flavors, it's to die for.  

My gf gets the surf n turf every time, and that's great too. 
The drenched olive oil loaf of bread is pretty sloppy, but super good and hard to resist finishing.  The Double baked potato is also one of my favorites.  I've had almost everything on the menu, and top to bottom, it's all excellent.  

It's a perfect place for a date or a party, they'll seat you accordingly.  I've been to Ruth Chris(over rated) and most of the steakhouses around, and this is by far my favorite, especially for the price.  Haven't tried Harris yet.
author: Chase F.

description:
BEST. STEAK. EVER.  I dined here last night after reading all these rave reviews. I was a bit skeptical about all the Peter Luger comparisons, as I'm from NYC and used to live right by that steakhouse - yes, I'm a fan.   I must admit, fully realizing that some ppl will say I'm blaspheming, that I think Bobo's kicks the ass of Luger's!

I had the filet mignon and it was amazing. Total food orgasm. My friend had the NY Strip which was also to die for (I got a taste).   I recommend the spinach side (sauteed with garlic, mm) and the garlic olive oil bread, which is homemade and covered in roasted garlic and olive oil.  They have a lovely Chateauneuf-du-Pape as well, which happens to be my favorite kind of wine.  I can't wait to go back - next time, I will try not to eat all day and order the Porterhouse.   The one downside: I don't see how I can eat a steak anywhere else now. I'm hooked.
author: Jacqui M.

description:
This place has officially become my post Napa tradition. I've come here three times after an indulgent day up north and a good steak is, in my opinion, the perfect way to cap off a trip to wine country. 
Fantastic aged beef, amazing sides and the best bread I have ever been served in a restaurant. 
What more can you ask for?
Oh yes, the atmosphere is unlike any other steakhouse I've been to: fun, colorful, inviting. 
Love this place.
author: Ross G.

description:
Went here the other night for girl's-steak-night-out (I love my girls). I had fairly low expectations because I hadn't heard that much about it, and what I did hear was more about the atmosphere and how kitschy it was. I figured that was probably OK since our usual problem is that we like nice places, we like steak, but when this particular group hangs, we are severely inappropriate and totally obnoxious. But my gawd after the steak I had I will totally go back to Bobo's, kitschy Barnum & Bailey decor and all.

I agree whole-heartedly with everyone else - the bone-in filet is incredible. Perfectly seasoned and perfectly rare - and wtf is with a bone-in filet anyway? I'd never heard of one but now it is my new best friend. Don't even bother with anything else on the menu.

My one complaint is that the salads are WEAK. A "wedge" is not 4 leaves of lettuce piled on top of each other with a drizzle of dressing. And it's certainly not worth $7 if that's all you're going to give me. 

The meal, with wine, salad, entree, and dessert can get pretty pricey, but I woke up and wanted the bone-in for breakfast. OK, that didn't sound right...

One more thing...if you're thinking of having cocktails before dinner, I'd suggest someplace else - the bar is really, really small and doesn't feel very cozy...
author: Kate S.

description:
As it turns out, aging a steak longer does indeed turn it into a melty, crackalicious piece of beef heaven.  I love steak.  And for me, Morton's has nothing on Boboquivari's.  (Value-wise, your best bet is Argentina, but only if you're already there as the plane fare can dice up the equation somewhat.)  

Bobo's has the best steak I've ever eaten in America.  To be clear, I should say that I love melty filets, and don't have as much appreciation for the rougher cuts that many steak connoisseurs feel give more flavor.  But the bone-in filet here blew me away.  So did the twice-baked potatoes.  I'm from Oklahoma, and I guess I like my steaks and potatoes to be extra rich and luscious in my mouth.  Check, and check.  I'm requesting Bobo's for my next birthday dinner.

And decor?  I hardly remember to mention it, I'm so preoccupied with the filet I ate ...
author: Jes H.

description:
Absolutely my favorite Steak House in the city. The staff is always on the ball, the waiters are attentive without being overbearing, and The Steak is definitely the best here. I always pick the Filet Mignon, and this cut here is like butter that melts under your knife. If you want more flavor, they also have this cut available "bone-in", and it is delicious. Their sides are not spectacular, but always tasty and well-presented. The heirloom tomato/mozzarella/avocado salad is to die for, and I find that in general their salads are always winners. In most steakhouses I always have to add salt to the steak to add flavor, and eat a starch alongside. At bobo's everything is perfect as it is, and the steak is so succulently delicious that you don't want anything spoiling its flavor.
Lark Creek Steak comes close, but bobo's still holds first place in my meat-loving-little-heart.
author: Caro T.

description:
I think I remember the sides being good, but honestly the steak stood on its own and made it hard to notice anything else.  

They have some crazy dry aging process that results in just unbelievable tasting meat.  I got the bigger filet, which my date promised to help me finish it as I assured him there was "no way" I'd be able to do it all myself upon ordering.  Annnd . .  yeeea, lets just say that I'm still wondering if he was grossed out at how quickly I inhaled the whole thing.  It was seriously so so good I just could not help it!   Big fan of the steak here.  Think it just may be the best steak I have ever had.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Drove by this restaurant and was curious so I looked it up on yelp. Went the next day for a family dinner --- 6 of us. The mussels, crab and shrimp plate was great --- lots of mussels and crab (a bit skimpy on the shrimp) for my partner, but shared with the rest of us.:) Great presentation and taste --- lots of butter. 

The steaks --- filet mignon with bone were enjoyed (and the bones by our doggies) by my brother and son --- they thought it was the best steak ever. My Mom and I had the petite filet mignon (great taste, tender but a bit small).

They comp'ed my StepDad the crab cakes (yummy) as they forgot them. His sunfish was great too. 

They also comp'ed us two of the mousse cones so we would have one for each of us!

Drinks were great, so was the service and food. Cute sort of 60's decor place. Food was great, staff was great and it was fun for a special family dinner. :)
author: Debbie C.

description:
No need to talk about the bone-in filet.  It's already popular and we all know to order it.  
The real secret treasure at Bobo's is the Iron-skillet Roasted Mussels, shrimp, & crab.  We were a little hesitant to try the seafood at a steak joint, but I just might have to say I thought it was better than the meat.  Don't get me wrong, I remember loving the steak; but I can't seem to stop dreaming about that sizzling hot platter of garlic butter drenched seafood. MMMmmm!

To save money, I suggest ordering one seafood platter & one bone-in filet.  It's definitely enough for two to share, and then Bobo's doesn't just have to be "a special occasion place."
author: Jen T.

description: We came here for our best friend birthday surprise party.  The service was great!! even when we first showed up- we told the staff that we're here for a surprise party. They gave us a nice sitting area upstairs. From the appetizers to the main course the food was awesome. The birthday girl was very surprised!! Thanks Bobo's for the wonderful experience. We will come back soon.
author: Erma N.

description: As Paula Deen would say, "I'm not your Cardiologist!"
author: Poochie M.

description:
Please get someone in the place that knows how to buy wine. The steaks are just about the best in the city, crab is a garlic butter masterpiece but the other sides are a little weak. How hard is it to make good creamed spinach anyway?  They will let you bring your own wine for a 15$ corkage fee. Make mine a magnum please....Oh 
the bone in filet is a darn good piece of meat but order it a little more done then you normally would because it will get rare near the bone.
author: michael h.

description:
Despite all the mixed reviews regarding this restaurant, the bf and I decided to try it out anyway.

Ambiance: Italian Carnivale decor with red walls, paintings all around, mixed colored curtains. Different rooms for dining, including an upstairs level. The bathroom is unisex, which isn't my cup of tea...but farely clean.

Food: Do not miss out on the Filet Mignon. My bf and I ordered both steaks at medium and it was cooked to perfection. Note: The petite Filet mignon is 5 oz. and perfect for a tiny appetite. I'm not sure what they sear it in, but it was amazing! We also ordered the Portabello Mushroom and  twice-baked potato as sides, which were perfect additions to the meal. The mushrooms were marinated in a butter sauce and potato was cooked with cheese and zucchini. Dinner is also served with caper and olive oil bread (yummy!).

Dessert: We ordered the mousse cones, which come with 4 small orders. They were light and not too filling. 

Service: I guess we lucked out because our waitress, Erin was extremely attentive and great!

Overall phenomenal experience.
author: Anne K.

description:
Old fashioned, in a good way. 
Quiet: you can talk easily (gasp!).
Burrata is the new black (but still good...).
author: Mick G.

description:
Holy hell, their steak is so completely satisfying, i think I've had semi-erotic dreams about it. Wine was deliciious, decor interesting, private booth pretty cool. 

The only thing distracting me from an amazing meal was the horrifying noise coming from a table across the room. Turned out to be a birthday boy aspirating his sirloin while his friend pounded him repeatedly on the back. 

Folks,can we all agree that this is not the way to save your friend from dying in a choking situation?  There's a simple maneuver formerly known as the Heimlich which takes about two brain cells to execute. Learn it.

Thankfully the guy threw up on the table and saved himself, as his friend clearly was not up to the job.
author: deb C.

description:
Picture two friends, home for the holidays (e.g. we didn't leave town), and trying desperately to find something to eat for Thanksgiving dinner. After stopping short of having Andy's deliver more mediocre Chinese food (because they weren't open), we started searching for places on Yelp. Finally, I start using "Thanksgiving dinner" as the freaking search term after calling 10 or so closed places. At this point, I am starving, and my friend has popped open a yogurt while I do some research. We find Bobo's, open late, still serving, and willing to seat us first come, first serve at some special tables in the front if we make it before the kitchen closes at 10pm. Um, how fast can we get there on Muni? 

The filet mignon was so amazing. The twice baked potato was so creamy. The sweet potato was like a little piece of Thanksgiving heaven, and really, all in all, this was one of my greatest Thanksgiving memories. Great food and wine, friendly service, and a beautiful venue will make Bobo's a new favorite of mine.
author: cynthia c.

description: Great steaks and fantastic Mac and Cheese. Our party had pretty much all the sides and found them all excellent. Seafood appetizers were very good as well. All in all, a great meal and great service.
author: alamedabrian m.

description: Delicious!! Steaks are so good they practically melt in your mouth! For the appetizer I recommend the sizzling mussel and crab dish.
author: Steph S.

description:
BEST STEAK I'VE EVER HAD! 

I came here a few months back from my boyfriend's birthday dinner. I was a little hesitant, but was more than pleasantly surprised. Ambiance was a  little kitschy, but dim and intimate. Service was impeccable. 

I tried/ordered: 
Crabcakes: YUM
Lobster soup: delicious, but would have like more than one piece of lobster
Mashed potato: REALLY salty, had to send it back, but the server was totally cool about it and very helpful. 
Bone-in Filet Mignon: ORGASMICALLY GOOD. I've never had one before, but the server recommended that if they have it available, it's definitely the best thing on the menu. She wasn't kidding. The bone adds so much flavor! It was juicy, tender and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. My favorite part? PERFECTLY cooked. Even in really swanky joints, I find that my steak is never cooked the way I want, but this was exactly to my liking. Medium Rare, on the just slightly rarer side. Pink, red in the center, and very juicy. 

I've been saving up to go again ever since. Thanks to my stimulus check, I now have reservations for Sunday!!!
author: Arsie J.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written about my favorite steak restaurant in SF.  My husband and I have been coming here for the last 7 years whenever we want to satisfy our steak and seafood craving.  We don't come here as often as we'd like so we always end up ordering the same thing:

-Crab cakes - oh so yummy and full of crab meat and topped with dried cranberries.  Usually when I order crab cakes elsewhere, it comes with a sauce.  These scrumptious cakes have no sauce but the pairing with the cranberries is surprisingly delicious!
-Double shrimp double crab - comes out on a sizzling skillet with 2 different types of butter
-Filet mignon-bone medium rare - the meat is so tender and melts in your mouth!  We split one since the portion is fairly large 
-Swiss chard - cuz you know, you have to have veggies

The only thing we don't like is that the portions for the shrimp in the "double shrimp double crab" have steadily decreased over the years and they started using smaller shrimp.  Nonetheless, that platter is still one of my favorite parts of coming here.

The service is usually great (with the exception of the last time we came here for my husband's birthday on Thursday).  They implemented an electronic order pad and it took the waitress a little longer than usual to get 
our orders vs writing it down the old fashioned way. 

One of these days we're gonna venture out and try other things on the menu...it's about time after 7 years of coming here!
