Can't wait for our next visit!
author: Lisa O.

description:
Ok i have been here 5x and everytime i come the food gets better n better. Love this place from the food to the service to the ambiance. You get free valet and there service is just great!!!!

Highly reccommend:

Starters-Mussels
Dinner-Filet Mignon
Sides-Twice baked potatoes

If you are a meat eater this is the restaurant for you. very Juicy, tender meat that i gaurantee u have never had. Food is a little  pricey but well worth it.
author: Nadiya M.

description:
6 of us went to celebrate a friend's birthday last night.  The bartender was great and attentive.  It went down hill from there.  We were seated in an upper dining room.  To make a really long story short . . . he was stretched so thin by the front door by serving other areas in addition to ours.  The service was horrific from start to finish.  For the prices they charge!  Yikes!  We should have have gone to ALFRED'S which is so far superior, consistent service, quality of food and great service.   The food was mediocre at best.  However, we poured our own wine and water...waited forever for the appetizers (which is when the nice, warm bread was served & not beforehand!) and waited and waited for our dinners.  We complained.  The manager came by the table.  But nothing changed!  A "special" (and comp dessert) was brought to the birthday boy.  However, the waiter never took anyone's dessert order prior!  We complained again.  Terrible timing and lack of attention and detail completely.  Poor guy!
It was a disaster!  Did I mention we should have gone to Alfred's?  Patrick J.
author: Patrick J.

description:
I must say that I am a huge fan of Bobo's. Their steaks are among the best I have ever had. And the strange decor is even growing on me. The prices are a bit high, but its a good place to go for a special occasion. They have a reasonable wine list and the sides are awesome. 

I usually get the lobster soup, the filet and share the potato. I don't think that I have ever heard a negative thing about this restaurant. If my waistline and wallet could handle it, I would eat there every night.
author: Matthew F.

description:
I've recommended this place to 10 or so people and have been there 4 times myself.  Each time I go, I am amazed by how good the steak is.  They used to have a sign that said "Best steak you've ever had. Period".  That was a few years ago, but it drew me in cuz I likes steak.

It was the best bone-in filet I've ever had so I started recommending it to people.  I've always had great service, and an outstanding steak.  I also read other Yelpers complaining about the service.  I just haven't seen that, but maybe I've been lucky.

In my experience, this is a top notch steak house.  I've tried most of the steakhouses in SF and I believe this to be the best in terms of flavor and texture of a medium-rare filet (one of my favorite foods).  I would eat there twice a week if I had a higher paying job.

Mmmmmm, Bobo's.  The best steak.  Period.
author: Full S.

description:
Went to Bobo's again with a couple of friends on Monday (I think I go there twice a year) and was pretty satisfied as usual. What keeps me from giving them a five is that the steaks are inconsistent. I've gotten 5-star quality steaks and overly salted 3-star quality steaks. I know that salting the meat brings out the taste, but too much salt ruins the steak. Not sure the bone-in is all that it is cracked up to be, but the filet mignon is always pretty solid. 

I should note that I absolutely love the mushroom side and am very fond of the zucchini fritters and onion rings as well. Had the Parmesan cauliflower for the first time on Monday and was nonplussed though. 

For the record service on Monday was impeccable and we definitely enjoyed the company of the bartender and hostess.
author: Pierre C.

description:
Wow, what a great place, 
A palatal fiesta, Great appetizers followed by the house's specialty: Bone filet mignon , never had a better steak.Ever.
author: Salim H.

description: Great strip, only wish they had a ribeye.  Service was very odd, but overall a good experience.
author: Amjad S.

description: My wife, our 15 year old son, and myself had dinner at Bobo's the day after Thanksgiving, 2010. We had read about how highly rated the steaks were, but after arrivingI was  a little weary, the place looked small on the outside and as you enter it is quite cramped. From the time we started to order to the time we paid the check, we were all  very impressed, from the appetizers to salads, to the main entrees, it was all delicous. The service was well done. The steaks were as good as I have ever had and even better. Just last week we had a very nice dinner at Alexanders in Cupertino, the steaks at Bobo's were actually better, i am very impressed, as is my wife and son. BTW, awesome martinis too!! We loved the whole experience!
author: Richard J.

description: This place is simply the best. On our last visit, the service was a bit inattentive. I should say, actually, that the supporting service staff (runners, etc...) were all warm, friendly -- amazing. However, our main server generally seemed distracted. Likely it was an off day. We all have them. Here's the thing, the place is wonderful! The food is amazing. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the city. If somehow the service really went downhill, I'd re-adjust my 5-stars but as it is, that bone-in filet, the cast iron mussels, their bread, the sides, the wine list, etc, are all fantastic!
author: Cute N.

description:
OMG the filet mignon are so tasty, with the bone in it's incredible!
We had a whole crab in garlic sauce was excellent as well as the side dishes especially the baked potato is must. The bread or brioche with warm olive oil on top was a great start for the meal. I'm not a big fan of the decor a bit old to my taste but other than that I recommended it. I think it's the best steakhouse in SF!!
author: Mattin N.

description:
My foodie girlfriend took me here to see Lisa, the hot waitress.  She's THAT hot.  I naturally had about a hundred iced tea refills.

The food's good too.

I had a thought afterwards that these fancy steak houses with their complicated meat donenesses ought to just provide photos of the meat in each respective doneness so you can get what you want.  As much as we enjoyed hot Lisa's sultry verbal imagery, $40 is a lot of unnecessary gambling when they could just show you instead of telling you.  They could even put the photos in fancy leather-bound resume binders or something.
author: Dan C.

description:
I almost gave the restaurant 4 stars because the hostess had bad phone manners, but she ended up as sweet as pie in person, plus she gave us the perfect seat for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. Ladies, if you want a restaurant to impress your man while you can still feel sexy in a red-velvet-kind-of-way at the same time, this is your place. 

Our waitress was a gem in pigtails, and knowing it was our first time, she took good care to give us honest recommendations, including NOT to order a dessert just for the sake of a birthday candle (because the desserts weren't that great, so save your money, she said). I hate wait staff that try to inflate the bill with fillers, so the honesty went a long way with me...ok...the steak. It SANG in my mouth. My Honey had the bone-in fillet ( I know, oxymoron) and I had the surf 'n turf, which was exactly my speed; a l'il beef and a l'il seafood. We left so stuffed after ordering two salads, our entrees and two sides, so please order with caution. Of honorable mention: the twice baked potato -- it is not for carb or fat phobes. I actually felt I gained weight in my thighs with each bite, but it was so delicious and I love my Honey so much, I didn't give a damn.
author: Rue M.

description:
One of the rules for most steakhouses that serve beef that is graded "Prime" is to not order the Filet.  If it's Prime that means all the meat is tender and you should go with a cut that has more flavor.

Bobo's breaks this rule.

Their dry age makes the Filet one of the most mind-blowing pieces of food to ever be set before you.  Add that to the gorgeous crab and you've got a night of debauchery only equaled by that time you woke up on the ground in the desert outside of Las Vegas with a stripper asleep in the driver seat of your rental and her panties on the windshield wipers.  

Bobo's has a killer menu with a great wine list and makes this San Francisco steakhouse better than almost any steakhouse in the country.  

Why are you still reading this?  You should be going to Bobo's.
author: Rick D.

description: Great price points and best Mac n Cheese!  We had a table of 5 and all agreed the steaks were done to perfection, we had 3 bone in Filets and 2 bone in NY Strips.  The price point for most steaks was $36, which is far less than many competitive steakhouses such as Flemings, Forbes Mill, Ruth Christs, Morton's, Donovan's and the like.  In addition, a bottle of 05 Alexander Valley Jordan Cab was $79.  Had this same bottle two nights earlier at Joe Dimaggio's and the price point was $110.  Their Modern Mac n Cheese was the best steakhouse mac n cheese I've had to date.  Lastly, the Dungeness Crab legs were every bit as good as their steaks.  Highly recommend Bob's
author: Mike M.

description:
Service: A/C
Food: A
Decor: B+ 
Dessert: B+

The maitre d needs to be sent to Monique's charm school. He was extremely rude in notifying us that we can't be seated because the whole party wasn't present. Later on, he threatened to cancel my reservation because two people hasn't shown up and he claimed that the restaurant was completely booked. Ironically, three tables around us was never occupied by any human beings during our 2.5 hours dining time.

Our server, on the other hand, was very sweet and attentive. In fact, she was so nice that we decided to share her our birthday cheesecake.

The outstanding food: bone-in filet mignon, crab cakes, chocolate cone. Those who like classic steak might be better off visiting Harris and those who enjoy flavorful steak will enjoy the bone-in filet mignon in Bobo's.
author: Fred F.

description:
Mmmm MEAT...

I've been to a lot of steak houses and I can even cook a mean steak at home. Most steak houses have disappointed me because of this. Boboquivari's is one that I actually go back to repeatedly.

The service seems to be hit or miss but the food more than makes up for it. The Fontina Cheese and Artichoke Fondue for an appetizer is AMAZING!! You could share this with 3-4 people.

I usually order the Petit Filet Mignon because I get full easily. It melts in your mouth and they cook it exactly as you request it. No underdone/overdone here! For sides, the Sauteed Garlic Swiss Chard was a perfect companion to my bloody meat steak.

Here's the crappy stuff that happened service-wise...I want to write about it in hopes they improve. If you clear plates off the table and you remove a person's knife or fork, REPLACE THE SILVERWARE! Sitting and staring at your food with no way to eat it sucks. I guess you could eat with your hands but that's not very lady-like. Also, what is up not giving us a seperate spoon for our coffee and dessert? I don't really want to dunk my dessert covered spoon into my coffee.

Oh yeah and I had the pear tartlet for dessert last time and it sucked. You need a knife to cut through that thing!

Otherwise, definitely come here if you are craving some moo cow. With a nice bottle of wine, it ended up being about $80 a person.
author: Cindy P.

description:
A friend of mine dined here before the Cyndi Lauper Concert last year and we are big fans of Filet Mignon, and Bobo's is to die for.  

Bobo's cocktails are creatively made by bartenders and always great and refreshing to taste.  

Bobo's is a contender with Morton's and Ruth Chris!  Definitely a great place to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, and life itself!
author: Kevin W.

description: My friend told me this place was a game changer. He was right. The bone-in filet was the best cut of meat I have every experienced. Dry aging the meat is the key. The brussle sprouts are a must. The twice baked was incredible.
author: David R.

description:
This is actually a really good restaurant. I was impressed by the quality of their food despite the unassuming outward appearance. 

The steaks are perfect. I cannot ask for a better piece of meat at this price. Bone-in- is the key... the flavor from the bone gives the meat its beefy taste. The texture of their steak is really exceptional--soft and tender. The sauce and juice are a perfect blend. Portions are good and you don't feel 10 lbs heavier walking out of the place. I also like the fact that they don't try to throw a lot of butter onto their meat, in an effort to make a piece of dry meat taste better (unlike another steakhouse on Vanessa). 

The atmosphere is good... very ambient lighting.. A good place for small party or a date. However, the last time I went there, we were seated at a very awkward table where we were perpendicular to another table next to us.. and in a lousy attempt to create privacy for us, they put up some pink see throw curtains.. but we really... how much privacy can you get from that.
author: Charlie W.

description:
Avocado and tomato wedge romaine salad, Moscow mojito, wine brought in by friends, and a HUGE bone-in filet....  makes for a happy girl.

It's not cheap, but it's a nice treat.  I split the meal with a friend and that was a good choice, even though the dress I was wearing could have fit a few more steaks in there.

Major props for complimentary valet parking!!!?!?!?!  I would probably come back here just for that.

Make a reservation and enjoy some fine meat.  That's what she said.
author: Laura B.

description:
First off, the decor is weird and uncomfortable. (I'm scare of clowns.)   Besides that, I have to say the in bone filet is hands down the best steak I've ever tasted. That's a bold statement!! It's like butter melting on a hot skillet when it touches your tongue. OMG. 

The appetizers are just okay. Maybe not worth it. Be prepared to spend a little under $100 per. Bring your own wine. Their wine is way overpriced and their corkage fee is only $15.

Why only 4 stars and not 5?....................The clowns. Whoa.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: All I have to say is the best fillet mignon ever by far melts in your mouth mmmmmmmmm !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Giovanni S.

description: Fantastic steak! Tremendous texture and flavor.  The seafood combo was equally great --best muscles I've had to date, love the serving method as it keeps everything hot and tasty.  Bravo, will return again as long s this keeps up!
author: David R.

description:
It's all about the meat. Forget the outdated, cheesy lounge decor. Focus on the food.

The steak was awesome and melted in my mouth. This is what dry-aging should be. The tuna carpaccio appetizer was great. The bread was different, perhaps a bit too oiled, but it was still good. I had a side of yam, which was very good; I would have it again. The desert (chocolate bomb) was tasty, and it was even more impressive with a '66 port. 

I went there tonight with my husband on a whim, and we were not disappointed. This place is a find. The steaks were better than Ruth's Chris', we thought, but the side offerings weren't. Bobo's ties with Ruth's for us, and that was definitely a Sunday night surprise.
author: Jennifer P.

description: One must try it to believe it. Reading reviews doesn't do Bobo's the slightest bit of justice.
author: Jack W.

description:
I came here with an out of town guest. We are both steak lovers and have heard great things about this place. I made a dinner reservation for 8pm but called to let them know we were running late. The hostess was very friendly and accommodating since it was Sunday night and they probably weren't very busy. We get there around 8:30pm and only had to wait a few minutes before getting seated at a booth right next to a window. The decor is done in reds and reminds me a bit of a dark circus with the multicolored lights. The booths are back to back so you can easily overhear other people's conversations if they forget to use their indoor voices. That was the case with this drunk lady in her 40's and her 60+ year old husband at the next booth. 

We started off with the Yellowtail carpaccio appetizer. I could have eaten 3 more plates of that on my own! The fish melted in my mouth and the balsamic vinegar and fresh chopped peppers they added were very complimentary! Next came our mains. I got the petite filet mignon with a side of yams. Chris got the surf and turf which came with crab and a petite filet. The meat was so soft and tender that I almost didn't need a knife to cut it. We both ordered it medium rare which is the only way to eat this kind of quality meat. My first bite was so flavorful and the combination of the yams provided for a sweet and savory treat in my mouth! The crab on Chris' dish looked really good, but was a bit salty for my taste. Besides, you can go to Chinatown and buy your own live crab and prepare it to your liking for a fraction of the price. Since we were already running late to meet some friends for drinks we didn't have time for dessert.

Overall, the steak was excellent and the service was top notch. Our valet was very courteous and went out of his way to open my car door for me. I will be back the next time I'm craving a nice juicy filet!
author: Danielle W.

description:
Went here with my Dad for a little birthday dinner ("dad, take me out for a meal")

We both had the bone-in filet. I thought it was good, nothing too crazy; I think I would have prefered a.. ahem.. "deboned" cut. However, days later my dad was still raving about this place, saying "I've told everyone" that it was "the best steak I remember having". I've only seen that kind of exuberance from him when he's being reunited with White Caste or Portillo's after a long hiatus.

Good service, but no beers on tap as I recall.
author: Mike W.

description:
So they lost our reservations, then had us wait 30 minutes to put us in a terrible table. LIsten if are positioning yourself as a premier steakhouse, you gotta get your sh#t together. How about offering some comp coctails or at least an apology. I walked out before trying the food so not sure but I would avoid them. Seriously disappointed, you and Ruth's can fight it out for over-priced-underacheivers of the year.

OK after much arm twisting I have revisited Bobo's. And much top my surprise it was a great surprise when hostess was very nice and had the reservation and seated us in a great seat. Then the waiter did a spot on job of dialing us in to the bone in filets and twice baked potato. Damn guys, nice work. They held the steaks while we finished our smokes and then delivered one of the best filets I have ever tasted. Buttery fork-cuttable smooth texture and rich flavor will hav eme visiting again. Paired with a super good creamy lush pinot and you have a perfect dinner. I was suprised... first impressions can be a bad thing I guess. The only downside was a starter that another table ordered od super hot mussels and other seafood filled the room with a thick unpleasant smell. So they don't get 5 stars... for that. Other than that, nice job Bobo's I am a believer now.
author: Robert A.

description:
The Great Steak-Out

If you happen to like steaks and the circus this is the place for you.  Sitting in a cozy corner of Boboquivari's circus wagon, you'll see the faces of satisfied carnivores digging into steak filets of every size.  The bread is crispy and dripping with butter and garlic; while the twice baked potato is baked once with chives and then kneaded into fluffiness by the hands of virgins.  Simply awesome.  The steak is cooked to perfection, and melts in your mouth like smooth butter.  The only thing that would make this place better is if your dinner came with a man.  Since it doesn't, bring your own and his credit card...order the surf and turf and let your mouths do the drooling, because these are high steaks.
author: Tina P.

description: Outstanding.  The bone-in Filet was one of the best steaks I've ever had.  I personally hate brussels sprouts... but my two friends who like them raved about them.  The crab salad is very good and so is the Swiss Chard.  Service was solid.
author: TG F.

description:
Thank God for cows...

The steak was pretty much perfect.  Medium-rare, bone-in fillet, cooked just right.

Appertizers were great as well - shrimp, mussels and crab cakes.  The crab cakes were especially good.
author: James R.

description: We thought we would give Bobo's a try after falling in love with the Dead Fish in Crockett.  This was by far the best steak we have ever had.  The service was nice and our server was very pleasant.  The restaurant is dimly lit, a lot of wood details, very quaint, very romantic.  The restaurant is smaller and the booths for 2 can be quite a squeeze, but it was well worth it to have such a wonderful and memorable meal.
author: RedCub S.

description: This is the weirdest restaurant I've ever been too in SF..... but the food was really good. We felt like we were eating inside a circus and most of the people there were kind of eclectic (I guess that's the only way I can describe them). Everything we ate was good but especially the steak.... We all agreed it could be some of the best steak we had ever tasted. We tried a few different dishes and our favorites were the muscles, the bone in fillet and the lobster with burrata crostini.
author: Rolo A.

description: I was in San Francisco for work, and extended the trip to visit with some friends the weekend of August 2, 2013.  After spending Saturday with a small group in Napa at a few wine tastings, one of the locals in the group was craving a steak, and everyone suggested Bobo's for dinner.  I walked in with my friend and was a little thrown by the quirky decor, but the food and service were AMAZING!!  Our waiter was so friendly, and the five of us split the crab feast as an appetizer (the best I've ever had), and my friends all had the bone in filet, while I had the whitefish.  We split a few bottles of wine, enjoyed the company, and I can say it was one of my favorite dinners I've had in a while.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Alyson Y.

description: One of the best steak houses I've been to ever! Must try the bone in filet mignon! Also try the iron skillet with mussels! Amazing! Dessert was ok...
author: Mai N.

description: LOVE this place! im not a steak girl at heart...but somethng about the luxe decor..the intimate seating..and friendly staff makes me want to swim in red wine and pair it off w a juicy steak.  Great for a date night...desserts are amazing....atmosphere 2 thumbs up
author: debbie l.

description: All in all a good experience: The bread is a wonderful start - focaccia drizzled with garlic-herb olive oil I think. I ordered the surf and turf... the crab flavor was good, but it was a little dry. It's a great deal if you want both meat and seafood. My filet was fine... I don't think it beats Ruth's Chris. I also tried some of my boyfriend's bone-in filet which, although a little juicier than a regular filet, is good, but not mindblowing or anything. Tip: the bones make an EXCELLENT broth for soup if you take them home and simmer them. I wasn't a big fan of the sides... the twice baked potato just seemed cheesy, the yams were very sweet, and the chard was just okay. The waiter Did recommend a great bottle of wine $70, faust, I think. It came out to $360 for 3 bone-in filets ($39 each), 3 sides, 1 surf and turf, and a bottle of wine. Best steak and crab in the city? No... but definitely a good meal. Minus a few points (but not really) for being seated on the top floor with a crass group of businessmen, and then an extremely noisy birthday party.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Man, this place is amazing.

I had the bone-in filet, and I felt like I was eating for days... the thing was never-ending!! But sooo delicious!

We also had the mussels which were fantastic as well. My friend had the crab legs and she was all over those - i love that they cook it in its natural crab flavors.

If the prices were a little bit lower, this place would definitely get 5 stars.
author: Jae A.

description: This place is SO delicious ... The atmosphere is very unique and has a very intimate feel.  The service is very friendly and helpful. Bring some friends and order the crab feast, but save some room cause the steaks are to die for.  I always order the Bone-In Fillet Mignon.  From the first bite you know you are in for a treat... If I could afford coming here every week, I would!
author: Bobby S.

description:
So one night I looked over at my boyfriend and said "I need to go for a steak tonight". We looked over yelp for twenty minutes or so, and decided that Boboquivari's sounded like an interesting choice. Noting from previous reviewers that we needed to get the 'bone on' option, we jumped in the car and headed over to the Marina (a good lengthed drive from Bernal Heights).

The first great thing about this restaurant we found out was the valet parking. We drove around the block initially looking for parking but there was absolutely nothing, so we came to the restaurant expecting to ask someone, when we saw the 'free valet' sign. Excellent!

Walking into Boboquivari's is an experience in itself. It is styled with a Mediterranean circus theme, and done well. It was exciting place to be, and pretty romantic. We initially were seated in the entrance room booth area, but the seats were low compared to the table, and it wasn't very comfortable. So we asked to move to the other room, which is MUCH better. The room on the right has a far more relaxed and romantic ambiance, and proper chair-table format. If you're going on date night, reserve a table there.

Our waiter was very attentive and had well thought out responses to everything we asked. We ended up ordering the tuna carpaccio and crabcakes to start, and then two bone-in mignons for main, with the sweet potato and spinach sides. Our starters were delicious - excellently sized and well flavored and presented. It looked almost haute cuisine. One major big-up is their house bread -- clearly baked on the premises, unusually flavored and absolutely brilliant. To be honest, just asking for bread as an appetizer will leave you feeling pleased. By the time the main course arrived, I'd almost forgotten about my need for steak!

The steak itself was wonderful. I'm a huge carnivore with a love of red meat, so quite the specialist here. They got the medium-rare just right. Juicy, warm and rather red against the bone. Delicious! The steak was A-grade, melt-in-your-mouth quality, and the side dishes we selected were a great complement. Overall - fabulous.

However, when the bill came, we were slighted startled. We had chosen this place partially for its '$$$' rather than '$$$$' listing. Personally I would give it '$$$$' (it is definitely over $60 per person). The bill for two came to $289, before tip. So, either be a little more careful with your choices here, or save this place for a really special night out!
author: Sarah F.

description:
This review is for the Bone-in Fillet Mignon.  Sweet mother of Steaks... it's beautiful.  

The baked potato was probably the best I've ever had, and the Swiss chard was super tasty.  

For dessert, had the pistachio panna cotta with mango sauce and a bit of mint - excellent.

Minus one star for putting sauce on that excellent cut, and perfectly cooked, meat.  The meat is so good, a sauce actually takes away from how good it is.  Bone's in Atlanta is a great example of amazing steak... just great meat, cooked to perfection, and the only sauce is pure blood.
author: Dan M.

description:
I have no idea how many times I have been here, but it's a lot. I've been to most all of the steakhouses in the city and Bobo's is my favorite. The bone-in filet is incredible, sides are good, and the sizzling seafood skillet appetizer is an absolute must. 

They have arguably the best steaks around, (we could split hairs all day about Harris's, Ruth's, etc...) but I like the fact they aren't the traditional steakhouse atmosphere. It's not quite as dark, a little bit louder and the staff tends to be younger and fun.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
*******  UPDATED 1/9/08 *******

Hubby and I went here again when his parents were in town and everyone raved about it for the rest of the trip.  Sadly, the mac and cheese I loved is off the menu, but I did try to bone-in filet and it was heavenly!  I'm talking melt in your mouth delicious!  I think I found a new favorite!  I also had the rasberry champagne sorbet which was so refreshing and lovely.  It was a perfect meal.

*************************


This is a special place for me and my husband.  This is one of designated date spots and I'm addicted to the surf and turf.  The crab is perfectly seasoned and the butter is divine.  The filet is so tender you can cut it with your fork.  Other goodies are the mod mac and the curried lobster soup.  I always leave here fat and happy!
author: Jessica H.

description:
I've been to Bobo's several times and they continue to deliver.  The kitschy, jester-themed steakhouse always presents a special experience and leaves you stuffed to the brim.  The steaks could be the juiciest, most buttery cuts I've ever tasted.  The sides are amazing as well; the twice-baked potato in particular is a great complement to any of the steaks.  I've had the porterhouse (cooked separately to ensure that both chops are done to perfection...essentially a small filet and a NY), and the bone-in filet.  I don't get the hype around the bone-in; all of their cuts are dry-aged to perfection and the bone-in wasn't an order of magnitude better as everyone seems to proclaim (both were amazing though).

Went there with a big group and the service was great.  We took over one of the rooms on the second floor and the waiter was very friendly and meshed well with the group.  He also decanted an imperial (6L) of BV George de Latour for us.  We were able to strike a deal with mgmt for the corkage, although they did try to pull the "corkage is for each 750 ml bottle" trick (it ISN'T!  Corkage is to cover the overhead of serving wine, cleaning glasses, etc...not to make up for lost revenue.  It isn't 8 times harder to open a 6L as it is to open 8 750 ml bottles...it's slightly harder but not linear with size.  Call it diminishing marginal effort (logarithmic perhaps?).  Either way, restaurants could bring wine prices down from the stratosphere and people will stop bringing their own bottles!...But I digress....

Despite the corkage diatribe (that is common to all restaurants, and just happened to surface in this review...), I give a top rating for Bobo's and I can't wait to return.
author: Nate H.

description:
Bone in filet!  Just order it...One of the best steaks of my life.

Interesting decor...Very red!
author: Bleep S.

description: This place is very overpriced and the lighting was very odd - reddish pink lights that are a bit creepy.  My niece was afraid to go in.   $8 sounds reasonable for sides, but what you get is not worth that.  Cauliflower was nothing special - about 1/4 of a head and was supposed to be sauteed but still almost raw. The onion rings side - 7 rings.  That's really a rip off.  You can get all the salads and sides at Mel's Diner - same quality, less money.  The steaks were good but not cooked as requested - two of us had to send them back (one had to go back twice) because they were purple and very rare instead of medium rare. The waitstaff, however, was attentive and nice.  Oh, and when we made the reservation they told us we had to be out by 8pm for the next party.  So we were all nervous when we were getting close to 8pm.  Not a good way to ensure a nice dining experience.
author: Amy H.

description: Place sort of looks like a more glamorous TGIF, but I came for one thing and one thing only and that was the bone-in filet. It was delicious. Definitely worth the hype.
author: Tim B.

description:
Went to BoBo's on Friday.  Tried the Bone in New York cut, as suggested by others, and it actually turned out pretty good.  Then I had a taste of the Bone-in filet and that was even better!

I was told to try BoBo's because I always rave about Morton's Canjun Ribeye, but after tasting both, I still think that it remains undetermined which one is better.  Here is the reason:

At BoBo's, you can't order a Canjun seasoned slap of meat, now if I had ordered the regular bone in at Morton's then I would have something to compare it too.

But all in all a great dining experience.  Comp valet parking was available.  Wasn't too crowded and the waiter was attentive.  

The Q-Ball tasted like a glorified Mojito, but was still tasty and refreshing.

Their olive bread is also delicious (big bread fan).  [Which always causes complications with me because I get full of the bread!  (Bread butter and sugar, for those who haven't tried it, try it!)  We can it the poor man prison food.]
author: Eric W.

description:
As others have noted this place makes the BEST filet in the city.  Although, I'm a small guy so I usually order the petite filet.  This steak melts in your mouth like a steak flavored m&m.

Why not 5 stars?  Their sides aren't the best and all the weird clowns everywhere freak me out.

But if I ever want to get a petite filet I come here because it is so f-ing good.  If you are in the mood for a steak do yourself a favor and go to Bobo's.
author: Jake A.

description:
Bobo's certainly serves up a mean steak! I went here for the first time about a month ago and still rave about the place. 

We started our meal with the Basil Martinis (which is why the place got a 4 star, not because the drink wasn't delicious, but because the drink was small for the price you pay!) and the whole crab (the waiter was even kind enough to break it up for us!). The crab was amazing. 

I then chose the bone-in filet mignon (which wasn't small at all, but enormous). They cooked the steak perfectly and it almost melted in my mouth. 

We ordered a slew of sides as well, but can't recall what they were as the steak really was the main event here. 

We went on a Friday night with a reservation, but showed up early and they were able to accommodate us. I am married, but this place may not be the best for a first date (there isn't enough action to keep you occupied), the room we were seated in was very quiet, but cute.
author: Alisa S.

description:
Do I like steaks? I do!

I come here every now and then and each time I can't help but thinking that vegetarians are missing something... 

My takeaways on Bobo's: always great and perfectly cooked steaks(I always choose the filet mignon, rare, slightly going on medium), good side veggies, not amazing but still OK wine list, good desserts, fun ambiance and even if the service is not always perfect, it's very good most of the time.
author: Lili G.

description:
Coming to a restaurant like Bobo's with a $100 gift card can be wonderful and terrible. Wonderful because, well, it's $100 gift card. But terrible because you can indulge in many more things that you might not normally if you actually cared what the bill total came to. We started wtih several appetizers our favorite two being the crab cakes and burretta. Burretta I love pretty much anywhere, but it was fantastic here we got the plain but I can't wait till next time to try it with a few different combo's. I wasn't expecting the crab cakes to be anything really exceptional, I like crab cakes in any normal setting, but these were the best crab cakes we've ever tasted we were considering ordering another round of them they were so dang good. The cranberries on the side was a great unique addition to the already very tasty fresh crab. The wedge salad was good.. but honestly too much dressing. I am a huge blue cheese fan so I felt odd not loving it, but it really isn't your typical wedge, it's a few long leaves of baby romaine and then a very large portion of dressing. It would have been great if i just had more lettuce to spread the dressing around. That said, it was an extremely rich and flavorful blue cheese, just overpowering with the lack of lettuce. We also got the lobster soup - good, but the curry made it a little stronger and different than I'd hoped, not so much of a lobster bisque as in creamy yummyness, the curry just gave it a zing that i didn't really want or need.  
Now onto the main event - the steaks! Well the hubby splurged and got the porterhouse. Um... is it common knowledge that a porterhouse is actually 2 full on steaks? We are big meat eaters, bbq, shop for beef ourselves, and have visited quite a few steak houses in our lives and I felt very silly not knowing that was what a porterhouse was, as did he. So we were a little surprised to see the full on NY and the filet mignon presented to him when the entree'scame out. At first we thought perhaps we ordered wrong. I got the surf and turf. The steaks were absolutely delicous. So tender, just the right amount of fatty goodness without seeming fatty. I wasn't a big fanof the crab. I love crab so i didn't dislike it by anymeans - but I just guess I prefer it without all the extra herbs and flavoring. I let the hubbs finish the crab and i stole a few pieces of his steak instead since he had an abundance.
Some of the desserts sounded ok, but after our meal we were totally stuffed and decided to skip dessert and walk home to try to walk off some of the delicous calorie packed meal.
author: Audrey V.

description: Superb steak.  I'm from Texas and I still dream of this steak. Greatest steak in the world, I swear. I'd travel back to SFO just to eat this steak.
author: Victor S.

description: I've been here twice so far and am about to go right now, I love the fillet, love the flavor of the meat, the Mac n cheese side is heavenly super cheddary! The wedge salad is the bomb cuzza the dressing!! The garlic bread they bring out is hot and buttery and it's like Hlf a loaf, the ambiance of the place is dim and romantic, service was awesome, and they were playing top 80's hots which just made the the experience more the better! I love this place so much, glad the concierge at the hotel in which I stayed recommended it or else I would have never known and been spreading the word to others!
author: Danielle M.

description:
I was nervous about trying this new steakhouse - but it's received pretty good reviews around the board. Bobo's offers free valet service, which was a plus! And their corkage fee was reasonable $15.

My husband and I ordered the Caesar's salad and the lobster bisque. I was very disappointed with the starters. The lobster bisque wasn't a bisque at all. It had chunks of lobster in a curry gravy sauce, which did not compliment the lobster. The salad wasn't bad, but I've had much better. I was about ready to leave because I wasn't prepared to spend $200 on a dinner that I was going to be disappointed with.

They brought out our entrees. We both ordered the surf and turf ($39), which is pretty reasonable. We were pleasantly surprised with the quality. I still like Harris' Steakhouse better. I probably wont go back - to many choices in San Francisco.
author: Carol P.

description:
The best fillet I've had anywhere in the world hands down.  Great flavor, soo tender. 

I ordered the "petite" which certainly left me wanting more!!!  

The waiter was so professional and polite and soft spoken he had so much class and dignity about him. 

That said the only thing keeping it from being a true 5 star restaurant by professional standards are that the decor is atrocious (reminds me of Bucca di Bepo for Pete's sake) and your plate comes with nothing on it..  Not even garnish, and certainly no extras. 

Oh  and if you wanna put some "extras" on it that's 7 bucks a pop.  :-( Too rich for my bank.    Oh and I had to pay 2bucks for my damn bread.  Kinda sad, I'm not cheap but for a restaurant of this caliber that's stingy.
author: David W.

description:
I have to start by saying that my boss' last name is Bobo and I already had positive connotations with the steakhouse before working at my current job.  With that being said -- DO I LOVE THE STEAK HERE.  

The atmosphere is a lil kitchsy, which makes it fun to be around -- its also a bit dark and bring-a-date-here-y.  The waiters that I've had (one was the manager and a couple regular waiters) have always been rather attentive (altho I've been known to flag down a waiter or two instead of waiting for them to come to the table) and the service was pleasant and unpretentious.  Also, curbside valet - my best friend - is always a great thing.

Onto the food.

BUTTER.  DRY-AGED.  MEAT.  I am a woman of many passions, but when you combine those three wonderful items together, it creates this deliciousness.  mmm.  steak. good.  and the crab salad that i've had before ain't bad either ;)
author: Glamorous D.

description:
**Update 10/19/07:  Recently had their bone-in filet mignon.  OMG.  The stuff steak-dreams are made of.  It was so good, we were speechless for a few minutes while our eyes rolled into the back of our heads.  ...On the other hand, don't ever get the 1/2 crab, 1/2 petit filet surf and turf.  That was absolutely disappointing.  Crab was dry, the filet was merely passable.  Definately the worst dish i've ever had there. **

The steaks are fantastic.  I LOVE steak and am a very discriminating steak eater.  

My favorite cut is the ribeye because of the texture, flavor, and marbling.  While Bobo's does not offer ribeye, I've had the filet mignon and the porterhouse, both times still being excellent.  I don't always love a filet mignon, as its a bit too lean for my tastes.  However, bobo's consistently does a fantastic job with the way they prepare the steaks.  I like mine rare, and they have not screwed it up yet.  And the flavor.  Love that rich browned butter flavor.  Velvety, melt in your mouth quality, with the perfect char on the crust.   In my pursuit of finding the best steaks in SF, Bobos consistently performs very high.

the scallops are very good too.
author: janice l.

description:
A good restaurant benchmark to live by is that if there are only two or three things on the menu, your chances are pretty good that they will all be excellent.

This is one of my favorite spots for steak in the city and is my go-to spot for crab.  I recommend sitting in the room upstairs, as you can get a decent view of the city.  The wine list is good - mostly California, but they still do have a good variety.  The setting is higher-end but not too fancy, and the prices are about what you would expect from a specialty/fine dining experience.

I first stopped in for dinner with a group of work colleagues and had a great experience.  The wait staff made good recommendations for sides and wine pairings, and both the crab and the steak were out of control.  They also have a few tasty ports on the dessert menu.  Overall tremendous experience.
author: a v.

description:
UPDATE
Been back a few more times. Steak is still tasty. No more cheese fondue though...
---------------
I went to Bobo's once and I thought the food was great. The steak was very tasty and I also enjoyed the cheese fondue. My dishes was a bit on the salty side but generally good and it did not spoil things.

Parking will be difficult.
author: kevin l.

description:
I'd never heard of this place until the week before I went... but I'll be sending any meat-eating lovers out here for steak from now on.  I think I had one of the best filets ever... so tender and juicy... my mouth is watering now as I type (when is dinner?!) ....  on top of that a great Zin (who woulda thought a ZIN would hold up to a steak?!... but it did!) to match...  

Not much to be said for the salad and sides, your standard stuff.  Definitely a leg up on Ruth's Chris...  thank goodness Bobo's steak doesn't come in a vat of butter!

Plus the 'free' valet... gotta love it, esp in the Marina.
author: Hayley L.

description:
Firstly let me say our party did enjoy the steak, hence the 1 star rating.
That's where it ends!
Decor was creepy fun house with lots of clowns and strange paintings. Very tight seating.
Waitstaff good..but Hostess the worst!! After receiving and paying our tab of $650..she asked us to leave for the next waiting party(she virtually said... get out)..never heard of such a thing at any restaurant!!! 
Tuna over dressed, blue cheese dressing ordinary, sides were greasy, fish fillet  swimming in salty sauce, shrimp uneatable so garlicky..all in all.. Do Not spend your money..VERY overpriced!, ordinary and rude hostess!!
author: z z.

description:
This is not your typical steakhouse, and what a treat that it isn't.  As soon as you walk into the place the wall decorations and colors bravely informs you that you are not in an ordinary restaurant and that you are about to experience something completely different taking you out of your comfort zone.  At least that was my impression upon my first visit to this delectably funky place,  with its sumptuously simple fare, and a fun and energetic wait staff.

The menu doesn't have a large selection of beef cuts, but it does cover the "trinity" of the sacred cow cuts i.e., fillet mignon, New York strip, and porterhouse.  Over the past three years, I've directly or indirectly tried each cut and found the cuts to be generously portioned, and seasoned appropriately highlighting and not overpowering the fine quality of the beef.  A unique characteristic that I've had to make an adjustment to is the manner in which they serve a boneless porterhouse steak.  I'm not sure why it is served this way, and to see a sirloin strip and a fillet not connect by a thick and darken T-bone denies me of a very appetizing visual.  None the less, I still enjoy the contrasting textures and flavors between the toothy sirloin strip and the melt-in-your mouth filet.......ahhhhh beef heaven.
And so to move on, the dining experience is more than just about the steak of course.
The appetizers will certainly appease any palate served in the right portion size so as not satiate to early into the menu.  I especially enjoy the mussels, clams, crabs broiled atop a stone slab  seasoned with wine, garlic and herbs brought to the table sizzling and steaming along with bread for sopping up the infused juices.
The sides are a unique addition to the entree, tastefully and simply prepared, and as it is served on its own dish it adds a family style dining experience.  I typically don't order desserts and if I do it is usually a refreshing sorbet, but we've tasted their dessert menu and attest that it is a light, sweet and pleasant finish to an excellent meal.
This steakhouse rates highly in the categories of wait staff, mixologists, culinary presentation and preparation of steaks and sides, while at the same time successfully being something different.  A typical steakhouse feels stiffed collard, and looks staunchly male, and it is refreshing to see and feel a new look.  As selfish as it sounds, I know it will be an impossibility to keep this place a secret.  So I'll just concede to tell it like it is so that you can experience the fine dining experience of Bobos.
author: Oscar M.

description: Great steaks and crab, attentive and discrete service.  Had a nice quiet back-room table. Solid experience.
author: Jim R.

description:
My boyfriend actually found this place listed on Opentable.com. He wanted to take me out to eat for my birthday but wasn't sure where I wanted to go. He thought it would be nice to try something new, so he made reservations for Bobo's.

The place was easy to find, parking; however, was not. Cute place, sort of smart/casual type environment, and the staff was friendly.

He ordered the porterhouse with the twice baked potatoe, and I had the filet (well-done) with the twice baked as well. I could not believe the taste of the filet when I took my first bite! For a steak that has been cooked well-done, the flavor was unbelievable! Oozing with flavor, juicy and easy to chew. It was the best steak I've had, and was a wonderful experience. I was glad that we went there!

If you like a nice well done steak (some of us don't like seeing red!!), go to BOBO's for a fantastic flavorful filet! You will definately get it there :)
author: l w.

description: Just got out from Bobo's with my hubby for our 1st anniversary dinner. The food was amazing, the filet mignon melted in your mouth, espresso martini was delish, n dessert was the bomb. On top of that, our server Vitto( hope I spell it right ;p ) was extremely amazing. He deserves $35 tips from us. Can't wait to come back to Bobo's
author: Irene T.

description: My mouth is watering looking at all the photos...I miss this restaurant.  I was very fortunate to enjoy a dinner here.  The bone-in fill\et was exceptional and the mussels were out of this world.  My Dad raved about Bobo's for months and then he finally spoiled us too.  Whether he is treating someone as a thank you dinner to treating family from out of town, Bobo's is always a must.  He even took a Chef from a Country Club and she couldn't stop raving about the filet.  She had never had a filet so tender, juicy and flavorful before.  It is worth every penny and you'll be wanting more. 5 STARS
author: Michelle M.

description: GREAT STEAK! Love the sides, too. The Crab is awesome, too... but, again, The Steak can NOT be beat. I order the The Porterhouse and have never been disappointed. You won't even think about adding salt, pepper, or sauce to your steak... it's ready to eat. From the Pacific to the Atlantic, Bobo's steak is the best you'll taste! FREE valet, and all staff are courteous and competent to say the least.
author: Chris P.

description:
Great quality steaks in a quirky but classy atmosphere.

One thing not to be missed - the fondue.  It is dy-no-mite.

If youre looking for a good date place and youre not afraid to drop a little coin, this place is for you.  If youre looking for a fun atmosphere where you can keep the price down a bit - go to Izzy's.
author: Ken S.

description:
Best steak in the city, or anywhere. And I love steak, i don't recommend things lightly. Plus this place has no tourists or bridge and tunnel peeps. It's a local secret, please keep it this way

Get the bone in fillet!!! 

My boyfriend and I love to come here and share an order of crab, Cesar, the bone in fillet Mignon, suite potato creme brule.

Love it!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Bobo's is a quirky little joint.  

Our service (March 2007 visit) was very good. It was really slow that night, and they struck the right balance between attentive and leaving us be.  I appreciated that the waiter noticed that I didn't touch my starter (just too too much oil) and offered to replace it.  Since I was sharing someone else's outstanding mozzarella starter, I declined a replacement and he took it off our bill.

The highlight of the meal was the side order of twice-baked potatoes.  Please, can I have some more?!?
author: Jess S.

description:
Had our surly waiter been less engrossed about something other than his job, I would have easily given Bobo's a 5-star rating.

Undiscouraged, we focused our positive vibes on their highly-regarded medium rare boner-in filet minon and three pounds of dungeness crab in garlic sauce. Both entrees were perfectly punctuated with the distinct flavor of fresh rosemary. The dinner was prefaced with hamachi garnished with finely diced chilies, olive oil and ponzu sauce, followed by crispy crab cakes on a half-bed of dried cranberries. 

The evening was complimented with a brilliant hubby who concurred the dining experience by bringing an '03 Silver Oak Alexander Valley Cab. Well done! Someone's going to get some.
author: Miles G.

description:
Holy friggin steak!  There is only one reason to go to this place and that's the beef.  They do a nice sizzling crab platter to start which is nice to split with your friends, add some shrimp if you want, but don't worry this is just filler before the main event.  

The Bone in Fillet is by far the best steak I've ever had.  If I am going out to dinner, I'd almost never choose to go to a steakhouse, I find it boring.  Sometimes the meat is really good and that makes it worth while, and sometimes it's even better.  This is the tastiest meat you will ever find, and it gets better and better as you get to the bone.  When you get to the bone, the meat tastes like butter.  It makes you want to cry. Truely unbelievable!  I'm talking full on weeping folks.

I can go on and on about this beef, but I think it's best summed by a line a fully grown 50 year man from Chicago said, "This is the best steak I've ever had."  Do they know their steak in the midwest? Yeah they do.  

Go here, eat steak.  So friggin good.
author: Jon S.

description:
I went here for my friend's bday. We had a party of five. The steaks here were awesome! I along with a few people in my group got the filet mignon BONE IN!! Oh the flavor was wonderful! Also, we ordered 1 whole crab. and that was one of the best crabs i've ever eaten. On top of that, we ordered a side of mushrooms that had a really good sauce too!

The steaks are HUGE ... and comes on their own. (No sides included) if i were to do it all again, I'd probably split the steak with someone and then maybe order another crab and maybe some more sides!

The food really receives 5 stars, however im putting only 4 stars since our waiter was not too great. He forgot to give us a lot of things that he provided to our neighbors like a stand for our crabs and the leg crackers too. He didnt bring us any bread. He hardly refilled our waters, hardly checked on us and was a bit rude and impatient when taking our orders.

So yea, service was wacky but the food was awesome! OH and decor was very interesting too!
author: Hiyasmin D.

description: Best steak I've ever had. I'm 27, so that's not a ton. But my 65-year-old father and 66-year-old mother both agreed-- it was also the best steak that THEY have ever had-- and they've eaten a lot more steaks than I have! Bone-in filet mignon. KILLLLLLLLER! Also, the full crab was incredible. Soak up the juice with your bread. Heart-stopping mmm mmm good!
author: Finley W.

description: The steaks we good. The only thing I didn't care for was the price. It was a little too pricey for the dinner.
author: Russell T.

description: Great steak. Good salad. Mediocre sides. Expensive for what you get.
author: Rob M.

description:
So....as my HGSC (hot girl's steak club) met for yet another dinner, we decided to go to, none other than the clown restaurant itself. Not having really any knowledge of this place, I went in with completely no expectations. 
And to my delightful suprise, as well as my fellows club members, our dinner was tummy-grubbin great! On my plate? Petite filet (grilled medium rare), chewy, juicy, moist, and so soft that I could have cut it with my fork. And as flavorful as this steak was, I really think that the sides made the meal. Sides: brussel sprouts, swiss chard, portobello mushrooms, cauliflower and the modern mac n' cheese. Now although, I am a huge fan of veggies, I really think that the brussel sprouts and swiss chard were my favorite! Whatever spices they applied to the green medley will definitely have me coming back for more...
The atmosphere was pretty dark and tight, but they accomodated our party of 8 and our server was soo sweet and nice, it was a very topping to our meal! yum yum!
author: Jenn H.

description:
WHAT a disappointment all the way around We went to Bobo`s for our ten year anniversary. We started off with the heirloom toy box tomatoes for $9.95 it tasted good but it was only about eight yellow and red grape tomatoes with some onions and avocado we had the Dungeness crab crostini $14.95 it was very good we had the baby romaine salad $9.95 this was very bidder we sent it back and had it taken off the bill. for our entrees we had the Portobello mushroom steak $18.95 for two mushrooms it was very good. We had the filet mignon it comes la carte $43.95 I ordered it medium it came chard black on the outside and very rare (as in raw and cold in the the center) sent it back the next one came burnt black on the outside but the inside was a perfect medium. We had the twice baked potato $8.95 it looked so good until I took my first bite and it was gritty I turned it over and it looked like it had not even been washed it had dirt on it. For a high-end restaurant I must say this was very poor. The service was mediocre at best our appetizers plats set empty on the table for quite some time with the waitress walking buy three times we had to stack them up and set them on the edge of the table for here to take them.
We go out for nice dinners often it`s not that unusual for us to spend $200 for dinner but this was the first time I was sooo disappointed that I felt I had to write a review.
author: Bob S.

description: Steak hell. this is where old reputations go to die. For $50.00 us you can get a burnt piece of steak and mediocre crab. Heaven help you if you are buying the over priced watered down cocktails.
author: John L.

description: Everyone likes this place, some love it.  I got the petite steak and petite really does mean very small here and I'm not a fan of big steaks either. Expensive and overrated. French waiter was excellent and friendly though.
author: Jason E.

description: Went twice... love the Seafood platter.
author: T L.

description:
Ok.  downhill..

Below is what i wrote to the Manager on the 5th of Jan 2010

Her response was " I will look into this matter and email you in the next few days"  a few days have past, maybe she meant a few weeks..

Note i took a picture in the restaurant of the Porterhouse NY and attached it.

Dear (Mgrs Name, left it out on purpose),
 
I have been a customer of your establishment for several years.  I was actually introduced to your restaurant via a business meeting and have continued to be a patron ever since.  My experience in the past has been excellent.  Good food and great service.  I have tried many steakhouses around the Bay Area including the highly touted Alexanders in Cupertino, Bobs on Montgomery, EPIC, Mortons, etc.. and still find myself coming back to Bobos.
 
Yesterday however was one of my worst dining experiences.
 
Let me preface the occasion before i explain the experience.
 
The event was for two occasions, a birthday and entertaining guests on vacation from Sweden.  I made reservations for 12 at 8pm on Monday.  I was excited for my guests.
 
We arrived half an hour early with several people missing.  So, we crowded the bar with several of us ordering drinks.  The bar tab was a bit confusing for (stand in managers name), who i believe was the stand in manager for the night. Three different tabs total.  However, when (stand in mgrs name) was making the drinks, i believe she was a bit frustrated with the confusion of what was on which tab, understandable.  However, she made a comment to another, whom I believe was another server, in which she stated to something of the effect of, "I must have bad karma".  I overhead it, and thought nothing of it.  Still not necessary.  This was a foreshadow of what was to come.
 
When all the guests arrived, we sat and ordered.  Jessica did a wonderful job and was very friendly.  It wasn't until we received our steaks.  I ordered medium well and the birthday person ordered medium.  Both steaks were dry and well done.  So, I explained to Jessica that they were cooked well.  She took my steak back for the chef, and it was returned with the chefs reply that they were well done.  Jessica offered for me to see the manager, but i declined.  I told Jessica that it was fine, but after some convincing by people at the table i decided to talk to the manager on duty. 
 
This is were i felt i was treated very poorly.  Typically, restaurants who maintain good quality and service would not even question the customer and just fix the problem. The manager came to the table, and to my surprise it was the bartender (Stand in Managers name).  Excuse the spelling.  She asked me what was wrong, in which i stated the the NY was well done.  She looked at it and told me that it was medium well and that she has known the chef for a very long time.  So i was questioned in front of my guests.  (Stand in mgr)  further stated that the we always suggest medium or medium rare for our cuts.  I was never told this.  She then asked me "what is it that you want'.  I expected her to find the answer.  I wasn't sure what to say since most places find the solution for you. She further stated "well i will do whatever you want".  She then extended an offer which had a rude tone to it.  She stated, "you know what you can keep those steaks, Porterhouse, and I will BUY you a new fillet".  I was actually offended, I dont need favors and i dont need anyone to buy me anything.  However, I told (stand in mngr)  fine, not sure what else to say.  She left, but the Swedish guests told me that they were scared of her.  The birthday guest didn't even want to ask to fix his steak because of the responses I was getting.  I didn't even touch the filet or finish the NY.
 
Attached is the picture at the restaurant, of the NY.
 
I'm not sure what Bobo's policy is on this quality and service, but my expectation was to have the decency to take it away and fix the problem, not to question and continue to question the patron.  I rarely complain, but being that i have been here many times with colleagues and friends that this was not the same quality and service i have received previously.
 
I was actually a bit embarrassed in selecting this place for my guests. 
 
Best Regards,
 
Andrew
author: Andrew J.

description: Best steak in SF! Filet Migeon with the bone in, is a must! Such a rare cut! Like butter, perfection! I had the side of portabella mushrooms with the onion rings, which were both good, but you need no sides with such a great steak! Just the mushrooms next time! Mmmmmm!
author: Ladyreyes R.

description: I chose BoBo's for a special birthday treat after hearing about it on KQED's Check Please. The guests raved about the steaks. I don't know what I expected from a SF steak house, but BoBo's wasn't it. Getting there and enjoying the free valet parking was fine, but the small, funky two story interior was a surprise. The Harlequin dark decor with heavy curtains might have worked as fun, if the rooms hadn't been so small and the diners so loud. We are generally not fussy diners but we changed tables three times. We ordered crab cake appetizers, bone in filet mignon, twice baked potato and brussels sprouts with an Italian cheesecake dessert. The steaks were excellent, but the other choices were simply average and would not have been well rated at the most average Chicago steak house.
author: Marcia S.

description:
I've had the best steak and crab of my life at this low-key restaurant, accompaning one of the best Martini's I've ever had. Once you have a meal here, you won't likely be the same. A little cha-ching, but worth the price.
*Wanna try another?* Sister restaurant to the Crabhouse in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
Five or six times a year, me and a few of the guys get together for a steak night.  There are a lot of factors that make these night fun, but for pure steak-eating satisfaction I don't think you can beat Bobo's.

I live in Steak Mecca...   two blocks from Harris', three from House of Prime Rib, down the street from Bobo's and up the street from Ruth's Chris. But the steak at Bobo's is the best.
author: Jeff T.

description:
I've gone to Bobo's a couple of times and had consistent, orgasmic meat experiences both times.

The first time I came, I had no idea what exactly to expect.  After swilling a couple of martinis, the steak arrived.  After the first bite, I instinctively stood up to go outside to smoke.  A real When Harry Met Sally moment.  

The bone-in filet is to jump off the bridge for.  Dry aged for 5-6 weeks.  The basil martinis, ohyeah, keep 'em coming.  The sides were good but just got in the way of the meat.  I do recommend the stuffed potato and I"m not generally a fan of that sort of deal.

The service was good.  Really though, they were just background noise compared to the meat.

It's pricey but worth it.
author: Mary P.

description:
I was surprised how wonderful the steak was.  I'd not heard anything about this place until a friend took me.
It's so out of the way.  So close to Fisherman's Wharf.  I would think tourist central, but it was good.
author: Kara H.

description:
Ordered the bone-in filet + some sides and the total came out to be 65 bucks. The filet is definitely one of the best I've had but think they should have a 8oz cut as well as the 5 and 10.

Free valet parking is always a plus in this city and the atmosphere is pretty kool. Would love to try their crabs next time but the only thing missing at this restaurant is the 'OMG' factor after eating the steak.
author: Dorikin W.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Bobo's. The food is amazing and they might just serve the best steak I've had in my life (I've eaten A LOT of steaks in my day).  I've tried a few appetizers and a few of the sides. All amazing. Desserts too. I really have nothing I can complain about from their menu. 

I like the decor upstairs (downstairs feels a little musty). It's interesting and unexpected. The first time I went here, I took my boyfriend for his birthday. He was so confused. It's next to a motel, doesn't look very amazing when you walk in, but the food blew us both away. 

My only issue with it has been that every time I've been there, I've been seated next to a large group that has been so loud I could barely have a conversation with my dinnermates. But that could have probably been easily solved if I mentioned it to the host/server. 

Service has been great too. Very friendly, timing is good, and I like knowing my server is around without cutting into my conversation too often. 

So overall, it's definitely one of my favorite SF spots. It's a cool, comfortable atmosphere with a guaranteed great meal!
author: S A.

description: Great steak and crab restaurant - lively music but dim lighting make it a good date or small group spot.
author: Elliot S.

description: the best place to have a dinner with your love ones!!! I really enjoy the service and food!
author: Patrick T.

description: This may be the best Filet Mignon I've ever had! Bone-in style! Medium rare. Simple! It made me reach Climax. Employees are fantastic! Polite, friendly, helpful, knowledgable. It has very odd decoration material, but I like it! Check the bathroom carefully, if you know what I mean! :)
author: Marisa S.

description: Amazing Food!  Hands down one of the best steaks I have had in a very long time.  Great ambiance and the service was excellent as well.
author: Jubi N.

description: Great place!!!! We both had the Bone-In Filet. Everything was perfect. Waiter Vito did an awesome job!!! We'll be back!
author: Ken T.

description:
We were invited as a special treat to the much touted Bobo's.  Naturally, we were excited and looking forward to the experience.  Imagine the let down when we pulled up to the entrance to the Travel Lodge and a dumpy looking building to the left.  Okay, you cannot judge a book by its cover. . . .

We waited outside, along with two other parties, while the hostess got her act together.  We were led up a narrow, dirty carpeted staircase lined with appallingly ugly, dusty looking memorabilia. to our table with a view (a motel across the way)  and crammed into a claustrophobic booth (we did like the privacy).  The restaurant is badly in need of a thorough cleaning and an upgrade to the decor.

The food:  We ordered onion rings (Mel's dinner better), petit filet mignon and the bone in  filet mignon, their signature dish.  Starting with presentation, if it means anything to you, well, the small portion of meat sat alone in the middle of the plate without any attempt to present it attractively.  There was no garnish whatsoever to break the austerity of the presentation.  I have to say the meat was cooked to perfection, medium rare, as requested, however, it was flavored by what I would describe as a mild stilton cheese which would be fine, but should have been offered as a side, if one prefers the actual flavor of the meat, which I do.   Even though they are famous for their steaks, we have had superb and much better steaks at Lark Creek, Ruth Chris and, of course,  Mastro's.   The side orders were extremely small and absolutely unremarkable.  The mac and cheese only rival would be Kraft's., we did not finish it.   The Brussel sprouts were okay.  Much too pricey for a mediocre meal. 

Our server, though competent, was cool, aloof and somewhat snobbish.  We had difficulty getting water when needed.

Now, all this aside, we had a wonderful time because of the people we were with.  We will go out with them again and again, but not to Boboquivaris.
author: Laura G.

description: This place was awesome!!  Get the in-bone steaks.  It's so mouth watering.  I suggest you order it medium rare so it's juicy. Ha! I also like the baked potatoes and the steamed veggies.  It's a must to try it out!
author: Jeremiah B.

description: Worst experience we ever had...went with my wife for her birthday , service was bad and food was horrible , my steak that i ordered medium  was  raw and i sent it back , and amazingly it came the same way it left ... the double cooked potato was so salty that i needed a pitcher of water before desert.... I will never go back to that place... overpriced and horrible service
author: Antonio P.

description:
Came here last night for dinner - we had made reservations and when we got there we were seated immediately. The restaurant has a cozy decor - lots of red, lots of color, very fun. Our waitress was fantastic. She had really great recommendations being that this was our first time eating there. 

We started off with the Costini Con Burrata w/heirloom tomatoes. This was really good, very refreshing. We both got the house special - the bone-in filet mignon, and 2 sides the portebello mushrooms and the onion rings. The filet was super tasty, so tender and it just melted in my mouth! The onion rings were nothing spectacular - but the mushrooms were extremely salty. We told our waitress this, and she got another one made....only that was extremely salty as well. She took it back, and I asked for the swiss chard instead. This was very tangy - but at least it was not heart attack salty! We were super stuffed at the end so we decided for no dessert...but the waitress brought my bf a birthday surprise! A mousse cone with a candle! That was really delicious! I was surprised that they actually remembered and made a note of that in their system. I think I had just mentioned it when I made the reservations. Very cool!

Service here was phenomenal. I esp. appreciated that they kept taking back the salty mushrooms and tried to fix our order. Water was always filled, and the warm bread was delicious. We also ordered 2 of their drinks: The Dream and The Blueberry Margarita. My favorite was the dream : delicious - sweet yet strong! Overall summery of the evening: meat was delicious, both times the mushrooms was extremely salty, but the service was terrific.
author: Betty S.

description:
Amazing steak and some very handsome men.
'Nuff said.
author: Danielle I.

description:
Best steak in the city HANDS DOWN!

Bone-in Filet Mignon is excellent.  Order the twice baked potato, mushrooms, and spinach as sides.
author: Jacob J.

description:
Can you have a heart attack and enjoy it?  Because I think that's what happened to me. 

Crab cake appetizer. Fuck yeah. 

Filet in-the-bone steak.  Oh my lord. Fat melts in your mouth good.  I forgot all about life while eating that steak and felt like an animal.  Then I felt my arteries seizing up and knew I could not eat dessert.  Of course my husband could. He always can.  Damn he is a finer human animal than me.  

We went with just the two of us, but this could easily suit a crowd of friends, a family, a group of bankers, whomever. It's the best steak I've had the city.

Ding one star for the heart attack-like feeling in restaurant.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Get the bone-in filet - no brainer.  I ordered it medium as I thought medium rare would be too rare near the bone.
The twice baked potato is very good and the swiss chard is good.

We got shrimp and crab on a skillet to start.  SO TASTY! And worth the effort as the crab in NOT cracked and the shrimp has its shell - but warning you may get messy.

Good wine list.
author: Mike A.

description: We came here on our way home from Napa.  My bf had their filet migon and he seemed to really enjoy his meal.  I had their crab and clams, it was really good, but a lil too salty for my palet. However, I still enjoyed my meal!
author: Connie C.

description:
the finest steak in town
mellow rock and roll music
fine selection of wines
did i mention finest steak in town?  bone in filet is ridiculous.
perfect setting for a large get together.
valet parking- a nice bonus.
friendly, attentive wait staff
option to dine at the bar or just grab a drink
author: william b.

description: The bone-in Filet Mignon Baby! And they mean medium-rare. Awsome! Juicy, tender, simple: how a filet should be. All the staff are very friendly. We got the Mussels as an appetizer and it was really good. The portion was huge. Good wine selections, too. Would return for a special occasion.
author: Mike S.

description: Best Steak House in SF!!! Hands down no doubt!!! Great service free valet, wonderful ambiance (great for a romantic date) and the food is indescribable, whether it's a steak or seafood everything is delicious!!! They probably have one of the best steak anywhere, the only better steak I've EVER had was in Odessa Ukraine, so if you're not willing to fly half way across the world your best bet is Bobo's!!!
author: Luke B.

description:
Bobo's is by far the best steak house in the city.  Not only are their steaks mouth-watering but the service is phonominal!  From the time I stepped foot in the restaurant, the beautiful blond hostess was so welcoming, to the time I left, the server and the manager were so charming and helpful with what to order.  And the ambiance was unforgettable...

The craft cocktails were a little pricey but soo good that I couldn't stop ordering them... the blueberry margarita and the espresso martini.

The steak was so good, words cannot describe!  Med-rare is the way to go!  I also highly recommend the heirloom tomato crostini..... mmmmmmm (my mouth is watering just thinking about it).

Bobo's is a must in this city!!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I'd give this place 3.5 stars.

First off, they offer FREE VALET parking! This place is super cute and the food is really good too! Once you walk in, you are greeted with the most amazing scent of garlic perfuming the air. The decor is really inviting and the staff was attentive and friendly. I was excited to try their bread that everyone was raving about, but it didn't taste as great as I had anticipated. We ordered the shrimp as an appetizer and they were SO good! They came on this sizzling skillet with this garlicky butter sauce. For our main course, I got the bone in New York strip with the twice baked potato. The steak was amazing and cooked to perfection! The potato on the other hand was kind gross. Whatever cheese they put in it, maybe some kind of bleu cheese, gave it a pungent smell and flavor that I didn't like. My boyfriend got the whole dungeness crab and cauliflower as a side. It was HUGE and it too was exceptionally delicious. Again, like my side,  the cauliflower was a let down. 

Although the sides are mediocre, Bobo's is a great place to eat with amazing food, service and ambiance.
author: Melissa K.

description: yummo food, good service, love the free valet.
author: Sara B.

description: The sauce I used for the meat here was my tears, the food is just that good. Honestly, some of the best steak, sweet potatoes, veggies... everything here was really top notch. The only problem is that it's pretty crowded so don't come without a reservation, especially on weekends. Service was pretty nice throughout, although they reminded us we had to be out by a certain time because of other reservations coming up and I don't think they have much seating in general.
author: Tim C.

description: Bobo's is such a treat. The mussels and shrimp are out of this world. Plus, you can't go wrong with the steak here. So tender and perfectly prepared. Highly recommend.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Three words bone-in-ribeye.

I took the advice of the waiter and got the bone in ribeye and it made me an instant fan of Bobo's.  

It's a little more casual than some of the other well known steakhouses, but who cares.  The food is great!
author: klb l.

description: I've gone to Bobo's twice now and I'd have to say that their steaks are pretty darn good!  Most recently I ordered the petite fillet while my friend got the new york bone-in.  Both were cooked to perfection, very flavorful, oh so tender and good.  I've had several of their sides and a couple of their appetizers which are all pretty good, nothing too special, but it is definitely their steaks that really makes this place so good.  I can even withstand the over the top, whacky decor for their steak.  We were given a table in what should have been a closet (practically enclosed except for one wall), but again worth it for their steak!
author: Jessica T.

description:
Spend the money and get the bone-in filet.  I took the hubby here for his birthday and got the petite filet and kept stealing bites off of his plate.  Mine was definitely a letdown, but his was amazing.  The tuna carpaccio was tasty (and not slimy) as an appetizer.  I did balk a bit at paying $7 for a sweet potato, and can't say that I'd do it again.  But to please my meat-loving husband, I would definitely come back here and eat the bone-in filet (if he's paying this time!!).

PS - My husband is looking over my shoulder and says that it is the best filet he's ever had.
author: Alison P.

description:
Lets be for real - There are only 3 steakhouses in S.F. that are rivals at this level of "Goodfella" eating. That is Bobo's , Bobs Steak And Chops, and Ruth's Chris's Steakhouse.....

I like all 3 for different reasons for different moods on different nights with different ladies --.

What Bobo's has above the other 2 is very unique side dishes, so this is what I mean, if I am NOT in the mood for the traditional baked potato with my steak, then Bobo's it is. If I am, well then Bobo's it can't be... - Understand yet ? At the same time, what is good about this place could be bad about it if your mood was contrary, etc..

The place is of ultimate intimacy, very small, pretty quiet, etc..
Service was excellent, as most places are to me (don't know why, must be my "Goodfella good looks", and hundreds falling out my pockets) - LOL....

Pretty much get laid every time I bring a girl to this place,,, so -- 5 stars it is !!

Seriously, the steak quality cuts are top notch, all food is of extreme high quality. The beef is aged properly and bought from the safest best corn fed places.
