Highly recommended for the intimate evening of no more than 2-3 people.
NOT recommended for large parties or if you desire and energetic dinner time.
author: Joel D.

description:
Amazing steak!  This is one of my "top three" fine steak restaurants (read my other reviews to learn the other two!).

My wife and I just ate dinner there again last night and her petite filet and my bone-in filet mignon were PERFECT (again).  They are not grandstanding on their menu or their website when they say they make "the steak", because they back it up by making "the steak".

In addition, we also ordered their brussels sprouts, onion rings and the crab crostini as an appetizer.  Fantastic!  Their wine menu is considerably extensive (to my wife's delight), but my sweet tooth preferred their "toasted hazelnut" mixed drink.  Try it, you'll like it.

Best to make a reservation for a sit down meal, however you can enjoy a steak dinner at the bar if you walk in impromptu and no tables are available.

Great food, excellent service and a prompt valet.  Oh yes, we'll be back!
author: Sean T.

description:
THE STEAK! THE CRAB! Definitely the best steak I've eaten west of NYC, but the atmosphere is weird, like Cirque du Soleil meets "Killer Clowns from Outerspace."  Also, it's located next to a motor lodge...very odd. 

We were seated upstairs in a totally claustrophobic corner in what looked like an old circus tent. The waiter was super attentive, but not annoying or hovering. Had the fillet (bone-in!) and the New York strip, which was fattier and tastier. The barrata app with heirloom tomatoes and croutons was also delicious, as was the bread--crusty on top, soft and warm inside. I also recommend the Bermuda onion rings as a side but skip the twice-baked potato.

Would definitely go back for the food, not the ambiance.
author: Macheeks ..

description: I absolutely love Bobo's!  For starters got the mussels which are dry roasted on a cast iron skillet, sweet potato, swiss chard and an order of shrimp . I'm not much for veggies and mussels, however the swiss chard and mussels were fantastic.  The sweet potato was very good as well.  I got the bone-in filet mignon, aged for 21 days, medium rare and it was absolutely perfect.  Full of flavor and soft, no sauce needed.  The service was very good and our waitress was friendly and attentive.  The interior will not remind you of an upscale restaurant, but I can overlook that when the food is so good.  Can't wait to go back!
author: David D.

description: New York Bone-In. Very good. I went with a group of friends and the wait staff was great to match the delicious food. The sides I tried were the twice-baked potato and the mushrooms. All very good... and I almost forgot the crab cakes and mussels that we started with.
author: Brian R.

description: Totally average quality and way overpriced.  Go to Izzy's and skip the BS.
author: Steve F.

description:
uh, what can i say? when you are paying so much at a restaurant like this, you should expect a lot from them, food and service wise. 

came in for a friend's birthday with a party of 8, and made reservation @ 830. we were not seated until around 930 and didnt leave the restaurant after 11pm.  the decor is dim and the place is very small. (nothing is wrong with that) LOVE the free parking tho =)

we also had 

medium rare bone-in Filet Mignon, it came out COMPELETLY RAW.  The lighting of the restaurant made it hard to recognize that the piece of meat is not cooked at all.   

mussels - very tasty, with buttery/oil herbal sauce

tuna carpaccio - skip it. it tasted like what any chinese restaurant can make with much cheaper price. i didnt enjoy it when there really isnt much to enjoy.  

portobello mushrooms - it was ok. diced into small pieces, nothing to rave about.  

i forgot to mention, the food took forever to get out the kitchen too.
author: Anna W.

description: Hands down,quite possibly the best steak I've ever had! Service was on point and the price wasn't overwhelming . I most definitely will be back many many times to please my palette.
author: Aaron J.

description:
First time I ate here I thought I was in heaven. Their bone-in filet was one of the best things I've ever eaten.

Second time I ate here it still rocked.

But since then, every time I been there the food has been soooo salty I could barely eat it. EVERYTHING was overly salty (well, not the wine).

For me, only reason to ever go here is for the bone-in, and only the bone-in. Sometime they dont even have it, so I barely go here anymore.
author: Maggie X.

description:
not impressed, which is a shame since all my friend's rave about this place and i was super excited to try it. here is what's wrong with it:

the first question when my friend and i walk in isn't "hello, how are you? welcome" or some variation of that, but it was a very curt "do you have a reservation?" we informed the hostess that we do not, to which her next question is "would you like to see a menu before you sit down?" WTF, who the hell looks at a menu before they're seated. correct me if i'm wrong, but isn't it customary to seat your diners and patrons before they look at the menu? 

so we're seated, we decide what we want and thought it would be a good idea to share since it was an early dinner and neither of us wanted to tote leftovers around the city til late into the night. the waiter comes by to take our order, and my friend does the ordering-one bone in filet mignon, he goes "ok two" no....one, we're going to share. "you don't want two? no....we're going to share one steak plus two sides. "you don't want two steaks?" no sir, ONE! ....and an order each of the twice baked potato and mac n cheese. 

our food comes......he places everything in front of her......um....am i not to eat? SMH we readjust everything so that it's all easy access for both of us. one steak, one half of a twice baked potato, two halves of an ugly looking plain baked potato, tiny order of mac n cheese. we're quite confused about the potatoes, so we ask him "is this how the twice baked potato comes? why are there 3 halves that look different?" he does not answer and walks away and doesn't come back for awhile. we eat our food, cuz quite frankly it looks delicious, and if the yummy bread was any indication, we are in for a feast. he comes back after we've finished most of the food, picks up the water pitcher on the table and refills her water, does not refill mine. ok, whatever, i'll fill mine up myself. we finished eating we ask for the check. the plain potatoes halves are untouched.

the bill comes and he's charged for two potatoes! $9 each btw! $9 for an ugly plain potato really? for $9 i could've gotten a whole bag of potatoes from safeway and made my own plain ass baked potato! so we wave him down and tell him he's charged us for two potatoes and we only ordered one. he claims, that my friend ordered two, one plain and one twice baked. which is of course not true! he apologizes for the "miscommunication" and adjusts our bill. 

not a great experience...to be fair the waiter was polite enough, however we got the feeling he was not only being snooty since we didn't a meal each, but he was also trying to charge us for things we did not order. the food was delicious, the service or attitude rather was lacking. i don't need great service, but DO NOT turn your nose up at me. the hostess was no better, she was lacking manners. i work in customer service myself, you're a fuckin hostess welcoming guests into your establishment, your business, guests that will be paying your salary at the end of the evening, a greeting certainly is not beyond expectation. 

sadly, i will not be coming back, which is too bad, cuz i loved the food. but there are so many delicious steak houses with great food who treat all their customers the same, no matter what they look like or how much their ordering. not to mention $9 for half of a twice backed potato? for $9 i expect the whole potato! the high prices and scarce portions are ridiculous! i can go to fleming's, pay the same price, my steak is 3 times bigger and juicer and tastier, and the sides are twice as big and they give whole potatoes! and i'm sure if someone were to order a plain potato they still would've found a way to make it more presentable. so utterly disappointed, i've been wanting to try this place, and now that i finally i have it was such a big let down! what a shame!
author: Gaile C.

description: What I particularly liked about this restaurant was the atmosphere and seating arrangements. We (two people) were seated in a "booth" on the upper floor, and there was a great sense of privacy and being alone.
author: Peter S.

description: I went back to another try and it was much better, we were seated right away, staff was much friendlier and the food was better. Still not out of this world steakhouse however it didn't leave a bad taste in my mouth, both the food and the experience... One of my best friends who I value his opinion love this place so I had to give it a second try and it was much better, still not worth going multiple times a week like him though :)
author: Bobby B.

description:
I love discovering a new city with the help of the trusty Yelp app, and I definittely was not disappointed with Boboquivari's... At first glance, the restaurant is very small and very... RED, but it has this cool moulin rouge feel to it- possibly because Bobo was a court jester... info provided by the bartender. 
We ate at the bar, as we were a walk in- but it worked out well. Met a lot of cool people eating at the bar as well and the service was quick because we didn't have to wait for a server. 
The porterhouse was amazingly tender- kind of strange that they separate it into two steaks though. You'll understand when you go. The mac and cheese was ok- a little on the bland side for me, but the steak was so perfectly seasoned that it made up for that. Honestly, one of the best porterhouses I've ever had. 
Dessert was an Italian style cheesecake, but that was a little too sweet for me...did I mention the porterhouse? Definitely outweighs the so-so everything else.
author: Janet H.

description:
Well I'm going to admit it (and I don't really want to because I'm too young to have tried the best steak of my life already!) and say that the bone-in fillet mignon was the best hunk of cow that I've ever had.  

This was my third experience with dry-aged beef (my last being Boa's in Santa Monica) and it is always a wonderful treat.  

Bobo's is a place of business and their business is cow and to a lesser degree, crab.  The service was great and it was the proper balance of attentive overseeing by our server as well as leaving us alone when we needed to be (ie, downing their marked up wine).

My only qualm with this place is the inexcapable guarantee that you'll be in close proximity to a group of younger tech-professionals (usually males drinking Stella with their steak) in jeans and Banana Republic shirts they probably still purchased while they were still seniors at Stanford.  I've never been and will always abhor dining snobs but coem on, have your fun but don't be so damn loud!  No one wants to hear how you should have bought Google's IPO way back when.  Seriously.  

It got so loud that I yelled "So where are we getting the Cocaine from?" to make those tech bufoons shut up and take their party outside.  What happened to resepecting your fellow diners  nowadays?

That horrible experience and the fact that there is no real 'memory' of the venue (like one would get from a good night at House of Prime Rib) forces me to give Bobo's a 4/5 instead of the 5 it should deserve.
author: Arvind M.

description:
OH BABY

Best steak house in the city by far and I have tried them all.  For you vegateble lovers their brussel sprouts are lights out.  Their crab is killer and even the bread to start out screams manliness.  I have not tried anything but their steak, but why would I?  These guys do not "cheat" by infusing their steak with butter like Harris's and the chain's: Ruth Chris and Morton's.  My girlfriend has allready agreed that she will stop being a vegetarian because of this restaurant and u should too.

The wait staff is also very accomodating and are not too snobby when u make group reservations.  I booked my office christmas party here and pursuaded my monthly steak club to give it a try (All twelve members agree it is their favorite).  Their cocktails are lights out and the wine list is as well thought out as any in the city.

(They are known to hand out shots of vermouth on the house)
author: Gabe H.

description:
So I believe that I have had the unique and amazing privilege to eat at some of the most exquisite restaurants in the world. Well, yesterday I got to eat the most amazing meal I think I have ever had. I know that I normally love hyperbole, but honestly this meal was amazing!!!!!!!!!

I started the meal with an amazing salad. The salad was made with a homemade creamy mozzarella cheese, tiny heirloom tomatoes, with avocado, and these tiny bread crumbs and then finished off with red onion and a light balsamic vinaigrette. The flavors were insane!

Next i had a their famous fillet Mignon on the bone, zucchini made with Japanese bread crumbs and a double baked potato with a marscapone cheese and just a little drizzle of sour cream. Just so you know when I asked for medium well on the steak, the waitress let me know that the chef would not do that. The chef knows exactly how it should be made. I was a bit nervous since I always need to have everything exactly how I like it. My friends, this was the most insane steak I have ever had! Honestly, IT WAS PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!

Lastly, for dessert we had a very simple chocolate mousse that was stuffed in tiny waffle cones. It was decadent, simple and had a perfect flavor! 

Anyone who comes and visits me will go to this stellar and perfect restaurant. The atmosphere feels a little cheesy, but the food, the service and the experience is one that I have never had! This is my favorite meal ever! It was amazing! Go to their website and check it out. 

www.boboquivaris.com/

Thanks for reading! It was amazing!
author: Mark K.

description:
I love steak!  I grew up in the Midwest, so it's in my blood to love steak.  Normally I would get the Kansas City Strip (not like its less flavorful cousin, the NY strip), but based on recommendations I got the bone-in filet.  It was great!  It's got a butter (I believe with some maple mixed in it) sauce that is amazing.  It was cooked perfectly and was just delicious.  Great wine selection and the sweet potato side dish was awesome.  My wife had the curry lobster soup as an app and she absolutely loved it.

The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars from me is the decor and I didn't have a strip steak.  The decor is a little hokey, but not distastefully so...I would just prefer a nicer ambiance for an upscale steak house.  Next time I come here I'll get the strip steak (the measuring stick of steaks in my opinion) and see how that compares with the filet.  If it's as good, then I'll probably change to 5 stars.
author: Michael S.

description: Amazing food, service. Cramped space though but still worth it for the terrific food.
author: Jacob C.

description: Bone-in filet mignon was what I had at this restaurant.  The meat was very tender and melted in your mouth.  I did not particularly like the decor, however, I understand that this is the particular theme they were going for.  Nonetheless, the food was excellent.  Nothing bad about this place!
author: Jimmy N.

description:
We tried Bobo's this past Saturday night and loved everything about our experience.  It was my husband's birthday and his special request for our dinner date was to get a good steak.  I knew he'd been to House of Prime Rib before and loved it, so I tried to get a reservation there, but it was booked up.  Happily, we managed to find an open table at Bobo's.

First, we really liked the quirky space, with all its little nooks and crannies, off-kilter pictures on the walls and kitschy knicknacks.  The decor and music (disco!) were a welcome respite from the typical steakhouse stuffiness.  The service was friendly and attentive, but not rushed or obtrusive.  Our waiter made a perfect wine recommendation for our meal.

We both decided to splurge and get the bone-in filet.  We agreed that it was the best steak either of us had ever tasted, bar none.  Flavorful, tender and perfectly medium rare.  It was memorably good and totally worth the splurge.

The seafood crostini appetizers, brussels sprouts and onion rings were all delicious (my one minor complaint would be that the onion rings weren't quite as stellar as everything else, but then I'm exceedingly picky about onion rings).  It was a lovely meal and a great dining experience.  We're already looking forward to our next excuse to go downtown and splurge.  We want to try the crab next time.
author: M D.

description: This is a fantastic steak house in the Marina. The decor is rather funky and has the look of someplace out of New Orleans, but the food is top notch. I recommend the Bone-in Filet and the Mac N' Cheese. Only knock would be the lack of a rib eye on the menu. Bread is delicious too.
author: Mike V.

description: Had our engagement party/reception dinner here. The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond our expectations. Food was amazing :)
author: David J.

description: Bobo's is definitely one of my favorite steakhouses in the city. It has a great ambiance. It's swanky, small, not the sort of decor you expect from a steakhouse, but that is why I love it. The food is great, some of the tastiest mussels I've had!
author: Leila S.

description:
Daph's rating: 2 stars
Jan's rating: 3 stars


Jan & I went here for our 5 year anniversary on Monday. We were looking forward to it since we saw it received good reviews & figured it's gotta be good. We had 7:30 reservations, but arrived 20 minutes early & were able to be seated right away which was great. The decor made me think of a circus/mardi gras kinda theme which is interesting & fun. You can tell this place used to be a house because of the layout of the restaurant & narrow stairs & small rooms. We were seated in a tiny cramped corner which we didn't like, but the place was small to begin with. They give you a complimentary garlic olive oil loaf which I didn't care so much for cuz it was sour. We decide to order for our appetizers the lobster soup & crab  cakes. We liked the crab cakes & the lobster soup wasn't bad either. For steaks, I order my favorite cut which is the filet mignon while Jan ordered the bone in filet mignon & for the sides we order their baked potato & portabello mushrooms. Jan enjoyed his steak, but I on the other hand thought it was alright. I didn't like how it was way too charred on the outside & was slightly bland tasting. As for the sides, the baked potato was HUGE & we thought it was ok, but we didn't like the portabello mushrooms because the sauce they cooked it in was overpowering the taste of the mushrooms. When we finished our steaks, we decide on dessert & order their pistachio panna cotta. Wow... it was really good. Reminded me of pistachio gelato & flan in one. Overall, we were disappointed w/this place. Service was fine, but if the dessert is what we enjoyed the MOST out of everything else we ordered at a steakhouse for the price we paid, that's EXTREMELY disappointing. =/ We've had WAY better steaks than this place. We don't care to ever go back here. Sorry Bobo's!
author: Jan And Daph S.

description:
Decided to take my family here since I got a decent amount from my tax rebate! :D yay!

haha... 

anyways... I arrive and get seated in this dimly lit room along with about 4 other tables... very cute, tiny little area... but comfy all the same. The food came out quickly (we came at 6:30pm on a Wednesday).. no long anticipation of "where is my food" feeling which is always a plus for me. 
Our waitress was super sweet and attentive... very good customer service! 

To the FOOD!!!
the house OLIVE BREAD.. OMG!!! the best bread I've ever had... yummmm.. I don't like bread that much... but this one was perfect, drizzled with olive oil, super moist soft center with a delish toasty crust and topped with garlicy olive tapenade... MY FAVORITE.. (and its' FREE--I'm so asian! haha)

Okay.. to the food I actually pay for!
We had the following:

Crostini with tomatoes, avocado and the special cheese- It was ok... I like it but its nothing fantastic, the cheese is homemade and i thought it had a nice consistency
Portobella Mushrooms- can't go wrong with this :)
Cauliflower- little undercooked but no complaints, had grated cheese over it. 
Twice Baked Potatoes- a little spicy, had interesting flavor... couldn't figure it out.. next time i'll ask the waitress but yummy to me regardless
Filet with Bone in- I only had a bite of this... I think Harris Steakhouse is better (sorry)
Mussels, Shrimp, Crab (They were ok... good value for how much you get... but again.. I think Thanh Long has better tasting crab)
Crab Cakes- (I like the ones at Houston's more, not as crunchy... this one is crunchy on the outside.... so if that's how you like it.. this will be perfect for you!)
Pistachio Panna Cotta-Delish! 
Dark Chocolate Mousse- soOOoOO goood.... if you like dark chocolate... its so rich and yummy!

SoOOo i know that I didn't think the food was AMAZING but everything was really really good to me. There are restaurants whose foods are better than theirs... but the atmosphere, the quantity, the variety, the staff and the BREAD and the DARK CHOCOLATE MOUSSE all added to the experience for me.. but just couldn't give it 4 stars because it wasn't THAT good. 

But the fact that my dad is allergic to seafood, and my mom loves seafood.. this restaurant is perfect to accommodate both of them :D.. and I'm a dessert person.. so this place did it for me!
author: Kristina L.

description: What can I say? I have never posted a review before,but felt compelled to this time. what a terrible experience! Pricey, poor service and really poor quality, from the salad to the overcooked shrimp and mussels, crab that they wouldn't crack, even after a request to do so, and a tough steak.Please save yourself a lot of money and just go to any other steak?house.
author: Valeri H.

description: Hostess service was a complete turn off and experience very sour. Got the up and down look as if we weren't worthy to eat there. Hostess could have handled the situation better. She told us she didn't have any seating for five till about 930pm. Didn't have any other backup plans to eat elsewhere so called to make a reservation and hostess said one had just canceled and could get a seat for five within thirty minutes. She looked surprised to see it was the same party she had just turned down. Steak a little over priced for the taste. Since I really haven't been to much places like these, I didn't know this but I advise you to share sides, steaks also if other person isn't a big eater. If it wasn't for hostess, I'd give this place a 4 and 1/2 stars. Jennifer and guys bringing out the food were great though! Just that dark haired lady seating the people. She needs to be trained or fired for that type of service. Wouldn't eat there again because of her. Too many places to eat in SF with better service and prices. Like I said, first time there and no backup plan otherwise would've gone elsewhere. Plus we were starving! Sorry yelpers.
author: SC E.

description:
Great Food,  fun atmosphere, good drinks
Went to BoBo's last night with family. Five people ages 56 to 20. Everyone shared Shrimp app. - outstanding, warm towelette provided to clean hands before main course, very nice and needed.
Steaks and crab dishes all cooked to perfection. 
Side dishes all top notch
The best dining experience in SF in a long time
Go out of your way to dine at BoBo's - great experience.
author: Brian K.

description: Fabulous selection of meat and fish.  Cooked to perfect, and all the side dishes are like butta'!  This is an insane dining experience.  Not to miss!
author: Haley O.

description:
I really thought the steak was pretty good, although the sides were a bit smaller than I expected. The appetizers and salad were surprisingly good as well. I wasn't expecting much, especially since my real bad experience at the Crab House (I have a hunch, just a hunch, that Bobo's and the Crab House are related...)

But I really can't give this place anything more than a star or two. Why? Because they did something that really irked me and probably would piss the hell out of a lot of people. Here's what happened...

So after dinner, we were wondering where our dessert menus were. After an extended period of time, the server comes back with a modest dessert which she mentioned was complimentary because we mentioned that the day was a special occasion. OK, that was a nice gesture, but it would've been nicer if maybe they offered us the dessert menu as well. The bill comes and, guess what, the dessert (1) they CHOSE for us (2) which was allegedly COMPLIMENTARY and (3) wasn't all that good, was tacked onto the bill. S.O. was FURIOUS and she was about to go crazy, but I really didn't think much of it myself, except that (1) I was going to short them on the tip and (2) I wasn't going to go back to a place that does stealth charges like that.
author: Ken L.

description: Fantastic as always! Service was great and the food was spot on. I highly recommend the bone-in filet and twice baked potatoes with a nice gin martini. I'm a repeat customer and will be back soon.
author: Dave M.

description: Steak does not get better than this! I grew up on some of the best beef in the world in Montana. I have eaten in some of the top steakhouses in America (Chicago, Texas, California, Colorado, Montana, etc.). Their bone-in steaks are dry aged and marvelous. A steak dinner does not get better than this. Add on top of that an intimate setting with fantasitcs sides and great wine, you're in for a treat. I can not get enough of this place. Great for bachelor parties, business dinners or impressing the father in law! This is it. Oh, and get the crab. Unreal.
author: Darin A.

description: The sign on the outside of this place says "Bobo's," which, unbeknownst to me at the time, is short for the restaurant's full name, Boboquivari's. I was a little unsure about eating at a place called "Bobo's." My assumption was that the restaurant was either owned by a clown (the brother of Bozo?) or someone with a clown fetish. I was glad that the owner had at least veered away from other famous clown names, such as "Krusty's." Obviously, I wasn't the only one confused by the restaurant's name, because the hostess made all of the patrons review the menu before being sat. I took the dive and discovered that the food here, although a bit pricey, was pretty good. I would definitely recommend having a steak and a good side. The surf and turf was pretty good too.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I ordered the petite filet and found that the top part was way too salty, and the inside of the meat is a bit flavorless.  So what happens is that when you put the piece in your meat, it's quite tasty w/ a bunch of salt hitting your tongue. But as you chew, everything becomes less flavorful and bland.  In the end, you'll realize that it's not that great overall.
The twice baked potato was not as good as everyone seem to rave about.  I thought it tasted weird w/ some zuchinni in the mix.  

We also tried the mussels, which was good.  The crab was a tad too dry.  And they call themselves a steak and seafood place?? 

The best item I thought for the night was the Italian cheesecake.  I was delighted that the meal ended w/ something good and sweet.

And still why the 2 stars?  1 star for the cheesecake, and 1 star for the complimentary valet parking.  That's it. 

The service, while wasn't horrible did not deserve a star.  It was mediocre service.  The thing we could not put up w/ was the snide comment from the hostess.  Thefore, I took away 1 star.
So my friend made reservations for a total of 10 people.  9 of us showed up.  As the hostess seated us and about to walk away, she told my friend that next time that she should call to confirm the number of people that will be showing up.  C'mon on.. 9 out of 10 ppl showed up.  It would be the exact same table setting, except that they have to take away 1 setting of plate and fork.  With a 18% mandatory tip, they cannot actually remove the extra chair and setting??  
To insert that snide comment before walking away was rude and a bit obnoxious of the hostess.  I would understand if only 6 or 7 of us showed up, b/c that would require re-moving the tables around.  
I am definitely appalled by the hostess's attitude.  They are the gateway to the impression of the restaurant, and by her saying that, it already ruined the mood for us before we started eating.  The food did not help matters, except the dessert probably.

I don't think we would come back for a "next time".  So the hostess can forget about us ever calling this place back to make reservations.
author: AhLin C.

description: this is one of those situations where I wish Yelp had a half star. This is a steak joint, but given how much the steak is your money is better spent at a place like Harris's. This is a steak joint right? A steak joint with a mardi gras atmosphere. The high point is the steak. We both had the bone in filet mignon dry aged for six weeks. The meat was good, it was cooked fairly well and for a medium rare chunk of meat it had the required pinkness, raw near the bone, good juice and a wonderful buttery flavor from adequate marbling. Where this place goes down hill is everything else. The side dishes were absolutely flavorless, the bread over done to the point of being a flaky mess and the yellow tail carpacio, although tasty, was over priced and drowned in a sea of olive oil and balsamic which neutralized most of the more subtle fish flavors. The real problem is that for a steak joint, or a place that posits itself as a house where flesh should be consumed, they had too few fleshy options. The high point here was the service, friendly, and by the looks of the crowd in the bar area, a local meeting place even if the pours were on the smallish side and priced on the high side.
author: Len S.

description:
Burrata was to die for...I've eaten her quite a few times and haven't tried this app until this past weekend, I will go back within the next 5 days to get it again! 

Skillet mussels are gone in 3.5 seconds after they hit the table. 

Bread is delish with the yummy mushroom/garlic roulade ontop.

Love the Cesar. 

The bone in fillet is the only way to go.
author: Jessica D.

description: Solid restaurant.  We've been in a few times in the past, but it had been a while.  Hubbie had the porterhouse, which was amazing. The twice baked potato was yummy, but only 1/2 of a very large potato.   I ordered 1/2 a crab.  When delivered, it was disappointing.  Very sparse on quantity.  I voiced my concern and they proceeded to bring us an additional 1/2 crab.  Very above and beyond for service.  We will return.  Pricey, but very solid food.
author: Genevieve B.

description: I like the cozy feel to this place.  Definately will be hitting this place up during the chiily winter nights coming up. The steaks are great especially the Bone In Filet.  I can remember the seafood appetizers being pretty good as well.  I really need to come here a few more times before I can really give it an honest review.
author: Demanding T.

description: I had only an app on my first visit.  It was delicious buratta  with heirloom tomatos and a nice balsamic vinaigrette.  Amazing garlic olive oil bread also!  I will review more when I have a full meal but can't wait to go back and try a bone in fillet!  Wonderful service from the bar staff as well, Pooyeh
author: Shawn A.

description: This place rules.  5 time customer now and have never been disappointed.  Whole crab, NY bone in (med/rare) twice baked potato with the tuna carpaccio to start!  Wash it all down with whiskey on the rocks...plus pretty girl....equals five stars for me. Will be 6 times soon....
author: Gabriel F.

description: Went with three other people for a Saturday night dinner around 8:00. Had the appetizers, salads, and a bisque: looked sloppy, tasted okay, not fantastic. Steaks were aged well, tasted good, but not good enough to justify the prices that normally include service and atmosphere. The service was more corner diner than fine dining. The tables are close together, the building is set up like a Buca di Beppo's with lots of kitsch and odd stairways and little rooms. When you pull into the driveway with the valet, you are also pulling into the Travelodge hotel next door. $450.00 for four without wine- I should have gone to Morton's.
author: Jay W.

description: Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! The mushrooms are a must as well as the bone in filet. We visited San Fran for the New Year and tried to get reservations at the House of Prime Rib, but to my disappointment they were booked. All I knew is we wanted steak for new years and I asked them if they had any recommendations and this is where they told me to go. The best steak we've ever had besides Morton's and Fleming's back home. Loved the restaurant decor and the service was phenomenal!!!
author: Coraly S.

description: Ruth who? Owned by a trio of North Beach-based restaurateurs (the Stinking Rose is another of their six California dining spots), this is the place to go for the most exquisite steak in the city. It's USDA-certified prime beef, dry-aged four to six weeks and cooked to perfection, pan-seared in its own natural juices, with a hint of garlic and rosemary, then deglazed. What really sets them aside from the competition are the amazing starters, like crab cakes with cranberry confit, and the creative side dishes, such as sauteed cauliflower in a lemon-garlic-caper sauce, Maui onion rings, and zucchini bread pudding. Ordering soup to nuts, so to speak, with a couple of drinks, will run you in excess of $100 per person, definitely worth it for an occasional splurge. Service is excellent, and the dazzling interior - with red walls and eye-catching tchotchkes everywhere - will keep you mesmerized.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Their food is good but very greasy, especially their steak. The drinks and the ambience were great though. The valet parking is definitely a plus in SF.  All in all, it was a good experience, but I am not sure if I want to go there again.
author: Narg R.

description:
Love this place!  They have the best dry aged steak ever!!!  And don't leave without trying the Basil Martini!!  I know, sounds strange but it is to die for!!  And of course dessert....mmmmmmm!
The service is very good!
author: Veronica D.

description:
Don't let the strange decor (clowns), the unusual location (seemingly tucked underneath a motel), or the long name fool you. This place is legit. 

If you're a steak purist (i.e. you only want a little salt and pepper on your steak, you want the restaurant's best food item to be the steak, etc.), you may prefer other steakhouses. However, the bone-in filet is truly wonderful and a rarity on a steak house menu. The best part about bobo's is that the sizzling seafood is just as good as the steak. Mussels, Shrimp, Crab: all are great. I usually stuff myself too much with the huge seafood items prior to my steak...but i never regret it.

The other thing I like about Bobo's is the pricing of both the steaks and the wine list. The steaks are not overly expensive. And being a couple that isn't rolling in $$$, my wife and I like that we don't have to go scouring through the wine list looking for that 1 bottle of Cab Sauv. that's in the $40-$80 price range. Bobo's lists the wines in sections by price: $29, $39, $49, etc. This makes ordering wine pretty pleasant for us.
author: Jason P.

description:
agree with hen a. bobo is for babos. 

from my two experiences there WOULD DEFINATELY NOT recommend this place. pm if you would like details.
author: Euge L.

description: we came at a decent time of day where they were not too busy, so we had prompt service and the food arrived in a timely manner.  i am a steak snob and people had told me that they had excellent steak here.  i had to try the best they had and sadly after 1 bite i wanted to leave.  my dining companion had the surf and turf which did not fair well either as the crab was literally just a boiled crab in butter, the entire plate ended up greasy.  later that night, i took my steak home (minus my 1 bite) and gave it to my dog.
author: Wayne L.

description: Way over rated steak place. I've been to better. Steak was okay. I ordered a shot of Remy but they didn't tell me it was $50. Daaamn, I didn't know that till the bill came. I thought they made a mistake so I asked what kind of Remy was it. They said it was Remy XO. For $50 more I could have got a bottle at Costco. It didn't even taste like XO. I thought it tasted like vsop. A shot of gold would probably go for the same price. Shouldn't they tell you a price if its going to cost more than your steak? What kind of b.s. is that. I paid the bill and took it as a lesson learned. I'm never going back here again. Everything is overpriced and didn't have the taste to match. Place was dead when we went in and now I know why. Place sucked.
author: Vinh T.

description: Sorry, I really wanted to like this place. My husband and I saw it on Check Please and actually ended up sitting next to the gentleman who reviewed it. My hubby had the steak, and loved it. (Note: he is born and bred Mid-western stock and knows his meat.) Me? I had the crab, not so great, actually barely fare. (Note: I am a San Francisco native and know my crab/seafood.) It was Alaskan King Crab Legs, that had very little flavor. Our bartender server was terrific, but alas we are both bartenders so we can always go to Dirty Trix and have a great cocktail at a great price. All in all, the hubby wants to have the steak again sometime and I think next time, I'll follow his lead.
author: Lee P.

description:
man that was some good meat.
i ordered the surf and turf, so i had a little bit of beef and a little bit of crab, and it was the best dinner i'd had in SF for the weekend i was there working. all of the appetizers beforehand were excellent as well. the decorations in here are weird and quirky, and the upstairs sitting area has some great windows and views of the comfort inn across the street.
but seriously, this is some good beef. the food was amazing. the desserts i don't really remember. but i loved it.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Ok, 4 reasons not to go :
#1.  NO SENSE OF TIMING, POOR MANAGEMENT:  I went to the restaurant for my friend's surprise grad dinner.  Since we have a big party, met the minimum, we got the priviate room by ourself.  Our reservation was 8:15pm.  There were a couple in the private room having dinner when we got there at 7:45 to set up the room, (since we were told it is a private room for us, we thought we can go a bit earlier to do a little decor).  The rest of our party came shortly after, Since it is a surprise party, everyone rather be there early then late, But guess what? Not only we were not seated in our room ON TIME, We were not even allowed in the room, no more than 4ppl  max, (the reasaon was: because they don't want to disturb the ONLY couple in the private room). Clock was ticking, the next thing you know, it is 8:30 already, and we were still not allowed to go in, b/c the couple were still there, plus of course they still have not set up the table yet  because of them.   Ok here is my thought,  i understand you dont want to disturb your customers, BUT, if you know you are gonna have a big party for the private room, don't u know better not to put anyone in that room when it is close to the reserved time?  Should you set the room up ahead of time? This is not how a up scaled restaurant should be like.  THE so called PRIVATE room, party of 18 minimum... HELLO???  Well as it turned out, we didn't get seated until 9pm. (45 mins late).   

#2.  THEY DON'T KEEP THEIR WORDS:  We were told when we made reservation, we can either order from their regular menu OR a pre-set menu of $55/ per person.  Remember it was "OR" that they told us. But, when we got there, they refused to honor that OPTION.  Everyone of us had to order from the set menu.  BECAUSE quote quote from them: "that's just easier for us" .  Sure, thats easier for you, but what about us?? that means every one has to either order three course with a whole Crab or 13lb steak.  If you want to order other things, salad, dessert, or maybe you dont want any of those-- TOO bad for you, (No, too bad for us!!) !  And,  of course we cannot share either, remember 18 ppl min to have the room?? (so 18 sets min.hahaha...) Oh forget to mention, a  bill of to $55X22++ for you is "small potato" -- Great business and easier for you!!! Wow, pefect!

# 3.  THING TEND TO GET MYSTERIOUSLY LOST IN THAT DARK PRIVIATE ROOM:  Ok, besides paying for food that's not even worse $55++, i unfortunetly had to pay a bit extra, BECAUSE, my camera has mysterousely dissapeared from my table!!  Btw, i was sure it was on my table, i even took a pic during dinner, and i had never left the table for bathroom or anything.  All my friend were in the room, double checked their belongings, and i dont know what happened, or how it happened, sometimes in between the dinner plates being taken away and hot towel being served, Camera dissapeared!!! 

#4.  OH last but not least, The food was not worse the price!!!  After you read all this, if you still are interested in going there, please take my  last little advice, if you want to have crab, have the whole crab, don't do half half with the meat.  The 1/2 crab meal is not as fresh as the whole one!  I am seafood person,  trust me, i can taste it!
author: Jasmin Y.

description:
With 30 reviews it's time for an FAQ So here it is

- Good food? Awesome steak, not so much other menu items
- Good Service?: Yep. The place is about steak, but service was quick, courteous, and professional 
- Good Ambiance? This place is about steak. Decor is heavily masculine and wouldn't be out of place in the late 70's or early 80's, think Rockford Files meets  Pulp Fiction, with lots of Chinese restaurant red thrown in for good measure. Crowd was mixed, but mostly older. Dress ranged from T-shirt and jeans to fairly formal. 
- Good value? For one large awesome steak, one small awesome steak, two Manhattans, two beers, two soups, a salad and two deserts we spent $160 plus tip. 
- Good for a first date? Definitely not. Bobo's is about steak, not total experience, stimulating environment or intimacy. The dinning room is very small and tightly packed. Intimate conversation is not recommended unless knowing that any sweet nothings will be shared by your date and the adjacent tables gives you an exhibitionist rush. 
- Reservations Required?: They serve their full menu at the bar, so not absolutely necessary but highly recommended. Note: I was able to get a time slot shown as not available on opentable.com by calling directly. 

Warning/Full Disclosure: Our experience was marred by the loud, foul-mouthed, boastful jerk at the next table. I have the conflict seeking tendencies of your basic doormat,  but it was bad to the point that I regretted there were no kids in the dinning room, as that would have given me unambiguous license to tell the guy to watch his language and/or lower his voice.  The waiter later explained that the guy was one of their best customers, someone who "kept the lights burning for a lot of years" and therefore felt "entitled." A jerky but valuable regular is a tough thing for any restaurant and obviously Bobo's made a decision. I'm guessing the guy comes in at least two or three times a week so know there is a reasonable chance your meal may come heavily peppered with the F word (and no, I don't mean fabulous). One positive: he left (to the obvious relief of the entire room) before our main courses arrived, allowing Bobo's to remain all about steak.
author: Bill S.

description:
Oh Bobo's, I wish you were better. I really wanted to like you. The Bone-In New York Strip had a great, sweet marbled taste. Definite quality meat. The meat was perfectly cooked rare, and sat in its own deglazed juices. Damned good steak for a steakhouse, but I was disappointed by the supporting cast.

Everything else was mediocre, if not sub-par for a high end steak house with the prices they were commanding. Sure they have Burrata and yes the velvety smooth, creamy texture was a man's version of McDreamy. But everything else was...   eh. Crab cakes were meaty, but nothing to have a food-gasm about. Again the steaks were great, but the char danced the fine line between a great sear and burnt toast crustyness. Yeah that's a word, don't worry about it. The meal wasn't helped much by the sides. In a word, they were sad. Portobello Mushrooms swimming in a sea of garlic grease, and Swiss Chard that seemed blanched dressed in garlic olive oil. So it's not fair to judge all the sides because we only had two, but c'mon folks you've got to know the sides make a good steak that much better. Poo poo poo on you for falling flat on your face. But hey, look at the bright side. There's places like Izzy's that make you look that much better! HIGH FIVE!
author: Al L.

description: Took my husband here. He loves Bob's Chop House but said this place is now his second fav. The staff was nice and the food yummy. I liked my steak nicely medium well done with a side of their mushrooms.
author: Carmelina A.

description:
My review is only on the CRAB portion of this restaurant:

People like this place??? My seafood platter (assortment of crab, shrimp and mussels) tasted fishy. I'm Asian so, I actually like fishy, but this was fishy in the "I think the seafood is not fresh" kinda way. The garlic bread wasn't bad, but it was dripping with butter. In fact, everything was bathed in butter. Ginormous thumbs down for me, although again I didn't eat the steak which is what everyone is raving about.
author: Mama L.

description: Boboquivari's steak is good! I could compare it with Peter Luger's (NYC) even though it's not cooked the same way. But it's definitely comparable and worth going again for steak!  Also, their portebello mushroom side dish is definitely worth ordering.
author: Hey Y.

description:
I went in with overly-inflated expectations and came away a little disappointed.  Some have suggested that Bobo's makes the best steaks in the City.  While I haven't yet tried all the major steakhouses, I have to imagine that at least one of those places can make a better New York steak than the one I had.  My steak was good, but it really wasn't much of an improvement over what I've had at a spot like Izzy's... I ordinarily like my beef rare, but this time I made an exception and ordered it medium-rare, because this is what Bobo's recommends.  What I got was closer to medium on the edges and more rare as I got closer to the bone.  While the flavor was good, if I spend 38 bucks on a steak, it had better melt in my mouth.  And this steak most definitely did not melt in my mouth.    They don't have the traditional sides -- like creamed spinach -- but there are plenty of other tasty options, like swiss chard in garlic and olive oil and creamed yams with brown sugar.

The service was okay, but a little slow.  And the winelist has a serious markup.  Seeing as the corkage is only 15 bucks, I'd bring your own bottle.
author: Andrew E.

description: Overall, great dining experience.  But I am giving three stars due to my steak being medium when I ordered medium rare.
author: Matthew F.

description: Bobo's does seafood and steak right!  The filet mignon is incredible, and packed with flavor.  They marinate their steaks for a VERY long time, something like weeks or months.  The crab and shrimp are just as tasty.  It might be a little pricey, but it's definitely worth it.  Order the bone-in filet mignon with some crab and shrimp and you will be delighted.  Perfect place for a nice date.
author: Thomas W.

description: Had some friends in town that wanted to try out a solid steak place and got a recommendation to visit Bobo's.  Certainly not a traditional chophouse, but we had some great meat.  My bone-in filet was a bit underdone (a rare event) but flavorful nonetheless.  Others in our party did the surf and turf and the petit filet, which also makes up in taste what is lacks in presentation.  The mussels to start were disappointing - very small - and the hamachi carpaccio was overloaded with too many extras.  The side dishes were simple but tasty: brussel sprouts, mushrooms and a twice-baked potato.  The service throughout was very good.
author: Matt C.

description: The best steak I've ever had was the bone-in filet here. It's expensive, but for me, last-meal-on-earth worthy. Get a potato dish too. Then get on your exercise bike.
author: Hurston P.

description: Boboquivari's is the best steakhouse in SF.  Amazingly tender beef, elegant presentation and plating on exquisitely unique modern china.  An astounding collection of one of a kind wine decanters will make any wine you order look impressive.  Big picture windows somehow manage to make busy Lombard street look cool...it's something about the angle of the streetlights with respect to the 2nd and 3rd story windows here.  The host and hostess are friendly and helpful and the wait staff is cheery and knowledgeable about the menu.  The bar offers the best views and a selection of the usual expected fine drink choices.  They use real fresh cut fruit rather than the limes cut 2 days ago that so many places try to pass off.  I can't wait to go back here and take more friends to enjoy everything Boboquivari's offers!
author: P H I L H.

description: Food is fantastic!  The steaks are unbelievable.  I got the surf and turf which was delicious.  My husband enjoyed the bone-in filet, which melted in his mouth.  For a starter, we had the lobster crostini.  This was also impeccable!  I never had anything like it.  The service was impeccable and the bread and martini's were also delicious!
author: Nicole M.

description: my favorite steakhouse in san francisco. the bone in filet is amazing!!!!! All the sides are delicious. place isnt too fancy inside so if anything i would consider giving it a half star off for that but the fact that the food is so great it makes up for that. if you like steak this is a
author: Dmitriy G.

description: Been here about 4 or 5 times and Bobo's = bone in filet! So amazing! Also had the twice baked potato, the burrata and the wedge salad. All are fabulous. Great San Francisco establishment and really enjoy taking friends from out of town to Bobo's! The service is always great and complimentary valet parking is a plus! When I want steak- Bobo's is always in the top 3 of potential candidates. Sometimes you just have to love that "Old San Francisco" feel of a dining experience!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Came here on a Monday nite and it was relatively pretty busy! The servers were ok, not too friendly? , but not rude. I ordered the surf and turf and I loved the crab!!! I'm not a big beef/rib/steak eater so I can't comment on that but the sauce and the crab complimented each other perfectly! The sauce tasted like some shrimp paste but it was delicious. Oh, and we also ordered 1 order of mussels and they tasted excellent with the butter sauce as well. The portebello mushroom was ok, not really worth it.
author: Kym Y.

description: I've always read good reviews about this place and a lot of people recommend the bone-in filet. Wasn't sure if it would live up to the hype, but after trying it for myself, I am now a believer. So tender and juicy. *drool* The only thing is that I guess the focus should be the slab of meat you order, but it wouldn't kill to include some sides, except those you have to order separately. But still good in my book.
author: Julie L.

description:
First of all, BEWARE of the "free" valet. They stole something from my car, so make sure if you've got anything worth anything, lock it up, don't just put it away. 

Don't be mesmerized by "It's the steak, It's the crab", I tell you what, the sign should read "Not worth the price that we charge". The positives are few and far between, the bone in filet  was delicious, the crab cakes were really small, cute, and tasty, but again not worth the bill at the end.

The bad--aside from the thief's in valet; the crab is horrible and everything else is mediocre at best.  I've eaten crab all my life, and this could have been the worst I've ever had. The menu says nothing, nor did the waiter, about how the crab is served. It comes coated with some brown, gritty, butter garlic sauce, which ruins anything it touches on the plate, and leaves your mouth tasting like a vat of Crisco. Also note that if you order the surf and turf, your cut of meat will look more like a taste off someone's plate rather than an actual steak.....my petite filet was, oh, 2.5-3oz. Not exactly what I had in mind.  For sides, the waiter recommended the Swiss Chard (not good) and the Twice Baked Potato (just ok). We also got the tomato romaine wedge salad, which was so unoriginal and bitter it should have been sent back (I've seen 8th grade Home Economic students make better).  The onion rings were decent, but at $1 a ring, were they that good? Probably not.  They also came along and randomly tossed half a loaf of toasted, stale, crusty bread on the table, dripping in olive oil.  It was so bad, I wondered why they even bother putting it out? 

If you are bound and determined to eat here, set the bar low, hide your valuables, and hope someone else picks up the check.
author: Scott R.

description:
I'm sorry...was that a steak I just consumed, or a deliciously seasoned and well-disguised stick of butter? Bobo's steaks, which are aged for many weeks more than most other establishments in the U.S. (or so they claim), are the best I've ever had---and my family is full of good cooks and knows how to grill a steak. Indeed, before Bobo's, the family steak held the top spot. People are serious about the horrendous atmosphere, though. I didn't really notice it the first time, but the last time I was there, it definitely struck me. It's like the inside of a clown on acid. It actually seems REALLY old school to me, and I'm under the impression that the restaurant actually hasn't been around that long...like long enough to get away with that "well, we decorated in the 40's" excuse. Also, sound carries inside, so it can be very loud if there's a large party in your section (especially a loud, obnoxious drunk one...consider yourself warned).

Anyway, the filet is almost consistency of butter, though I did try to chew it with just my tongue and the roof of my mouth, and that didn't quite work. But then I didn't have the leverage of my jaw, so I think it's safe to say a toothless person could eat this steak. The crab cakes with the dried cranberry relish are also fanfuckingtastic. (I bet the straight up crab is too...this is San Francisco, after all). I've tried the onion rings and the baked/stuffed potato, too. The onion rings are made with purple onions (which are my favorite), so I was surprised I wasn't that thrilled by them. The baked potato had a good consistency and was artfully done, but I'm not a fan of whatever cheese they use in it (fontina, I think). That didn't stop me from eating a few bites when the BF wanted to share one, though. It is pricey ($29 for the petite filet, I think, and around $8 per side), so be prepared to pay. But you're guaranteed to get a five star steak...just don't get TOO high before you go or you might be afraid to step inside.
author: Jasmine F.

description: So I went back only because a friend really wanted to try the bone-in filet mignon. It was hardly my first choice given my previous experience there. In all honesty, I'm glad went back. This time, I had the bone-in myself (and not the Surf n Turf), and our waitress came back to our table more than three times! I have to say that the bone-in was one of the best steaks I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  I'm going back and I know exactly what I'm getting!!
author: Francis A.

description: I had a few people rave at me about this place, but then I found out it was done by the same people behind the Stinking Rose. I gave it a chance -- on a special birthday. It was just one weak link in a chain of FAIL that day, but I feel the same way about this place as I do about the Stinking Rose -- take a tourist here, but not on the day that they are leaving.
author: Darren M.

description: Bobo's has the best piece of meat I've ever put in my mouth.  I could cut my filet with my fork it was so soft.  I was getting to my last bite and had to cut it in half just to make it last a little longer.  The last bite was just as good as the first.  My mouth is watering just thinking of how good it tasted.  Next time I'm going for the mac-n-cheese and some of their bomb looking crab!  Best steak in the city IMO.
author: Chard M.

description: The steaks are really good. The waiter recommended the bone-in fillet. Sides are a la carte. This place is not the run of the mill, stuffy, uptight steakhouse. It is very laid back and offers unique decor.
author: Ana M.

description: It's true that the quality of the bone-in filet is excellent, and our server was attentive. But otherwise, I was underwhelmed. I found the food generally over-salted (and I like my food salty) and the decor indifferent (we were next to a photo of Stockard Channing, or at least I think it was her). For a meal of red meat, I'm still inclined to favor the House of Prime Rib.
author: Denny A.

description:
Pretty simple - great food, so-so service. 

I've worked in the restaurant industry so have sympathy for some of those terrible service reviews on a busy Friday or Sat. night. But I came in here early on a Friday, with not many people and didn't get great service...sat for way to long before someone asked my order. 

Look, that said - great steak! Really, really good beef here and the twice-baked poato is the best i've had. I've had some of the best steaks in america and this ranks up there...beef almost tastes like bacon its so good.  

Will say this - and i won't take away any stars for it - I got the tuna tartar and it came pretty much room tempurature. I don't know if that has a culinary value or not - the flavors on the tune was delicous - but kind of creeped me out. I'd like that served cold on a very cold plate...but again, that may be considered the way to do it among food critics...i just don't  know.
author: JOHN O.

description: Took a client here for a dinner. Ordered the bone-in filet and the mussel, shrimp, and crab plate. One of the best steaks I've ever had, hands down. I was here on a weeknight so the atmosphere was fairly calm and quiet. The decor doesn't deserve any awards, but it gets the job done. Definitely on top of my list of steakhouses.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Wow, was I disappointed...An avid SF restaurant-goer, I waited nearly a year to go to Bobo's and came away limp. The praise was deafening, but I found my meal decent, but certainly not memorable. First, the decor...In a word, god-awful. Looks like Luciano Pavarotti threw up in there.  Lots of tschotkies you'd find in a watery-red-sauce Italian North Beach tourist trap, not in a high priced steakhouse. Second, the service. Our waiter, while nice enough, knew little to nothing about the food or how it was prepared...Then, our table. We had a reservation for nearly a week in advance but were still sat at a table under the stairs. Sounded like there was a running of bulls in Pamplona through our meal. The racket of heavy-set waiters up and down the stairs all service was so bad we asked to be moved to another table. Now the food: well, spinach cheese fondue was not hot enough and the consistency was too heavy. My steak was good as it goes, but I can think of at least a half dozen other SF steakhouses (and those not even known for their steak!) that serve up a more flavorable side of beef. Think Harris', House of Prime Rib, ....hell, even, Izzy's!. Our sides -- a poor attempt at a mac and cheese dish which was really a few strands of rotini pasta with a bad blue cheese sauce lathered over it --- were pitiful.
So...no, I am not going back. When I am in the mood for a steak, I'm looking elsewhere
author: Jonathan T.

description:
When your waiter comes over and tells you right off the bat that you have to be done eating by 8, it isnt a nice way to start your meal.  then he tells you its because "you were late". while looking at his watch...(they only have one large table and only do two seatings there at 6 and at 8)
um Im sorry, it was a party of 12, all but 3 of us were there on time and could have been seated but werent.  oh and by the way, you should never tell your customers they have a time limit.  its rude.  he could have subtly hurried us up.  just left a bad taste in my mouth.
But then we had the food.  the yellowtail carpaccio-silly good.  there was a tomato and burrata thing that was phenomenal.  my house salad was delicious.  the mac and cheese?  holy smokes.  my surf and turf was ok only because the crab was dry and there was not much of it. my steak however, was cooked perfectly.  
oh, and we werent done by 8.  Sorry to the next reservation waiting on that table!
author: erica r.

description: took the family there for my dad's bday.  bone in fillet was good.  bigger than I thought it would be, cooked perfectly med rare, and very flavorful.  the sizzling seafood platter (mussels, shrimp, and crab) with three sauces was the highlight of the meal to me.... atleast it's what I will remember.  also, very convenient that they have valet.  I would go back.
author: nick t.

description:
my gent & i went here to celebrate his birthday on saturday.
our meal was absolutely perfect!

all of the following were impeccable:

- complimentary (yes, FREE) valet.
- service. our waiter was knowledgable, attentive & funny.
- atmosphere. cozy & cute. (so maybe i like clowns)
- wine list. whatever red my boy chose for us was divine.
- crab cakes with cranberry relish. :]
- bone in filet. melt-in-your-mouth, cream-in-your-pants AMAZING.
- cheesecake. yummmm.

last but not least....
- fellow patrons. the buzzed older gentlemen at the table behind us who tripped every single time he got up to use the restroom. & most importantly, the business men across from us having an overly-serious conversation about POWER EXCHANGE.

could it get any better?
author: Lizzy L.

description: Been here like 5 times. The very first time a few years back (2006?) was AMAZING AMAZING. 5 STARS. Since, its been yummy, but never quite quite as good as before. The steak is EXCELLENT tho. Best in the city. I usually order the Bone in Fillet. Juicy and delicious. In the most recent trip I had the shrimp platter as my entreee and it was KILLER. Garlicy butter sauce that you dip them in I could drink. Yum. Not to mention the flavoring already on the shrimp-delicious for a garlic lover!!
author: Tara M.

description:
The T-bone filet mignon was too tempting to pass up.  For the price, this place is a better deal than Harris and Ruth's Chris.  I felt the lighting was a little too dim, so that I could not see how charred my steak really was.  

But the services was awesome.  Although I arrived on time, the rest of my party was quite late(last person did not get there until 30 minutes after our time slot), but they gladly held the reservation for me without any fuss.  The service in this place is top-notch.  The food is extremely good.  This is my new favorite steakhouse.  The ambiance is prime for taking a date.  

Parking is a bummer and the only thing that would keep me from coming more regularly(along with the prices, of course).  

I don't give out 5 stars very often, but I was very impressed with my first visit here.
author: Stephen N.

description:
Cliff Notes:
                          Bone in Filet - Excellent
                          Crab - Fresh and Delish
                          Service - Terrifyingly BAD
                          Everything else - Mediocre at best...

Enlightening version:

        We went to Bobo's in search of very good steak. We found that in the bone-in filet and nothing else. The Porterhouse was a true steakhouse's nightmare, a strip and filet from different cows of vastly disproportionate sizes. The filet was dinky and tasted bland and sad compared to its bone-in counterpart. The petite filet was beyond petite and a total rip off.
         The crab was excellent. The sides were ok, as were the smattering of apps. The bread, which they charge for, was not worth it. Get some potatoes instead...
          The service was scary, so scary it matched the cheesy Atlantic City decor. We were a large party, and I'm aware that large parties can be a pain in the petooty. But, we're fun and gracious! 
           To begin, our waiter insisted on speaking to us as if we were seventy year olds in a country club. Even when we tried to have fun with him, he continued his charade of playing "fine dining waiter". It was sad.
            We brought our wine with us to Bobo's already fearing it would be overpriced and not worth it to buy bottles there. We were right, the wine was orgnaized by price - all varietals together under tackaliscious $ markers! We began with an $60 Amorone. Our waiter poured it into our cheap table wine glasses almost to the top. The wine glasses were so full we couldn't aerate the wine. Plus, I can find more suitable wine vessels at IKEA!
             Our server continued to be inept, not understanding the sequence of service, not knowing how to describe a Porterhouse, etc, etc. I didn't think this kind of ineptitude was SF - like, but I guess you learn something new everyday. 
             I'll leave Lombard to the out of towners.
author: Lee T.

description: Probably the best steak house in SF.  Simply due to the dry aged bone in filet.  Pretty hard to find in most steak houses but literally you can go there and just get that and be happy.  Seriously try it.
author: Charles C.

description: This steakhouse has amazing food, delicious sides, good portions and nice wine, however I rarely think to visit it due to the location and the somewhat overwhelming decor. It's great for tourists, just A-Ok for me.
author: Sara W.

description: I ate my whole entire New York steak!!  I killed it & even took a few bites off of my hubby's crab & filet mignon.  Onion rings, good.  Twice baked potato, great.  Free bread, great.  Steak, heavenly.  Cocktails & wine, generous & perfectly mixed.  Complimentary valet parking, AWESOME!!  The steaks were perfectly cooked to medium rare & just the right amount of crispness outside.  I was smiling after every bite.  I will definitely be rewarding myself & spending my hard earned money here again!  They are most definitely more delicious than Ruth Chris.
author: Rhona B.

description: The steak was great. We also had a combo sizzling iron seafood platter (crab, mussels and shrimp), a variety of wedge salads and some crab which were all good but not outstanding.  The space is a little weird, but the smell of cleaning fluid when we first walked in really put me off.  After a martini and my first bite of the amazing steak I was able to let the chemical smell go and enjoy.
author: Jim B.

description: I came here on a saturday night with reservations for 6pm. When I got there, there was only a family eating in the dining room and one couple at the bar so it seemed like there was no need for a reservation. It still took a while for our server to greet us even though there was no one really there. My friend and I ordered crostini con burrata app because we didn't know what it was and wanted to try it. We picked the smoked salmon, crab and avocado one. It was good but the portion was so small that I don't think we'd get it again for $13 for nearly 2 bites each. On the other hand, the dinner entrees were great. I had the Petit Filet cooked MR and the steaks texture when I bit into it was perfect. I swear it melted in my mouth. The mushrooms were ok but the twice baked potato that my friend got as a side was way better. He also got the surf and turf which had half crab and petit filet as well. It was good as well, but for some reason the petit filet that came with the surf and turf didn't taste as good as the a la carte petit filet. All in all the entrees were good, but if I do go again I'm just sticking to the steak and a twice baked potato!!!! BOTH YUMMY! Another perk I almost forgot is that when you eat here there's no need to look for parking...COMPLIMENTARY VALET!!!!
author: Krystal G.

description:
This place is FABULOUS!!!  I called them last Saturday afternoon to make last minute reservations for a party of 12( day before Mother's Day).  They very kindly did some juggling of schedule to accomodate us. Later on it turned out there would only be 6 of us. When i called to let them know they were very appreciative.  So, 6 of us sat in a round booth. The decor was amusing, attractive...quirky and fun. The staff was  nothing but friendly and attentive.
The food OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!
The lobster curry soup, scrumptiouis...the brussels sprouts w/ pancetta..MMMMMM. 
The meat, I'm told, was amazing. I had 1/2 garlic broiled crab. It was delicious, but personally took too long to crack open, for small the smaller bites inside. Next time I"ll go for meat, as yummy as the crab was. They have an elegant selection of desserts. I only have fabulous things to say about this place, including the free valet parking (tips, of course). Can't wait to go back.
author: June K.

description: I asked for a booth as well on my Open Table reservation but got a stuffy table in a little room by the entrance.  My filet was way overseared.. I swear I could feel the cancer coming on..  Overall the food was good but overpriced.
author: Derrick V.

description: Went here a few nights ago, had the basil martini, Caesar salad, bone-in filet and cheesecake.  The Caesar was hands down the best I have ever had and that's a lot of Caesars over the years.   The filet was not seasoned and was not near as good as some of the other Bone-In filets I have had at other places.  Our cheese cake seemed like it came from Costco..... All and all, I will go back if I have to with friends but I will not spring for the bone-in filet because it isn't worth it.  I will also just drink my dessert because the martinis were good.
author: Brooke K.

description: The steak here is so good I could just die.  Its like the best meat I have ever put in my mouth.,  Some people say the service is bad.  Ive never experienced this.  But seriously I'd wait like 2 hours for that steak (the bone in Filet)  To die for..and the bread with the oil and the olives and the sides ..Im tellin you..dont waste time at Harris or Ruths anthing..I promise this steak is bananas!  I just can't take it!
author: Michelle K.

description: Delicious aged beef. Though it is really pricey, I felt certain combinations were better than others (ie. portabello mushroom side instead of corn). corkage fees and certain styles of cooked beef will nail you at the end of the night. what comes with great food, comes with a price right?
author: Jason C. J.

description: Brought my family in from out of town, sad the service was rude and an inconvenience. Spoke with the manager Bernie he tried to make it right but unfortunately it was said and done, it overshadowed the food. Thank you TEO for the bad service.
author: Tania M.

description: The one time I was dining at Bobo's I was very impressed with their mussels and shrimp, crabs and most of other side dishes (twice baked potato, crab cake, etc). However, for a high end steak house that offer 40-dollar filet mignon that is really chewy is really a turn off.  The place may be a little too dim for most people and I was not a big fan. Service was excellent. Besides the chewy meat, almost everything else was near perfection. Well, maybe with the exception of the price =-P
author: Mike S.

description: I came here for thanksgiving! The crabcake appetizer was amazing...super crunchy on the outside and soft inside.! the lobster soup was alright.  I ordered the bone-in fillet mignon, probably the SOFTEST steak i've ever had in my life. The crab was great too, a lil oily/VERY garlic-ey!! YUM. it might be too salty for some people, but perfect for me. As for dessert, I shared the kir royale sorbet and it came in a waffle nest and it was also very delish! it came out to be $130 for two people...but I enjoyed a very nice thanksgiving dinner! and i can't forget to mention that the atmosphere is pretty nice too :)
author: Momo O.

description: First the good. The steak was really exceptional and the wine list was nice as well. Our server was fine, but we were ignored by both servers and the hostess for quite a while before we were seated. In fact, it was not until a member of our party went up to the hostess that she finally acknowledged us and we were seated. It just doesn't seem like it would have been that difficult for someone to say "Hi folks, we'll be with you in a moment. Especially since we were standing right next to the hostess stand. Maybe we just caught them on an off night, but I am going to say 2 stars for the service and four stars for the food.
author: J F.

description: Great bone-in filet and loved the heirloom tomato salad. Fun ambiance and great drinks.
author: Jen M.

description: I've heard alot about this place and it lived up to the hype. A group of 8 ate here and everyone at the table got the bone-filet (rare) and it was so delicious. For appetizer, we got seafood and mussel skillet. Mussels were definitely good. Sides were portobello mushrooms, twice-baked potato, and onion rings. Loved the mushrooms. The desserts didn't look that interesting though. If its your first time, get the bone-in filet!
author: Yanting L.

description: Best steakhouse in the city. Bone in filet is to die for.
author: sara D.

description: A steakhouse that does not serve ribeye shouldn't really be called a steakhouse (Izzy's, I'm talking to you too).  This is merely a place that serves steaks and while they do a fine job serving the cuts they do have, you can't really compare Bobo's to the others.  The sides they serve are maginal at best, the decor and dining room(s) are a bit odd too and what's with a limit on corkage, 2 bottles max?
author: Jon P.

description:
Man, it pains me to do this - but two stars. well, call it 2.5 stars.

It seems that whenever I am really excited to try a new place, the experience never amounts to my expectations.

I took BF to bobo's for this bday dinner on Friday night. We started with some drinks at the bar while we waited for out table.  Table was ready in a few minutes.

We order a bottle of pinot and start with the crab and double mussels.  Both wine and seafood schmorgesboard (sp?) are promptly delivered - so far so good.

Let me say that the crab and mussels were phenomenal. There were so many mussels that we couldn't even come close to eating them all. After mowing our way through 2/3 of the sizzling skillet, we decide we better stop so we have room for our steak.

Here's were the night takes a turn for the worst.

We stop eating anf sit there with out table full of empty mussel shells and broken crab bits for about 15 minutes. Finally, I see waitress, flag her down, and let her know we are done. (thought maybe the 1/3 mussels left might be confusing her - maybe she should have checked  on our table once during the evening).

10 more minutes go by. 

Then someone clears the seafood mess off our tabke.

20 minutes go by - no steak. no visit from waitress. we sit. we eye our watches. 

Finally, I grab waitress and ask if the steak is going to be much longer b/c we have company over - her response : just a few minutes, the chef had to make the sides.

what? we ordered everything  at the same time like an hour and a half ago. brussel sprouts and portabello mushrooms cant take that long.

Finally, 10 more minutes go by and steak and sides arrive. By this time, all of the seafood has had time to settle and we're not even hungry for steak. we each have a few bites and are done. Take basically entire steak and sides home. boooooooo.

Then i had to flag down witress for check.

It looked like they only had one waitress for the entire section up stairs. What a disappointment. I had such high hopes. Would I go back? only of someone else is paying. hard to spend my own money on such lowsy service.
author: Kay T.

description: We went again; and it was perfect as always. Its our favorite place in the neighborhood for steaks and fun drinks!
author: Stuart M.

description: Hands down our top pick of one of the top steaks you can ever have.  Bone in Filet of course and then get a crab or two.  Their crab is truly the best flavor you will eat anywhere, simply excellent.  Wine list is great, steak, crab, excellent.  Side a little shaky. Wait staff are really really job.  Bernard their captain is first rate.  Another plus free valet parking right out in front !  Excellent.
author: BGinLove B.

description:
An extremely overrated steakhouse. Only positive thing is the 'free' valet parking service which is pretty much one poor guy trying to park cars into a 20 spot garage while keeping Lombard's right lane off Van Ness clear of customer's cars. Once you get in and sit down however, there isn't much positive left. 
The prices are standard steakhouse but the quality of meat and steak grilling skill is very poor. First of all, this steak house uses a flat iron skillet, fancy way of saying the steaks are not cooked properly. I order my steaks rare everywhere I go and so I know exactly what to expect. Not only did my steak come back very overcooked but almost everyone with me had the same problem. Some got wrong cuts of beef and it was just horrible. My steak was probably medium well with a very poor texture and the meat itself was not juicy and lacked flavor. 
It's very sad when a 'steakhouse' serves poor meat but extra sad when the best food they serve is their crab which is only so-so at best. The servers are nice and the decor is pretty cool but the pricing is ridiculous. I am usually happy to pay about $100 a person at a steakhouse if the steaks are good. Paying $100 at Bobos i felt was a crime. One of the worst steaks I have ever paid for in my life. But for those who call this place the best... get your taste buds, tongues, palates examined. For the same price, you can get a much better tasting steak and overall experience at almost any other steakhouse in the city. 
Stick to the basics, Morton's is a big public company restaurant franchise for a reason. Consistency is worth every penny.
author: Art L.

description:
Great place to go for steak and crab. 

No complaints about the food here. I usually start with one of the iron skillets that they have available. Good stuff. The filet Mignon is excellent. The Bobo's style porterhouse is great for two people to share.  I usually get the twice baked potato which is delicious.  The crabs are good but I have to be in the mood to crack them.
