The place is on the small side.  The bar area is really congested especially if your sitting by the front window. The waiting staff was pretty good but they looked annoy with the rather small space to maneuver.

I will definitely be back.
author: Terrel R.

description: Yummy!  Get the bone-in filet! Try the Cucacabra cocktail....or two!
author: Lena D.

description:
As impossible as it may seem in the gourmet food capital, I was able to have an awful meal at what was deemed San Francisco's second-best steakhouse.  We were seated in a small upstairs room that was decorated with random knickknacks, which were most likely found in the basement of the owner's parent's house.  I'm talking foam a Siva heads, a tin lantern, mirrored flower holders, and tea candles.  I swear I thought that I was in the game Clue: Colonel Mustard in the Library with a candle stick. 

So the decor was bad, but the food was worse.  We ordered a "wedge" of salad.  I imagined a quarter head of iceberg lettuce or something like that.  What arrived was three, wilted leaved of romaine smothered in blue cheese dressing.  We sent the first "wedge" back and got another one that was marginally more fresh.  Maybe I'm a fool for thinking that a steakhouse can do a good veggie.  I was similarly disappointed by the bland cauliflower and deep fried zucchini, which were cut like hot-dog pennies.  I did like the onion rings and yams.

As for the steak, I had the petite filet and my friend had the porter house.  He said he loved the porter house and there was various "MMmmm" sounds expressed that confirmed that it was in fact a good steak.  The petite filet was small but good, though undercooked. 

I had high hopes for this place.  Sorry to say it doesn't live up to most of the reviews or the title of second-best steak in SF.  I would love to know what Chef Ramsey would say.
author: Abbey K.

description: Finally made it here and what great experience. We started off with a house salad which wasn't drowned with dressing the way I like it. Then came the complimentary bread that was really good, the split top with EVOO drizzled in between was a nice touch. Mussels were the next victim of the night and that was just goood goood. Next was the highlight of the night! I had the bone in filet and the wife got the petite. The wife's was cooked perfectly but mine was a little over cooked but the aged meat was SOLID regardless. Huge flavor, sooo good. For the sides we had the twice baked potato, yams, and the mushrooms. Mushrooms were the best by far. Finally we ordered the cheesecake for dessert. I would say ordinary at best, their not known for desserts. Our server was very attentive and keeping an eye on us which I didn't mind but the wife felt uneasy. The big disappointment was that we requested a birthday dessert for her mother but they forgot. Other than that it was the best steak I had in a long time and it was an experience. I highly recommend you to give them a try. Oh and I almost forgot FREE VALET! Next stop Alexanders!
author: T L.

description: I have been here with friends on several occasions.  Valet is really the only option, but it is complimentary.  This is a nice place to come with a group.  A very nice and unique setting.  The steak is fantastic, as you can read in detail in other reviews.  A unique San Francisco experience in my book.
author: Ryan W.

description:
I'd never been here before, but a friend and I wanted to try a steakhouse that neither of us had been to before.  Based on the Yelp reviews, we decided to try this place.

I had the filet mignon, and was not disappointed.  It was cooked to order, not over done, flavored right, and leaving you wanting more.

For sides, I split the half-baked potato in order to get some of my friend's mac & cheese.  I figured the potato would be good, but I was pleasantly surprised with the mac & cheese.  It came out sizzling with some bread crumb-type topping.

As a bonus, they had free valet parking.

Food: great
Service: good
Price: reasonable

Overall, I would definitely go again, and I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good filet mignon.
author: Bay Area T.

description: Love it, Love it, Love it...and really love the Portabello Mushroom side. Boboquivari, by the way, means "Court Jester", but there is nothing funny about how good these steaks are
author: Jason D.

description: I came here with my wife as our last meal on our honeymoon.  The bone-in filet was aces along with the swiss chard.  The wine list by price point was great; we could pick a bottle without breaking the bank.  Bookbinder's in Philly was our standard for a great steak meal but Bobo's surpassed that.  Can't say enough about this place and we can't wait to come back.
author: Michael P.

description: BONE IN FILET!!! If they don't have it, walk right out. If they do, get it with the twice baked potato, mushrooms, and the crab as an appetizer. Mmmm... SO GOOD!!!
author: Freckles H.

description:
i had tried pretty much all the steak house in the city, and bobo met all my requirement .................we had an 830 res and even though people were piling up by the door we were seated right away, the service was attentive enough, and believe me if you want the best piece of meat you have to go for their bone-in filet mignon....................it is divine............it is the best 43$ i had ever spent on food

make sure you try the chocolate mousse for dessert
author: Giu G.

description: Boboquivari's (The Steak, The Crab) Let me rephrase that. (The Crab, The Mussels) This place rocks. The steak is really good. You can't beat a dry rub steak and that is how they prepare them.   I wish they had a rib-eye. Cowboy cut is how steaks should be in my book. But, these folks really know how to do anything with a shell with expertise. I love the cast iron method of preparation at high heat. If you love dungeness or mussels you need to try this place. Even the wharf cannot compare. Drinks are great, atmosphere is great. Location is ok, but food will make up for it. Service is also great and the GM really earned the 5 star rating. We received a slightly wrong order and he really made it right and made us laugh.  I'm a fan and will continue to go back.....Period.
author: cody c.

description: Awesome place for BONE IN FILLET.  The meat is so tender and full of flavor and juises.  One of the best steaks I've ever had.  I've tried plenty of steaks but this one lives up to the hype.  It is a bit pricey, but I am willing to pay for a good steak.  I rank it up there with Ruth's Chris and Alexanders.
author: John V.

description: Excellent food and decor. The setup is very fortunate to make it feel really nice and intimate while being able to actually fit a lot of people. The only thing that makes this anything but a 5 star is that it was quite pricey. That said, the food was good and I really enjoyed my experience.
author: Kevin T.

description: The bone-in filet is AWESOME!  Just like butta...I also really enjoyed the burrata appetizer and the sourdough bread drenched in garlic and olive oil.  Yum.  Boyfriend ordered the crab, which I tried -- not bad, but not amazing.  They clean out the guts (the best part...)  OK desserts but nothing that really grabbed my attention.  Would definitely come back though...
author: Mitzi C.

description: So good!! The filet on the bone is to die for, mac and cheese 2 thumbs up from my husband, I loved the crab and shrimp.  Amber our waitress was great.  First time here and hubby's birthday dinner was a success.  Not to mention the free valet parking!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I love the atmosphere and the food is great. The fillet minion  and twice baked potato were one of the best I have ever tasted . Drinks were strong and good too. I'll be coming back soon.
author: Brandy F.

description:
My friends touted Bobo's as the best steak in town. All of them recommended the Bone-in Filet and the twice stuffed potato.

In my opinion, I've tasted better steak and sides at other steakhouses (20oz Bone-in Filet at Metropolitan Grill, Seattle), but Bobo's still ranks very high among the restaurants I've visited.

I'm not sure if it was my table's luck, but my buddy and I both ordered the bone-in filet medium rare and received steaks that were unevenly cooked. The portion of meat away from the bone was cooked almost all the way through. The meat was still tender, but it was not a bit raw in the middle. As I progressed closer to the bone, the center became rarer and was delicious. If only it had been a bit more even throughout. I understand that the section by the bone would be the most rare, but I did not expect the rest of my steak to be severely compromised.

I'm not a big guy, but I am a big eater. I want my steakhouse meals to be huge. I want a large steak and large sides. The sides at Bobo's didn't really cut it for me. Our twice baked potato was probably about the size of a computer mouse, and the sweet potato looked a single scoop of ice cream on a plate. The taste didn't blow my mind either.

Maybe my expectations were set too high and maybe we went on an off night, but the small portion of the steak that was cooked perfectly is enough to make me want to go back and give them another try.
author: Joe H.

description:
3.5 I love the way this restaurant is set up. We were late to a pre-highschool reunion dinner and found oursleves lost in the bar area. There are numerous smaller rooms within this multi story building. Makes for a more intimate meal. I'd go back with just the two of us to try out the two person tables they have, almost hidden behind curtains. We found our table of nine on the second floor, in the main room . Im actually not sure if it was the main room because it seemed like every room was the main room. 

It kinda annoys me when youre in the marina, trying to enjoy your steak and wine, and a larger party just cant seem to lower their voices. Laughing the night away about some joke regarding a dinosaur hunter and his cave woman.....

haha...its so much better, though, when youre the guy telling the joke and its making your own friends laugh hysterically. 

so why less than four stars? While the sides were probably the best ive had in any steak house anywhere (brown sugar'd yams!!!!), the steak was just okay. Bone in ribeye was good. But when youre claiming that you are NY's answer to the esteemed Peter Luger Steakhouse, you had better have the steaks to back it up. Now im not any kind of steak specialist, and i couldnt tell that these steaks were aged longer then normal. I've also actually never been to Peter Luger, but i have had better than Bobo's. The place is great, but their food is good....thats all. 

PS: I think i made my friend VJ cry, with that dinosaur hunter/cavewoman joke =P
author: joe j.

description:
been here a few times. 

had the bone-in fillet and prime rib. both really good. top 5 steak houses ive been to. 

baked potato, mashed yams and bloody mary's are good too. 

atmosphere is average. 

would go back for a bday
author: Bobby B.

description: The food was delicious, the ambiance was perfect and the service was impeccable with a charming wait staff. Can't wait to dine there again. I highly recommend their filet mignon bone-in with their twice baked potato. Their brussel sprouts with pancetta is a close second for favorite sides. Because they serve certain food on iron skillets, though it comes in piping hot and steaming, the scent also stays on your closes and makes the room slightly smoky. Thus I would also recommend dressing appropriate with the anticipation that you will smell like you've been to a BBQ after dining there. This restaurant also have curtains in each dining room (3) that can provide groups with some private space, this would be a very fun place to take a group.
author: Ivy W.

description:
wow.  my bf surprised me by taking me here for my birthday dinner and the food, service, and ambiance was amazing.  the decor was very unique, but i liked how it didnt look like every other steakhouse in the business.  we were seated in a cute little booth meant for 2, and it even had little curtains on the side that the waiter drew closed for us so we could have a bit more privacy haha - very fun.  

we started dinner off with some wine (decently priced bottles!) and an appetizer of mussels - YUM.  he got the bone-in filet mignon and i got the surf and turf, medium rare.  WOW.  the food was amazingly good, i loved every bite of it.  my bf thought the filet was more on the rare side than he would have liked, but the meat was very tender and juicy.  the crab was a bit messy, but who cares when it's so good?  

my bf had mentioned it was my birthday, and the server surprised the both of us with a complimentary dessert with a lil candle in it - how thoughtful =) it was a perfect dinner !!
author: Maxine C.

description: My memory is a little foggy due to the fact that we spent the day in Sonoma on a tour for my birthday, came back had more drinks at another bar, then ended up here, very very drunk. We all weren't there, one of us was leaving early, we couldn't speak straight, we looked trashy because we had wine spilled all over us but this place waited on us and smiled the whole time. The food was excellent based on the expression on my face from the pictures. Mussels - get them. Even if you don't like them you would like these. It's worth the money.
author: Jessica S.

description: wasn't that impressed. I've been told by many that this is one of the best  places to get steak in the city. My steak was ok... nothing special. The appetizers were decent, the service was mediocre, and I can't remember anything distinctive about the dessert. Overall, I guess i was just expecting a lot more so I left finding the place a little cheesy and feeling so so about my meal. I might have to give this place another shot given how much most of my friends like it.
author: shadi m.

description: Great steak, but if you get the fillet on bone, make sure you get it medium well or more - anything else is RAW - and i like bloody meat but they go a bit too far
author: Scott K.

description: I don't eat land animals.  My live-in boyfriend does.  Poor boyfriend.  No cow for you.   Because I love him though, I took him to Bobos for his birthday.  He ordered the porterhouse, which he said was one of the best steaks he ever had.  They seated us in a little nook, and comped dessert, which they served with a little candle.   I had the crab, which was also fantastic.  All in all, a great place to take the meat eater in your life.
author: Amanda B.

description:
It was an unfortunate thing for me that I'm suppose to stay away from seafood for a bit due to some mysterious food allergy that I got somewhat recently because this place is well known for their steaks and crab... and I love me some crab.  But enough of the pity, I went here this past weekend part of a Bachelor Party night.

From the outside, the place looks pretty deceiving as it looked like some ghetto joint next to a Travelodge.  But once you go inside, it was a much different experience than I thought.  Once inside, you're greeted to a classy-looking bar and I think there were a few small dining tables down the hall.  Did I mention this place is cramped?  I almost feel like I was headed to some exclusive steak house during the alcohol prohibition period.  All the rooms, hallways, and stairwells felt a bit claustrophobic, but it made for an interesting experience that I actually though, "hey, this is kinda cool."

The staff was very friendly and our waitress was this British girl, so that accent helped the dining experience even more.  So despite the exterior, the menu here is basically luxury style where there are few items, everything is a la carte, and everything was expensive.  I ordered the New York Bone-In ($39) with a side of portabello mushrooms ($8) and fried zucchini ($8).  I ordered the steak medium-rare (which is done by default unless specified), but my steak came more medium than it was medium-rare.  I didn't tell them to redo it (I hate doing that as much as possible, so to not get "extra sauces" into my meal), but the flavor was very good.  It was still pretty tender and the juices was very flavorful with whatever spices and herbs they used to marinate it.  The sides, I thought the mushrooms were decent; it actually came out lukewarm when I got mine, but the zucchini was excellent especially dipping it in the tartar sauce.  One thing that I regretted getting was their baked potato and I tried a bite out of someone else's and it was amazing.  I don't know what they did, but you get a half slice and its basically a mashed potato mixed with butter and spinach dip and not sure what else.  Trust me, get the baked potato for the side if you do come here.

I saw some of what other people had and the filet mignon ($39) looked pretty typical.  It was 8 oz and it looked very tender, but people I talked to wasn't jumping out of their chair for it.

By the end of the night after some corkage fees and splitting the cost for some of the appetizers, I spent about $90 there.  Was it worth $90?  No, but I guess I would be very hard pressed to ever say any restaurant would be worth that much.  But if you want a fine, dining steak (and I suppose crab) experience, then you can't go wrong here.  They have a great wait staff, the unique atmosphere of the restaurant, and their food is quite eloquant, though not without a few mishaps that I encountered.  I would go back again, but I preferably would want to pay less and try out their crab.
author: David Y.

description: Phenomenal!! That is the only word I can use to describe the bone-in filet and delicious sides I had when I came here a few months ago. Don't be fooled by the nearby Travelodge. It's on the expensive side, but everybody deserves to indulge sometime, right??
author: Heidi B.

description: OMG!! I miss Bobo.. I kid you not this is the BEST steak I've ever had in my life..The bone in filet is incredible. No other steak house has ever come close. This place is great for groups, you can dine upstairs in a semi private area.
author: April Rose D.

description: The steak here is absolutely fantastic.  If it is available, get the bone-in filet mignon because it is even more fantastic.  The seafood there is good, and the bread that comes with the meal is fantastic.  The servers are very attentive and I honestly don't have any complaints about this place.  I was in SF for a week and it was the best meal I had during the entire trip.
author: Allen K.

description: This is by far the best steakhouse in SF!  We have tried most of the top rated steakhouses and we always end up saying, "hey bobo's is better!"  The prices are reasonable, and the food is great!
author: Rebecca W.

description: Generally love this place, but my last experience 2 nights ago was not so great. Sat next to 2 couples, one of whom brought their baby.  The baby seat was in my space and my dinner experience was ruined.  I felt that our waitress was avoiding me and when the bill came to $450 for my hubby and me, I seriously questioned why I was there.  The sides are WAY-OVER-PRICED and definitely the portion has been reduced since the summer.    What gives Bobo's?  I am a regular and sad to write this!
author: Bev T.

description:
Pretty good dry aged beef BUT pricey for the , mediocre service, decor, and fawning but useless manager/owner.

But that was a good cut of beef...
author: Cary W.

description:
My fiance took me here for my birthday since I am a steak/crab lover.  I didn't know much about the restaurant prior to the visit, nor had I read any reviews, so I had no preconceived expectations.
We were in no mood to look for parking so we decided to valet-news to us that's it's complimentary.  What a fantastic surprise!
Upon entering the restaurant I automatically noticed the horrible decor...fuscia colored walls mixed with the crookedly hung pictures and multi colored light fixtures.  
We were seated at a back table against the wall which was nice and cozy.  Their wine list leaves a lot to be desired, and it seems a little over priced.  We ordered mixed drinks which were excellent, although it took a long time to get them.  Only one bartender on a Saturday night for a full restaurant and bar?? Our waitress was nice but seemed to be giving us a serious sales pitch in describing the beef..we're already here so you don't need to convince us to want to stay here. The appetizer that we ordered-crab crostini with avocado & salmon lacked flavor.  I wouldn't recommend it.  Our main dish, me the surf and turf and my fiance the fillet on the bone was fantastic.  The meat was very tender and succulent and my crab had so much flavor.  It was work getting to all of the meat inside of the crab legs, but they give you all of the necessary tools.  
Synopsis-Fantastic steak but lacking in other areas.
author: Angela N.

description:
Food- 4.5
Value-2
Service-4 

If judged on food alone, this place would easily be a five. The meat is tender and flavorful, but considering that value is taken into account, the price simply knocks it down one, almost two stars. The meat- best cut is bone in filet- practically melts in your mouth. Sides are all a la carte and for the most part, generally good (we had the brussel sprouts, twiced baked potatoes, and mushrooms), the starter salads are mediocre, and the only other appertizer I've had were the mussels, highly reminiscent of The Stinking Rose (their sister restaurant). Maybe rivaling the meat, actually no, but very, very, very good are the desserts; the panna cotta was absolutely incredible. Expect to spend a good 150 for two people (without wine, including tip). Parking is extremely easy as it is free valet.
author: Tammy P.

description: We've gone here for 3 years now for anniversaries and such and we love it. The food is awesome and the service is excellent despite always being busy. They have valet so it's also very convenient. The filet mignon, brussel sprouts and bread are delicious. We've had dessert and it's good, not orgasmic but good.
author: Fam G.

description:
i brought my parents here for my father's birthday this past weekend since we're a family that loves our surf and turf.  we spent a good 15 minutes deciding who was going to order what so as to make sure we could basically try a little bit of everything on the menu.

we started with the lobster soup and the crab, salmon, and artichoke crostini with burrata.  My first opinion of the soup was that they didn't give us nearly enough, but upon consuming half of it i discovered it was really rich and thick and full of huge chunks of lobster!  The crostini was light but the portions of crab were not skimpy, and even though it wasn't a real standout, it was a refreshing appetizer.  And being a lover of cheeses, the burrata was really good both by itself and on bites of the crostini.  (i had heard that burrata is the king of fresh mozzarella, and it definitely lived up to the hype)  

for the main course we ordered two filets and the whole crab that we all shared.  plus a twice baked potato and zucchini friti on the side.  The steaks really were perfectly tender with the right amount of charring on the top, and whatever the flavors were, they were delicious.  The crab was also excellent.  Much better than your typical boiled crab.  Even though the garlic and butter were applied to the outside of the crab, the meat still had some of the flavors of it, but of course could be dipped in the sauce.  I really liked the potato and the zucchini was fine, but nothing spectacular.  the only downside was how incredibly messy it was, but that's always the case with crab and they bring you wet napkins after dinner to help with the cleanup process (major props for the wet towels).  

dessert consisted of cones filled with mousse (so good), and pistachio panna cotta (which i really liked, but the parentals weren't too thrilled by).

the waitstaff was very attentive, but not in our faces.  Our server was constantly making sure our glasses were filled (though they did leave carafes of water on the tables) and that we had everything we needed, but never rushed us (i take my time going for every last bit of crab meat).  A pleasant dining experience, and a birthday dinner that my father considers one of his best.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: Yum! This is our go-to place for birthdays and out-of-town guests. I've never had the steak, because we always get the same thing: the three pounds of garlic-roasted crab legs. It is so delicious! And they have a cocktail there that I've never been able to find elsewhere, called a Toasted Hazelnut. It's kind of like a White Russian. I have only two complaints, neither of which is big enough to take off a star: sometimes it's hot and stuffy if you're seated upstairs, and the cocktails are a bit pricey for their size. Try the crab!
author: Amanda H.

description:
Loved Bobo's steakhouse, the reason?  Bone-in filet!  This is serious steak and a truly the best I've ever had.

The restaurant is a bit funky and intimate, we sat upstairs where there were three tables; the waitstaff was attentive and walked us through the menu.  The offerings are typical steakhouse:  starters, salad/soup, the steak, crab and fish.  

The gem not to be missed is the bone-in filet mignon.  Pass on the petite filet, the crab, etc. Just upgrade to the bone-in and you will experience steak nirvana.  Cooked medium rare, it is a meal in itself.  

The sides, all a la carte, are good as well and compliment the steak.  We shared potatoes, mushrooms and brussel sprouts and all were delightful.  Dessert offerings include a tray of small chocolate Dunce caps, which were a delightful end to a wonderful meal.

I recommend Bobo's for anyone who loves a great steak in a warm intimate atmosphere.
author: M G.

description: Bo Bo's is my favorite steak house in SF or anywhere near northern Califorina. The bone in fillet is so tender that I actually opt for the new york steak. The portions are big enough to split with some one else and stll be satisfied. That is, if you feel like sharing. I am looking forward to the leftovers in the fridge! Yum.
author: Charise B.

description: Best Steak I ever Had!  I could just stop there, but there is actually more.  When we first arrived it seemed so touristy to us that we had low expectations.  Once we got instead we were treated to a cool layout of multi-floors, multi-nock and cranny seating arrangements, and gigantic booths.  We ordered some drinks and they were great.  Got Some onion rings, a salad and the crab cakes to start and all were excellent, although very small portions.  Which at the time seemed like a bad thing, but when you are about to eat a steak, they were actually perfect size.  I got the Bone-in Fillet Mignon.  This is an unheard of cut, even from the Butcher we were eating with!  It gives you the texture of the Fillet, with the taste of a New York Strip.   It was so good.  I even but this place about the Number 9 steak house in Vegas now!
author: Pele N.

description:
I had been anticipating dining at Bobo's for quite some time now.  Alas, last night, the opportunity presented itself and I was thrilled! 
First impressions:
The valet was slow.
The hostess was not very welcoming.
The restaurant is so festive, like a steakhouse in a circus trailer! I love the split-level setup... climbing to the top floor was fun.  I LOVED the decorations; automatically put me in a great mood.
The menu: 
Started with the crab cakes -two of them, plenty of crab, delicious.
Double Muscles and crab -the crab was FANTASTIC, the muscles looked and tasted like yesterday's batch.
Bone-in fillet mignon, medium-rare -one side was cooked to a perfect medium rare, the other was RARE. Eh, for the price, I feel like I've had MUCH better.
The mushrooms and the baked yam -both delicious. 
Food overview -lot's oil used in cooking, expensive without complete quality to back. Even the bread was soaked in oil. 
I wouldn't opt to go back.
author: Rada I.

description: Bobo's is my guilty pleasure. Typically, when I want to really get my hands dirty, i'll go with the petite filet and half crab. It simply cannot be beat. However, when I'm feeling especially decadent, I'll order the bone-in aged filet. I can't quite put my finger on it, but they do something to their steaks that creates this abundance of flavor that I have yet to find in any other steakhouse I've ever been to. Hands down the best steak I've ever had the pleasure of cornering and devouring. Bonus, Bobo's always serves me my steak extremely rare, exactly as I order it. Never once have I had to send my steak back as being overdone. And let's face it, for a girl like me  with slightly vampiric tendencies, it's as close to love as I'll ever get. Their sides are delicious and easily large enough for two or three. I highly recommend the sauteed chard, mushrooms, or twice baked potato. However, you could order blindly off of their menu and be pleasantly surprised by what was served. Always a crowd pleaser, from the funky decor to the too-small but still appealing bar area, Bobo's has won this chick's heart for good.
author: Myah F.

description: I love bobo's. The fried crab is amazing. I've taken so many groups here, especially from out of town, and no one is ever disappointed. I love the fact that it's a steak house that isn't Ruth Chris or HPR. I always start with the Crab as an app for the table and then move on to steaks and sides. If you have a big enough group (8-10) it's fun to just order one of every side and share them all. It's also great for a date. My boyfriend and I got a table under the curtains and it was really secluded and quiet. Another neighborhood gem that I will go back to again and again.
author: Katie G.

description:
I would really love to give it 3 1/2 but alas, that option is not available. 

So rating the bone-in filet alone, I'd have given it 5 stars for sure.Hands down the most delicious piece of beef I've ever put in my mouth. The crab cakes were also incredible!  As for everything else, it's about average if not below.

The sizzling iron plate shrimp appetizer was good but nothing very unique, the twice baked potato was great for the first 5 bites and then it became a bit disappointing. The zucchinis fritti was terrible. We ate two pieces and said "why even bother?". I was slightly annoyed that the waitress didn't pick up on our obvious dislike for it (we cleaned our plates on EVERYTHING else but left that completely intact) but I guess I should have said something if I really cared that much. 

The decor, as mentioned by most everyone else is totally bizarre and fairly obnoxious. And we sat WAY too close to the couple next to us. 

But GO HERE for the filet. Don't waste your time with much else as to your sides--just focus on the meat. You can't go wrong. I am STILL dreaming about it. I'd come again but I'm much prepared for ordering now.
author: Sarah L.

description: My friend has been telling me about this place forever so finally we got a group together & went . We had reservation for 6 but there ended up being 10 of us ...a dick move on our part but they did a great job in working out a table for us .Enough of my rambling , Whole crab tasted like it was massaged by garlic butter & rainbows just amazing . Then the bone in filet came........................MY god that was a large sized filet cooked to perfection full of flavor possible the best steak I've ever had . It is now the day after & I'm still in a blissful food coma . If you like steak you have to check this place out .
author: Todd C.

description: Overrated! Yes the meat was flavorful, but they overcooked our steaks.  We asked for medium and it was medium well by the time it made it to our table.  On top of that it cost 160 bucks for 2 people! I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Brian H.

description:
My second visit to this establishment.  On visit one we made a reservation through Open table and all was well except the food was a little too salty.  The server was excellent and the steaks were too.  The wine list is very nice.

On visit two we did not make a reservation and the obvious difference in treatment based on appearance and no reservation was dramatic.  Again the food was over salted, the steaks were good and the service was fair.  The server was a slightly reserved almost stuffy male of european origin with a less than cordial demeanor.  It seemed as if the room he was working was for those who did not have reservations and it seemed he resented the task of serving those who may or may not be as generous with the gratuity.  Again the wine list was very nice and set up for tourists as all the selections were catagorized by price using the grocery store method of pricing on the .99 ie., 19.99......29.99 etc. Effective but tacky.  Still I would return and be sure to make a reservation as well as ask to be seated in one of the dark dining areas as opposed to the brightly lit area with a view of the traffic on Lombard st.  Avoid the side dishes and request lite salt on the meats.  The first visit we ordered the filet mignon and it was prepared perfect.  The second visit we ordered the NY and they were medium supposed to be medium rare but still very tasty.  The dessert did not meet house made standards so I would skip that and head out for some gelato.
author: Bobby M.

description: Their excellent steak and atmosphere are why I'm rating Bobo's as highly as I have.  I found the meal to be very pricey, and some of the dishes not at all worthwhile.  On the other hand, the filet mignon and the zucchini fritti might have been the best I've ever had.  Bottom line: Don't bother ordering the baby romaine wedge, the crab, or the portobello mushrooms, but I'd still go back.
author: Christine H.

description: Bobo's came with a very high reputation from some friends so my expectations were up.  But, Bobo's did not deliver.  The baked yams were a very good side dish but the petite filet was so small I thought it was a joke.  If it was not for the good company in party, this would have been a very bad experience.
author: Jake B.

description:
Went there with my wife for the first time tonight. 

Though the place was nearly empty (and was still so when we left two hours later), the hostess sat us right next to the restroom. 

We ordered:

- Mojito
- Gin & Tonic
- Tuna Carpaccio
- 1/2 Crab
- NY Steak, bone-in
- Portabello mushroom side order.

The cocktails were fine, enough to ameliorate the effects of our dreadful seating. 

The bread was served having been soaked in half a cup of olive oil, such that once you'd had a piece your hands were soaked in olive oil and the proximity of the bathroom was actually a good thing as your fingers looked like you'd, well, just soaked your hands in a bowl of olive oil. 

The tuna was warm and oily, and came out literally one minute after ordering (even before our cocktails came), indicating it'd been pre-made and sitting under a heat lamp in the kitchen. 

The crab was kind of chewy, and had a kind of sour smell - probably not terribly fresh. 

The steak was $39.00, a la fucking carte. For $39 a steak had better melt in my stupid steak hole and produce an all-night boner. At the very least, it should have come with two sides and my choice of sauce to smother it with. This one, though fine, was no better than any I'd ever had at goddamn sizzler for half the price. Had it cost $20, this would have been a great steak. For $39, it was just offensive.

The mushroom side dish - diced portabello mushrooms sauteed with garlic and capers -  was tepid when brought to the table and cooler than room temperature half way through the dish. Despite the garlic and capers, this dish was remarkable flavorless and quite oily.

Although the service was good and on par with their inflated prices, overall this place is a fucking ripoff, and we won't be back.
author: fleurd d.

description:
this place is amazing!  get the crabcakes they are so damn good! I'm not usually a fan of mushrooms but the mushrooms they have as a side dish are extremely good as well.

And don't forget the main dish .... the bone-in filet!!!!
author: Christina S.

description: Took a good friend here for his birthday and none of us were disappointed.  I have been visiting Bobo's for a few years now and always their quality and service are fantastic.   Dry aged steak is yummy!  The ice cream cone chocolate mousse dessert is great for sharing too.
author: Kristine K.

description:
Went here for the first time in 2008 and it has since been our favorite restaurant!  My boyfriend and I recommend this place to all of our friends and have taken multiple people back with us.  We travel over an hour each way to go to this place and it is worth every minute of our drive.
First, the food is incredible!  The bread they bring out is topped with green olives and olive oil is disbursed throughout the loaf which is so good!  We always get the crab cakes.  I don't even like crab but last time we went we ordered 2 orders  so we could each have 2.  They are crispy on the outside, excellent flavors inside, and topped with a cranberry relish that is the best crab cake topping I've ever tasted!  I always get the filet mignon (bone-out) and my boyfriend always gets the filet mignon (bone-in).  This is by far the best steak you will ever have.  I recently tried Ruth's Chris to see how it compared to Bobo's filet and it paled in comparison to Bobo's.  The aging process they do with their steaks and the method of cooking causes the steak to literally melt in your mouth.  The twice baked potato is my favorite side.  It is SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD!  My boyfriend loves the mac n cheese side.  As far as sides go, those two are the best.  

Negative would be that our service is somewhat hit or miss.  We have had a couple servers who were very friendly, knowledgeable, and actually kept our waters full, but more often than not, our service is under par.  We had one waiter whose cologne was so strong it almost ruined our meal, which was on top of the fact that he only checked on us once.  The servers are making good tips because of the price of food, so I would think that servers would be a little more attentive to things like refilling water and menu knowledge.  If we didn't love the food like we do, the service would be enough reason for us to not go back.  They have changed the recipe on the steaks since when we first started going.  It's still excellent but I personally like it even better (if that's possible) when they used some rosemary in pan when cooking the steak.  The flavor was just a bit more complex.  The noice level can get obnoxious.  The last couple of times we have been seated next to business parties who seem to think they are the only people in the place.

Overall, this place is worth every penny if you are a food lover like me.  The only way to describe how incredible the food is is to just recommend you go try it yourself.   I would love to give this place 5 stars but until the service improves I will have to keep it to 4.
author: Jeanie B.

description:
ok, I have to give this 5 stars because it's so deserving... come with a huge stomach please and more than just 2 people. 

I've been here about 3 times now and all the times, it's been amazing! 
We've always had about 6 or more people, so it was fun to eat your steak and drink and share all the yummy sides. 

I haven't been to BOB's Steakhouse, but this by far is my favorite. 
I've been to Harris, Ruth's, Morton's, and one in San Jose, I can't remember the name, but it's in downtown. 

Go there and try it for your self! The decor is very much like a clown. 
Creepy and fun!
author: Judi K.

description: My family and I ate her on Christmas Day!  I had the filet and the burata!  Most delicious meal I have had in San Francisco!  Highly recommend it!
author: Daisey Mae W.

description: A girlfriend took me here for my birthday dinner.  This restaurant was at her suggestion and I almost changed locations on her as originally there were going to be 3 of us and the other girl couldn't make it.  So, I almost said "since it is going to be the two of us, let's go to our usual".  Luckily, for me I didn't.  The food here was amazing.  The bread was amazing, the petite filet mignon was amazing, the sides were amazing, the dessert was amazing, the wine was amazing.  Our server was attentive and nice.  Highly recommended.  I am already sitting here the morning after, racking my brain for another reason to come back here....soon!
author: Stella C.

description: WOW...one of the best steaks I have had in a long time! With out reservations we had about an hour wait, however they were very accommodating at the bar. We ordered a bottle of wine and a few appetizers. The wine suggestion was fabulous, the crab brushetta was amazing! My fillet was prepared perfectly, and the twice baked potato was awesome! I loved the feel of the place and the service was great. I can't wait for my next trip back!
author: Lisa K.

description: wonderful wonderful - the bread with the olive oil and garlic delicious, salad was wonderful and the bone in flllet mignon was great. Service was good and the valet parking was nice. Didnt care that the whole menu was ala carte, therefore bringing the price up drastically. Would be nice if at least the side dishes was included, having to pay for everything seperately was a bit ridiculous. Although the food was delicious I think i will search for a different place next outing - for this place - $170 plus was a bit high for dinner for two.
author: James B.

description:
DELICIOUS!
My friend and I went to Bobos last night and it was totally amazing.
For two people they put us upstairs at a two-top in the middle of the room. They offered us a corner two-top but it felt like you were eating in a closet, so we opted to sit pretty close to a four-top party. They were fun people so we were happy we sat next to them. 

 I ordered the lobster soup which was amazing. Lobster chunks and curry with delicious croûtons. Amazing. For my entree I ordered the half pound Garlic Butter Crab. Amazing! The sauce was so good and the crab was flavorful all the way through the shell. I ordered the twice baked potato which was delicious as well,  but with the soup and all the crab, I couldn't finish the whole thing. 

My friend ordered the surf & turf which was a petite filet mignon with almost as much crab that I had. I had a bite of the filet mignon and it was absolutely perfect. By the end of the meal, we were both covered in crab shell bits and our hands were coated in butter. Awesome! Our total bill was about $95, and we didn't order any wine! It is pricey, but if you can spring for it , I highly recommend it.
author: Nicolette M.

description: All I can say is bone in filet, possibly the best steak I have ever eaten. The crab is delectable as well.
author: P K.

description: The food was delish! amazing crab and steaks, its a great place for a birthday or group dinner! we went there last night for a friends bday and had a blast, the set up with the food is great for group dinners, we got one huge appetizer that all 6 of us shares, got 2 twiced baked potatoes that were easy and big enough to cut into 3's, olive bread was amazing and bacony-brussel sprouts was rich with flavor.  great place!
author: Bernie B.

description:
I came here with high expectations, and they were met. Only a couple restaurants get 5 stars in my book, and I don't think this is going to be one of them... not because the food isn't good (bc it is), but just because I like Houston's better, and want to differentiate. ALso, Bobo's is pricey!

My mom and I got the filet mignon (no bone), and my dad got the hawaiin fish.  All were delicious.  They bring you bread in the beginning that is olive and garlic or something? very good.  

The main meals are a la carte.  They said for three people we should get 2 or 3 sides; we got 2 and that was definitely enough.  We got the sauteed cauliflower and then something else that was like steamed spinach but not quite? the cauliflower was good, I think next time though i'd get the zuchini frittada rather than the spinach-like-stuff.

The food is good! ...but there is a price for that!

- We went on a Monday night and had no problem going last minute... I'd probably suggest that
- The area is also kind of small and intimate with romantic/dim lighting, so probably not the best spot for a first date (might be awkward) or rowdy bunch
author: Caitlin B.

description: Now this is a steakhouse. Let's not take anything away from other great steakhouses around the US, like Sparks in NYC, Bones in Atlanta, and Delmonico's in Vegas; but Bobo's, for those in the know, has some of the best, if not the best, steaks you'll ever have.   Why? Two words: Dry aging. The filet mignon was a good sized slab of meat, oozing with the juicy goodness that can only be associated with the finest food this planet has to offer. Coupled with a nice Cabernet Sauvignon, the suateed spinach, and baked potato, this very well could be the best meal San Francisco has to offer, and that's saying a lot.
author: Nishan K.

description: The steak is amazing! The atmosphere and service is all really good. I'll leave the corn-fed stuff to y'all as I am pretty much grass-fed only these days. While their beef is super tender and flavorful, I get that feedlot grain-fed beef hangover, which is not worth it. The sides were unique and well done, especially the green beans with cocoa nibs. They were not doing the big crab deal when I went, but hearing how good it is, I might just have to go back.
author: Alex C.

description: The best steakhouse! I really enjoyed their steak and their atmosphere! The service was great and I will be going back for sure!
author: Hooman M.

description: Pretty much the best steak I've ever had!  The surf n' turf is unbelievable!  If a guy ever REALLY wants to impress a girl (who is a meat-eater) take her to Bobo's.  Its funny, I find myself having conversations about Bobo's more than any other restaurant in the city.  Truly amazing!
author: Lauren M.

description: ALL i can say is man ohh man this is the best steak i had in my life quick friendly service and worth every penny i will be back again soon!!!
author: enrique g.

description: Good steak, as expected; one of the top five places to get one in the city... However after factoring prices (and everything else other than the food) in, something feels left to be desired.
author: Aaron J.

description: The steaks here are so good, I've never had a bone-in filet mignon before!!  My husband and I enjoyed it immensely.  I tried my friend's NY strip and it done to perfection as well.  I didn't much care for the swiss chard side as it was a little too sour for me.  Nor  did I care for the tuna carpaccio as it didn't taste that fresh--the chili pepper/olive tapenade on top couldn't even cover that.  The crab cakes weren't bad, but I make them better myself.  The twice baked potato was good.  I think this is a great place to stick if you love meat and potatoes.
author: Kit E.

description: I usually HATE going to the Marina, especially to dine. But, Boboquivari surprised me. The dry aged steak is delish. I agree with everyone that the atmosphere is quite tacky though.
author: vicki c.

description:
i ordered the surf & turf, the 1/2 crab and petite filet mignon.  really, the best filet mignon i've ever had in my life!!!  

i really did have a good dining experience here.  we were late for our rsvp, called in re: delay and they were totally okay with it.  at arrival there was valet parking, always sweet (a drag to find parking in sf). 

so here is what i tried.
appetizer: 
tuna carpaccio - should have skipped it . . . it was weird . . . 
lobster soup - rich and yummy . . . but wouldn't order again
shrimp - can't go wrong . . . 

sides:
mushrooms - okay, a bit sour for my taste
baked potato - delicious
onion rings - good according to friends (i don't eat onions)

dessert:
did not have room!  everything that i usually eat was delicious!

ALL MY FRIENDS ENJOYED THEIR FOOD and I WILL BE COMING BACK!!!
author: lucie l.

description:
Bobos has the best steak I've had on the West Coast. Their bone-in filet can't be missed for any steak lover in the city. The place has an old-steakhouse vibe inside - funky intimate atmosphere that's a touch claustrophobic when they're busy. 

The menu is simple and to the point - exactly what it should be. Steaks, crab, a few apps and simple sides. We had a some apps and they were amazing - especially the Lobster soup. If they're serving the bone-in filet (apparently it's not always available) make sure you take advantage. Mains and sides are ordered individually and everything we sampled was great. I recommend the twice-baked potato.
Service was great as well - really I can't find any downsides to mention. Even the prices are great for the quality.  
The best place I've found for a steak in SF.
author: Dan W.

description:
i just read the other reviews and i am surprised at the (few) negative reviews! every time i've been there the service was so good the waiters stopped just short of giving us back rubs. in fact, the second time i went there i met my mother after work. she got there ahead of me and spotted me walking past the restaraunt, not knowing i wanted to look at something down the block. one of the bartenders actually went out the door and walked halfway down the street calling my name! (he was so handsome i almost dropped my purse)  

anyway, the steak is AMAZING, the portobello mushrooms transport me, so does the olive loaf bread. although the decor does take a bit getting used to...cramped and much too cluttered...but the warm colors help stimulate the appetite.

i wanna say one thing about the decor: Boboquivari is the italian equivelant to Harlequin, a kind of gaudy court jester. the decor is meant to celebrate him, a fact anyone can read about on the back of the menu. i don't get the impression that the place was ever meant to be high-end, just a good quality fun place to get great steak. it's just expensive because the quality of the food demands it. and frankly, it isn't really that expensive, i just don't have a lot of money and as a typical american i'm used to getting the large price-saving combo meals...

the portions are not what i would call large, but everyone i have taken there has agreed with me that we always left satisfied. my theory is that when the flavors are so good that you take your time to enjoy, then your stomache has a chance to feel satisfied. my mother says that's how french women stay thin...lol!
author: kashi d.

description: The steaks are delicious, I could not finish my Fillet Mignon, The sides also were delicious but a bit on the small side if you had to share it, I wasn't that thrilled with the decor but it has an explanation behind it though I can't remember what it was. The staff was competent , fast and attentive. Overall I had a great birthday dining experience, I would not recommend to go if your on a budget but if you want to treat yourself to a good steak give this place a shot. Oh the valet parking was also a plus because it was free.  Cheers and I hoped this review was helpful. Greg J.
author: Gregory J.

description: If I was just reviewing the steak that I ate "the Bone in Filet" then I would definitely give the place 5 stars.  The service (Jackie our server) was also phenomenal.  But I would have given this place 4.5 but since YELP doesn't allow me to do that, I took away the last star because the salad and the Lobster soup was not that good, and the desserts just ok.  But the crab cake appetizers were excellent.  The decor of the place is very old, but I do think the circular bar is very cool.  I didn't have the opportunity to taste the crab entree which looked delicious.  So I definitely plan to return so I can taste the crabs.
author: Myra M.

description: This place is the BEST for a juicy filet mignon cooked the way you want it!  We had a large party and all of our filet mignons came out the way we ordered it.  Very impressed!  Also, you have to order the sweet potatoes!
author: Catherine S.

description: "Home of the Tantalizing, melts-like-butter-in-your-mouth, steaks". After a day of shopping in Cuppertino, a celebrity friend & I had reservations here for dinner. From the outside, the place didn't look like the typical upscale 5 star joints that I'm used to, but hey-what the heck!?! So as we got out of the car (Valet service a plus), we were escorted past the line, and taken upstairs to our private dining room (compliments of the owner) near the patio. We greeted by the Maitre d' & were offered the best selection of Cognac on the house ($200 bottle not on the menu). After skimming through the menu, we decided to go with Appetizer: Apple-walnut cranberry salad. Entree: Porterhouse Filet Mignon. Sides: Baked yam, Portobello mushrooms, and modern mac & cheese for the sides. Drinks: Moscow Mojito & Champagne. Everything was delish & more than enough food to take home for left overs. The only complaint that I have was the loud cackling hens (middle-aged drunk white women, one who tried to hit on me & my guest), were extremely "chocolate" wasted, loud, & obnoxious. With the way Bobo's require a specif formal dress code, reservations, and over $200 for dinner for 2, you would think that type of behavior wasn't allowed. Overall the food was great & I'd return again. Compliments to the Chef ;-)
author: Nikkole M.

description: This is the best steakhouse I've ever eaten in and believe me I've tried alot of them... both in the city and in Toronto (where I'm from).  Their bone-in fillet is to die for so you need to give this a shot when you go.  The ambiance and service was also top-notch but parking was a pain so its wise to taxi or valet there.  Btw.. Ruth's Chris was the runner up and Harris' was down near Izzy's.
author: J J.

description: This place is nothing short of absolutely amazing! I've driven by this place for years and have always been curious about it. I recently went there for dinner and was blown away. The space itself is very cute, warm and inviting. There is a large bar as soon as you walk in which is perfect if you want to sit down for a glass of wine before being seated. We started with the mussels (which were very moderately priced btw..$15 for a huge plate, and were delicious!) and then I had a perfectly cooked filet mignon with portobello mushrooms. My taste buds were in absolute heaven. I tried some of my friend's crab and enjoyed it as well. The wait staff was incredibly nice and attentive. I would DEFINITELY come back and would highly recommend this place to all of my friends.
author: Sarai S.

description: Just went back for dinner over the weekend and was a little disappointed. The steaks were good but not as good as I remember. The side dishes were way too rich with too much salt.  The best part of the visit was the wine.
author: Sean B.

description: I have to agree with most.  This is the best steakhouse I've been to in SF, or really in CA...so far.  But hey, its damn expensive! Of course the only thing that would make me go to a place like this was a girl.  A damn hot girl.  They cook their steaks well.  The wine list is of a decent length and has good variety.  There is a booth in the corner with a curtain.  I think you have to reserve it in advance.  That would've been nice.  The cool part is this place got me mega brownie points with the lil woman.  I wonder who's taking her there nowadays.
author: Amir B.

description:
Best place in the city to get a steak, by far.  The service is not tremendous and the decor (dark, funky) is not for everyone, but if you want a romantic dinner with a loved one, and a perfectly cooked steak, this is the spot for you.

We started off with the burrata with grilled asparagus and heirloom tomatoes.  The EVOO that it came with was flavorful, but the burrata was the star of this salad/appetizer.  Creamy and mild, I have to find somewhere in the city that sells a close imitation!

For dinner, I ordered the New York strip and my girlfriend ordered the surf & turf (half-crab, petit filet).  I snagged one of the crab legs from her, and almost wished I had gotten her meal!  Though it takes some effort with the cracking/extracting, the claw meat was worth every bit of time spent.  The legs were enormous, fresh, and juicy, though the accompanying sauce was nothing to write home about.

The New York strip was one of the best I've had, not just in SF.  Mine was medium rare and cooked exactly that way.  Those who don't want a steak red in the middle should order it medium.  The steak was so good I contemplated taking the bone up with my hands and chewing off every last delectable morsel of meat.

Not to be missed were the twice-baked potatoes, which were the best I've ever had.  They were silky smooth and cooked perfectly, and had a flavorful burst of scallion, sour cream, and seasoning that will make sure I order it next time I come back. 

Since it was my girlfriend's birthday, I also got the strawberry cheesecake.  Luckily, it was very light and not too sweet, so even though we were stuffed, it did not make us feel sick from overeating after we finished.  Overall the experience was tremendous here, and I'd recommend it to anyone in a smaller group looking for an intimate (and delicious) meal.
author: James S.

description: Cool Bohemian themed steak and seafood restaurant in the Marina. Love the bone-in rib eye.  You have to get the garlic crab starter.  Pretty solid wine list as well.  Much cooler vibe than places like Harris', Bob's or Morton's.
author: Michael K.

description: I have mixed feeling about this place. The first time we dined here we gave it 5 stars. The steak, crab, shrimp, potatoes... everything was excellent. We recommended it to everyone we knew. The second time about two weeks ago, I left the restaurant with food poisoning :(. I don't blame it on the food as much as the dessert. The cheesecake was the only thing I had that my husband did not and it left me sick for a full 24 hours. My $200 dinner was literally down the toilet. The food (the bone in filet, per my husband, is the best) and cocktails are good but I would think twice about ordering anything dairy off their menu (I'm sure their cheesecake any other night is fine, I'm just now traumatized).  Another side note, the waitress (both visits) were very dry and unpleasant but service was good... just don't expect a smile as you write them a $30- $35 tip. My husband still gives the restaurant 5 stars (of course he would, he went to sleep full and content)
author: Ava G.

description: Went back to Bobo's, this time with a client. It was still wonderful, but unfortunately it just doesn't seem like Dungeness crab has come into it's own yet this year. I had hoped that Bobo's crab would surpass some of the mediocre crab that I've had since the season opened, but it too was sort of mushy and not full to the shell. Despite being a little disappointed, I look forward to going back. The sides are great, the service is good, and the valet parking is oh-so-convenient!
author: Michelle F.

description: Damn that steak was good!  This place is probably one of the best steakhouses I've been to.  I'm a huge meat eater and I love steak so I will bet my right nut that you will love this steakhouse.  Although, Bobo's is under the category, "steakhouse," I know they serve great seafood too.  Normally, I request for horseradish with my meats, but this steak was so damn good and aged to perfection.  The service was fabulous and the wine list is pretty good.  The only flaw is that parking is a bitch, unless you want to get valet, but I would save that cash for dessert.  ;)
author: Manton R.

description:
This place was easy to find and the complimentary valet parking is sweet!

Garlic Baked Sourdough Olive Loaf here is so good.  My first impression of it was that it was very greasy.  After I tried it, I loved it.

I got the Filet Mignon Bone-In was really good.  I've always heard the good things about it here, so I had to try it.  I got it medium, but I think I'll ask for medium well next time - it was a little too red for me.

My fiance got the Mussels, Shrimp, & Crab Iron Skillet.  It was good.  It was a pleasant surprised that the waitress brought warm hot towels to clean our hands with.

My fiance proposed here on Valentine's Day, so this place has a special meaning to me now.
author: Tina B.

description: Now I'm no steak expert, but the steak at Bobo's is probably the best i've ever tasted. I've been to Bob's(which is also good), Ruth's Chris(overrated), and House of Prime Rib(not in the same class), and this is my favorite. I would write a little bit more about this place but I hafta go pee real bad. Good steak!
author: Tommy B.

description: Expensive SF steak house w/ very good food (they dry age their steaks longer so they're supposedly more tender), and very good service, but sort of a weird vibe in terms of the decor (sort of a quasi-middle eastern circus tent thing happening)...We had potatoes and porto mushy's as sides and they were bomb.
author: Ryan W.

description: Have been slowly making the round of steakhouses in SF, and Bobo's is by far my favorite in terms of taste so far!  As most have said, the bone-in filet is delish.  I had a bit left over and brought it home for my dad - he is quite discerning when it comes to food - and he actually loved it as well...made me think this must have been some darn good meat!  Other high notes - sauteed mushrooms and the brussel sprouts...yum!  Cute restaurant design, not at all stuffy.  Of note - I went with a group of 6 and we got cozy in an upstairs booth - was a fun, intimate setting.  Watch the stairs if you're seated upstairs - long, somewhat narrow, and dark staircase.  Friendly service.  Main problem is it's not the best deal cost-wise (main entrees are all a la carte, wine was pricey), but worth the occasional splurge if you're in the mood for a good piece of steak.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Went to this place finally last night for the first time for a good friend's birthday dinner. Had the "Bone In Filet Mignon" and it was the BEST damn piece of red meat I think I've ever had. 

Remember in the movie The Matrix when Agent Smith took Cypher to a restaurant in the matrix? And Cypher ate that PERFECT steak...that's what I ate last night! 

  Service was good, place was nice, lots of red everywhere, free valet parking which was nice....4 stars due to the fact that everything is a la carte. $40 should include a damn potato or at least, at least 3 or 4 asparagus spears!?!?! But no matter, I shall return.
author: Steve K.

description: The steak here is as great as the decor is cheesy.  no really, you put your knive in the steak and it tears like a delicate piece of paper.  Kind of pricy but good.
author: Dishar R.

description: I give out very few 5 star ratings, but this places absolutely deserves it. The unique cuts of beet (bone in filet!) are simply amazing. perfectly flavored and cooked every time I've been there. The sides are just ok (though the clams platter is pretty great), but as I say, who goes to a steakhouse for the sides? Having gone to pretty much all the steakhouses in the city, a few in Boston and Vegas, this one is by far my favorite.
author: Franco R.

description: So visit #3, 1st time sucked...2nd time Rocked thanks to Erin  & now #3.....Everything was AMAZING, from the food to the table to the awesome server we had..Thanks Caroline.....Even the bartender knew what a "mint julip" was this time...Keeps getting better.
author: F G.

description:
Bone...in...filet.

Enough said.  I used to go to Harris when I was looking for a good steak.  Boboquivari blows it away.  We tend to have a couple of cocktails and a bottle or two of wine when we go (I know mom, I am working on it), which gets pretty spendy, but worth the trip a few times a year.
author: Matt A.

description: i had Thanksgiving dinner here one year. no dry turkey, just a juicy hunk of red meat! prepared and seasoned perfectly. the aps were tasty too - sizzling iron roasted shrimp and crab!
author: Jeff W.

description: The bone-in filet is one of the best steaks in the City.  The first time I came to Bobo's, I was blown away, not only by the quality of the meat, but by the extra-mile service we were given.  I mentioned to our server that the only thing missing on the menu was a bearnaise sauce, to which she replied that the chef would be happy to make it with a little advance notice!  Excited b the possibility of the best steak experience ever, & impressed by a restaurant that seemed to sincerely want to please it's customers, I booked a birthday dinner for 6 friends, mouth watering as I anticipated a fantastic steak with the ultimate topper.  But alas, when I called ahead to request the bearnaise special, I was told that not only did they not have the necessary ingredients (cream & tarragon), but they similarly did not have the desire to acquire the ingredients to make a special dish.  Dreams dashed, Bobo's has joined the ranks of your typical steak-house ~ good steaks, with an aloof & snobbish attitude to match.
author: Karyn E.

description: Had to try the bone-in filet mignon after reading all of the reviews on yelp. It was very tasty and I actually took half of it home because it was so big! For the sides, we ordered the portabello mushrooms and swiss chard -  Honestly, I really wasn't that impressed with the sides. I though the chard was seasoned on the salty side and the mushrooms had big chucks of garlic on it and were semi-undercooked.  I heard the mac'ncheese was really good, but it's off their menu now.  The yumminess was the pistachio panna cotta.
author: Natalie S.

description:
This is an awful tourist trap.  The bread which was soaked in garlic and I mean soaked was inedible.  The twice cooked potato was like glue and I couldn't take 2 bites. The steak quality was good but it was covered in an overpowering and not very good sauce.

Review - don't go.
Izzy's Steak House which is close is 1/3 less in price and though not great is 100% better than this tourist destination.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Truly, I've never seen such poor service. Went here for Dad's birthday, party of 4 with two teenagers.  All ordered bone in filet.  Although we explained to the waiter that we wanted them pink, nor red or wet in the middle, three of the four steaks came out too rare.  Not a big deal to us, just please cook them a little more.  However, waiter left the 4th one at the table and continued to bring the sides, so the birthday boy ate his dinner alone while the three of us watched.  Then, when our steaks came out, he sat and watched us eat.  Moreover, my steak was poor quality with fat running through it.  Waiter proceeded to tell me I should order a different steak because I just "wasn't aware" of what BIFM tastes like.  Really? I've had plenty of BIFM's all over the U.S., including at Fleming's in San Jose (which was PERFECT), Gibson's in Chicago, the Caucus Room in DC, etc.   All were far superior to what I was served.  At least the manager came over and agreed with me on the quality and then made a second steak (which is reason for the 2nd star).  Worst of all, when it came time for dessert, the two teens ordered something, and waiter brings my son's dessert with a candle in it, places it in front of my husband who blows out the candle, then the waiter picks it up and places it in front of my son.  They couldn't even be bothered to give my husband a birthday dessert! (Yes, they were informed weeks ahead of our dinner that it was a birthday celebration).  Still, if you don't want to comp a free dessert, fine, be cheap, but for goodness sake, don't "borrow" someone else's dessert to make it look like you did!  Shocked at the lack of class and service.
author: Karen D.

description: I love Bobo's.  One bite of the bone in fillet and i was sold.  It seems a little odd that it is attached to a travellodge but, this is san francisco, so you have to find space where you can.  I think that the best part about Bobo's is that it is a killer steak without feeling like you need to get super dresses up.
author: Robert R.

description: Bobo's was absolutely delicious. The Filet Mignons I ordered was cooked to perfection and the sauce was unbelievable!!!! The atmosphere was laid back yet classy. Service wasn't bad. Its a good idea to make reservations if you go during the weekend, it gets busy.
author: Ivy G.

description: Every bell desk in the city recommends this place, but it's no reason locals shouldn't dine there.  Expensive, but worth it.
author: Lane K.

description:
Loves it! We went there for an anniversary dinner and it was also last minute. Fortunately for us on a saturday night at 8 there was a table for two in the bar by the window, and we were seated right away. (really wish they had a podium for the hostess though, it felt like we walked into the back kitchen and felt a little lost) on to the food.
     Crab Cakes: Almost all crab with enough crumbs to hold it together, and the cranberry relish was the perfect addition. 
     Baked Yams: Smooth and creamy, with a sprinkle of brown sugar on top. Although for 8 bucks I wish the portions were a little bigger, also because yams are my favorite side and do not want to share. (sorry b.f)
      Portobello mushrooms: fantastic, the seasonings were so good it could have been mistaken for little cubes of tender beef. 
       Surf and Turf: (Petit filet mignon and 1/2 crab) the steak was extremely tender, however some parts were a little over salted...still good. and crab was great with the butter lemon caper sauce thing.

       Best thing was our waiter Bernard who was the BEST! Bernard was prompt when needed but did not overcrowd us. Replaced water when and, inquired about our food appropriately. He even gave us an extra pair of crab crackers in case my b.f wanted some crab or if I just wanted some help.  
    We are so coming back. And we actually prefer  a steak house that isn't so pretentious ahem...Ruths' Chris
author: Lyna K.

description: If you like meat, go to BOBOQUIVARI'S!!!!  I'm surprised not more people know about this amazing meat gem.  I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday, and boy was it a feast of a celebration.  We love seafood, and we love meat.  So, the group of us (four people) decided to order the double crab double mussels, the double crab double shrimp, two BONE IN FILET MIGNONS, mac & cheese, brussel sprouts and twice baked potato.  Man oh man.  The seafood was great, but I definitely have had better.  The mac & cheese was good, however, I'm not a big fan of blue cheese, and there was a lot of it in there.  The other sides weren't outstanding either.  But the Bone-in Filet Mignon was utterly, melt in your mouth delicious!!!  If you come here, you must order this Bone-in Filet Mignon!!  For four people, and all that food, the bill was just under $250.  Mind you we didn't order drinks.  What a deal!!  Reasonably priced, scrumptious food!  Will be visiting again very soon!
author: Rachel B.

description: So I basically stopped ordering steak in San Francisco about 10 years ago, since every time I did it never held a candle to anything I've had in Chicago or NYC.  Until BOBO's comes along.  This is the real deal.  Exceptional prime aged meat, cooked on the bone the way it should be for flavor.  I love the NY steak, but I even thought the filet cooked on the bone was great.  Sides are interesting, and the Iron skillet seafood makes for a great start to the meal.  It's about time this town served up a great steak!
author: Aaron N.

description: This place has some good aged steaks.  Though nothing beats HOPR in my opinion.  But, I really loved the crab that I had here.  It was drenched in a garlic butter sauce that was finger-lickin' good.  Is it wrong that I would rather get bread and dip it in the crab juice, rather than have dessert?  I came for the steak, but would go back for the crab.
author: Zac A.

description:
u really have to be craving some meat when you get here. 

first, watch your first step when you enter. i almost fell over. but that could be completely my fault because i was already buzzin upon arrival.  ambiance is eclectic and welcoming. staff is very friendly and warm.  

STEAK: grrrrreat. even medium-well. i know. i'm sick like that. 

DRINKS: the bartender knows what she is doing. she made up this drink, called the 8-ball, which is AWESOME but i swear she bit off the drink menu at Blowfish Sushi. whatever, it's still yummy. 

i would definitely come back here again.
author: Sharonrose B.

description:
Excellent service. Our waitress was beautiful, sweet, attentive, and knowledgeable. Cute setting, great for a date or perhaps a special dinner with the folks? Unique decor ... I digged it. 

The food was scrumptious. I got the Filet Mignon on the bone. Delicious ... perhaps the best steak I've ever had? Twice baked potato as a side & a zucchini appetizer. 'The Dream' Martini for a cocktail: de-lish!

The only downside? The dang price! I would prefer to gorge myself on sushi any night!
author: Devin P.

description: Very convenient valet parking. Ask to sit upstairs, it's much nicer. Very good steak.
author: Marina N.

description:
Expensive, but worth it.

Bone in fillet mignon was the best steak I've ever had. 

The sides, dessert, appetizers were all good enough, but just come here for the steak.
author: Saikat P.

description: Went here on a whim.  Never had interest to dine here but I am glad I did!  Free valet parking was a plus I hate looking for parking in the city.  It was about 10pm when I found myself ordering fillet mignon and a twice baked potato, strange...  I wasn't even that hungry.  I cut into the fillet mignon and could of sworn something happened to me... it was like eating straight butter it was so good!! I can't say this place is the best, but I will definitely come back.  It would be nice to come with a date... very private dinning nooks.  Hummm... I don't think I'll order that potato again it had too many herbs & spices.  Dress code: very casual to extra dressy. :)
author: Angelica R.

description: All along I thought Ruth Chris was the steak place until I dined at Bobo's.... Absolutely the best steak so far. I had the filet mignon  with the bone. Very good all around.
author: Bob F.

description:
man this place is hands down, the best steak place i've ever had (so far). this place is just soooo damn goood! 
-bobos steak is tasty, juicy, just perfect. been here several times and this place never disappoints me or the bf.  i have no idea why pple like ruths chris...blah. unless u like ur bland steak sitting on top of butter...
-sides: cauliflower is probably the best side dish here. OMG delicious!!
-dessert: the ITALIAN cheesecake!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! not your regular cheesecake, it has marscopone cheese instead, and its so GOOD!! my mouth is watering thinking about it. if you dont like your desserts too sweet like sugar, this is a MUST try. One time I ordered two slices at the end of our meal! its just THAT good!
- i would give this place 10 stars if i had a choice! the only thing is that its not as pretty or romantic compared to other restaurants..the clown thing is kinda tacky. but who cares the food is great. and free valet!
author: linh t.

description: Where's the beef? AT BOBO's!! I have to say this is the best steak I think I've ever tasted. A bit pricey but its definitely worth it. The beef was cooked to perfection, slightly crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The twice baked potato and sauteed mushrooms were the perfect side dishes, but this place is really all about the beef.  The pear tart is great for dessert.  It looks kind of cheesy from the outside but the inside has a moroccan theme. The best thing is that they are open reasonably late for dinner. My boyfriend and I went in before they closed and the food was still amazing, not to mention we had a whole moroccan wing of the restaurant to ourselves! If you are in the mood for some serious steak its worth visiting.
author: Roopa D.

description: I had the chance to experience this establishment last night and was impressed. The steak was simply outstanding and makes my mind drool just thinking about it. The decor was something to behold. But I have to say the service was truely exceptional (Thanks Amber!). I love it when a server takes care of details. Hate to say it, but details only f&b people would recognize. I would suggest this restaurant to you reading this.
author: K K.

description: I ate here a few months ago with my dad.  Let me preface this by saying Dad is farmboy turned techie CFO who doesn't do well with overpriced, bullshitty food.  That said, he loved this place!  We both had the filet mignon and he said it was the best steak he had tasted in his life.  Enough about my dad, I loved it!  Given I've only eaten about 5 steaks in my life, having recently come over to the dark side (i.e., embracing red meat carnivorous behavior, I couldn't get enough of it.  I have to agree with what a lot of the others have said--the sides were a bit pricey for what they were.  Have you guys ever seen the movie the Great Outdoors? Remember that scene where John Candy's character has to eat 96 ounces of steak (from what I remember)? Yeah, I wish that were me at Bobo's.
author: Melissa M.

description: This place makes a succulent bone-in fillet mignon that few steaks in the city rival.  The rest of the menu leaves a little to be desired.  The sides, which I feel are critical in a steakhouse, are good but rather small, and I'm disappointed that they removed "fancy mac and cheese" from the list.  The iron skillet roasted shrimp are overcooked and tiny.  Otherwise, the food is good, and the atmosphere is cool and offbeat due to the harlequin theme.  Definitely worth a try.
author: Dan A.

description: Fantastic steaks, I had a NY strip. The medium-rare flavor really came through towards the bone (their fillet and New York come in bone-ins). Great interior and atmosphere. Side dishes were rather small in portion (compared to Ruth's Chris I suppose) but still good. Highly recommend.
author: Inbae L.

description: We celebrated our wedding anniversary at Bobo's last month. The restaurant was dark, very mysterious and romantic. We were first served with this garlic infused bread drizzled with olive oil that really really good. We had crab cakes for appetizer which we both enjoyed. For our main course we both ordered filet mignons bone-in in medium rare. The steaks came out really really good, it was so tender and melted in our mouths. The cut was also huge. After having bread and crab cakes, I couldn't finish my steak without the possibility of passing out from too much food. We also ordered the twice baked potatoes and portobello mushrooms as sides. The potatoes were excellent but the mushrooms were just okay for us. Their mojito also looked wonderful but it didn't taste great as it looked. A+ though for the free parking.
author: Jo Ann A.

description: I love this place. Yes, the menu is limited, but the steak is the best you will find in the city - particularly the bone-in filet mignon. In fact, I have NEVER in my life had a better steak than the bone-in filet. If I come across some extra money, I go straight to Bobo's.
