This place is not just excellent because of the amazing steak, sides and service, but also because of its character. A lot of steak restaurants feel pretentious and sterile. This place is quirky, fun and welcoming. This restaurant epitomizes the best kind of San Francisco restaurant experience.
author: renee H.

description: Try the bone in filet, tasty and cooked to perfection. Decor and ambience is catchy, though not nice. But hey, it's unique and the food/service is great. I have to add, the sides were just so so. Just get the steak and a potato. Damn I couldn't remember how to spell potato for a second. Almost added an "e" at the end. Friggin Dan Quayle put that in my head and now it's always there. What's that idiot doing anyway? Ok, I'm rambling. Bobo's also has a reasonable corkage fee, so bring a bottle.
author: Dave M.

description: Quirky atmosphere. Great filet. Some AWESOME fondu!
author: michelle k.

description: The best Steak in San Francisco. The service is mediocre, but the food makes this place amazing. If you order the crab, it comes in the shell, which makes things interesting (a little tough to crack). This place will not let you down.
author: Tabor, S.

description: By far the best steak I have had in San Francisco.  I had the bone in fillet.  It was very tender and cooked just right.  It was nice that they didn't use too much seasoning as to detract from the taste of the meat.  It is a bit expensive but I didn't feel like I got ripped off when I left.  The ambiance was unpretentious, which is good but I felt as if they just threw a bunch of crap all over the place.
author: Brent G.

description:
My friends swear by this place, they took some pics here http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNU6sPRWzVl0ngCRqat1TQ?select=2UOjYHGjy3kCWYPQI_alfA

I wasn't thrilled with the decor or the place (it's all so vertical like Jeanty' but red) or to have to go all the way to the Marina for that matter, proximity makes a difference! They also put us in the back in a corner some people might call cozy, I wanted more natural light, especially dining at an indecent 5pm, it is that packed (or is it really)

Good service though, we even landed a French speaking waiter, +

The crab (not so much), mussel and shrimp appetizer was deelish, the bread woulda surely enhanced the experience but I'm off it (it won't last)

The in-bone filet was available, fantastic. They did medium rare medium rare which is no small feat. Tender, flavorful. I got some dijon and went to town. Caution: the petit filet is smaller than most other places. The orders we picked were pretty average: mushrooms were kinda sour, cauliflower is... cauliflower. Gotta try some twice baked potatoes next time

$250 for 3 (w/ half bottle of wine), I dunno, is that ok? haha. So I'm not really sure how all that compiles to 4 stars, I'm slippin

We topped the meal with the chocolate bomb, it's aight

Bobo's is a very strong steak option for our dear city
author: xo x.

description: OMG.this place is the best kept secret in SF! I start salivating whenever I think about their bone-in fillet and the twice baked potatoes, especially when paired with a strong martini and a nice botle of wine...hands down the BEST steak I have ever eaten time and time again...and that's coming from a self-proclaimed steak conoisseur!!! I've been to Harris's, Morton's, Izzy's, El Raigon, Joe DiMaggios, Acme Chophouse, you name it and NOTHING, no NOTHING compares to good old Bobo's.  The ambiance is dark and sexy (although somewhat scary with all the clown decor) and the service is always top notch. 5+++ stars! Go now and chow down!!
author: A B.

description: This is quite possibly the best steak I have ever had.  Order the bone in fillet rare.  The only con of the place is the service can be slow at times but after eating the steak you forget all about it.
author: Ryan R.

description: What can I say? The steak exceeded my expectations (I recommend the fillet mignon bone-in due to its amazing flavor) and the service was good. Not great or anything, but rather adequate. The meat itself was probably the most delicious that I have ever eaten and it was prepared perfectly and rather quickly. In a word: awesome!
author: Paul A.

description: Best stake I have ever had. I love it. Incredible service,  great atmosphere, and its always consistent.  I just wish they had a better wine selection.
author: L L.

description: I think a cow would eat a steak from Bobo's. I have eaten steak everywhere you're supposed to eat steak, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Cut, Chicago Chop House, Charlie Palmer, Peter Luger, etc....I think this place does the BEST steak San Francisco has to offer. The sides are great, and they make some tasty cocktails, try the Moscow Mojito.
author: Joshua G.

description: bottom line...could not have had a better time or meal....service...fantastic...the steak...OMG..better than we have had in years...were referred by a server at Maggiano's in Santana Row..took his advice...and were so happy...cant wait to go back...do not let the exterior fool you...its cozy...quaint...fun...great place for the locals....super...great...fantastic...
author: Russ T.

description:
yes, indeed, best steak ever.

Well, i think the review said itself already, so i am not going to repeat it.

Give 4 stars is because each steak is 40+ dollar.   A steak only, no appetizer, drink, veges....  Just you and the meat. :)
author: James L.

description:
The steak was just so-so here. After all of the hype, I was actually pretty disappointed. The twice baked potato, was good though, as was the ice cream cone trio of desserts.

Wouldn't come back here. There are better steakhouses in San Francisco.
author: Michael C.

description: I can't decide which I like the best the Steak or the Staff?  I have been in several times, eaten at tables and at the bar, and had perfect execution every time.  The Dry Aged Beef is head and shoulders above other steaks available in town, and the staff is friendly, professional and the not-so-serious atmosphere raises Bobo's above all the "smoke filled room" feel of traditional steak houses.  Bobo was a court jester, so there is clown stuff and red and black checked walls, the only thing serious is the seriously great food!  What a relief from library/hunting room red leather and stuffy captains that think they are sommeliers!
author: Trip H.

description:
This was hands down the best steak that I have ever had.  I agree about the bread, it was soaked in olive oil.  I only wish that I could have gotten the full-sized filet.  It really melts in your mouth.  I was lured into the Mac and cheese but I would choose something else next time.

So just went for my next time and it was absolutely amazing.  The first time was no fluke.  The bread was not as oily this time and insanely good.  We also had the cauliflour and the mushroom sides; they were fantastic.  Also, for dessert, try the rasberry panne cotta.  It was really tasty but not overly rich.
author: Brooks O.

description: I got the mussels and crab. I've had better of both! Maybe next time, I should go with the steak since it's a steakhouse.
author: Cassandra T.

description: The Bone-in Filet is simple amazing! It's the best steak I have had in the city. Well done Bobo's, well done.
author: Brad h.

description:
We would also recommend using Andrea's Natural Marble and Stone Company.  We spent three weekends looking at pre-fabricated granite counters, and we received a few price quotes.  The prefab places had a lot of similar granite options, but we did not find the color scheme we were looking for.  We also  wondered if any of the companies we had visited had cut some corners, such as using color enhanced granite, 5/8 inch rather than 3/4 inch granite, etc).  Because of the reviews on Yelp, we went to Andrea's.  We assumed we would not be able to afford their services, but we liked the idea that it is a family business and that Giovanni, his father, and his son Andrea, had all been trained as stone fabricators.  Although much of their work is fabricating materials people buy elsewhere, they do have a selection of slabs in their warehouse.  They happened to have a slab with the colors we wanted, and it had some interesting garnet, carbon and quartz highlights.  We gave Andrea the layout details of our galley kitchen.  He spent a lot of time discussing our relatively small project and helped us choose a counter edge that fits our particular needs.  We were very surprised when we learned that his price was almost the same as the price quotes we had received at the prefab places, and we agreed to have Andrea fabricate and install our countertop.   

Andrea came to our house in Concord to prepare the template and answered all of our questions.  He made very good suggestions, patiently worked with us at the warehouse regarding what portions of the slab would be used for each part of our counter, and then did a very nice job cutting and installing the countertop.   Thanks Andrea and Giovanni.
author: Ralph M.

description:
Some of the worst service we've ever had.

Don't get me wrong, the food was amazing.  Steaks were perfectly cooked.  But the food was completely overshadowed by the poor service.  Didn't sit us till 45 minutes after our reservation.  Once we sat we didn't get any water or bread, even when the table who sat after us got it right away.  Not once did the server ask if we wanted something to drink.  I can go on and on.

We could have just gotten a bad luck of the draw.  But either way, our experience was such that we will never go back.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Last night my mom, step-dad, and I had a great meal:
Crab fettecine alfredo
Hawaiian Sun Fish with sides of mac & cheese and yams

Amazingly, stepdad did not order steak.  He thoroughly enjoyed the crab alfredo but thought it a little under seasoned.  I had a portion of his to try and found that it was not underseasoned but light and creamy, puntuated with scallions, to let the crab come through.  

The Hawaiian Sun fish was accompanied by seaweed that was cooked or dressed in soy, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil.  

The sides of mac & cheese (mild white cheeses and mine was made better by the addition of cracked black pepper) and the yams were big hits with mom & I.  Especially the yams; they were lightly sweetened but I couldn't recognize with what.  We should have gotten two orders.  

We ooh-aahed, licked our fingers, but we didn't eat the half loaf of the home-made bread they gave us.  We wanted to save room for the dessert: Kir Royale-Champagne Chambord sorbet in a waffle nest.

Bobquivari's was suggested by desk clerk at the parent's hotel, the Lombard Motor Inn.  They were happy because it was directly across the street.  No urban hiking, or expensive cab taking, necessary.
author: Courtney S.

description: One of San Francisco's great steak houses: First when you walk into this establishment you immediately notice that it's not your typical steakhouse decor. It's styled in a cabaret'ish, romantic, quaint athmosphere that I can't accurately describe and you'll just have to check it out to understand. The menu offers not only steak but also seafood such as dungeness crab and mussels which was actually very good! They offer about 7 side dishes which compliments anything you order as your main entree. Now to the steaks...I've only ordered the Bone In Filet the few times I've been there because, why change when you've tasted something so awesome? Read their website to find out how seriously they take their steaks! I can't say anymore, you'll just have to judge for yourself.
author: M V.

description: I thought the steak was crazy good. Flavor was awesome, very tender.  The twice baked potato was also a hit with me, very tasty.Can't wait to go back.  Service was helpful and good.
author: Amy J.

description: I've been to Bobo's many times over the past few years and have loved the place.  I was so disappointed at my experience a few weeks ago when I took my parents there.  Our steaks were chewy and did not have the usual rosemary/garlic marinade. They were also on raw side rather than medium rare. The sides were cold.  The service was also fair. Our waitress, although pleasant, disappeared after she took our order. We ended up pouring our own wine and tracking down someone else when we needed water.  I will never go back, especially given how expensive the restaurant is ($280 for 3 people)
author: Lisa B.

description: Talk about eclectic decor to draw you in, I loved the ambiance and the cozy feel of the restaurant, and hello!! complimentary valet parking! Ok so the waitress was a bit moody and really slow. She never refilled drinks, she forgot our crostini heirloom tomato appetizer, yet it was on our bill. wtf?!? oh heck no! Anyhow onto the good stuff......The complimentary sourdough garlic bread is sooo yummy, but don't fill up on it. The FILET MIGNON BONE-IN ($39) Seriously, cooked perfectly, great texture and so flavorful! The IRON SKILLET ROASTED MUSSELS, SHRIMP, AND CRAB ($39) was also delicious. However, the mussels were a bit "dinky," the crab was mediocre, but the shrimps were sooooo good. They brought back the MODERN MAC AND CHEESE ($8) it's definitely not for the weak or dieting (haha me!) but I shared.  Also, the TWICE BAKED POTATO ($8) was perfectly seasoned and was a large portion. After all the deliciousness I couldn't handle even a wafer-thin dessert, this place is definitely one of the best steak houses I've been to!
author: Diana L.

description:
McDonalds, KFC, Taco Bell, Carls Jr.
All of the above mentioned restaraunts are far better than Bobo's. This is the worst restaraunt in the city. If you want a steak, go to Alfreds or Harris Steakouse or House of Prime Rib NOT Bobo's. We went there for a friends birthday and had reservations for 10 people. Not only did they seat us an HOUR AND A HALF after our reservations but they sat us at a table for 6. They said they would bring us more chairs which means we would have to practically sit on top of eachother. We left the restaraunt in disgust. Worst service! Worst atmosphere! Worst dining experience I ever had. Avoid this place at all costs.

The only reason I gave this place even one star is because the bartender was hot and friendly. Other than that, this place should be burned to the ground!
author: Paul H.

description: Found this place doing research for a trip to SF with our two teens.  We were seated upstairs in a very small room next to a Christmas party group of about 12 men who were very loud. It was muggy, dark  and uncomfortable.  The decor is between brothel and creepy.  BUT having said that, we all ordered the Filet Mignon, and while a bit undercooked, they were delicious.  The twice baked potato and brussel sprouts were also very good.  It is not a place that I would ever go back to though--too steamy, loud, cramped, dark and nothing outstanding on any front. And I have had as good or better food many other places.   Now the Ghirardelli sundaes we had afterward....were stellar!
author: richard e.

description: Definitely the best steak in San Francisco, but what a lame name.
author: John B.

description: I first discovered and dined at Bobo's about three months ago, and they serve what very well may be the best steak in the city.  If you've ever been to Peter Luger in Brooklyn, Bobo's ages and cooks its beef in much the same way.  I've had the bone-in filet on three separate occasions, and it has been nothing short of sublime each time.  The mushrooms and twice-baked potatoes are both excellent sides, and the wine list is reasonably priced.  The decor and the ambience are a little bizarre, but if what you're looking for is a truly fine piece of beef that is exquisitely prepared, this is your place.
author: Drew W.

description: I came with a friend and was skeptical of the choice because of it's unpretentious location, however I was mistaken.  The food was AMAZING!  We ordered the crab and mussle platter along with the filet minogn.  I have never had a better steak, it was amazing!  Perfectly charred on the outside, and tender on the inside.  I loved that the staff was friendly and attentive as well.  It was not overly sceney and the food was unbeatable!!
author: Sarah S.

description: I give it 5 for the bone-in filet.  Decor is kind of weird but they know how to do steak.  Waiters are knowledgeable and courteous.  We brought our own wine and the corkage was $20.  The bread is actually really good here.  My husband and I each started with one of their wedges which they serve the traditional way with bacon and blue cheese but they also serve it with a number of other dressings.  I've had much better wedges.  We each had the bone-in filet (they dont always have them) done medium rare.  Perfection.  We did potatoes for our side and they were good.
author: Janet L.

description:
Don't consider myself someone with extraordinary expectations from wait staff....just, like, get the drink orders right, get the *actual* orders right, and perhaps check in with the table one or twice in the course of an hour.  By all accounts, terrible service.  

Very good steak.  Silly little salads.  Uneven dessert menu.  (Mine was terrible-tasting, my friends looked good and he said he enjoyed it.)

Decor that's so quirky and distracting that it demands a menu and wait staff to carry through its "theme," which totally doesn't happen.  (Perhaps the theme would be, "We're having fun!")  Instead, it's like you're in actuality eating in an old school steak house (the waiter's demeanour said, "You're unbearable a*holes I can just barely, barely tolerate for the nineteen seconds of this interaction!")...but an old school steak house that a clown car crashed into  and then exploded.
author: marc c.

description:
Walking in to this place i was taken by the layout of the restaurant.  It was dimmly lit and had multiple dining nooks on multiple levels. These nooks can make for a more intimate setting, if your party is 2-3.  The service there was great with informed waiters.  Just a note, expect a wait if you have no reservations.

Now, I am fairly new to steak but i can safely say that this is probably the second best New York that i have ever had.  Being our first visit to this place the waiter kindly explained to us the aging process used on all their steaks.  Apparently something delicious happens during this process. whatever it was keep doing it.  My Girl, who is a filet fiend, said that her petite filet was the best she had ever had.  I guess that means its good.  We both each got a side, the twice baked 'tato and the onion rings, both of which were amazing and we wished that we had ordered more sides.
author: Milo A.

description:
My date almost slipped and fell immediately upon entry (the service dude merely watched, offered no apologies, and commenced to lead us to our seats) - which was not good, but shit always happens when its me and her.  

So we got to our pimpin seats (it wasn't busy so the two of us were seated in a round sofa upstairs), got the seafood grill (tasty, but dang how many mussels you need?), bone in filet, salad (which had approximately three leafs of romaine i am not joking we actually had to ask for more leaves), and sides. 

Desserts were real nice - the chocolate thing was very near perfect.  Our server for the night was a friendly gentleman and treated us both very well.  Bobos seems like an ideal place for a dinner date, or family get together.. 100 bucks a head should do it - well worth it - probably the best steak in town.
author: Alex Y.

description: I've been here twice so far, both times it's been the absolute finest steakhouse I've been to.  I've eaten at steakhouses all over the country.  Ringside in Portland, OR.  Abe and Louie's in Boston are both close seconds but none compare to Boboquivari's.
author: Bradford H.

description: Great steak and twice baked potato. Severely lacking in other areas including service. For $180 meal for 2 people  I would rather spend my money else where and I would not go back anytime soon.
author: Joe M.

description: Bone-in filet mignon --- perhaps the best steak ever!  Enough said.
author: L K.

description: this is one of my favorite steakhouses!(2nd only to Harris') my filet mignon is always done to perfection, and i mean perfection... its like eating silk (not that i've eaten silk but you get the idea) for steak lovers, this is pure heaven. an interesting side note: i usually never have dessert but the "chocolate cones" thing is to die for. ok so, the funky red-black stripes and "carnival clowns" decor is a bit strange, but you'll get used to it after a few times. it can even grow on you a little.... great service too, they really treat you well. this is not only a great steakhouse, but one of the best restaurants in the city. request the upstairs for groups, although my favorite place to sit is the middle booth downstairs.
author: Michelle I.

description: Bobo's offers the perfect dining experience.  It's a classy restaurant with a funky masquerade twist.  Hostesses, bartenders, and servers are all warm, friendly, and accommodating.  And the food is, and I say this with conviction, great!  It really is well above average.  An A+ if you will.  I came here last Friday for the first time after hearing so many rave reviews about this place and I must say that it did live up to its expectations.  Alas, there wasn't anything surprising because I came for great and that's what they gave me.  (As a sidenote, I love trying a place where I have no expectations at all and am pleasantly surprised.  Going in with an unbiased opinion creates for a better judgement of the overall experience.  I feel that there is a high risk of disappointment in venturing to a widely praised restaurant due to failure to meet high expectations.)  Moving on....we arrived early to get a drink at the bar.  I got a split of champagne and I was impressed by the champagne flute.  The mark of a classy glass is a thin stem.  Not as impressed with the wine glasses because of the thicker stems, but that's okay.  My date ordered a scotch and I really have nothing to say about that.  We were seated promptly and attended to with kindness and servitude.  For the night our order consisted of the Cherry Tomato and Avocado Salad, one Crab to share, a Twice-Baked Potato to share, and the kicker Filet Mignon.  The salad and potato were good.  Unique dishes and quality, but not as good as the crab or filet.  Now, I've always found it ironic that crab is served at nice restaurants even though it seems like something you should be eating out in the backyard with ribs or something.  That shit is so messy.  But I really liked it.  It wasn't too buttery and garlicy because sometimes that can over-power the crab.  Now the filet was amazing.  Considering this is my favorite type of steak, it was really a treat to have such a tender piece of meat cooked to perfection.  In retrospect I probably could have ordered a bigger one and have nixed some of the sides.  Dinner was followed by a cappucino.  Now I'm not a huge coffee drinker because the stuff makes me sick, but this cappucino was amazing.  If Starbucks made coffees like that, then maybe I'd actually buy the stuff.  We brought our own wine and I didn't much look at the wine list, but I do know that there were some $800 bottles there.  Whoo.  Those must be good.  After all the wonderful things said about Bobo's I agree with people, but don't expect angels to swoop down and bring you diamond encrusted champagne flutes with Dom Perignon, cholesterol free steaks that melt in your mouth, and no-calorie ice cream cakes that make you skinnier.  Anyway, sometimes it's the company that makes an experience and in this case it definitely was.  I had a splendid time with my date which only made everything else that much better.  Brilliant drinks, brilliant food, brilliant service, brilliant conversation--an overall brilliant time!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Wow, who knew?? I passed this place a hundred times without ever venturing inside (tacky appearance scared me away), only to discover that it's fantastic!  Ambiance is all around horrid - kind feels like you're in clown horror movie - but the taste of steak melting in your mouth is sufficiently distracting. Lobster bisque is too small but divine.
author: Maggie Z.

description: Boboquivari's is the west coast incarnation of Peter Luger in Brooklyn.  No concessions are made to decor (west Texas bordello meets Dean Martin) or convenience (think "l'Idiot" in L.A. Story if you arrive before 10pm sin reservations), because you don't go there for that.  This place is about The Steak.  Sides are a distraction, and ambiance is for wimps.  The meat is dry-aged for a month and a half before it is deemed ready.  Those of you with less refined palates who are used to the rubber and gristle national chains might be a little off-put by the texture, and indeed mistake the "au jus" for butter.  It's not.  The bone-in fillet mignon will shake the foundations of even the most dyed-in-the-wool PETA-card-carrying vegan.  Boboquivari's is the reason God invented cows.  WARNING: The cooking method and specifications are clearly laid out on the menu so if you order medium rare, expect the meat to be lukewarm in the middle with red sections close to the bone.  And expect rare to moo when you first poke it with your fork.
author: Gabriel S.

description: Best steak in San Francisco, maybe the entire Bay Area.  Amazing food, amazing service, just an absolutely top-quality restaurant.
author: Brad N.

description: All my brothers are athletes so growing up my family knew their way around steakhouses. I think I have been to every Morton's and Ruth's Chris in the country! That aside, "Bobo's" has to be the hands down best steak I may have ever tried. Without a doubt in the US. Consistent quality and exceptional service. The two main entrees they serve are filets and roasted garlic dungeness crab. I've tried all the sides and they are top notch. The tomato, avocado, red onion romaine wedge with evoo vinaigrette is great as are all the homemade burrata dishes. Don't even get me started on the bread they bring to the table! This is a splurge to be sure but if you are going to spend the money this one (its at franklin and van ness after all) is WELL worth it.
author: Ann K.

description: Came here for a large birthday dinner (20 people). The staff was extremely nice and they treated us very well. Our group was lucky enough to have an almost private room to ourselves so some of the atmosphere was lost. The drinks were a bit pricey and could have been poured a little stiffer, but they weren't bad. And their wine list was a bit unsophisticated and slightly overpriced for what I was getting. As everyone before me has already said, you come here for the steak. I had the bone-in New York which was RIDICULOUSLY GOOD. It wasn't the best steak (I categorize Prime Rib joints differently) I ever had, but it has jumped into my Top 5 for sure, maybe even Top 3. They know their steaks here, but you definitely pay for it. Everything is a la carte, and I recommend getting some sides to balance out your meal. The cauliflower was good and so was the twice baked potato. But in terms of what Bobo's was selling, THE STEAK, this place is a 4 star joint. Damn good steak......... leaves the mouth watering.
author: Arick R.

description: I went here with my boyfriend last night because I broke his sunglasses by accident when I was drunk last weekend and agreed to pay him back, so he wanted to go to dinner instead.   This place is decorated quite strangely...I think it is supposed to be a "Mardigras theme" but I'm still not sure.  There were cheap plastic beads hanging everywhere.  It didn't really have a "fine dining" feel if u know what I mean but it wasn't HORRIBLE.  The steak here is really good...at least the filet, and the portabello mushrooms too.  But the zucchini is gross.   Wine= great...i was definately drunk when I left.
author: Jessi C.

description: A clever court jester theme and complimentary valet parking! ...The evening was off to a great start. Their steak is probably one of the best I've ever had, but the portions are teeny tiny and everything has to be ordered a la carte. I tried some of my friend's walnut salad. Excellent. I ordered the Panzenella salad with initial concerns of being overwhelmed with tomatoes. I was pleasantly surprised though by the nice balance between the tomatoes, avocado, croutons, and whatever else. Crab cakes and onion rings were regular. The steak is juicy and therefore, delicious and totally worth trying. Just be sure to order a bunch of sides, otherwise, you'll still be hungry.
author: Nicole N.

description: Living in Chicago, the home of steaks, I can say that bobos is the best steak restaurant i have ever been to.  The bone in filet is amazing here.  I took my friend here, who graduated from the CI and he said this was the best steak place he has ever been to.  Best in the country as far as Im concerned.
author: Eric L.

description: I went because everybody kept telling me that this place had "great" steaks (always heavily emphasizing the "great").  It is now clear that my friends know bubkis from steak.  This place has a fun atmosphere, but it is NOT  a great steakhouse.  In fact, it's not even really a mediocre steakhouse.  It's a pity that they'd take some nice dry aged beef and slather it full of sauce and salt.  The sides didn't fare much better -- the zucchini frites smelled of rancid oil, and the baked potato (which we did not order, but was "comped" when they realized their mistake) was too heavy full of cheese and whatever the hell else they'd stuffed in there.  The wedge salads were OK, and the house baked bread was nice.  But next time I want a real steak, I'll go to Alfred's.
author: Zach G.

description:
i wanna first must start off by saying there is not much at all to this place, even though it is amazingly large inside. 

they serve an AMAZING steak, period. you will not find a better steak for the price. oh, they serve it with a light wine gravy sauce which really complements the steaks tenderness and taste. its quality.

the crab they churn about is quite good too, but to me is overshadowed by the filet mignon. i would still recommend it.

i would say the best deal here is the surf and turf (petite filet and half crab), i think for right around $35.

parking is pretty good for the area. you should be ok parking within a block or two on lombard.

the rest of the food here (minus the above average complimentary bread) is really just fluff like the fries or ice filled drink at your favorite fast food joynt. if you come strictly for steak and/or crab you have succeeded admirably!  i would avoid spending xtra yuks trying to satisfy those parts of you brain if you can. i mean, the salads and sides are ok, but they cost like half of what the steak does, and they will only wet your whistle at best.

ordering drinks here can also double your check pretty fast.

no ambiance, it feels dark and gloomy inside, the seats are over puffed and seem to cling to your botox, i mean buttocks. ugh, bad joke.

the waiting staff will always be hit or miss, but if you are dressing nicer and seem of more importance socially and intellectually, you will probably get more visits from the staff.
author: Dayman D.

description: I'd heard from a friend about how this place was comparable to Harris' and I have to say it definitely is not. Which does not mean the steak wasn't good, it definitely was but the whole ambiance and feel of the crowd and quality of the service just isn't up to par to a place like Harris'. To start, the decor is kitschy bordering on hideous, and for some reason the majority of the other diners seemed to be a bunch of loud and obnoxious drunks with young, unruly kids. Which is not necesarily the restaurant's fault but it definitely detracted from our dining experience. However, our salads were quite tasty and the famous olive oil soaked bread was delicious. The quality and preparation of the steaks were good and they are quite tender, however I felt like my steak was overpeppered, every time I took a bite I got a delicious meat taste and then a strong aftertaste of pepper. We had the champagne sorbet for dessert which was yummy. Overall the place was only three stars for me but I'm going to give it an extra star for Lisa our server who was a total sweetheart and so nice and dealt graciously with all the other rude people seated next to us. She definitley helped elevate our experience here. However, with so many other yummy steakhouses in the city I don't think I'll come back here.
author: Cathy T.

description: never new this place stumble on it around marina, suppose to go to gary danco that night but since my company didn' want to seat in the bar and long wait look for other places..a16 is another great place but so pack on a wed...so move on to our back up reservation the boulevard, but that was so out the way so found this great place,very cozy,decent and can't ask for more...love the fillet minon and the crab mussels and nice bottle of white wine
author: cecille p.

description: OH.....MY......GOD!!!!!!! this place was really everything that everyone described it to be. I went last night for the first time, and WOW... i was blown away at how good my steak was. First let me start by saying that from the outside... it looks like a TGIFridays... so it was never really appealing to me. BUT the saying never judge a book by its cover seriously applies to this restaurant. I followed many peoples advise and requested a booth on my opentable reservation. We were promptly seated in the front room, in a great booth by the window (overlooking lombard). Not the best view, but at least we had a window. The decor is the only reason why I cannot give it 5 stars. It is really tacky, loud, and just distracting. My eyes kept going all over the place instead of focusing on the convo I was having with my friend I hadn't seen in over  year. We said yes to the bread, which is baked fresh for each order with olives and garlic and olive oil. SOOOO good. There is nothing better than having warm bread at the table. I got the spinach and fontina fondue and Mike got the curry lobster soup. Both were so good, and we could've ended our meal there, since we were already pretty full. I would've like the consistency of the fondue to be meltier (is that a word?), but I think fontina isn't really meant for fondue... still good though, and the fact that the spinach dip tasted like spinach was a major plus. I had the petit filet mignon which was the perfect size, anything bigger and I would not have finished it. The steak, was PERFECT. Beautifully crispy on the outside, and juicy and soft on the inside. so soft that the steak just melts in your mouth. I'm salivating again as I write this...Mike got the one on the bone which is their specialty and he said it was the best steak he ever had, but it was too big for him. If we hadn't had the apps it would've been better. We also got a side of Maui onion rings, and those were also fabulous. Very crispy and sweet. cant wait to go back
author: Marina K.

description: i didn't think anybody could hold a candle to izzy's but MAN does bobo's give them a run for their money.  i had the surf and turf (petit filet mignon and crab) WOW!!!! it was amazing.  the steak was just right- tender and juicy, and the crab was garlicy and had a dish of melted butter to dip it in. MMMMM!! their drinks are also very good.  i had a lavender infused gin martini.  genius.
author: Shanti G.

description: YUM! The husband and I had a wonderful dinner here after a whole day of different excursions.  The setting of the restaurant is dark and gives it a nice candle lit romantic feeling even though it has a very eccentric decor with different things hanging all over the place.  We got to the restaurant just on time for our reservation and they have complimentary Valet parking!!  We enjoyed some cocktails and their yummy complimentary garlic toast like bread.  I started off with the dungeness crab crostini and he had a salad... both were very good... for entrees I had the surf n turf which is a petite filet and half a crab... which was the PERFECT meal and there was a lot of crab so I could give him some as well. The crab was roasted in a garlic sauce... it was very flavorful.   He had the bone-in filet mignon, which they are famous for having because not too many restaurants have this... he was very satisfied and even commented that he never thought he would be full from a filet but he was.  We passed on desserts but there were a few that sounded good but we had cupcakes galore that we had purchased earlier.  The waitress was very attentive and very nice... it was all in all a very good meal.
author: Kymberli C.

description: damn this place has incredible beef. my filet mignon was prefectly seasoned and cooked.  the wine was good and a great compliment to our meal.  the filet mignon was better than the kobe beef at Harris' steak house.  I had to take off one star because we ordered the crab and shrimp appetizer platter and it wasn't all that impressive.  stick with their beef, pass on the seafood. =)
author: Ames K.

description: Best steakhouse in San Francisco.  You must order the bone-in filet.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Nick H.

description: i would give this place negative stars but since yelp won't allow me, one star. i went a couple months ago with a group of ten and ALL of us hated it. i ordered a medium that came out like a medium rare. my boyfriend ordered a medium rare that came out like a medium. they suck hardcore. i chose this place for a birthday party and now my rep is ruined. the other yelpers who gave this place more than one star are _______!! a rip off!
author: Angela C.

description:
I was so disappointed with Bobo's, after always going on yelp and reading reviews, it prompted me to open an account and write a review of my experience. My wife and I went there for dinner, made reservations on open table and all went smoothly. Arrived a few minutes late, we parked at valet which was complimentary as others have said. Went inside and the hostess promptly seated us. So far so good.
Our waitress was very nice, we ordered the crab cake appetizer while going over the menu. While waiting for the appetizer our bread came and was ok, greasy but kind of good in a way. When the crab cakes arrived they looked good. Crispy and crusty on the outside moist and meaty inside, nice crab flavor. The cranberry relish they served on the side was really good with them. So now we are happily awaiting our dinner. Appetizer was good, wine is good, we are happy. Then comes dinner, my wife ordered the double shrimp and crab and I ordered the infamous bone-in fillet. As our sides we ordered the portabella mushrooms and twice baked potato. At this point all looked great, but flavor wasn't really there. The dbl shrimp and crab was ok at the very best, not something I expected to have here. It was more on par with a tourist trap. My fillet, after reading review after review about the bone-in fillet, I was expecting greatness, I mean the "best steak in the city" as some have said. I was so disappointed you can't imagine. Well, I guess you can since it prompted me to write this review.  It was a good fillet, not the best, not even close. I have decided after this, that for me a fillet on it is own should not be bone-in. Kind of defeats the purpose of a nice fillet. The sides where good, mushrooms and a twice baked potato, could it of been bad? I guess so, but they were good so I will leave it at that. Would I order again? The mushrooms yes, because my wife loves mushrooms. We also ordered dessert, the chocolate mousse cones. Not bad, they were good but not really our style. We ordered them because nothing else sounded appealing. A little bit of mouse in an upside down waffle cone. With that said, the fillet was aged, flavorful but a little salty and a good size. The dbl shrimp and crab, don't waste your money. Crab cakes good, service was pretty good. Everything else was just...  well just ok.  That is why it gets 2 stars, maybe 2.5.
To sum it up, I wouldn't go back there. There are too many restaurants in just the city alone that are far better in every aspect.
author: Marie C.

description: bottom line: bobo's has excellent steak (i got the filet mignon bone-in, like the rest of the world, it seems.)  the sides are tasty too... but for the price of the steak here, you would expect to get these gratis!  at least the valet is free!
author: Jill k.

description: Friends from Massachusetts said "We feel like steak tonight." I knew I had to deliver a great place so my first instinct was to hope and pray that House of Prime Rib had an opening. No luck...not even with a cash offer to create an opening. I dialed Bobo's and they had an available table within the hour of my phone call on Saturday evening!  This was my first time there so I was admittedly nervous about inviting out of town guests. Yelper's seemed to enjoy it so I felt a bit better. We had a great booth comfortable for lingering. Our waiter was charming, in fact the entire staff was attentive and very unpretentious. We ordered the warm bread with olives and olive oil. It was okay...a bit too salty for me but they guys seemed to like it. I ordered the mojito which was full of limes and mint and not enough vodka to give me a buzz-it was tasty though. (For $10 I expect more alcohol in my drink). The fillet was in a word 'butter.' I doubt anyone can eat an incredible amount of meat in one sitting which is why the petite cut is plenty( Bobo's offers a 19oz steak)! The twice baked potato was killer and it complimented the meat perfectly. My friends seemed impressed and I felt good about my restaurant choice. Next time I'm ordering the crab. Whatever you do...save room for an after dinner chocolate martini it was hands down the BEST drink I have ever had at a steakhouse.
author: Sherie R.

description:
steak, oh how i love you.  im a steak fanatic and having moved to NY, so much more so.  *side note* NY steak blows away anything in SF..anything

that being said. bobo's was really good. if i remember though, they don't have ribeye, so if that's your cut you're out of luck here.  i've never been a fan of filet's but it was pretty good here and dry age is definitely the way to go with filets.

the crab was ok...too much work and too messy for me. not worth it. come here for the steak if you like filets...though i much prefer Harris.
author: Alex C.

description: Boboquivari's or Bobo's for short is the only steakhouse I know of that not only ages their steaks 4-6 weeks, but also includes a bone-in filet mignon.  It's definitely a treat that you'll have to try for yourself and comes to the table sizzling hot.
author: Jim K.

description: I've been here once and loved it.  Great atmosphere and the servers were on top of everything.  The only knock may be the price but if you want a deal on a steak, go to Sizzler.  The Filet was fantastic!
author: Glen E.

description: freaking perfect, melt-in-your-mouth filet, awesome wine, and Amber was an ideal server. was able to have dinner on a Thursday night with no reservation and just a short wait. the decor is crazy but appealing (red and gold and tutus, oh my). i can't wait to go back and i don't know why i'd never been there before! (oh yeah, it was over $200 for two people, but worth every ducat.)
author: Gretchen T.

description: This place has a little bit of a bipolar disorder. The first time I went here, I waited one hour for a table when we made reservations. We waited at the bar and told them that we were fine eating at the bar. They told us that they don't serve food at the bar. Eventually we said fuck it and went to Izzy's. Tonight I walked in with no reservations and they were able to seat us immediately AT THE BAR. Probably a change in policy but who knows. The meal was excellent but they do things a little different here that you should know about. The crab is cooked in a skillet instead of boiled. The heat from the skillet is intense and makes the shell of the crab brittle. You have to be very careful when you crack the crab. Tiny little pieces of crab shell go everywhere and you could end up cracking your tooth on a piece of crab shell like Sam Malone did in the free salad he ate from Melville's. ( It is the subplot of the episode where Cliff thinks he is a comedian and Lilith is the only one who thinks he is funny. Season 10 Episode 15. IMDB it.) ANYWAY.......They also dry age their meat which makes it delicious. I mean that steak is really good. We also had the twice baked mashed potatoes which were tasty. The mushrooms are really tasty but you will be belching that garlic for the rest of the night. Overall this is a really good place. They have some really cool tables up stairs for parties of 6 or more. Looks like a good place to get the guys together before a big night out on the town.
author: John S.

description: I did not expect to like Bobo's.  I'm kind of a steak snob and didn't expect to find a great piece of meat in a place that reminded me of Clown Alley.  I mean I'm used to crappy steakhouse decor (ie. Peter Luger's) but don't think I've been to a steakhouse that gaudy that looked like TGI Friday's from outside.  My friends and I had initially planned to go to Bob's but at the last second, the rug was pulled out from under me and we were transported to Bobo's.  Anyway, the night didn't start out too hot.  We were 15ish minutes late for our reservation so the hostess had given our table away.  She wasn't particularly friendly and kept telling us to wait 5 more minutes even though we weren't being pushy at all.  After being told "5 more minutes", probably 5 more times, we were finally seated.  Once we were seated, the hostess magically became much friendlier.  Plus our waitress was great.  I think her name was Kimberly.  She was very attentive and offered good suggestions without trying to upsell us.  Since the 3 of us were ordering steaks, she suggested sharing the whole crab to start when we had intended to get the larger 3 pound option.  The crab was delicious.  I'm not usually the biggest fan of crab since it requires a little too much effort on my part, but this was well worth it.  The accompanying garlic baked sourdough olive loaf was perfect for soaking up the excess sauce from the crab.  For entrees, we all opted for the bone-in filet.  The waitress explained that there were only 6 places in the country that offered a bone-in filet (this was the first time I'd ever seen it and i've been around the block a few times) and that Bobo's was known for it so I decided not to order the NY Bone-in that I'd been eying.  All of our steaks were cooked perfectly.  I have to say that this was perhaps the best steak I've had in San Francisco, rivaling Harris'.  This was steak as it should be done - no unnecessary sauces or accompaniments.  Just a great quality piece of meat with minimal seasoning.  For sides, we shared the mod mac (Bobo's take on mac & cheese) and sauteed portobello mushrooms.  Both sides were excellent, but the mac portion was a little small.  We enjoyed a surprisingly well priced bottle of Jordan Cab with our meals.  As everyone was pretty stuffed, we opted to forgo dessert and just have some after-dinner drinks.  All in all, Bobo's was well worth the $$$.  For a superb piece of meat, there aren't a lot of options in SF and Bobo's should be at the top of the list.
author: Saw T.

description: Experiences like this remind me why I'm not a vegetarian.  I gave up trying to age my own steaks in the vegetable crisper of my refrigerator after realizing that I probably can never get them to taste as good as a dry-aged cut from Bobo's.  They are one of only 3 restaurants in the country that has FDA approval to age their steaks for this long.  During 6 weeks of dry aging, excess water leaves the meat thereby concentrating flavor, and natural enzymes already existing in the meat actually break down tough connective tissue and do some of the chewing for you.  The grain is nonexistent. You need skills in order to cut a bone-in filet, which is why you don't often see them on menus.  Order just a steak and maybe a glass of wine.  You don't need bread.  You don't need appetizers.  You don't need sides.  You don't even need a toothpick.  The enzymes in your saliva are enough to melt away this protein from the gums of even the most gap-toothed of diners.
author: Kevin G.

description: want some melt in your mouth BEEF? then come to bobo's and get the bone in filet mignon. don't make the mistake of getting any other cut. a nice glass of red wine...twice baked potato...mushrooms...swiss chard...you've got an amazing meal. damn, i'm hungry...
author: Nini G.

description:
i was a bit taken aback when we walked in b/c i had heard it was a great steakhouse so wasn't expecting the extreme CHEEZINESS of the place.
what kind of cheez you ask?
o, cheez by way of AHA, bangles, hall& oates from the 80's music (i'm certain they had pandora permanently hooked into the 80's love songs channel b/c the hits kept coming),  heavy pierrot theme going on, and blood red painted walls -which combined w/ the neon signage from the motel across the st. was actually quite flattering.
i didn't do my research so i shouldn't have been surprised.
here's the deal:
service:  obsequious. don't mind that so much (wouldn't mind it @ all in other sectors of life.....) but i always feel like i'm being taken when the waitress is too servile.
atmo:  young tourists finally taking off their GGBRidge hoodies..
food:  ok, here's the problem. i know everyone's gotta pay rent, labor, ingredients, but. the pricing sitch was out of control.  you can't, you really can't do that romaine wedge & just plop some dressing on top & charge 9$.   if you're gonna charge all that the food's gotta be all that & i could tell this place is all about buttah & salt & sizzling platter.  and i know that's the very essence of the steakhouse experience, but this is no peter lugar's, by a long shot.  the husband - from iowa -so he knows his carcass - was not thrilled with the meat.
that being said, the kiddies' loved it, the king crab leggies were really salty & delish, and everyone looked gorgeous.
author: Kim Y.

description: You definitely do not go to this restaurant for the ambience.  Its a scary dimly lit mix of court jester, clown and medieval harlequin wrapped into one.  But, its okay, because we were there to eat meat.  And eat meat we did.  We ordered two bone-in filets and after an extensive lesson from the enthusiastic server, we were informed that the steak is kept offsite, aged longer than at all other steakhouses, and when its cooked, it gets rarer close to the bone (e.g., medium rare would be rare near the bone).  So we ordered medium rare and medium accordingly.  The steak is large, savory and well-cooked, crispy on the outside and chewy melt in your mouth good on the inside.  We also had an appetizer of yellowtail tuna carpaccio that was little too citrusy, and definitely not as good as other tuna carpaccios in the city (such as Kabuto, for one). For sides we got onion rings that were big and crunchy and sauteed mushrooms that were good because they were drenched in butter.  In the end, it was a satisfying meal.  At Bobo's, good steak you ask for and good steak you will get.
author: JoKr M.

description: I'm going to say it. I'm going to say it, and I mean it! Boboquivari's is the best steak in San Francisco. I AM a steak person. I eat my filet's on the rarer side of medium, I get a great red wine to wash it down with and I do it without regard for the price because it is the one weakness I don't want to fix. That being said, I will say again, this is the best steak in San Francisco. I've been 4 times in the last month and a half and not once has it been anything less than stellar. 420 Yelpers can't be wrong. To the good stuff... The Basil Martini is a must! You can get it sweet or not, either way it's great. I like it with more of a bite to it. I have had the bone-in filet and the petit filet, both are super. They cook it perfectly, without question and are smart enough to under cook it and cook up for you to get it right. The portobello mushroom saute is divine as well as the chard. I'm not really a dessert person, so I can't speak to that, but if it's red meat you're lookin for, don't wait... get over there. BTW... a friend and I decided to give it a shot on Valentine's Day... they worked us in, no problem. Very accommodating. I will say this though, if you make a reservation, plan to be seated 30-45 minutes late or make your reservation later and get there early. They work it out, but they aren't the most organized, I think it's because people enjoy themselves so much (ambiance and all) that they stay longer than anticipated... it's worth every second though!!
author: Amanda D.

description: Went her with the family for my brother's graduation and as a starter we had the mussel, shrimp and crab iron skillet OMG off the hook! HELLA GOOD! If you like the Dead Fish or the Stinken Rose you will love this place. Personally you can't go wrong with anything, its all delish! A must have cocktail is the Cucacabra (I believe thats the name) its like a margarita but with cucumber juice, very refreshing!  Mmm... just thinking of it makes me want to go back!
author: Evangelina M.

description: I like the atmosphere here, it's not like your typical steakhouse.  I like the fact that there are multiple floors so you're not in one big dining room.  Service was great, our waitress was helpful in selecting a bottle of wine for us.  Wound up choosing a red that had a "earthy taste to it, like dirt".  She was right!  I'm not a big wine drinker to begin with anyway.  Started with the white tuna carpaccio, which was just ok to me.  I've had better.  I was getting my fill on the tasty garlic baked sourdough olive loaf.  Very oily but still good.  I had the filet mignon bone-in which is the most popular apparently.  I can see why.  It was delicious.  Unfortunately I was too full to sample any dessert.  I'll save that for next time.  Oh, they had free valet as well - a plus considering how difficult it is to find parking in this area of Lombard and Van Ness.  Definitely would recommend this place!!  Go Bobo's!!
author: Benson C.

description:
my new york bone in was delicious.  the only downfall of the meal was my twice baked potato.  it was WAY too salty to enjoy.  not my kind of potato.  i'm a huge hamachi lover and the tuna carpaccio was just wonderful.

the whole ambiance of the place was ok.  i'm not a big fan of close tables and barely lit rooms....but it seems like it would be a cute date spot.
author: H. G.

description: I wasn't overly impressed wit the experience but the food was good. My boyfriend thought his steak was excellent and the muscles were some of the best I've had. I thought the service was really mediocre - we had to ask for our wine after the food came out, and it took awile to get seated and to get our drinks in the first place. I wouldn't go back for a romantic dinner but may be a good place for a business event.
author: cam b.

description: pricey, so get someone else to bring you here. i had the crab and baked yams, which was a silly combination and did not go well together. i think they just add butter to everything to make it taste good - the bread was amazingly good because it was - laced with butter, the crab was coated with butter too, as to be expected. the petit filet mignon should be enough to fill you up, if you're a smallish girl. i had two bites of my friend's (i'm "vegetarian") and it was good, but somewhat salty.
author: Lijia X.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE Bobo's! Hands down the best place for steak in this city and maybe the world.  The dry aging is fantastic, the sides are to die for plus the crab is addicting.  Take me here anyday and you can take me home.
author: Cbr A.

description: pretty pricey for what u get. i don't think it's the best steak ever, but it is very tender. the sides are delicious and service is great.
author: Karen H.

description: oh yea.... diamond in the rough.. nothing like a GREAT aged steak.. medium rare.. nothing to fluff it up.. just the steak.... the crab is awesome too..
author: Timothy W.

description: I was impressed with the steak here at Bobo's, highly recommended. My petite filet was delicious. The costini appetizer was tasty, with smoked salmon, crab and avacado on toasted bread. For the side dishes we had the twiced baked potato, which was also good. Drinks are little pricey, and I was disappointed that the bar didn't not have any kind of peach flavor liqour. Vanilla gelato with fresh berries were refreshing. All in all, a fantastic dinner but there was one thing. The service was disappointing. For such a highly recommended place, we were quite annoyed with the service. Our server was great in the beginning (when there weren't any other people dining around us), but when our food was served, it was horrible. We order another round of drinks, and it never came. By the time I had finished my food, I didn't want the drink (that hadn't arrived) and I was cranky I didn't have any more alcohol. Our server never asked us how the food was, and we needed extra sour cream for the potato. in my opinion, they need another server in her area when it starts to fill up. Patrons do not like to be ignored, especially when they need something. And especially when they're dropping this much money to eat here. Great food, less than mediocre service.
author: Beth W.

description:
The fanciest restaurant I've ever been to. My parents and I once went to House of Prime Rib, which was elegant, but it was a tourist attraction compared to Bobo's --- is it classless of me to call it Bobo's for short? Well, I'm not really a fancy person myself, but I do enjoy fine dining, and this is the finest experience I've ever had. Thanks to the restaurant's website, I glanced through their menu in advance and the prices blew me away. But Bobo's schooled me on fine steak dining and fine dining in general.

The only reason I dock the one star is because I'm no expert on steaks, but I had the New York steak and it was the most flavorful slab of meat --- and dish in general --- that I've ever devoured. I started with asparagus and split a side dish of portabello mushroms with a friend, and the veggies were as flavorful as the steak. Oh, and the meat thing: I'm no meat-eater, at least not regularly. I was only here for a birthday dinner, but if I have to come here for someone else's special occasion again, there'll be no complaints from me. 

The service was amazing: our server was attentive, conversational, and very accomodating. Some of the other guests in our party had some requests that I considered a bit finely particular (I like to be flexible and tolerant with restaurant service, myself), but our server tended to us in all the ways humanly possible. And getting drinks at the bar was an experience entirely separate from the dining, for the bartender was also exquisitely attentive and conversational, and the setting is so intimate that you could hang out there when it's not packed but probably still have a good time with a modest crowd. (Both our server and the bartender were women, and I wonder if the consistent quality of service is a kind of coincidence.) I had this cucumber drink thing (I couldn't pronounce the name for the life of me) that hit the spot in such a right way that I had to have a second glass during dinner and therefore I achieved just the right level of tipsiness. Amazing experience that epitomizes the concept of good food and good company.
author: Joseph R.

description: Damn this place is good!  I'm not a steak person at all (used to be, found it cruel, try to be kind you know) but I tried a bite as it was insisted that I do and it was fantastic.  The thing is though everything is really good.  The crab, the mashed potatoes all of it.  It's small and cozy--read small--but ohh so good.
author: Misti L.

description: I've been to Bobo's about 5 times. I happened to find this place through a friend, but never thought some campy restaurant on Lombard street with an entrance in a parking garage could ever be good. BOY was I wrong! This is by far the best steak in the city and one of the best steaks in the west. Prime. Shall I say it again? Prime. I'm always one to go for a bone-in filet, but I will say skip that and get the New York. I ordered the filet the first time I went there and it was fabulous. My friend ordered the bone-in New York and gave me a taste of his...mmmmmmm. The best. And, I've been to a lot of good steak house's: Ruth's, Harris', Izzy's, House O', etc. Last night, I ordered the mussels which are served on a sizzling raised platter. To die for! Simple with drawn butter in the middle. Can't resist seafood that isn't tinkered with too much. These were by far the best (non-altered) mussels I've ever had in a restaurant. This is a great place for a date or a few friends to meet up and enjoy an unpretentious but wonderful dining experience. Second to the steak, I always judge a steak house by their martini's and I can honestly say they make one of the best in the city. A+. Enjoy!
author: Edward W.

description: Great filet, inside is a little too chucky-cheese.  I don't mind though cuz the steak is worth it.
author: Aditya P.

description: Bobo's can really fire up a great steak.  This is not the place for the Tofu & Sauvignon-Blanc crowd, which probably explains some of the poor reviews. I recommend a martini at the bar first, and the bone-in filet is outstanding. I'm not one for seafood however my friends raved about the crab. Location is so-so...but it does keep the tourists away which is an advantage.
author: Dirk S.

description: wow.  what a great place.  i work in a michelan star restaurant, so i would like to think this review has some credability.  lol.  i have been to this restaurant twice.  we decided to give it a shot on my birthday, based on the fact my first visit, i remembered my steak, and everyone in our partys'  was cooked perfectly.  as for the review, in which i just read about the person who had an overcooked ny, you might try ordering your ny's med rare.  that is always the recommended temperature for that cut.  a new york can start to become tough when cooked passed med rare.  (just sayin).  anyhoo, my steak was cooked perfectly again and so was my girl's.  the skillet mussels, were delish, the sides were all on point.  the steak had great flavor, and the side of mushrooms we ordered was a great compliment.  the service was on point.  hostess was busy but made eye contact with us immediately, and same with the bartender.  everyone was super nice.  we had some bubbly at the bar while we had a short wait for a table after our res.  and am i glad we waited, because they took us to a very nice table.  as for the server, i believe her name is Ilse, spelled i-l-s-e, (we were on the second floor i think), was on point.  she was a very nice lady, not over intrusive. we had four courses, all timed perfectly. she also made some good suggestions.  we never waited for any beverages.  and finally, free valet parking, nice touch.  this restaurant is great because they focus on things that are extremely important when it comes to food and beverage. eye contact, being hospitible while also being efficient, good quality food cooked correctly with good flavor, quick delivery of beverages, excellent timing of the courses, not making people wait without giving them some sort of direction, delicous warm bread brought without asking,  and making good decisions about making us wait a couple minutes for a better table.  the people that work here are able to make good decisions.  and nice little touches like free valet parking in the city, one less worry for their diners.  i have to say this place makes their guests feel important, and cares about food quality.  thank you for the memorable birthday experience.  totally erased the horrible experience from last year's birthday when we went to harris' steak house got stereotyped, and left due to the rude, smart mouthed hostess, who talked to us like she was shrugging off men trying to buy her a drink at a club.  lol.  we left before we tried the food.  we will definately be back to boboquivari's.
author: E E.

description: The bone-in filet mignon was one of the best I have ever had, and I've lived in New York City and Argentina, where some of the best steaks are served. Eclectic atmosphere, but good service and tasty food make this the best steak house in San Francisco.
author: Nor S.

description: This is the best steakhouse I have ever been to.  I have been several times and not once have I had a bad experience.  The steak here is so amazing and full of flavor.  They also have some great salads and side dishes notably the twice baked potatoe.  I highly suggest this place!
author: Maile W.

description:
After driving by this intriguing looking restaurant for many years, my friend picked this location for my surprise Birthday dinner.  We had a terrible experience.  The waiter was pretentious and inattentive.  Two tables that came after us got their bread and water before we did.  When he approached us to take our order, we were in the middle of a conversation, discussing what wine to order; he abruptly interrupted and asked if we were ready to order - not even waiting for us to take a breath - he interrupted again and asked "are you ladies ready to order?".  Apparently he was in a hurry.  We made our decision on the wine and he asked if we'd like it with our dinner or sooner and we replied "as soon as possible" - it didn't arrive until after we had finished our appetizers which were ordered at the same time as the wine and our dinner.   My appetizer was Lobster Soup in an extremely small cup.  There were large pieces of crab in it which would have been okay except both pieces of crab had not been properly cleaned and they still had cartilage in them - definitely not edible nor digestible!   When the waiter finally brought the wine, it appeared that he was not an experienced wine server and poured large portions into each of our glasses.  After toasting and taking one sip each, we had a horrific experience - my friend saw a RAT run under our table!  We both screamed and jumped up, knocking the table on the way up with all the liquids on the table spilling everywhere (the wall, the table, the chair and ME! ).  The waiter happened to be standing behind us at another table and upon seeing all the commotion, he non-nonchalantly opened the door that was next to our table that leads out to the Patio to let the critter out.   We heard one of the waitresses say "it must have been a shadow" - I hardly think the waiter would have opened the door to allow a "shadow" to escape.

Being a service provider myself, I always believe when something goes wrong its " the recovery" that makes or breaks a situation. . . . well, after ushering us downstairs and seating us in the bar area, they didn't bother to bring us bread or water and didn't offer to replace our wine.  We asked our new waitress if she'd been told about our experience and why we were now sitting in her section and she replied "no".  So, we proceeded to tell her and while she appeared sympathetic that's where it ended.  We asked the bus boy to get us the manager, which, after 10 minutes he/she never appeared.  When our new waitress made her way back to us, I asked her to see the manager and she replied "I'm the manager".  We were floored!  In a relatively expensive restaurant like that (any restaurant for that matter) we were shocked that no one but the customer bothered to let the manager know about the experience.   After we went into more detail with her than we had previously when we thought she was just our waitress, she offered to take care of the wine (which, after all the spillage upstairs only had two glasses left in it) and treat us to dessert.   

We left there with the impression that no one really cared about what we had experienced.     I'm told that many restaurants have critters circulating about and even if this is true, the customer should never see them.  There are health codes here after all.

We will definitely NOT be going back there.
author: Julie S.

description: This place was close by and looked cute so after looking at the prices we almost past it up but then thought better of it. We sat at the bar and had the crab for two ($50) and basically thought it was good. The bartender was relatively new but very friendly and the atmosphere is indeed why one looks for little places in San Francisco.
author: Kyle S.

description: totally overpriced and mediocre at best. i went back and it was really good this time around! still pricey but i would go back!
author: M F.

description: i was pleasantly surprised by this place. it certainly wasn't the best steak house i've ever been to but i enjoyed it. i was with great people so that could have been it as well. my petit was a little too petit. i knew i should have gotten the bone in steak... had the brussel sprouts and that was tasty too. it's also around the corner from me so if i'm ever craving a hunk of meat - i'd stop by again...
author: Miss O.

description: the food here is ok, but this is NOT a san francisco restaurant, for better or for worse.  we had the roasted crab, which was more like roasted garlic and oil, the mozarella salad, a twice baked potato -- basically a meal of 100 percent fat.  it all tasted pretty good (the crab really had too much garlic, and i love garlic), but it was hideously expensive.  the interior was not of this city -- more like a new orleans whorehouse.  our waiter was super nice, but we were surrounded by groups of businessmen on expense account talking loudly about...business.  it was interesting, but i won't go back.
author: Dawn J.

description: i have to admit: i had serious reservations about this place based on the garish sign alone.  when my best friend's friends started working here, i thought "hmm..there must be something about this place."  and then i finally went there last night and it blew my mind away.  although i haven't tried harris or epic yet, i do heart mastros down in socal and house of prime rib is a home away from home.  so i like my steak.  and it was unfreakingbelievable.  got the filet bone in on the recommendation of our fabulous server rob (heart him!) and i don't know what that dry aging does to the meat but that is good stuff.  it was tender, flavorful and the sauce was just its juices with maybe some additional seasoning. that is all it needed.  also a huge fan of the crusty bread (though hard to cut) that was filled with olive oil and roasted garlic on top.  for dessert, we had pistachio panna cotta (i don't even normally like panna cotta but the pistachio was amazing) and then had these waffle cones filled with chocolate mouse.  all in all, a rich and delicious meal.  I'm thinking this is the best steak in the city...and I'm on a mission to find out if any of the competitors make me think otherwise.
author: Cathy L.

description: My brother hates San Francisco.  If he could live in the middle of nowhere surrounded by acres upon acres of land he would.  He has his own electrical company and hates driving in San Francisco so much that he won't even consider bidding on a great job in the city.  So imagine my surprise when he suggested meeting for dinner at Bobo's.  I'd never been. He declared it to have the best steak ever.  I immediately loved it when I walked in, great decor.  Excellent service.  We split the butter leaf bleu cheese salad, perfectly balanced amount of lettuce and cheese.  yum! For sides we shared a twice baked potato, swiss chard and zuchinni fritti.  They were all good but i would reccomend the zuchinni as an appetizer, it doesn't go with a steak very well. It tastes more like bar food (good bar food).   Let's get to my main point.  Ordered the bone in filet (medium since I can't do too red).  It was the BEST STEAK I WILL EVER HAVE IN MY ENTIRE LIFE.  I've been to Harris', Bob's, Alfred's, Ruth Chris, Kincaids, Broadway Prime, Town.... Nothing comes close.  This is AMAZING melts in your mouth like butter steak.  I cannot stress how important it is to me that everyone experience the bone in filet, it will change your life for the better.
author: Danae D.

description: I've been going to Bobo's since it opened about three years ago.  Simply put, this is the best steak I've ever had.  I've been to all the steakhouses in SF, and many in New York and elsewhere, and this is by far superior.  (Worth noting, however, Bobo's only serves the filet mignon, New York and porterhouse, so if you're craving a prime rib, go to Harris', or House of Prime Rib if you can stand the tourists).  When you order, get the bone-in.  The beef is dry aged, so prepare your taste buds.  The filet is king - tender and jiucy, but respect to the New York, which has mucho gusto.  The sides are all good, I especially like the mushrooms, which are super garlickey, and go well with the steak.  The wine list is pretty good, and thank heavens for the full bar and tasty martinis.  The service is very friendly and attentive and never intrusive.  About the only negative is that the bar is a bit small, and getting reservations for Friday and Saturday nights is becoming harder.  So let's keep this place a secret.
author: Justin M.
